ori_sentence: Keratitis is a condition in which the eye's cornea, the clear dome on the front surface of the eye, becomes inflamed.
simple_sent: Keratitis is a disease of the eye. When this happens, the cornea (the clear part of the eye) becomes inflamed.

ori_sentence: Lathyrism is a condition, caused by eating certain legumes of the genus Lathyrus.
simple_sent: Lathyrism is a disease. People get it when they eat certain legumes.

ori_sentence: Hyperkeratosis is thickening of the stratum corneum (the outermost layer of the epidermis, or skin), often associated with the presence of an abnormal quantity of keratin, and also usually accompanied by an increase in the granular layer.
simple_sent: Hyperkeratosis is a thickening of the stratum corneum (the outermost layer of the epidermis, or skin). When there is too much keratin in the stratum corneum, this causes the skin to become too thin.

ori_sentence: Infestation is the state of being invaded or overrun by pests or parasites.
simple_sent: Infestation is when a place has been invaded or taken over by pests.

ori_sentence: Gangrene is a type of tissue death caused by a lack of blood supply.
simple_sent: Gangrene is a tissue death. It happens when there is no blood.

ori_sentence: Persistent Müllerian duct syndrome (PMDS) is the presence of Müllerian duct derivatives (fallopian tubes, uterus, and/or the upper part of the vagina) in what would be considered a genetically and otherwise physically normal male animal by typical human based standards.
simple_sent: Persistent Müllerian duct syndrome (PMDS) is when there are Müllerian duct derivatives (fallopian tubes, uterus, and/or the upper part of the vagina) in what would be considered a normal male animal, but which is not normally found in humans.

ori_sentence: Meningococcal disease describes infections caused by the bacterium Neisseria meningitidis (also termed meningococcus).
simple_sent: Meningococcal disease is a disease. It is caused by a bacterium called Neisseria meningitidis.

ori_sentence: Hepatoerythropoietic porphyria is a very rare form of hepatic porphyria caused by a disorder in both genes which code Uroporphyrinogen III decarboxylase (UROD).
simple_sent: Hepatoerythropoietic porphyria is a very rare form of hepatic porphyria. It is caused by a change in the code for a enzyme called Uroporphyrinogen III.

ori_sentence: Pyomyositis is a bacterial infection of the skeletal muscles which results in an abscess.
simple_sent: Pyomyositis is a bacterial infection of the muscles. It can cause an abscess.

ori_sentence: Kernicterus is a bilirubin-induced brain dysfunction.
simple_sent: Kernicterus is a brain disorder caused by bilirubin.

ori_sentence: Chronic venous insufficiency (CVI) is a medical condition in which blood pools in the veins, straining the walls of the vein.
simple_sent: Chronic venous insufficiency (CVI) is a medical condition. In this condition, the walls of the veins become too thin.

ori_sentence: The rectus femoris muscle is one of the four quadriceps muscles of the human body.
simple_sent: The rectus femoris muscle is a muscle in the leg. It is one of four muscles.

ori_sentence: Encephalomyelitis is inflammation of the brain and spinal cord.
simple_sent: Encephalomyelitis is a disease of the brain and spinal cord.

ori_sentence: A chylothorax is an abnormal accumulation of chyle, a type of lipid-rich lymph, in the space surrounding the lung.
simple_sent: A chylothorax is an abnormal build-up of lymph in the lung. Chyle is a type of lipid-rich lymph.

ori_sentence: The teres minor (Latin teres meaning 'rounded') is a narrow, elongated muscle of the rotator cuff.
simple_sent: The teres minor is a small muscle in the shoulder. Its Latin name is teres meaning rounded.

ori_sentence: Neuropathic arthropathy (or neuropathic osteoarthropathy), also known as Charcot joint (often Charcot foot) after the first to describe it, Jean-Martin Charcot, refers to progressive degeneration of a weight-bearing joint, a process marked by bony destruction, bone resorption, and eventual deformity due to loss of sensation.
simple_sent: Neuropathic arthropathy (or neuropathic osteoarthropathy), also known as Charcot joint (often Charcot foot) is a condition in which the body gradually loses the ability to use a weight-bearing joint. The process is marked by bony destruction and bone resorption.

ori_sentence: A cerebral infarction is the pathologic process that results in an area of necrotic tissue in the brain (cerebral infarct).
simple_sent: A cerebral infarction is when an area of tissue in the brain gets too big. This is called a cerebral infarction.

ori_sentence: Eosinophilia is a condition in which the eosinophil count in the peripheral blood exceeds 5×108/L (500/μL).
simple_sent: Eosinophilia Eosinophilia is a condition in which there are too many eosinophils in the blood.

ori_sentence: Aicardi syndrome is a rare genetic malformation syndrome characterized by the partial or complete absence of a key structure in the brain called the corpus callosum, the presence of retinal abnormalities, and seizures in the form of infantile spasms.
simple_sent: Aicardi syndrome is a rare disease. People who have the disease have a part or complete lack of a key structure in the brain called the corpus callosum. In addition, they have problems with their eyes, and they have seizures.

ori_sentence: Stevens–Johnson syndrome (SJS) is a type of severe skin reaction.
simple_sent: Stevens-Johnson syndrome (SJS) is a serious medical condition.

ori_sentence: May–Hegglin anomaly (MHA), is a rare genetic disorder of the blood platelets that causes them to be abnormally large.
simple_sent: The May-Hegglin anomaly (MHA) is a very rare disease. It causes platelets in the blood to be very large.

ori_sentence: Ketosis is a metabolic state characterized by elevated levels of ketone bodies in the blood or urine.
simple_sent: Ketosis is a metabolic state. When there is too much ketone in the blood, people get sick.

ori_sentence: Ovarian hyperstimulation syndrome (OHSS) is a medical condition that can occur in some women who take fertility medication to stimulate egg growth, and in other women in very rare cases.
simple_sent: Ovarian hyperstimulation syndrome (OHSS) is a medical condition. It happens to some women when they take fertility medication, but it can also happen to other women.

ori_sentence: Myotonia is a symptom of a small handful of certain neuromuscular disorders characterized by delayed relaxation (prolonged contraction) of the skeletal muscles after voluntary contraction or electrical stimulation.
simple_sent: Myotonia is a symptom of certain neuromuscular disorders. It means that the muscles of the body do not relax as quickly as they should after a voluntary contraction or stimulation.

ori_sentence: Myoglobinuria is the presence of myoglobin in the urine, which usually results from rhabdomyolysis or muscle injury.
simple_sent: Myoglobinuria is when there is too much myoglobin in the urine. This usually happens when muscles are hurt.

ori_sentence: Medullary cystic kidney disease (MCKD) is an autosomal dominant kidney disorder characterized by tubulointerstitial sclerosis leading to end-stage renal disease.
simple_sent: Medullary cystic kidney disease (MCKD) is a life long disease. People who have the disease will have tubulointerstitial sclerosis.

ori_sentence: A bone cyst or geode is a cyst that forms in bone.
simple_sent: A bone cyst is a lump or lump in the bone.

ori_sentence: Parametritis (also known as pelvic cellulitis) is an infection of the parametrium (connective tissue adjacent to the uterus).
simple_sent: Parametritis (also called pelvic cellulitis) is an infection of the uterus. It is also called pelvic cellulitis.

ori_sentence: Ectodermal dysplasia (ED) is a group of genetic syndromes all deriving from abnormalities of the ectodermal structures.
simple_sent: Ectodermal dysplasia (ED) is a group of diseases. All of them are caused by problems with the ectodermal structures.

ori_sentence: Tetracaine, also known as amethocaine, is an ester local anesthetic used to numb the eyes, nose, or throat.
simple_sent: Tetracaine (also known as amethocaine) is a local anesthetic. It can be used to stop bleeding.

ori_sentence: A communication disorder is any disorder that affects an individual's ability to comprehend, detect, or apply language and speech to engage in discourse effectively with others.
simple_sent: A communication disorder is any disorder that affects a person's ability to talk to others effectively. It can also affect their ability to read language.

ori_sentence: Vasa praevia is a condition in which fetal blood vessels cross or run near the internal opening of the uterus.
simple_sent: Vasa praevia is when the blood vessels of the fetus cross each other when they are in the uterus.

ori_sentence: Middle cerebral artery syndrome is a condition whereby the blood supply from the middle cerebral artery (MCA) is restricted, leading to a reduction of the function of the portions of the brain supplied by that vessel: the lateral aspects of frontal, temporal and parietal lobes, the corona radiata, globus pallidus, caudate and putamen.
simple_sent: Middle cerebral artery syndrome is a condition in which the blood supply from the middle cerebral artery (MCA) is restricted. This results in the brain not being able to use the parts of the brain that it is normally able to use, including the frontal, temporal and parietal lobes.

ori_sentence: The supraspinatus (plural supraspinati) is a relatively small muscle of the upper back that runs from the supraspinous fossa superior portion of the scapula (shoulder blade) to the greater tubercle of the humerus.
simple_sent: The supraspinatus (plural supraspinati) is a small muscle in the upper back. The supraspinatus runs from the superior portion of the scapula to the greater tubercle of the humerus.

ori_sentence: An abdominal pregnancy can be regarded as a form of life threatening condition ectopic pregnancy where the embryo or fetus is growing and developing outside the womb in the abdomen, but not in the Fallopian tube, ovary or broad ligament.
simple_sent: An abdominal pregnancy is when the embryo or fetus is in the abdomen, but not in the Fallopian tube, ovary or broad ligament. If this happens, it can be a life threatening condition.

ori_sentence: Kasabach–Merritt syndrome, also known as hemangioma with thrombocytopenia is a rare disease, usually of infants, in which a vascular tumor leads to decreased platelet counts and sometimes other bleeding problems, which can be life-threatening.
simple_sent: Kasabach-Merritt syndrome, also known as hemangioma with thrombocytopenia, is a rare disease. In this disease, a vascular tumor causes the blood to lose platelet numbers. This can cause bleeding that is life-threatening.

ori_sentence: Mucolipidosis is a group of inherited metabolic disorders that affect the body's ability to carry out the normal turnover of various materials within cells.
simple_sent: Mucolipidosis is a group of inherited metabolic disorders. These disorders affect the body's ability to move materials around in the body.

ori_sentence: Cowpox is an infectious disease caused by the cowpox virus (CPXV).
simple_sent: Cowpox is a disease. It is caused by a virus from cows.

ori_sentence: Peyronie's disease is a connective tissue disorder involving the growth of fibrous plaques in the soft tissue of the penis.
simple_sent: Peyronie's disease is a disease of the soft tissue of the penis. It causes the soft tissue to grow fibrous plaques.

ori_sentence: Ectromelia is a congenital condition where long bones are missing or underdeveloped.
simple_sent: Ectromelia is a birth condition. In this case, long bones are missing.

ori_sentence: A query string is a part of a (URL) that assigns values to specified parameters.
simple_sent: A query string is a part of a (URL). It contains a number of parameters.

ori_sentence: A xanthoma (pl. xanthomas or xanthomata)
simple_sent: A xanthoma is a type of cancer.

ori_sentence: In virology, influenza A virus subtype H1N1 (A/H1N1) is a subtype of Influenza A virus.
simple_sent: Influenza A virus subtype H1N1 (also known as A/H1N1) is a new strain of influenza.

ori_sentence: Lown–Ganong–Levine syndrome (LGL) is a pre-excitation syndrome of the heart.
simple_sent: Lown-Ganong-Levine syndrome (LGL) is a heart disease that does not cause.

ori_sentence: Tic disorders are defined in the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders (DSM) based on type (motor or phonic) and duration of tics (sudden, rapid, nonrhythmic movements).
simple_sent: Tic disorders are listed in the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders (DSM) by the type of movement the person has (motor or phonic) and for how long.

ori_sentence: Pituitary adenomas are tumors that occur in the pituitary gland.
simple_sent: Pituitary adenomas are cancer of the pituitary gland.

ori_sentence: Proton-pump inhibitors (PPIs) are a class of medications that cause a profound and prolonged reduction of stomach acid production.
simple_sent: Proton-pump inhibitors (PPIs) are a class of drugs. They work by reducing the production of stomach acid.

ori_sentence: Endophthalmitis is inflammation of the interior cavity of the eye, usually caused by infection.
simple_sent: Endophthalmitis is a disease of the eye. It is usually caused by an infection.

ori_sentence: Medulloblastoma is a common type of primary brain cancer in children.
simple_sent: Medulloblastoma is the most common brain cancer in children.

ori_sentence: The levator scapulae is a skeletal muscle situated at the back and side of the neck.
simple_sent: The levator scapulae is a muscle in the neck. It is located at the back.

ori_sentence: Nephritis is inflammation of the kidneys and may involve the glomeruli, tubules, or interstitial tissue surrounding the glomeruli and tubules.
simple_sent: Nephritis is a disease of the kidneys. It usually starts in the glomeruli, but it can also affect the tubules or the surrounding tissue.

ori_sentence: A dermoid cyst is a teratoma of a cystic nature that contains an array of developmentally mature, solid tissues.
simple_sent: A dermoid cyst is a cystic (growing out of the body) tumor. It has a lot of solid tissues in it.

ori_sentence: Bartter syndrome (BS) is a rare inherited disease characterised by a defect in the thick ascending limb of the loop of Henle, which results in low potassium levels (hypokalemia),
simple_sent: Bartter syndrome (BS) is a rare disease. People who have the disease have a defect in the part of the body that carries potassium. This makes them have low potassium.

ori_sentence: Gilbert syndrome (GS) is a syndrome in which the liver of affected individuals processes bilirubin more slowly than the majority.
simple_sent: Gilbert syndrome (GS) is a disease. In this disease, the liver does not process bilirubin as fast as it should.

ori_sentence: The brachialis (brachialis anticus), also known as the Teichmann muscle, is a muscle in the upper arm that flexes the elbow.
simple_sent: The brachialis muscle is a muscle in the upper arm. It is also called the brachialis anticus or Teichmann muscle.

ori_sentence: Chromatophores are cells that produce color, of which many types are pigment-containing cells, or groups of cells, found in a wide range of animals including amphibians, fish, reptiles, crustaceans and cephalopods.
simple_sent: Chromatophores are cells that produce color, of which many types are pigment-containing cells. Chromatophores are found in a wide range of animals, including fish, amphibians, reptiles, and cephalopods.

ori_sentence: The acromioclavicular joint, or AC joint, is a joint at the top of the shoulder.
simple_sent: The acromioclavicular joint is an important joint in the human body.

ori_sentence: Dyscalculia (/ˌdɪskælˈkjuːliə/), sometimes called dysarithmia, is a disability resulting in difficulty learning or comprehending arithmetic, such as difficulty in understanding numbers, learning how to manipulate numbers, performing mathematical calculations and learning facts in mathematics.
simple_sent: Dyscalculia, sometimes called dysarithmia, is a disability that makes it hard for people to learn or understand arithmetic. This means that they have a hard time understanding numbers, learning how to use numbers, and doing mathematical calculations.

ori_sentence: Bicuspid aortic valve (BAV) is an inherited form of heart disease in which two of the leaflets of the aortic valve fuse during development in the womb resulting in a two-leaflet (bicuspid) valve instead of the normal three-leaflet (tricuspid) valve.
simple_sent: Bicuspid aortic valve (BAV) is a type of heart disease. In this disease, two of the leaflets of the aortic valve come together during development. This makes a two-leaflet (bicuspid) valve instead of a three-leaflet (tricuspid) valve.

ori_sentence: A Meckel's diverticulum, a true congenital diverticulum, is a slight bulge in the small intestine present at birth and a vestigial remnant of the omphalomesenteric duct (also called the vitelline duct or yolk stalk).
simple_sent: A Meckel's diverticulum is a small bulge in the small intestine. This bulge is present at birth because the omphalomesenteric duct that went into the small intestine has been destroyed.

ori_sentence: Cogan syndrome (also Cogan's syndrome) is a rare disorder characterized by recurrent inflammation of the front of the eye (the cornea) and often fever, fatigue, and weight loss, episodes of vertigo (dizziness), tinnitus (ringing in the ears) and hearing loss.
simple_sent: Cogan syndrome (also called Cogan's syndrome) is a rare disorder. It happens when the front of the eye (the cornea) gets inflamed all the time. This can cause fever, fatigue, weight loss, dizziness, tinnitus (ringing in the ears) and hearing loss.

ori_sentence: Placenta accreta occurs when all or part of the placenta attaches abnormally to the myometrium (the muscular layer of the uterine wall).
simple_sent: Placenta accreta happens when the placenta is too close to the myometrium. The myometrium is a part of the uterine wall.

ori_sentence: Anorgasmia is a type of sexual dysfunction in which a person cannot achieve orgasm despite adequate stimulation.
simple_sent: Anorgasmia is when a person can not have an orgasm, even with a lot of stimulation. It is a sexual dysfunction.

ori_sentence: Chemosis is the swelling (or edema) of the conjunctiva.
simple_sent: Chemosis is when the conjunctiva gets too big.

ori_sentence: Reye syndrome is a rapidly worsening brain disease.
simple_sent: Rye syndrome is a fast-growing brain disease.

ori_sentence: Hepatitis A is an infectious disease of the liver caused by Hepatovirus A (HAV); it is a type of viral hepatitis.
simple_sent: Hepatitis A is a disease of the liver. It is caused by a virus, called Hepatovirus A (HAV).

ori_sentence: Acanthosis nigricans is a medical sign characterised by brown-to-black, poorly defined, velvety hyperpigmentation of the skin.
simple_sent: Acanthosis nigricans is a medical sign. It is when the skin has dark brown to black areas that are not defined.

ori_sentence: Dysmetria (English: wrong length) is a lack of coordination of movement typified by the undershoot or overshoot of intended position with the hand, arm, leg, or eye.
simple_sent: Dysmetria (English: wrong length) is a lack of coordination of movement. This means that the hand, arm, leg, or eye does not stay in one position.

ori_sentence: Photokeratitis or ultraviolet keratitis is a painful eye condition caused by exposure of insufficiently protected eyes to the ultraviolet (UV) rays from either natural (e.g. intense sunlight) or artificial (e.g. the electric arc during welding) sources.
simple_sent: Photokeratitis or ultraviolet keratitis is a painful eye condition. It is caused by exposure to ultraviolet (UV) rays from either natural sources (such as sunlight) or artificial sources (e.g. electric arc during welding).

ori_sentence: Diphyllobothriasis is the infection caused by tapeworms of the genus Diphyllobothrium (commonly D. latum and D. nihonkaiense).
simple_sent: Diphyllobothriasis is a disease. It is caused by two species of tapeworm, D. latum and D. nihonkaiense.

ori_sentence: Chondropathy refers to a disease of the cartilage.
simple_sent: Chondropathy is a type of bone disease.

ori_sentence: Agranulocytosis, also known as agranulosis or granulopenia, is an acute condition involving a severe and dangerous lowered white blood cell count (leukopenia, most commonly of neutrophils) and thus causing a neutropenia in the circulating blood.
simple_sent: Agranulocytosis, also known as agranulosis or granulopenia, is a disease. It happens when a person has a low number of white blood cells (leukopenia), most commonly neutrophils, in their blood.

ori_sentence: Stargardt disease is the most common inherited single-gene retinal disease.
simple_sent: Stargardt disease is the most common retinal disease in the world.

ori_sentence: Oligodendrogliomas are a type of glioma that are believed to originate from the oligodendrocytes of the brain or from a glial precursor cell.
simple_sent: Oligodendrogliomas are a type of brain cancer. They are found in the brain and are either found in the glial cells or in the bone.

ori_sentence: Cryopyrin-associated periodic syndrome (CAPS) is a group of rare, heterogeneous autoinflammatory disease characterized by interleukin 1β-mediated systemic inflammation and clinical symptoms involving skin, joints, central nervous system, and eyes.
simple_sent: Cryopyrin-associated periodic syndrome (CAPS) is a group of rare diseases where the skin, joints, central nervous system, and eyes become inflamed. These symptoms are caused by interleukin 1β-mediated systemic inflammation.

ori_sentence: Bing–Neel syndrome (BNS) is an extremely rare neurologic complication of Waldenström macroglobulinemia (WM), which is a chronic lymphoproliferative disorder.
simple_sent: Bing-Neel syndrome (BNS) is a very rare disease. It is a complication of Waldenström macroglobulinemia. Waldenström macroglobulinemia is a disease.

ori_sentence: Acalculia is an acquired impairment in which people have difficulty performing simple mathematical tasks, such as adding, subtracting, multiplying and even simply stating which of two numbers is larger.
simple_sent: Acalculia is a condition in which people have a hard time doing simple math jobs. For example, they have a hard time adding or subtracting numbers or saying which number is larger.

ori_sentence: In humans and some other mammals, the soleus is a powerful muscle in the back part of the lower leg (the calf).
simple_sent: In humans and some other mammals, the soleus is a muscle in the lower leg. It is very strong.

ori_sentence: The abdominal external oblique muscle (also external oblique muscle, or exterior oblique) is the largest and outermost of the three flat abdominal muscles of the lateral anterior abdomen.
simple_sent: The external oblique muscle (also called the external oblique muscle) is a muscle in the abdomen. It is the largest of the three muscles that make up the external oblique.

ori_sentence: Paranoid personality disorder (PPD) is a mental illness characterized by paranoid delusions, and a pervasive, long-standing suspiciousness and generalized mistrust of others.
simple_sent: Paranoid personality disorder (PPD) is a mental illness. People with PPD usually have long-standing paranoid delusions and a general distrust of others.

ori_sentence: Dermatochalasis is a medical condition, defined as an excess of skin in the upper or lower eyelid, also known as "baggy eyes.
simple_sent: Dermatochalasis is a medical condition. It happens when there is too much skin on the upper or lower eyelid.

ori_sentence: Flail chest is a life-threatening medical condition that occurs when a segment of the rib cage breaks due to trauma and becomes detached from the rest of the chest wall.
simple_sent: Flail chest is a medical condition. It happens when a section of the rib cage breaks because of a trauma, and the rest of the chest wall comes apart.

ori_sentence: Athetosis is a symptom characterized by slow, involuntary, convoluted, writhing movements of the fingers, hands, toes, and feet and in some cases, arms, legs, neck and tongue.
simple_sent: Athetosis is a symptom where the body does not move for a long time. The fingers, hands, toes, and feet move slowly, and sometimes the arms, legs, and the tongue.

ori_sentence: Hyperhomocysteinemia is a medical condition characterized by an abnormally high level of homocysteine in the blood, conventionally described as above 15 μmol/L.
simple_sent: Hyperhomocysteinemia is a medical condition. In it, the blood has a very high level of homocysteine. This level is usually above 15 μmol/L.

ori_sentence: Wilms' tumor protein is a protein that in humans is encoded by the WT1 gene on chromosome 11p.
simple_sent: Wilms' tumor protein is a protein. In humans, it is found on the 11p chromosome.

ori_sentence: Fox–Fordyce disease is a chronic blockage of the sweat gland ducts with a secondary, non-bacterial inflammatory response to the secretions and cellular debris in the cysts.
simple_sent: Fox-Fordyce disease is a condition in which the sweat gland ducts are blocked for a long time. This causes the sweat gland to produce non-bacterial bacteria.

ori_sentence: Carrion's disease is an infectious disease produced by Bartonella bacilliformis infection.
simple_sent: Carrion's disease is a disease. It is caused by a bacteria called Bartonella.

ori_sentence: The semimembranosus muscle (/ˌsɛmiˌmɛmbrəˈnoʊsəs/) is the most medial of the three hamstring muscles in the thigh.
simple_sent: The semimembranosus muscle is a muscle in the thigh. It is one of the three main hamstring muscles.

ori_sentence: The triceps, or triceps brachii (Latin for "three-headed muscle of the arm"), is a large muscle on the back of the upper limb of many vertebrates.
simple_sent: The triceps (Latin: triceps brachii) is a muscle in the back of the body. The name comes from the Latin word for "three-headed muscle".

ori_sentence: The abdominal internal oblique muscle, also internal oblique muscle or interior oblique, is an abdominal muscle in the abdominal wall that lies below the external oblique muscle and just above the transverse abdominal muscle.
simple_sent: The internal oblique muscle is a muscle in the abdominal wall. It is just below the external oblique muscle and just above the transverse abdominal muscle. It is called the internal oblique muscle.

ori_sentence: A pleural effusion is accumulation of excessive fluid in the pleural space, the potential space that surrounds each lung.
simple_sent: A pleural effusion is when there is too much fluid in the pleural space. This space is around each lung.

ori_sentence: Septic shock is a potentially fatal medical condition that occurs when sepsis, which is organ injury or damage in response to infection, leads to dangerously low blood pressure and abnormalities in cellular metabolism.
simple_sent: Septic shock is a medical condition that can be very dangerous. It happens when sepsis, or damage to the body from an infection, causes your blood pressure to get too low.

ori_sentence: Corneal ulcer is an inflammatory or, more seriously, infective condition of the cornea involving disruption of its epithelial layer with involvement of the corneal stroma.
simple_sent: A corneal ulcer is an inflammation or infection of the cornea. It happens when the outside layer of the cornea, called the epithelial layer, is damaged.

ori_sentence: Chondroblastoma is a rare, benign, locally aggressive bone tumor that typically affects the epiphyses or apophyses of long bones.
simple_sent: Chondroblastoma is a very rare type of bone cancer. It usually affects the epiphyses or apophyses of the long bones.

ori_sentence: Cohen syndrome (also known as Pepper syndrome or Cervenka syndrome) is a very rare autosomal recessive genetic disorder with varied expression, characterised by obesity, intellectual disability, distinct craniofacial abnormalities and potential ocular dysfunction.
simple_sent: Cohen syndrome (also known as Pepper syndrome or Cervenka syndrome) is a very rare genetic disorder. People who have Cohen syndrome have an intellectual disability, they are more likely to be obese, and they may have problems with their eyes.

ori_sentence: Polyarthritis is any type of arthritis that involves 5 or more joints simultaneously.
simple_sent: Polyarthritis is a type of arthritis. It usually involves 5 or more joints.

ori_sentence: Lung transplantation, or pulmonary transplantation, is a surgical procedure in which one or both lungs are replaced by lungs from a donor.
simple_sent: A lung transplant is a medical procedure. In it, a person is given new lungs, from a different person.

ori_sentence: Hidrocystoma (also known as cystadenoma, a Moll's gland cyst, and a sudoriferous cyst) is an adenoma of the sweat glands.
simple_sent: Hidrocystoma (also called cystadenoma, a mollusc cyst, and a sudoriferous cyst) is a condition of the skin.

ori_sentence: Cushing's disease is one cause of Cushing's syndrome characterised by increased secretion of adrenocorticotropic hormone (ACTH) from the anterior pituitary (secondary hypercortisolism).
simple_sent: Cushing's disease is caused by an increase in a hormone called adrenocorticotropic hormone from the anterior pituitary gland. This is called secondary hypercortisolism.

ori_sentence: Parotitis is an inflammation of one or both parotid glands, the major salivary glands located on either side of the face, in humans.
simple_sent: Parotitis is an inflammation of the parotid glands. The parotid glands are two glands that are on either side of the face.

ori_sentence: A ureterocele is a congenital abnormality found in the ureter.
simple_sent: A ureterocele is a condition where the ureter is not working properly.

ori_sentence: Plasmacytoma is a plasma cell dyscrasia in which a plasma cell tumour grows within soft tissue or within the axial skeleton.
simple_sent: Plasmacytoma is a type of cancer. In this disease, the plasma cell tumour grows inside the soft tissue or the axial skeleton.

ori_sentence: Vitamin K deficiency bleeding (VKDB) of the newborn, previously known as haemorrhagic disease of the newborn, is a rare form of bleeding disorder that affects newborns and young infants due to low stores of vitamin K at birth.
simple_sent: Vitamin K deficiency bleeding (VKDB) of the newborn, previously known as haemorrhagic disease of the newborn, is a condition in which the baby does not get enough vitamin K at birth.

ori_sentence: Phonophobia, also called ligyrophobia or sonophobia, is a fear of or aversion to loud sounds (for example fireworks)—a type of specific phobia.
simple_sent: Phonophobia, also called ligyrophobia or sonophobia, is a fear of sounds. People who have this fear are afraid of loud sounds.

ori_sentence: Hemophagocytic lymphohistiocytosis (HLH), also known as haemophagocytic lymphohistiocytosis (British spelling), and hemophagocytic or haemophagocytic syndrome, is an uncommon hematologic disorder seen more often in children than in adults.
simple_sent: Hemophagocytic lymphohistiocytosis (HLH), also known as haemophagocytic lymphohistiocytosis (British spelling) or hemophagocytic or haemophagocytic syndrome, is a disease that affects the blood.

ori_sentence: A chalazion (plural chalazia or chalazions) or meibomian cyst is a cyst in the eyelid usually due to a blocked meibomian gland,  typically in the middle of the eyelid, red, and not painful.
simple_sent: A chalazion (plural chalazia or chalazions) or meibomian cyst is a cyst in the eyelid. It is usually in the middle of the eyelid, and is usually not painful.

ori_sentence: Keratoderma is a hornlike skin condition.
simple_sent: Keratoderma is a skin condition.

ori_sentence: In human biology, handedness is an individual's preferential use of one hand, known as the dominant hand, due to it being stronger, faster or better in dexterity.
simple_sent: In human biology, handedness means that one hand is used more often than the other. This is because the dominant hand is stronger and faster.

ori_sentence: Pyuria is the condition of urine containing white blood cells or pus.
simple_sent: Pyuria is when the urine has too many white blood cells.

ori_sentence: Miliaria, also called sweat rash, is a skin disease marked by small and itchy rashes due to sweat trapped under the skin by clogged sweat gland ducts.
simple_sent: Miliaria, also called sweat rash, is a skin disease. People who have the disease have small, itchy rashes on their skin that look like sweat.

ori_sentence: Pendred syndrome is a genetic disorder leading to congenital bilateral (both sides) sensorineural hearing loss and goitre with euthyroid or mild hypothyroidism (decreased thyroid gland function).
simple_sent: Pendred syndrome is a genetic disorder. People with Pendred syndrome have hearing loss on both sides of their body. They also have euthyroid or mild hypothyroidism.

ori_sentence: Partial androgen insensitivity syndrome (PAIS) is a condition that results in the partial inability of the cell to respond to androgens.
simple_sent: Partial androgen insensitivity syndrome (PAIS) is a condition. In this condition, the cell is not able to respond to androgens.

ori_sentence: Coffin–Siris Syndrome is a rare genetic disorder that causes developmental delays and absent fifth finger and toe nails.
simple_sent: Coffin-Siris Syndrome is a rare disease. It causes developmental problems and people with it do not have fifth toes.

ori_sentence: Centronuclear myopathies (CNM) are a group of congenital myopathies where cell nuclei are abnormally located in the center of muscle cells instead of their normal location at the periphery.
simple_sent: Centronuclear myopathies (CNM) are a group of diseases in which the nuclei of the cell are in the middle of the cell instead of where they should be.

ori_sentence: Labyrinthitis, also known as vestibular neuritis, is the inflammation of the inner ear.
simple_sent: Labyrinthitis is an inflammation of the inner ear. It is also called vestibular neuritis.

ori_sentence: Pheochromocytoma (PHEO or PCC) is a rare tumor of the adrenal medulla composed of chromaffin cells, also known as pheochromocytes.
simple_sent: Pheochromocytoma (PHEO or PCC) is a small tumor in the adrenal glands. The cells that cause it are called pheochromocytes.

ori_sentence: Epiretinal membrane or macular pucker is a disease of the eye in response to changes in the vitreous humor or more rarely, diabetes.
simple_sent: Epiretinal membrane or macular pucker is a disease of the eye. It usually starts when the vitreous humor in the eye changes.

ori_sentence: Spinocerebellar ataxia type 13 (SCA13) is a rare autosomal dominant disorder, which, like other types of SCA, is characterized by dysarthria, nystagmus, and ataxia of gait, stance and the limbs due to cerebellar dysfunction.
simple_sent: Spinocerebellar ataxia type 13 (SCA13) is a rare disorder. Like other types of SCA, people with this disorder have dysarthria, nystagmus, and ataxia of the limbs because of problems with the cerebellar system.

ori_sentence: Apraxia is a motor disorder caused by damage to the brain (specifically the posterior parietal cortex or corpus callosum) which causes difficulty with motor planning to perform tasks or movements.
simple_sent: Apraxia is a motor disorder. It is caused by damage to the brain's posterior parietal cortex. This damage makes it hard for the person to plan their movements and perform tasks.

ori_sentence: In human biology, handedness is an individual's preferential use of one hand, known as the dominant hand, due to it being stronger, faster or better in dexterity.
simple_sent: In human biology, handedness is the use of one hand by an individual more often than the other. This is because the dominant hand is stronger.

ori_sentence: Dandruff is a skin condition that mainly affects the scalp.
simple_sent: Dandruff is a condition of the skin. It mostly affects the scalp.

ori_sentence: Catecholaminergic polymorphic ventricular tachycardia (CPVT) is an inherited genetic disorder that predisposes those affected to potentially life-threatening abnormal heart rhythms or arrhythmias.
simple_sent: Catecholaminergic polymorphic ventricular tachycardia (CPVT) is a genetic disease. People who have the disease are more likely to have abnormal heart rhythms or arrhythmias.

ori_sentence: Knee replacement, also known as knee arthroplasty, is a surgical procedure to replace the weight-bearing surfaces of the knee joint to relieve pain and disability , most commonly offered when joint pain is not diminished by conservative sources and also for other knee diseases such as rheumatoid arthritis and psoriatic arthritis.
simple_sent: Knee replacement, also known as knee arthroplasty, is a surgical procedure to replace the weight-bearing surfaces of the knee joint to relieve pain and disability. The most common reason for knee replacement is the need to treat pain in the knee, especially if it is from arthritis.

ori_sentence: Acne conglobata is a highly inflammatory disease presenting with comedones, nodules, abscesses, and draining sinus tracts.
simple_sent: Acne conglobata is a highly inflammatory disease. It can cause fluid in the sinuses and draining sinus tracts.

ori_sentence: Steatohepatitis is a type of fatty liver disease, characterized by inflammation of the liver with concurrent fat accumulation in liver.
simple_sent: Steatohepatitis is a type of fatty liver disease. The disease causes the liver to become too fat and make too much fat.

ori_sentence: Dentinogenesis imperfecta (DI) is a genetic disorder of tooth development.
simple_sent: Dentinogenesis imperfecta is a disease. It is a genetic condition.

ori_sentence: Warthin's tumor, also known as papillary cystadenoma lymphomatosum, is a benign cystic tumor of the salivary glands containing abundant lymphocytes and germinal centers (lymph node-like stroma).
simple_sent: Warrthin's tumor, also known as papillary cystadenoma lymphomatosum, is a cancer of the salivary glands. It is a benign tumor that does not cause any problems other than pain.

ori_sentence: Porencephaly is an extremely rare cephalic disorder involving encephalomalacia.
simple_sent: Porencephaly is a very rare condition. It is also called encephalomalacia.

ori_sentence: Hepacivirus is a genus of positive-strand RNA viruses in the family Flaviviridae.
simple_sent: Hepacivirus is a kind of virus. It is a positive-strand RNA virus.

ori_sentence: Appendicitis is inflammation of the appendix.
simple_sent: Appendicitis is a medical condition.

ori_sentence: An osteosarcoma (OS) or osteogenic sarcoma (OGS) (or simply bone cancer) is a cancerous tumor in a bone.
simple_sent: Osteosarcoma is a cancer of the bone. The most common type of bone cancer is called osteosarcoma.

ori_sentence: Perichondritis  is inflammation of the perichondrium, a layer of connective tissue which surrounds cartilage.
simple_sent: Perichondritis is an inflammation of the cartilage. The cartilage is a thin layer of tissue.

ori_sentence: Carpenter syndrome, also called acrocephalopolysyndactyly type II, is an extremely rare autosomal recessive congenital disorder characterized by craniofacial malformations, obesity, and syndactyly.
simple_sent: Carpenter syndrome, also called acrocephalopolysyndactyly type II, is a very rare disorder. People with Carpenter syndrome have a lot of problems with their face, and they are also very fat.

ori_sentence: The iliopsoas muscle (/ˌɪlioʊˈsoʊ.əs/) refers to the joined psoas and the iliacus muscles.
simple_sent: The iliopsoas muscle is the second largest muscle in the back. It is joined to the psoas.

ori_sentence: An ankle fracture is a break of one or more of the bones that make up the ankle joint.
simple_sent: An ankle fracture is when one or more bones in the ankle fall out of place.

ori_sentence: Sarcoma botryoides or botryoid sarcoma is a subtype of embryonal rhabdomyosarcoma, that can be observed in the walls of hollow, mucosa lined structures such as the nasopharynx, common bile duct, urinary bladder of infants and young children or the vagina in females, typically younger than age 8.
simple_sent: Sarcoma botryoides or botryoid sarcoma is a type of rhabdomyosarcoma. It can be found in the walls of hollow, mucosa lined structures such as the nasopharynx, urinary bladder of infants and young children, the vagina in females, and the common bile duct in people.

ori_sentence: KBG syndrome is a genetic disease that is the result of a mutation in the ANKRD11 gene at location 16q24.3.
simple_sent: KBG syndrome is a rare genetic disease. It is caused by a change in the gene 16q24.3.

ori_sentence: Tendinopathy, also known as tendinitis or tendonitis, is a type of tendon disorder that results in pain, swelling, and impaired function.
simple_sent: Tendinopathy, also known as tendinitis or tendonitis, is a disease of the tendons in the body. It causes pain and swelling.

ori_sentence: Pilocytic astrocytoma (and its variant pilomyxoid astrocytoma) is a brain tumor that occurs most commonly in children and young adults
simple_sent: Pilocytic astrocytoma, also known as pilomyxoid astrocytoma, is a type of brain tumor. It usually occurs in children.

ori_sentence: Synovial chondromatosis is a locally aggressive bone tumor of the cartilaginous type.
simple_sent: Synovial chondromatosis is a type of bone tumor. It is usually found locally.

ori_sentence: Schizoid personality disorder (/ˈskɪtsɔɪd, ˈskɪdzɔɪd/, often abbreviated as SPD or SzPD) is a personality disorder characterized by a lack of interest in social relationships, a tendency toward a solitary or sheltered lifestyle, secretiveness, emotional coldness, detachment and apathy.
simple_sent: Schizoid personality disorder (often shortened to SPD or SzPD) is a personality disorder. People who have this condition tend to have a lack of interest in social relationships, a tendency toward a solitary or sheltered lifestyle, and an emotional coldness and detachment.

ori_sentence: Placental insufficiency or utero-placental insufficiency is the failure of the placenta to deliver sufficient nutrients to the fetus during pregnancy, and is often a result of insufficient blood flow to the placenta.
simple_sent: Placental insufficiency (also called utero-placental insufficiency) is when the placenta does not give enough nutrients to the fetus during pregnancy. This happens because the placenta does not get enough blood.

ori_sentence: Angiomyolipomas are the most common benign tumour of the kidney.
simple_sent: Angiomyolipomas are the most common benign kidney cancer.

ori_sentence: Johanson–Blizzard syndrome is a rare, sometimes fatal autosomal recessive multisystem congenital disorder featuring abnormal development of the pancreas, nose and scalp, with intellectual disability, hearing loss and growth failure.
simple_sent: Johanson-Blizzard syndrome is a rare disorder. People who have it have abnormal development of the pancreas, nose and scalp. They also have intellectual disability, hearing loss and growth failure.

ori_sentence: Microscopic colitis refers to two related medical conditions which cause diarrhea: collagenous colitis and lymphocytic colitis.
simple_sent: There are two main types of colitis. They are called collagenous colitis and lymphocytic colitis.

ori_sentence: Respiratory failure results from inadequate gas exchange by the respiratory system, meaning that the arterial oxygen, carbon dioxide, or both cannot be kept at normal levels.
simple_sent: Respiratory failure happens when the respiratory system does not get enough oxygen from the blood. The blood does not have enough oxygen or carbon dioxide.

ori_sentence: Lipomatosis is believed to be an autosomal dominant condition in which multiple lipomas are present on the body.
simple_sent: Lipomatosis is an autosomal dominant condition. This means that many lipomas can be found on the body.

ori_sentence: A hibernoma is a benign neoplasm of vestigial brown fat.
simple_sent: A hibernoma is a small tumor or benign growth.

ori_sentence: Glucagonoma is a very rare tumor of the pancreatic alpha cells that results in the overproduction of the hormone, glucagon.
simple_sent: Glucagonoma is a very rare tumor. It happens when the pancreas produces too much glucagon, a hormone.

ori_sentence: Stretch marks, also known as striae (IPA /ˈstɹaɪ.iː/) or striae distensae, are a form of scarring on the skin with an off-color hue.
simple_sent: Stretch marks (also called striae or striae distensae) are marks that appear on the skin. They have an off-color color.

ori_sentence: Pericarditis is inflammation of the pericardium (the fibrous sac surrounding the heart).
simple_sent: Pericarditis is a disease of the heart. It causes inflammation of the pericardium.

ori_sentence: Diabetic coma is a reversible form of coma found in people with diabetes mellitus.
simple_sent: Diabetic coma is when a person has diabetes, and they can not wake up.

ori_sentence: Ovarian cancer is a cancer that forms in or on an ovary.
simple_sent: Ovarian cancer is a cancer that affects the ovary.

ori_sentence: Holt–Oram syndrome (also called atrio-digital syndrome, atriodigital dysplasia, cardiac-limb syndrome, heart-hand syndrome type 1, HOS, ventriculo-radial syndrome) is an autosomal dominant disorder that affects bones in the arms and hands (the upper limbs) and often causes heart problems.
simple_sent: Holt-Oram syndrome (also called atrio-digital syndrome, atriodigital dysplasia, cardiac-limb syndrome, heart-hand syndrome, and ventriculo-radial syndrome) is a disease. People who have the disease have problems with the bones in their arms and hands.

ori_sentence: Astigmatism is a type of refractive error due to rotational asymmetry in the eye's refractive power.
simple_sent: Astigmatism is a type of vision problem. It is caused by an imbalance in the eye's refractive power.

ori_sentence: Erythroderma is an inflammatory skin disease with redness and scaling that affects nearly the entire cutaneous surface.
simple_sent: Erythroderma is an inflammatory skin disease. It causes redness and scaling on the skin, usually on the face.

ori_sentence: An air embolism, also known as a gas embolism, is a blood vessel blockage caused by one or more bubbles of air or other gas in the circulatory system.
simple_sent: An air embolism (also called a gas embolism) is a blockage of blood vessels. This happens when air or other gas gets into the blood.

ori_sentence: Periodic paralysis is a group of rare genetic diseases that lead to weakness or paralysis from common triggers such as cold, heat, high carbohydrate meals, not eating, stress or excitement and physical activity of any kind.
simple_sent: Periodic paralysis is a group of rare diseases. These diseases cause the person to become weak or paralyzed if they are exposed to certain things, such as cold, heat, not eating, or stress.

ori_sentence: The transverse abdominal muscle (TVA), also known as the transverse abdominis, transversalis muscle and transversus abdominis muscle, is a muscle layer of the anterior and lateral (front and side) abdominal wall which is deep to (layered below) the internal oblique muscle.
simple_sent: The transverse abdominal muscle (TVA), also known as the transverse abdominis, transversalis muscle and transversus abdominis, is a muscle in the belly. It is the second largest muscle in the body after the oblique muscle.

ori_sentence: An osteoid osteoma is a benign (non-cancerous) bone tumor that arises from osteoblasts and some components of osteoclasts.
simple_sent: An osteoid osteoma is a bone tumor that does not cause any problems. It is a non-cancerous bone tumor.

ori_sentence: Radiculopathy, also commonly referred to as pinched nerve, refers to a set of conditions in which one or more nerves are affected and do not work properly (a neuropathy).
simple_sent: Radiculopathy, also called pinched nerve, is a set of conditions. In these conditions, one or more nerves are affected, and they do not work properly.

ori_sentence: Compartment syndrome is a condition in which increased pressure within one of the body's anatomical compartments results in insufficient blood supply to tissue within that space.
simple_sent: Compartment syndrome is a condition. When there is a lot of pressure in one area of the body, the blood can not get to the part of the body that needs it.

ori_sentence: Fibrosarcoma (fibroblastic sarcoma) is a malignant mesenchymal tumour derived from fibrous connective tissue and characterized by the presence of immature proliferating fibroblasts or undifferentiated anaplastic spindle cells in a storiform pattern.
simple_sent: Fibrosarcoma (fibroblastic sarcoma) is a malignant cancer of the connective tissue. The cells that cause fibrosarcoma are called fibroblasts. The cells that cause fibrosarcoma are called spindle cells.

ori_sentence: Arthritis is a term often used to mean any disorder that affects joints.
simple_sent: Arthritis is a common disease. It is any disease that affects the joints.

ori_sentence: Malakoplakia (from Greek Malako "soft" + Plako "plaque") is a rare inflammatory condition which makes its presence known as a papule, plaque or ulceration that usually affects the genitourinary tract.
simple_sent: Malakoplakia (from Greek Malako "soft" + Plako "plaque") is a rare disease. When people have it, it looks like a papule, plaque or ulcer, and it can be very bad.

ori_sentence: Contact dermatitis is a type of inflammation of the skin.
simple_sent: Contact dermatitis is a condition of the skin.

ori_sentence: Yellow nail syndrome, also known as "primary lymphedema associated with yellow nails and pleural effusion", is a very rare medical syndrome that includes pleural effusions, lymphedema (due to under development of the lymphatic vessels) and yellow dystrophic nails.
simple_sent: Yellow nail syndrome, also known as primary lymphedema associated with yellow nails and pleural effusion, is a rare medical condition. People who have the disease will have yellow nails, lymphedema, and not enough lymphatic vessels to drain the blood.

ori_sentence: The quadratus lumborum muscle, informally called the QL, is a paired muscle of the left and right posterior abdominal wall.
simple_sent: The quadratus lumborum muscle is a muscle in the back of the body. It is also called the QL muscle.

ori_sentence: Sinusitis, also known as rhinosinusitis, is inflammation of the mucous membranes that line the sinuses resulting in symptoms that may include thick nasal mucus, a plugged nose, and facial pain.
simple_sent: Sinusitis, also known as rhinosinusitis, is an infection of the sinuses. When people get sinusitis, they have a plugged nose, thick nasal mucus, and pain in their face.

ori_sentence: Catatonia is a neuropsychiatric behavioral syndrome that is characterized by abnormal movements, immobility, abnormal behaviors, and withdrawal.
simple_sent: Catatonia is a behavioral disorder. People with catatonia have abnormal movements, immobility, abnormal behaviors, and withdrawal.

ori_sentence: The vastus intermedius (/ˈvæstəs ˌɪntərˈmiːdiəs/)
simple_sent: Vastus intermedius (Latin: vastus largeus)

ori_sentence: Osteoblastoma is an uncommon osteoid tissue-forming primary neoplasm of the bone.
simple_sent: Osteoblastoma is a rare bone cancer. It forms in the primary bone tissue.

ori_sentence: Focal segmental glomerulosclerosis (FSGS), also known as “focal glomerular sclerosis” or “focal nodular glomerulosclerosis,” is a histopathologic finding of scarring (sclerosis) of glomeruli and damage to renal podocytes.
simple_sent: Focal segmental glomerulosclerosis (FSGS), also known as focal nodular glomerulosclerosis, focal glomerular sclerosis, or focal glomerular sclerosis, is a disease of the glomeruli.

ori_sentence: Embryonal carcinoma is a relatively uncommon type of germ cell tumour that occurs in the ovaries and testes.
simple_sent: Embryonal carcinoma is a type of cancer that does not happen a lot. It happens in the ovaries and testes.

ori_sentence: Emery–Dreifuss muscular dystrophy (EDMD) is a type of muscular dystrophy, a group of heritable diseases that cause progressive impairment of muscles.
simple_sent: The Emery-Dreifuss type of muscular dystrophy (EDMD) is one of the most common forms of muscular dystrophy. People with EDMD have problems with muscles.

ori_sentence: Empty sella syndrome is the condition when the pituitary gland shrinks or becomes flattened, filling the sella turcica with cerebrospinal fluid instead of the normal pituitary.
simple_sent: Empty sella syndrome is when the pituitary gland becomes flattened or smaller. This makes the sella turcica (the female part of the pituitary gland) smaller.

ori_sentence: Sleep paralysis (plural: sleep paralyses) is a state, during waking up or falling asleep, in which a person is aware but unable to move or speak.
simple_sent: Sleep paralysis (also called sleep paralysis or sleep paralysis) is when a person can not move or speak when they wake up or fall asleep.

ori_sentence: Necrolytic migratory erythema is a red, blistering rash that spreads across the skin.
simple_sent: Necrolytic erythema is a red, blistering rash. It looks like a red rash.

ori_sentence: The erector spinae (/ɪˈrɛktər ˈspaɪni/ i-REK-tər SPY-nee) or spinal erectors is a set of muscles that straighten and rotate the back.
simple_sent: The erector spinae or spinal erectors is a set of muscles in the back. They help to straighten and rotate the back.

ori_sentence: A lymphocele is a collection of lymphatic fluid within the body not bordered by epithelial lining.
simple_sent: A lymphocele is a place in the body where the lymphatic fluid is not surrounded by skin.

ori_sentence: In the human body, the adductor longus is a skeletal muscle located in the thigh.
simple_sent: In the human body, the adductor longus muscle is located in the thigh.

ori_sentence: The gracilis muscle (/ˈɡræsɪlɪs/; Latin for "slender") is the most superficial muscle on the medial side of the thigh.
simple_sent: The gracilis muscle is a muscle in the thigh. The word "gracilis" comes from the Latin word meaning "slender".

ori_sentence: A thymoma is a tumor originating from the epithelial cells of the thymus that is considered a rare malignancy.
simple_sent: A thymoma is a tumor in the thymus. It is a rare malignancy because it does not usually affect people.

ori_sentence: Idiopathic interstitial pneumonia (IIP), or noninfectious pneumonia are a class of diffuse lung diseases.
simple_sent: Idiopathic interstitial pneumonia (IIP) is a disease. It is different from regular pneumonia.

ori_sentence: Rhabdomyosarcoma (RMS), is a highly aggressive form of cancer that develops from mesenchymal cells that have failed to fully differentiate into myocytes of skeletal muscle.
simple_sent: Rhabdomyosarcoma (RMS) is a type of bone cancer. It starts in the mesenchymal cells, which are the cells that make up the skeletal muscle.

ori_sentence: A food allergy is an abnormal immune response to food.
simple_sent: A food allergy is when the body does not like food.

ori_sentence: Testicular torsion occurs when the spermatic cord (from which the testicle is suspended) twists, cutting off the blood supply to the testicle.
simple_sent: Testicular torsion happens when the testicle is attached to the spermatic cord. When this happens, blood can not get to the testicle.

ori_sentence: In medicine, Meigs's syndrome, also Meigs syndrome or Demons–Meigs syndrome, is the triad of ascites, pleural effusion, and benign ovarian tumor (ovarian fibroma, fibrothecoma, Brenner tumour, and occasionally granulosa cell tumour).
simple_sent: In medicine, Meigs's syndrome, also Meigs syndrome or Demons-Meigs syndrome, is when a person has three things at the same time: pleural effusion, ascites, and an ovarian tumor. It can also be called fibrothecoma.

ori_sentence: Mild cognitive impairment (MCI) is a neurocognitive disorder which involves cognitive impairments beyond those expected based on an individual's age and education but which are not significant enough to interfere with instrumental activities of daily living.
simple_sent: Mild cognitive impairment (MCI) is a neurocognitive disorder. People with mild cognitive impairment have problems with thinking and language, but they are not significant enough to interfere with their daily life.

ori_sentence: The tensor fasciae latae (or tensor fasciæ latæ or, formerly, tensor vaginae femoris) is a muscle of the thigh.
simple_sent: The tensor fasciae latae is a muscle in the thigh. It is also called the tensor fasciæ latæ.

ori_sentence: Kyphosis is an abnormally excessive convex curvature of the spine as it occurs in the thoracic and sacral regions.
simple_sent: Kyphosis is an abnormally large curvature of the spine. It usually happens in the sacral and thoracic regions.

ori_sentence: A thyroglossal cyst is a fibrous cyst that forms from a persistent thyroglossal duct.
simple_sent: A thyroglossal cyst is a cyst in the thyroglossal duct. It is usually small.

ori_sentence: An enostosis is a small area of compact bone within the cancellous bone.
simple_sent: An enostosis is a small bone defect. It is a small area of bone.

ori_sentence: Epiglottitis is the inflammation of the epiglottis—the flap at the base of the tongue that prevents food entering the trachea (windpipe).
simple_sent: Epiglottitis is an infection of the epiglottis. The epiglottis is a flap at the base of the tongue that keeps food out.

ori_sentence: Lymphomatoid papulosis (LyP) is a rare skin disorder.
simple_sent: Lymphomatoid papulosis is a very rare disease.

ori_sentence: The adductor magnus is a large triangular muscle, situated on the medial side of the thigh.
simple_sent: The adductor magnus is a muscle in the thigh. It is a large triangular muscle.

ori_sentence: The gluteus minimus, or glutæus minimus, the smallest of the three gluteal muscles, is situated immediately beneath the gluteus medius.
simple_sent: The gluteus minimus is the smallest of the three gluteal muscles. The gluteus medius is the largest gluteal muscle.

ori_sentence: Spondylolysis is a defect or stress fracture in the pars interarticularis of the vertebral arch.
simple_sent: Spondylolysis is a fracture of the vertebral arch. This is called a stress fracture.

ori_sentence: Blepharitis is one of the most common ocular conditions characterized by inflammation, scaling, reddening, and crusting of the eyelid.
simple_sent: Blepharitis is one of the most common eye conditions. The most common symptom of blepharitis is redness and swelling of the eyelid.

ori_sentence: Cerebral hypoxia is a form of hypoxia (reduced supply of oxygen), specifically involving the brain; when the brain is completely deprived of oxygen, it is called cerebral anoxia.
simple_sent: Cerebral hypoxia is when the brain does not get enough oxygen. When there is not enough oxygen in the brain, this is called cerebral anoxia and it is very bad.

ori_sentence: Transitional cell carcinoma, also called urothelial carcinoma, is a type of cancer that typically occurs in the urinary system.
simple_sent: Transitional cell carcinoma, also known as urothelial carcinoma, is a cancer of the urinary system.

ori_sentence: Neurogenic shock is a distributive type of shock resulting in hypotension (low blood pressure), often with bradycardia (slowed heart rate), caused by disruption of autonomic nervous system pathways.
simple_sent: Neurogenic shock is a type of shock. It causes low blood pressure (hypotension) and slow heart rate. This is because the autonomic nervous system is disrupted.

ori_sentence: Horner's syndrome, also known as oculosympathetic paresis, is a combination of symptoms that arises when a group of nerves known as the sympathetic trunk is damaged.
simple_sent: Horner's syndrome, also known as oculosympathetic paresis, is a disease. It is caused by damage to a part of the nervous system called the sympathetic trunk.

ori_sentence: Mastitis is inflammation of the breast or udder, usually associated with breastfeeding.
simple_sent: Mastitis is an infection of the breast. It usually happens during breastfeeding.

ori_sentence: In human anatomy, the extensor carpi ulnaris is a skeletal muscle located on the ulnar side of the forearm.
simple_sent: The extensor carpi ulnaris is a skeletal muscle in the forearm. It is located on the ulnar side.

ori_sentence: The semitendinosus (/ˌsɛmiˌtɛndɪˈnoʊsəs/) is a long superficial muscle in the back of the thigh.
simple_sent: The semitendinosus is a long muscle in the back of the thigh. It is called a thigh muscle.

ori_sentence: Fanconi anaemia (FA) is a rare genetic disease resulting in impaired response to DNA damage.
simple_sent: Fanconi anaemia is a rare disease. It happens when a person's DNA gets damaged.

ori_sentence: Usher syndrome, also known as Hallgren syndrome, Usher–Hallgren syndrome, retinitis pigmentosa–dysacusis syndrome or dystrophia retinae dysacusis syndrome, is a rare genetic disorder caused by a mutation in any one of at least 11 genes resulting in a combination of hearing loss and visual impairment.
simple_sent: Usher syndrome, also known as Hallgren syndrome, Usher–Hallgren syndrome, retinitis pigmentosa–dysacusis syndrome, or dystrophia retinae dysacusis, is a rare disease. People who have Usher syndrome have either hearing loss, visual impairment, or both.

ori_sentence: Hot flashes (also known as hot flushes) are a form of flushing, often caused by the changing hormone levels that are characteristic of menopause.
simple_sent: Hot flashes (also known as hot flushes) can happen at any time of the day or night. They are often caused by changing hormone levels.

ori_sentence: Hepatosplenomegaly (commonly abbreviated HSM) is the simultaneous enlargement of both the liver (hepatomegaly) and the spleen (splenomegaly).
simple_sent: Hepatosplenomegaly (commonly abbreviated HSM) is when the spleen and liver become bigger at the same time. This is called hepatomegaly.

ori_sentence: A papilloma (plural papillomas or papillomata) (
simple_sent: A papilloma is a tumor on the skin.

ori_sentence: In anatomy, flexor carpi radialis is a muscle of the human forearm that acts to flex and (radially) abduct the hand.
simple_sent: The flexor carpi radialis is a muscle in the forearm. It is the main muscle of the forearm.

ori_sentence: Allergic conjunctivitis (AC) is inflammation of the conjunctiva (the membrane covering the white part of the eye) due to allergy.
simple_sent: Allergic conjunctivitis (AC) is a disease of the eye. It is caused by an allergy to the white part of the eye.

ori_sentence: The Eucoccidiorida are an order of microscopic, spore-forming, single-celled parasites belonging to the apicomplexan class Conoidasida.
simple_sent: The Eucoccidiorida are an order of single-celled parasites. The single-celled parasites are microscopic in size.

ori_sentence: A cystic hygroma is an abnormal growth that usually appears on a baby's neck or head.
simple_sent: A cystic hygroma is a growth on a baby's head or neck that is not normal.

ori_sentence: Fanconi syndrome or Fanconi's syndrome (English: /fɑːnˈkoʊni/, /fæn-/) is a syndrome of inadequate reabsorption in the proximal renal tubules of the kidney.
simple_sent: Fanconi syndrome or Fanconi's syndrome is a disease. People who have the disease will have tubules in the kidney that are too small.

ori_sentence: A granuloma is an aggregation of macrophages that forms in response to chronic inflammation.
simple_sent: A granuloma is a mass of macrophages. They form when there is a lot of inflammation.

ori_sentence: The flexor digitorum profundus is a muscle in the forearm of humans that flexes the fingers (also known as digits).
simple_sent: The flexor digitorum profundus is a muscle in the forearm. It is used to flex the fingers and thumbs.

ori_sentence: Protothecosis, otherwise known as Algaemia, is a disease found in dogs, cats, cattle, and humans caused by a type of green alga known as Prototheca that lacks chlorophyll and enters the human or animal bloodstream.
simple_sent: Protothecosis, also known as algaemia, is a disease. It is caused by a type of alga (green alga) that does not have chlorophyll. This alga gets into the human or animal's blood.

ori_sentence: Steatopygia is the state of having substantial levels of tissue on the buttocks and thighs.
simple_sent: Steatopygia is a condition where there is a lot of tissue on the buttocks and thighs.

ori_sentence: Paraphrenia is a mental disorder characterized by an organized system of paranoid delusions with or without hallucinations (the positive symptoms of schizophrenia) and without deterioration of intellect or personality (its negative symptom).
simple_sent: Paraphrenia is a mental disorder. It is characterized by an organized system of paranoid delusions (positive symptoms of schizophrenia) and sometimes hallucinations (negative symptoms of schizophrenia).

ori_sentence: Nocardiosis is an infectious disease affecting either the lungs (pulmonary nocardiosis) or the whole body (systemic nocardiosis).
simple_sent: Nocardiosis is a disease. When people get nocardiosis, they get sick with nocardiosis all over the body.

ori_sentence: Retinopathy is any damage to the retina of the eyes, which may cause vision impairment.
simple_sent: Retinopathy is when the retina of the eyes gets damaged. This can cause vision problems.

ori_sentence: Insomnia, also known as sleeplessness, is a sleep disorder in which people have trouble sleeping.
simple_sent: Insomnia, also known as sleeplessness, is a problem where people can not sleep well.

ori_sentence: Schizophreniform disorder is a mental disorder diagnosed when symptoms of schizophrenia are present for a significant portion of time (at least a month), but signs of disturbance are not present for the full six months required for the diagnosis of schizophrenia.
simple_sent: Schizophreniform disorder is a mental disorder. People with this disorder usually have symptoms of schizophrenia for a long time (at least a month), but they do not have all the symptoms for the full six months.

ori_sentence: Dopamine beta (β)-hydroxylase deficiency is a condition involving inadequate dopamine beta-hydroxylase.
simple_sent: Dopamine beta-hydroxylase is an enzyme. It breaks down dopamine to make other chemicals.

ori_sentence: In human anatomy, the abductor pollicis longus (APL) is one of the extrinsic muscles of the hand.
simple_sent: The abductor pollicis longus is a muscle in the hand. It is also called the abductor finger.

ori_sentence: Multiple organ dysfunction syndrome (MODS) is altered organ function in an acutely ill patient requiring medical intervention to achieve homeostasis.
simple_sent: Multiple organ dysfunction syndrome (MODS) is when the patient has many different organs that do not work properly together.

ori_sentence: Ameloblastoma is a rare, benign or cancerous tumor of odontogenic epithelium (ameloblasts, or outside portion, of the teeth during development) much more commonly appearing in the lower jaw than the upper jaw.
simple_sent: Ameloblastoma is a rare cancer of the teeth. It is usually found in the lower jaw, but it can also be found in the upper jaw as well. The cells that cause ameloblastoma are called epithelium.

ori_sentence: Opsoclonus refers to uncontrolled, irregular, and nonrhythmic eye movement.
simple_sent: Opsoclonus is when the eye does not work properly or at all.

ori_sentence: Macular edema occurs when fluid and protein deposits collect on or under the macula of the eye (a yellow central area of the retina) and causes it to thicken and swell (edema).
simple_sent: Macular edema is when fluid or protein builds up under the macula of the eye. This makes the eye water a yellow color and makes the eye look red and watery.

ori_sentence: Hyperplasia (from ancient Greek ὑπέρ huper 'over' + πλάσις plasis 'formation'), or hypergenesis, is an enlargement of an organ or tissue caused by an increase in the amount of organic tissue that results from cell proliferation.
simple_sent: Hyperplasia is an enlargement of an organ or tissue. When there is an increase in the amount of cells in an area, the amount of organic tissue increases, and the tissue gets bigger.

ori_sentence: A rhabdomyoma is a benign tumor of striated muscle.
simple_sent: A rhabdomyoma is a small tumor, usually small.

ori_sentence: Bird fancier's lung (BFL) is a type of hypersensitivity pneumonitis.
simple_sent: Bird fancier's lung is a disease. It is also called BFL.

ori_sentence: The extensor digitorum muscle (also known as extensor digitorum communis) is a muscle of the posterior forearm present in humans and other animals.
simple_sent: The extensor digitorum muscle (also called the extensor digitorum communis) is a muscle in the forearm. It is found in the back.

ori_sentence: Trichofolliculoma is a cutaneous condition characterized by a benign, highly structured tumor of the pilosebaceous unit.
simple_sent: Trichofolliculoma is a cutaneous condition. It is a benign tumor of the pilosebaceous unit in the skin.

ori_sentence: Nail–patella syndrome  is a genetic disorder that results in small, poorly developed nails and kneecaps, but can also affect many other areas of the body, such as the elbows, chest, and hips.
simple_sent: Nail-patella syndrome is a genetic disorder. People who have it have small, poorly developed nails. It can also affect other parts of the body, like the elbows and the hips.

ori_sentence: Osteoporosis is a systemic skeletal disorder characterized by low bone mass, micro-architectural deterioration of bone tissue leading to bone fragility, and consequent increase in fracture risk.
simple_sent: Osteoporosis is a disease of the bones. It causes low bone mass, which makes the bone weak. This makes the bone stronger, but it also increases the risk of fracture.

ori_sentence: Cortical blindness is the total or partial loss of vision in a normal-appearing eye caused by damage to the brain's occipital cortex.
simple_sent: Cortical blindness is damage to the brain's occipital cortex. This causes a total or partial loss of vision in a normal eye.

ori_sentence: Flexor digitorum superficialis (flexor digitorum sublimis) is an extrinsic flexor muscle of the fingers at the proximal interphalangeal joints.
simple_sent: The Flexor digitorum superficialis is a flexor muscle of the fingers. It is also called the flexor digitorum sublimis.

ori_sentence: Erythroplakia is a clinical term to describe any erythematous (red) area on a mucous membrane, that cannot be attributed to any other pathology.
simple_sent: Erythroplakia is a medical term. It describes a red area on a mucous membrane. It can not be caused by anything else.

ori_sentence: Pelvic inflammatory disease, also known as pelvic inflammatory disorder (PID), is an infection of the upper part of the female reproductive system, namely the uterus, fallopian tubes, and ovaries, and inside of the pelvis.
simple_sent: Pelvic inflammatory disease (PID) is an infection of the upper part of the female reproductive system. This includes the uterus, fallopian tubes, ovaries, and the inside of the pelvis.

ori_sentence: The pectoralis major (from Latin pectus 'breast') is a thick, fan-shaped or triangular convergent muscle, situated at the chest of the human body.
simple_sent: The pectoralis major (from Latin pectus 'breast ') is a muscle in the chest. It is very thick and it looks like a fan.

ori_sentence: Marshall-Smith Syndrome, discovered in 1971
simple_sent: Marshall-Smith syndrome is a disease.

ori_sentence: Osteochondromas are the most common benign tumors of the bones.
simple_sent: Osteochondromas are the most common bone cancer in people.

ori_sentence: Paget's disease of bone (commonly known as Paget's disease or, historically, osteitis deformans) is a condition involving cellular remodeling and deformity of one or more bones.
simple_sent: Paget's disease of bone (also called Paget's disease or osteitis deformans) is a disease. It causes changes to the cells in the bones.

ori_sentence: Osteolysis is an active resorption of bone matrix by osteoclasts and can be interpreted as the reverse of ossification.
simple_sent: Osteolysis is the active resorption of bone matrix by osteoclasts. It is the opposite of ossification.

ori_sentence: The gluteus medius, one of the three gluteal muscles, is a broad, thick, radiating muscle.
simple_sent: The gluteus medius is a muscle in the leg. It is one of three gluteal muscles.

ori_sentence: A vestibular schwannoma (VS), also called acoustic neuroma, is a benign tumor that develops on the vestibulocochlear nerve that passes from the inner ear to the brain.
simple_sent: A vestibular schwannoma (also called acoustic neuroma) is a type of tumor. It happens when a nerve that goes from the inner ear to the brain becomes damaged.

ori_sentence: Slipped capital femoral epiphysis (SCFE or skiffy, slipped upper femoral epiphysis, SUFE or souffy, coxa vara adolescentium)
simple_sent: Slipped upper femoral epiphysis (SUFE or souffy, coxa vara adolescentium) is a defect in the acetabulum.

ori_sentence: Diaphragmatic hernia is a defect or hole in the diaphragm that allows the abdominal contents to move into the chest cavity.
simple_sent: Diaphragmatic hernia A diaphragmatic hernia is a hole in the diaphragm. It allows the stomach to move into the chest.

ori_sentence: Schizoaffective disorder (SZA, SZD or SAD) is a mental disorder characterized by abnormal thought processes and an unstable mood.
simple_sent: Schizoaffective disorder (SZA, SZD or SAD) is a mental disorder. People who have this disorder have an unstable mood.

ori_sentence: Hepatitis C is an infectious disease caused by the hepatitis C virus (HCV) that primarily affects the liver; it is a type of viral hepatitis.
simple_sent: Hepatitis C is a disease caused by a virus in a human blood called the Hepatitis C virus. The disease mainly affects the liver.

ori_sentence: Cholangiocarcinoma, also known as bile duct cancer, is a type of cancer that forms in the bile ducts.
simple_sent: Cholangiocarcinoma is a cancer of the bile ducts. It is also called bile duct cancer.

ori_sentence: Duodenitis is inflammation of the duodenum.
simple_sent: Duodenitis is a medical condition.

ori_sentence: Viral hemorrhagic fevers (VHFs) are a diverse group of animal and human illnesses in which fever and hemorrhage are caused by a viral infection.
simple_sent: Viral hemorrhagic fevers (VHFs) are a group of diseases. In these diseases, the fever and bleeding are caused by a viral infection.

ori_sentence: Prader–Willi syndrome (PWS) is a genetic disorder caused by a loss of function of specific genes on chromosome 15.
simple_sent: Prader-Willi syndrome (PWS) is a life long disease. It is caused by a lack of certain genes.

ori_sentence: Palpitations are perceived abnormalities of the heartbeat characterized by awareness of cardiac muscle contractions in the chest, which is further characterized by the hard, fast and/or irregular beatings of the heart.
simple_sent: Palpitations are a feeling that the heart is beating too fast or too slow. They are caused by muscle contractions in the chest, and the hard, fast and/or irregular beatings of the heart.

ori_sentence: Dyshidrosis is a type of dermatitis that is characterized by itchy blisters on the palms of the hands and bottoms of the feet.
simple_sent: Dyshidrosis is a type of skin disease. People with Dyshidrosis have itchy blisters on their hands and feet.

ori_sentence: Respiratory acidosis is a state in which decreased ventilation (hypoventilation) increases the concentration of carbon dioxide in the blood and decreases the blood's pH (a condition generally called acidosis).
simple_sent: Respiratory acidosis is a condition in which the blood's pH is lower than it should be. This happens when people have less ventilation and their blood has less carbon dioxide in it.

ori_sentence: A lentigo (/lɛnˈtaɪɡoʊ/) (plural lentigines, /lɛnˈtɪdʒɪniːz/) is a small pigmented spot on the skin with a clearly defined edge, surrounded by normal-appearing skin.
simple_sent: A lentigo (plural lentigines) is a small spot on the skin. It has a clear edge, and is surrounded by normal-appearing skin, but people do not know this.

ori_sentence: A trisomy is a type of polysomy in which there are three instances of a particular chromosome, instead of the normal two.
simple_sent: A trisomy is a polysomy. This means that there are three different versions of a chromosome, instead of two.

ori_sentence: Angiokeratoma is a benign cutaneous lesion of capillaries, resulting in small marks of red to blue color and characterized by hyperkeratosis.
simple_sent: Angiokeratoma is a benign cutaneous lesion of capillaries. It causes small marks on the skin that look red to blue in color.

ori_sentence: Sydenham's chorea, also known as chorea minor and historically and occasionally referred to as St Vitus' dance, is a disorder characterized by rapid, uncoordinated jerking movements primarily affecting the face, hands and feet.
simple_sent: Sydenham's chorea, also known as chorea minor and sometimes as St Vitus' dance, is a dance disorder. People who have it have rapid, uncoordinated jerking movements that affect the face, hands and feet.

ori_sentence: The extensor carpi radialis longus is one of the five main muscles that control movements at the wrist.
simple_sent: The extensor carpi radialis longus is a muscle in the wrist. It is one of five main muscles.

ori_sentence: Ganglioneuroma is a rare and benign tumor of the autonomic nerve fibers arising from neural crest sympathogonia, which are completely undifferentiated cells of the sympathetic nervous system.
simple_sent: Ganglioneuroma is a rare tumor of the autonomic nerve. The cells that cause it are called neural crest sympathogonia, and they are all the same kind of cells.

ori_sentence: A myxoma (New Latin from Greek 'muxa' for mucus) is a myxoid tumor of primitive connective tissue.
simple_sent: A myxoma (from Greek 'muxa' for mucus) is a tumor in the eye. It is a type of cancer.

ori_sentence: Brachydactyly (Greek βραχύς = "short" plus δάκτυλος = "finger"), is a medical term which literally means "short finger".
simple_sent: Brachydactyly is a medical term. The Greek word literally means "short finger", but the term is more of a medical term.

ori_sentence: The plantaris is one of the superficial muscles of the superficial posterior compartment of the leg, one of the fascial compartments of the leg.
simple_sent: The plantaris is a muscle in the back of the leg. The plantaris is one of the superficial muscles of the back of the leg.

ori_sentence: The flexor pollicis longus (/ˈflɛksər ˈpɒlɪsɪs ˈlɒŋɡəs/; FPL, Latin flexor, bender; pollicis, of the thumb; longus, long) is a muscle in the forearm and hand that flexes the thumb.
simple_sent: The flexor pollicis longus (FPL) is a muscle in the forearm and hand. It flexes the thumb and is the second largest muscle in the hand.

ori_sentence: In human anatomy, the extensor pollicis brevis is a skeletal muscle on the dorsal side of the forearm.
simple_sent: The extensor pollicis brevis is a muscle in the forearm. It is the largest muscle in the hand.
