ori_sentence: Cockayne syndrome (CS), also called Neill-Dingwall syndrome, is a rare and fatal autosomal recessive neurodegenerative disorder characterized by growth failure, impaired development of the nervous system, abnormal sensitivity to sunlight (photosensitivity), eye disorders and premature aging.
simple_sent: Cockayne syndrome (CS), also called Neill-Dingwall syndrome, is a rare and fatal disorder. It is caused by a gene in the human body that does not work properly. This causes growth failure, problems with the nervous system, eye disorders and premature aging.

ori_sentence: Manganism or manganese poisoning is a toxic condition resulting from chronic exposure to manganese.
simple_sent: Manganese poisoning is when manganese is in a person's blood for a long time.

ori_sentence: Poikilocytosis is variation in cell shape: poikilocytes may be oval, teardrop-shaped, sickle-shaped or irregularly contracted.
simple_sent: The shape of the poikilocytes can be oval, teardrop-shaped, sickle-shaped or contracted in a different way.

ori_sentence: Prolymphocytic leukemia is divided into two types according to the kind of cell involved: B-cell prolymphocytic leukemia and T-cell prolymphocytic leukemia.
simple_sent: Prolymphocytic leukemia is a cancer of blood and bone marrow. People with prolymphocytic leukemia have a lot of blood and bone marrow.

ori_sentence: Ventricular flutter is an arrhythmia, more specifically a tachycardia affecting the ventricles with a rate over 250-350 beats/min, and one of the most indiscernible.
simple_sent: Ventricular flutter is an arrhythmia. It is when the heart is beating too fast. It usually happens at a rate of over 250-350 beats per minute.

ori_sentence: Refeeding syndrome is a metabolic disturbance that occurs as a result of reinstitution of nutrition in people and animals who are starved, severely malnourished, or metabolically stressed because of severe illness.
simple_sent: Refeeding syndrome is a problem with the body's metabolism. It happens when people and animals who have been starved or severely malnourished, or who have been sick for a long time, get new food.

ori_sentence: Valvular heart disease is any cardiovascular disease process involving one or more of the four valves of the heart (the aortic and mitral valves on the left side of heart and the pulmonic and tricuspid valves on the right side of heart).
simple_sent: Valvular heart disease is a disease of the heart. It usually affects one or more of the four main valves of the heart (the aortic valve, the mitral valve, the pulmonic valve, and the tricuspid valve).

ori_sentence: The smallpox vaccine was the first vaccine to be developed against a contagious disease.
simple_sent: The smallpox vaccine was the first vaccine to stop the disease completely.

ori_sentence: Capillary leak syndrome is characterized by the escape of blood plasma through capillary walls, from the blood circulatory system to surrounding tissues, muscle compartments, organs or body cavities.
simple_sent: Capillary leak syndrome is a medical condition. In it, blood flows out of the blood vessels and into other tissues, muscle groups, organs or body cavities.

ori_sentence: The subscapularis is a large triangular muscle which fills the subscapular fossa and inserts into the lesser tubercle of the humerus and the front of the capsule of the shoulder-joint.
simple_sent: The subscapularis is a large triangular muscle in the back of the shoulder. It fills the subscapular fossa, which is a small opening in the back of the shoulder.

ori_sentence: Dravet syndrome, previously known as severe myoclonic epilepsy of infancy (SMEI), is an autosomal dominant genetic disorder which causes a catastrophic form of epilepsy, with prolonged seizures that are often triggered by hot temperatures or fever.
simple_sent: Dravet syndrome, previously known as severe myoclonic epilepsy of infancy (SMEI), is an autosomal dominant genetic disorder. People with Dravet syndrome have a long time between seizures, and they often have more than one.

ori_sentence: A hydrocele is an accumulation of serous fluid in a body cavity.
simple_sent: A hydrocele is a fluid build-up in a body cavity.

ori_sentence: In human anatomy, extensor carpi radialis brevis is a muscle in the forearm that acts to extend and abduct the wrist.
simple_sent: In human anatomy, the extensor carpi radialis brevis is a muscle in the forearm. It is found in the forearm.

ori_sentence: Cystinosis is a lysosomal storage disease characterized by the abnormal accumulation of cystine, the oxidized dimer of the amino acid cysteine.
simple_sent: Cystinosis is a lysosomal storage disease. This disease happens when cystine, an amino acid, becomes too much in the body.

ori_sentence: In medicine, the median arcuate ligament syndrome (MALS, also known as celiac artery compression syndrome, celiac axis syndrome, celiac trunk compression syndrome or Dunbar syndrome) is a rare condition characterized by abdominal pain attributed to compression of the celiac artery and the celiac ganglia by the median arcuate ligament.
simple_sent: The median arcuate ligament syndrome (MALS), also known as celiac artery compression syndrome or celiac trunk compression syndrome, is a condition where the median arcuate ligament in the middle of the back of the body becomes wider than it should be. This causes abdominal pain.

ori_sentence: Trichoepithelioma is a neoplasm of the adnexa of the skin.
simple_sent: Trichoepithelioma is a type of skin cancer.

ori_sentence: An intracranial aneurysm, also known as a brain aneurysm, is a cerebrovascular disorder in which weakness in the wall of a cerebral artery or vein causes a localized dilation or ballooning of the blood vessel.
simple_sent: An intracranial aneurysm, also known as a brain aneurysm, is an abnormality of the wall of a blood vessel in the brain. When this happens, the blood vessel can become too wide.

ori_sentence: Duodenal cancer is a cancer in the first section of the small intestine known as the duodenum.
simple_sent: Duodenal cancer is a cancer of the duodenum. The duodenum is a part of the small intestine.

ori_sentence: Epulis (Greek: ἐπουλίς; plural epulides) is any tumor like enlargement (i.e. lump) situated on the gingival or alveolar mucosa.
simple_sent: Epulis (Greek, plural epulides) is a growth or lump on the gingival or alveolar mucosa, which is where teeth come from.

ori_sentence: Dyschromia refers to an alteration of the color of the skin or nails.
simple_sent: Dyschromia means that the skin or nails are not the same color.

ori_sentence: A dysostosis is a disorder of the development of bone, in particular affecting ossification.
simple_sent: Dysostosis is a disease. It causes problems with bone development, especially ossification.

ori_sentence: Urbach–Wiethe disease  is a very rare recessive genetic disorder, with approximately 400 reported cases since its discovery.
simple_sent: Urbach-Wiethe disease is a very rare genetic disorder. About 400 people in the world have it, and it is very dangerous.

ori_sentence: Hysterectomy is the surgical removal of the uterus.
simple_sent: A hysterectomy is when the uterus is removed.

ori_sentence: A thyroid adenoma is a benign tumor of the thyroid gland, that may be inactive or active (functioning autonomously) as a toxic adenoma.
simple_sent: A thyroid adenoma is a tumor on the thyroid gland. It can be a benign tumor, or it can be a toxic tumor that can cause cancer.

ori_sentence: Hemangioblastomas, or haemangioblastomas, are vascular tumors of the central nervous system that originate from the vascular system, usually during middle age.
simple_sent: Hemangioblastomas, or haemangioblastomas, are tumors in the central nervous system. They usually start in middle age, and usually cause pain.

ori_sentence: An arteriovenous fistula is an abnormal connection or passageway between an artery and a vein.
simple_sent: An arteriovenous fistula is where an artery meets a vein. This is called a fistula.

ori_sentence: Microstomia is a small mouth (micro- a combining form meaning small +
simple_sent: Microstomia is a word that means "small mouth" or "small".

ori_sentence: Microcheilia is a congenital disorder where one's lips are unusually small.
simple_sent: Microcheilia Microcheilia happens when a person's lips are too small.

ori_sentence: A bone sarcoma is a primary  malignant bone tumour, a type of sarcoma that starts in the bones.
simple_sent: A bone sarcoma is a malignant tumor in the bone. There are two types of bone sarcoma.

ori_sentence: No reflow phenomenon is the failure of blood to reperfuse an ischemic area after the physical obstruction has been removed or bypassed.
simple_sent: No reflow phenomenon is when the blood does not flow back to an ischemic area because the obstruction has been removed.

ori_sentence: An odontogenic tumor is a neoplasm of the cells or tissues that initiate odontogenic processes.
simple_sent: An odontogenic tumor is a tumor that does not cause any problems with the teeth.

ori_sentence: An obturator hernia is a rare type of hernia of the pelvic floor in which pelvic or abdominal contents protrudes through the obturator foramen.
simple_sent: An obturator hernia is a hernia of the pelvic floor. Usually, it is a simple hernia, and does not cost much money to treat.

ori_sentence: Mucinous cystadenocarcinoma is a type of tumor in the cystadenocarcinoma grouping.
simple_sent: Mucinous cystadenocarcinoma is a type of cancer. It is a type of brain tumor.

ori_sentence: Endometrial hyperplasia is a condition of excessive proliferation of the cells of the endometrium, or inner lining of the uterus.
simple_sent: Endometrial hyperplasia is a condition in which too many cells grow in the endometrium. The endometrium is the lining of the uterus.

ori_sentence: The hepatitis C virus (HCV) is a small (55–65 nm in size), enveloped, positive-sense single-stranded RNA virus of the family Flaviviridae.
simple_sent: The hepatitis C virus (HCV) is a virus. It is a small virus, about 55-65 nm in size, and it can not be seen or felt.

ori_sentence: Bruit, also called vascular murmur, is the abnormal sound generated by turbulent flow of blood in an artery due to either an area of partial obstruction or a localized high rate of blood flow through an unobstructed artery.
simple_sent: Bruit, also called vascular murmur, is a sound that is made when blood flows very fast in an artery. It can be caused by either a small blockage, or a very high rate of blood flow through the artery.

ori_sentence: Ovarian pregnancy refers to an ectopic pregnancy that is located in the ovary.
simple_sent: Ovarian pregnancy is when the ovary is not working properly.

ori_sentence: Congenital mesoblastic nephroma, while rare, is the most common kidney neoplasm diagnosed in the first three months of life and accounts for 3-5% of all childhood renal neoplasms.
simple_sent: Congenital mesoblastic nephroma is very rare. It is the most common kidney disease in children in the first three months of life. About 3-5% of children have it.

ori_sentence: Metageria is a cutaneous condition characterized by premature aging.
simple_sent: Metageria is a skin condition. It causes premature aging.

ori_sentence: A carbuncle is a cluster of boils caused by bacterial infection, most commonly with Staphylococcus aureus or Streptococcus pyogenes.
simple_sent: A carbuncle is a large group of boils on the skin. They are caused by a bacterial infection, usually Staphylococcus aureus.

ori_sentence: Macrophage activation syndrome is a severe, potentially life-threatening, complication of several chronic rheumatic diseases of childhood.
simple_sent: Macrophage activation syndrome is a life-threatening complication of several childhood rheumatic diseases. It is a serious condition.

ori_sentence: Essential tremor (ET), also called benign tremor, familial tremor, and idiopathic tremor, is a medical condition characterized by involuntary rhythmic contractions and relaxations (oscillations or twitching movements) of certain muscle groups in one or more body parts of unknown cause.
simple_sent: Essential tremor (ET), also called benign tremor, familial tremor, and idiopathic tremor, is a medical condition in which certain muscle groups in one or more parts of the body contract or relax in a way that is not normally done.

ori_sentence: Lecithin cholesterol acyltransferase deficiency is a disorder of lipoprotein metabolism.
simple_sent: Lecithin cholesterol acyltransferase deficiency is a medical condition.

ori_sentence: Lipoatrophy is the term describing the localized loss of fat tissue.
simple_sent: Lipoatrophy is when fat tissue is lost in certain areas.

itemLabel: syndrome of inappropriate antidiuretic hormone secretion
ori_sentence: Syndrome of inappropriate antidiuretic hormone secretion (SIADH) is characterized by excessive unsuppressible release of antidiuretic hormone (ADH) either from the posterior pituitary gland, or an abnormal non-pituitary source.
simple_sent: The most common cause is a lack of antidiuretic hormone (ADH) from the pituitary gland. When this happens, the body tries to make more ADH from other sources, but it does not work well.

ori_sentence: Osteochondromatosis is a condition involving a proliferation of osteochondromas.
simple_sent: Osteochondromatosis is a disease. There are many different osteochondromas.

ori_sentence: Clear cell sarcoma is a rare form of cancer called a sarcoma.
simple_sent: Clear cell sarcoma is a cancer that does not usually cause cancer.

ori_sentence: In psychology, stress is a feeling of emotional strain and pressure.
simple_sent: Stress in psychology is a feeling of pressure or stress.

ori_sentence: Greig cephalopolysyndactyly syndrome is a disorder that affects development of the limbs, head, and face.
simple_sent: Greig cephalopolysyndactyly syndrome is a rare disorder. It affects the face, head, and limbs.

ori_sentence: Loeys–Dietz syndrome (LDS) is an autosomal dominant genetic connective tissue disorder.
simple_sent: Loeys-Dietz syndrome is a genetic disease. It affects the connective tissue of the body.

ori_sentence: Shprintzen–Goldberg syndrome is a multiple anomaly syndrome that has craniosynostosis, multiple abdominal hernias, cognitive impairment, and other skeletal malformations as key features.
simple_sent: Shprintzen-Goldberg syndrome is a syndrome. People with Shprintzen-Goldberg syndrome have craniosynostosis, multiple abdominal hernias, and other problems.

ori_sentence: Scleroderma is a group of autoimmune diseases that may result in changes to the skin, blood vessels, muscles, and internal organs.
simple_sent: Scleroderma can cause changes to the skin, blood vessels, muscles, and internal organs. It is a type of autoimmune disease.

ori_sentence: Pacman dysplasia is a lethal autosomal recessive skeletal dysplasia.
simple_sent: Pacman dysplasia is a very dangerous disease. It is recessive.

ori_sentence: PAPA syndrome is an acronym for pyogenic arthritis, pyoderma gangrenosum and acne.
simple_sent: PAPA syndrome is a medical condition. It is also called pyogenic arthritis.

ori_sentence: Hereditary pancreatitis (HP) is an inflammation of the pancreas due to genetic causes.
simple_sent: Hereditary pancreatitis is a disease. It is caused by something in the body.

ori_sentence: Neutrophilic eccrine hidradenitis (NEH) usually is a cutaneous complication of chemotherapy, but it can also occur for other reasons.
simple_sent: Neutrophilic eccrine hidradenitis (NEH) is usually caused by chemotherapy, but it can also be caused by other things.

ori_sentence: Monoarthritis is inflammation (arthritis) of one joint at a time.
simple_sent: Monoarthritis happens in only one joint at a time.

ori_sentence: Giant cell arteritis (GCA), also called temporal arteritis, is an inflammatory autoimmune disease of large blood vessels.
simple_sent: Giant cell arteritis (GCA) is an autoimmune disease. It is also called temporal arteritis.

ori_sentence: Palmoplantar keratodermas are a heterogeneous group of disorders characterized by abnormal thickening of the stratum corneum of the palms and soles.
simple_sent: Palmoplantar keratodermas are a group of diseases in which the skin of the palms and soles of the feet become too thick.

ori_sentence: Wiskott–Aldrich syndrome (WAS) is a rare X-linked recessive disease characterized by eczema, thrombocytopenia (low platelet count), immune deficiency, and bloody diarrhea (secondary to the thrombocytopenia).
simple_sent: Wiskott-Aldrich syndrome (WAS) is a rare disease. People who have the disease have eczema, thrombocytopenia (low platelet count), an immune deficiency, and bloody diarrhea.

ori_sentence: Neuroferritinopathy  is a genetic neurodegenerative disorder characterized by the accumulation of iron in the basal ganglia, cerebellum, and motor cortex of the human brain.
simple_sent: Neuroferritinopathy is a genetic disorder. It happens when iron builds up in the brain's basal ganglia, cerebellum, and motor cortex.

ori_sentence: Pyaemia (or pyemia) is a type of sepsis that leads to widespread abscesses of a metastatic nature.
simple_sent: Pyaemia (or pyemia) is a type of sepsis. Many abscesses are caused by pyemia.

ori_sentence: Micropolygyria, is a neuronal migration disorder, a developmental anomaly of the brain characterized by development of numerous small convolutions (microgyri), causing intellectual disability and/or other neurological disorders.
simple_sent: Micropolygyria, is a developmental disorder of the brain. In this disorder, many small convolutions (microgyri) develop in the brain. This can cause intellectual disability and/or other neurological disorders.

ori_sentence: Neutrophil immunodeficiency syndrome is a condition caused by mutations in the Rac2 gene.
simple_sent: Neutrophil immunodeficiency syndrome is a rare disease. It is caused by a gene.

ori_sentence: Pagetoid reticulosis (also known as "acral mycoses fungoides", "localized epidermotropic reticulosis", "mycosis fungoides palmaris et plantaris", "unilesional mycosis fungoides", and "Woringer–Kolopp disease") is a cutaneous condition, an uncommon lymphoproliferative disorder, sometimes considered a form of mycosis fungoides.
simple_sent: Pagetoid reticulosis (also known as "acral mycoses fungoides", "localized epidermotropic reticulosis", "mycosis fungoides palmaris et plantaris", "unilesional mycosis fungoides", and "Woringer-Kolopp disease") is an infection of the skin. It is also known as an uncommon lymphoproliferative disorder.

ori_sentence: A pulmonary sequestration is a medical condition wherein a piece of tissue that ultimately develops into lung tissue is not attached to the pulmonary arterial blood supply, as is the case in normally developing lung.
simple_sent: A pulmonary sequestration is a medical condition in which a piece of tissue that eventually becomes lung tissue is not attached to the blood supply. In normally developing lung, this tissue is attached to the blood.

ori_sentence: Mucormycosis, also known as black fungus, is a serious fungal infection, usually in people who are immunocompromised.
simple_sent: Mucormycosis is a serious fungal infection. It is also called black fungus, because it looks like it.

ori_sentence: Human papillomavirus infection (HPV infection) is an infection caused by human papillomavirus (HPV), a DNA virus from the Papillomaviridae family.
simple_sent: Human papillomavirus infection (HPV infection) is a disease. The human papillomavirus (HPV) that causes it is a DNA virus.

ori_sentence: A myelodysplastic syndrome (MDS) is one of a group of cancers in which immature blood cells in the bone marrow do not mature, so do not become healthy blood cells.
simple_sent: Myelodysplastic syndrome (MDS) is a cancer of the bone marrow. In this disease, the blood cells in the bone marrow do not develop into healthy blood cells.

ori_sentence: A prolactinoma is a benign tumor (adenoma) of the pituitary gland that produces a hormone called prolactin.
simple_sent: A prolactinoma is a small tumor in the pituitary gland. It usually does not cause any problems.

ori_sentence: Oral submucous fibrosis is a chronic, complex, premalignant (1% transformation risk) condition of the oral cavity, characterized by juxta-epithelial inflammatory reaction and progressive fibrosis of the submucosal tissues (the lamina propria and deeper connective tissues).
simple_sent: Oral submucous fibrosis is a condition of the oral cavity. It is a long-term, complex condition that causes tissue in the oral cavity to change into fibrosis. The tissues that change into fibrosis are the lamina propria and deeper connective tissues.

ori_sentence: Medulloepithelioma is a rare, primitive, fast-growing brain tumour thought to stem from cells of the embryonic medullary cavity.
simple_sent: Medulloepithelioma is a rare type of brain tumor. It starts in the medullary cavity, a part of the brain.

ori_sentence: Multiple carboxylase deficiency is a form of metabolic disorder involving failures of carboxylation enzymes.
simple_sent: Multiple carboxylase deficiency is a disease. It happens when carboxylation enzymes do not work properly.

ori_sentence: Pachyonychia congenita (often abbreviated as "PC") is a rare group of autosomal dominant skin disorders that are caused by a mutation in one of five different keratin genes.
simple_sent: Pachyonychia congenita (often abbreviated as PC) is a condition of the skin. It is caused by a change in one of five keratin genes in the human body.

ori_sentence: Hyperhidrosis is a condition characterized by abnormally increased sweating, in excess of that required for regulation of body temperature.
simple_sent: Hyperhidrosis is a condition where people have an abnormally large amount of sweating. This is more than is needed to control body temperature.

ori_sentence: Aspermia is the complete lack of semen with ejaculation (not to be confused with azoospermia, the lack of sperm cells in the semen).
simple_sent: Aspermia is when there is no semen at all. This is not the same as azoospermia, where there are no sperm at all.

ori_sentence: Brugada syndrome (BrS) is a genetic disorder in which the electrical activity within the heart is abnormal.
simple_sent: Brugada syndrome (BrS) is a disease. In it, the heart does not work the way it should.

ori_sentence: A teratoma is a tumor made up of several different types of tissue, such as hair, muscle, teeth, or bone.
simple_sent: A teratoma is a tumor that is made up of different types of tissue. For example, hair or bone.

ori_sentence: Poliosis (also called poliosis circumscripta), is the decrease or absence of melanin (or colour) in head hair, eyebrows, eyelashes or any other hairy area.
simple_sent: Poliosis (also called poliosis circumscripta) is when there is less melanin in the hair on the head. This is also seen in eyebrows.

ori_sentence: Idiopathic intracranial hypertension (IIH), previously known as pseudotumor cerebri and benign intracranial hypertension, is a condition characterized by increased intracranial pressure (pressure around the brain) without a detectable cause.
simple_sent: Idaiopathic intracranial hypertension (IIH), also called benign intracranial hypertension or pseudotumor cerebri, is when the blood pressure in the brain becomes too high. There is no cause for this.

ori_sentence: Aortic valve replacement is a procedure whereby the failing aortic valve of a patient's heart is replaced with an artificial heart valve.
simple_sent: Aortic valve replacement is a medical treatment. In it, an artificial heart valve is placed in the place of the aortic valve.

ori_sentence: Orotic aciduria (AKA hereditary orotic aciduria) is a disease caused by an enzyme deficiency resulting in a decreased ability to synthesize pyrimidines.
simple_sent: Orotic aciduria (also called hereditary orotic aciduria) is a disease. It is caused by an enzyme in your body that is not working properly.

ori_sentence: Buphthalmos (plural: buphthalmoses) is enlargement of the eyeball and is most commonly seen in infants and young children.
simple_sent: Buphthalmos (plural: buphthalmoses) is when the eyeball becomes bigger. It is most often seen in young children.

ori_sentence: Roseola, also known as sixth disease, is an infectious disease caused by certain types of human herpes viruses.
simple_sent: Roseola (also called sixth disease) is a disease. It is caused by two types of herpes viruses.

ori_sentence: Macroglobulinemia is the presence of increased levels of macroglobulins in the circulating blood.
simple_sent: Macroglobulinemia is when there are more macroglobulins in the blood than normal.

ori_sentence: Pericoronitis is inflammation of the soft tissues surrounding the crown of a partially erupted tooth, including the gingiva (gums) and the dental follicle.
simple_sent: Pericoronitis is an infection of the soft tissues around a tooth. This includes the gingiva (gums) and the tissue around the tooth's crown.

ori_sentence: Carnosinemia, is a rare autosomal recessive metabolic disorder caused by a deficiency of carnosinase, a dipeptidase (a type of enzyme that splits dipeptides into their two amino acid constituents).
simple_sent: Carnosinemia is a rare disease. It is caused by a lack of carnosinase. Carnosinase is an enzyme that breaks down dipeptides into their two amino acids, niacin and riboflavin.

ori_sentence: The gastrocnemius muscle (plural gastrocnemii) is a superficial two-headed muscle that is in the back part of the lower leg of humans.
simple_sent: The gastrocnemius muscle is a muscle in the lower leg. It is a two-headed muscle because it has two heads.

ori_sentence: Pyoderma gangrenosum is a rare, inflammatory skin disease where painful pustules or nodules become ulcers that progressively grow.
simple_sent: Pyoderma gangrenosum is a rare disease of the skin. It causes painful nodules on the skin that eventually become ulcers.

ori_sentence: Marinesco–Sjögren syndrome (MSS), sometimes spelled Marinescu–Sjögren syndrome, is a rare autosomal recessive disorder.
simple_sent: Marinesco-Sjögren syndrome is a rare disorder. It is also called Marinescu-Sjögren syndrome or Marinescu-Sjögren syndrome.

ori_sentence: Asherman's syndrome (AS), is an acquired uterine condition that occurs when scar tissue (adhesions) form inside the uterus and/or the cervix.
simple_sent: Asherman's syndrome is a condition. It happens when scar tissue (adhesions) form inside the uterus, or on the outside of the uterus.

ori_sentence: Deep brain stimulation (DBS) is a neurosurgical procedure involving the placement of a medical device called a neurostimulator (sometimes referred to as a "brain pacemaker"), which sends electrical impulses, through implanted electrodes, to specific targets in the brain (brain nuclei) for the treatment of movement disorders, including Parkinson's disease, essential tremor, dystonia, and other conditions such as obsessive-compulsive disorder and epilepsy.
simple_sent: Deep brain stimulation (DBS) is a medical procedure in which a medical device called a neurostimulator is placed inside the brain. This device sends electrical impulses to specific parts of the brain (called the brain nuclei). This is done to help people with movement disorders such as Parkinson's disease, essential tremor, dystonia, and other conditions such as obsessive-compulsive disorder.

ori_sentence: Hairy cell leukemia is an uncommon hematological malignancy characterized by an accumulation of abnormal B lymphocytes.
simple_sent: Hairy cell leukemia is a rare hematological disease. It happens when B lymphocytes in the body become abnormal.

ori_sentence: Apert syndrome is a form of acrocephalosyndactyly, a congenital disorder characterized by malformations of the skull, face, hands and feet.
simple_sent: Apert syndrome is a form of acrocephalosyndactyly. People with Apert syndrome have problems with their skull, face, hands and feet.

ori_sentence: Erectile dysfunction (ED), also called impotence, is the type of sexual dysfunction in which the penis fails to become or stay erect during sexual activity.
simple_sent: Erectile dysfunction (ED), also called impotence, is when a man's penis is not able to stay erect during sex. It can also be called impotence.

ori_sentence: Retropharyngeal abscess (RPA) is an abscess located in the tissues in the back of the throat behind the posterior pharyngeal wall (the retropharyngeal space).
simple_sent: Retropharyngeal abscess (RPA) is an abscess in the back of the throat. It is usually found in the retropharyngeal space, which is behind the throat.

ori_sentence: Papilledema or papilloedema is optic disc swelling that is caused by increased intracranial pressure due to any cause.
simple_sent: Papilledema or papilloedema is a swelling of the optic disc. It can be caused by any number of things.

ori_sentence: Cementoma is an odontogenic tumor of cementum.
simple_sent: Cementoma is a cancer of the teeth.

ori_sentence: A bruise, also known as a contusion, is a type of hematoma of tissue, the most common cause being capillaries damaged by trauma, causing localized bleeding that extravasates into the surrounding interstitial tissues.
simple_sent: A bruise, also known as a contusion, is a type of hematoma of tissue. The most common cause of bruise is damage to the blood vessels. This causes bleeding to the surrounding tissues.

ori_sentence: Anthrax is an infection caused by the bacterium Bacillus anthracis.
simple_sent: Anthrax is a very dangerous disease. It is caused by a bacterium.

ori_sentence: Suicidal ideation (or suicidal thoughts) means having thoughts, ideas, or ruminations about the possibility of ending one's life.
simple_sent: Suicidal ideation (or suicidal thoughts) is when a person thinks about taking their own life. This can be a bad idea.

ori_sentence: Pulpitis is inflammation of dental pulp tissue.
simple_sent: Pulpitis is a disease of the teeth.

ori_sentence: Dyskinesia refers to a category of movement disorders that are characterized by involuntary muscle movements, including movements similar to tics or chorea and diminished voluntary movements.
simple_sent: Dyskinesia is a group of movement disorders. These disorders are caused by involuntary muscle movements. These movements can be similar to tics or chorea.

ori_sentence: Arachnoid cysts are cerebrospinal fluid covered by arachnoidal cells and collagen that may develop between the surface of the brain and the cranial base or on the arachnoid membrane, one of the three meningeal layers that cover the brain and the spinal cord.
simple_sent: Arachnoid cysts are cysts in the brain. They are made of arachnoidal cells and collagen. They may form between the surface of the brain and the base of the skull, or on the membrane between the brain and the spinal cord.

ori_sentence: Yersiniosis is an infectious disease caused by a bacterium of the genus Yersinia.
simple_sent: Yersiniosis is a disease. It is caused by a bacterium called Yersinia.

ori_sentence: Hypocalcemia is low calcium levels in the blood serum.
simple_sent: Hypocalcemia is low blood calcium levels.

ori_sentence: Abdominal compartment syndrome (ACS) occurs when the abdomen becomes subject to increased pressure reaching past the point of intra-abdominal hypertension (IAH).
simple_sent: Abdominal compartment syndrome (ACS) is a medical condition. It happens when the abdomen gets too much pressure, and it makes it hard to breathe.

ori_sentence: Alphapapillomavirus is a genus of viruses, in the family Papillomaviridae.
simple_sent: Alphapapillomavirus is a type of virus. It is found in humans.

ori_sentence: Fibromas are benign tumors that are composed of fibrous or connective tissue.
simple_sent: Fibromas are small, benign tumors. They are made up of connective tissue.

ori_sentence: Neuroblastoma (NB) is a type of cancer that forms in certain types of nerve tissue.
simple_sent: Neuroblastoma is a cancer of the nervous system. It is a type of cancer.

ori_sentence: Retinitis is inflammation of the retina in the eye, which can permanently damage the retina and lead to blindness.
simple_sent: Retinitis is an inflammation of the retina. If it is not treated, the retina can become damaged forever.

ori_sentence: Vitiligo is a long-term skin condition characterized by patches of the skin losing their pigment.
simple_sent: Vitiligo is a long-term skin condition. People who have it will lose their pigment.

ori_sentence: A VIPoma or vipoma (/vɪˈpoʊmə/) is a rare endocrine tumor that overproduces vasoactive intestinal peptide (thus VIP + -oma).
simple_sent: A VIPoma or vipoma is a rare tumor in the gastrointestinal tract. VIP + -oma means it produces too much vasoactive intestinal peptide.

ori_sentence: Proctitis is an inflammation of the anus and the lining of the rectum, affecting only the last 6 inches of the rectum.
simple_sent: Proctitis is an infection of the rectum. It usually only affects the last 6 inches of the rectum, called the last 6 inches.

ori_sentence: Arterial tortuosity syndrome is a rare congenital connective tissue condition disorder characterized by elongation and generalized tortuosity of the major arteries including the aorta.
simple_sent: Arterial tortuosity syndrome is a rare condition. People who have the condition will have the major arteries including the aorta stretched out too far for their body.

ori_sentence: A mouth ulcer (aphtha) is an ulcer that occurs on the mucous membrane of the oral cavity.
simple_sent: A mouth ulcer (aphtha) is an ulcer in the oral cavity, which is where the teeth are.

ori_sentence: The biceps or biceps brachii (Latin: musculus biceps brachii, "two-headed muscle of the arm") is a large muscle that lies on the front of the upper arm between the shoulder and the elbow.
simple_sent: The biceps or biceps brachii (Latin: musculus biceps brachii) is a muscle in the upper arm. It is between the shoulder and the elbow, and is very strong.

ori_sentence: Immune thrombocytopenic purpura (ITP), also known as idiopathic thrombocytopenic purpura or immune thrombocytopenia, is a type of thrombocytopenic purpura defined as an isolated low platelet count with a normal bone marrow in the absence of other causes of low platelets.
simple_sent: Immune thrombocytopenic purpura (ITP), also known as idiopathic thrombocytopenic purpura or immune thrombocytopenia, is a disease where the blood does not have enough platelets to clot. This usually happens when there are too few platelets in the bone marrow.

ori_sentence: Post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD) is a mental and behavioral disorder that can develop because of exposure to a traumatic event, such as sexual assault, warfare, traffic collisions, child abuse, domestic violence or other threats on a person's life.
simple_sent: Post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD) is a mental and behavioral disorder. People who have been through a traumatic event (such as a war, a sexual assault, a car accident, or a child's abuse) may experience PTSD.

ori_sentence: A wound is a type of injury which happens relatively quickly in which skin is torn, cut, or punctured (an open wound), or where blunt force trauma causes a contusion (a closed wound).
simple_sent: A wound is a type of injury to the body. When the skin is torn, cut, or punctured, it is called an open wound. When the skin is closed, it is called a closed wound.

ori_sentence: Monocytopenia is a form of leukopenia associated with a deficiency of monocytes.
simple_sent: Monocytopenia is a disease. It is caused by a lack of monocytes.

ori_sentence: Asplenia refers to the absence of normal spleen function and is associated with some serious infection risks.
simple_sent: Asplenia means that there is no normal spleen function. It can also cause serious infection risks.

ori_sentence: The rhomboid muscles (), often simply called the rhomboids, are rhombus-shaped muscles associated with the scapula.
simple_sent: The rhomboid muscles are muscles in the scapula. They are often called the rhomboids because they look like them.

ori_sentence: Small-cell carcinoma is a type of highly malignant cancer that most commonly arises within the lung, although it can occasionally arise in other body sites, such as the cervix, prostate, and gastrointestinal tract.
simple_sent: Small-cell carcinoma is a type of cancer. It is most common in the lung, but it can also happen in other parts of the body. For example, it can happen in the cervix, prostate, or gastrointestinal tract.

ori_sentence: Thrombotic microangiopathy (TMA) is a pathology that results in thrombosis in capillaries and arterioles, due to an endothelial injury.
simple_sent: Thrombotic microangiopathy (TMA) is a disease. In it, capillaries and arterioles become too hard for blood to flow through.

ori_sentence: Kidney transplant or renal transplant is the organ transplant of a kidney into a patient with end-stage kidney disease (ESRD).
simple_sent: A kidney transplant is when a person who has a problem with their kidney gets a new one. This is called a kidney transplant.

ori_sentence: A paraneoplastic syndrome is a syndrome (a set of signs and symptoms) that is the consequence of cancer in the body, specifically due to the production of chemical signaling molecules (such as hormones or cytokines) by tumor cells or by an immune response against the tumor.
simple_sent: A paraneoplastic syndrome is a syndrome (a set of signs and symptoms) that happens when cancer cells in the body produce chemicals (such as hormones or cytokines) that the immune system does not like because it does not think the cancer is normal.

ori_sentence: Heavy chain disease is a form of paraproteinemia and plasma cell dyscrasia that involves the proliferation of cells producing immunoglobulin heavy chains.
simple_sent: Heavy chain disease is a form of paraproteinemia and plasma cell dyscrasia. In heavy chain disease, the cells produce too many heavy chains.

ori_sentence: 2-hydroxyglutaric aciduria is a rare neurometabolic disorder characterized by the significantly elevated levels of hydroxyglutaric acid in one's urine.
simple_sent: 2-hydroxyglutaric aciduria is a rare disorder. When people have this condition, they have higher levels of hydroxyglutaric acid in their urine.

ori_sentence: A paraganglioma is a rare neuroendocrine neoplasm that may develop at various body sites (including the head, neck, thorax and abdomen).
simple_sent: A paraganglioma is a rare type of cancer. It can happen to any part of the body, including the head, neck, and abdomen.

ori_sentence: A cataract is a cloudy area in the lens of the eye that leads to a decrease in vision.
simple_sent: A cataract is a cloudy area in the eye. If it is not treated, the eye will get worse.

ori_sentence: Fibrosis, also known as fibrotic scarring, is a pathological wound healing in which connective tissue replaces normal parenchymal tissue to the extent that it goes unchecked, leading to considerable tissue remodelling and the formation of permanent scar tissue.
simple_sent: Fibrosis, also known as fibrotic scarring, is a condition where connective tissue grows back faster than normal. When this happens, it causes the tissue to change and grow back faster. This causes permanent scarring.

ori_sentence: Postural orthostatic tachycardia syndrome (POTS) is a condition in which a change from lying to standing causes
simple_sent: Postural orthostatic tachycardia syndrome (POTS) happens when someone goes from lying to standing very quickly.

ori_sentence: Macrocephaly is a condition in which circumference of the human head is abnormally large.
simple_sent: Macrocephaly is when the human head is too big. People with this condition are:

ori_sentence: Ptosis, also known as blepharoptosis, is a drooping or falling of the upper eyelid.
simple_sent: Ptosis (also called blepharoptosis) is when the upper eyelid falls down.

ori_sentence: Chronic atrophic rhinitis, or simply atrophic rhinitis, is a chronic inflammation of the nose characterised by atrophy of nasal mucosa, including the glands, turbinate bones and the nerve elements supplying the nose.
simple_sent: Chronic atrophic rhinitis, or simply atrophic rhinitis, is a condition where the nose becomes smaller and smaller. This makes it hard for the nasal mucosa, the part of the nose that people breathe in, to move.

ori_sentence: Mitochondrial disease is a group of disorders caused by mitochondrial dysfunction.
simple_sent: Mitochondrial disease is a group of diseases that affect the mitochondria.

ori_sentence: Immunodeficiency, also known as immunocompromisation, is a state in which the immune system's ability to fight infectious diseases and cancer is compromised or entirely absent.
simple_sent: Immunodeficiency, also known as immunocompromisation, is when a person's immune system is not able to fight off infections. This can cause cancer.

ori_sentence: A germinoma is a type of germ-cell tumor, which is not differentiated upon examination.
simple_sent: A germinoma is a type of tumor that does not show up on examination.

ori_sentence: A boil, also called a furuncle, is a deep folliculitis, infection of the hair follicle.
simple_sent: A boil, also called a furuncle, is an infection of the hair follicle.

ori_sentence: Gorham's disease (pronounced GOR-amz), also known as Gorham vanishing bone disease and phantom bone disease, is a very rare skeletal condition of unknown cause, characterized by the uncontrolled proliferation of distended, thin-walled vascular or lymphatic channels within bone, which leads to resorption and replacement of bone with angiomas and/or fibrosis.
simple_sent: Gorham's disease (also known as Gorham vanishing bone disease and phantom bone disease) is a disease that does not have a known cause. It happens when the blood and bone become too thin, or have too many blood vessels or lymphatic channels in them. This causes the bone to break down and change into other things, like angiomas and fibrosis.

ori_sentence: Diffuse panbronchiolitis (DPB) is an inflammatory lung disease of unknown cause.
simple_sent: Diffuse panbronchiolitis (DPB) is a lung disease. It is not known why.

ori_sentence: Fleck corneal dystrophy, also known as
simple_sent: Fleck corneal disease is a disease.

ori_sentence: Gliomatosis cerebri is a rare primary brain tumor.
simple_sent: Gliomatosis cerebri is a very rare brain disease.

ori_sentence: Heřmanský–Pudlák syndrome (often written Hermansky–Pudlak syndrome or abbreviated HPS) is an extremely rare autosomal recessive disorder which results in oculocutaneous albinism (decreased pigmentation), bleeding problems due to a platelet abnormality (platelet storage pool defect), and storage of an abnormal fat-protein compound (lysosomal accumulation of ceroid lipofuscin).
simple_sent: Heřmanský–Pudlák syndrome (often written Hermansky–Pudlak syndrome or abbreviated HPS) is an autosomal recessive disorder. People who have the syndrome will have decreased pigmentation in their eyes, bleeding problems because of a platelet problem, and an abnormal fat-protein compound will be kept in the body.

ori_sentence: Romano–Ward syndrome is the most common form of congenital Long QT syndrome (LQTS), a genetic heart condition that affects the electrical properties of heart muscle cells.
simple_sent: Romano-Ward syndrome is a genetic heart condition. It is the most common form of Long QT syndrome (also called Long QT syndrome or LQTS).

ori_sentence: A hydrosalpinx is a condition that occurs when a Fallopian tube is blocked and fills with serous or clear fluid near the ovary (distal to the uterus).
simple_sent: A hydrosalpinx is a condition in which the fallopian tube is blocked. The fluid that fills the tube comes from the ovary near the uterus.

ori_sentence: Hyperkalemic periodic paralysis (HYPP, HyperKPP) is an inherited autosomal dominant disorder that affects sodium channels in muscle cells and the ability to regulate potassium levels in the blood.
simple_sent: Hyperkalemic periodic paralysis (HYPP, HyperKPP) is a disease. It is caused by a gene in the body that controls sodium channels. This makes potassium levels in the blood too high.

ori_sentence: Osteochondrodysplasia is a general term for a disorder of the development (dysplasia) of bone ("osteo") and cartilage ("chondro").
simple_sent: Osteochondrodysplasia is a disease. It is when the bone (osteo) and cartilage (chondro) do not develop properly.

ori_sentence: Juvenile myelomonocytic leukemia (JMML) is a serious chronic leukemia (cancer of the blood) that affects children mostly aged 4 and younger.
simple_sent: Juvenile myelomonocytic leukemia (JMML) is a cancer of the blood. It is the most common cancer in children, and the second most common cancer.

ori_sentence: Erythrasma is a superficial skin infection that causes brown, scaly skin patches.
simple_sent: Erythrasma is a small infection of the skin. It causes small brown patches.

ori_sentence: The biceps femoris (/ˈbaɪsɛps ˈfɛmərɪs/) is a muscle of the thigh located to the posterior, or back.
simple_sent: The biceps femoris is a muscle in the back of the thigh. It is also called the back muscle.

ori_sentence: Attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) is a behavioral and neurodevelopmental disorder characterized by inattention, hyperactivity, and impulsivity, which are pervasive, impairing, and otherwise age inappropriate.
simple_sent: Attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) is a behavioral and neurodevelopmental disorder. People who have Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder have hyperactivity, inattention, and impulsivity.

ori_sentence: The trapezius is a large paired trapezoid-shaped surface muscle that extends longitudinally from the occipital bone to the lower thoracic vertebrae of the spine and laterally to the spine of the scapula.
simple_sent: The trapezius muscle is a large muscle in the back of the body. It goes all the way from the occipital bone to the lower vertebrae of the spine, and then all the way to the scapula.

ori_sentence: Subphrenic abscess is a disease characterized by an accumulation of infected fluid between the diaphragm, liver, and spleen.
simple_sent: A subphrenic abscess is an infection of the diaphragm. The fluid gets into the liver, spleen, and stomach.

ori_sentence: The pectineus muscle (/pɛkˈtɪniəs/, from the Latin word pecten, meaning comb) is a flat, quadrangular muscle, situated at the anterior (front) part of the upper and medial (inner) aspect of the thigh.
simple_sent: The pectineus muscle (from Latin pecten, meaning "comb") is a muscle in the back of the thigh. It is flat and has a quadrangular shape and is in the front part of the thigh.

ori_sentence: Alternating hemiplegia of childhood is an ultra-rare neurological disorder named for the transient episodes, often referred to as "attacks", of hemiplegia (weakness or paralysis) from which those with the disorder suffer.
simple_sent: Alternating hemiplegia of childhood is a rare neurological disorder. It is named for the short-term attacks of hemiplegia (weakness or paralysis) that people with the disorder experience.

ori_sentence: The gluteus maximus is the main extensor muscle of the hip.
simple_sent: The gluteus maximus is an important muscle in the hip.

ori_sentence: Erythema induratum is a panniculitis on the calves.
simple_sent: Erythema induratum is a disease of the calves.

ori_sentence: Fournier gangrene is a type of necrotizing fasciitis or gangrene affecting the external genitalia or perineum.
simple_sent: Fournier gangrene is a type of gangrene. It usually happens to the outside of the genitalia or perineum.

ori_sentence: Noonan syndrome (NS) is a genetic disorder that may present with mildly unusual facial features, short height, congenital heart disease, bleeding problems, and skeletal malformations.
simple_sent: Noonan syndrome (NS) is a genetic disorder. People who have it may have some unusual facial features, short height, bleeding problems, and a bad heart.

ori_sentence: Weaver syndrome is a rare autosomal dominant genetic disorder associated with rapid growth beginning in the prenatal period and continuing through the toddler and youth years.
simple_sent: Weaver syndrome is a rare genetic disorder. People who have the disease have very fast growth beginning in the prenatal period and continuing through their childhood.

ori_sentence: Endocrine diseases are disorders of the endocrine system.
simple_sent: Endocrine diseases are diseases of the endocrine system.

ori_sentence: McCune–Albright syndrome is a complex genetic disorder affecting the bone, skin and endocrine systems.
simple_sent: McCune-Albright syndrome is a genetic disease. It affects the skin, bone, and endocrine system.

ori_sentence: Viral pneumonia is a pneumonia caused by a virus.
simple_sent: Viral pneumonia is usually spread by viruses.

ori_sentence: Lysinuric protein intolerance (LPI) is an autosomal recessive metabolic disorder affecting amino acid transport.
simple_sent: Lysinuric protein intolerance (LPI) is a genetic disease. It affects the way amino acids are moved.

ori_sentence: Acanthamoeba keratitis (AK) is a rare disease in which amoebae of the genus Acanthamoeba invade the clear portion of the front (cornea) of the eye.
simple_sent: Acanthamoeba keratitis (AK) is a disease. It happens when amoebae from the genus Acanthamoeba get into the eye and cause damage.

ori_sentence: Cystic fibrosis (CF) is a genetic disorder that affects mostly the lungs, but also the pancreas, liver, kidneys, and intestine.
simple_sent: Cystic fibrosis (CF) is a disease. People with CF have problems with their lungs, liver, kidneys, and pancreas.

ori_sentence: Central cord syndrome (CCS) is the most common form of cervical spinal cord injury.
simple_sent: Central cord syndrome is an injury to the spinal cord. It is very common.

ori_sentence: Granular cell tumor is a tumor that can develop on any skin or mucosal surface, but occurs on the tongue 40% of the time.
simple_sent: Granular cell tumor A granular cell tumor can grow on any surface of the skin, but most often on the tongue.

ori_sentence: Tick paralysis is the only tick-borne disease that is not caused by an infectious organism.
simple_sent: Tick paralysis is the most common tick-borne disease. It does not usually cause disease.

ori_sentence: Poland syndrome is a birth defect characterized by an underdeveloped chest muscle and short webbed fingers on one side of the body.
simple_sent: Poland syndrome is a birth defect. People with Poland syndrome have short webbed fingers on one side of their body.

ori_sentence: Barth syndrome (BTHS) is an X-linked genetic disorder.
simple_sent: Barth syndrome is a rare genetic disease.

ori_sentence: Cholesteatoma is a destructive and expanding growth consisting of keratinizing squamous epithelium in the middle ear and/or mastoid process.
simple_sent: Cholesteatoma is a malignant growth in the middle ear. Cholesteatoma is usually found in the middle ear and/or mastoid process.

ori_sentence: Caroli disease (communicating cavernous ectasia, or congenital cystic dilatation of the intrahepatic biliary tree) is a rare inherited disorder characterized by cystic dilatation (or ectasia) of the bile ducts within the liver.
simple_sent: Caroli disease is a rare disease. People who have the disease will have cystic dilatation (or ectasia) of the bile ducts within the liver. This is called communicating cavernous ectasia.

ori_sentence: Cytokine release syndrome (CRS) is a form of systemic inflammatory response syndrome (SIRS) that can be triggered by a variety of factors such as infections and certain drugs.
simple_sent: Cytokine release syndrome (CRS) is a type of inflammatory response. It can be caused by many different things, like certain drugs or infections.

ori_sentence: A vascular headache is an outdated term to describe certain types of headache which were thought to be related to blood vessel swelling and hyperemia as cause of pain.
simple_sent: A vascular headache is an old term to describe certain types of headache. It used to be thought that the cause of headache was blood vessel swelling.
