Other people with the disorder have a furrowed and wrinkled appearance (particularly in the face and on the palms and soles of the feet); some people have thick, dark, velvety areas of skin (acanthosis nigricans) are sometimes found on the hands and feet and in the groin.

ori_sentence: Postpericardiotomy syndrome (PPS) is a medical syndrome referring to an immune phenomenon that occurs days to months (usually 1–6 weeks) after surgical incision of the pericardium (membranes encapsulating the human heart).
simple_sent: Postpericardiotomy syndrome (PPS) is a medical condition. It happens when the pericardium (membranes that surround the heart) are cut during a surgery, and the body becomes immune to it.

ori_sentence: Coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) is a contagious disease caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2
simple_sent: Coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) is a disease. It is caused by a coronavirus (a type of virus).

ori_sentence: Potocki–Shaffer syndrome (PSS), also known as DEFECT11 syndrome or chromosome 11p11.2 deletion syndrome, is a rare contiguous gene syndrome that results from the microdeletion of section 11.2 on the short arm of chromosome 11 (11p11.2).
simple_sent: Potocki-Shaffer syndrome (PSS), also known as DEFECT11 syndrome or chromosome 11p11.2 deletion syndrome, is a rare disease. It is caused by a small part of a gene, called section 11.2, being cut off.

ori_sentence: Parathyroidectomy is the surgical removal of one or more of the (usually) four parathyroid glands.
simple_sent: Parathyroidectomy is when one or more parathyroid glands are removed, usually by surgery.

ori_sentence: Bone resorption is resorption of bone tissue, that is, the process by which osteoclasts break down the tissue in bones and release the minerals, resulting in a transfer of calcium from bone tissue to the blood.
simple_sent: Bone resorption is the process by which bone tissue (or the cells that make up the bone) is broken down and released to the blood. The process is called bone growth and development.

ori_sentence: Placental site trophoblastic tumor is a form of gestational trophoblastic disease, which is thought to arise from intermediate trophoblast.
simple_sent: Placental site trophoblastic tumor Placental site trophoblastic tumor is a form of trophoblastic disease.

ori_sentence: Branchio-oculo-facial syndrome (BOFS) is a disease that arises from a mutation in the TFAP2A gene.
simple_sent: Branchio-oculo-facial syndrome (BOFS) is a disease. It is caused by a gene change.

ori_sentence: Hypergammaglobulinemia is a medical condition with elevated levels of gamma globulin.
simple_sent: Hypergammaglobulinemia is a medical condition. It causes high levels of gamma globulin.

ori_sentence: Angioimmunoblastic T-cell lymphoma (AITL, sometimes misspelled AILT, formerly known as "angioimmunoblastic lymphadenopathy with dysproteinemia") is a mature T-cell lymphoma of blood or lymph vessel immunoblasts characterized by a polymorphous lymph node infiltrate showing a marked increase in follicular dendritic cells (FDCs) and high endothelial venules (HEVs) and systemic involvement.
simple_sent: Angioimmunoblastic T-cell lymphoma (AITL, sometimes misspelled AILT, formerly known as "angioimmunoblastic lymphadenopathy with dysproteinemia") is a cancer of the blood and lymphatic system. It is characterized by a polymorphous lymph node infiltrate, a marked increase in follicular dendritic cells (FDCs) and high endothelial venules (HEVs) and systemic involvement.

ori_sentence: Post-intensive care syndrome (PICS) describes a collection of health disorders that are common among patients who survive critical illness and intensive care.
simple_sent: Post-intensive care syndrome (PICS) is a set of health problems that many patients get after they have been through intensive care.

ori_sentence: Sialuria is a group of disorders resulting in an accumulation of free sialic acid.
simple_sent: Sialuria is a disease. It happens when sialic acid becomes too much in the body.

ori_sentence: Young–Simpson syndrome (YSS) is a rare congenital disorder with symptoms including hypothyroidism, heart defects, facial dysmorphism, cryptorchidism in males, hypotonia, mental retardation and postnatal growth retardation.
simple_sent: Young-Simpson syndrome (YSS) is a rare disorder. People with YSS have heart defects, hypothyroidism, facial dysmorphism, cryptorchidism in males, hypotonia, mental retardation, and slow growth.

ori_sentence: Hepatitis B is an infectious disease caused by the hepatitis B virus (HBV) that affects the liver; it is a type of viral hepatitis.
simple_sent: Hepatitis B is a disease. It is caused by a virus in a human blood called the Hepatitis B virus (HBV).

ori_sentence: Hodgkin lymphoma (HL) is a type of lymphoma, in which cancer originates from a specific type of white blood cells called lymphocytes, where multinucleated Reed–Sternberg cells (RS cells) are present in the patient's lymph nodes.
simple_sent: Hodgkin lymphoma (HL) is a type of cancer of the lymphatic system. The cells that cause the cancer are white blood cells called lymphocytes. The cells that cause the cancer are found in the lymph nodes.

ori_sentence: Smith–Fineman–Myers syndrome (SFMS1) is a congenital disorder that causes birth defects.
simple_sent: Smith-Fineman-Myers syndrome (SFMS1) is a birth defect. It is a congenital disorder.

ori_sentence: Amphistomiasis is a parasitic disease of livestock animals, more commonly of cattle and sheep, and humans caused by immature helminthic flatworms belonging to the order Echinostomida.
simple_sent: Amphistomiasis is a disease. It is caused by immature helminthic flatworms. The disease mostly affects cattle and sheep, but can also occur in humans.

ori_sentence: Accessory nerve disorder is an injury to the spinal accessory nerve which results in diminished or absent function of the sternocleidomastoid muscle and upper portion of the trapezius muscle.
simple_sent: Accessory nerve disorder is an injury to the accessory nerve in the spinal cord. This can cause problems with the upper portion of the trapezius muscle and the sternocleidomastoid muscle.

ori_sentence: Sleep state misperception (SSM) is a term in the International Classification of Sleep Disorders (ICSD) most commonly used for people who mistakenly perceive their sleep as wakefulness, though it has been proposed that it be applied to those who severely overestimate their sleep time as well ("positive" sleep state misperception).
simple_sent: Sleep state misperception (SSM) is a term in the International Classification of Sleep Disorders (ICSD) about people who think their sleep is wakefulness. People who have a sleep state misperception but think their sleep is longer than it really is can get help from the ICSD.

ori_sentence: Amelanotic melanoma is a type of skin cancer in which the cells do not make any melanin.
simple_sent: Amelanotic melanoma is a type of skin cancer. The cells in the skin do not make melanin.

ori_sentence: Cyclotropia is a form of strabismus in which, compared to the correct positioning of the eyes, there is a torsion of one eye (or both) about the eye's visual axis.
simple_sent: Cyclotropia is a form of strabismus. In this case, one or both of the eyes are not working properly, or one eye is not moving properly at all.

ori_sentence: Parastremmatic dwarfism is a rare bone disease that features severe dwarfism, thoracic kyphosis (a type of scoliosis that affects the upper back), a distortion and twisting of the limbs, contractures of the large joints, malformations of the vertebrae and pelvis, and incontinence.
simple_sent: Parastremmatic dwarfism is a rare bone disease. People with parastremmatic dwarfism have a distorted and twisting of the limbs, contractures of the large joints, malformations of the vertebrae and pelvis, and incontinence. This condition affects the upper back.

ori_sentence: Overactive bladder (OAB) is a condition where there is a frequent feeling of needing to urinate to a degree that it negatively affects a person's life.
simple_sent: Overactive bladder (OAB) is a condition where people feel like they need to urinate all the time. It can affect a person's life.

ori_sentence: Foodborne illness (also foodborne disease and colloquially referred to as food poisoning) is any illness resulting from the spoilage of contaminated food, pathogenic bacteria, viruses, or parasites that contaminate food, as well as prions (the agents of mad cow disease), and toxins such as aflatoxins in peanuts, poisonous mushrooms, and various species of beans that have not been boiled for at least 10 minutes.
simple_sent: Foodborne illness (also foodborne disease and colloquially referred to as food poisoning) is when food goes bad because of pathogenic bacteria, viruses, or parasites that get into the food, or because the food was not cooked properly. For example, mad cow disease, aflatoxins in peanuts, poisonous mushrooms, and beans that have not been boiled for at least 10 minutes can cause foodborne illness.

ori_sentence: Wissler's syndrome is a rheumatic disease that has a similar presentation to sepsis.
simple_sent: Wissler's syndrome is a disease. It is like sepsis, but it is not the same.

ori_sentence: Pentalogy of Cantrell (or thoraco-abdominal syndrome) is a rare congenital syndrome that causes defects involving the diaphragm, abdominal wall, pericardium, heart and lower sternum.
simple_sent: Pentalogy of Cantrell (or thoraco-abdominal syndrome) is a birth defect. It causes problems with the heart, diaphragm, abdominal wall, and lower sternum.

ori_sentence: Neonatal adrenoleukodystrophy is an inborn error of peroxisome biogenesis.
simple_sent: Neonatal adrenoleukodystrophy is a life long disease in humans.

ori_sentence: Netherton syndrome is a severe, autosomal recessive form of ichthyosis associated with mutations in the SPINK5 gene.
simple_sent: Netherton syndrome is a very bad form of ichthyosis. It is caused by changes in the SPINK5 gene.

ori_sentence: Ethylmalonic encephalopathy (EE) is a rare autosomal recessive inborn error of metabolism.
simple_sent: Ethylmalonic encephalopathy is a rare disease. It is caused by an error in metabolism.

ori_sentence: Autoimmune hypophysitis is defined as inflammation of the pituitary gland due to autoimmunity.
simple_sent: Autoimmune hypophysitis happens when the body's immune system attacks the pituitary gland.

ori_sentence: Immunoproliferative disorders are disorders of the immune system that are characterized by the abnormal proliferation of the primary cells of the immune system, which includes B cells, T cells and natural killer (NK) cells, or by the excessive production of immunoglobulins (also known as antibodies).
simple_sent: Immunoproliferative disorders are disorders of the immune system. They happen when the body does not produce enough of the cells it needs to fight off infections, such as B cells, T cells, andNK cells. They also happen when the body makes too many immunoglobulins.

ori_sentence: Bromoderma is a skin condition characterized by an eruption of papules and pustules on the skin.
simple_sent: Bromoderma is a skin condition. People who have it get papules and pustules on the skin.

ori_sentence: Carcinosarcomas are malignant tumors that consist of a mixture of carcinoma (or epithelial cancer) and sarcoma (or mesenchymal/connective tissue cancer).
simple_sent: Carcinosarcomas are malignant tumors in the skin. They are caused by a combination of two types of cancer: epithelial cancer and sarcoma.

ori_sentence: Adenomyoma is a tumor (-oma) including components derived from glands (adeno-) and muscle (-my-).
simple_sent: Adenomyoma is a type of tumor. It is made up of glands (adeno-) and muscle (my-).

ori_sentence: Acute basophilic leukemia is a rare form of acute myeloid leukemia where blasts are accompanied by abnormal basophils in all stages of differentiation.
simple_sent: Acute basophilic leukemia is a rare form of acute myeloid leukemia. In this form, the basophils do not work properly at all.

ori_sentence: Autonomic neuropathy (AN or AAN) is a form of polyneuropathy that affects the non-voluntary, non-sensory nervous system (i.e., the autonomic nervous system), affecting mostly the internal organs such as the bladder muscles, the cardiovascular system, the digestive tract, and the genital organs.
simple_sent: Autonomic neuropathy (AN or AAN) is a form of polyneuropathy. It affects the autonomic nervous system, which is the part of the nervous system that controls movement and control of the body. It mostly affects internal organs.

ori_sentence: Spondyloarthropathy or spondyloarthrosis refers to any joint disease of the vertebral column.
simple_sent: Spondyloarthropathy or spondyloarthrosis is a disease of the vertebral column.

ori_sentence: Bronchomalacia is a term for weak cartilage in the walls of the bronchial tubes, often occurring in children under a day.
simple_sent: Bronchomalacia is when the cartilage in the walls of the bronchial tubes are weak, or not working properly.

ori_sentence: Lumbar spinal stenosis (LSS) is a medical condition in which the spinal canal narrows and compresses the nerves and blood vessels at the level of the lumbar vertebrae.
simple_sent: Lumbar spinal stenosis (LSS) is a medical condition. In it, the nerves and blood vessels at the level of the lumbar vertebrae are compressed.

ori_sentence: Sealpox is a cutaneous (skin) condition caused by a Parapoxvirus, usually affecting seal handlers who have been bitten by infected harbor or grey seals.
simple_sent: Sealpox is a cutaneous (skin) condition caused by a parapoxvirus. It usually affects people who work with harbor seals or grey seals.

ori_sentence: Rheumatoid vasculitis is skin condition that is a typical feature of rheumatoid arthritis, presenting as peripheral vascular lesions that are localized purpura, cutaneous ulceration, and gangrene of the distal parts of the extremities.
simple_sent: Rheumatoid vasculitis is a condition of the skin. It is a typical feature of rheumatoid arthritis. People who have it have localized purpura, cutaneous ulceration, and gangrene of the extremities.

ori_sentence: Tolosa–Hunt syndrome is a rare disorder characterized by severe and unilateral headaches with orbital pain, along with weakness and paralysis (ophthalmoplegia) of certain eye muscles (extraocular palsies).In 2004, the International Headache Society provided a definition of the diagnostic criteria which included granuloma.
simple_sent: In 2004, the International Headache Society gave a definition of the diagnostic criteria which included granuloma. Tolosa-Hunt syndrome is a rare disorder characterized by severe and unilateral headaches with orbital pain, along with weakness and paralysis of certain eye muscles.

ori_sentence: Papillomaviridae is a family of non-enveloped DNA viruses whose members are known as papillomaviruses.
simple_sent: The Papillomaviridae is a family of viruses. The viruses in the family are not enclosed in DNA.

ori_sentence: Eiken syndrome is a rare autosomal bone dysplasia with a skeletal phenotype which has been described in a unique consanguineous family, where it segregates as a recessive trait.
simple_sent: Eiken syndrome is a rare disease of bone dysplasia. It is found in a small group of people in the world. In this family, it is a recessive trait.

ori_sentence: Rh deficiency syndrome is a type of hemolytic anemia that involves erythrocytes whom membranes are deficient in Rh antigens.
simple_sent: Rh deficiency syndrome is a type of hemolytic anemia. It happens when the erythrocytes do not have enough Rh.

ori_sentence: Alveolar rhabdomyosarcoma (ARMS) is a subtype of the rhabdomyosarcoma soft tissue cancer family whose lineage is from mesenchymal cells and are related to skeletal muscle cells.
simple_sent: Alveolar rhabdomyosarcoma (ARMS) is a soft tissue cancer of the alveolar region. It is a type of rhabdomyosarcoma and is the third most common soft tissue cancer.

ori_sentence: Acrania is a rare congenital disorder that occurs in the human fetus in which the flat bones in the cranial vault are either completely or partially absent.
simple_sent: Acrania is a rare disorder of the human fetus. In this condition, the flat bones in the middle of the brain are either completely or partially absent.

ori_sentence: Aneurysmal bone cyst (ABC), is a non-cancerous bone tumor composed of multiple varying sizes of spaces in a bone which are filled with blood.
simple_sent: Aneurysmal bone cyst (ABC) is a non-cancerous bone tumor. It is made up of different sizes of spaces in a bone that are filled with blood.

ori_sentence: Pseudoathetosis is abnormal writhing movements, usually of the fingers, caused by a failure of joint position sense (proprioception) and indicates disruption of the proprioceptive pathway, from nerve to parietal cortex.
simple_sent: Pseudoathetosis is abnormal writhing movements, usually of the fingers. This is caused by a failure of joint position sense (proprioception) and can be treated with a combination of drugs and surgery.

ori_sentence: Boomerang dysplasia is a lethal form of osteochondrodysplasia known for a characteristic congenital feature in which bones of the arms and legs are malformed into the shape of a boomerang.
simple_sent: Boomerang dysplasia is a life-threatening form of osteochondrodysplasia. When a person is born with the disease, their arms and legs will have the shape of a boomerang.

ori_sentence: A pyogenic liver abscess is a type of liver abscess caused by bacteria.
simple_sent: A liver abscess is an abscess of the liver that does not stop.

ori_sentence: Cerebral vasculitis (sometimes the word angiitis is used instead of "vasculitis") is vasculitis (inflammation of the blood vessel wall) involving the brain and occasionally the spinal cord.
simple_sent: Cerebral vasculitis (sometimes the word angiitis is used instead of "vasculitis") is an inflammation of the blood vessel wall. It usually starts in the brain and goes down the spinal cord.

ori_sentence: Pituicytoma is a rare brain tumor.
simple_sent: Pituicytoma is a small brain tumor.

ori_sentence: Analbuminaemia or analbuminemia is a genetically inherited metabolic defect characterised by an impaired synthesis of serum albumin.
simple_sent: Analbuminaemia or analbuminemia is a disease. It is caused by a defect in the production of albumin in the body.

ori_sentence: African trypanosomiasis, also known as African sleeping sickness or simply sleeping sickness, is an insect-borne parasitic infection of humans and other animals.
simple_sent: African Trypanosomiasis (also called sleeping sickness or African sleeping sickness) is a disease. It is caused by an insect called a Trypanosome.

ori_sentence: Hydrolethalus syndrome (HLS) is a rare genetic disorder that causes improper fetal development, resulting in birth defects and, most commonly, stillbirth.
simple_sent: Hydrolethalus syndrome (HLS) is a rare genetic disorder. If it is not treated, the child will have many birth defects, including stillbirth.

ori_sentence: Lentiginosis refers to the presence of lentigines in large numbers or in a distinctive configuration.
simple_sent: Lentiginosis is when there are a lot of lentigines or when they are in different shapes.

ori_sentence: Cachexia (/kəˈkɛksiə/) is a complex syndrome associated with an underlying illness causing ongoing muscle loss that is not entirely reversed with nutritional supplementation.
simple_sent: Cachexia is a medical condition. It is caused by an underlying illness, and causes loss of muscle mass. This can not be reversed without nutritional supplementation.

ori_sentence: Geriatrics, or geriatric medicine, is a specialty that focuses on health care of elderly people.
simple_sent: Geriatrics (or geriatric medicine) is a medical field that deals with older people.

ori_sentence: Lipodermatosclerosis is a skin and connective tissue disease.
simple_sent: Lipodermatosclerosis is a disease of the skin.

ori_sentence: A gallstone is a stone formed within the gallbladder out of precipitated bile components.
simple_sent: A gallstone is a stone that has formed in the gallbladder because of too much bile.

ori_sentence: A urachal cyst is a sinus remaining from the allantois during embryogenesis.
simple_sent: A urachal cyst is a cyst that remains after the allantois is removed.

ori_sentence: Meningism is a set of symptoms similar to those of meningitis but not caused by meningitis.
simple_sent: Meningism The symptoms of meningism are similar to those of meningitis, but not the same.

ori_sentence: Ear pain, also known as earache, is pain in the ear.
simple_sent: Ear pain can also be called simply ear pain.

ori_sentence: Adiposis dolorosa, is an outdated term for many years used synonymously as Dercum's disease, lipedema or Anders disease.
simple_sent: For many years, this disease was also called Dercum's disease, lipedema or Anders disease, but this is not correct.

ori_sentence: Pellagra is a disease caused by a lack of the vitamin niacin (vitamin B3).
simple_sent: Pellagra is a disease. It is caused by lack of niacin in the body.

ori_sentence: XYY syndrome is a genetic condition in which a male has an extra Y chromosome.
simple_sent: XYY syndrome. This condition happens when a person has an extra Y chromosome.

ori_sentence: Thyroid nodules are nodules (raised areas of tissue or fluid) which commonly arise within an otherwise normal thyroid gland.
simple_sent: Thyroid nodules are raised areas of tissue or fluid inside the thyroid gland. Most of the time they are small.

ori_sentence: Osteoarthritis (OA) is a type of degenerative joint disease that results from breakdown of joint cartilage and underlying bone.
simple_sent: Osteoarthritis (OA) is a degenerative disease of the joints. It causes the cartilage in the joints to break down.

ori_sentence: An adenoma is a benign tumor of epithelial tissue with glandular origin, glandular characteristics, or both.
simple_sent: An adenoma is a tumor in the skin. It may be a benign tumor, or it may be a glandular tumor.

ori_sentence: Nyctalopia (; from Ancient Greek  νύκτ- (núkt-) 'night',  ἀλαός (alaós) 'blind, invisible', and  ὄψ (óps) 'eye'), also called night-blindness, is a condition making it difficult or impossible to see in relatively low light.
simple_sent: Nyctalopia (; from Ancient Greek  νύκτ- (núkt-) 'night',  ἀλαός (alaós) 'blind, invisible', and  ὄψ (óps) 'eye'), also called night-blindness, is a condition in which it is not possible to see in the dark.

ori_sentence: Sleepwalking, also known as somnambulism or noctambulism, is a phenomenon of combined sleep and wakefulness.
simple_sent: Sleepwalking, also called somnambulism or noctambulism, is when people sleep and then wake up.

ori_sentence: Spermatocele is a fluid-filled cyst that develops at the head of the epididymis.
simple_sent: Spermatocele is a cyst in the epididymis. It is a fluid-filled cyst.

ori_sentence: Subdural effusion refers to an effusion in the subdural space, usually of cerebrospinal fluid.
simple_sent: Subdural effusion is when there is fluid in the subdural space. This is usually in cerebrospinal fluid.

ori_sentence: T-cell lymphoma is a rare form of cancerous lymphoma affecting T-cells.
simple_sent: T-cell lymphoma is a cancer of the blood. It is a rare disease.

ori_sentence: Dissociative identity disorder (DID), previously known as multiple personality disorder (MPD), is a mental disorder characterized by the maintenance of at least two distinct and relatively enduring personality states.
simple_sent: Dissociative identity disorder (DID), also known as multiple personality disorder (MPD), is a mental disorder. People who suffer from it think that they have two different personalities.

ori_sentence: In human anatomy, the infraspinatus muscle is a thick triangular muscle, which occupies the chief part of the infraspinatous fossa.
simple_sent: In human anatomy, the infraspinatus muscle is a thick triangular muscle in the back of the human body.

ori_sentence: Pressure ulcers, also known as pressure sores or bed sores, are localised damage to the skin and/or underlying tissue that usually occur over a bony prominence as a result of usually long-term pressure, or pressure in combination with shear or friction.
simple_sent: Pressure ulcers, also known as pressure sores or bed sores, are localised damage to the skin and/or underlying tissue. They usually occur as a result of long-term pressure in the area, such as when a person is worked hard for a long time.

ori_sentence: Epilepsy is a group of non-communicable neurological disorders characterized by recurrent epileptic seizures.
simple_sent: Epilepsy is a non-communicable disease. People who have it will have many epileptic seizures.

ori_sentence: The teres major muscle is a muscle of the upper limb.
simple_sent: The teres major muscle is an important muscle.

ori_sentence: Vasectomy reversal is a term used for surgical procedures that reconnect the male reproductive tract after interruption by a vasectomy.
simple_sent: Vasectomy reversal is a surgery where the male reproductive tract is reconnected after a man has had a vasectomy.

ori_sentence: Frontotemporal dementia (FTD), or frontotemporal degeneration disease, or frontotemporal neurocognitive disorder, encompasses several types of dementia involving the frontal and temporal lobes.
simple_sent: Frontotemporal dementia (FTD), also called frontotemporal neurocognitive disorder, frontotemporal degeneration disease, or frontotemporal dementia, is a form of dementia.

ori_sentence: The extensor digiti minimi (extensor digiti quinti proprius) is a slender muscle of the forearm, placed on the ulnar side of the extensor digitorum communis, with which it is generally connected.
simple_sent: The extensor digiti minimi (extensor digiti quinti proprius) is a small muscle in the forearm. It is connected to the extensor digitorum communis by the ulnar collateral ligament.

ori_sentence: The rectus abdominis muscle, also known as the "abdominal muscle" or simply the "abs", is a paired muscle running vertically on each side of the anterior wall of the human abdomen, as well as that of some other mammals.
simple_sent: The rectus abdominis (abdominal muscle) is a muscle in the human body. It is a muscle that runs vertically on each side of the human abdomen, from the front to the back of the body.

ori_sentence: Subclavian steal syndrome (SSS), also called subclavian steal steno-occlusive disease, is a constellation of signs and symptoms that arise from retrograde (reversed) blood flow in the vertebral artery or the internal thoracic artery, due to a proximal stenosis (narrowing)
simple_sent: Subclavian steal syndrome (SSS), also called subclavian steal steno-occlusive disease, is a disease. People who have the disease will have signs and symptoms that make it hard for the blood to move from one part of the body to the other.

ori_sentence: Congenital pulmonary airway malformation (CPAM), formerly known as congenital cystic adenomatoid malformation (CCAM), is a congenital disorder of the lung similar to bronchopulmonary sequestration.
simple_sent: Congenital cystic adenomatoid malformation (CCAM), also known as congenital pulmonary airway malformation (CPAM), is a condition where the lungs do not work properly.

ori_sentence: A cystocele, also known as a prolapsed bladder, is a medical condition in which a woman's bladder bulges into her vagina.
simple_sent: A cystocele is a problem with the bladder. When this happens, the bladder bulges into the vagina.

ori_sentence: Shellfish poisoning includes four syndromes that share some common features and are primarily associated with bivalve molluscs (such as mussels, clams, oysters and scallops.)
simple_sent: Shellfish poisoning is a disease. There are four main types of shellfish poisoning, and they all affect molluscs (such as mussels, clams, oysters and scallops).

ori_sentence: An embolism is the lodging of an embolus, a blockage-causing piece of material, inside a blood vessel.
simple_sent: An embolism is when a piece of material, called an embolus, gets stuck inside a blood vessel.

ori_sentence: Limb–mammary syndrome is a cutaneous condition characterized by p63 mutations.
simple_sent: Limb-mammary syndrome is a skin condition. It is caused by p63 mutations.

ori_sentence: Hypolipoproteinemia, hypolipidemia, or hypolipidaemia (British English) is a form of dyslipidemia that is defined by abnormally lowered levels of any or all lipids and/or lipoproteins in the blood.
simple_sent: Hypolipoproteinemia, hypolipidemia, or hypolipidaemia (British English) is a condition in which the blood has low levels of certain lipids. These lipids are called lipoproteins.

ori_sentence: Stiff skin syndrome (also known as "Congenital fascial dystrophy") is a cutaneous condition characterized by ‘rock hard’ induration, thickening of the skin and subcutaneous tissues, limited joint mobility, and mild hypertrichosis in infancy or early childhood.
simple_sent: Stiff skin syndrome (also known as "Congenital fascial dystrophy") is a condition where the skin becomes hard and thick. There is also limited joint mobility. This condition usually starts in infancy or early childhood.

ori_sentence: Esthesioneuroblastoma, is a rare cancer of the nasal cavity.
simple_sent: Esthesioneuroblastoma is a small cancer of the nose.

ori_sentence: Interdigitating dendritic cell sarcoma is a form of malignant histiocytosis affecting dendritic cells.
simple_sent: Interdigitating dendritic cell sarcoma is a cancer of the dendritic cells. It is a malignant disease.

ori_sentence: Ichthyosis prematurity syndrome (IPS) is a dermatological disease with known genetic causes.
simple_sent: Ichthyosis prematurity syndrome (IPS) is a disease. People who have it have red skin.

ori_sentence: Townes–Brocks syndrome (TBS) is a rare genetic disease that has been described in approximately 200 cases in the published literature.
simple_sent: Townes-Brocks syndrome (TBS) is a rare disease. About 200 people in the world have the disease, and it is very dangerous.

ori_sentence: Pre-eclampsia is a disorder of pregnancy characterized by the onset of high blood pressure and often a significant amount of protein in the urine.
simple_sent: Pre-eclampsia is a condition during pregnancy. It causes high blood pressure, and in some cases, a lot of protein is in the urine.

ori_sentence: Jackson–Weiss syndrome (JWS) is a genetic disorder characterized by foot abnormalities and the premature fusion of certain bones of the skull (craniosynostosis), which prevents further growth of the skull and affects the shape of the head and face.
simple_sent: Jackson-Weiss syndrome (JWS) is a genetic disorder. People with JWS have problems with their feet and their skull. This makes certain bones of the skull not grow properly, and it changes the shape of their head and face.

itemLabel: very long chain acyl-coa dehydrogenase deficiency
ori_sentence: Very long-chain acyl-coenzyme A dehydrogenase deficiency  is a fatty-acid metabolism disorder which prevents the body from converting certain fats to energy, particularly during periods without food.
simple_sent: Very long-chain acyl-coenzyme A dehydrogenase deficiency is a disease. It makes it hard for the body to change fats into energy. This makes it hard for the body to eat.

ori_sentence: Hepatoblastoma is a malignant liver cancer occurring in infants and children and composed of tissue resembling fetal liver cells, mature liver cells, or bile duct cells.
simple_sent: Hepatoblastoma is a cancer of the liver. It is most common in infants and children. The cells that cause Hepatoblastoma are called liver cells.

ori_sentence: Iminoglycinuria, is an autosomal recessive disorder of renal tubular transport affecting reabsorption of the amino acid glycine, and the imino acids proline and hydroxyproline.
simple_sent: Iminoglycinuria, is an autosomal recessive disorder of the renal tubular transport. It causes problems with the way glycine and proline are absorbed by the kidneys.

ori_sentence: Phimosis is a condition in which the ridged band of the akroposthion of the foreskin of the penis cannot stretch to allow it to be pulled back past the glans.
simple_sent: Phimosis is a condition in which the foreskin of the penis can not stretch all the way. This makes it hard for the penis to pull back past the glans.

ori_sentence: Pneumonia is an inflammatory condition of the lung primarily affecting the small air sacs known as alveoli.
simple_sent: Pneumonia is a disease of the lung. It mainly affects the alveoli, which are the small air sacs.

ori_sentence: Vitamin E deficiency in humans is a very rare condition, occurring as a consequence of abnormalities in dietary fat absorption or metabolism rather than from a diet low in vitamin E. Collectively
simple_sent: Vitamin E deficiency in humans is a very rare condition. The main cause is that the body does not use up the fat it gets from food properly, or it does not get enough vitamin E.

ori_sentence: Cystadenoma (or "cystoma") is a type of cystic adenoma.
simple_sent: Cystadenoma is a type of adenoma, or tumor.

ori_sentence: Thrombocytopenic purpura are purpura associated with a reduction in circulating blood platelets which can result from a variety of causes, such as kaposi sarcoma.
simple_sent: Thrombocytopenic purpura are purpura caused by a reduction in blood platelets. They can be caused by many different things, like kaposi sarcoma.

ori_sentence: Hypoactive sexual desire disorder (HSDD), hyposexuality or inhibited sexual desire (ISD) is considered a sexual dysfunction in some jurisdictions and is characterized as a lack or absence of sexual fantasies and desire for sexual activity, as judged by a clinician.
simple_sent: Hypoactive sexual desire disorder (HSDD), hyposexuality or inhibited sexual desire (ISD) is a lack or absence of sexual desire. People who have this condition may also have problems with sexual intercourse.

ori_sentence: Iridodialysis, is a localized separation or tearing away of the iris from its attachment to the ciliary body.
simple_sent: Iridodialysis is when the iris is cut off from the body of the eye. It is a small tear.

ori_sentence: A sarcoma is a malignant tumor, a type of cancer that arises from transformed cells of mesenchymal (connective tissue) origin.
simple_sent: A sarcoma is a type of cancer. The cells that cause sarcoma are called mesenchymal cells and are found in connective tissue.

ori_sentence: Melasma (also known as chloasma faciei, or the mask of pregnancy when present in pregnant women) is a tan or dark skin discoloration.
simple_sent: Melasma (also known as chloasma faciei) is dark tan or dark skin discoloration on the hands, feet, and face.

ori_sentence: Hydropneumothorax is defined as the presence of both air and fluid within the pleural space.
simple_sent: Hydropneumothorax means that both air and fluid are in the pleural space at the same time.

ori_sentence: Anovulation is when the ovaries do not release an oocyte during a menstrual cycle.
simple_sent: Anovulation is when the ovaries do not make any eggs. This is called anovulation.

ori_sentence: Spasmodic torticollis is an extremely painful chronic neurological movement disorder causing the neck to involuntarily turn to the left, right, upwards, and/or downwards.
simple_sent: Spasmodic torticollis is a movement disorder. It causes the neck to turn from the left to the right, from the right to the left, or from the left to the right.

ori_sentence: Lymphoid leukemias are a group of leukemias affecting circulating lymphocytes, a type of white blood cell.
simple_sent: Lymphoid leukemias are cancer of the lymphatic system. They affect white blood cells, called lymphocytes.

ori_sentence: Calcinosis is the formation of calcium deposits in any soft tissue.
simple_sent: Carcinosis is when calcium is built up in any soft tissue.

ori_sentence: Thecomas or theca cell tumors are benign ovarian neoplasms composed only of theca cells.
simple_sent: Thecomas or theca cell tumors are cancer of the theca cells. They are usually small.

ori_sentence: Spondyloperipheral dysplasia is an autosomal dominant disorder of bone growth.
simple_sent: Spondyloperipheral dysplasia is a disease that affects bone growth.

ori_sentence: Postpartum thyroiditis refers to thyroid dysfunction occurring in the first 12 months after pregnancy and may involve hyperthyroidism, hypothyroidism or the two sequentially.
simple_sent: Postpartum thyroiditis is a condition where the thyroid gland does not work properly. It usually happens in the first 12 months after pregnancy.

ori_sentence: Graves' disease, also known as toxic diffuse goiter, is an autoimmune disease that affects the thyroid.
simple_sent: Graves disease, also called toxic diffuse goiter, is a disease. It causes problems with the thyroid.

ori_sentence: Gestational trophoblastic neoplasia (GTN) is group of rare diseases related to pregnancy and included in gestational trophoblastic disease (GTD) in which abnormal trophoblast cells grow in the uterus.
simple_sent: Gestational trophoblastic neoplasia (GTN) is a disease that happens during pregnancy. In this disease, abnormal trophoblast cells grow in the uterus and cause problems for the baby.

ori_sentence: Thyroid disease is a medical condition that affects the function of the thyroid gland.
simple_sent: Thyroid disease is when the thyroid gland does not work the way it should.

ori_sentence: Sputum is mucus that is coughed up from the lower airways (the trachea and bronchi).
simple_sent: Sputum is mucus that comes out of the lower airways in the body.

ori_sentence: Cellulite is the herniation of subcutaneous fat within fibrous connective tissue that manifests as skin dimpling and nodularity, often on the pelvic region (specifically the buttocks), lower limbs, and abdomen.
simple_sent: Cellulite is the herniation of subcutaneous fat within fibrous connective tissue. People who have cellulite often notice it on their buttocks, lower limbs, and in the abdomen.

ori_sentence: The tibia /ˈtɪbiə/ (plural tibiae /ˈtɪbii/ or tibias), also known as the shinbone or shankbone, is the larger, stronger, and anterior (frontal) of the two bones in the leg below the knee in vertebrates (the other being the fibula, behind and to the outside of the tibia), and it connects the knee with the ankle bones.
simple_sent: The tibia (plural tibiae or tibias) is a bone in the leg below the knee. It is also called the shinbone or shankbone, because it is in the front part of the leg, before the knee. The other bone in the leg is the fibula, which is behind the tibia.

ori_sentence: Antidepressants are medications used to treat major depressive disorder, some anxiety disorders, some chronic pain conditions, and to help manage some addictions.
simple_sent: Antidepressants are used to help people with major depressive disorder. They are also used to help people with chronic pain and other conditions.

ori_sentence: Ibuprofen is a medication in the nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) class that is used for treating pain, fever, and inflammation.
simple_sent: Ibuprofen is a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) that helps to reduce pain and inflammation in the body.

ori_sentence: Rheumatoid arthritis (RA) is a long-term autoimmune disorder that primarily affects joints.
simple_sent: Rheumatoid arthritis (RA) is an autoimmune disease. It mainly affects the joints.

ori_sentence: A coma is a deep state of prolonged unconsciousness in which a person cannot be awakened, fails to respond normally to painful stimuli, light, or sound, lacks a normal wake-sleep cycle and does not initiate voluntary actions.
simple_sent: A coma is a deep state of unconsciousness in which a person does not wake up until a long time has passed. The person may not be able to feel pain, light or sound, and may not be able to move around.

ori_sentence: A spermatozoon (pronounced /ˌspɜːrmætəˈzoʊən/, alternate spelling spermatozoön; plural spermatozoa; from Ancient Greek: σπέρμα ("seed") and Ancient Greek: ζῷον ("living being")) is a motile sperm cell, or moving form of the haploid cell that is the male gamete.

ori_sentence: The cerebral cortex, also known as the cerebral mantle, is the outer layer of neural tissue of the cerebrum of the brain in humans and other mammals.
simple_sent: The cerebral cortex is a part of the brain. In humans and other mammals, it is the outer layer of the cerebrum, the main part of the brain.

ori_sentence: Tears for Fears are an English pop rock band formed in Bath, England, in 1981 by Roland Orzabal and Curt Smith.
simple_sent: Tears for Fears is an English rock band. The band was started in 1981 by Curt Smith and Roland Orzabal.

ori_sentence: Astrocytomas are a type of brain tumor.
simple_sent: Astrocytoma is a type of brain cancer.

ori_sentence: Dactinomycin, also known as actinomycin D, is a chemotherapy medication used to treat a number of types of cancer.
simple_sent: Dactinomycin, also known as actinomycin D, is a chemotherapy drug. It is used to treat certain types of cancer.

ori_sentence: Nausea is a diffuse sensation of unease and discomfort, often perceived as an urge to vomit.
simple_sent: Nausea is a feeling of pain and discomfort. Sometimes people feel like they need to vomit.

ori_sentence: Boric acid, also called hydrogen borate, boracic acid, and orthoboric acid is a weak, monobasic Lewis acid of boron.
simple_sent: Boric acid, also known as boracic acid, is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is H2O2.

ori_sentence: Hives, also known as urticaria, is a kind of skin rash with red, raised, itchy bumps.
simple_sent: Hives (also called urticaria) are red, raised, itchy bumps on the skin.

ori_sentence: Bile (from latin bilis), or gall, is a dark-green-to-yellowish-brown fluid produced by the liver of most vertebrates that aids the digestion of lipids in the small intestine.
simple_sent: Bile is a dark-green-to-yellowish-brown fluid. It is made by the liver of most animals, and goes to the small intestine where it helps the body digest lipids.

ori_sentence: The radius or radial bone is one of the two large bones of the forearm, the other being the ulna.
simple_sent: The radius is the second largest bone in the forearm. The other big bone is the ulna.

ori_sentence: A febrile seizure, also known as a fever fit or febrile convulsion, is a seizure associated with a high body temperature but without any serious underlying health issue.
simple_sent: A febrile seizure, also known as a fever fit or febrile convulsion, is when a person's body temperature gets too high. It usually does not cause any problems.

ori_sentence: Dysentery (/ˈdɪsəntri/) is a type of gastroenteritis that results in bloody diarrhea.
simple_sent: Dysentery is a disease. When people get dysentery, they have bloody diarrhea.

ori_sentence: The cerebrum, telencephalon or endbrain, is the largest part of the brain containing the cerebral cortex (of the two cerebral hemispheres), as well as several subcortical structures, including the hippocampus, basal ganglia, and olfactory bulb.
simple_sent: The cerebrum is the largest part of the brain. It contains the cerebral cortex (the main part of the brain), as well as several subcortical structures. These include the hippocampus, basal ganglia, and olfactory bulb.

ori_sentence: Far-sightedness, also known as long-sightedness, hypermetropia, or hyperopia, is a condition of the eye where distant objects are seen clearly but near objects appear blurred.
simple_sent: Far-sightedness, also known as long-sightedness, hypermetropia, or hyperopia, is a condition in which it is hard for the eye to focus on things far away.

ori_sentence: Potassium nitrate or Indian Saltpetre is a chemical compound with the chemical formula KNO3.
simple_sent: Potassium nitrate is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is KNO3.

ori_sentence: The renal veins are veins that drain the kidney.
simple_sent: The renal veins take away the blood from the kidney.

ori_sentence: Infertility is the inability of a person, animal or plant to reproduce by natural means.
simple_sent: Infertility is when a person or an animal can not have children by natural means.

ori_sentence: A sleep disorder, or somnipathy, is a medical disorder of the sleep patterns of a person.
simple_sent: A sleep disorder, or somnipathy, is when a person can not get enough sleep.

ori_sentence: The rectum is the final straight portion of the large intestine in humans and some other mammals, and the gut in others.
simple_sent: The rectum is a part of the large intestine. In humans, it is the last straight part of the large intestine.

ori_sentence: Breast cancer is cancer that develops from breast tissue.
simple_sent: Breast cancer is the most common cancer in women.

ori_sentence: Propane (/ˈproʊpeɪn/) is a three-carbon alkane with the molecular formula C3H8.
simple_sent: Propane is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is C3H8.

ori_sentence: Measles is a highly contagious infectious disease caused by measles virus.
simple_sent: Measles is a disease. The disease is caused by a virus called Measles.

ori_sentence: Glycerol (/ˈɡlɪsərɒl/; also called glycerine in British English and glycerin in American English) is a simple polyol compound.
simple_sent: Glycerol is a simple polyol. It is also called glycerine in British English, and glycerin in American English.

ori_sentence: Imatinib, sold under the brand names Gleevec and Glivec (both marketed worldwide by Novartis) among others, is an oral chemotherapy medication used to treat cancer.
simple_sent: Imatinib (also known as Gleevec and Glivec) is an oral chemotherapy drug. It is used to treat certain types of cancer, such as breast cancer.

ori_sentence: The optic nerve, also known as cranial nerve II, or simply as CN II, is a paired cranial nerve that transmits visual information from the retina to the brain.
simple_sent: The optic nerve is a cranial nerve. The optic nerve carries information from the retina to the brain. It is also called the cranial nerve II.

ori_sentence: Myocarditis, also known as inflammatory cardiomyopathy, is inflammation of the heart muscle.
simple_sent: Myocarditis is an inflammation of the heart muscle. It is also called inflammatory cardiomyopathy.

ori_sentence: Stuttering, also known as stammering, is a speech disorder in which the flow of speech is disrupted by involuntary repetitions and prolongations of sounds, syllables, words, or phrases as well as involuntary silent pauses or blocks in which the person who stutters is unable to produce sounds.
simple_sent: Stuttering, also known as stammering, is a speech disorder in which the person who stutters can not produce sounds. The person who stutters can not make the sounds on their own, so they have to try to make the sound with their mouth when they are speaking.

ori_sentence: Adrenaline, also known as epinephrine, is a hormone and medication which is involved in regulating visceral functions (e.g., respiration).
simple_sent: Adrenaline (also known as epinephrine) is a hormone. It is a chemical that helps the body control its internal functions.

ori_sentence: The cerebellum (Latin for "little brain") is a major feature of the hindbrain of all vertebrates.
simple_sent: The cerebellum is a small part of the brain. It is called the "little brain".

ori_sentence: Anaesthesia is a state of controlled, temporary loss of sensation or awareness that is induced for medical purposes.
simple_sent: Anaesthesia is a temporary loss of feeling or awareness. It is usually done for medical reasons.

ori_sentence: Yaws is a tropical infection of the skin, bones, and joints caused by the spirochete bacterium Treponema pallidum pertenue.
simple_sent: Yaws is an infection of the skin and bones. It is caused by a bacterium called Treponema pallidum pertenue.

ori_sentence: In biology, a reflex, or reflex action, is an involuntary, unplanned sequence or action and nearly instantaneous movement in response to a stimulus.
simple_sent: In biology, a reflex, or reflex action, is an action that a person does without thinking about it. It is an involuntary action.

ori_sentence: Rupture of membranes (ROM) or amniorrhexis is a term used during pregnancy to describe a rupture of the amniotic sac.
simple_sent: Rupture of membranes (ROM) or amniorrhexis is when the amniotic sac is broken, usually during pregnancy.

ori_sentence: Refsum disease  is an autosomal recessive neurological disease that results in the over-accumulation of phytanic acid in cells and tissues.
simple_sent: Refsum disease  is an autosomal recessive neurological disease. It happens when a person gets too much phytanic acid in their cells.

ori_sentence: Sodium bicarbonate (IUPAC name: sodium hydrogencarbonate), commonly known as baking soda or bicarbonate of soda, is a chemical compound with the formula NaHCO3.
simple_sent: Sodium bicarbonate is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is NaHCO3. It is also known as baking soda or bicarbonate of soda.

ori_sentence: A chemical substance is a form of matter having constant chemical composition and characteristic properties.
simple_sent: A chemical substance is a form of matter that always has the same chemical composition.

ori_sentence: Growing pains are recurring pain symptoms that are relatively common in children ages 3 to 12.
simple_sent: Growing pains are pain symptoms that usually last for a long time. They are common in children.

ori_sentence: Tonsillitis is inflammation of the tonsils in the upper part of the throat.
simple_sent: Tonsillitis is an infection of the tonsils. It usually starts in childhood.

ori_sentence: An allergen is a type of antigen that produces an abnormally vigorous immune response in which the immune system fights off a perceived threat that would otherwise be harmless to the body.
simple_sent: An allergen is a type of antigen that causes an immune response in the body. The immune system fights off the allergen, because it thinks the allergen is dangerous to the body.

ori_sentence: In the nervous system, a synapse is a structure that permits a neuron (or nerve cell) to pass an electrical or chemical signal to another neuron or to the target effector cell.
simple_sent: In the nervous system, a synapse is a structure that allows a neuron (or nerve cell) to move from one part of the nervous system to another part of the nervous system.

ori_sentence: Listeriosis is a bacterial infection most commonly caused by Listeria monocytogenes, although L. ivanovii and L. grayi have been reported in certain cases.
simple_sent: It is caused by Listeria monocytogenes. The most common type of Listeria is L. ivanovii, but L. grayi has also been found.

ori_sentence: Constipation refers to bowel movements that are infrequent or hard to pass.
simple_sent: Constipation is when a person's bowel movements are not often or hard.

ori_sentence: Hexamethylenetetramine, also known as methenamine, hexamine, or urotropin, is a heterocyclic organic compound with the formula (CH2)6N4.
simple_sent: Hexamethylenetetramine is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is (CH2)6N4. It is also known as methenamine or hexamine.

ori_sentence: Potassium hydroxide is an inorganic compound with the formula KOH, and is commonly called caustic potash.
simple_sent: Potassium hydroxide is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is KOH. It has the formula KOH.

ori_sentence: Irritation, in biology and physiology, is a state of inflammation or painful reaction to allergy or cell-lining damage.
simple_sent: Irritation, in biology and physiology, is a state of inflammation. Irritation can also be a painful reaction.

ori_sentence: Mumps is a viral disease caused by the mumps virus.
simple_sent: Mumps is a disease. It is caused by a virus.

simple_sent: Fucosidosis is a rare disease. In this disease, the FUCA1 gene is changed. This changes the way the enzyme alpha-L-fucosidase works.

simple_sent: Lemierre's syndrome is a rare disease. It is caused by an internal jugular vein.

simple_sent: A bone fracture (abbreviated FRX or Fx, Fx, or #) is a break in a bone. There is a break in the bone where the bone used to be.

ori_sentence: In vertebrate anatomy, the pituitary gland, or hypophysis, is an endocrine gland, about the size of a pea and weighing 0.5 grams (0.018 oz) in humans.
simple_sent: The pituitary gland is about the size of a pea. In humans, it is about the size of a pea and it weighs about 0.5 grams.

ori_sentence: Déjà vu (/ˌdeɪʒɑː ˈv(j)uː/ DAY-zhah-VOO, -⁠VEW, French: [deʒa vy]; "already seen") is a borrowed French word expressing the feeling that one has lived through the present situation before.

ori_sentence: Oromandibular dystonia is a form of focal dystonia affecting the mouth, jaw and tongue, and in this disease it is hard to speak.
simple_sent: Oromandibular dystonia Oromandibular dystonia affects the mouth and jaw. In this disease, it is hard to speak.

ori_sentence: The visual cortex of the brain is the area of the cerebral cortex that processes visual information.
simple_sent: The visual cortex is the part of the brain that deals with visual information.

simple_sent: Osteochondritis dissecans (OCD or OD) is a joint disease. It mostly affects the subchondral bone, but it can also affect other bones in the body.

ori_sentence: Amphetamine (contracted from alpha-methylphenethylamine) is a central nervous system (CNS) stimulant that is used in the treatment of attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD), narcolepsy, and obesity.
simple_sent: Amphetamine is a central nervous system (CNS) stimulant. It is used to treat narcolepsy, attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD), obesity, and other related conditions.

ori_sentence: Norman–Roberts syndrome, is a rare form of microlissencephaly caused by a mutation in the RELN gene.
simple_sent: Norman-Roberts syndrome is a rare condition. It is caused by a change in the RELN gene.

ori_sentence: A hallucination is a perception in the absence of an external stimulus that has the qualities of a real perception.
simple_sent: A hallucination is a thought or feeling that does not have an external stimulus. It is not a real perception.

ori_sentence: Flatulence is defined in the medical literature as "flatus expelled through the anus" or the "quality or state of being flatulent", which is defined in turn as "marked by or affected with gases generated in the intestine or stomach; likely to cause digestive flatulence".
simple_sent: Flatulence is defined in the medical literature as "flatus expelled through the anus" or the "quality or state of being flatulent". The medical literature also defines flatulence as the "quality or state of being flatulent" by a person's body after eating.

ori_sentence: Fireworks are a class of low explosive pyrotechnic devices used for aesthetic and entertainment purposes.
simple_sent: Fireworks are a type of explosive device. They are used for entertainment and entertainment purposes.

ori_sentence: A snakebite is an injury caused by the bite of a snake, especially a venomous snake.
simple_sent: A snakebite is an injury that happens when a snake bites you. This can be very bad.

ori_sentence: Bipolar disorder, previously known as manic depression, is a mood disorder characterized by periods of depression and periods of abnormally-elevated mood that last from days to weeks each.
simple_sent: Bipolar disorder, used to be called manic depression, is a mood disorder. People with bipolar disorder have short periods of good mood and long periods of bad mood.

ori_sentence: A syndrome is a set of medical signs and symptoms which are correlated with each other and often associated with a particular disease or disorder.
simple_sent: A syndrome is a set of medical signs and symptoms. These signs and symptoms are often related to a particular disease or disorder.

ori_sentence: Norepinephrine (NE), also called noradrenaline (NA) or noradrenalin, is an organic chemical in the catecholamine family that functions in the brain and body as both a hormone and neurotransmitter.
simple_sent: Norepinephrine (NE), also called noradrenaline (NA) or noradrenalin, is a chemical compound. It is a hormone and a neurotransmitter, which means it makes chemicals in the brain work.

ori_sentence: Claustrophobia is the fear of confined spaces.
simple_sent: Claustrophobia is a fear of small spaces.

ori_sentence: Glia, also called glial cells (singular gliocyte) or neuroglia, are non-neuronal cells in the central nervous system (brain and spinal cord) and the peripheral nervous system that do not produce electrical impulses.
simple_sent: Glia are non-neuronal cells in the central nervous system and the peripheral nervous system. They do not produce electrical impulses like neurons do, but they do help the nervous system work.

ori_sentence: Formaldehyde (/fərˈmældəhaɪd/ fər-MAL-də-hide, also /fɔːrˈ-/ for-) (systematic name methanal) is a naturally occurring organic compound with the formula CH2O (H−CHO).
simple_sent: Formaldehyde (also known as methanal) is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is CH2O (H−CHO). It is a naturally occurring organic compound.

ori_sentence: The deltoid muscle is the muscle forming the rounded contour of the human shoulder.
simple_sent: The deltoid muscle is a muscle in the shoulder. It is the biggest muscle in the shoulder.

ori_sentence: Lafora disease is a terminal and autosomal recessive genetic disorder characterized by the presence of inclusion bodies, known as Lafora bodies, within the cytoplasm of the cells in the heart, liver, muscle, and skin.
simple_sent: Lafora disease is an autosomal recessive genetic disorder. People who have the disease have bodies called Lafora bodies in the cytoplasm of the cells in their heart, liver, muscle, and skin.

ori_sentence: Tooth decay, also known as cavities or caries, is the breakdown of teeth due to acids produced by bacteria.
simple_sent: Tooth decay, also known as caries, is when teeth become weak because of acids from bacteria.

ori_sentence: Dyslexia, also known as reading disorder, is a disorder characterized by difficulty reading in individuals with otherwise unaffected intelligence.
simple_sent: Dyslexia, also known as reading disorder, is a learning disorder. People who have the disorder have a hard time reading.

ori_sentence: Emphysema, or pulmonary emphysema, is a lower respiratory tract disease, characterised by air-filled spaces (pneumatoses) in the lung, that can vary in size and may be very large.
simple_sent: Emphysema, or pulmonary emphysema, is a disease of the lung. People with emphysema have air-filled spaces (pneumatoses) in the lung. These spaces can be very large.

ori_sentence: In humans and most mammals and birds, the iris (plural: irides or irises) is a thin, annular structure in the eye, responsible for controlling the diameter and size of the pupil, thus the amount of light reaching the retina.
simple_sent: In humans and most mammals and birds, the iris is a thin, annular structure in the eye. It controls how big the pupil is and how much light can go through the eye and into the brain.

ori_sentence: Morphine is a pain medication of the opiate family that is found naturally in a dark brown, resinous form, from the poppy plant (Papaver somniferum).
simple_sent: Morphine is a pain medication. It comes from the poppy plant (Papaver somniferum), and is usually found in the form of a dark brown substance.

ori_sentence: Propylene glycol (IUPAC name: propane-1,2-diol) is a viscous, colorless liquid, which is nearly odorless but possesses a faintly sweet taste.
simple_sent: Propylene glycol (IUPAC name: propane-1,2-diol) is a colorless liquid. It does not have any smell, but it does have a slightly sweet taste.

ori_sentence: L-Tyrosine or tyrosine (symbol Tyr or Y) or 4-hydroxyphenylalanine is one of the 20 standard amino acids that are used by cells to synthesize proteins.
simple_sent: L-Tyrosine or tyrosine (symbol Tyr or Y) is an amino acid. It is one of the 20 most important amino acids that all living things need.

ori_sentence: Shortness of breath (SOB), also known as dyspnea (BrE: dyspnoea), is a feeling of not being able to breathe well enough.
simple_sent: Shortness of breath (SOB), also known as dyspnea (BrE: dyspnoea), is when people find it hard to breathe.

ori_sentence: Riboflavin, also known as vitamin B2, is a vitamin found in food and sold as a dietary supplement.
simple_sent: Riboflavin is a vitamin. It is also known as vitamin B2. Riboflavin is found in food.

ori_sentence: 1,4-Dichlorobenzene (1,4-DCB, p-DCB, or para-dichlorobenzene, sometimes abbreviated as PDCB or para) is an organic compound with the formula C6H4Cl2.
simple_sent: 1,4-Dichlorobenzene, also known as PDCB or para-dichlorobenzene, is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is C6H4Cl2.

ori_sentence: Anorexia nervosa, often referred to simply as anorexia, is an eating disorder characterized by low weight, food restriction, body image disturbance, fear of gaining weight, and an overpowering desire to be thin.
simple_sent: Anorexia nervosa is an eating disorder. People who have it think that they have low weight, but they also think that they have a bad body image, a fear of gaining weight, and a desire to be thin.

ori_sentence: The thymus is a specialized primary lymphoid organ of the immune system.
simple_sent: The thymus is an important lymphoid organ in the human body.

ori_sentence: Lymph (from Latin, lympha meaning "water") is the fluid that flows through the lymphatic system, a system composed of lymph vessels (channels) and intervening lymph nodes whose function, like the venous system, is to return fluid from the tissues to the central circulation.
simple_sent: Lymph (from Latin, lympha meaning "water") is the fluid that flows through the lymphatic system. The lymphatic system is made up of lymph vessels (channels) and lymph nodes. The lymphatic system is a part of the circulatory system.

ori_sentence: Gluten is a group of seed storage proteins found in certain cereal grains.
simple_sent: Gluten is a type of protein. It is found in many different foods.

ori_sentence: Ammonium chloride is an inorganic compound with the formula NH4Cl and a white crystalline salt that is highly soluble in water.
simple_sent: Ammonium chloride is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is NH4Cl. It is a white crystalline salt.

ori_sentence: Melanoma, also redundantly known as malignant melanoma, is a type of skin cancer that develops from the pigment-producing cells known as melanocytes.
simple_sent: Melanoma, also called malignant melanoma, is a cancer of the skin. The cells that cause melanoma are called melanocytes.

ori_sentence: Phenolphthalein is a chemical compound with the formula C20H14O4 and is often written as "HIn" or "phph" in shorthand notation.
simple_sent: Phenolphthalein is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is C20H14O4. Its chemical formula is HIn.

ori_sentence: Cervical cancer is a cancer arising from the cervix.
simple_sent: Cervical cancer is a cancer of the cervix.

ori_sentence: Relapsing polychondritis is a multi-systemic condition characterized by repeated episodes of inflammation and deterioration of cartilage.
simple_sent: Relapsing polychondritis is a multi-system condition. It occurs when the cartilage in the knee becomes damaged again and again.

ori_sentence: Colorectal cancer (CRC), also known as bowel cancer, colon cancer, or rectal cancer, is the development of cancer from the colon or rectum (parts of the large intestine).
simple_sent: Colorectal cancer (also called bowel cancer, colon cancer, or rectal cancer) is cancer of the colon or rectum. It is the third most common cancer in people.

ori_sentence: The medical history, case history, or anamnesis (from Greek: ἀνά, aná, "open", and μνήσις, mnesis, "memory") of a patient is information gained by a physician by asking specific questions, either of the patient or of other people who know the person and can give suitable information, with the aim of obtaining information useful in formulating a diagnosis and providing medical care to the patient.
simple_sent: The medical history, case history, or anamnesis of a patient is information gained by a physician by asking specific questions, either of the patient or of other people who know the patient and can give suitable information, with the aim of getting information that can be used to make a diagnosis and provide medical care to the patient.

ori_sentence: The organic compound 1,1,1-trichloroethane, also known as methyl chloroform, is a chloroalkane.
simple_sent: 1,1,1-trichloroethane, also known as methyl chloroform, is a chemical compound.

ori_sentence: The human back, also called the dorsum, is the large posterior area of the human body, rising from the top of the buttocks to the back of the neck.
simple_sent: The human back, also called the dorsum, is the back part of the human body. It starts at the buttocks and goes all the way up to the neck.

ori_sentence: Obsessive–compulsive disorder (OCD) is a mental and behavioral disorder in which an individual has intrusive thoughts and/or feels the need to perform certain routines repeatedly to the extent where it induces distress or impairs general function.
simple_sent: Obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD) is a mental and behavioral disorder. People who have this disorder often feel the need to do certain things over and over again, to the point that they feel sick or have bad health problems.

ori_sentence: Gram stain or Gram staining, also called Gram's method, is a method of staining used to classify bacterial species into two large groups: Gram-positive bacteria and Gram-negative bacteria.
simple_sent: Gram stain or Gram staining, also called Gram's method, is a way to tell different types of bacteria apart. Gram staining can be used to tell the difference between bacteria.

ori_sentence: Chlordiazepoxide, trade name Librium among others, is a sedative and hypnotic medication of the benzodiazepine class; it is used to treat anxiety, insomnia and symptoms of withdrawal from alcohol and other drugs.
simple_sent: Chlordiazepoxide, also known as Librium, is a hypnotic and sedative medication. It is used to treat anxiety, insomnia, and withdrawal symptoms from alcohol and other drugs.

ori_sentence: Li–Fraumeni syndrome is a rare, autosomal dominant, hereditary disorder that predisposes carriers to cancer development.
simple_sent: Li-Fraumeni syndrome is a rare disease. People who have it are more likely to have cancer later in life.

ori_sentence: Methadone, sold under the brand names Dolophine and Methadose among others, is a synthetic opioid agonist used for chronic pain and also for opioid dependence
simple_sent: Methadone (also known as Dolophine and Methadose) is a drug that is an opioid. It is used to treat pain and it can also be used for addiction.

ori_sentence: Phenol (also called carbolic acid) is an aromatic organic compound with the molecular formula C6H5OH.
simple_sent: Phenol is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is C6H5OH. It is also called carbolic acid.

ori_sentence: Whooping cough, also known as pertussis or the 100-day cough, is a highly contagious bacterial disease.
simple_sent: Whooping cough, also known as pertussis, is a disease. It is caused by bacteria.

ori_sentence: Lupus erythematosus is a collection of autoimmune diseases in which the human immune system becomes hyperactive and attacks healthy tissues.
simple_sent: Lupus erythematosus is an autoimmune disease. This means that the body's immune system attacks healthy parts of the body.

ori_sentence: Formic acid, systematically named methanoic acid, is the simplest carboxylic acid, and has the chemical formula H2CO2.
simple_sent: Formic acid, also known as methanoic acid, is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is H2CO2.

ori_sentence: The humerus (/ˈhjuːmərəs/, plural: humeri) is a long bone in the arm that runs from the shoulder to the elbow.
simple_sent: The humerus is a long bone in the arm. It goes from the shoulder to the elbow, and is called the humerus.

ori_sentence: Calcitriol is the active form of vitamin D, normally made in the kidney.
simple_sent: Carcinriol is an important vitamin. It is usually made in the kidney.

ori_sentence: Darifenacin (trade name Enablex in United States and Canada, Emselex in the European Union) is a medication used to treat urinary incontinence due to an overactive bladder.
simple_sent: Darifenacin (also known as Enablex in the United States and Emselex in the European Union) is a prescription drug. It is used to treat urinary incontinence.

simple_sent: General anaesthesia can mean:

simple_sent: Depersonalization can mean that the mind or body is not important to the person, or that the person does not care about it.

ori_sentence: Jaundice, also known as icterus, is a yellowish or greenish pigmentation of the skin and whites of the eyes due to high bilirubin levels.
simple_sent: Jaundice, also known as icterus, is when the skin and eyes are yellow or green. This is because of too much bilirubin.

ori_sentence: Tabun or GA is an extremely toxic chemical substance.
simple_sent: Tabun is a very dangerous chemical. It is very toxic.

ori_sentence: The trigeminal nerve (the fifth cranial nerve, or simply CN V) is a nerve responsible for sensation in the face and motor functions such as biting and chewing; it is the most complex of the cranial nerves.
simple_sent: The trigeminal nerve is a nerve in the face. It is the fifth cranial nerve. The trigeminal nerve is the most important nerve in the face because it controls movements such as biting and chewing.

ori_sentence: The vagus nerve, historically cited as the pneumogastric nerve, is the tenth cranial nerve or CN X, and interfaces with the parasympathetic control of the heart, lungs, and digestive tract.
simple_sent: The vagus nerve is the tenth (number 10) cranial nerve in the human body. It controls the heart, lungs, and digestive tract and is called the parasympathetic nerve.

ori_sentence: Travelers' diarrhea (TD) is a stomach and intestinal infection.
simple_sent: Travelers' diarrhea is a disease. It is a stomach infection.

ori_sentence: Dienogest, sold under the brand name Visanne among others, is a progestin medication which is used in birth control pills and in the treatment of endometriosis.
simple_sent: Dienogest (also known as Visanne) is a progestin medication. It is used to treat endometriosis and is also used as a birth control pill.

ori_sentence: Sexual headache is a type of headache that occurs in the skull and neck during sexual activity, including masturbation or orgasm.
simple_sent: Sexual headache is a headache that happens during sexual activity. It usually happens in the neck and skull.

ori_sentence: The Chaddock reflex is a diagnostic reflex similar to the Babinski reflex.
simple_sent: The Chaddock reflex is a reflex. It is similar to the Babinski reflex.

ori_sentence: A biopsy is a medical test commonly performed by a surgeon, interventional radiologist, or an interventional cardiologist.
simple_sent: A biopsy is a medical test. It is usually done by a surgeon or a cardiologist to find out what is wrong.

ori_sentence: Cluster headache (CH) is a neurological disorder characterized by recurrent severe headaches on one side of the head, typically around the eye.
simple_sent: Cluster headache (CH) is a neurological disorder. People who have it often have headaches on one side of their head all the time.

ori_sentence: Clare Victoria Balding  (born 29 January 1971) is an English broadcaster, journalist, and author.
simple_sent: Clare Balding (born January 29, 1971) is an English television and radio presenter.

ori_sentence: Nocardia is a genus of weakly staining Gram-positive, catalase-positive, rod-shaped bacteria.
simple_sent: Nocardia is a genus of bacteria. These bacteria are Gram-positive and catalase-positive.

ori_sentence: Ergocalciferol, also known as vitamin D2 and nonspecifically calciferol, is a type of vitamin D found in food and used as a dietary supplement.
simple_sent: Ergocalciferol, also known as vitamin D2, is a chemical compound. It is found in food and in some supplements as well.

ori_sentence: The aorta (/eɪˈɔːrtə/ ay-OR-tə) is the main and largest artery in the human body, originating from the left ventricle of the heart and extending down to the abdomen, where it splits into two smaller arteries (the common iliac arteries).
simple_sent: The aorta is the largest and main artery in the human body. It comes from the left ventricle of the heart and goes all the way down to the abdomen. At the end of the aorta are two smaller arteries called the iliac arteries.

ori_sentence: Platelets, also called thrombocytes (from Greek θρόμβος, "clot" and κύτος, "cell"), are a component of blood whose function (along with the coagulation factors) is to react to bleeding from blood vessel injury by clumping, thereby initiating a blood clot.
simple_sent: Platelets, also called thrombocytes (from Greek, "clot" and "cell"), are a small part of blood. Their function is to help blood clot when there is bleeding from a blood vessel. They are also called coagulation factors.

ori_sentence: Acetylcholine (ACh) is an organic chemical that functions in the brain and body of many types of animals (including humans) as a neurotransmitter—a chemical message released by nerve cells to send signals to other cells, such as neurons, muscle cells and gland cells.
simple_sent: Acetylcholine (ACh) is an organic chemical that is released by nerve cells in the brain and body of many types of animals (including humans) to send signals to other cells in the body. This signal is called a neurotransmitter.

ori_sentence: A bronchus is a passage or airway in the lower respiratory tract that conducts air into the lungs.
simple_sent: A bronchus is an airway in the lower part of the body. It carries air to the lungs.

ori_sentence: Aphthous stomatitis, or recurrent aphthous stomatitis (RAS), is a common condition characterized by the repeated formation of benign and non-contagious mouth ulcers (aphthae) in otherwise healthy individuals.
simple_sent: Aphthous stomatitis, or recurrent aphthous stomatitis (RAS), is a condition in which the mouth ulcers (aphthae) in the mouth grow back again and again, even when the person is otherwise healthy.

ori_sentence: Calcifediol, also known as calcidiol, 25-hydroxycholecalciferol, or 25-hydroxyvitamin D3 (abbreviated 25(OH)D3), is a form of vitamin D produced in the liver by hydroxylation of vitamin D3 (cholecalciferol) by the enzyme vitamin D 25-hydroxylase.
simple_sent: Calcifediol, also known as 25-hydroxycholecalciferol, 25-hydroxyvitamin D3, 25-hydroxycholecalciferol, or 25(OH)D3, is a type of vitamin D. It is made by the liver by a process called vitamin D 25-hydroxylase.

ori_sentence: The hypothalamus (from Ancient Greek ὑπό, "under", and θάλαμος, "chamber") is a portion of the brain that contains a number of small nuclei with a variety of functions.
simple_sent: The hypothalamus is a part of the brain. There are a number of small nuclei in the hypothalamus. The word hypothalamus comes from the Ancient Greek words, "under", and "chamber".

ori_sentence: Warts are typically small, rough, hard growths that are similar in color to the rest of the skin.
simple_sent: Warts are usually small, hard and rough growths. They are usually the same color as the skin.

ori_sentence: Malic acid is an organic compound with the molecular formula C4H6O5.
simple_sent: Mali acid is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is C4H6O5.

ori_sentence: Ibandronic acid is a bisphosphonate medication used in the prevention and treatment of osteoporosis and metastasis-associated skeletal fractures in people with cancer.
simple_sent: Ibandronic acid is a bisphosphonate drug. It is used to prevent and treat osteoporosis. It is also used to treat cancer of the bones.

ori_sentence: Strabismus is a condition in which the eyes do not properly align with each other when looking at an object.
simple_sent: Strabismus is when the eyes are not aligned properly. When they look at something, they do not align.

ori_sentence: Pectus carinatum, also called pigeon chest, is a malformation of the chest characterized by a protrusion of the sternum and ribs.
simple_sent: Pectus carinatum, also called pigeon chest, is a malformation of the chest. It looks like there is a hole in the chest.
