simple_sent: Precursor B-cell lymphoblastic leukemia is a disease. In it, the body makes too many B-cell lymphoblasts. These cells are in the blood and in the bone marrow.

ori_sentence: Dementia manifests as a set of related symptoms, which usually surface when the brain is damaged by injury or disease.
simple_sent: Dementia causes a set of related symptoms. These symptoms usually start when the brain is damaged by injury or disease.

ori_sentence: Marchiafava–Bignami disease is a progressive neurological disease of alcohol use disorder, characterized by corpus callosum demyelination and necrosis and subsequent atrophy.
simple_sent: Marchiafava-Bignami disease is a progressive disease of the brain. It causes the corpus callosum to become shorter and shorter, and eventually it will die.

ori_sentence: The thumb is the first digit of the hand, next to the index finger.
simple_sent: The thumb is the second largest finger in the hand after the index finger.

ori_sentence: Brain abscess (or cerebral abscess) is an abscess caused by inflammation and collection of infected material, coming from local (ear infection, dental abscess, infection of paranasal sinuses, infection of the mastoid air cells of the temporal bone, epidural abscess) or remote (lung, heart, kidney etc.)
simple_sent: A brain abscess (or cerebral abscess) is an abscess in the brain. It is usually caused by an infection of the brain, but it can also be caused by other things, like an ear infection, a dental abscess, or an infection of the paranasal sinuses.

ori_sentence: The maxilla (plural: maxillae /mækˈsɪliː/) in vertebrates is the upper fixed (not fixed in Neopterygii) bone of the jaw formed from the fusion of two maxillary bones.
simple_sent: The maxilla (plural maxillae) in vertebrates is the upper bone of the jaw that is fixed. It is formed when two bones from the side of the jaw join together.

ori_sentence: Mercury(II) chloride (or mercury bichloride, mercury dichloride) - historically also known as sulema or corrosive sublimate is the inorganic chemical compound of mercury and chlorine with the formula HgCl2.
simple_sent: Mercury(II) chloride, also known as bichloride and dichloride, is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is HgCl2. It has mercury and chlorine in it.

ori_sentence: In biology and biochemistry, protease inhibitors, or antiproteases, are molecules that inhibit the function of proteases (enzymes that aid the breakdown of proteins).
simple_sent: In biology and biochemistry, a protease inhibitor is a molecule that stops a protein from working. Proteases are enzymes that help proteins to break down.

ori_sentence: Scurvy is a disease resulting from a lack of vitamin C (ascorbic acid).
simple_sent: Scurvy is a disease. It is caused by lack of vitamin C.

ori_sentence: The salivary glands in mammals are exocrine glands that produce saliva through a system of ducts.
simple_sent: The salivary glands are glands in the body. In mammals, the salivary glands are located in the throat.

ori_sentence: Color blindness (color vision deficiency) is the decreased ability to see color or differences in color.
simple_sent: Color blindness (color vision deficiency) is when people can not see color at all.

ori_sentence: Mood disorder, also known as affective disorder, is a group of conditions of mental and behavioral disorder where a disturbance in the person's mood is the main underlying feature.
simple_sent: Mood disorder, also known as affective disorder, is a condition where a person's mood changes from one place to another. There are many different types of mood disorder.

ori_sentence: Quinine is a medication used to treat malaria and babesiosis.
simple_sent: Quinine is a medicine. It is used to treat malaria.

ori_sentence: A delusion is a fixed belief that is not amenable to change in light of conflicting evidence.
simple_sent: A delusion is a fixed belief. It can not be changed, even if there is new evidence.

ori_sentence: Arrhythmias, also known as cardiac arrhythmias, heart arrhythmias, or dysrhythmias, are irregularities in the heartbeat, including when it is too fast or too slow.
simple_sent: Heart arrhythmias (also called cardiac arrhythmias or dysrhythmias) is when the heart is beating too fast or too slow. There are many types of arrhythmias.

simple_sent: In cell biology, the cytoplasm is the outside of a cell. It is where all the material of the cell is, except for the cell nucleus.

ori_sentence: The endoplasmic reticulum (ER) is, in essence, the transportation system of the eukaryotic cell, and has many other important functions such as protein folding.
simple_sent: The endoplasmic reticulum (ER) is an important part of the eukaryotic cell. The endoplasmic reticulum has many important functions.

ori_sentence: Isosorbide dinitrate (ISDN) is a medication used for heart failure, esophageal spasms, and to treat and prevent chest pain from not enough blood flow to the heart.
simple_sent: Isosorbide dinitrate (ISDN) is a medication. It is used to treat heart failure. It is also used to prevent chest pain when the heart is working hard.

ori_sentence: In the vertebrate spinal column, each vertebra (plural vertebrae) is an irregular bone with a complex structure composed of bone and some hyaline cartilage, the proportions of which vary according to the segment of the backbone and the species of vertebrate.
simple_sent: In the vertebrate spinal column, each vertebra (plural vertebrae) is an irregular bone with a complex structure composed of bone and some cartilage. Different animals have different types of vertebrae and different types of cartilage.

ori_sentence: Psittacosis—also known as parrot fever, and ornithosis—is a zoonotic infectious disease in humans caused by a bacterium called Chlamydia psittaci and contracted from infected parrots, such as macaws, cockatiels, and budgerigars, and from pigeons, sparrows, ducks, hens, gulls and many other species of birds.
simple_sent: Psittacosis (also known as parrot fever, and ornithosis) is a disease caused by a bacterium (Chlamydia psittaci) that is spread from birds to people. This bacterium is most often found in parrots, but it can also be found in pigeons, sparrows, ducks, hens, and gulls.

simple_sent: Typhus (also known as typhus fever) is a disease. There are two types of typhus, called epidemic typhus and scrub typhus.

ori_sentence: The medulla oblongata or simply medulla is a long stem-like structure which makes up the lower part of the brainstem.
simple_sent: The medulla oblongata is a long part of the brain. It is like a stem, and it goes all the way to the top.

ori_sentence: Gout is a form of inflammatory arthritis characterized by recurrent attacks of a red, tender, hot, and swollen joint.
simple_sent: Gout is a form of arthritis. People with gout usually have a red, tender, hot, and swollen joint.

ori_sentence: A migraine (UK: /ˈmiːɡreɪn/, US: /ˈmaɪ-/) is a primary headache disorder characterized by recurrent headaches that are moderate to severe.
simple_sent: A migraine (UK: /ˈmiːɡreɪn/, US: /ˈmaɪ-/) is a type of headache. People who have a migraine often have other headaches as well.

simple_sent: A toothbrush is a tool that people use to clean their teeth and gums.

simple_sent: Asperger syndrome (also known as Asperger's) is a neurodevelopmental disorder. People with Asperger syndrome have problems with social and nonverbal communication, and they find it hard to keep up with other people.

ori_sentence: A right bundle branch block (RBBB) is a heart block in the right bundle branch of the electrical conduction system.
simple_sent: A right bundle branch block (RBBB) is a part of the electrical system. It is found in the right coronary heart.

ori_sentence: Cytarabine, also known as cytosine arabinoside (ara-C), is a chemotherapy medication used to treat acute myeloid leukemia (AML), acute lymphocytic leukemia (ALL), chronic myelogenous leukemia (CML), and non-Hodgkin's lymphoma.
simple_sent: Cytarabine (also known as cytosine arabinoside) is a chemotherapy drug. It is used to treat people with three types of leukemia: acute myeloid leukemia (AML), chronic myelogenous leukemia (CML), and non-Hodgkin's lymphoma.

ori_sentence: Albinism is the congenital absence of any pigmentation or colouration in an animal, plant, or person, resulting in white hair, feathers, scales and skin and pink eyes in mammals, birds, reptiles, amphibians and fish and invertebrates as well.
simple_sent: Albinism is when an animal, plant, or person is born without any color or pigmentation. This results in white hair, feathers, scales and skin and pink eyes in mammals, birds, reptiles, amphibians and fish and invertebrates.

ori_sentence: An abscess is a collection of pus that has built up within the tissue of the body.
simple_sent: An abscess is a large mass of pus that has built up inside the body.

simple_sent: Haemophilia or hemophilia (from Ancient Greek  αἷμα (haîma) 'blood', and  φιλία (philía) 'love of'), is a condition in which the body can not make blood clots. This means that the body can not stop bleeding.

simple_sent: Blood plasma is a light amber liquid that is made when blood cells are taken out of the blood. It contains proteins and other things from the blood.

ori_sentence: Pain is a distressing feeling often caused by intense or damaging stimuli.
simple_sent: Pain can be a very bad feeling. It can be caused by many things.

ori_sentence: Angina, also known as angina pectoris, is chest pain or pressure, a symptom of coronary heart disease, usually due to insufficient blood flow to the heart muscle (myocardium).Angina is usually due to obstruction or spasm of the arteries that supply blood to the heart muscle.
simple_sent: Angina, also known as angina pectoris, is chest pain or pressure, a symptom of heart disease. The main cause of angina is that the blood does not get to the heart muscle fast enough, causing the heart to work harder than it should.

ori_sentence: Biotin, also called vitamin B7, is one of the B vitamins.
simple_sent: Biotin is an important vitamin. It is also called B7.

ori_sentence: Hepatitis is inflammation of the liver tissue.
simple_sent: Hepatitis is a disease of the liver.

ori_sentence: A hernia is the abnormal exit of tissue or an organ, such as the bowel, through the wall of the cavity in which it normally resides.
simple_sent: A hernia is an abnormal exit of tissue or an organ through the wall of the body. This usually happens in the bowel.

ori_sentence: Bulimia nervosa, also known as simply bulimia, is an eating disorder characterized by binge eating followed by purging; and excessive concern with body shape and weight.
simple_sent: Bulimia nervosa, also known as simply bulimia, is an eating disorder. People who suffer from it think that they eat too much, and that it makes them fat.

simple_sent: Adenosine triphosphate (ATP) is an organic compound. It is a chemical compound that contains adenosine and triphosphate ions. It is an energy source for many living things, including humans.

ori_sentence: Acne, also known as acne vulgaris, is a long-term skin condition that occurs when dead skin cells and oil from the skin clog hair follicles.
simple_sent: Acne, also known as acne vulgaris, is a condition of the skin. It happens when hair follicles are blocked by dead skin cells.

simple_sent: Zellweger syndrome is a rare disorder. In people with Zellweger syndrome, there are less or no peroxisomes in their cells.

ori_sentence: Syncope, commonly known as fainting, is a loss of consciousness and muscle strength characterized by a fast onset, short duration, and spontaneous recovery.
simple_sent: Syncope, also known as fainting, is a loss of consciousness and muscle strength. It usually happens very quickly and is usually over very quickly.

ori_sentence: Ischemia or ischaemia is a restriction in blood supply to any tissues, muscle group, or organ of the body, causing a shortage of oxygen that is needed for cellular metabolism (to keep tissue alive).
simple_sent: Ischemia or ischaemia is when the blood can not supply enough blood to any tissue, muscle group, or organ of the body. This causes a lack of oxygen, which is what keeps tissue alive.

ori_sentence: Morpholine salicylate is a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug.
simple_sent: Morpholine salicylate is an anti-inflammatory drug.

ori_sentence: Pentaerythritol tetranitrate (PETN), also known as PENT, PENTA, (primarily in Russian) TEN, corpent, or penthrite (or, rarely and primarily in German, as nitropenta), is an explosive material.
simple_sent: Pentaerythritol tetranitrate, also known as PENT, PENTA, TEN, corpent, or penthrite, is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is PETN.

simple_sent: Hemolytic-uremic syndrome (HUS) is a group of blood disorders. When people have HUS, they have low red blood cells and platelets.

ori_sentence: A Zenker's diverticulum, also pharyngeal pouch, is a diverticulum of the mucosa of the human pharynx, just above the cricopharyngeal muscle (i.e. above the upper sphincter of the esophagus).
simple_sent: A Zenker's diverticulum (also called pharyngeal pouch) is a small tube in the human throat. It can be found just above the cricopharyngeal muscle.

simple_sent: Malignant histiocytosis is a rare disease. It is found in humans and in the Bernese Mountain Dog. It is caused by histiocytosis of the lungs.

ori_sentence: Diphtheria is an infection caused by the bacterium Corynebacterium diphtheriae.
simple_sent: The bacteria that causes diphtheria is called Corynebacterium diphtheriae.

ori_sentence: Prostate cancer is cancer of the prostate.
simple_sent: Prostate cancer is a cancer of the body.

ori_sentence: The duodenum is the first section of the small intestine in most higher vertebrates, including mammals, reptiles, and birds.
simple_sent: The duodenum is a part of the small intestine. It is the first section of the small intestine in most animals.

ori_sentence: Q fever or query fever is a disease caused by infection with Coxiella burnetii, a bacterium that affects humans and other animals.
simple_sent: Q fever or question fever is a disease. It is caused by a bacterium (Coxiella burnetii) and it can be very dangerous.

ori_sentence: Bisabolol, or more formally α-(−)-bisabolol or also known as levomenol, is a natural monocyclic sesquiterpene alcohol.

simple_sent: Scarlet fever is a disease. It is caused by a bacterium called Streptococcus pyogenes, or group A strep.

ori_sentence: Melatonin is a hormone primarily released by the pineal gland at night, and has long been associated with control of the sleep–wake cycle.
simple_sent: Melatonin is a hormone that is released by the pineal gland at night. People who sleep a lot use this hormone to help them sleep.

ori_sentence: A polymer (/ˈpɒlɪmər/; Greek poly-, "many" + -mer, "part")is a substance or material consisting of very large molecules, or macromolecules, composed of many repeating subunits.
simple_sent: A polymer (from Greek poly-, "many" + -mer, "part") is a material or compound that is made up of many smaller molecules. The molecules are called macromolecules.

ori_sentence: The lens,  or crystalline lens is a  transparent biconvex structure in the eye that, along with the cornea, helps to refract light to be focused on the retina.
simple_sent: The lens, or crystalline lens, is a structure in the eye that helps to focus light. The cornea is the other main structure in the eye.

ori_sentence: Plague is an infectious disease caused by the bacterium Yersinia pestis.
simple_sent: The disease is caused by a bacterium called Yersinia pestis.

ori_sentence: A polynucleotide molecule is a biopolymer composed of 13 or more nucleotide monomers covalently bonded in a chain.
simple_sent: A polynucleotide molecule is a small molecule. It is made up of 13 nucleotide monomers joined together at the top.

ori_sentence: Aciclovir (ACV), also known as acyclovir, is an antiviral medication.
simple_sent: Aciclovir, also known as acyclovir, is an antiviral drug.

ori_sentence: Stomach cancer, also known as gastric cancer, is a cancer that develops from the lining of the stomach.
simple_sent: Stomach cancer is a cancer of the stomach. It is the most common cancer in women and men.

ori_sentence: Uterine prolapse is when the uterus descends towards or through the opening of the vagina.
simple_sent: Uterine prolapse is when the uterus goes all the way through the vagina.

simple_sent: The ulna is a long bone in the forearm. The length of the ulna is from the elbow to the smallest finger. The ulna is found on the left side of the forearm, next to the shoulder.

simple_sent: Roflumilast (also known as Daxas) is an anti-angiogenic drug. It works by stopping the enzyme phosphodiesterase-4 (PDE-4) from working.

ori_sentence: Esmolol, sold under the brand name Brevibloc, is a cardioselective beta1 receptor blocker with rapid onset, a very short duration of action, and no significant intrinsic sympathomimetic or membrane stabilising activity at therapeutic dosages.
simple_sent: Esmolol, sold under the brand name Brevibloc, is a cardioselective beta1 receptor blocker. It has a very short half-life (how long it takes for the drug to work) and does not act at all on the beta1 receptor.

ori_sentence: Meprobamate—marketed as Miltown by Wallace Laboratories and Equanil by Wyeth, among others—is a carbamate derivative used as an anxiolytic drug.
simple_sent: Meprobamate (also known as Miltown and Equanil) is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is carbamate.

ori_sentence: A phobia is a type of anxiety disorder defined by a persistent and excessive fear of an object or situation.
simple_sent: A phobia is an anxiety disorder. People with a phobia usually have a strong fear of something.

ori_sentence: The esophagus (American English) or oesophagus (British English; both /iːˈsɒfəɡəs, ɪ-/), informally known as the food pipe or gullet, is an organ in vertebrates through which food passes, aided by peristaltic contractions, from the pharynx to the stomach.
simple_sent: The esophagus (American English) or oesophagus (British English), also known as the food pipe or gullet, is an organ in vertebrates that carries food from the pharynx to the stomach. It is also called the food pipe.

ori_sentence: Exophthalmos (also called exophthalmus, exophthalmia, proptosis, or exorbitism) is a bulging of the eye anteriorly out of the orbit.
simple_sent: Exophthalmos (also called exophthalmus, exophthalmia, proptosis, or exorbitism) is a problem with the eye.

ori_sentence: Adipose tissue, body fat, or simply fat is a loose connective tissue composed mostly of adipocytes.
simple_sent: Adipose tissue, body fat, or simply fat is the loose connective tissue that makes up the human body.

ori_sentence: In vertebrate anatomy, hip (or "coxa" in medical terminology) refers to either an anatomical region or a joint.
simple_sent: In anatomy, the hip (or "coxa" in medical terminology) is either a joint or an anatomical region.

ori_sentence: Fibromuscular dysplasia (FMD) is a non-atherosclerotic, non-inflammatory disease of the blood vessels that causes abnormal growth within the wall of an artery.
simple_sent: Fibromuscular dysplasia (FMD) is a disease of the blood vessels. It is a non-atherosclerotic disease and does not cause inflammation.

ori_sentence: The pupil is a black hole located in the center of the iris of the eye that allows light to strike the retina.
simple_sent: The pupil is a small black hole in the eye. It is in the center of the eye, near the iris.

ori_sentence: Subarachnoid hemorrhage (SAH) is bleeding into the subarachnoid space—the area between the arachnoid membrane and the pia mater surrounding the brain.
simple_sent: Subarachnoid hemorrhage (SAH) is a bleeding in the subarachnoid space of the brain. This area is between the arachnoid membrane and the pia mater.

ori_sentence: In the physiology of the kidney, renal blood flow (RBF) is the volume of blood delivered to the kidneys per unit time.
simple_sent: In the physiology of the kidney, renal blood flow (RBF) is how much blood is going to and from the kidney.

ori_sentence: Caudal regression syndrome, or sacral agenesis (or hypoplasia of the sacrum), is a rare birth defect.
simple_sent: Caudal regression syndrome, also called sacral agenesis, is a birth defect that does not happen often.

ori_sentence: Hypospadias is a common variation in fetal development of the penis in which the urethra does not open from its usual location in the head of the penis.
simple_sent: In this case, the urethra does not open at all. In this case, the penis does not open at all because the urethra does not open at all.

ori_sentence: An apocrine sweat gland (/ˈæpəkrən, -ˌkraɪn, -ˌkriːn/; from Greek apo 'away' and krinein 'to separate') is composed of a coiled secretory portion located at the junction of the dermis and subcutaneous fat, from which a straight portion inserts and secretes into the infundibular portion of the hair follicle.
simple_sent: An apocrine sweat gland (from Greek apo 'away' and krinein 'to separate ') is a part of the human body that helps the body cool down. The apocrine sweat gland has a long, coiled part that goes from the dermis to the hair follicle.

ori_sentence: A galactocele (also called lacteal cyst or milk cyst) is a retention cyst containing milk or a milky substance that is usually located in the mammary glands.
simple_sent: A galactocele (also called lacteal cyst or milk cyst) is a cyst in the mammary glands. It usually has milk in it, or a milky substance.

ori_sentence: Sodium lactate is the sodium salt of lactic acid, and has a mild saline taste.
simple_sent: Sodium lactate is a chemical compound. It has sodium and lactate ions in it.

ori_sentence: Triethylenetetramine (TETA and trien), also called trientine (INN), is an organic compound with the formula [CH2NHCH2CH2NH2]2.
simple_sent: Triethylenetetramine, also known as trientine, is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is [CH2NHCH2CH2NH2]2.

ori_sentence: Dwarfism occurs when an organism is exceptionally small.
simple_sent: Dwarfism is when a person or animal is very small.

ori_sentence: Vitamin deficiency is the condition of a long-term lack of a vitamin.
simple_sent: A vitamin deficiency is when a person does not get enough vitamins.

ori_sentence: Chest pain is pain or discomfort in the chest, typically the front of the chest.
simple_sent: Chest pain is a pain in the chest. Usually, it is felt in the front.

ori_sentence: Muscle contraction is the activation of tension-generating sites within muscle cells.
simple_sent: Muscle contraction is when muscle cells make more tension than they should.

ori_sentence: Trigeminal neuralgia (TN or TGN) is a long-term pain disorder that affects the trigeminal nerve, the nerve responsible for sensation in the face and motor functions such as biting and chewing.
simple_sent: Trigeminal neuralgia is a long-term pain disorder that affects the trigeminal nerve. The trigeminal nerve is the nerve that gives the human face its sensation of pain.

ori_sentence: Maprotiline, sold under the brand name Ludiomil among others, is a tetracyclic antidepressant (TeCA) that is used in the treatment of depression.
simple_sent: Maprotiline (also known as Ludiomil) is a drug that is used to treat depression. It is sold under the brand name Ludiomil.

ori_sentence: Clemastine, also known as meclastin, is a first-generation H1 histamine antagonist (antihistamine) with anticholinergic properties (drying) and sedative side effects.
simple_sent: Clemastine, also known as meclastin, is a first-generation H1 histamine antagonist (antihistamine). It also has a sedative and drying effect when taken by itself.

ori_sentence: Exemestane, sold under the brand name Aromasin among others, is a medication used to treat breast cancer.
simple_sent: Exemestane (also known as Aromasin) is a drug. It is used to treat breast cancer.

ori_sentence: The femur (/ˈfiːmər/, pl. femurs or femora /ˈfɛmərə/), or thigh bone, is the proximal bone of the hindlimb in tetrapod vertebrates.
simple_sent: The femur (plural: femurs) is the lowest bone in the human body. It is also called the thigh bone or femur.

ori_sentence: Thalassemias are inherited blood disorders characterized by decreased hemoglobin production.
simple_sent: Thalassemias are inherited blood disorders. They cause reduced production of hemoglobin.

ori_sentence: The cecum or caecum is a pouch within the peritoneum that is considered to be the beginning of the large intestine.
simple_sent: The cecum or caecum is a small pouch inside the body. It is the beginning of the large intestine, called the peritoneum.

ori_sentence: The pharynx (plural: pharynges) is the part of the throat behind the mouth and nasal cavity, and above the oesophagus and trachea (the tubes going down to the stomach and the lungs).
simple_sent: The pharynx is the part of the throat that is behind the mouth and nasal cavity. It is above the trachea and oesophagus, and below the stomach and lungs.

ori_sentence: Phenylketonuria (PKU) is an inborn error of metabolism that results in decreased metabolism of the amino acid phenylalanine.
simple_sent: Phenylketonuria (PKU) is a disease. In it, the body does not use the amino acid phenylalanine as it should.

ori_sentence: Vomiting (also known as emesis and throwing up) is the involuntary, forceful expulsion of the contents of one's stomach through the mouth and sometimes the nose.
simple_sent: Vomiting (also known as emesis and throwing up) is when the stomach contents are pushed out of the body through the mouth or nose.

simple_sent: Ziehl -

ori_sentence: 17α-Hydroxyprogesterone (17α-OHP), also known as 17-OH progesterone (17-OHP), or hydroxyprogesterone (OHP), is an endogenous progestogen steroid hormone related to progesterone.
simple_sent: 17α-Hydroxyprogesterone, also known as 17-OH progesterone (17-OHP) or hydroxyprogesterone (OHP), is a progestogen hormone that helps women become pregnant.

ori_sentence: Oxcarbazepine, sold under the brand name Trileptal among others, is a medication used to treat epilepsy and bipolar disorder.
simple_sent: Oxcarbazepine (also known as Trileptal) is a medication. It is used to treat bipolar disorder and epilepsy.

ori_sentence: Antinuclear antibodies (ANAs, also known as antinuclear factor or ANF) are autoantibodies that bind to contents of the cell nucleus.
simple_sent: Antinuclear antibodies (also called antinuclear factor or ANF) are antibodies that work against a part of the cell.

ori_sentence: Cinacalcet, sold under the brand name Sensipar among others, is a medication used to treat secondary hyperparathyroidism, parathyroid carcinoma, and primary hyperparathyroidism.
simple_sent: Cinacalcet, sold under the brand name Sensipar among others, is a drug that is used to treat parathyroidism. It is also used to treat primary hyperparathyroidism.

ori_sentence: Afferent nerve fibers are the axons (nerve fibers) carried by a sensory nerve that relay sensory information from sensory receptors to regions of the brain.
simple_sent: Afferent nerve fibers are the nerve fibers that carry information from one part of the brain to another part of the brain. They are called axons.

ori_sentence: Strychnine (/ˈstrɪkniːn/ or /-nɪn/; US mainly /ˈstrɪknaɪn/) is a highly toxic, colorless, bitter, crystalline alkaloid used as a pesticide, particularly for killing small vertebrates such as birds and rodents.
simple_sent: Strychnine is a very toxic, colorless, bitter, crystalline alkaloid that is used as a pesticide. It is used to kill small animals such as birds and rodents because it is very toxic.

ori_sentence: Rheumatoid factor (RF) is the autoantibody that was first found in rheumatoid arthritis.
simple_sent: Rheumatoid factor (RF) is a protein. It is the main cause of rheumatoid arthritis.

ori_sentence: Transmissible spongiform encephalopathies (TSEs) are a group of progressive and fatal conditions that are associated with prions and affect the brain and nervous system of many animals, including humans, cattle, and sheep.
simple_sent: Transmissible spongiform encephalopathies (TSEs) are a group of diseases that usually get worse over time. They are caused by prions, and they affect the brain and nervous system of many animals.

ori_sentence: Progressive multifocal leukoencephalopathy (PML) is a rare and often fatal viral disease characterized by progressive damage (-pathy) or inflammation of the white matter (leuko-) of the brain (-encephalo-) at multiple locations (multifocal).
simple_sent: Progressive multifocal leukoencephalopathy (PML) is a rare disease. It is caused by a virus that causes damage to the white matter (leuko-) in the brain. This damage can happen at multiple locations (multifocal).

ori_sentence: Bexarotene, sold under the brand Targretin, is an antineoplastic (anti-cancer) agent approved by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) (December 1999) and the European Medicines Agency (EMA) (March 2001) for use as a treatment for cutaneous T cell lymphoma (CTCL).
simple_sent: Bexarotene (also known as Targretin) is an anti-cancer drug that is sold under the brand name Targretin by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) and by the European Medicines Agency (EMA) for the treatment of cutaneous T cell lymphoma.

ori_sentence: Cilastatin inhibits the human enzyme dehydropeptidase.
simple_sent: Cilastatin works by stopping the enzyme dehydropeptidase.

ori_sentence: Hydroquinone, also known as benzene-1,4-diol or quinol, is an aromatic organic compound that is a type of phenol, a derivative of benzene, having the chemical formula C6H4(OH)2.
simple_sent: Hydroquinone, also known as benzene-1,4-diol or quinol, is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is C6H4(OH)2. It is an aromatic organic compound.

ori_sentence: Phenacetin (acetophenetidin, N-(4-ethoxyphenyl)acetamide) is a pain-relieving and fever-reducing drug, which was widely used following its introduction in 1887.
simple_sent: Phenacetin (acetophenetidin, N-(4-ethoxyphenyl)acetamide) is a drug that helps to reduce pain and fever. It was first used in 1887.

ori_sentence: Etoposide, sold under the brand name Vepesid among others, is a chemotherapy medication used for the treatments of a number of types of cancer including testicular cancer, lung cancer, lymphoma, leukemia, neuroblastoma, and ovarian cancer.
simple_sent: Etoposide, also known as Vepesid, is a chemotherapy drug. It is used to treat certain types of cancer, such as testicular cancer, lung cancer, leukemia, and neuroblastoma. It is sold under the brand name Vepesid.

ori_sentence: In tetrapods, cervical vertebrae (singular: vertebra) are the vertebrae of the neck, immediately below the skull.
simple_sent: In tetrapods, the cervical vertebrae are the vertebrae immediately below the skull in the neck.

ori_sentence: Pulmonary heart disease, also known as cor pulmonale, is the enlargement and failure of the right ventricle of the heart as a response to increased vascular resistance (such as from pulmonic stenosis) or high blood pressure in the lungs.
simple_sent: Pulmonary heart disease, also known as cor pulmonale, is when the right ventricle of the heart becomes smaller. This happens when the blood pressure in the lungs becomes too high, or when there is too much blood in the body.

ori_sentence: In human anatomy, the wrist is variously defined as (1) the carpus or carpal bones, the complex of eight bones forming the proximal skeletal segment of the hand; (2) the wrist joint or radiocarpal joint, the joint between the radius and the carpus and; (3) the anatomical region surrounding the carpus including the distal parts of the bones of the forearm and the proximal parts of the metacarpus or five metacarpal bones and the series of joints between these bones, thus referred to as wrist joints.
simple_sent: In human anatomy, the wrist includes the carpus or carpal bones, which are eight bones in the hand. The wrist also includes the wrist joint, the joint between the radius and the carpus, and the series of joints between these bones, called the radiocarpal joint. The wrist also includes the distal parts of the bones of the forearm and the proximal parts of the metacarpus or five metacarpal bones.

ori_sentence: Unexplained infertility is infertility that is idiopathic in the sense that its cause remains unknown even after an infertility work-up, usually including semen analysis in the man and assessment of ovulation and fallopian tubes in the woman.
simple_sent: Unexplained infertility is infertility for which the cause is not known even after a doctor has looked at the man's semen and the woman's ovulation and fallopian tubes. This is called idiopathic infertility.

ori_sentence: Oxacillin (trade name Bactocill) is a narrow-spectrum beta-lactam antibiotic of the penicillin class developed by Beecham.
simple_sent: Oxacillin (also known as Bactocill) is an antibiotic. It is a beta-lactam antibiotic, like penicillin.

ori_sentence: Keloid, also known as keloid disorder and keloidal scar,is the formation of a type of scar which, depending on its maturity, is composed mainly of either type III (early) or type I (late) collagen.
simple_sent: Keloid, also known as keloid disorder and keloidal scar, is a type of scar. The type depends on the type of collagen in the scar, and how long it has been there.

ori_sentence: Anemia or anaemia (British English) is a blood disorder in which the blood has a reduced ability to deliver oxygen due to a lower than normal number of red blood cells, or a reduction in the amount of hemoglobin.
simple_sent: Anemia is when the blood does not have enough oxygen. This is because there are less red blood cells in the blood. When there are less red blood cells, there is less oxygen in the blood.

ori_sentence: Myofascial pain syndrome (MPS), also known as chronic myofascial pain (CMP), is a syndrome characterized by chronic pain in multiple myofascial trigger points ("knots") and fascial (connective tissue) constrictions.
simple_sent: Myofascial pain syndrome (MPS), also known as chronic myofascial pain (CMP), is a condition in which the pain in a part of the body (the myofascial cartilage) keeps getting worse and worse.

ori_sentence: Zieve's syndrome is an acute metabolic condition that can occur during withdrawal from prolonged heavy alcohol use.
simple_sent: Zieve's syndrome is a very bad condition. It can happen when people have been using alcohol for a long time.

ori_sentence: Nikolsky's sign is a clinical dermatological sign, named after Pyotr Nikolsky (1858–1940), a Russian physician who trained and worked in the Russian Empire.
simple_sent: The sign is named after Pyotr Nikolsky. He was a Russian doctor who worked in the Russian Empire, and he was born and died in Russia.

ori_sentence: The pisiform bone (/ˈpaɪsɪfɔːrm/ or /ˈpɪzɪfɔːrm/), also spelled pisiforme (from the Latin pisifomis, pea-shaped), is a small knobbly, sesamoid bone that is found in the wrist.
simple_sent: The pisiform bone is a small bone in the wrist. The name comes from the Latin pisifomis, meaning "pea-shaped", and pisiforme, meaning "narrow".

ori_sentence: The acetabulum /æsəˈtæbjʊləm/ (cotyloid cavity) is a concave surface of the pelvis.
simple_sent: The acetabulum is the flat surface of the pelvis. It is called acotyloid cavity.

ori_sentence: A Le Fort fracture of the skull is a classic transfacial fracture of the midface, involving the maxillary bone and surrounding structures in either a horizontal, pyramidal or transverse direction.
simple_sent: A Le Fort fracture of the skull is a major injury to the midface. The bone can be broken in either a horizontal, pyramidal or transverse direction (from side to side).

ori_sentence: The parotid gland is a major salivary gland in many animals.
simple_sent: The parotid gland is an important salivary gland.

ori_sentence: Excretion is a process in which metabolic waste is eliminated from an organism.
simple_sent: Excretion is a process where waste products are removed from an organism.

ori_sentence: Codeine is an opiate and prodrug of morphine used to treat pain, coughing, and diarrhea.
simple_sent: Codeine is used to treat pain. It is also used to treat cough and diarrhea.

ori_sentence: Pentoxyverine (rINN) or carbetapentane is an antitussive (cough suppressant) commonly used for cough associated with illnesses like common cold.
simple_sent: Pentoxyverine (rINN) or carbetapentane is a chemical compound. It is used to stop a cough, when people have a common cold.

ori_sentence: Scoliosis is a medical condition in which a person's spine has a sideways curve.
simple_sent: Scoliosis is a medical condition. It is when a person's spine looks sideways.

ori_sentence: Priapism is a condition in which a penis remains erect for hours in the absence of stimulation or after stimulation has ended.
simple_sent: Priapism is when a man's penis remains erect for hours after he has had no sex, or after he has had no sex at all.

ori_sentence: Berylliosis, or chronic beryllium disease (CBD), is a chronic allergic-type lung response and chronic lung disease caused by exposure to beryllium and its compounds, a form of beryllium poisoning.
simple_sent: Berylliosis, or chronic beryllium disease (CBD), is a disease of the lung. It is caused by a long-term exposure to beryllium and its chemical compounds.

ori_sentence: Second-degree atrioventricular block (AV block) is a disease of the electrical conduction system of the heart.
simple_sent: Second-degree atrioventricular block (AV block) is an electrical problem in the heart.

ori_sentence: Hemoglobinopathy is the medical term for a group of inherited blood disorders and diseases that primarily affect red blood cells.
simple_sent: Hemoglobinopathy is a group of diseases and disorders that all affect red blood cells. It is a medical term.

ori_sentence: Panthenol (also called pantothenol) is the alcohol analog of pantothenic acid (vitamin B5), and is thus a provitamin of B5.
simple_sent: Panthenol (also called pantothenol) is a chemical compound. It is also known as pantothenic acid or pantothenol.

ori_sentence: Pyridoxal phosphate (PLP, pyridoxal 5'-phosphate, P5P), the active form of vitamin B6, is a coenzyme in a variety of enzymatic reactions.
simple_sent: Pyridoxal phosphate, also known as pyridoxal 5'-phosphate, is a chemical compound. It is an enzyme that helps in many reactions.

ori_sentence: Duchenne muscular dystrophy (DMD) is a severe type of muscular dystrophy that primarily affects boys.
simple_sent: Duchenne muscular dystrophy (DMD) is the most common form of muscular dystrophy.

ori_sentence: Diammonium phosphate (DAP; IUPAC name diammonium hydrogen phosphate; chemical formula (NH4)2(HPO4) is one of a series of water-soluble ammonium phosphate salts that can be produced when ammonia reacts with phosphoric acid.
simple_sent: Diammonium phosphate, also known as diammonium hydrogen phosphate, is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is (NH4)2(HPO4). It has ammonium and phosphate ions in it.

ori_sentence: Pemoline is a stimulant drug of the 4-oxazolidinone class.
simple_sent: Pemoline is a chemical compound. It is a stimulant.

ori_sentence: In vertebrate anatomy, ribs (Latin: costae) are the long curved bones which form the rib cage, part of the axial skeleton.
simple_sent: In anatomy, the ribs are the long curved bones in the human body. They are called the rib cage in Latin.

ori_sentence: Haematochezia is the passage of fresh blood through the anus, usually in or with stools (contrast with melena).
simple_sent: Haematochezia is when fresh blood goes through the anus. It usually goes in or with stools.

ori_sentence: Hemotympanum or hematotympanum, refers to the presence of blood in the tympanic cavity of the middle ear.
simple_sent: Hemotympanum or hematotympanum is a blood vessel in the middle ear. It is called a tympanum.

ori_sentence: Nabilone, sold under the brand name Cesamet among others, is a synthetic cannabinoid with therapeutic use as an antiemetic and as an adjunct analgesic for neuropathic pain.
simple_sent: Nabilone is a synthetic cannabinoid. It is sold under the brand name Cesamet in the United States. Nabilone is used as an antiemetic and as an analgesic.

ori_sentence: Lassa fever, also known as Lassa hemorrhagic fever (LHF), is a type of viral hemorrhagic fever caused by the Lassa virus.
simple_sent: Lassa fever (also called Lassa hemorrhagic fever or LHF) is a disease. It is caused by the Lassa virus.

ori_sentence: Armodafinil (trade name Nuvigil) is the enantiopure compound of the eugeroic
simple_sent: Armodafinil (also known as Nuvigil) is a chemical compound.

ori_sentence: Bethanechol is a parasympathomimetic choline carbamate that selectively stimulates muscarinic receptors without any effect on nicotinic receptors.
simple_sent: Bethanechol works by selectively stimulating muscarinic receptors. It does not work as well on nicotinic receptors.

ori_sentence: Chenodeoxycholic acid (CDCA; also known as chenodesoxycholic acid, chenocholic acid and 3α,7α-dihydroxy-5β-cholan-24-oic acid) is a bile acid.
simple_sent: Chenodeoxycholic acid (CDCA) is a chemical compound. It is also known as chenodesoxycholic acid and chenocholic acid.

ori_sentence: Letrozole, sold under the brand name Femara (by Novartis) among others, is an aromatase inhibitor which is used in the treatment of hormonally-responsive breast cancer after surgery.
simple_sent: Letrozole, sold under the brand name Femara (by Novartis) among others, is an aromatase inhibitor. It is used in the treatment of breast cancer after surgery.

ori_sentence: Fenfluramine, sold under the brand name Fintepla, is a medication used for the treatment of seizures associated with Dravet syndrome in people age two and older.
simple_sent: Fenfluramine (also known as Fintepla) is a drug that is taken for the treatment of seizures. It is used to treat people with Dravet syndrome.

ori_sentence: Anastrozole, sold under the brand name Arimidex among others, is a medication used in addition to other treatments for breast cancer.
simple_sent: Anastrozole is a drug that is used to treat breast cancer. It is sold under the brand name Arimidex and other names.

ori_sentence: The anterior cecal artery (or anterior caecal artery) is a branch of the ileocolic artery which supplies the anterior region of the cecum.
simple_sent: The anterior cecal artery (or anterior caecal artery) is an artery in the human body. It goes to the front part of the cecum.

ori_sentence: A lipoma is a benign tumor made of fat tissue.
simple_sent: A lipoma is a small tumor, made of fat.

ori_sentence: Cervical intraepithelial neoplasia (CIN), also known as cervical dysplasia, is the abnormal growth of cells on the surface of the cervix that could potentially lead to cervical cancer.
simple_sent: Cervical dysplasia, also known as cervical intraepithelial neoplasia (CIN), is when the cells on the outside of the cervix do not grow like they should.

ori_sentence: Hypernatremia, also spelled hypernatraemia, is a high concentration of sodium in the blood.
simple_sent: Hypernatremia is when the blood has too much sodium. It is also called hypernatraemia.

ori_sentence: Dialysis disequilibrium syndrome (DDS) is the collection of neurological signs and symptoms, attributed to cerebral edema, during or following shortly after intermittent hemodialysis or CRRT.
simple_sent: Dialysis disequilibrium syndrome (DDS) is a collection of neurological signs and symptoms. It usually happens after hemodialysis or CRRT, but it can also happen before or after.

ori_sentence: Relapsing fever is a vector-borne disease caused by infection with certain bacteria in the genus Borrelia, which is transmitted through the bites of lice or soft-bodied ticks (genus Ornithodoros).
simple_sent: It is caused by certain bacteria in the genus Borrelia. These bacteria are spread through the bites of lice or soft-bodied ticks (genus Ornithodoros).

ori_sentence: Superior mesenteric artery (SMA) syndrome is a gastro-vascular disorder in which the third and final portion of the duodenum is compressed between the abdominal aorta (AA) and the overlying superior mesenteric artery.
simple_sent: Superior mesenteric artery syndrome (SMA) is a medical condition. In it, the third and final part of the duodenum is compressed between the superior mesenteric artery and the abdominal aorta.

ori_sentence: The appendicular artery, also known as appendiceal artery, commonly arises from the terminal branch of the ileocolic artery, or less commonly from the posterior cecal artery or an ileal artery.
simple_sent: The appendicular artery is an artery in the human body. It comes from the ileal artery (just below the knee) or from the posterior cecal artery (just above the knee).

ori_sentence: A breast cyst is a fluid-filled sac within the breast.
simple_sent: A breast cyst is a large fluid sac in the breast.

ori_sentence: Ramsay Hunt syndrome type 2, also known as RHS and herpes zoster oticus, is a disorder that is caused by the reactivation of varicella zoster virus in the geniculate ganglion, a nerve cell bundle of the facial nerve.
simple_sent: Ramsay Hunt syndrome type 2 (also known as RHS and herpes zoster oticus) is a disease. It is caused by a virus (varicella zoster) that infects the geniculate ganglion of the facial nerve.

ori_sentence: Flurazepam (marketed under the brand names Dalmane and Dalmadorm) is a drug which is a benzodiazepine derivative.
simple_sent: Flurazepam (also known as Dalmane and Dalmadorm) is a drug. It is a kind of benzodiazepine.

ori_sentence: A Sertoli cell (a kind of sustentacular cell) is a "nurse" cell of the testicles that is part of a seminiferous tubule and helps in the process of spermatogenesis, the production of sperm.
simple_sent: A Sertoli cell is a cell in the testicles. It is part of the seminiferous tubule (a part of the testicles where sperm are made). It helps in making sperm.

ori_sentence: The caudate nucleus is one of the structures that make up the corpus striatum, which is a component of the basal ganglia.
simple_sent: The caudate nucleus is a part of the basal ganglia. It is part of the corpus striatum in the brain.

ori_sentence: Persecutory delusions are a set of delusional conditions in which the affected persons believe they are being persecuted, despite a lack of evidence.
simple_sent: Persecutory delusions are a type of mental illness. In these cases, the person thinks that they are being persecuted, even if there is no evidence.

ori_sentence: Anterior spinal artery syndrome (also known as "anterior spinal cord syndrome") is syndrome caused by ischemia of the anterior spinal artery, resulting in loss of function of the anterior two-thirds of the spinal cord.
simple_sent: Anterior spinal artery syndrome (also known as anterior spinal cord syndrome) is a medical condition. In it, the anterior two-thirds of the spinal cord (the part near the top of the head) is damaged.

ori_sentence: The posterior cecal artery (or posterior caecal artery) is a branch of the ileocolic artery.
simple_sent: The posterior cecal artery is an important artery in the human body.

ori_sentence: The middle colic artery is an artery of the abdomen.
simple_sent: The middle colic artery is an important artery.

ori_sentence: The right colic artery is an artery of the abdomen.
simple_sent: The right colic artery is an important artery.

ori_sentence: High-altitude pulmonary edema (HAPE) is a life-threatening form of non-cardiogenic pulmonary edema that occurs in otherwise healthy people at altitudes typically above 2,500 meters (8,200 ft).
simple_sent: High-altitude pulmonary edema (HAPE) is a life-threatening form of pulmonary edema. In otherwise healthy people at altitudes above 2,500 meters (8,200 ft) it can be very dangerous.

ori_sentence: Dopamine-responsive dystonia (DRD) also known as Segawa syndrome (SS), is a genetic movement disorder which usually manifests itself during early childhood at around ages 5–8 years (variable start age).
simple_sent: Dopamine-responsive dystonia (DRD), also known as Segawa syndrome (SS), is a genetic movement disorder. People who have this disorder are usually between the ages of 5 and 8.

ori_sentence: A pancreatic pseudocyst is a circumscribed collection of fluid rich in pancreatic enzymes, blood, and , typically located in the lesser sac of the abdomen.
simple_sent: A pancreatic pseudocyst is a small amount of fluid in the abdomen. This fluid has pancreatic enzymes, blood, and other things in it.

ori_sentence: Haemobilia is a medical condition of bleeding into the biliary tree.
simple_sent: Haemobilia is a disease. It causes bleeding in the biliary tree.

ori_sentence: Hemarthrosis is a bleeding into joint spaces.
simple_sent: Hemarthrosis is a joint disease.

ori_sentence: Zidovudine (ZDV), also known as azidothymidine (AZT), is an antiretroviral medication used to prevent and treat HIV/AIDS.
simple_sent: Zidovudine (also known as azidothymidine, ZDV or AZT) is a drug. It is used to treat HIV/AIDS.

ori_sentence: Pia mater (/ˈpaɪ.ə ˈmeɪtər/ or /ˈpiːə ˈmɑːtər/), often referred to as simply the pia, is the delicate innermost layer of the meninges, the membranes surrounding the brain and spinal cord.
simple_sent: The pia mater is the innermost layer of the meninges. The meninges are the membranes that surround the brain and spinal cord. The pia mater is often called simply the pia.

ori_sentence: Alendronic acid, sold under the brand name Fosamax among others, is a bisphosphonate medication used to treat osteoporosis and Paget's disease of bone.
simple_sent: Alendronic acid, also known as Fosamax, is a bisphosphonate drug. It is used to treat osteoporosis and other bone diseases.

ori_sentence: Jacobsen syndrome is a rare chromosomal disorder resulting from deletion of genes from chromosome 11 that includes band 11q24.1.
simple_sent: Jacobsen syndrome is a rare disease. It happens when genes on the 11th chromosome (band 11q24) are changed.

ori_sentence: In immunology, the Arthus reaction (/ˌɑːrˈtjuːs/) is a type of local type III hypersensitivity reaction.
simple_sent: In immunology, the Arthus reaction is a local hypersensitivity reaction. It is also called Arthus syndrome.

ori_sentence: The pelvis (plural pelves or pelvises) is the lower part of the trunk, between the abdomen and the thighs (sometimes also called pelvic region), together with its embedded skeleton (sometimes also called bony pelvis, or pelvic skeleton).
simple_sent: The pelvis (plural pelves or pelvises) is the lower part of the body. It is between the abdomen and the thighs. In humans, the pelvis is the lower part of the body between the abdomen and the thighs.

ori_sentence: Id reactions (also known as "disseminated eczema," and "generalized eczema") are types of acute dermatitis developing after days or weeks at skin locations distant from the initial inflammatory or infectious site.
simple_sent: Id reactions (also known as "disseminated eczema," and "generalized eczema") occur after days or weeks at skin locations that did not cause the first type of eczema.

ori_sentence: An osteoma (plural: "osteomata") is a new piece of bone usually growing on another piece of bone, typically the skull.
simple_sent: An osteoma (plural osteomata) is a new piece of bone. It usually grows on top of another piece of bone, the skull.

ori_sentence: Aquagenic urticaria, also known as water allergy and water urticaria, is a rare form of physical urticaria in which hives develop on the skin after contact with water, regardless of its temperature.
simple_sent: Aquagenic urticaria, also known as water allergy and water urticaria, is a rare form of urticaria. The hives do not appear on the skin when the water is at a normal temperature.

ori_sentence: Shoulder impingement syndrome is a syndrome involving tendonitis (inflammation of tendons) of the rotator cuff muscles as they pass through the subacromial space, the passage beneath the acromion.
simple_sent: Shoulder impingement syndrome is a condition where the muscles in the shoulder become inflamed. It usually happens when the muscles in the shoulder pass through a space called the subacromial space.

ori_sentence: Bretylium (also bretylium tosylate) is an antiarrhythmic agent.
simple_sent: Brietlium is a chemical element. Its chemical formula is bretylium.

ori_sentence: Sulfasalazine (SSZ), sold under the trade name Azulfidine among others, is a medication used to treat rheumatoid arthritis, ulcerative colitis, and Crohn's disease.
simple_sent: Sulfasalazine (also known as Azulfidine) is a prescription drug. It is used to treat rheumatoid arthritis, ulcerative colitis, and Crohn's disease.

ori_sentence: Freiberg disease, also known as a Freiberg infraction, is a form of avascular necrosis in the metatarsal bone of the foot.
simple_sent: Freiberg disease is a disease. It is caused by damage to the metatarsal bone in the foot, called Freiberg disease.

ori_sentence: Varicose veins, also known as varicoses, are a medical condition in which superficial veins become enlarged and twisted.
simple_sent: Varicose veins (also called varicoses) are veins that are too big for their own good. They become twisted.

ori_sentence: Amiloride, sold under the trade name Midamor among others, is a medication typically used with other medications to treat high blood pressure or swelling due to heart failure or cirrhosis of the liver.
simple_sent: Amiloride (also known as Midamor) is a drug that is used to treat high blood pressure. It can also be used to treat heart failure or cirrhosis of the liver.

ori_sentence: Hypoglycemia, also known as low blood sugar, is a fall in blood sugar to levels below normal.
simple_sent: Hypoglycemia (also called low blood sugar) is when your blood sugar is lower than normal.

ori_sentence: Bardet–Biedl syndrome (BBS) is a ciliopathic human genetic disorder that produces many effects and affects many body systems.
simple_sent: Bardet-Biedl syndrome (BBS) is a human genetic disorder. People who have it have many different effects.

ori_sentence: Obesity hypoventilation syndrome (OHS) is a condition in which severely overweight people fail to breathe rapidly or deeply enough, resulting in low oxygen levels and high blood carbon dioxide (CO2) levels.
simple_sent: Obesity hypoventilation syndrome (OHS) is a condition in which people who are very overweight can not breathe quickly or deeply enough. This makes their blood have low oxygen levels.

ori_sentence: Diethyl ether, or simply ether, is an organic compound in the ether class with the formula (C2H5)2O, sometimes abbreviated as Et2O (see Pseudoelement symbols).
simple_sent: Diethyl ether, also known as ether, is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is (C2H5)2O. Its chemical formula is Et2O.

ori_sentence: Acrocyanosis is persistent blue or cyanotic discoloration of the extremities, most commonly occurring in the hands, although it also occurs in the feet and distal parts of face.
simple_sent: Acrocyanosis is when the skin becomes blue or cyanotic color. It usually happens in the hands and feet, but it can also happen in other parts of the body.

ori_sentence: Microalbuminuria is a term to describe a moderate increase in the level of urine albumin.
simple_sent: Microalbuminuria is when the level of albumin in the urine is a little bit higher.

ori_sentence: Ideomotor Apraxia, often IMA, is a neurological disorder characterized by the inability to correctly imitate hand gestures and voluntarily mime tool use, e.g. pretend to brush one's hair.
simple_sent: Ideomotor Apraxia, often IMA, is a neurological disorder. People with it can not make hand gestures or use tools properly. They can not even brush their own hair.

ori_sentence: Phytophotodermatitis, also known as berloque dermatitis or margarita photodermatitis, is a cutaneous phototoxic inflammatory reaction resulting from contact with a light-sensitizing botanical agent followed by exposure to ultraviolet light (from the sun, for instance).
simple_sent: Phytophotodermatitis, also known as berloque dermatitis or margarita photodermatitis, is an infection of the skin. It is caused by contact with a light-sensitizing agent, such as a plant, or by exposure to ultraviolet light.

ori_sentence: Transverse myelitis (TM) is a rare neurological condition in which the spinal cord is inflamed.
simple_sent: Transverse myelitis is a very rare disease. In it, the spinal cord becomes very inflamed.

ori_sentence: The proximal radioulnar joint (superior radioulnar joint) is a synovial pivot joint between the circumference of the head of the radius and the ring formed by the radial notch of the ulna and the annular ligament.
simple_sent: The radioulnar joint (also called superior radioulnar joint) is a joint in the human body. It is between the ulna and the head of the radius. It is a synovial pivot joint.

ori_sentence: A tantrum, temper tantrum, meltdown, fit or hissy fit is an emotional outburst, usually associated with those in emotional distress, that is typically characterized by stubbornness, crying, screaming, violence, defiance, angry ranting, a resistance to attempts at pacification, and, in some cases, hitting and other physically violent behavior.
simple_sent: A tantrum, temper tantrum, meltdown, fit or hissy fit is an emotional outburst, usually associated with people in emotional distress. People who have a tantrum often do things like crying, screaming, running around, hitting, swearing, and sometimes they do things that are physically violent.

ori_sentence: Tarlov cysts, are type II innervated meningeal cysts, cerebrospinal-fluid-filled (CSF) sacs most frequently located in the spinal canal of the sacral region of the spinal cord (S1–S5) and much less often in the cervical, thoracic or lumbar spine.
simple_sent: Tarlov cysts, are type II innervated meningeal cysts, cerebrospinal-fluid-filled (CSF) sacs in the spinal canal of the spinal cord (S1-S5) and much less often in the cervical, thoracic or lumbar spinal canal (S1-S5).

simple_sent: A hemostat (also called a hemostatic clamp, arterial forceps, or pean after Jules-Émile Péan) is a tool that is used to control bleeding during surgery.

simple_sent: Deferoxamine (also known as desferrioxamine) is a chemical compound. It is also known as Desferal.

ori_sentence: Arthrofibrosis (from Greek: arthro- joint, fibrosis - scar tissue formation) has been described in most joints like knee, hip, ankle, foot joints, shoulder (frozen shoulder, adhesive capsulitis), elbow (stiff elbow), wrist, hand joints as well as spinal vertebrae.

simple_sent: The adrenal glands (also known as suprarenal glands) are glands in the human body. They produce many different hormones, including adrenaline and cortisol.

simple_sent: Alfentanil (also known as Alfenta and Rapifen in Australia) is a synthetic opioid. It is a very powerful and short-acting drug.

ori_sentence: Ponatinib (trade name Iclusig /aɪˈkluːsɪɡ/ eye-KLOO-sig, previously AP24534) is an oral drug developed by ARIAD Pharmaceuticals for the treatment of chronic myeloid leukemia (CML) and Philadelphia chromosome–positive (Ph+) acute lymphoblastic leukemia (ALL).
simple_sent: Ponatinib (trade name Iclusig; formerly AP24534) is a drug that is taken orally. It is used to treat patients with chronic myeloid leukemia (CML) and Philadelphia chromosome-positive acute lymphoblastic leukemia (ALL).

ori_sentence: The Koebner phenomenon or Köbner phenomenon (UK: /ˈkɜːbnər/, US: /ˈkɛb-/), also called the Koebner response or the isomorphic response, attributed to Heinrich Köbner, is the appearance of skin lesions on lines of trauma.
simple_sent: The Koebner phenomenon or Köbner phenomenon (also called the Koebner response or the isomorphic response) is a phenomenon. Heinrich Köbner wrote about it in the 1920s, and it is well-known today.

ori_sentence: Amlexanox (trade name Aphthasol) is an anti-inflammatory antiallergic immunomodulator used to treat recurrent aphthous ulcers (canker sores), and (in Japan) several inflammatory conditions.
simple_sent: Amlexanox (trade name Aphthasol) is an anti-inflammatory immunomodulator. It is used to treat several inflammatory conditions, including canker sores and recurrent aphthous ulcers.

simple_sent: Rifabutin is an antibiotic. It is used to treat people with tuberculosis and other diseases.

simple_sent: Interstitial cystitis (IC) is a chronic pain in the bladder. It can also be called bladder pain syndrome.

simple_sent: Iopanoic acid is a chemical compound. It is used in cholecystography.

ori_sentence: A stye, also known as a hordeolum, is a bacterial infection of an oil gland in the eyelid.
simple_sent: A stye (also called hordeolum) is an infection of the eyelid. It is caused by bacteria.

simple_sent: Phenol red (also known as phenolsulfonphthalein or PSP) is a chemical that changes the color of water.

simple_sent: Tranexamic acid (TXA) is a medication. It is used to prevent or treat excessive blood loss from major trauma, surgery, heavy menstruation, and postpartum bleeding.

simple_sent: Ceftibuten is an antibiotic drug. It is an antibiotic.

simple_sent: Pyridostigmine is a medication. It is used to treat myasthenia gravis.

simple_sent: Drospirenone is a progestin medication. It is used to prevent pregnancy. It is also used to treat some forms of menopause.

ori_sentence: The right gastroepiploic artery (or right gastro-omental artery) is one of the two terminal branches of the gastroduodenal artery.
simple_sent: The right gastroepiploic artery (or right gastro-omental artery) is an important blood vessel in the human body.

ori_sentence: A motor neuron (or motoneuron or efferent neuron) is a neuron whose cell body is located in the motor cortex, brainstem or the spinal cord, and whose axon (fiber) projects to the spinal cord or outside of the spinal cord to directly or indirectly control effector organs, mainly muscles and glands.
simple_sent: A motor neuron (or motoneuron or efferent neuron) is a type of neuron. Its cell body is in the motor cortex of the brain, and its axon (fiber) is in the spinal cord. The function of a motor neuron is to control muscles and glands in the spinal cord.

ori_sentence: Intrauterine growth restriction (IUGR), or fetal growth restriction, refers to poor growth of a fetus while in the womb during pregnancy.
simple_sent: Intrauterine growth restriction (IUGR) is when a fetus does not grow as much as it should during pregnancy. This is called fetal growth restriction.

simple_sent: Procarbazine is a drug that is used to treat cancer. It is used to treat Hodgkin's lymphoma.

ori_sentence: Digestive enzymes are a group of enzymes that break down polymeric macromolecules into their smaller building blocks, in order to facilitate their absorption by the body.
simple_sent: Digestive enzymes are enzymes that help the body to break down things into smaller pieces. They do this so that the food can be taken in better by the body.

simple_sent: Sodium selenate is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is Na2SeO4. It has sodium and selenate ions in it.

simple_sent: Amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS), also known as motor neurone disease (MND) or Lou Gehrig's disease, is a disease that causes the brain to lose the ability to use its muscles.

ori_sentence: In human anatomy, the inferior mesenteric artery, often abbreviated as IMA, is the third main branch of the abdominal aorta and arises at the level of L3, supplying the large intestine from the distal transverse colon to the upper part of the anal canal.
simple_sent: In human anatomy, the inferior mesenteric artery (or IMA) is the third main branch of the abdominal aorta. It comes up from the left side of the large intestine, past the colon, and into the upper part of the anal canal.

simple_sent: Lymphogranuloma venereum (LGV), also known as climatic bubo, poradenitis inguinale, lymphogranuloma inguinale, and strumous bubo, is a sexually transmitted disease. It is caused by Chlamydia trachomatis.

simple_sent: Costello syndrome (also called faciocutaneoskeletal syndrome or FCS syndrome) is a rare disease. People who have it are very sick.

ori_sentence: The median sacral artery (or middle sacral artery) is a small artery that arises posterior to the abdominal aorta and superior to its bifurcation.

simple_sent: Tetrasodium pyrophosphate, also known as sodium pyrophosphate, is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is TSPP.

ori_sentence: Pirenzepine (Gastrozepin), an M1 selective antagonist, is used in the treatment of peptic ulcers, as it reduces gastric acid secretion and reduces muscle spasm.

ori_sentence: Invasive carcinoma of no special type (NST) also known as invasive ductal carcinoma or ductal NOS and previously known as invasive ductal carcinoma, not otherwise specified (NOS) is a group of breast cancers that do not have the "specific differentiating features".
simple_sent: Invasive carcinoma of no special type (NST), also known as invasive ductal carcinoma or ductal NOS, is a cancer of the breast. It is different from most other breast cancers because it does not have certain features that other breast cancers have.

ori_sentence: The anterior inferior cerebellar artery (AICA) is one of three pairs of arteries that supplies blood to the cerebellum.
simple_sent: The anterior inferior cerebellar artery (AICA) is a blood vessel in the central nervous system.

simple_sent: The common hepatic artery is a small blood vessel. It goes from the stomach to the liver. It gives blood to the liver and to the pancreas.

ori_sentence: The right gastric artery arises, in most cases (53% of cases), from the proper hepatic artery, descends to the pyloric end of the stomach, and passes from right to left along its lesser curvature, supplying it with branches, and anastomosing with the left gastric artery.
simple_sent: The right gastric artery comes from the proper hepatic artery and goes down to the pyloric end of the stomach. It has branches that go from right to left, and it connects the right gastric artery to the left gastric artery.

ori_sentence: Amoxicillin is an antibiotic used to treat a number of bacterial infections.
simple_sent: Amoxicillin is an antibiotic. It is used to treat certain infections.

ori_sentence: A nosebleed, also known as epistaxis, is bleeding from the nose.
simple_sent: A nosebleed is bleeding from the nose. It is also called epistaxis.
