simple_sent: Tamsulosin (also known as Flomax) is a drug that is used to treat benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and chronic prostatitis. It is also used to help with the passage of kidney stones.

ori_sentence: A genetic disorder is a health problem caused by one or more abnormalities in the genome.
simple_sent: A genetic disorder is a health problem where one or more parts of the genome are wrong.

ori_sentence: Fructose malabsorption, formerly named dietary fructose intolerance (DFI), is a digestive disorder in which absorption of fructose is impaired by deficient fructose carriers in the small intestine's enterocytes.
simple_sent: Fructose malabsorption is a disease. It used to be called dietary fructose intolerance (DFI), but now it is called fructose malabsorption because the body can not take in the fructose.

ori_sentence: Liver tumors (also known as hepatic tumors) are abnormal growth of liver cells on or in the liver.
simple_sent: Liver tumors are cancer of the liver. They are also called hepatic tumors.

ori_sentence: Focal seizures (also called partial seizures and localized seizures) are seizures which affect initially only one hemisphere of the brain.
simple_sent: Focal seizures (also called partial seizures and localized seizures) happen when a person's brain has a problem with one side.

ori_sentence: Spinal disc herniation is an injury to the cushioning and connective tissue between vertebrae, usually caused by excessive strain or trauma to the spine.
simple_sent: Spinal disc herniation is an injury to a part of the spine. The injury usually happens when a person puts too much pressure on their spine.

ori_sentence: Cornelia de Lange syndrome (CdLS) is a genetic disorder.
simple_sent: Cornelia de Lange syndrome is a very rare disease.

ori_sentence: Trendelenburg's sign is found in people with weak or paralyzed abductor muscles of the hip, namely gluteus medius and gluteus minimus.
simple_sent: People with Trendelenburg's disease have weak or paralyzed muscles in their hip. These muscles are the gluteus medius and gluteus minimus.

ori_sentence: Olanzapine, sold under the trade name Zyprexa among others, is an atypical antipsychotic primarily used to treat schizophrenia and bipolar disorder.
simple_sent: Olanzapine (also known as Zyprexa) is an atypical antipsychotic drug. It is used to treat schizophrenia and bipolar disorder.

ori_sentence: Lyme disease, also known as Lyme borreliosis, is a vector-borne disease caused by the Borrelia bacterium which is spread by ticks in the genus Ixodes.
simple_sent: Lyme disease (also called Lyme borreliosis) is a disease. It is caused by a bacterium called Borrelia, and is spread by ticks.

ori_sentence: Chlorphenamine (CP, CPM), also known as chlorpheniramine, is an antihistamine used to treat the symptoms of allergic conditions such as allergic rhinitis (hay fever).
simple_sent: Chlorphenamine (CP, CPM), also known as chlorpheniramine, is a chemical compound. It is an antihistamine that helps to treat allergies.

ori_sentence: Lacosamide, sold under the brand name Vimpat among others, is a medication used in the adjunctive treatment of partial-onset seizures and diabetic neuropathic pain.
simple_sent: Lacosamide, sold under the brand name Vimpat among others, is a medication that is used to treat diabetic neuropathic pain and partial-onset seizures.

ori_sentence: Famciclovir is a guanosine analogue antiviral drug used for the treatment of various herpesvirus infections, most commonly for herpes zoster (shingles).
simple_sent: Famciclovir is an antiviral drug. It is used to treat different types of herpes. It is most commonly used to treat herpes zoster (shingles).

ori_sentence: A pulmonary artery is an artery in the pulmonary circulation that carries deoxygenated blood from the right side of the heart to the lungs.
simple_sent: A pulmonary artery is an artery in the heart. It carries blood from the right side of the heart to the lungs, where it is oxygenated.

ori_sentence: Rivaroxaban, sold under the brand name Xarelto among others, is an anticoagulant medication (blood thinner) used to treat and prevent blood clots.
simple_sent: Rivaroxaban (also known as Xarelto) is a blood thinner. It is used to help prevent blood clots and to treat certain diseases.

ori_sentence: Pica is the eating or craving of things that are not food.
simple_sent: Pica is when people eat things that are not food.

ori_sentence: Agenesis of the corpus callosum (ACC) is a rare birth defect in which there is a complete or partial absence of the corpus callosum.
simple_sent: Agenesis of the corpus callosum is a birth defect. In this case, the human body does not have the corpus callosum.

ori_sentence: Dipyridamole (trademarked as Persantine and others) is a nucleoside transport inhibitor and a PDE3 inhibitor medication that inhibits blood clot formation when given chronically and causes blood vessel dilation when given at high doses over a short time.
simple_sent: Dipyridamole (trademarked as Persantine and others) is a nucleoside transport inhibitor and a PDE3 inhibitor medication. When taken at high doses over a short time, it causes blood vessel dilation and can stop a blood clot.

ori_sentence: Delusional disorder is a mental illness in which a person has delusions, but with no accompanying prominent hallucinations, thought disorder, mood disorder, or significant flattening of affect.
simple_sent: Delusional disorder is a mental illness. In it, the person has delusions, but they do not have the other symptoms of the disease, like hallucinations or bad moods.

ori_sentence: Staphylococcal scalded skin syndrome (SSSS) is a dermatological condition caused by Staphylococcus aureus.
simple_sent: Staphylococcal scalded skin syndrome (SSSS) is a disease. It is caused by Staphylococcus aureus.

ori_sentence: Selenium disulfide, also known as selenium sulfide, is a chemical compound and medication used to treat pityriasis versicolor, seborrhoeic dermatitis, and dandruff.
simple_sent: Selenium disulfide, also known as selenium sulfide, is a chemical compound. It is a chemical compound that contains selenium and sulfide ions.

ori_sentence: Zinc chloride is the name of chemical compounds with the formula ZnCl2 and its hydrates.
simple_sent: Zinc chloride is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is ZnCl2.

ori_sentence: Kraurosis vulvae is a cutaneous condition characterized by atrophy and shrinkage of the skin of the vagina and vulva often accompanied by a chronic inflammatory reaction in the deeper tissues.
simple_sent: Kraurosis vulvae is a condition where the skin of the vagina and vulva becomes smaller and smaller. This happens because of an inflammatory reaction in the deeper tissues.

ori_sentence: Capecitabine, sold under the brand name Xeloda among others, is a chemotherapy medication used to treat breast cancer, gastric cancer and colorectal cancer.
simple_sent: Capecitabine (also known as Xeloda) is a chemotherapy drug. It is used to treat breast cancer, colorectal cancer, and gastric cancer.

ori_sentence: Vinpocetine (ethyl apovincaminate) is a synthetic derivative of the vinca alkaloid vincamine.
simple_sent: Vinpocetine is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula isethyl apovincaminate.

ori_sentence: Neurocytoma is a type of nervous system benign tumor which is primarily derived from nervous tissue.
simple_sent: Neurocytoma is a benign tumor of the nervous system. Most of them come from nervous tissue.

ori_sentence: The mesentery is an organ that attaches the intestines to the posterior abdominal wall in humans and is formed by the double fold of peritoneum.
simple_sent: The mesentery attaches the intestines to the abdominal wall. In humans, the double fold of peritoneum forms the mesentery.

ori_sentence: Dabigatran, sold under the brand name Pradaxa among others, is an anticoagulant used to treat and prevent blood clots and to prevent stroke in people with atrial fibrillation.
simple_sent: Dabigatran (also known as Pradaxa) is an anticoagulant. It is used to prevent blood clots. It is also used to prevent a stroke in people with atrial fibrillation.

ori_sentence: A pneumothorax is an abnormal collection of air in the pleural space between the lung and the chest wall.
simple_sent: A pneumothorax is an abnormally large amount of air in the space between the lung and the chest wall.

ori_sentence: Methylchloroisothiazolinone, also referred to as MCI, is the organic compound with the formula S(C2HCl)C(O)N(CH3).
simple_sent: Methylchloroisothiazolinone is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is S(C2HCl)C(O)N(CH3).

ori_sentence: The fundus of the eye is the interior surface of the eye opposite the lens and includes the retina, optic disc, macula, fovea, and posterior pole.
simple_sent: The fundus of the eye is the inside surface of the eye. It is where the retina and optic disc are. The fundus is opposite the lens.

ori_sentence: In pathology, a Councilman body, also known as Councilman hyaline body or apoptotic body, is an acidophilic (eosinophilic / pink-staining on H&E) globule of cells that represents a dying hepatocyte often surrounded by normal parenchyma.
simple_sent: In pathology, a Councilman body, also known as Councilman hyaline body or apoptotic body, is a small, pink-staining globule of cells in the body of a dead hepatocyte. It is often surrounded by normal parenchyma.

ori_sentence: Onchocerciasis, also known as river blindness, is a disease caused by infection with the parasitic worm Onchocerca volvulus.
simple_sent: Onchocerciasis (also called river blindness) is a disease. It is caused by a worm called Onchocerca volvulus.

ori_sentence: Acute inhalation injury may result from frequent and widespread use of household cleaning agents and industrial gases (including chlorine and ammonia).
simple_sent: Acute inhalation injury may happen because cleaning agents and industrial gases are used too often. This includes chlorine and ammonia.

ori_sentence: Ustekinumab, sold under the brand name Stelara®, is a monoclonal antibody medication developed by Janssen Pharmaceuticals, for the treatment of Crohn's disease, ulcerative colitis, plaque psoriasis and psoriatic arthritis, targeting both
simple_sent: Ustekinumab, also known as Stelara, is a monoclonal antibody drug that is used to treat psoriasis, ulcerative colitis and psoriatic arthritis. It is sold under the brand name Stelara by Janssen Pharmaceuticals.

ori_sentence: The Multiple Sleep Latency Test (MSLT) is a sleep disorder diagnostic tool.
simple_sent: The Multiple Sleep Latency Test (MSLT) is a test to find out if you sleep.

ori_sentence: A scar is an area of fibrous tissue that replaces normal skin after an injury.
simple_sent: A scar is an area of skin after an injury. It is made of special tissue.

ori_sentence: Inoculation is a set of methods of artificially inducing immunity against various infectious diseases.
simple_sent: Inoculation is a way to make people immune against diseases by making them not sick.

ori_sentence: Ziprasidone, sold under the brand name Geodon among others, is an atypical antipsychotic used to treat schizophrenia and bipolar disorder.
simple_sent: Ziprasidone (also known as Geodon) is an atypical antipsychotic drug. It is used to treat schizophrenia and bipolar disorder.

ori_sentence: Oculomotor nerve palsy or oculomotor neuropathy is an eye condition resulting from damage to the third cranial nerve or a branch thereof.
simple_sent: Oculomotor nerve palsy or oculomotor neuropathy is a disease of the eye. It happens when the third cranial nerve is damaged.

ori_sentence: Bell's palsy is a type of facial paralysis that results in a temporary inability to control the facial muscles on the affected side of the face.
simple_sent: Bell's palsy is a type of paralysis of the face. When this happens, the facial muscles on one side of the face are not able to do anything.

ori_sentence: Wheat germ oil is extracted from the germ of the wheat kernel, which makes up only 2.5% by weight of the kernel Wheat germ oil is particularly high in octacosanol - a 28-carbon long-chain saturated primary alcohol found in a number of different vegetable waxes.
simple_sent: Wheat germ oil is extracted from the germ of the wheat kernel, which makes up only 2.5% by weight of the kernel. Octacosanol, a 28-carbon long-chain saturated primary alcohol found in many vegetable waxes, is found in wheat germ oil.

ori_sentence: Lapatinib (INN), used in the form of lapatinib ditosylate (USAN) (trade names Tykerb and Tyverb marketed by Novartis) is an orally active drug for breast cancer and other solid tumours.
simple_sent: Lapatinib (also known as lapatinib ditosylate, Tykerb, and Tyverb) is a drug that is used to treat breast cancer. It is used in the United States by Novartis.

ori_sentence: An accessory auricle is considered a developmental anomaly resulting from the persistence of a structure which variably recapitulates the normal external ear.
simple_sent: An accessory auricle is considered a developmental anomaly because the normal external ear structure is not the same all the time.

ori_sentence: Microcoria is a congenital disease in which the pupils of the subject are narrower than 2 mm in diameter.
simple_sent: Microcoria is a disease. In this case, the pupils are smaller than 2 mm in diameter.

ori_sentence: Cervical ectropion is a condition in which the cells from the 'inside' of the cervical canal, known as glandular cells (or columnar epithelium), are present on the 'outside' of the vaginal portion of the cervix.
simple_sent: Cervical ectropion is when the cells from the 'inside' of the cervix (the part of the body that is outside the vagina) come in contact with the cells from the 'outside' of the cervix.

ori_sentence: Lomefloxacin hydrochloride (sold under the following brand names in English-speaking countries Maxaquin, Okacyn, Uniquin) is a fluoroquinolone antibiotic used to treat bacterial infections including bronchitis and urinary tract infections.
simple_sent: Lomefloxacin hydrochloride (also known as Maxaquin, Okacyn, and Uniquin in English) is a fluoroquinolone antibiotic. It is used to treat bacterial infections of the urinary tract and bronchitis.

ori_sentence: Internuclear ophthalmoplegia (INO) is a disorder of conjugate lateral gaze in which the affected eye shows impairment of adduction.
simple_sent: Internuclear ophthalmoplegia (INO) is an eye disease. It happens when the eye can not use its lateral gaze properly.

ori_sentence: Zinc pyrithione (or pyrithione zinc) is a coordination complex of zinc.
simple_sent: Zinc pyrithione is a chemical compound. It has zinc and pyrithione ions.

ori_sentence: Portal vein thrombosis (PVT) is a vascular disease of the liver that occurs when a blood clot occurs in the hepatic portal vein, which can lead to increased pressure in the portal vein system and reduced blood supply to the liver.
simple_sent: Portal vein thrombosis (PVT) is a disease of the liver. It happens when a blood clot occurs in the portal vein, which is a small blood vessel that leads to the liver.

ori_sentence: Dextroamphetamine (D-AMP) is a central nervous system (CNS) stimulant and an amphetamine enantiomer that is prescribed for the treatment of attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) and narcolepsy.
simple_sent: Dextroamphetamine (D-AMP) is a central nervous system (CNS) stimulant and an amphetamine enantiomer. It is used to treat Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD) and narcolepsy.

ori_sentence: Desflurane (1,2,2,2-tetrafluoroethyl difluoromethyl ether) is a highly fluorinated methyl ethyl ether used for maintenance of general anesthesia.
simple_sent: Desflurane is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is 1,2,2,2-tetrafluoroethyl difluoromethyl ether.

ori_sentence: Cyclandelate is a vasodilator used in the treatment of claudication, arteriosclerosis and Raynaud's disease.
simple_sent: Cyclandelate is a vasodilator. It is used to treat certain diseases, like arteriosclerosis.

ori_sentence: The medial pterygoid nerve (or internal pterygoid nerve) is a nerve of the head.
simple_sent: The medial pterygoid nerve is a brain nerve. It is located in the head.

ori_sentence: Janeway lesions are rare, non-tender, small erythematous or haemorrhagic macular, papular or nodular lesions on the palms or soles only a few millimeters in diameter that are associated with infective endocarditis and often indistinguishable from Osler's nodes.
simple_sent: Janeway lesions are rare, non-tender, small lesions on the palms or soles only a few millimeters in diameter. They are associated with infective endocarditis and often look the same as Osler's nodes, but are not the same.

ori_sentence: In cardiovascular physiology, stroke volume (SV) is the volume of blood pumped from the left ventricle per beat.
simple_sent: Stroke volume (SV) is how much blood is pumped into the left ventricle during a heart attack.

ori_sentence: An underweight person is a person whose body weight is considered too low to be healthy.
simple_sent: An underweight person is a person whose body weight is too low for their weight.

ori_sentence: Nasopharyngeal carcinoma (NPC), or nasopharynx cancer, is the most common cancer originating in the nasopharynx, most commonly in the postero-lateral nasopharynx or pharyngeal recess (fossa of Rosenmüller), accounting for 50% of cases.
simple_sent: Nasopharyngeal carcinoma (NPC), or nasopharynx cancer, is the most common cancer of the nasopharynx. About 50% of cases occur in the postero-lateral part of the nasopharynx, which is also called the back part.

ori_sentence: Fixed drug reactions, are common and so named because they recur at the same site with each exposure to a particular medication.
simple_sent: Fixed drug reactions are common. They happen at the same place every time a drug is taken, so they are called fixed drug reactions.

ori_sentence: Familial Mediterranean fever (FMF) is a hereditary inflammatory disorder.
simple_sent: Familial Mediterranean fever (FMF) is a disease from Europe.

ori_sentence: Rhombencephalosynapsis is a rare genetic brain abnormality of malformation of the cerebellum.
simple_sent: Rhombencephalosynapsis is a rare disease. It happens when the cerebellum is wrong.

ori_sentence: Paroxysmal cold hemoglobinuria (PCH) is an autoimmune hemolytic anemia featured by complement-mediated intravascular hemolysis after cold exposure.
simple_sent: Paroxysmal cold hemoglobinuria (PCH) is an autoimmune hemolytic anemia. When people are cold, their blood makes less hemoglobin.

ori_sentence: The human musculoskeletal system (also known as the human locomotor system, and previously the activity system) is an organ system that gives humans the ability to move using their muscular and skeletal systems.
simple_sent: The human musculoskeletal system (also known as the human activity system) is an organ system that gives humans the ability to move from one place to another. This is called movement.

ori_sentence: Asomatognosia is a neurological disorder characterized as loss of recognition or awareness of part of the body.
simple_sent: Asomatognosia is a neurological disorder. People who have it do not know what part of the body it is.

ori_sentence: Telmisartan, sold under the brand name Micardis among others, is a medication used to treat high blood pressure, heart failure, and diabetic kidney disease.
simple_sent: Telmisartan, also known as Micardis, is a prescription drug. It is used to treat high blood pressure, heart failure, and diabetes.

ori_sentence: Zileuton (trade name Zyflo) is an orally active inhibitor of 5-lipoxygenase, and thus inhibits leukotrienes (LTB4, LTC4, LTD4, and LTE4) formation, used for the maintenance treatment of asthma.
simple_sent: Zileuton (also known as Zyflo) is an orally active inhibitor of 5-lipoxygenase. Because of this, it is able to prevent leukotrienes (LTB4, LTC4, LTD4) from forming.

ori_sentence: Thalidomide, sold under the brand names Contergan and Thalomid among others, is a medication used to treat a number of cancers (including multiple myeloma), graft-versus-host disease, and a number of skin conditions including complications of leprosy.
simple_sent: Thalidomide, sold under the brand names Contergan and Thalomid among others, is a drug that is taken for the treatment of certain types of cancer, including multiple myeloma. It is also used to treat certain skin conditions.

ori_sentence: Normal-pressure hydrocephalus (NPH), also called malresorptive hydrocephalus, is a form of communicating hydrocephalus in which excess cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) occurs in the ventricles, and with normal or slightly elevated cerebrospinal fluid pressure.
simple_sent: Normal-pressure hydrocephalus (NPH), also called malresorptive hydrocephalus, is a form of hydrocephalus where the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) in the ventricles of the back of the body becomes too large.

ori_sentence: Hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) is the most common type of primary liver cancer in adults and is currently the most common cause of death in people with cirrhosis.
simple_sent: Hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) is the most common type of liver cancer in adults. In people with cirrhosis, it is the most common cause of death.

ori_sentence: Cystinuria is an inherited autosomal recessive disease characterized by high concentrations of the amino acid cystine in the urine, leading to the formation of cystine stones in the kidneys, ureters, and bladder.
simple_sent: Cystinuria is an inherited disease. People who have the disease will have high levels of the amino acid cystine in their urine. This causes cystine stones to form in the kidneys, ureters, and bladder.

ori_sentence: Dithranol (INN) or anthralin (USAN and former BAN) is a hydroxyanthrone, anthracene derivative, medicine applied to the skin of people with psoriasis.
simple_sent: Dithranol (also known as anthralin and hydroxyanthrone) is a chemical compound. It is used to treat people with psoriasis.

ori_sentence: Lupus pernio is a chronic raised indurated (hardened) lesion of the skin, often purplish in color.
simple_sent: Lupus pernio is a disease of the skin. It is a chronic raised indurated (hardened) lesion.

ori_sentence: Sevoflurane is a sweet-smelling, nonflammable, highly fluorinated methyl isopropyl ether used as an inhalational anaesthetic for induction and maintenance of general anesthesia.
simple_sent: Sevoflurane is a sweet-smelling, nonflammable, highly fluorinated drug that is used as an general anesthetic. It does not cause any damage to the body.

ori_sentence: Muscular dystrophies (MD) are a genetically and clinically heterogeneous group of rare neuromuscular diseases that cause progressive weakness and breakdown of skeletal muscles over time.
simple_sent: Muscular dystrophies (MD) are a group of rare diseases. When a person has a muscular dystrophies, his or her muscles become weaker over time.

ori_sentence: Weight loss, in the context of medicine, health, or physical fitness, refers to a reduction of the total body mass, by a mean loss of fluid, body fat (adipose tissue), or lean mass (namely bone mineral deposits, muscle, tendon, and other connective tissue).
simple_sent: Weight loss, in the context of medicine, health, or physical fitness, means a reduction of the total body mass, by a mean loss of fluid, body fat (called adipose tissue), and lean mass (also called bone mass).

ori_sentence: Turner syndrome (TS), also known as 45,X, or 45,X0, is a genetic condition in which a female is partially or completely missing an X chromosome.
simple_sent: Turner syndrome (also called 45,X, or 45,X0) is a condition. It happens when a person has an X chromosome that is missing.

ori_sentence: A soft-tissue sarcoma (STS) is a malignant tumour, a type of cancer, that develops in soft tissue.
simple_sent: A soft-tissue sarcoma (STS) is a cancer of the soft tissue. It is a type of cancer.

ori_sentence: Pyometra or pyometritis is a uterine infection.
simple_sent: Pyometra or pyometritis is a medical condition.

ori_sentence: Kaposi's sarcoma (KS) is a type of cancer that can form masses in the skin, in lymph nodes, in the mouth, or in other organs.
simple_sent: Kaposi's sarcoma is a cancer of the skin. It can also happen in the mouth, in the bones, or in other parts of the body.

ori_sentence: Merkel cell carcinoma (MCC) is a rare and aggressive skin cancer occurring in about 3 people per 1,000,000 members of the population.
simple_sent: Merkel cell carcinoma is a cancer of the skin. About 3 people in every 1,000,000 get this cancer, and it is very aggressive.

ori_sentence: Histidinemia, is a rare autosomal recessive metabolic disorder caused by a deficiency of the enzyme histidase.
simple_sent: Histidinemia, is a rare metabolic disorder. It is caused by a lack of the enzyme histidase.

ori_sentence: Primary ciliary dyskinesia (PCD), is a rare, ciliopathic, autosomal recessive genetic disorder that causes defects in the action of cilia lining the respiratory tract (lower and upper, sinuses, Eustachian tube, middle ear), fallopian tube, and flagellum of sperm cells.
simple_sent: Primary ciliary dyskinesia (PCD) is a rare genetic disorder. It causes problems with the cilia that line the lower and upper parts of the respiratory tract. This includes the sinuses, the middle ear, the fallopian tube, and the flagellum of sperm cells.

ori_sentence: Gardner's syndrome (also known as Gardner syndrome, familial polyposis of the colon, or familial colorectal polyposis) is a subtype of familial adenomatous polyposis (FAP).
simple_sent: Gardner's syndrome (also known as familial adenomatous polyposis or familial colorectal polyposis) is a disease. People who have it are very sick.

ori_sentence: Oligohydramnios is a medical condition in pregnancy characterized by a deficiency of amniotic fluid, the fluid that surrounds the fetus in the abdomen, in the amniotic sac.
simple_sent: Oligohydramnios is a medical condition during pregnancy. It is caused by a lack of amniotic fluid. This is the fluid that surrounds the fetus during pregnancy.

ori_sentence: Bortezomib, sold under the brand name Velcade among others, is an anti-cancer medication used to treat multiple myeloma and mantle cell lymphoma.
simple_sent: Bortezomib (also known as Velcade) is an anti-cancer drug. It is used to treat mantle cell lymphoma and multiple myeloma.

ori_sentence: Water intoxication, also known as water poisoning, hyperhydration, overhydration, or water toxemia, is a potentially fatal disturbance in brain functions that results when the normal balance of electrolytes in the body is pushed outside safe limits by excessive water intake.
simple_sent: Water intoxication, also known as hyperhydration, overhydration, or water toxemia, is when people drink too much water. It happens when the body does not have the electrolytes it should have, and the brain does not work the way it should.

ori_sentence: Sexual dysfunction is difficulty experienced by an individual or partners during any stage of normal sexual activity, including physical pleasure, desire, preference, arousal, or orgasm.
simple_sent: Sexual dysfunction is a problem that people have during sexual activity. It can happen during any stage of sexual activity, including physical pleasure or arousal.

ori_sentence: Dandy–Walker malformation (DWM), also known as Dandy–Walker syndrome (DWS), is a rare congenital brain malformation in which the part joining the two hemispheres of the cerebellum (the cerebellar vermis) does not fully form, and the fourth ventricle and space behind the cerebellum (the posterior fossa) are enlarged with cerebrospinal fluid.
simple_sent: Dandy-Walker malformation (DWM), also known as Dandy-Walker syndrome (DWS), is a condition in which the cerebellar vermis does not fully form. The fourth ventricle and space behind the cerebellum (the posterior fossa) are enlarged with cerebrospinal fluid.

ori_sentence: Erysipelas is a relatively common bacterial infection of the superficial layer of the skin (upper dermis), extending to the superficial lymphatic vessels within the skin, characterized by a raised, well-defined, tender, bright red rash, typically on the face or legs, but which can occur anywhere on the skin.
simple_sent: Erysipelas is a bacterial infection of the superficial layer of the skin (the upper dermis). The infection causes a raised, well-defined, tender, bright red rash, usually on the face or legs, but which can occur anywhere on the skin.

ori_sentence: Pontocerebellar hypoplasia (PCH) is a heterogeneous group of rare neurodegenerative disorders caused by genetic mutations and characterised by progressive atrophy of various parts of the brain such as the cerebellum or brainstem (particularly the pons).
simple_sent: Pontocerebellar hypoplasia (PCH) is a rare disease that causes damage to the brain. The disease causes the parts of the brain, called the cerebellum and the brainstem to become smaller, and eventually to stop working.

ori_sentence: Pilomatricoma, is a benign skin tumor derived from the hair matrix.
simple_sent: Pilomatricoma is a skin tumor. It comes from the hair matrix.

ori_sentence: Carbachol, also known as carbamylcholine and sold under the brand name Miostat among others, is a cholinomimetic drug that binds and activates acetylcholine receptors.
simple_sent: Carbachol (also known as carbamylcholine) is a drug that works by binding to and activating acetylcholine receptors. It is sold under the brand name Miostat.

ori_sentence: Courvoisier's law states that a painless palpably enlarged gallbladder (known as Courvoisier's sign or Courvoisier-Terrier's sign, or Courvoisier syndrome) accompanied with mild jaundice is unlikely to be caused by gallstones.
simple_sent: Courvoisier's law says that an enlarged gallbladder is not usually caused by gallstones. If a person has Courvoisier's sign or Courvoisier-Terrier's sign, and they have mild jaundice, it may be because of gallstones.

ori_sentence: The hydatid of Morgagni can refer to one of two closely related bodily structures:
simple_sent: The hydatid of Morgagni can be two different things, but they are very similar.

ori_sentence: In psychology, logorrhea or logorrhoea (from Ancient Greek λόγος logos "word" and ῥέω rheo "to flow"), is a communication disorder that causes excessive wordiness and repetitiveness, which can cause incoherency.
simple_sent: Logorrhea or logorrhoea is a communication disorder. The name comes from the Ancient Greek word logos meaning "word" and the word rheo meaning "to flow" in the Greek language.

ori_sentence: Cycloplegia is paralysis of the ciliary muscle of the eye, resulting in a loss of accommodation.
simple_sent: Cycloplegia is a disease of the eye. In it, the ciliary muscle of the eye is paralyzed.

ori_sentence: Annuloaortic ectasia is a dilation of the proximal ascending aorta and aortic annulus.
simple_sent: Annuloaortic ectasia happens when the aorta and aortic annulus become too wide.

ori_sentence: Hemolytic anemia is a form of anemia due to hemolysis, the abnormal breakdown of red blood cells (RBCs), either in the blood vessels (intravascular hemolysis) or elsewhere in the human body (extravascular).
simple_sent: Hemolytic anemia is a form of anemia due to hemolysis. Red blood cells (RBCs) in the blood stop working properly. This happens either in the blood vessels or elsewhere in the body.

ori_sentence: In human anatomy, the neurocranium, also known as the braincase, brainpan, or brain-pan is the upper and back part of the skull, which forms a protective case around the brain.
simple_sent: In human anatomy, the neurocranium is the upper and back part of the skull. It is also called the braincase, brainpan, or brain-pan.

ori_sentence: Lanreotide (INN) is a medication used in the management of acromegaly and symptoms caused by neuroendocrine tumors, most notably carcinoid syndrome.
simple_sent: Lanreotide (INN) is a medication that is used to treat acromegaly. Acromegaly is a condition where the eye can not see well.

ori_sentence: Fecal incontinence (FI), or in some forms encopresis, is a lack of control over defecation, leading to involuntary loss of bowel contents, both liquid stool elements and mucus, or solid feces.
simple_sent: Fecal incontinence (FI), or in some forms encopresis, is when a person has no control over when they need to go to the bathroom, and they can not control how they go to the bathroom.

ori_sentence: Mitral stenosis is a valvular heart disease characterized by the narrowing of the opening of the mitral valve of the heart.
simple_sent: Mitral stenosis is a heart disease. In it, the opening of the mitral valve gets smaller and smaller.

ori_sentence: Ehlers–Danlos syndromes (EDS) are a group of thirteen genetic connective-tissue disorders that are in the current classification, with a fourteenth type discovered in 2018.
simple_sent: Ehlers-Danlos syndromes (EDS) are a group of disorders. There are currently thirteen different types of EDS, and in 2018 a fourteenth type was discovered.

ori_sentence: Silver nitrate is an inorganic compound with chemical formula AgNO3.
simple_sent: Silver nitrate is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is AgNO3.

ori_sentence: A pimple is a kind of comedo that results from excess sebum and dead skin cells getting trapped in the pores of the skin.

ori_sentence: Fenofibrate (sold under the brand names Tricor, Fenobrat etc.), is an oral medication of the fibrate class used to treat abnormal blood lipid levels.
simple_sent: Fenofibrate (also known as Tricor and Fenobrat) is an oral medication. It is used to treat abnormal levels of blood cholesterol.

ori_sentence: Adult-onset
simple_sent: Adult-onset

ori_sentence: Ophthalmoparesis  refers to weakness (-paresis) or paralysis (-plegia) of one or more extraocular muscles which are responsible for eye movements.
simple_sent: Ophthalmoparesis is when one or more muscles in the eye become weak. These muscles are responsible for moving the eye around.

ori_sentence: A comedo is a clogged hair follicle (pore) in the skin.
simple_sent: A comedo is a pore in the skin where hair grows.

ori_sentence: IgA nephropathy (IgAN), also known as Berger's disease () (and variations), or synpharyngitic glomerulonephritis, is a disease of the kidney (or nephropathy) and the immune system; specifically it is a form of glomerulonephritis or an inflammation of the glomeruli of the kidney.
simple_sent: IgA nephropathy (IgAN), also known as Berger's disease () (and variations), or synpharyngitic glomerulonephritis, is a disease of the kidney (or nephropathy) and the immune system. The most common cause of IgA nephropathy is left renal failure.

ori_sentence: A tic is a sudden, repetitive, nonrhythmic motor movement or vocalization involving discrete muscle groups.
simple_sent: A tic is a sudden, non-rhythmic movement or sound that is done very quickly and by many muscles.

simple_sent: Cigler -

simple_sent: Kallmann syndrome is a genetic disorder. People with Kallmann syndrome do not go through puberty.

ori_sentence: Dermatitis herpetiformis (DH) is a chronic autoimmune blistering skin condition, characterised by intensely itchy blisters filled with a watery fluid.
simple_sent: Dermatitis herpetiformis (DH) is a painful and itchy condition of the skin. It is caused by an autoimmune disease.

simple_sent: Non-Hodgkin lymphoma (NHL) is a type of cancer. It is different from Hodgkin lymphoma because it does not spread.

ori_sentence: An aura is a perceptual disturbance experienced by some with epilepsy or migraine.
simple_sent: An aura is a feeling. Some people who have epilepsy or migraine have an aura.

simple_sent: Renal cell carcinoma (RCC) is a type of cancer of the kidney. It starts in the lining of the proximal convoluted tubule, which is a part of the small tube that carries urine.

ori_sentence: The red nucleus or nucleus ruber is a structure in the rostral midbrain involved in motor coordination.
simple_sent: The red nucleus or nucleus ruber is a part of the brain. It is located in the midbrain.

ori_sentence: Melena or melaena refers to the dark black, tarry feces that are associated with upper gastrointestinal bleeding.
simple_sent: Melena or melaena are dark black feces. They can also cause bleeding in the upper gastrointestinal tract.

ori_sentence: Arteritis is the inflammation of the walls of arteries, usually as a result of infection or autoimmune response.
simple_sent: Arteritis is an inflammation of the walls of arteries. The most common cause of arteritis is infection.

ori_sentence: Leukocyte adhesion deficiency (LAD), is a rare autosomal recessive disorder characterized by immunodeficiency resulting in recurrent infections.
simple_sent: Leukocyte adhesion deficiency, or LAD, is a rare disease. It is caused by a lack of leukocytes. It causes recurrent infections.

ori_sentence: Wolfram syndrome, also called DIDMOAD (diabetes insipidus, diabetes mellitus, optic atrophy, and deafness), is a rare autosomal-recessive genetic disorder that causes childhood-onset diabetes mellitus, optic atrophy, and deafness as well as various other possible disorders.
simple_sent: Wolfram syndrome, also called DIDMOAD (diabetes insipidus, diabetes mellitus, optic atrophy, and deafness), is a rare disease. People with Wolfram syndrome have diabetes insipidus, diabetes mellitus, optic atrophy, and deafness.

simple_sent: The suprachiasmatic nucleus (SCN) is a small part of the brain. It is located in the hypothalamus region of the brain.

ori_sentence: Dacryocystitis is an infection of the lacrimal sac, secondary to obstruction of the nasolacrimal duct at the junction of lacrimal sac.
simple_sent: Dacryocystitis is an infection of the lacrimal sac. When people get dacryocystitis, they can not use the lacrimal sac.

simple_sent: Oculocerebrorenal syndrome (also called Lowe syndrome) is a rare disorder. People who have it have congenital cataracts, hypotonia, intellectual disability, tubular acidosis, aminoaciduria, and low-molecular-weight proteinuria.

ori_sentence: Thanatophoric dysplasia is a severe skeletal disorder characterized by a disproportionately small ribcage, extremely short limbs and folds of extra skin on the arms and legs.
simple_sent: Thanatophoric dysplasia is a very rare disorder. People with this condition have a very small ribcage, very short limbs, and extra skin on their arms and legs.

ori_sentence: The ductus arteriosus, also called the ductus Botalli, named after the Italian physiologist Leonardo Botallo, is a blood vessel in the developing fetus connecting the trunk of the pulmonary artery to the proximal descending aorta.
simple_sent: The ductus arteriosus, also called the ductus Botalli, is a blood vessel in the developing fetus. The ductus arteriosus is a blood vessel in the developing fetus that connects the pulmonary artery to the aorta.

ori_sentence: The frontal lobe is the largest of the four major lobes of the brain in mammals, and is located at the front of each cerebral hemisphere (in front of the parietal lobe and the temporal lobe).
simple_sent: The frontal lobe is the front part of the brain. It is located at the front of the brain, between the parietal lobe and the temporal lobe. It is the largest part of the brain.

ori_sentence: Trifluoperazine, sold under the brand name Stelazine among others, is a typical antipsychotic primarily used to treat schizophrenia.
simple_sent: Trifluoperazine, also known as Stelazine, is an antipsychotic drug. It is used to treat people with schizophrenia.

ori_sentence: Methyltestosterone, sold under the brand names Android, Metandren, and Testred among others, is an androgen and anabolic steroid (AAS) medication which is used in the treatment of low testosterone levels in men, delayed puberty in boys, at low doses as a component of menopausal hormone therapy for menopausal symptoms like hot flashes, osteoporosis, and low sexual desire in women, and to treat breast cancer in women.
simple_sent: Methyltestosterone, sold under the brand names Android, Metandren, and Testred among others, is an androgen and anabolic steroid (AAS) medication which is used to treat low levels of testosterone in men, to treat osteoporosis in women, and to treat breast cancer in women. It is also used as a part of menopausal hormone therapy to treat hot flashes, osteoporosis, and low sexual desire in women.

ori_sentence: Ribavirin, also known as tribavirin, is an antiviral medication used to treat RSV infection, hepatitis C and some viral hemorrhagic fevers.
simple_sent: Ribavirin (also known as tribavirin) is an antiviral drug. It is used to treat people who have Hepatitis C or RSV.

ori_sentence: Werner syndrome (WS) (sometimes Werner's syndrome), also known as "adult progeria", is a rare, autosomal recessive disorder which is characterized by the appearance of premature aging.
simple_sent: Werner syndrome (sometimes called Werner's syndrome or adult progeria) is a rare disease. People who have the disease will look very young, and they will not live long.

ori_sentence: High-functioning autism (HFA) is an autism classification where a person exhibits no intellectual disability, but may exhibit deficits in communication, emotion recognition and expression, and social interaction.
simple_sent: High-functioning autism (HFA) is a type of autism. In this type, the person does not have any intellectual disability, but they have problems with communication and social skills.

ori_sentence: Lacidipine (tradenames Lacipil or Motens) is a calcium channel blocker.
simple_sent: Lacidipine is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is Lacipil.

ori_sentence: Polymyalgia rheumatica (PMR) is a syndrome with pain or stiffness, usually in the neck, shoulders, upper arms, and hips, but which may occur all over the body.
simple_sent: Polymyalgia rheumatica (PMR) is a disease. People with PMR usually have pain or stiffness in their neck, shoulders, upper arms, and hips.

ori_sentence: Dermatographic urticaria is a skin disorder and one of the most common types of urticaria, affecting 2–5% of the population.
simple_sent: Dermatographic urticaria is a skin disorder. About 2-5% of people have it, and it is the most common skin disorder.

ori_sentence: Osteochondrosis is a family of orthopedic diseases of the joint that occur in children, adolescents and rapidly growing animals, particularly pigs, horses, dogs, and broiler chickens.
simple_sent: Osteochondrosis is a disease of the joint. It usually happens in children, young people, and animals that are quickly growing, such as horses, dogs, and broiler chickens.

ori_sentence: Osteogenesis imperfecta (IPA: /ˌɒstioʊˈdʒɛnəsɪs ˌɪmpɜːrˈfɛktə/; OI), colloquially known as brittle bone disease, is a group of genetic disorders that all result in bone that breaks easily.
simple_sent: Osteogenesis imperfecta (also called brittle bone disease or osteogenesis imperfecta) is a group of genetic disorders. All of them result in bone that breaks easily.

ori_sentence: The jugular veins are veins that take deoxygenated blood from the head back to the heart via the superior vena cava.
simple_sent: The jugular veins take blood from the head to the heart. They take oxygenated blood from the head back to the heart.

ori_sentence: Deferiprone, sold under the brand name Ferriprox among others, is a medication that chelates iron and is used to treat iron overload in thalassaemia major.
simple_sent: Deferiprone, sold under the brand name Ferriprox among others, is a drug that helps to remove iron from the blood. It chelates iron.

ori_sentence: Primary myelofibrosis (PMF) is a rare bone marrow blood cancer.
simple_sent: Primary myelofibrosis is a very rare blood cancer.

simple_sent: Dry eye syndrome (DES) is a medical condition. It is also called keratoconjunctivitis sicca.

ori_sentence: Dermatofibrosarcoma protuberans (DFSP) is a rare locally aggressive malignant cutaneous soft-tissue sarcoma.
simple_sent: Dermatofibrosarcoma protuberans (DFSP) is a rare soft tissue sarcoma. It can be found locally.

ori_sentence: A seminoma is a germ cell tumor of the testicle or, more rarely, the mediastinum or other extra-gonadal locations.
simple_sent: A seminoma is a tumor in the testicle. Usually, it is in the testicle itself, but sometimes it is in the mediastinum.

ori_sentence: A dermatofibroma, or benign fibrous histiocytomas, is a benign nodule in the skin, typically on the legs, elbows and chest of an adult.
simple_sent: A dermatofibroma, or benign histiocytomas, is a small lump or lump in the skin. Usually it is found on the legs or elbows.

ori_sentence: Sitagliptin, sold under the brand name Januvia among others, is an anti-diabetic medication used to treat type 2 diabetes.
simple_sent: Januvia, also known as Sitagliptin, is an anti-diabetic medication. It is used to treat type 2 diabetes.

simple_sent: Mexiletine (also known as Mexitil and NaMuscla) is a prescription drug. It is used to treat pain, abnormal heart rhythms, and some causes of muscle stiffness.

ori_sentence: A subluxation is an incomplete or partial dislocation of a joint or organ.
simple_sent: A subluxation is when a joint or organ is not fully open.

simple_sent: Acrodermatitis chronica atrophicans is a disease of the skin. It is the third or late stage of Lyme borreliosis.

simple_sent: Tacrine acts as an acetylcholinesterase inhibitor. It also acts as an indirect cholinergic agonist.

ori_sentence: Mirtazapine, sold under the brand name Remeron among others, is an atypical antidepressant, and as such is used primarily to treat depression.
simple_sent: Mirtazapine (also known as Remeron) is an atypical antidepressant. It is used to treat people with depression.

simple_sent: Primaquine is a medication. It is used to treat malaria and to prevent it from happening.

ori_sentence: Phentolamine, sold under the brand name Regitine among others, is a reversible nonselective α-adrenergic antagonist.
simple_sent: Phentolamine (also known as Regitine) is a chemical compound. It is an α-adrenergic antagonist.

simple_sent: Piperonyl butoxide is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is PBO. It is pale yellow to light brown in color.

simple_sent: Silver sulfadiazine, sold under the brand Silvadene among others, is a topical antibiotic. It is used to prevent infection in the skin.

ori_sentence: Flumazenil (also known as flumazepil, code name Ro 15-1788) is a selective GABAA receptor antagonist administered via injection, otic insertion, or intranasally.
simple_sent: Flumazenil (also known as flumazepil, code name Ro 15-1788) is a drug that acts on the GABAA receptor. It is given by injection or intranasally.

simple_sent: Paroxysmal hand hematoma is a skin condition where a large amount of blood flows into the palm or the surface of a finger. This causes temporary pain in the hand, followed by rapid swelling and a small amount of blueish discoloration.

simple_sent: Sinus node dysfunction (SND), also known as sick sinus syndrome (SSS), is a group of abnormal heart rhythms (arrhythmias). The most common cause of sinus node dysfunction is left heart failure.

simple_sent: 1q21.1 deletion syndrome is a chromosome abnormality.

simple_sent: Clubfoot is a birth defect. One or both feet are turned inward when they are born.

simple_sent: Leukorrhea is a yellowish or greenish discharge from the vagina. It is also known as fluor albus in English.

simple_sent: Mephenytoin (also known as Mesantoin) is a chemical compound. It is an anticonvulsant.

ori_sentence: Osteopetrosis, literally "stone bone", also known as marble bone disease or Albers-Schönberg disease, is an extremely rare inherited disorder whereby the bones harden, becoming denser, in contrast to more prevalent conditions like osteoporosis, in which the bones become less dense and more brittle, or osteomalacia, in which the bones soften.
simple_sent: Osteopetrosis, literally "stone bone", also known as marble bone disease or Albers-Schönberg disease, is a disease where the bones of the body harden and become more dense. This is different from osteoporosis, where the bones become less dense but still strong, and osteomalacia, where the bones become weaker but still strong.

simple_sent: Young's syndrome, also known as azoospermia sinopulmonary infections, sinusitis-infertility syndrome and Barry-Perkins-Young syndrome, is a condition where the male sex organs do not work properly. It is a rare condition.

simple_sent: Cat eye syndrome (CES) or Schmid-Fraccaro syndrome is a condition. It happens when a person has an extra chromosome that is not normal.

ori_sentence: Acanthosis nigricans is a medical sign characterised by brown-to-black, poorly defined, velvety hyperpigmentation of the skin.
simple_sent: Acanthosis nigricans is a medical sign. It is when the skin has dark brown to black areas that are not defined.

simple_sent: Oral cancer is cancer of the lips, mouth, or upper throat. It is also called mouth cancer.

ori_sentence: Rheumatic fever (RF) is an inflammatory disease that can involve the heart, joints, skin, and brain.
simple_sent: Rheumatic fever (RF) is a disease. It can affect the heart, the skin, and the joints.

simple_sent: An inguinal hernia is when the stomach contents go through the inguinal canal.

simple_sent: Neuroacanthocytosis is a medical condition. In it, the blood has spiculated red blood cells, called acanthocytes, that are not normal in normal blood.

simple_sent: Marfan syndrome is a rare genetic disorder. It affects many parts of the body at once.

simple_sent: Neonatal jaundice is when a baby's eyes and skin are yellow. This is because the baby's blood has too much bilirubin.

simple_sent: Corticobasal degeneration (CBD) is a rare disease. It affects the brain's basal ganglia and cerebral cortex.

simple_sent: Flurbiprofen is a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAIDs). Its chemical formula is phenylalkanoic acid.

ori_sentence: 1,2-Dichlorotetrafluoroethane, or R-114, also known as cryofluorane (INN), is a chlorofluorocarbon (CFC) with the molecular formula ClF2CCF2Cl.
simple_sent: 1,2-Dichlorotetrafluoroethane, also known as cryofluorane, is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is ClF2CCF2Cl.

ori_sentence: Erythritol is an organic compound, a sugar alcohol (or polyol), used as a food additive and sugar substitute.
simple_sent: Erythritol is an organic compound. It is a sugar alcohol, which means it has sugar in it.

ori_sentence: Phenylephrine is a medication primarily used as a decongestant, to dilate the pupil, to increase blood pressure, and to relieve hemorrhoids.
simple_sent: Phenylephrine is also used as a decongestant. When taken as a decongestant, it causes the blood pressure to go down.

simple_sent: Xerostomia, also known as dry mouth, is dryness in the mouth. It can be caused by changes in the way saliva is made up of, or less saliva coming out of the mouth.

ori_sentence: Undecylenic acid is an organic compound with the formula CH2=CH(CH2)8CO2H.
simple_sent: It is an organic compound. Its chemical formula is CH2=CH(CH2)8CO2H.

simple_sent: Oxymetholone (also known as Anadrol and Anapolon) is an androgen and anabolic steroid drug. It is used to treat anemia, a disease of the blood.

ori_sentence: Everolimus is a medication used as an immunosuppressant to prevent rejection of organ transplants and in the treatment of renal cell cancer and other tumours.
simple_sent: Everolimus is an immunosuppressant. It is used to prevent organ transplants and to treat certain types of cancer, such as renal cell cancer.

ori_sentence: Promazine (brand name Sparine among others), is used as a short-term add-on treatment for psychomotor agitation.
simple_sent: Promazine (brand name Sparine among others), is a drug that is taken for short periods of time.

ori_sentence: Penciclovir is a guanosine analogue antiviral drug used for the treatment of various herpesvirus infections.
simple_sent: Penciclovir is a drug. It is an analogue of guanosine. It is used to treat herpesvirus infections.

ori_sentence: Oxandrolone, sold under the brand names Oxandrin and Anavar, among others, is an androgen and anabolic steroid (AAS) medication which is used to help promote weight gain in various situations, to help offset protein catabolism caused by long-term corticosteroid therapy, to support recovery from severe burns, to treat bone pain associated with osteoporosis, to aid in the development of girls with Turner syndrome, and for other indications.
simple_sent: Oxandrolone, sold under the brand names Oxandrin and Anavar, among others, is an androgen and anabolic steroid (AAS) medication which is used to help promote weight gain in various situations. It is also used to treat bone pain caused by osteoporosis, to support recovery from severe burns, to help in the development of girls with Turner syndrome, and for other indications.

simple_sent: Levocetirizine (also known as Xyzal) is a third generation antihistamine. It is used to treat allergic rhinitis (hay fever) and hives that do not go away after a while.

simple_sent: Patellar tendinitis is an injury to the knee. It happens when the tendon in the knee is too used.

ori_sentence: Derealization is an alteration in the perception of the external world, causing sufferers to perceive it as unreal, distant, distorted or falsified.
simple_sent: Derealization is a change in how a person sees the outside world. This makes them see the world as unreal, distant, distorted or false.

ori_sentence: Panic is a sudden sensation of fear, which is so strong as to dominate or prevent reason and logical thinking, replacing it with overwhelming feelings of anxiety and frantic agitation consistent with an animalistic fight-or-flight reaction.
simple_sent: Panic is a sudden feeling of fear. The fear is so strong that it stops logical thinking and thinking, and replaces it with feelings of anxiety. This is like an animal fight-or-flight reaction.

ori_sentence: Inborn errors of metabolism form a large class of genetic diseases involving congenital disorders of enzyme activities.
simple_sent: Inborn errors of metabolism form a large class of genetic diseases. They are caused when an enzyme is not working properly.

ori_sentence: Tobramycin is an aminoglycoside antibiotic derived from Streptomyces tenebrarius that is used to treat various types of bacterial infections, particularly Gram-negative infections.
simple_sent: Tobramycin is an antibiotic. It is an aminoglycoside antibiotic. It is used to treat certain types of bacterial infections, especially Gram-negative infections.

ori_sentence: A diastema (plural diastemata, from greek διάστημα, space) is a space or gap between two teeth.
simple_sent: A diastema (plural diastemata) is a space between two teeth. The word comes from the Greek word.

ori_sentence: Onychotillomania is a compulsive behavior in which a person picks constantly at the nails or tries to tear them off.
simple_sent: Onychotillomania is a very bad behavior. People who have it often pick at their nails and try to tear them off.

ori_sentence: Cavernous hemangioma, also called cavernous angioma, venous malformation, cavernoma, or cerebral cavernous malformation (CCM) (when referring to presence in the brain) is a type of venous malformation due to endothelial dysmorphogenesis from a lesion which is present at birth.
simple_sent: A cavernous hemangioma, also called cavernous angioma, cavernoma, cavernous malformation, or cerebral cavernous malformation (CCM) is a malformation of the brain. Cavernous hemangioma is a type of malformation of the brain.

ori_sentence: The VACTERL association (also VATER association, and less accurately VACTERL syndrome) refers to a recognized group of birth defects which tend to co-occur (see ).
simple_sent: The VACTERL association (also VATER association, and less accurately VACTERL syndrome) is a group of birth defects. There are many different types of VACTERL.

ori_sentence: The dawn phenomenon, sometimes called the dawn effect, is an observed increase in blood sugar (glucose) levels that takes place in the early-morning, often between 2 a.m. and 8 a.m. First described by Schmidt in 1981 as an increase of blood glucose or insulin demand occurring at dawn, this naturally occurring phenomenon is frequently seen among the general population and is clinically relevant for patients with diabetes as it can affect their medical management.
simple_sent: The dawn phenomenon, sometimes called the dawn effect, is an increase in blood sugar (glucose) levels that takes place in the early-morning, often between 2 a.m. and 8 a.m. First described by Schmidt in 1981, this naturally occurring phenomenon is often seen among the general population, and is clinically relevant for patients with diabetes as it can affect their medical management.

ori_sentence: Congenital rubella syndrome (CRS) can occur in a developing fetus of a pregnant woman who has contracted rubella, usually in the first trimester.
simple_sent: Congenital rubella syndrome (CRS) can happen when a pregnant woman gets rubella. This usually happens in the first trimester of pregnancy.

ori_sentence: In dermatologic pathology, a dermal cylindroma, also dermal eccrine cylindroma or cutaneous cylindroma) and (less specifically) cylindroma, is a benign adnexal tumor that occurs on the scalp and forehead.
simple_sent: A dermal cylindroma (also called dermal eccrine cylindroma or cutaneous cylindroma) is a benign tumor on the scalp. It is also called a cutaneous cylindroma.

ori_sentence: Tachycardia, also called tachyarrhythmia, is a heart rate that exceeds the normal resting rate.
simple_sent: Tachycardia (also known as tachyarrhythmia) is when your heart rate is too high.

ori_sentence: Phenoxybenzamine (marketed under the trade name Dibenzyline) is a non-selective, irreversible alpha blocker.
simple_sent: Phenoxybenzamine (also known as Dibenzyline) is a chemical compound. It is an alpha blocker.

ori_sentence: Dicoumarol (INN) or dicumarol (USAN) is a naturally occurring anticoagulant drug that depletes stores of vitamin K (similar to warfarin, a drug that dicoumarol inspired).
simple_sent: Dicoumarol (also known as dicumarol) is an anticoagulant drug. It works by taking away the vitamin K from the blood, just like warfarin.

ori_sentence: Pyrimethamine, sold under the brand name Daraprim among others, is a medication used with leucovorin (leucovorin is used to decrease side effects of pyrimethamine; it does not have intrinsic anti-parasitic activity) to treat the parasitic diseases toxoplasmosis and cystoisosporiasis.
simple_sent: Pyrimethamine is used to treat the parasitic diseases toxoplasmosis and cystoisosporiasis. Pyrimethamine is sold under the brand name Daraprim among others, to treat the parasitic diseases toxoplasmosis and cystoisosporiasis.

ori_sentence: Somatostatinomas are a tumor of the delta cells of the endocrine pancreas that produces somatostatin.
simple_sent: Somatostatinomas are cancer of the somatostatin cells. They are found in the endocrine pancreas.

ori_sentence: Lymphoma is a group of blood malignancies that develop from lymphocytes (a type of white blood cell).
simple_sent: Lymphoma is a cancer of the blood. The cells that cause lymphoma are called lymphocytes.

ori_sentence: Cricoid pressure, also known as the Sellick manoeuvre or Sellick maneuver, is a technique used in endotracheal intubation to try to reduce the risk of regurgitation.
simple_sent: Cricoid pressure, also known as the Sellick manoeuvre or Sellick maneuver, is a way to try to stop a baby from spitting up when they are born.

ori_sentence: Granulomatosis with polyangiitis (GPA), previously known as Wegener's granulomatosis (WG), is an extremely rare long-term systemic disorder that involves the formation of granulomas and inflammation of blood vessels (vasculitis).
simple_sent: Granulomatosis with polyangiitis (GPA), previously known as Wegener's granulomatosis (WG), is a long-term disease that causes the growth of granulomas in the blood. It also causes inflammation of the blood vessels.

ori_sentence: Primidone, sold under various brand names, is a barbiturate medication that is used to treat partial and generalized seizures, as well as essential tremors.

ori_sentence: Amprenavir (original brand name Agenerase, GlaxoSmithKline) is a protease inhibitor used to treat HIV infection.
simple_sent: Amprenavir (originally called Agenerase) is a drug. It is used to treat HIV infection.

ori_sentence: A colloid cyst is a non-malignant tumor in the brain.
simple_sent: A colloid cyst is a small tumor in the brain.

ori_sentence: Combined spinal and epidural anaesthesia (CSE) is a regional anaesthetic technique, which combines the benefits of both spinal anaesthesia and epidural anaesthesia and analgesia.
simple_sent: Combined spinal and epidural anaesthesia (CSE) is a method of anesthesia. It uses both spinal anaesthesia and epidural anaesthesia to help with pain during surgery.

ori_sentence: Respiratory tract infections (RTIs) are infectious diseases involving the respiratory tract.
simple_sent: Respiratory tract infections (RTIs) are diseases that affect the respiratory system.

ori_sentence: Dexamethasone is a glucocorticoid medication used to treat rheumatic problems, a number of skin diseases, severe allergies, asthma, chronic obstructive lung disease, croup, brain swelling, eye pain following eye surgery, superior vena cava syndrome (a complication of some forms of cancer), and along with antibiotics in tuberculosis.
simple_sent: Dexamethasone is a glucocorticoid drug. It is used to treat rheumatic problems, a number of skin diseases, severe allergies, asthma, chronic obstructive lung disease, croup, brain swelling, eye pain following eye surgery, and certain types of tuberculosis.

ori_sentence: Symphysis pubis dysfunction (SPD) is a condition that causes excessive movement of the pubic symphysis, either anterior or lateral, as well as associated pain, possibly because of a misalignment of the pelvis.
simple_sent: Symphysis pubis dysfunction (SPD) is a condition in which the pubic symphysis (the middle section of the pelvis) moves too much. This can cause pain and sometimes even death.

ori_sentence: Lambert–Eaton myasthenic syndrome (LEMS) is a rare autoimmune disorder characterized by muscle weakness of the limbs.
simple_sent: Lambert-Eaton Myasthenic Syndrome (LEMS) is a rare disease. People who have the disease have weakness in their limbs.

ori_sentence: Tactile corpuscles or Meissner's corpuscles are a type of mechanoreceptor discovered by anatomist Georg Meissner (1829–1905) and Rudolf Wagner.
simple_sent: Meissner's corpuscles are a type of mechanoreceptor. They were discovered by the German anatomist Georg Meissner in the 19th century.

ori_sentence: Duodenal atresia is the congenital absence or complete closure of a portion of the lumen of the duodenum.
simple_sent: Duodenal atresia is an abnormality in the duodenum. A part of the lumen of the duodenum is closed.

ori_sentence: Polyarteritis nodosa (PAN) is a systemic necrotizing inflammation of blood vessels (vasculitis) affecting medium-sized muscular arteries, typically involving the arteries of the kidneys and other internal organs but generally sparing the lungs' circulation.
simple_sent: Polyarteritis nodosa (PAN) is an inflammation of blood vessels (vasculitis). It usually affects medium-sized muscular arteries, but it can also affect other blood vessels. It usually does not affect the lungs, but it can affect them.

ori_sentence: Liposarcomas are the most common subtype of soft tissue sarcomas, accounting for at least 20% of all sarcomas in adults.
simple_sent: Liposarcomas are the most common soft tissue sarcomas. At least 20% of people in the United States have this disease.

ori_sentence: Doxylamine is a first-generation antihistamine used as a short-term sedative and hypnotic (sleep aid) or in combination formulations to provide night-time allergy and cold relief.
simple_sent: Doxylamine is a first-generation antihistamine. It is used as a short-term sedative and as a hypnotic (sleep aid) in combination with other drugs to help people sleep.

simple_sent: Sulbactam is a chemical compound.

simple_sent: Lomitapide (also known as Juxtapid in the United States and Lojuxta in the European Union) is a cholesterol-lowering drug. It is used to treat people with familial hypercholesterolemia.

ori_sentence: Xylitol is a chemical compound with the formula C5H12O5, or HO(CH2)(CHOH)3(CH2)OH; specifically, one particular stereoisomer with that structural formula.
simple_sent: Xylitol is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is C5H12O5. It has the chemical formula HO(CH2)(CHOH)3(CH2)OH.

ori_sentence: Amrinone, also known as inamrinone, and sold as Inocor, is a pyridine phosphodiesterase 3 inhibitor.
simple_sent: Amarinone (also known as Inocor) is a chemical compound. It is an inhibitor of phosphodiesterase 3.

ori_sentence: Trimethoprim (TMP) is an antibiotic used mainly in the treatment of bladder infections.
simple_sent: Trimethoprim (also known as TMP) is an antibiotic. It is a common antibiotic.

ori_sentence: Inclusion body myositis (IBM) (/maɪoʊˈsaɪtɪs/)
simple_sent: Inclusion body myositis (IBM) is a disease.

ori_sentence: Nijmegen breakage syndrome (NBS), is a rare autosomal recessive congenital disorder causing chromosomal instability, probably as a result of a defect in the double Holliday junction DNA repair mechanism and/or the synthesis dependent strand annealing mechanism for repairing double strand breaks in DNA (see Homologous recombination).
simple_sent: Nijmegen breakage syndrome (NBS), is a rare autosomal recessive congenital disorder that causes chromosomal instability. It is caused by a defect in the double Holliday junction DNA repair mechanism, which helps to repair double strand breaks in DNA (see Homologous recombination).

simple_sent: Leigh syndrome (also called Leigh disease and subacute necrotizing encephalomyelopathy) is a disease. People who have this disease are very sick.

ori_sentence: The lingual nerve carries sensory innervation from the anterior two-thirds of the tongue.
simple_sent: The lingual nerve is an important nerve. It is located in the front part of the tongue.

ori_sentence: Weber's syndrome, also known as midbrain stroke syndrome or superior alternating hemiplegia, is a form of stroke that affects the medial portion of the midbrain.
simple_sent: Weber's syndrome, also called superior alternating hemiplegia or midbrain stroke syndrome, is a disease that happens when a person has a stroke.

ori_sentence: The posterior longitudinal ligament is a ligament connecting the posterior surfaces of the vertebral bodies of all of the vertebrae.
simple_sent: The posterior longitudinal ligament is a ligament in the back of the body. It connects the posterior surfaces of the vertebrae.

ori_sentence: Isosorbide mononitrate, sold under many brand names, is a medication used for heart-related chest pain (angina), heart failure, and esophageal spasms.
simple_sent: Isosorbide mononitrate is a prescription drug. It is used to treat heart failure, esophageal spasms, and chest pain.

ori_sentence: Liddle's syndrome, also called Liddle syndrome is a genetic disorder inherited in an autosomal dominant manner that is characterized by early, and frequently severe, high blood pressure associated with low plasma renin activity, metabolic alkalosis, low blood potassium, and normal to low levels of aldosterone.
simple_sent: Liddle's syndrome, also called Liddle syndrome is a genetic disorder. People with Liddle's syndrome have low plasma renin activity, low blood potassium, and normal to low levels of aldosterone. This causes early, and frequently severe, high blood pressure.

ori_sentence: A dysgerminoma is a type of germ cell tumor; it usually is malignant and usually occurs in the ovary.
simple_sent: A dysgerminoma is a type of tumor on the ovary. It is usually a malignant tumor.

ori_sentence: Pseudobulbar palsy is a medical condition characterized by the inability to control facial movements (such as chewing and speaking) and caused by a variety of neurological disorders.
simple_sent: Pseudobulbar palsy is a medical condition in which the person can not control their facial movements. It can be caused by many different neurological disorders.

ori_sentence: Sprengel's deformity (also known as high scapula or congenital high scapula) is a rare congenital skeletal abnormality where a person has one shoulder blade that sits higher on the back than the other.
simple_sent: Sprengel's deformity (also known as high scapula or congenital high scapula) is when a person is born with one shoulder blade higher than the other. This is called a high scapula.

ori_sentence: The rectouterine pouch, pouch of Douglas, or rectovaginal pouch is the extension of the peritoneum between the rectum and the posterior wall of the uterus in the human female.
simple_sent: The rectouterine pouch is a part of the human body. It is made up of the peritoneum. It is between the rectum and the posterior wall of the uterus.

ori_sentence: Atrophic gastritis is a process of chronic inflammation of the gastric mucosa of the stomach, leading to a loss of gastric glandular cells and their eventual replacement by intestinal and fibrous tissues.
simple_sent: Atrophic gastritis is a disease of the stomach. It causes inflammation of the gastric mucosa (the part of the stomach that people eat from the outside of the body).

ori_sentence: Lipedema is a condition that is almost exclusively found in women and results in enlargement of both legs due to deposits of fat under the skin.
simple_sent: Lipedema is a condition that mostly affects women. It causes both legs to become bigger because of fat deposits under the skin.

ori_sentence: Rizatriptan, sold under the brand name Maxalt among others, is a medication used for the treatment of migraine headaches.
simple_sent: Rizatriptan (also known as Maxalt) is a prescription drug. It is used to treat migraine headaches.

ori_sentence: Oxymorphone (sold under the brand names Numorphan and Opana among others) is a highly potent opioid analgesic indicated for treatment of severe pain.
simple_sent: Oxymorphone (also known as Numorphan and Opana) is an opioid analgesic. It is used to treat pain that is very severe.

ori_sentence: Tinea cruris, also known as jock itch, is a common type of contagious, superficial fungal infection of the groin region, which occurs predominantly but not exclusively in men and in hot-humid climates.
simple_sent: Tinea cruris, also known as jock itch, is a fungal infection of the groin region. It is usually found in hot-humid climates and in men, but it can also be in women.

ori_sentence: Intermenstrual bleeding, previously known as metrorrhagia, is uterine bleeding at irregular intervals, particularly between the expected menstrual periods.
simple_sent: Intermenstrual bleeding, also known as metrorrhagia, is bleeding during the menstrual cycle. It happens more often than people think.

ori_sentence: Isosorbide is a bicyclic chemical compound from the group of diols and the oxygen-containing heterocycles, containing two fused furan rings.
simple_sent: Isosorbide is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is E2O3. It has two fused furan rings and is a bicyclic chemical compound.

ori_sentence: The left colic artery is a branch of the inferior mesenteric artery.
simple_sent: The left colic artery is called the inferior mesenteric artery.

ori_sentence: Phosphofructokinase deficiency, is a rare muscular metabolic disorder, with an autosomal recessive inheritance pattern.
simple_sent: Phosphofructokinase deficiency, is a rare disease. It is found in very few people and is a recessive disorder.

ori_sentence: Trichiasis (/trɪkiˈeɪsɪs/ trik-ee-AY-sis, /trɪˈkaɪəsɪs/ tri-KEYE-ə-sis) is a medical term for abnormally positioned eyelashes that grow back toward the eye, touching the cornea or conjunctiva.
simple_sent: Trichiasis is a condition where the eyelashes of some people grow back in the wrong direction. This means that they touch the cornea or the conjunctiva of the eye.

ori_sentence: Obstructed defecation is "difficulty in evacuation or emptying the rectum [which] may occur even with frequent visits to the toilet and even with passing soft motions".
simple_sent: Obstructed defecation is "difficulty in emptying the rectum". It can happen even if the person goes to the toilet many times, and even when they have soft motions.

simple_sent: Developmental coordination disorder (DCD), also known as developmental motor coordination disorder, developmental dyspraxia or simply dyspraxia, is a neurodevelopmental disorder. People who have this disorder have problems with moving their body from one side to the other.

ori_sentence: Propofol, marketed as Diprivan, among other names, is a short-acting medication that results in a decreased level of consciousness and a lack of memory for events.
simple_sent: Propofol, also known as Diprivan, is a short-acting drug. When people take it, they have a lower level of consciousness and they do not remember things.

ori_sentence: Nelfinavir (NFV; brand name Viracept) is an antiretroviral drug used in the treatment of the human immunodeficiency virus (HIV).
simple_sent: Nelfinavir (also known as Viracept) is a drug. It is used to treat people with human immunodeficiency virus (HIV).

ori_sentence: Lipoblastoma is a type of subcutaneous benign fatty tumor.
simple_sent: Lipoblastoma is a small benign tumor in the brain.

ori_sentence: Myotonic dystrophy (DM) is a type of muscular dystrophy, a group of genetic disorders that cause progressive muscle loss and weakness.
simple_sent: Myotonic dystrophy (DM) is a type of muscular dystrophy. People who have this disease have progressive muscle loss.

ori_sentence: CREST syndrome, also known as the limited cutaneous form of systemic sclerosis (lcSSc), is a multisystem connective tissue disorder.
simple_sent: CREST syndrome, also called limited cutaneous sclerosis, limited cutaneous sclerosis or limited cutaneous sclerosis, is a disease.

ori_sentence: In the fetal heart, the foramen ovale (), also foramen Botalli, or the ostium secundum of Born, allows blood to enter the left atrium from the right atrium.
simple_sent: In the fetal heart, the foramen ovale allows blood to go from the right atrium to the left atrium. This is called the ostium secundum of Born.

simple_sent: Methotrexate (formerly known as amethopterin) is a drug. It is used to treat cancer.

simple_sent: Pityriasis alba is a skin condition. People who have it usually have dry, fine-scaled, pale areas on the face that look like a pimple.

ori_sentence: Dysesthesia (or dysaesthesia) means "abnormal sensation".
simple_sent: Dysesthesia means "not normal" or "not right".

simple_sent: Leukodystrophies are a group of diseases. They are usually inherited, and usually start in childhood.

simple_sent: Small intestine cancer is a type of cancer.

simple_sent: The mean corpuscular hemoglobin concentration (MCHC) shows how much hemoglobin there is in a given red blood cell.

ori_sentence: Korotkov sounds are the sounds that medical personnel listen for when they are taking blood pressure using a non-invasive procedure.
simple_sent: Korotkov sounds are the sounds that medical people listen for when they take their blood pressure. They use them to take blood pressure.

simple_sent: Giant-cell tumor of the bone. Giant-cell tumor of the bone (GCTOB).

simple_sent: A surgical drain is a tube that is used to remove fluid from a body part.

simple_sent: Dressler syndrome is a secondary form of pericarditis. It happens when the heart or pericardium is damaged.

simple_sent: Phenylmercuric nitrate is a chemical compound. It has a strong antiseptic and antifungal effect.

simple_sent: Schimmelpenning syndrome is a neurocutaneous condition in which one or more sebaceous nevi appear on the face or scalp. It is associated with problems in the central nervous system, the ocular system, the cardiovascular system and the gastrointestinal system.

simple_sent: Blood urea nitrogen (BUN) is a test to see how much urea there is in your blood.

simple_sent: The substantia propria is the thickest layer of the cornea of the eye. It is tough, unyielding, and completely transparent.

simple_sent: LDL apheresis is a medical procedure. It is done to take away the cholesterol-containing low-density lipoprotein (LDL) from the blood.

simple_sent: Pancreatic cancer is cancer of the pancreas. The pancreas is a small organ behind the stomach. It is a gland.

simple_sent: Actinic keratosis (AK) is an early stage of cancer. It is when the skin becomes very thick, scaly, or crusty.

ori_sentence: Dapsone, also known as diaminodiphenyl sulfone (DDS), is an antibiotic commonly used in combination with rifampicin and clofazimine for the treatment of leprosy.
simple_sent: Dapsone, also known as diaminodiphenyl sulfone (DDS), is an antibiotic. It is an antibiotic that is used to treat leprosy.

simple_sent: A liver abscess is a large mass inside the liver.

simple_sent: Leukocoria is an abnormal white reflection in the eye. It is also called white pupillary reflex.

simple_sent: Leber's hereditary optic neuropathy (LHON) is a degeneration of the retinal ganglion cells (RGCs) and their axons. The disease mainly affects young adult males, but it can affect any age or gender.

simple_sent: Cyclic vomiting syndrome (CVS) is a disease. It is a chronic, long-term condition.

simple_sent: Dysuria is when urination is difficult or painful.

simple_sent: Pine tree (or piñón)

simple_sent: Head and neck cancer is cancer of the head and neck. The most common types of head and neck cancer are cancer of the mouth, throat, nose, and sinuses.

simple_sent: Pityriasis rubra pilaris is a disease. People who have this disease have reddish orange scaling plaques and keratotic papules.

simple_sent: Sporotrichosis is a fungal infection. It can affect the skin, lungs, bone, and joints. It is also called rose handler's disease.

simple_sent: Lamivudine (also known as 3TC) is a medication. It is used to treat or prevent HIV/AIDS.

simple_sent: A craniopharyngioma is a type of brain tumor. It starts in the pituitary gland, but it can also happen in other parts of the brain.

simple_sent: Otosclerosis is a condition of the middle ear. In it, one or more parts of the bony otic capsule in the bony labyrinth are not as thick as they should be.

ori_sentence: Levo-Transposition of the great arteries is an acyanotic congenital heart defect in which the primary arteries (the aorta and the pulmonary artery) are transposed, with the aorta anterior and to the left of the pulmonary artery; the morphological left and right ventricles with their corresponding atrioventricular valves are also transposed.
simple_sent: The Levo-Transposition of the great arteries is a birth defect in which the two main arteries in the heart, the aorta and the pulmonary artery, are moved around. The left and right ventricles are also moved around, and the right side of the heart now has two atrioventricular valves instead of one.

simple_sent: Nephronophthisis is a genetic disease of the kidneys. It affects children.

simple_sent: WHIM Syndrome (or Warts, Hypogammaglobulinemia, Immunodeficiency, and Myelokathexis syndrome) is a disease. People who have the disease will have noncyclic neutropenia.

simple_sent: A Krukenberg tumor is a cancer of the ovary. It usually starts in the gastrointestinal tract, but it can also happen in other places, for example in the breast.
