simple_sent: A pterygium of the eye (plural pterygia or pterygiums) is a growth on the outside of the eye. It looks like a pinkish, triangular piece of tissue.

simple_sent: Diltiazem (also known as Cardizem) is a calcium channel blocker medication. It is used to treat high blood pressure and certain heart problems.

simple_sent: Ethylestrenol, also known as ethyloestrenol or ethylnandrol, is an androgen and anabolic steroid (AAS) medication which has been used in the past to promote weight gain and to treat anemia and osteoporosis. It is sold under the brand names Maxibolin and Orabolin but has been discontinued for use in humans.

simple_sent: Squinavir (also known as Invirase and Fortovase) is a drug that helps to prevent or treat HIV/AIDS. It is sold under the brand names Invirase and Fortovase.

simple_sent: The lateral sulcus (also called lateral fissure or Sylvian fissure) is a small opening in the human brain.

simple_sent: In medicine and medical anthropology, a culture-bound syndrome, culture-specific syndrome, or folk illness is a disease that is only known to exist in a certain society or culture, and can only be seen in that society or culture.

simple_sent: Bedaquiline (also known as Sirturo) is a drug. It is used to treat tuberculosis.

ori_sentence: Progeria is a specific type of progeroid syndrome, also known as Hutchinson-Gilford syndrome.

ori_sentence: Tocainide (Tonocard) is a class Ib antiarrhythmic agent.
simple_sent: Tocainide is an antiarrhythmic chemical.

ori_sentence: In pediatric medicine, acrocephalosyndactylia (or acrocephalosyndactyly) is the common presentation of craniosynostosis and syndactyly.
simple_sent: Acrocephalosyndactylia (also called acrocephalosyndactyly) is a condition where the brain does not work properly.

simple_sent: Cryoglobulinemia is a medical condition. In it, the blood has a lot of proteins called cryoglobulins. These are proteins that when they are at a low temperature, they do not work at all.

simple_sent: Antazoline (also known as naphazoline) is an antihistamine. It is used to help relieve nasal congestion. It is also used in eye drops to help relieve the symptoms of allergic conjunctivitis.

simple_sent: Pelizaeus-Merzbacher disease is an X-linked neurological disorder. It affects the central nervous system of the human body.

ori_sentence: Denys–Drash syndrome (DDS) or Drash syndrome is a rare disorder or syndrome characterized by gonadal dysgenesis, nephropathy, and Wilms' tumor.
simple_sent: Denys-Drash syndrome (DDS) or Drash syndrome is a rare disease. People who have the disease have gonadal dysgenesis and nephropathy.

ori_sentence: Fasciitis is an inflammation of the fascia, which is the connective tissue surrounding muscles, blood vessels and nerves.
simple_sent: Fascitis is an inflammation of the fascia. The fascia is the tissue that surrounds the muscles and nerves.

ori_sentence: Focal cortical dysplasia (FCD) is a congenital abnormality of brain development where the neurons in an area of the brain failed to migrate in the proper formation in utero.
simple_sent: Focal cortical dysplasia (FCD) is a defect in brain development. In this condition, the neurons in an area of the brain do not move properly during development.

ori_sentence: Hypophosphatasia (/ˌhaɪpoʊˈfɒsfeɪtˌeɪʒə/; also called deficiency of alkaline phosphatase, phosphoethanolaminuria, or Rathbun's syndrome; sometimes abbreviated HPP) is a rare, and sometimes fatal, metabolic bone disease.
simple_sent: Hypophosphatasia, also called alkaline phosphatase deficiency, phosphoethanolaminuria, or Rathbun's syndrome, is a disease of the bone. It is a rare, and sometimes fatal, metabolic bone disease.

ori_sentence: ICF syndrome (or Immunodeficiency, Centromere instability and Facial anomalies syndrome) is a very rare autosomal recessive immune disorder.
simple_sent: ICF syndrome (also called Immunodeficiency, Centromere instability and Facial anomalies syndrome) is a very rare disease.

ori_sentence: Polyploidy is a condition in which the cells of an organism have more than two paired (homologous) sets of chromosomes.
simple_sent: Polyploidy is when there are more than two sets of chromosomes in a cell. This is called polyploidy.

ori_sentence: Zolmitriptan, sold under the brand name Zomig among others, is a triptan used in the acute treatment of migraine attacks with or without aura and cluster headaches.
simple_sent: Zolmitriptan (also known as Zomig) is a triptan drug. It is used to treat migraine headaches. It can also be used to treat cluster headaches.

ori_sentence: Docosahexaenoic acid (DHA) is an omega-3 fatty acid that is a primary structural component of the human brain, cerebral cortex, skin, and retina.
simple_sent: Docosahexaenoic acid (DHA) is an important omega-3 fatty acid. DHA is found in the human brain, the skin, and the retina.

ori_sentence: Iron deficiency, or sideropenia, is the state in which a body lacks enough iron to supply its needs.
simple_sent: Iron deficiency is when the body does not have enough iron. This is called sideropenia.

ori_sentence: Anodontia is a rare genetic disorder characterized by the congenital absence of all primary or permanent teeth.
simple_sent: Anodontia is a rare genetic disorder. People who have it will not have any primary or permanent teeth.

ori_sentence: Pyridoxine, is a form of vitamin B6 found commonly in food and used as a dietary supplement.
simple_sent: Pyridoxine is a vitamin B6. It is usually found in food but can also be taken as a supplement.

ori_sentence: Miglitol is an oral anti-diabetic drug that acts by inhibiting the ability of the patient to break down complex carbohydrates into glucose.
simple_sent: Miglitol is an oral anti-diabetic drug. It works by not allowing the body to break down complex carbohydrates into glucose.

ori_sentence: Levothyroxine, also known as L-thyroxine, is a manufactured form of the thyroid hormone thyroxine (T4).
simple_sent: Levothyroxine (also known as L-thyroxine) is a chemical compound. It is a type of thyroid hormone.

ori_sentence: Monocytic leukemia is a type of myeloid leukemia characterized by a dominance of monocytes in the marrow.

ori_sentence: Galactosemia (British galactosaemia, from Greek γαλακτόζη + αίμα, meaning galactose + blood, accumulation of galactose in blood) is a rare genetic metabolic disorder that affects an individual's ability to metabolize the sugar galactose properly.
simple_sent: Galactosemia, also known as British galactosaemia, is a rare genetic metabolic disorder. It affects an individual's ability to metabolize the sugar galactose properly, and can cause serious health problems.

simple_sent: Cantamenial epilepsy is a form of epilepsy. In women, it is more common during the time of her menstrual cycle.

ori_sentence: Zolpidem, sold under the brand name Ambien, , is a medication primarily used for the short-term treatment of sleeping problems.
simple_sent: Zolpidem, also known as Ambien, is a short-term treatment for sleeping problems. It is sold under the brand name Ambien.

simple_sent: Lactose intolerance is a condition. It happens when a person can not digest lactose, a sugar in dairy products.

simple_sent: Eugenol is a chemical compound. It has an allyl chain added to it. Eugenol is a member of the allylbenzene class.

ori_sentence: Procaine is a local anesthetic drug of the amino ester group.
simple_sent: Procaine is an pain-killer. It is a local anesthetic.

ori_sentence: A gonad, sex gland, or reproductive gland is a mixed gland that produces the gametes and sex hormones of an organism.
simple_sent: A gonad, sex gland, or reproductive gland is a gland in the body that makes sex hormones and gametes.

simple_sent: Deflazacort (also known as Calcort) is a glucocorticoid. It is used as an anti-inflammatory drug.

ori_sentence: The myenteric plexus (or Auerbach's plexus) provides motor innervation to both layers of the muscular layer of the gut, having both parasympathetic and sympathetic input (although present ganglion cell bodies belong to parasympathetic innervation, fibers from sympathetic innervation also reach the plexus), whereas the submucous plexus has only parasympathetic fibers and provides secretomotor innervation to the mucosa nearest the lumen of the gut.

The submucous plexus has only parasympathetic fibers and provides secretomotor innervation to the mucosa nearest the lumen of the gut, but the parasympathetic fibers reach the myenteric plexus from the outside of the gut.

simple_sent: Hypovolemia is a condition in which there is an abnormally low amount of extracellular fluid in the body.

simple_sent: Echinococcosis is a disease. It is caused by Echinococcus tapeworms.

simple_sent: The Bartholin's glands are two small glands, about the size of a pea. They are on the left and right side of the vagina, slightly behind the vulva. They are called greater vestibular glands.

simple_sent: WAGR syndrome (also known as WAGR complex, Wilms tumour-aniridia syndrome, aniridia-Wilms tumour syndrome, and Wilms tumour-aniridia syndrome) is a rare disease. simple_sent: Adenoviral keratoconjunctivitis, also known as epidemic keratoconjunctivitis or keratoconjunctivitis epidemica, is a viral infection of the eye.

simple_sent: Salsalate is a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID). It is also known as salicylate.

ori_sentence: Endurance (also related to sufferance, resilience, constitution, fortitude, and hardiness) is the ability of an organism to exert itself and remain active for a long period of time, as well as its ability to resist, withstand, recover from, and have immunity to trauma, wounds, or fatigue.
simple_sent: Endurance (also related to sufferance, resilience, constitution, fortitude, and hardiness) is the ability of an organism to keep itself active for a long period of time, without getting tired. It is also the ability of an organism to survive trauma.

simple_sent: Conjoined twins are identical twins. They are sometimes called siamese twins because they look like them.

simple_sent: Cerivastatin is a drug.

simple_sent: Dust mite allergy, also called house dust allergy, is when people get an allergic reaction to dust mites.

simple_sent: Tricuspid atresia is a heart disease. In this case, the tricuspid valve is not there when a person is born.

simple_sent: Cetirizine (also known as Zyrtec) is a second-generation antihistamine. It is used to treat allergic rhinitis (commonly called hay fever), dermatitis, and urticaria.

simple_sent: Pentagastrin (also known as Peptavlon) is a synthetic polypeptide. It is also known as gastrin.

simple_sent: The left and right carotid arteries (also called the common carotid arteries) are arteries in the neck and head. They supply blood to the head and neck and are called the carotid arteries in English.

simple_sent: The sebaceous gland is a very small gland in the skin. It opens into a hair follicle (where the hair grows) and releases a liquid called sebum into the hair follicle.

simple_sent: The International Prostate Symptom Score (IPSS) is an eight-question written test to help people find out if they have prostate cancer. The test can also help people find out if they have symptoms of benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH).

simple_sent: The word auscultation comes from the Latin word auscultare. It means to listen to the body, usually with a stethoscope.

simple_sent: A Howell-Jolly body is a cytopathological finding in erythrocytes. They are basophilic nuclear remnants (clusters of DNA).

simple_sent: Retrognathia is a type of malocclusion. In this case, the maxilla or mandible is placed farther back than it should be. This makes the facial skeleton and soft tissues not fit together.

simple_sent: Acute kidney injury (AKI), also called acute renal failure (ARF), is when the kidney does not work the way it should. It usually starts within 7 days after a person has had a kidney infection.

ori_sentence: Salmeterol is a long-acting β2 adrenergic receptor agonist (LABA) used in the maintenance and prevention of asthma symptoms and maintenance of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) symptoms.
simple_sent: Salmeterol is a long-acting β2 adrenergic receptor agonist that is used to treat asthma. It is also used to help people with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD).

simple_sent: Photopsia is when there is light in the field of vision, but we do not see it.

simple_sent: A pericardial effusion is a fluid build-up in the pericardial cavity.

simple_sent: The one and a half syndrome is a rare disease. In this disease, both eyes can not move properly. One eye can not move at all, and the other cannot move at all.

simple_sent: Paclitaxel (also known as Taxol) is a chemotherapy drug. It is used to treat certain types of cancer, like breast cancer.

simple_sent: Diabetic embryopathy is when a child is born with diabetes. It is caused by mother's diabetes.

simple_sent: Laser hair removal is a method of hair removal. This is done by using laser light to destroy the hair follicle.

simple_sent: Contact dermatitis is a condition of the skin.

simple_sent: The maxillary nerve is a cranial nerve. It is one of the three nerve branches that make up the trigeminal nerve.

simple_sent: Severe combined immunodeficiency (SCID), also known as Swiss-type agammaglobulinemia, is a rare genetic disorder that causes the body to not produce enough T cells or B cells. There are many different types of SCID and they all have different symptoms.

simple_sent: 22q13 deletion syndrome, also known as Phelan-McDermid syndrome, is a genetic disorder. People with 22q13 deletion syndrome have a long arm on their chromosome 22.

simple_sent: Escitalopram (also known as Cipralex and Lexapro) is an antidepressant. It is a chemical that works by taking away the serotonin from the brain.

simple_sent: Stavudine (also known as Zerit) is an antiretroviral drug. It is used to prevent and treat HIV/AIDS.

ori_sentence: Loratadine, sold under the brand name Claritin among others, is a medication used to treat allergies.
simple_sent: Loratadine is a medication that is used to treat allergies. It is sold under the brand name Claritin.

ori_sentence: Orthopnea or orthopnoea is shortness of breath (dyspnea) that occurs when lying flat, causing the person to have to sleep propped up in bed or sitting in a chair.
simple_sent: Orthopnea or orthopnoea is shortness of breath (dyspnea) when a person is lying flat on their back. People who have it have to sleep propped up.

ori_sentence: The posterior ethmoidal nerve is a nerve of the orbit around the eye.
simple_sent: The ethmoidal nerve is a nerve in the back of the eye.

ori_sentence: Allodynia is a condition in which pain is caused by a stimulus that does not normally elicit pain.
simple_sent: Allodynia is when the pain is caused by something that does not normally cause pain.

ori_sentence: Intermittent pneumatic compression is a therapeutic technique used in medical devices that include an air pump and inflatable auxiliary sleeves, gloves or boots in a system designed to improve venous circulation in the limbs of patients who suffer edema or the risk of deep vein thrombosis (DVT) or pulmonary embolism (PE).
simple_sent: Intermittent pneumatic compression (IPC) is a medical device that uses an air pump to compress the blood vessels in the patient's legs. The goal is to improve circulation in the limbs of patients who have problems with blood flow, such as edema, pulmonary embolism or deep vein thrombosis.

ori_sentence: Frontal lobe disorder, also frontal lobe syndrome, is an impairment of the frontal lobe that occurs due to disease or frontal lobe injury.
simple_sent: The front part of the brain is called the frontal lobe. The front part of the mind is called the frontal lobe.

ori_sentence: A quadriceps tendon rupture is a tear of the tendon that runs from the quadriceps muscle to the top of the knee cap.
simple_sent: A quadriceps tendon tear is a tear in the quadriceps muscle. The tendon runs from the knee to the top of the knee.
