simple_sent: Meconium aspiration syndrome (MAS) is a medical condition. When a baby has meconium in their nose, they can not breathe.

ori_sentence: The coronal suture is a dense, fibrous connective tissue joint that separates the two parietal bones from the frontal bone of the skull.
simple_sent: The coronal suture is a joint in the skull. It is where the two parietal bones come together. It is a very dense tissue joint.

ori_sentence: Congenital muscular dystrophies are autosomal recessively-inherited muscle diseases.
simple_sent: Congenital muscular dystrophies: This condition is inherited from parents.

ori_sentence: Hypocapnia (from the Greek words υπό meaning below normal and καπνός kapnós meaning smoke), also known as hypocarbia, sometimes incorrectly called acapnia, is a state of reduced carbon dioxide in the blood.
simple_sent: Hypocapnia is a state of reduced carbon dioxide in the blood. It is also known as hypocarbia, sometimes incorrectly called acapnia. The name comes from the Greek words υπό meaning below normal and kapnós meaning smoke.

ori_sentence: In the kidney, the macula densa is an area of closely packed specialized cells lining the wall of the distal tubule, at the point where the thick ascending limb of the Loop of Henle meets the distal convoluted tubule.
simple_sent: In the kidney, the macula densa is an area of specialized cells that line the wall of the distal tubule. At this point, the thick ascending limb of the Loop of Henle meets the distal convoluted tubule.

ori_sentence: Hypochondroplasia (HCH) is a developmental disorder caused by an autosomal dominant genetic defect in the fibroblast growth factor receptor 3 gene (FGFR3) that results in a disproportionately short stature, micromelia and a head that appears large in comparison with the underdeveloped portions of the body.
simple_sent: Hypochondroplasia (HCH) is a developmental disorder. It is caused by a genetic defect in the fibroblast growth factor receptor 3 (FGFR3) gene. Because of this, people with HCH have a short stature and a head that looks large compared to their body size.

ori_sentence: Epithelioid hemangioendothelioma (eHAE) is a rare tumor, first characterized by Sharon Weiss and Franz Enzinger in 1982 that both clinically and histologically is intermediate between angiosarcoma and hemangioma.
simple_sent: Epithelioid hemangioendothelioma (eHAE) is a very rare tumor. It is found in very few people and is the third most common malignant tumor in the world after angiosarcoma and hemangioma.

ori_sentence: Zonisamide, sold under the brand name Zonegran, is a medication used to treat the symptoms of epilepsy and Parkinson's disease.
simple_sent: Zonisamide (also known as Zonegran) is a drug. It is used to treat Parkinson's disease and other conditions.

ori_sentence: Erythromycin is an antibiotic used for the treatment of a number of bacterial infections.
simple_sent: Erythromycin is an antibiotic. It is used to treat certain bacterial infections.

ori_sentence: Jamaican vomiting sickness, also known as toxic hypoglycemic syndrome (THS), acute ackee fruit intoxication, or ackee poisoning, is an acute illness caused by the toxins hypoglycin
simple_sent: Jamaican vomiting sickness, also known as Ackee poisoning or toxic hypoglycemic syndrome (THS), is a disease. It is caused by the toxins in ackee fruit.

ori_sentence: Paresthesia is an abnormal sensation of the skin (tingling, pricking, chilling, burning, numbness) with no apparent physical cause.
simple_sent: Paresthesia is a strange sensation in the skin. It feels like something is pricking or burning on the skin, but it is not.

ori_sentence: Selenium deficiency occurs when an organism lacks the required levels of selenium, a critical nutrient in many species.
simple_sent: Selenium deficiency happens when an organism does not have enough selenium. Many species need selenium to live.

ori_sentence: Perianal hematoma is a hematoma located in, or on the border of the anus.
simple_sent: A perianal hematoma is a hematoma that can be found near the anus.

ori_sentence: Dysdiadochokinesia (DDK) is the medical term for an impaired ability to perform rapid, alternating movements (i.e., diadochokinesia).
simple_sent: Dysdiadochokinesia (DDK) is a medical term. This means that it is hard for the person to do fast or slow movements.

ori_sentence: Gastrinomas are neuroendocrine tumors (NETs), usually located in the duodenum or pancreas, that secrete gastrin and cause a clinical syndrome known as Zollinger-Ellison syndrome (ZES).
simple_sent: Gastrinomas are tumors in the duodenum or pancreas. These tumors make gastrin and cause a disease called Zollinger-Ellison syndrome (ZES).

ori_sentence: Cabergoline, sold under the brand name Dostinex among others, is a dopaminergic medication used in the treatment of high prolactin levels, prolactinomas, Parkinson's disease, and for other indications.
simple_sent: Cabergoline, sold under the brand name Dostinex among others, is a drug that is used to treat high levels of prolactin in the blood. It is also used to treat Parkinson's disease.

ori_sentence: Desipramine, sold under the brand name Norpramin among others, is a tricyclic antidepressant (TCA) used in the treatment of depression.
simple_sent: Desipramine (also known as Norpramin) is a tricyclic antidepressant. It is used to treat depression and anxiety.

ori_sentence: Umbilical cord prolapse is when the umbilical cord comes out of the uterus with or before the presenting part of the baby.
simple_sent: Umbilical cord prolapse is when the umbilical cord comes out of the mother before the baby is born.

ori_sentence: In cardiology, an Austin Flint murmur is a low-pitched rumbling heart murmur which is best heard at the cardiac apex.
simple_sent: An Austin Flint murmur is a heart murmur. In cardiology, it is the most common heart murmur in people.

ori_sentence: Activities of daily living (ADLs or ADL) is a term used in healthcare to refer to people's daily self-care activities.
simple_sent: Activities of daily living (ADLs or ADL) are activities that people do every day to help themselves.

ori_sentence: Post-polio syndrome (PPS, poliomyelitis sequelae) is a group of latent symptoms of poliomyelitis (polio), occurring at about a 25–40% rate (latest data greater than 80%).
simple_sent: Post-polio syndrome (PPS, poliomyelitis sequelae) occurs in about 25-40% of cases. But in some cases, it may occur at a rate of more than 80%.

ori_sentence: A melanocytoma is a rare pigmented tumor that has been described as a variant of the melanocytic nevus and is a derivative of the neural crest.
simple_sent: A melanocytoma is a rare type of tumor that looks like a dark spot on the skin. It is similar to the melanocytic nevus.

ori_sentence: The Triangular fibrocartilage complex (TFCC) is formed by the triangular fibrocartilage discus (TFC), the radioulnar ligaments (RULs) and the ulnocarpal ligaments (UCLs).
simple_sent: The Triangular fibrocartilage complex (TFCC) is a complex of ligaments. The three main parts of the complex are the fibrocartilage discus and the radioulnar ligaments.

ori_sentence: Entropion is a medical condition in which the eyelid (usually the lower lid) folds inward.
simple_sent: Entropion is a medical condition. When this happens, the lower lid of the eyelid folds inward.

ori_sentence: Sleep apnea, also spelled sleep apnoea, is a sleep disorder in which pauses in breathing or periods of shallow breathing during sleep
simple_sent: Sleep apnea (also called sleep apnoea) is when a person's breathing becomes short and shallow during sleep.

ori_sentence: Ocular dominance, sometimes called eye preference or eyedness, is the tendency to prefer visual input from one eye to the other.
simple_sent: Ocular dominance, also called eye preference or eyedness, is when one eye focuses more on something than the other.

ori_sentence: Oral allergy syndrome (OAS) is a type of food allergy classified by a cluster of allergic reactions in the mouth and throat in response to eating certain (usually fresh) fruits, nuts, and vegetables that typically develops in adults with hay fever.
simple_sent: Oral allergy syndrome (OAS) is a type of food allergy. People who have the disease will have allergic reactions in the mouth and throat when they eat certain foods. This usually happens when they eat fresh fruits and vegetables.

ori_sentence: Catarrh is an exudate of inflamed mucous membranes in one of the airways or cavities of the body, usually with reference to the throat and paranasal sinuses.
simple_sent: Catarrh is a liquid made from mucous membranes in one of the airways or cavities of the body. It is usually made in the paranasal sinuses.

ori_sentence: Hypercholesterolemia, also called high cholesterol, is the presence of high levels of cholesterol in the blood.
simple_sent: Hypercholesterolemia, also called high cholesterol, is when cholesterol levels are too high in the blood.

ori_sentence: Macrocytosis is the enlargement of red blood cells with near-constant hemoglobin concentration, and is defined by a mean corpuscular volume (MCV) of greater than 100 femtolitres (the precise criterion varies between laboratories).
simple_sent: Macrocytosis is the growth of red blood cells with a high amount of hemoglobin. It is measured by a mean corpuscular volume (MCV) of more than 100 femtolitres. The MCV varies between laboratories.

ori_sentence: Isoniazid, also known as isonicotinic acid hydrazide (INH), is an antibiotic used for the treatment of tuberculosis.
simple_sent: Isoniazid, also known as isonicotinic acid hydrazide, is a chemical compound. It is an antibiotic.

ori_sentence: Platypnea or platypnoea is shortness of breath (dyspnea) that is relieved when lying down, and worsens when sitting or standing.
simple_sent: Platypnea or platypnoea is a shortness of breath (dyspnea). When they are lying down, they do not have this problem.

ori_sentence: Tinea corporis is a fungal infection of the body, similar to other forms of tinea.
simple_sent: Tinea corporis is a fungal infection of the body. It is similar to smallpox.

ori_sentence: Specific language impairment (SLI)
simple_sent: Specific language syndrome (SLS)

ori_sentence: An epigastric hernia is a type of hernia that causes fat to push through a weakened area in the walls of the abdomen.
simple_sent: An epigastric hernia is a hernia in the wall of the abdomen. The fat in the area gets pushed through.

ori_sentence: Panniculitis is a group of diseases whose hallmark is inflammation of subcutaneous adipose tissue (the fatty layer under the skin – panniculus adiposus).
simple_sent: Panniculitis is a group of diseases that cause inflammation of the panniculus adiposus (the fatty layer under the skin).

ori_sentence: Pargyline (brand name Eutonyl) is an irreversible selective monoamine oxidase (MAO)-B inhibitor drug (IC50 for MAO-A
simple_sent: Pargyline (also known as Eutonyl) is a drug. It is an irreversible monoamine oxidase (MAO) inhibitor.

ori_sentence: Echopraxia (also known as echokinesis) is the involuntary repetition or imitation of another person's actions.
simple_sent: Echopraxia (also known as echokinesis) is when a person does something without thinking about it.

ori_sentence: Eprosartan is an angiotensin II receptor antagonist used for the treatment of high blood pressure.
simple_sent: Eprosartan is a drug. It works by attacking the angiotensin II receptor in the blood.

ori_sentence: Keratoacanthoma (KA) is a common low-grade (unlikely to metastasize or invade) rapidly-growing skin tumour that is believed to originate from the hair follicle (pilosebaceous unit) and can resemble squamous cell carcinoma.
simple_sent: Keratoacanthoma (KA) is a common low-grade (not likely to spread or become bigger) skin tumor that grows very quickly. It usually starts in the hair follicle and can look like squamous cell carcinoma.

ori_sentence: Vemurafenib (INN, marketed as Zelboraf) is an inhibitor of the B-Raf enzyme developed by Plexxikon (now part of Daiichi-Sankyo) and Genentech for the treatment of late-stage melanoma.
simple_sent: Vemurafenib (also known as Zelboraf) is an inhibitor of the B-Raf enzyme. It is used to treat melanoma. It was developed by Plexxikon and Genentech.

ori_sentence: Autoimmune hepatitis, formerly called lupoid hepatitis, is a chronic, autoimmune disease of the liver that occurs when the body's immune system attacks liver cells, causing the liver to be inflamed.
simple_sent: Autoimmune hepatitis is an autoimmune disease of the liver. When the body's immune system attacks the liver cells, the liver becomes inflamed and can not function properly.

ori_sentence: The posterior superior alveolar branches (posterior superior dental branches) arise from the of the maxillary nerve just before it enters the infraorbital groove; they are generally two in number, but sometimes arise by a single trunk.
simple_sent: The posterior superior alveolar branches come from the maxillary nerve just before it enters the infraorbital groove. They are usually two in number, but sometimes a single trunk comes from the front branches.

ori_sentence: Brain herniation is a potentially deadly side effect of very high pressure within the skull that occurs when a part of the brain is squeezed across structures within the skull.
simple_sent: Brain herniation is a very bad side effect of very high pressure in the skull. When this happens, a part of the brain is pushed into other parts of the skull.

ori_sentence: The sagittal suture, also known as the interparietal suture and the sutura interparietalis, is a dense, fibrous connective tissue joint between the two parietal bones of the skull.
simple_sent: The sagittal suture (also called the interparietal suture) is a joint between the two parietal bones of the skull. It is also called the interparietal suture.

ori_sentence: The posterior chamber is a narrow space behind the peripheral part of the iris, and in front of the suspensory ligament of the lens and the ciliary processes.
simple_sent: The posterior chamber is a narrow space behind the iris. The ciliary processes and the suspensory ligament in front of the lens are in this chamber.

ori_sentence: Milker's nodules are a cutaneous condition that is most commonly transmitted from the udders of infected cows.
simple_sent: Milker's nodules are usually found in cows. The disease is most often found in the udders of cows.

ori_sentence: A habit (or wont as a humorous and formal term) is a routine of behavior that is repeated regularly and tends to occur subconsciously.
simple_sent: A habit (or wont as a more formal term) is something that people do often. They do it because it is comfortable for them.

ori_sentence: Premenstrual syndrome (PMS) refers to emotional and physical symptoms that regularly occur in the one to two weeks before the start of each menstrual period.
simple_sent: Premenstrual syndrome (PMS) is a medical condition. It usually starts one to two weeks before the first period of your menstrual cycle.

ori_sentence: Reactive arthritis, formerly known as Reiter's syndrome, is a form of inflammatory arthritis that develops in response to an infection in another part of the body (cross-reactivity).
simple_sent: Reactive arthritis, once called Reiter's syndrome, is a type of arthritis. It happens when the body tries to fight off an infection in another part of the body.

ori_sentence: Hypersalivation, or ptyalism, also known as hypersialorrhea or hypersialosis is the excessive production of saliva.
simple_sent: Hypersalivation, or ptyalism, is when people make too much saliva. It is also called hypersialorrhea.

ori_sentence: Melanosis coli, also pseudomelanosis coli, is a disorder of pigmentation of the wall of the colon, often identified at the time of colonoscopy.
simple_sent: Melanosis coli, also called pseudomelanosis coli, is an infection of the wall of the colon. It is usually found during a colonoscopy.

ori_sentence: Cortisone is a pregnane (21-carbon) steroid hormone.
simple_sent: Cortisone is a human sex steroid hormone.

ori_sentence: Paliperidone, sold under the trade name Invega among others, is an atypical antipsychotic.
simple_sent: Paliperidone is an atypical antipsychotic drug. It is sold under the name Invega.

ori_sentence: Egomania is psychiatric term used to describe excessive preoccupation with one's ego, identity or self and applies the same preoccupation to anyone who follows one’s own ungoverned impulses, is possessed by delusions of personal greatness & grandeur and feels a lack of appreciation.
simple_sent: Egomania is a psychiatric term used to describe a person who has a lot of interest in their ego, identity or self. Egomania can also be used to describe people who feel that they are not good enough, or that they are not good enough.

ori_sentence: Hyphema is a condition that occurs when blood enters the front (anterior) chamber of the eye between the iris and the cornea.
simple_sent: Hyphema is when blood comes into the eye from the outside. This happens between the iris and the cornea.

ori_sentence: A degloving injury is a type of avulsion in which an extensive section of skin is completely torn off the underlying tissue, severing its blood supply.
simple_sent: A degloving injury is an injury to the skin. In this case, a large section of skin is torn off, and the blood supply is cut off.

ori_sentence: Sturge–Weber syndrome, sometimes referred to as encephalotrigeminal angiomatosis, is a rare congenital neurological and skin disorder.
simple_sent: Sturge-Weber syndrome is a rare neurological and skin disorder. It is sometimes called encephalotrigeminal angiomatosis.

ori_sentence: The dural venous sinuses (also called dural sinuses, cerebral sinuses, or cranial sinuses) are venous channels found between the endosteal and meningeal layers of dura mater in the brain.
simple_sent: The dural venous sinuses (also called dural sinuses, cerebral sinuses, or cranial sinuses) are a set of blood vessels in the brain. They are found between the meningeal and endosteal layers.

ori_sentence: Agnosia is the inability to process sensory information.
simple_sent: Agnosia is not able to process information well.

ori_sentence: Pseudohypoparathyroidism is a condition associated primarily with resistance to the parathyroid hormone.
simple_sent: Pseudohypoparathyroidism is a condition. It happens when the parathyroid hormone is not working properly.

ori_sentence: Metyrapone, sold under the brand name Metopirone, is a medication which is used in the diagnosis of adrenal insufficiency and occasionally in the treatment of Cushing's syndrome (hypercortisolism).
simple_sent: Metyrapone (also known as Metopirone) is a medication that is taken for the treatment of adrenal insufficiency. It is also used to treat Cushing's syndrome (hypercortisolism).

ori_sentence: Axonal transport, also called axoplasmic transport or axoplasmic flow, is a cellular process responsible for movement of mitochondria, lipids, synaptic vesicles, proteins, and other organelles to and from a neuron's cell body, through the cytoplasm of its axon called the axoplasm.
simple_sent: Axonal transport, also called axoplasmic transport or axoplasmic flow, is a cellular process in which organelles move from one part of the cell to another. Organelles move mitochondria, lipids, synaptic vesicles, proteins, and other things through the cytoplasm.

ori_sentence: Azotemia (azot, "nitrogen" + -emia, "blood condition") is a medical condition characterized by abnormally high levels of nitrogen-containing compounds (such as urea, creatinine, various body waste compounds, and other nitrogen-rich compounds) in the blood.
simple_sent: Azotemia (azot, "nitrogen" + -emia, "blood condition") is a medical condition where the blood has very high levels of nitrogen in it. This is because many things in the body have nitrogen in them, like urea and creatinine.

ori_sentence: Chronic thromboembolic pulmonary hypertension (CTEPH) is a long-term disease caused by a blockage in the blood vessels that deliver blood from the heart to the lungs (the pulmonary arterial tree).
simple_sent: Chronic thromboembolic pulmonary hypertension (CTEPH) happens when the blood vessels in the lungs that carry blood (the pulmonary arterial tree) do not work properly.

ori_sentence: Palpation is the process of using one's hands to check the body, especially while perceiving/diagnosing a disease or illness.
simple_sent: Palpation is the use of one's hands to check the body. It can also be used to find out about a disease or illness.

ori_sentence: Myeloma cast nephropathy, also referred to as light-chain cast nephropathy, is the formation of plugs (urinary casts) in the kidney tubules from free immunoglobulin light chains leading to kidney failure in the context of multiple myeloma.
simple_sent: Myeloma cast nephropathy, also known as light-chain cast nephropathy, is a disease that causes plugs to form in the kidney tubules. In people with multiple myeloma, this can lead to kidney failure.

ori_sentence: Azoospermia is the medical condition of a man whose semen contains no sperm.
simple_sent: Azoospermia is when a man's semen does not have any sperm in it.

ori_sentence: Sirenomelia, also called mermaid syndrome, is a rare congenital deformity in which the legs are fused together, giving the appearance of a mermaid's tail, hence the nickname.
simple_sent: Sirenomelia is a rare condition. When a person is born with the condition, their legs are fused together. This looks like a mermaid's tail, and is called mermaid syndrome.

ori_sentence: The pelvic floor or pelvic diaphragm is composed of muscle fibers of the levator ani, the coccygeus muscle, and associated connective tissue which span the area underneath the pelvis.
simple_sent: The pelvic floor or pelvic diaphragm is the area under the pelvis where the human pelvis meets the ground. It is made up of the levator ani and coccygeus muscle.

ori_sentence: Myopericytoma is a rare perivascular soft tissue tumour.
simple_sent: Myopericytoma is a rare soft tissue cancer.

ori_sentence: An accessory navicular bone is an accessory bone of the foot that occasionally develops abnormally in front of the ankle towards the inside of the foot.
simple_sent: An accessory navicular bone is a bone in the foot. It is usually near the inside of the foot, but sometimes it is in front of the ankle.

ori_sentence: A nuchal cord is when the umbilical cord becomes wrapped around the fetus's neck.
simple_sent: The nuchal cord is the umbilical cord that goes from the mother to the baby.

ori_sentence: In physiology, base excess and base deficit refer to an excess or deficit, respectively, in the amount of base present in the blood.
simple_sent: In physiology, base excess and base deficit mean that the amount of base in the blood is higher than it should be.

ori_sentence: Sibutramine, formerly sold under the brand name Meridia among others, is an appetite suppressant which has been discontinued in many countries.
simple_sent: Sibutramine is an appetite suppressant. It used to be sold under the brand name Meridia in many countries, but it is no longer.

ori_sentence: Amyloidosis is a group of diseases in which abnormal proteins, known as amyloid fibrils, build up in tissue.
simple_sent: Amyloidosis is a disease where abnormal proteins (called amyloid fibrils) build up in the body.

ori_sentence: Tadalafil, sold under the brand name Cialis among others, is a medication used to treat erectile dysfunction (ED), benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH), and pulmonary arterial hypertension.
simple_sent: Tadalafil (also known as Cialis) is a drug that is used to treat erectile dysfunction. It is also used to treat benign prostatic hyperplasia and pulmonary arterial hypertension.

ori_sentence: Hospital-acquired pneumonia (HAP) or nosocomial pneumonia refers to any pneumonia contracted by a patient in a hospital at least 48–72 hours after being admitted.
simple_sent: Hospital-acquired pneumonia (HAP) or nosocomial pneumonia is when a person gets pneumonia in a hospital, but they do not get it very often.

ori_sentence: Praziquantel (PZQ), sold under the brandname Biltricide among others, is a medication used to treat a number of types of parasitic worm infections in mammals, birds, amphibians, reptiles, and fish.
simple_sent: Praziquantel (PZQ), also known as Biltricide, is an anti-parasitic drug. It is used to treat certain types of worm infections in birds, fish, mammals, and amphibians.

ori_sentence: Betaxolol is a selective beta1 receptor blocker used in the treatment of hypertension and glaucoma.
simple_sent: Betaxolol is a drug. It is used to treat glaucoma and high blood pressure.

ori_sentence: Cabozantinib, sold under the brand names Cometriq and Cabometyx among others, is a medication used to treat medullary thyroid cancer, renal cell carcinoma, and hepatocellular carcinoma.
simple_sent: Cabozantinib (also known as Cometriq and Cabometyx) is a drug that is used to treat thyroid cancer. It is also used to treat renal cell carcinoma and hepatocellular carcinoma.

ori_sentence: A pelvic fracture is a break of the bony structure of the pelvis.
simple_sent: A pelvic fracture is a break in the pelvis (lower back).

ori_sentence: Sacroiliac joint dysfunction generally refers to pain in the sacroiliac joint region that is caused by abnormal motion in the sacroiliac joint, either too much motion or too little motion.
simple_sent: Sacroiliac joint dysfunction is pain in the sacroiliac joint when there is too much motion or not enough motion in the sacroiliac joint. This is called sacroiliac joint dysfunction.

ori_sentence: The oculomotor nerve is the third cranial nerve (CN III).
simple_sent: The oculomotor nerve is a nerve in the eye.

ori_sentence: Muscle hypertrophy or muscle building involves a hypertrophy or increase in size of skeletal muscle through a growth in size of its component cells.
simple_sent: Muscle hypertrophy is a growth in the size of skeletal muscle cells. When people build muscle, they also increase the size of their cells.

ori_sentence: Myelolipoma (myelo-, from the ancient greek μυελός, marrow; lipo, meaning of, or pertaining to, fat; -oma, meaning tumor or mass) is a benign tumor-like lesion composed of mature adipose (fat) tissue and haematopoietic (blood-forming) elements in various proportions.
simple_sent: Myelolipoma (myelo-, from the ancient greek μυελός, marrow; lipo, meaning of, or pertaining to, fat; -oma, meaning tumor or mass) is a benign tumor-like lesion in the bone. There are many different kinds of myelolipoma, depending on how old the person is.

ori_sentence: Myotomy is a surgical procedure in which muscle is cut.
simple_sent: Myotomy is a special surgery. The muscle is cut.

ori_sentence: Bentiromide is a peptide used as a screening test for exocrine pancreatic insufficiency and to monitor the adequacy of supplemental pancreatic therapy.
simple_sent: Bentiromide is a peptide. It is used to test if a person has pancreatic insufficiency (not having enough energy to eat) and to monitor therapy.

ori_sentence: A tremor is an involuntary, somewhat rhythmic, muscle contraction and relaxation involving oscillations or twitching movements of one or more body parts.
simple_sent: A tremor is an involuntary muscle contraction or relaxation. It is usually caused by movement in one or more body parts that are not working properly.

ori_sentence: Axonotmesis is an injury to the peripheral nerve of one of the extremities of the body.
simple_sent: Axonotmesis is an injury to the central nervous system in the body.

ori_sentence: Bacillary angiomatosis (BA) is a form of angiomatosis associated with bacteria of the genus Bartonella.
simple_sent: Bacillary angiomatosis (BA) is a disease. It is caused by bacteria in the Bartonella genus.

ori_sentence: Becker's nevus (also known as "Becker's melanosis", "Becker's pigmentary hamartoma", "nevoid melanosis", and "pigmented hairy epidermal nevus") is a benign skin disorder predominantly affecting males.
simple_sent: Becker's nevus (also called Becker's melanosis, Becker's pigmentary hamartoma, or just nevus) is a skin disorder. It mostly affects males, but can also affect females.

ori_sentence: Hypokalemia is a low level of potassium (K+) in the blood serum.
simple_sent: Hypokalemia is when there is too little potassium in the blood.

ori_sentence: Locked-in syndrome (LIS), also known as pseudocoma, is a condition in which a patient is aware but cannot move or communicate verbally due to complete paralysis of nearly all voluntary muscles in the body except for vertical eye movements and blinking.
simple_sent: Locked-in syndrome (LIS), also known as pseudocoma, is a condition in which the patient does not know what is going on. The patient can not move or talk because the muscles in his or her body are all paralyzed.

ori_sentence: Sitosterolemia is a rare autosomal recessively inherited lipid metabolic disorder.
simple_sent: Sitosterolemia is a rare disease. It is an inherited lipid metabolic disorder.

ori_sentence: Renal osteodystrophy/adynamic bone disease is currently defined as an alteration of bone morphology in patients with chronic kidney disease (CKD).
simple_sent: Renal osteodystrophy/adynamic bone disease is a disease where the bone in the kidney does not develop properly. This is called renal failure.

ori_sentence: Carglumic acid, sold under the brand name Carbaglu among others, is used for the treatment of hyperammonaemia.
simple_sent: Carglumic acid is also used to treat hyperammonaemia. It is sold under the brand name Carbaglu.

ori_sentence: Bacterial vaginosis (BV) is a disease of the vagina caused by excessive growth of bacteria.
simple_sent: Bacterial vaginosis is a disease. It happens when bacteria grow too much in the vagina.

ori_sentence: An epispadias is a rare type of malformation in which the urethra ends, in males, in an opening on the upper aspect of the penis, and in females when the urethra develops too far anteriorly.
simple_sent: An epispadias is a rare condition. In this case, the urethra ends in an opening on the upper side of the penis. In other cases, the urethra develops too far forward.

ori_sentence: Hydrochlorothiazide (HCTZ or HCT) is a diuretic medication often used to treat high blood pressure and swelling due to fluid build up.
simple_sent: Hydrochlorothiazide (HCTZ or HCT) is a diuretic drug. It is used to treat high blood pressure and other problems with the body.

ori_sentence: Ototoxicity is the property of being toxic to the ear (oto-), specifically the cochlea or auditory nerve and sometimes the vestibular system, for example, as a side effect of a drug.
simple_sent: Ototoxicity is the property of a drug or other substance to be toxic to the ear (oto-), especially the cochlea or auditory nerve. This is usually a side effect of the drug.

ori_sentence: Dermatophytosis, also known as ringworm, is a fungal infection of the skin.
simple_sent: Dermatophytosis is a skin disease. It is also called ringworm.

ori_sentence: Sodium benzoate is the sodium salt of benzoic acid, widely used as a food preservative and pickling agent.
simple_sent: Sodium benzoate is used as a food preservative. It is also used to make pickling easier.

ori_sentence: Acute intermittent porphyria (AIP) is a rare metabolic disorder affecting the production of heme resulting from a deficiency of the porphobilinogen deaminase.
simple_sent: Acute intermittent porphyria (AIP) is a rare disease. It happens when the body does not produce heme because of a lack of deaminase.

ori_sentence: Acute interstitial pneumonitis is a rare, severe lung disease that usually affects otherwise healthy individuals.
simple_sent: Acute interstitial pneumonitis is a very rare disease. It usually does not affect people who are healthy.

ori_sentence: Triamterene (trade name Dyrenium among others) is a potassium-sparing diuretic often used in combination with thiazide diuretics for the treatment of high blood pressure or swelling.
simple_sent: Triamterene is a potassium-sparing diuretic. It is used to treat high blood pressure or other problems where the blood pressure is too high.

ori_sentence: Emphysema, or pulmonary emphysema, is a lower respiratory tract disease, characterised by air-filled spaces (pneumatoses) in the lung, that can vary in size and may be very large.
simple_sent: Emphysema, or pulmonary emphysema, is a disease of the lung. People with emphysema have air-filled spaces (pneumatoses) in the lung. These spaces can be very large.

ori_sentence: An empyema (/ˌɛmpaɪˈiːmə/) is a collection or gathering of pus within a naturally existing anatomical cavity.
simple_sent: An empyema (pronounced) is a collection of pus in the body. It is a natural part of the body.

ori_sentence: A Baker's cyst, also known as a popliteal cyst, is a type of fluid collection behind the knee.
simple_sent: A Baker's cyst, also called a popliteal cyst, is a cyst that is found behind the knee.

ori_sentence: Symmetrical drug-related intertriginous and flexural exanthema (SDRIFE), more popularly known as baboon syndrome because of its resemblance to the distinctive red buttocks displayed by female baboons, is a systemic contact dermatitis characterized by well-demarcated patches of erythema distributed symmetrically on the buttocks.
simple_sent: Symmetrical drug-related intertriginous and flexural exanthema (SDRIFE), more popularly known as baboon syndrome because it looks like female baboons, is a disease that causes red patches of erythema on the buttocks. People who have the disease have red buttocks.

ori_sentence: Hirschsprung's disease (HD or HSCR) is a birth defect in which nerves are missing from parts of the intestine.
simple_sent: Hirschsprung's disease is a birth defect. In this disease, parts of the intestine are missing.

ori_sentence: The parietal lobe is one of the four major lobes of the cerebral cortex in the brain of mammals.
simple_sent: The parietal lobe is a part of the brain. In mammals, it is one of four major lobes.

ori_sentence: A Bankart lesion is an injury of the anterior (inferior) glenoid labrum of the shoulder.
simple_sent: A Bankart lesion is an injury to the shoulder. This is called a glenoid labrum injury.

ori_sentence: Vulvar cancer is a cancer of the vulva, the outer portion of the female genitals.
simple_sent: Vulvar cancer is a cancer of the vulva. It is the most common cancer in women.

ori_sentence: Bartonellosis is an infectious disease produced by bacteria of the genus Bartonella.
simple_sent: Bartonellosis is a disease. The bacteria that cause it are called Bartonella.

ori_sentence: Basal-cell carcinoma (BCC), also known as basal-cell cancer, is the most common type of skin cancer.
simple_sent: Basal cell cancer (BCC) is a cancer of the skin. It is the most common skin cancer.

ori_sentence: Atrial fibrillation (AF or A-fib) is an abnormal heart rhythm (arrhythmia) characterized by rapid and irregular beating of the atrial chambers of the heart.
simple_sent: Atrial fibrillation (AF or A-fib) is a heart rhythm problem. It happens when the heart is beating too fast or too slow, or both at the same time.

ori_sentence: Alport syndrome is a genetic disorder affecting around 1 in 5,000-10,000 children, characterized by glomerulonephritis, end-stage kidney disease, and hearing loss.
simple_sent: Alport syndrome is a genetic disorder. About 1 in 5,000-10,000 children in the world have it, and most of them do not even know they have it.

ori_sentence: Acute disseminated encephalomyelitis (ADEM), or acute demyelinating encephalomyelitis, is a rare autoimmune disease marked by a sudden, widespread attack of inflammation in the brain and spinal cord.
simple_sent: Acute disseminated encephalomyelitis (ADEM), also called acute demyelinating encephalomyelitis, is a disease that happens very quickly. It causes inflammation in the brain and spinal cord.

ori_sentence: Ellis–Van Creveld syndrome (also called mesoectodermal dysplasia but see '' section below) is a rare genetic disorder of the skeletal dysplasia type.
simple_sent: Ellis-Van Creveld syndrome is a rare genetic disorder. It is also called mesoectodermal dysplasia, but that is not the same as the disease.

ori_sentence: The papillary muscles are muscles located in the ventricles of the heart.
simple_sent: The papillary muscles are a group of muscles in the heart.

ori_sentence: A bactericide or bacteriocide, sometimes abbreviated Bcidal, is a substance which kills bacteria.
simple_sent: A bactericide is a chemical that kills bacteria. It is also called bacteriocide.

ori_sentence: Babinski–Nageotte syndrome is an alternating brainstem syndrome.
simple_sent: Babinski-Nageotte syndrome is a rare medical condition.

ori_sentence: A midlife crisis is a transition of identity and self-confidence that can occur in middle-aged individuals, typically 45 to 65 years old.
simple_sent: A midlife crisis is a change in self-confidence and identity. It usually happens in people who are 45 to 65 years old.

ori_sentence: Dupuytren's contracture (also called Dupuytren's disease, Morbus Dupuytren, Viking disease, and Celtic hand) is a condition in which one or more fingers become permanently bent in a flexed position.
simple_sent: Dupuytren's contracture (also called Morbus Dupuytren and Celtic hand) is a disease. In this condition, one or more fingers become permanently bent in a certain direction.

ori_sentence: Microsporidiosis is an opportunistic intestinal infection that causes diarrhea and wasting in immunocompromised individuals (HIV, for example).
simple_sent: Microsporidiosis is an infection of the gastrointestinal tract. It can cause diarrhea and sometimes even death if not treated.

ori_sentence: Cervicocranial syndrome or (Craniocervical Junction Syndrome: CCJ syndrome) is a neurological illness.
simple_sent: Cervicocranial syndrome (also called Craniocervical Junction syndrome) is a medical condition.

ori_sentence: Endolymph is the fluid contained in the membranous labyrinth of the inner ear.
simple_sent: Endolymph is a small fluid in the inner ear. It is called endolymph.

ori_sentence: Endometritis is inflammation of the inner lining of the uterus (endometrium).
simple_sent: Endometritis is a disease of the uterus. It causes inflammation of the endometrium.

ori_sentence: Methylisothiazolinone, MIT, or MI, is the organic compound with the formula S(CH)2C(O)NCH3.
simple_sent: Methylisothiazolinone is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is S(CH)2C(O)NCH3.

ori_sentence: Tianeptine, sold under the brand names Stablon and Coaxil among others, is an atypical antidepressant which is used mainly in the treatment of major depressive disorder, although it may also be used to treat anxiety, asthma, and irritable bowel syndrome.
simple_sent: Tianeptine (also known as Stablon and Coaxil) is an atypical antidepressant. It is used to treat major depressive disorder, although it may also be used to treat anxiety, irritable bowel syndrome, and other conditions.

ori_sentence: A patch test is a diagnostic method used to determine which specific substances cause allergic inflammation of a patient's skin.
simple_sent: A patch test is a test to see if certain substances cause an allergic reaction in a patient's skin.

ori_sentence: Beevor's sign is medical sign in which the navel moves towards the head upon flexing the neck, indicating selective weakness of the lower abdominal muscles.
simple_sent: Beevor's sign is a medical sign. When a person flexes their neck, the navel moves towards the head when this is done.

ori_sentence: Hypervitaminosis is a condition of abnormally high storage levels of vitamins, which can lead to various symptoms as over excitement, irritability, or even toxicity.
simple_sent: Hypervitaminosis is a condition in which the levels of vitamins in the body are too high. This can lead to different symptoms.

ori_sentence: Tolterodine, sold under the brand names Detrol among others, is medication used to treat frequent urination, urinary incontinence, or urinary urgency.
simple_sent: Tolterodine (also known as Detrol) is a medication. It is used to treat people with urinary incontinence or urinary urgency.

ori_sentence: Disseminated intravascular coagulation (DIC) is a condition in which blood clots form throughout the body, blocking small blood vessels.
simple_sent: Disseminated intravascular coagulation (DIC) happens when blood forms clots. These clots can stop small blood vessels.

ori_sentence: Barrett's esophagus is a condition in which there is an abnormal (metaplastic) change in the mucosal cells lining the lower portion of the esophagus, from normal stratified squamous epithelium to simple columnar epithelium with interspersed goblet cells that are normally present only in the small intestine and large intestine.
simple_sent: Barrett's esophagus is a condition in which the mucosal cells lining the lower portion of the esophagus (the part of the food that comes out of the stomach) are not the same as they are in the small intestine. The cells that make up the esophagus are not the same either.

ori_sentence: In law, medicine, and statistics, cause of death is an official determination of conditions resulting in a human's death, which may be recorded on a death certificate.
simple_sent: In law, medicine, and statistics, cause of death is the cause of a human's death. A person's cause of death is written on his or her death certificate.

ori_sentence: Digitoxin is a cardiac glycoside used for the treatment of heart failure and certain kinds of heart arrhythmia.
simple_sent: Digitoxin is a cardiac glycoside. It is used to treat heart failure and other problems of the heart.

ori_sentence: General paresis, also known as general paralysis of the insane (GPI) or paralytic dementia, is a severe neuropsychiatric disorder, classified as an organic mental disorder and caused by the chronic meningoencephalitis that leads to cerebral atrophy in late-stage syphilis.
simple_sent: General paresis, also known as general paralysis of the insane (GPI) or paralytic dementia, is a mental illness. It is caused by a disease called meningoencephalitis, which makes the brain not work properly.

ori_sentence: Babesiosis or piroplasmosis is a malaria-like parasitic disease caused by infection with a eukaryotic parasite in the order Piroplasmida, typically a Babesia or Theileria, in the phylum Apicomplexa.
simple_sent: Babesiosis or piroplasmosis is a disease similar to malaria. It is caused by a bacterium (Piroplasmida: Babesia or Theileria) that infects the body and causes a disease called Babesiosis.

ori_sentence: A urinary tract infection (UTI) is an infection that affects part of the urinary tract.
simple_sent: A urinary tract infection (UTI) is an infection of the urinary system.

ori_sentence: A needle holder, also called needle driver, is a surgical instrument, similar to a hemostat, used by doctors and surgeons to hold a suturing needle for closing wounds during suturing and surgical procedures.
simple_sent: A needle holder, also called a needle driver, is a surgical tool. It is used by doctors and surgeons to hold a needle so that it can be used to close a wound after surgery.

ori_sentence: Endoscopic ultrasound (EUS) or echo-endoscopy is a medical procedure in which endoscopy (insertion of a probe into a hollow organ) is combined with ultrasound to obtain images of the internal organs in the chest, abdomen and colon.
simple_sent: Endoscopic ultrasound (EUS) or echo-endoscopy is a medical procedure in which doctors use ultrasound and endoscopy to find out what is going on in the body. This is done to find out if something is wrong.

ori_sentence: Osteitis fibrosa cystica (/ˌɒstiˈaɪtɪs faɪˈbroʊsə ˈsɪstɪkə/ OS-tee-AY-tis fy-BROH-sə SIS-tik-ə), is a skeletal disorder resulting in a loss of bone mass, a weakening of the bones as their calcified supporting structures are replaced with fibrous tissue (peritrabecular fibrosis), and the formation of cyst-like brown tumors in and around the bone.
simple_sent: Osteitis fibrosa cystica (OS-tee-AY-tis fy-BROH-sə SIS-tik-ə) is a disease of the bones. It causes a loss of bone mass, a weakening of the bones as fibrous tissue replaces the calcified structures that hold the bones together.

ori_sentence: Gonadal dysgenesis is classified as any congenital developmental disorder of the reproductive systemin the male or female.
simple_sent: Gonadal dysgenesis is a disorder of the reproductive system. It usually affects either the male or the female.

ori_sentence: Penile cancer is cancer that develops in the skin or tissues of the penis.
simple_sent: Penile cancer is a type of cancer. It usually starts in the skin.

ori_sentence: Methaqualone is a sedative and hypnotic medication.
simple_sent: Methaqualone is a hypnotic and sedative drug.

ori_sentence: Ceftazidime, sold under the brand names Fortaz among others, is a third-generation cephalosporin antibiotic useful for the treatment of a number of bacterial infections.
simple_sent: Ceftazidime, also known as Fortaz, is a third-generation cephalosporin antibiotic. It is used to treat certain types of bacterial infections.

ori_sentence: Enophthalmos is the posterior displacement of the eyeball within the orbit due to changes in the volume of the orbit (bone) relative to its contents (the eyeball and orbital fat), or loss of function of the orbitalis muscle.
simple_sent: Enophthalmos is the posterior displacement of the eyeball within the orbit. This happens when the volume of the orbit (bone) changes compared to what is inside the eyeball.

ori_sentence: Cerebral shunts are commonly used to treat hydrocephalus, the swelling of the brain due to excess buildup of cerebrospinal fluid (CSF).
simple_sent: Cerebral shunts are most often used to treat hydrocephalus. Hydrocephalus is when the brain has too much cerebrospinal fluid.

ori_sentence: Oppositional defiant disorder (ODD) is listed in the DSM-5 under Disruptive, impulse-control, and conduct disorders and defined as "a pattern of angry/irritable mood, argumentative/defiant behavior, or vindictiveness".
simple_sent: Oppositional defiant disorder (ODD) is a disorder. It is listed in the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders as "a pattern of argumentative/defiant behavior, or vindictiveness".

ori_sentence: The juxtaglomerular apparatus (also known as the juxtaglomerular complex) is a structure in the kidney that regulates the function of each nephron, the functional units of the kidney.
simple_sent: The juxtaglomerular apparatus (also known as the juxtaglomerular complex) is a part of the kidney. It is in the middle part of the kidney, between the kidneys.

ori_sentence: In statistics and probability theory, the median is the value separating the higher half from the lower half of a data sample, a population, or a probability distribution.
simple_sent: In statistics and probability theory, the median is the number that separates the higher half of a population from the lower half. It is called the upper half.

ori_sentence: The ileum (/ˈɪliəm/) is the final section of the small intestine in most higher vertebrates, including mammals, reptiles, and birds.
simple_sent: The ileum is the last section of the small intestine. In mammals, reptiles and birds, it is the last section of the small intestine.

ori_sentence: Cryptosporidiosis, sometimes informally called crypto, is a parasitic disease caused by Cryptosporidium, a genus of protozoan parasites in the phylum Apicomplexa.
simple_sent: Cryptosporidiosis is a disease. It is caused by Cryptosporidium, a protozoan parasite. The disease is sometimes called "cryptosporine disease".

ori_sentence: Encephalocele is a neural tube defect characterized by sac-like protrusions of the brain and the membranes that cover it through openings in the skull.
simple_sent: Encephalocele is a neural tube defect. It looks like a sac-like part of the brain. The brain and membranes are covered by the membranes.

ori_sentence: In medicine, precocious puberty is puberty occurring at an unusually early age.
simple_sent: In medicine, precocious puberty is when a person starts puberty at an early age.

ori_sentence: Bethlem myopathy is an autosomal dominant myopathy, classified as a congenital form of muscular dystrophy, that is caused by a mutation in one of the three genes coding for type VI collagen.
simple_sent: Bethlem myopathy is a congenital form of muscular dystrophy. It is caused by a change in one of the three genes that code for type VI collagen in the human body.

ori_sentence: The frontal suture is a fibrous joint that divides the two halves of the frontal bone of the skull in infants and children.
simple_sent: The frontal suture is the part of the skull where the two faces of a person meet. It is a small joint.

ori_sentence: The sacrum (plural: sacra or sacrums), in human anatomy, is a large, triangular bone at the base of the spine that forms by the fusing of the sacral vertebrae (S1–S5) between ages 18 and 30.
simple_sent: The sacrum (plural: sacra or sacrums) is a large bone in the back of the human body. It is located at the base of the spine and is a triangular shaped bone.

ori_sentence: Prednisone is a glucocorticoid medication mostly used to suppress the immune system and decrease inflammation in conditions such as asthma, COPD, and rheumatologic diseases.
simple_sent: Prednisone is a glucocorticoid drug that is used to reduce inflammation in the body. It is mostly used in conditions like asthma, COPD, and rheumatologic diseases.

ori_sentence: Temozolomide (TMZ), sold under the brand name Temodar among others, is a medication used to treat some brain tumors such as glioblastoma multiforme or anaplastic astrocytoma.
simple_sent: Temozolomide (also known as Temodar) is a drug that is used to treat certain types of brain cancer. These include glioblastoma multiforme.

ori_sentence: Rosacea is a long-term skin condition that typically affects the face.
simple_sent: Rosacea is a long-term skin condition. It usually affects the face.

ori_sentence: Tuberous sclerosis complex (TSC) is a rare multisystem autosomal dominant genetic disease that causes non-cancerous tumours to grow in the brain and on other vital organs such as the kidneys, heart, liver, eyes, lungs and skin.
simple_sent: Tuberous sclerosis complex (TSC) is a rare disease. People who have the disease have non-cancerous tumours that grow in the brain. These tumours can then grow in the heart, liver, eyes, lungs and skin.

ori_sentence: The hard palate is a thin horizontal bony plate made up of two bones of the facial skeleton, located in the roof of the mouth.
simple_sent: The hard palate is a part of the face. It is made up of two bones. They are located in the roof of the mouth.

ori_sentence: The corpus callosum (Latin for "tough body"), also callosal commissure, is a wide, thick nerve tract, consisting of a flat bundle of commissural fibers, beneath the cerebral cortex in the brain.
simple_sent: The corpus callosum (Latin for "tough body"), also called callosal commissure, is the part of the human brain that nerves go through. It is a wide, thick nerve tract.

ori_sentence: The forearm is the region of the upper limb between the elbow and the wrist.
simple_sent: The forearm is the upper part of the body. It is between the elbow and wrist.

ori_sentence: Glimepiride, is an anti-diabetic medication used to treat type 2 diabetes.
simple_sent: Glimepiride is an anti-diabetic drug. It is used to treat diabetes.

ori_sentence: Acid erosion is a type of tooth wear.
simple_sent: This is called acid erosion.

ori_sentence: The patella, also known as the kneecap, is a flat, rounded triangular bone which articulates with the femur (thigh bone) and covers and protects the anterior articular surface of the knee joint.
simple_sent: The patella, also known as the kneecap, is a small, flat, triangular bone in the knee. It is next to the femur, and together they make up the knee joint.

ori_sentence: Patulous Eustachian tube (PET) is the name of a physical disorder where the Eustachian tube, which is normally closed, instead stays intermittently open.
simple_sent: Patulous Eustachian tube (PET) is a medical condition. It happens when the Eustachian tube, which is normally closed, is not closed at all.

ori_sentence: The crista galli (Latin: "crest of the rooster") is the upper part of the perpendicular plate of the ethmoid bone of the skull.
simple_sent: The crista galli is the upper part of the ethmoid bone of the skull. It is also called the "crest of the rooster".

ori_sentence: Syndactyly is a condition wherein two or more digits are fused together.
simple_sent: Syndactyly is when two or more digits are not properly joined together.

ori_sentence: Ectopia cordis (Greek: "away / out of place" + Latin: "heart") or ectopic heart is a congenital malformation in which the heart is abnormally located either partially or totally outside of the thorax.
simple_sent: Ectopia cordis (Greek: "away / out of place" + Latin: "heart") is a condition in which the heart is not in the right place. This is called an ectopic heart.

ori_sentence: Koenen's tumor (KT), also commonly termed periungual angiofibroma, is a subtype of the angiofibromas.
simple_sent: Koenen's tumor (also called periungual angiofibroma) is a type of bone cancer.

ori_sentence: Creatine (/ˈkriːətiːn/ or /ˈkriːətɪn/) is an organic compound with the nominal formula (H2N)(HN)CN(CH3)CH2CO2H. This species exists in various modifications (tautomers) in solution.
simple_sent: Creatine is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is (H2N)(HN)CN(CH3)CH2CO2H. This species exists in various modifications (tautomers) in solution.

ori_sentence: Dysarthria is a speech sound disorder resulting from neurological injury of the motor component of the motor–speech system and is characterized by poor articulation of phoneme.
simple_sent: Dysarthria is a speech sound disorder. It happens when a part of the motor system of the speech system is damaged. This makes it hard to say words.

ori_sentence: Miso (みそ or 味噌) is a traditional Japanese seasoning produced by fermenting soybeans with salt and kōji (the fungus Aspergillus oryzae) and sometimes rice, barley, seaweed, or other ingredients.
simple_sent: Miso is a Japanese seasoning. It is made by fermenting soybeans with salt and a fungus (the fungus Aspergillus oryzae). Sometimes rice, barley, or seaweed are added to the soybeans.

ori_sentence: Dysmenorrhea, also known as painful periods or menstrual cramps, is pain during menstruation.
simple_sent: Dysmenorrhea is pain during menstruation. It is also called painful periods or menstrual cramps.

ori_sentence: Thyroid cancer is cancer that develops from the tissues of the thyroid gland.
simple_sent: Thyroid cancer is a cancer that affects the thyroid gland.

ori_sentence: Paraldehyde is the cyclic trimer of acetaldehyde molecules.
simple_sent: Paraldehyde is a chemical compound. It is an alcohol.

ori_sentence: Pentostatin (or deoxycoformycin, trade name Nipent, manufactured by SuperGen) is an anticancer chemotherapeutic drug.
simple_sent: Pentostatin (also known as deoxycoformycin) is a chemotherapeutic drug. It is also known as Nipent.

ori_sentence: Mediastinal shift is the deviation of the mediastinal structures towards one side of the chest cavity, usually seen on chest radiograph.
simple_sent: Mediastinal shift is when the mediastinal structures move from one side to the other. This is usually seen on a chest radiograph.

ori_sentence: Pentosuria is a condition where the sugar xylitol, a pentose, presents in the urine in unusually high concentrations.
simple_sent: Pentosuria is when the sugar xylitol is in the urine in a very high amount. This is called pentose.

ori_sentence: The QRS complex is the combination of three of the graphical deflections seen on a typical electrocardiogram (ECG or EKG).
simple_sent: The QRS complex is made up of three things: The deflection on the ECG The deflection on the EKG.

ori_sentence: Oligoastrocytomas are a subset of brain tumors that present with an appearance of mixed glial cell origin, astrocytoma and oligodendroglioma.
simple_sent: Oligoastrocytomas are a type of brain tumor. They are different from astrocytoma, which is a normal brain tumor, and oligodendroglioma.

ori_sentence: Hereditary multiple osteochondromas (HMO), also known as hereditary multiple exostoses, is a disorder characterized by the development of multiple benign osteocartilaginous masses (exostoses) in relation to the ends of long bones of the lower limbs such as the femurs and tibias and of the upper limbs such as the humeri and forearm bones.
simple_sent: Hereditary multiple osteochondromas (HMO), also known as hereditary multiple exostoses, is a medical condition in which a person develops multiple masses (exostoses) at the ends of long bones in the body. The most common types of exostoses are at the ends of long bones in the lower limbs, such as the femurs and tibias.

ori_sentence: Acute stress disorder (ASD, also known as acute stress reaction, psychological shock, mental shock, or simply shock) is a psychological response to a terrifying, traumatic, or surprising experience.
simple_sent: Acute stress disorder (ASD), also known as psychological shock, acute stress reaction, or shock, is a condition that happens when people are not prepared for something.

ori_sentence: Butylated hydroxytoluene (BHT), also known as dibutylhydroxytoluene, is a lipophilic organic compound, chemically a derivative of phenol, that is useful for its antioxidant properties.
simple_sent: Butylated hydroxytoluene (BHT), also known as dibutylhydroxytoluene, is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is Dibutylhydroxytoluene.

ori_sentence: In medicine, Murphy's sign (Also called Sweeney’s sign) is a maneuver during a physical examination as part of the abdominal examination.
simple_sent: In medicine, Murphy's sign (also called Sweeney's sign) is a sign that a person should do something to help their health.

ori_sentence: Neurofibromatosis type II (also known as MISME syndrome – multiple inherited schwannomas, meningiomas, and ependymomas) is a genetic condition that may be inherited or may arise spontaneously, and causes benign tumors of the brain, spinal cord, and peripheral nerves.
simple_sent: Neurofibromatosis type II (also known as MISME syndrome - multiple inherited schwannomas, meningiomas, and ependymomas) is a cancer of the brain and spinal cord. It is caused by a mutation in a person's genes.

ori_sentence: Gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD), is a chronic condition in which stomach contents rise up into the esophagus, resulting in either symptoms or complications.
simple_sent: Gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD), is a disease where the contents of the stomach come up into the esophagus. This can cause symptoms.

ori_sentence: The blastocyst is a structure formed in the early development of mammals.
simple_sent: The blastocyst is a very early stage in a mammal's development.

ori_sentence: Enteroaggregative Escherichia coli (EAEC or EAggEC) are a pathotype of Escherichia coli which cause acute and chronic diarrhea in both the developed and developing world.
simple_sent: Enteroaggregative Escherichia coli (EAEC or EAggEC) are a type of Escherichia coli. They cause diarrhea in both people and animals.

ori_sentence: Morsicatio buccarum is a condition characterized by chronic irritation or injury to the buccal mucosa (the lining of the inside of the cheek within the mouth), caused by repetitive chewing, biting or nibbling.
simple_sent: Morsicatio buccarum is a condition where the lining of the inside of the cheek within the mouth gets irritated or hurt all the time. This can be caused by chewing, biting or nibbling.

ori_sentence: Toxocariasis is an illness of humans caused by larvae (immature worms) of either the dog roundworm (Toxocara canis), the cat roundworm (Toxocara cati) or the fox roundworm (Toxocara canis).
simple_sent: Toxocariasis is a disease. It is caused by Toxocara canis and Toxocara cati roundworms. The roundworm that causes the disease is called a dog roundworm.

ori_sentence: Goodpasture syndrome (GPS), also known as anti-glomerular basement membrane disease, is a rare autoimmune disease in which antibodies attack the basement membrane in lungs and kidneys, leading to bleeding from the lungs, glomerulonephritis, and kidney failure.
simple_sent: Goodpasture syndrome (GPS), also known as anti-glomerular basement membrane disease, is an autoimmune disease. People who have the disease will have problems with their lungs and kidneys, and they will have problems with their kidneys.

ori_sentence: Ivabradine, sold under the brand name Procoralan among others, is a medication, which is an If inhibitor,used for the symptomatic management of stable heart-related chest pain and heart failure.
simple_sent: Ivabradine, sold under the brand name Procoralan among others, is a drug that is used to treat heart failure and other conditions related to the heart. It is an If inhibitor.

ori_sentence: Glossitis can mean soreness of the tongue, or more usually inflammation with depapillation of the dorsal surface of the tongue (loss of the lingual papillae), leaving a smooth and erythematous (reddened) surface, (sometimes specifically termed atrophic glossitis).
simple_sent: Glossitis can mean soreness of the tongue, or more usually inflammation with loss of the lingual papillae. This leaves a smooth and erythematous (reddened) surface, (sometimes called atrophic glossitis) which makes it difficult to eat or drink.

ori_sentence: Indacaterol is an ultra-long-acting beta-adrenoceptor agonist developed by Novartis.
simple_sent: Indacaterol is a long-acting beta-adrenoceptor drug that is developed by Novartis.

ori_sentence: In medicine, a stent is a metal or plastic tube inserted into the lumen of an anatomic vessel or duct to keep the passageway open, and stenting is the placement of a stent.
simple_sent: In medicine, a stent is a metal or plastic tube that is put into a blood vessel or duct. The tube is put there so that the blood can flow through the duct.

ori_sentence: Finasteride, sold under the brand names Proscar and Propecia among others, is a medication used to treat hair loss and benign prostatic hyperplasia in men.
simple_sent: Finasteride (also known as Proscar and Propecia) is a prescription drug. It is used to treat men with hair loss and benign prostatic hyperplasia.

ori_sentence: Minoxidil (2,4-diamino-6-piperidinopyrimidine 3-oxide), sold under the brand name Rogaine among others, is a medication used for the treatment of high blood pressure and pattern hair loss in males and females.
simple_sent: Minoxidil (2,4-diamino-6-piperidinopyrimidine 3-oxide), also known as Rogaine, is a drug that is used to treat high blood pressure. It is also used to treat hair loss.

ori_sentence: Domperidone, sold under the brand name Motilium among others, is a medication used as an antiemetic, gastric prokinetic agent, and galactagogue.
simple_sent: Domperidone, sold under the brand name Motilium among others, is a drug that is taken for the treatment of gastric ulcers.

ori_sentence: Dermatitis repens (also known as Acrodermatitis continua, Acrodermatitis perstans, Pustular acrodermatitis, Acrodermatitis continua of Hallopeau, Acrodermatitis continua suppurativa Hallopeau, Hallopeau's acrodermatitis, Hallopeau's acrodermatitis continua, and Dermatitis repens Crocker) is a rare, sterile, pustular eruption of the fingers and toes that slowly extends proximally.
simple_sent: Dermatitis repens (also known as Acrodermatitis continua, Pustular acrodermatitis, Hallopeau's acrodermatitis, Hallopeau's acrodermatitis continua, or Dermatitis repens Crocker) is an infection of the skin. It causes a pustular eruption of the fingers and toes that slowly spreads to the rest of the body.

ori_sentence: Bendamustine, sold under the brand name Treanda among others, is a chemotherapy medication used in the treatment of chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL), multiple myeloma, and non-Hodgkin's lymphoma.
simple_sent: Bendamustine (also known as Treanda) is a chemotherapy drug. It is used to treat three types of cancer: chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL), multiple myeloma, and non-Hodgkin's lymphoma.

ori_sentence: Bronchiolitis is blockage of the small airways in the lungs.
simple_sent: Bronchiolitis is when the small airways in the lungs are blocked.

ori_sentence: Orlistat is a drug designed to treat obesity.
simple_sent: Orlistat is a drug to treat weight problems.

ori_sentence: Vardenafil is a PDE5 inhibitor used for treating erectile dysfunction that is sold under the trade names Levitra, Staxyn, and Vivanza.
simple_sent: Vardenafil (also known as Levitra, Staxyn, and Vivanza) is a drug that helps to treat erectile dysfunction.

ori_sentence: Dyclonine (Dyclocaine) is an oral anaesthetic that is the active ingredient of Sucrets, an over-the-counter throat lozenge.
simple_sent: Dyclonine (also known as Dyclocaine) is a pain-killer. It is also the main active ingredient in Sucrets.

ori_sentence: Uremic fetor is a urine-like odor on the breath of people with uremia.
simple_sent: Uremic fetor makes people smell like urine. People with uremia have it.

ori_sentence: Laryngospasm is an uncontrolled or involuntary muscular contraction (spasm) of the vocal folds.
simple_sent: Laryngospasm is when a person's voice becomes too hard. It is a muscle contraction.

ori_sentence: Dysembryoplastic neuroepithelial tumour (DNT, DNET) is a type of brain tumor.

simple_sent: Terbutaline, sold under the brand names Bricanyl and Marex among others, is a β2 adrenergic receptor agonist. It is used to treat asthma and as a tocolytic (anti-contraction medication) to prevent labor for up to 48 hours.

simple_sent: Giemsa stain is a nucleic acid stain. It is named after the German chemist and bacteriologist Gustav Giemsa, because Giemsa was one of the first people to discover how DNA works.

simple_sent: A uterine malformation is a malformation of the female sex organs. It happens because the Müllerian ducts during embryogenesis are not working properly.

simple_sent: 4-Aminosalicylic acid (also known as para-aminosalicylic acid) is an antibiotic. It is used to treat tuberculosis. It is sold under the brand name Paser.

ori_sentence: Methylparaben, also methyl paraben, one of the parabens, is a preservative with the chemical formula CH3(C6H4(OH)COO).
simple_sent: Methylparaben, also known as methyl paraben, is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is CH3(C6H4(OH)COO).

ori_sentence: Risus sardonicus or rictus grin is a highly characteristic, abnormal, sustained spasm of the facial muscles that appears to produce grinning.
simple_sent: Risus sardonicus or rictus grin is a sign that people are not healthy. It is a spasm of the facial muscles that makes them grin.

simple_sent: Microcephaly (from Latin microcephalia "small head") is a medical condition where a baby's head is smaller than normal. The word comes from the Ancient Greek μικρός mikrós "small".

ori_sentence: Achromatopsia, also known as total color blindness, is a medical syndrome that exhibits symptoms relating to at least five conditions.
simple_sent: Achromatopsia, also known as total color blindness, is a medical condition. It is caused by at least five conditions.

ori_sentence: Van der Woude syndrome (VDWS) is a genetic disorder characterized by the combination of lower lip pits, cleft lip with or without cleft palate (CL/P), and cleft palate only (CPO).
simple_sent: Van der Woude syndrome (VDWS) is a genetic disorder. A person with Van der Woude syndrome has lower lip pits, a cleft palate, and a cleft lip with or without.

ori_sentence: Onycholysis is a common medical condition characterized by the painless detachment of the nail from the nail bed, usually starting at the tip and/or sides.
simple_sent: Onycholysis is a common medical condition that causes the nail to fall out from the nail bed. This usually happens at the tip and/or sides.

ori_sentence: Burning mouth syndrome (BMS) is a burning sensation in the mouth with no underlying known dental or medical cause.
simple_sent: Burning mouth syndrome (BMS) is a burning feeling in the mouth. There is no known cause for this.

ori_sentence: Triosephosphate isomerase deficiency is a rare autosomal recessive metabolic disorder which was initially described in 1965.
simple_sent: Triosephosphate isomerase deficiency is a disease. It is a rare disease, and was first discovered in 1965.

ori_sentence: Pectus excavatum is a structural deformity of the anterior thoracic wall in which the sternum and rib cage are shaped abnormally.
simple_sent: Pectus excavatum is an abnormally shaped part of the thoracic wall. The sternum and rib cage are not the same size.

ori_sentence: Unstable angina (UA),
simple_sent: Stable angina (UA)

ori_sentence: The ileocolic artery is the lowest branch arising from the concavity of the superior mesenteric artery.
simple_sent: The ileocolic artery is an important artery in the heart. It is the lowest branch.

ori_sentence: Sialadenitis (sialoadenitis) is inflammation of salivary glands, usually the major ones, the most common being the parotid gland, followed by submandibular and sublingual glands.
simple_sent: Sialadenitis (sialoadenitis) is an infection of the salivary glands. The most common salivary glands are the parotid, submandibular, and sublingual glands.

ori_sentence: Edwards syndrome, also known as trisomy 18, is a genetic disorder caused by the presence of a third copy of all or part of chromosome 18.
simple_sent: Edwards syndrome, also known as trisomy 18, is a disease. People who have it have either one or two copies of chromosome 18.

simple_sent: Carnitine palmitoyltransferase II deficiency is an autosomal recessively inherited genetic metabolic disorder in which long-chain fatty acids are not able to get to the mitochondria where they can be used for energy.

ori_sentence: Liquefactive necrosis (or colliquative necrosis) is a type of necrosis which results in a transformation of the tissue into a liquid viscous mass.
simple_sent: Liquefactive necrosis (or colliquative necrosis) happens when the tissue becomes too hard to work with and turns into a liquid.

ori_sentence: A neuroma (/njʊəˈroʊmə/;
simple_sent: A neuroma is a tumor.

simple_sent: Fluorouracil (also known as Adrucil and 5-FU) is a chemotherapy drug. It is used to treat cancer.

ori_sentence: Obdormition (/ˌɒbdɔːrˈmɪʃən/; from Latin obdormire "to fall asleep") is a medical term describing numbness in a limb, often caused by constant pressure on nerves or lack of movement.
simple_sent: Obdormition (from Latin obdormire "to fall asleep") is a medical term. It describes numbness in one or both arms or legs because of a lack of movement or pressure on the nerves.

ori_sentence: A vaccine adverse event (VAE), sometimes referred to as a vaccine injury, is an adverse event caused by vaccination.
simple_sent: A vaccine adverse event (VAE) is something that happens when a vaccine is given to a person.

ori_sentence: Aluminosis (also known as aluminium lung) is a restrictive lung disease caused by exposure to aluminum-bearing dust.
simple_sent: Aluminosis (also known as aluminum lung) is a disease of the lung. It is caused by aluminum dust.

ori_sentence: Obstructive uropathy is a structural or functional hindrance of normal urine flow, sometimes leading to renal dysfunction (obstructive nephropathy).
simple_sent: Obstructive uropathy happens when there is a problem with normal urine flow. This can lead to problems with the kidneys.

ori_sentence: Nabumetone is a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID).
simple_sent: Nabumetone is a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID).

ori_sentence: Ketorolac, sold under the brand name Toradol among others, is a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) used to treat pain.
simple_sent: Ketorolac, also known as Toradol, is a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID). It is used to treat pain.

ori_sentence: Enzalutamide, sold under the brand name Xtandi, is a nonsteroidal antiandrogen (NSAA) medication which is used in the treatment of prostate cancer.
simple_sent: Enzalutamide (also known as Xtandi) is a nonsteroidal antiandrogen (NSAA) drug. It is used to treat prostate cancer.

ori_sentence: Inhalation happens when air or other gases enter the lungs.
simple_sent: Inhalation takes place when air or gas enters the lungs.

ori_sentence: A blue nevus is a type of coloured mole, typically a single well-defined blue-black bump.
simple_sent: A blue nevus is a type of mole. It usually has a single blue-black bump on the surface.

ori_sentence: Cryptogenic organizing pneumonia (COP), formerly known as bronchiolitis obliterans organizing pneumonia (BOOP), is an inflammation of the bronchioles (bronchiolitis) and surrounding tissue in the lungs.
simple_sent: Cryptogenic organizing pneumonia (COP), used to be called bronchiolitis obliterans organizing pneumonia (BOOP) until a new vaccine was found in the 1960s.

ori_sentence: Blau Syndrome is an autosomal dominant genetic inflammatory disorder which affects the skin, eyes, and joints.
simple_sent: Blau Syndrome is a genetic disorder. People with Blau Syndrome have dark skin, eyes, and joints.

ori_sentence: Irritable bowel syndrome (IBS), referred to previously as spastic or nervous colon, and spastic bowel, is a functional gastrointestinal disorder characterized by a group of symptoms accompanied together that include abdominal pain and changes in the consistency of bowel movements.
simple_sent: Irritable bowel syndrome (IBS), previously known as spastic bowel syndrome, spastic colon, or nervous colon, is a medical condition. It is characterized by a number of symptoms, including abdominal pain, changes in bowel movements, and fatigue.

ori_sentence: The endometrium is the inner epithelial layer, along with its mucous membrane, of the mammalian uterus.
simple_sent: The endometrium is a part of the uterus. It is made up of a thin layer called the mucous membrane.

ori_sentence: Raloxifene, sold under the brand name Evista among others, is a medication used to prevent and treat osteoporosis in postmenopausal women and those on glucocorticoids.
simple_sent: Raloxifene (also known as Evista) is a prescription drug. It is used to prevent and treat osteoporosis in women who have gone through menopause.

ori_sentence: Felty's syndrome, also called Felty syndrome, (FS) is rare autoimmune disease characterized by the triad of rheumatoid arthritis, enlargement of the spleen and low neutrophil count.
simple_sent: Felty's syndrome, also called Felty syndrome, (FS) is a rare disease. It is caused by three things: rheumatoid arthritis, low neutrophil count, and enlarged spleen.

ori_sentence: Intestinal malrotation is a congenital anomaly of rotation of the midgut.
simple_sent: Intestinal malrotation is when the midgut does not turn properly.

ori_sentence: Fever of unknown origin (FUO), refers to a condition in which the patient has an elevated temperature (fever) but despite investigations by a physician no explanation has been found.
simple_sent: Fever of unknown origin (FUO), is a condition where a person has a high temperature (fever), but no reason can be found for it, and the patient does not get sick more.

ori_sentence: Adenomyosis is a medical condition characterized by the growth of cells that build up the inside of the uterus (endometrium) atypically located within the cells that put up the uterine wall (myometrium), as a result, thickening of the uterus occurs.
simple_sent: Adenomyosis is a medical condition in which the cells that make up the inside of the uterus grow outside of the cells that make up the inside of the uterus. As a result, the inside of the uterus gets thicker.

ori_sentence: Viral hepatitis is liver inflammation due to a viral infection.
simple_sent: Viral hepatitis is an infection of the liver.

ori_sentence: Twin-to-twin transfusion syndrome (TTTS), also known as feto-fetal transfusion syndrome (FFTS), twin oligohydramnios-polyhydramnios sequence (TOPS) and stuck twin syndrome, is a complication of monochorionic multiple pregnancies (the most common form of identical twin pregnancy) in which there is disproportionate blood supply between the fetuses.
simple_sent: Twin-to-twin transfusion syndrome (TTTS), also known as feto-fetal transfusion syndrome (FFTS), twin oligohydramnios-polyhydramnios sequence (TOPS) and stuck twin syndrome, is when the blood of one twin is given to the other twin, but the blood does not go to the right place.
