simple_sent: Alström syndrome (also called Alström-Hallgren syndrome) is a very rare disease. People who have it are very fat as a result of a genetic mutation.

ori_sentence: Extrapyramidal symptoms (EPS) are symptoms that are archetypically associated with the extrapyramidal system of the brain's cerebral cortex.
simple_sent: Extrapyramidal symptoms (EPS) are symptoms that can be found in the brain. They are usually found in the cerebral cortex.

ori_sentence: Oral rehydration therapy (ORT) is a type of fluid replacement used to prevent and treat dehydration, especially due to diarrhea.
simple_sent: Oral rehydration therapy (ORT) is a medical treatment. It is used to help people who are sick with dehydration.

ori_sentence: Cholesterol embolism occurs when cholesterol is released, usually from an atherosclerotic plaque, and travels as an embolus in the bloodstream to lodge (as an embolism) causing an obstruction in blood vessels further away.
simple_sent: Cholesterol embolism happens when cholesterol is released from a plaque in the body. The cholesterol goes into the blood and it gets stuck in the blood vessels. This causes an embolism.

ori_sentence: Fibrous papule of the nose is a harmless small bump on or near the nose.
simple_sent: A papule of the nose is a small bump on the nose, but it is not dangerous.

ori_sentence: Chronic pancreatitis is a long-standing inflammation of the pancreas that alters the organ's normal structure and functions.
simple_sent: Chronic pancreatitis is a long-standing disease of the pancreas. It changes the normal structure and function of the organ.

ori_sentence: Venous hum is a benign phenomenon.
simple_sent: Venous hum is not dangerous.

ori_sentence: Familial hypocalciuric hypercalcemia (FHH) is an inherited condition that can cause hypercalcemia, a serum calcium level typically above 10.2 mg/
simple_sent: Familial hypocalciuric hypercalcemia (FHH) is an inherited condition. This condition can cause a person to have a high level of calcium.

ori_sentence: Lepidopterism is an irritant contact dermatitis caused by irritating caterpillar or moth hairs coming into contact with the skin or mucosa.
simple_sent: Lepidopterism is an infection of the skin. It is caused when caterpillar or moth hairs come into contact with the skin.

ori_sentence: Reticulocytes are immature red blood cells (RBCs).
simple_sent: The red blood cells are called reticulocytes.

ori_sentence: Cutis marmorata telangiectatica congenita is a rare congenital vascular disorder that usually manifests in affecting the blood vessels of the skin.
simple_sent: Cutis marmorata telangiectatica congenita is a rare disease. People who have the disease have blood vessels in their skin that are too big.

ori_sentence: Ingenol mebutate, sold under the brand name Picato, is a substance that is found in the sap of the plant Euphorbia peplus, commonly known as milkweed, and is an inducer of cell death.
simple_sent: Ingenol mebutate, also known as Picato, is a chemical compound. It is found in the sap of the plant milkweed (Euphorbia peplus), and it causes cell death.

ori_sentence: Congenital hepatic fibrosis is an inherited associated with proliferation of interlobular bile ducts within the portal areas and fibrosis that do not alter hepatic lobular architecture.
simple_sent: Congenital hepatic fibrosis is an inherited disease that causes bile ducts within the portal areas to become too large. It does not affect other parts of the body.

ori_sentence: Millard–Gubler syndrome is a lesion of the pons.
simple_sent: Millard-Gubler syndrome is a brain disease.

ori_sentence: Dura mater is a thick membrane made of dense irregular connective tissue that surrounds the brain and spinal cord.
simple_sent: The dura mater surrounds the brain and spinal cord. It is a thick membrane made of connective tissue.

ori_sentence: A cramp is a sudden, involuntary muscle contraction or overshortening; while generally temporary and non-damaging, they can cause significant pain and a paralysis-like immobility of the affected muscle.
simple_sent: A cramp is a sudden, involuntary muscle contraction or overshortening. Most of the time they are not bad, and the muscle does not feel any pain, but sometimes they do.

ori_sentence: The falx cerebri, also known as the cerebral falx, is a large, crescent-shaped fold of meningeal layer of dura mater that descends vertically in the longitudinal fissure between the cerebral hemispheres of the human brain.
simple_sent: The falx cerebri, also known as the cerebral falx, is a fold in the middle of the human brain. It is a large, crescent-shaped fold that descends vertically in the middle of the human brain.

ori_sentence: The asymmetrical tonic neck reflex (ATNR) is a primitive reflex found in newborn humans that normally vanishes around 6 months of age.
simple_sent: The tonic neck reflex (ATNR) is a reflex in humans. When a human is born, he or she makes a tonic neck reflex.

ori_sentence: Leukoplakia is a firmly attached white patch on a mucous membrane which is associated with increased risk of cancer.
simple_sent: Leukoplakia is a white patch on a mucous membrane. People with leukoplakia have a higher risk of cancer.

ori_sentence: Chloroxylenol, also known as para-chloro-meta-xylenol (PCMX), is an antiseptic and disinfectant which is used for skin disinfection, and together with alcohol for cleaning surgical instruments.
simple_sent: Chloroxylenol (also known as para-chloro-meta-xylenol) is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is PCMX. It is an antiseptic and a disinfectant.

ori_sentence: A premature heart beat is a heart rhythm disorder corresponding to a premature contraction of one of the chambers of the heart.
simple_sent: A premature heart beat is when the heart is beating too fast. It happens when one of the chambers of the heart is not working right.

ori_sentence: Keratolytic Winter erythema (also known as Oudtshoorn disease or Oudtshoorn skin) is a rare autosomal dominant skin disease of unknown cause which causes redness and peeling of the skin on the palms and soles.
simple_sent: Keratolytic Winter erythema (also known as Oudtshoorn disease or Oudtshoorn skin) is a skin disease that does not have a known cause. It causes redness and peeling of the skin on the hands and feet.

ori_sentence: Operant conditioning (also called instrumental conditioning) is a type of associative learning process through which the strength of a behavior is modified by reinforcement or punishment.
simple_sent: Operant conditioning (also called instrumental conditioning) is a way to change the behavior of an animal so that it will do something you want it to do.

ori_sentence: The trapezoid bone (lesser multangular bone) is a carpal bone in tetrapods, including humans.
simple_sent: The trapezoid bone is a small bone in the hand. It is the smaller multangular bone.

simple_sent: A neurectomy is a surgery where a nerve is removed. This is called a nerve block.

ori_sentence: Cisapride is a gastroprokinetic agent, a drug that increases motility in the upper gastrointestinal tract.

simple_sent: Radial neuropathy is a type of mononeuropathy. It is caused by damage to the radial nerve, which is a nerve in the arm.

ori_sentence: Neuroendocrine tumors (NETs) are neoplasms that arise from cells of the endocrine (hormonal) and nervous systems.
simple_sent: Neuroendocrine tumors (NETs) are cancer of the endocrine (hormonal) and nervous systems.

ori_sentence: Mitoxantrone (INN, BAN, USAN; also known as Mitozantrone in Australia; trade name Novantrone) is an anthracenedione antineoplastic agent.
simple_sent: Mitoxantrone (also known as Novantrone in Australia) is a chemical compound. It is an antineoplastic agent.

ori_sentence: Triptorelin, sold under the brand names Decapeptyl and Gonapeptyl among others, is a medication that acts as an agonist analog of gonadotropin-releasing hormone, thus reversibly repressing expression of luteinizing hormone (LH) and follicle-stimulating hormone (FSH).
simple_sent: Triptorelin, sold under the brand names Decapeptyl and Gonapeptyl among others, is a medication that works by inhibiting the release of gonadotropin-releasing hormone (GnRH). When this happens, the body does not produce LH or FSH.

ori_sentence: Serum total protein, also known as total protein, is a biochemical test for measuring the total amount of protein in serum.
simple_sent: The total protein test (also called serum protein test) is a test to see how much protein there is in the serum.

ori_sentence: An exostosis, also known as bone spur, is the formation of new bone on the surface of a bone.
simple_sent: An exostosis is when new bone is formed. It is also called a bone spur.

ori_sentence: Takayasu's arteritis (TA), also known as aortic arch syndrome, nonspecific aortoarteritis, and pulseless disease, is a form of large vessel granulomatous vasculitis with massive intimal fibrosis and vascular narrowing, most commonly affecting young or middle-age women of Asian descent, though anyone can be affected.
simple_sent: Takayasu's arteritis (TA), also known as aortic arch syndrome, nonspecific aortoarteritis, and pulseless disease, is an inflammatory disease of the blood vessels. It usually affects young or middle-age women, but it can happen to men as well.

simple_sent: Retinitis pigmentosa is a disease. People who have it will lose their vision.

ori_sentence: Prazosin is an α1 blocker medication primarily used to treat high blood pressure, symptoms of an enlarged prostate, and nightmares related to post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD).
simple_sent: Prazosin is a drug that is used to treat high blood pressure. It is also used to treat symptoms of an enlarged prostate, and to treat post-traumatic stress disorder.

ori_sentence: Pyrantel is a medication used to treat a number of parasitic worm infections.
simple_sent: Pyrantel is a medicine. It is used to treat certain kinds of infections.

ori_sentence: Geographic tongue, also known by several other terms, is a condition of the mucous membrane of the tongue, usually on the dorsal surface.
simple_sent: Geographic tongue is a condition of the tongue. It is usually found on the dorsal surface (bottom part of the tongue).

simple_sent: Obtundation is when a person has less than full consciousness. This usually happens because of a medical condition or trauma.

ori_sentence: The tibial nerve is a branch of the sciatic nerve.
simple_sent: The tibial nerve is an important nerve.

simple_sent: Fosamprenavir (also known as Lexiva in the U.S. and Telzir in Europe) is a drug that is used to treat HIV infection. It is also known as calcium salt.

ori_sentence: Acute generalized exanthematous pustulosis (AGEP) (also known as pustular drug eruption and toxic pustuloderma) is a rare skin reaction that in 90% of cases is related to medication administration.
simple_sent: Acute generalized exanthematous pustulosis (AGEP) (also known as toxic pustuloderma) is a rare skin reaction. In 90% of cases, the cause of the pustulosis is the drug.

ori_sentence: Bronchoscopy is an endoscopic technique of visualizing the inside of the airways for diagnostic and therapeutic purposes.
simple_sent: Bronchoscopy is an endoscopic procedure to view the inside of the airways. It is used to diagnose and treat diseases.

ori_sentence: Chikungunya is an infection caused by the Chikungunya virus (CHIKV).
simple_sent: Chikungunya is a disease. The disease is caused by a virus.

ori_sentence: Methohexital or methohexitone (marketed under the brand names Brevital and Brietal) is a drug which is a barbiturate derivative.
simple_sent: Methohexital (also known as Brietal and Brevital) is a barbiturate drug. It is also known as methohexitone.

ori_sentence: Ocular melanosis (OM) is a blue-gray and/or brown lesion of the conjunctiva that can be separated into benign conjunctival epithelial melanosis (BCEM) and primary acquired melanosis (PAM), of which the latter is considered a risk factor for uveal melanoma.
simple_sent: Ocular melanosis (OM) is a condition where the outside of the eye (the conjunctiva) becomes blue-gray and/or brown. There are two types of ocular melanosis: benign conjunctival epithelial melanosis (BCEM) and primary acquired melanosis (PAM).

ori_sentence: Kocher's sign is a medical sign that denotes an eyelid phenomenon in hyperthyroidism and Basedow's disease.
simple_sent: Kocher's sign is a medical sign. It can be seen when someone has hyperthyroidism or Basedow's disease.

ori_sentence: The alveolar process (/ælˈviːələr/) is the thickened ridge of bone that contains the tooth sockets on the jaw bones (in humans, the maxilla and the mandible).
simple_sent: The alveolar process is a thick ridge of bone in the jaw. In humans, the two main parts of the alveolar process are the maxilla and the mandible.

ori_sentence: A spinal cord injury (SCI) is damage to the spinal cord that causes temporary or permanent changes in its function.
simple_sent: A spinal cord injury (SCI) is damage to the spinal cord. It usually happens over a short period of time.

ori_sentence: Norrie disease is a rare disease and genetic disorder that primarily affects the eyes and almost always leads to blindness.
simple_sent: Norrie disease is a very rare disease. It mostly affects the eyes, and people who have it are usually blind.

ori_sentence: The ophthalmic nerve (V1) is one of three divisions of the trigeminal nerve (CN V).
simple_sent: The ophthalmic nerve is a nerve in the eye. It is part of the trigeminal nerve.

ori_sentence: An oogonium (plural oogonia) is a small diploid cell which, upon maturation, forms a primordial follicle in a female fetus or the female (haploid or diploid) gametangium of certain thallophytes.
simple_sent: An oogonium (plural oogonia) is a small diploid cell. When it becomes big enough, it forms a follicle in a female fetus or the female gametes of certain thallophytes.

ori_sentence: Oscillopsia is a visual disturbance in which objects in the visual field appear to oscillate.
simple_sent: Oscillopsia is when an object in the visual field appears to move from one place to another.

ori_sentence: Goat milk is the milk of domestic goats.
simple_sent: Goat milk is a type of milk.

ori_sentence: Sympathetic ophthalmia (SO), also called spared eye injury, is a diffuse granulomatous inflammation of the uveal layer of both eyes following trauma to one eye.
simple_sent: Sympathetic ophthalmia (SO) is an inflammation of the uveal layer of both eyes. It can also be called spared eye injury, but that is not the same.

ori_sentence: The corneal epithelium (epithelium corneæ anterior layer) is made up of epithelial tissue and covers the front of the cornea.
simple_sent: The front part of the cornea is called the epithelium. The epithelium covers the front part of the cornea.

ori_sentence: The facial nerve (the labyrinthine segment) is the seventh cranial nerve, or simply CN VII.
simple_sent: The labyrinthine segment of the facial nerve is the seventh cranial nerve.

ori_sentence: Aplastic anemia is a disease in which the body fails to produce blood cells in sufficient numbers.
simple_sent: Aplastic anemia is when the body does not produce enough blood cells. This is a disease.

ori_sentence: Siderosis is the deposition of excess iron in body tissue.
simple_sent: Siderosis is when iron is put into the body too much.

ori_sentence: Granuloma inguinale is a bacterial disease caused by Klebsiella granulomatis (formerly known as Calymmatobacterium granulomatis) characterized by genital ulcers.
simple_sent: Granuloma inguinale is a bacterial disease. It is caused by a bacterium called Klebsiella granulomatis. The disease is characterized by genital ulcers.

ori_sentence: Hyporeflexia refers to below normal or absent reflexes (areflexia).
simple_sent: Hyporeflexia is when the reflexes are not as strong.

ori_sentence: Hyperacusis is the increased sensitivity to sound and a low tolerance for environmental noise.
simple_sent: Hyperacusis means that the person is more sensitive to sound and less sensitive to noise.

ori_sentence: Wartenberg's syndrome is a specific mononeuropathy, caused by entrapment of the superficial branch of the radial nerve.
simple_sent: Wartenberg's syndrome is a medical condition. It is caused by damage to the radial nerve in the neck.

ori_sentence: Heart cancer is an extremely rare form of cancer that is divided into primary tumors of the heart and secondary tumors of the heart.
simple_sent: Heart cancer is a very rare type of cancer. The two main types of heart cancer are primary heart cancer and secondary heart cancer.

ori_sentence: δ-Aminolevulinic acid (also dALA, δ-ALA, 5ALA or 5-aminolevulinic acid), an endogenous non-proteinogenic amino acid, is the first compound in the porphyrin synthesis pathway, the pathway that leads to heme in mammals, as well as chlorophyll in plants.
simple_sent: Aminolevulinic acid (also known as dALA, 5ALA or 5-aminolevulinic acid) is a chemical compound. It is an amino acid that is found in all living things. It is the first part of the porphyrin synthesis process.

ori_sentence: Amodiaquine (ADQ) is a medication used to treat malaria, including Plasmodium falciparum malaria when uncomplicated.
simple_sent: Amodiaquine (ADQ) is a medication. It is used to treat Plasmodium falciparum malaria and other related diseases.

ori_sentence: Tungiasis is an inflammatory skin disease caused by infection with the female ectoparasitic Tunga penetrans (also known as chigoe flea, jigger, nigua or sand flea; NOTE: not chigger), found in the tropical parts of Africa, the Caribbean, Central and South America, and India.
simple_sent: The female Tunga penetrans (also known as chigoe flea, jigger, nigua or sand flea) is the main cause of tungiasis. Tunga penetrans can be found in tropical parts of Africa, the Caribbean, Central and South America, and India.

ori_sentence: Pulmonary alveolar proteinosis (PAP) is a rare lung disorder characterized by an abnormal accumulation of surfactant-derived lipoprotein compounds within the alveoli of the lung.
simple_sent: Pulmonary alveolar proteinosis (PAP) is a rare disease. In it, the alveoli of the lung (the opening to the lungs) become too big for their size.

ori_sentence: Gradenigo's syndrome, also called Gradenigo-Lannois syndrome, is a complication of otitis media and mastoiditis involving the apex of the petrous temporal bone.
simple_sent: Gradenigo's syndrome, also called Gradenigo-Lannois syndrome, is an infection of the temporal bone in the face. It is also called mastoiditis.

ori_sentence: A systemic disease is one that affects a number of organs and tissues, or affects the body as a whole.
simple_sent: A systemic disease is a disease that affects more than one part of the body, or the whole body.

ori_sentence: A glycogen storage disease (GSD, also glycogenosis and dextrinosis) is a metabolic disorder caused by an enzyme deficiency affecting glycogen synthesis, glycogen breakdown, or glucose breakdown, typically in muscles and/or liver cells.
simple_sent: A glycogen storage disease (GSD, also glycogenosis and dextrinosis) is a disease where the body can not make enough glycogen. This usually happens when there is not enough glucose in the body's blood.

ori_sentence: Retinopathy of prematurity (ROP), also called retrolental fibroplasia (RLF) and Terry syndrome, is a disease of the eye affecting prematurely born babies generally having received neonatal intensive care, in which oxygen therapy is used due to the premature development of their lungs.
simple_sent: Retinopathy of prematurity (ROP), also called retrolental fibroplasia (RLF) and Terry syndrome, is a disease of the eye. It happens to babies who were born too early. When they are born, their lungs do not develop properly and they need oxygen.

ori_sentence: Phlebitis or venitis is the inflammation of a vein, usually in the legs.
simple_sent: Phlebitis or venitis is a disease. It usually happens in the legs.

ori_sentence: Histrionic personality disorder (HPD) is defined by the American Psychiatric Association as a personality disorder characterized by a pattern of excessive attention-seeking behaviors, usually beginning in early childhood, including inappropriate seduction and an excessive desire for approval.
simple_sent: Histrionic personality disorder (HPD) is a type of personality disorder. People who have this disorder usually have a pattern of attention-seeking behaviors that start in early childhood, and they also have a strong desire for approval.

ori_sentence: Biliary dyskinesia is a disorder of some component of biliary part of the digestive system in which bile cannot physically move in the proper direction through the tubular biliary tract.
simple_sent: Biliary dyskinesia is a disease. It happens when the bile in the biliary system can not move in the right direction through the body. This is called biliary dyskinesia.

ori_sentence: The epithalamus is a posterior (dorsal) segment of the diencephalon.

ori_sentence: Alveolar osteitis, also known as dry socket, is inflammation of the alveolar bone (i.e., the alveolar process of the maxilla or mandible).
simple_sent: Alveolar osteitis, also known as dry socket, is an infection of the alveolar bone. It usually starts in the alveolar process.

ori_sentence: Leonine facies is a facies that resembles that of a lion.
simple_sent: The Leonine facies looks a little like a lion.

ori_sentence: Chronic progressive external ophthalmoplegia (CPEO), is a type of eye disorder characterized by slowly progressive inability to move the eyes and eyebrows.
simple_sent: Chronic progressive external ophthalmoplegia (CPEO) is an eye disease that gets worse over time. People with this disease can not move their eyes.

ori_sentence: The pulmonary wedge pressure (PWP), also called pulmonary arterial wedge pressure (PAWP), pulmonary capillary wedge pressure (PCWP), pulmonary artery occlusion pressure (PAOP), or cross-sectional pressure, is the pressure measured by wedging a pulmonary catheter with an inflated balloon into a small pulmonary arterial branch.
simple_sent: The pulmonary wedge pressure (PWP), also called pulmonary capillary wedge pressure (PCWP), pulmonary artery occlusion pressure (PAOP), or cross-sectional pressure, is the pressure in a pulmonary artery when a person breathes through their nose.

ori_sentence: Paraphimosis is an uncommon medical condition in which the foreskin of a penis becomes trapped behind the glans penis, and cannot be reduced (pulled back to its normal flaccid position covering the glans).
simple_sent: Paraphimosis is an unusual medical condition. In this condition, the foreskin of a penis gets caught behind the glans penis, and can not be removed, even if the man wants to.

ori_sentence: A neurofibroma is a benign nerve-sheath tumor in the peripheral nervous system.
simple_sent: A neurofibroma is a small tumor in the central nervous system.

ori_sentence: Manual lymphatic drainage (MLD) is a type of massage based on the hypothesis that it will encourage the natural drainage of the lymph, which carries waste products away from the tissues back toward the heart.
simple_sent: Manual lymphatic drainage (MLD) is a type of massage that is done to help lymphatic drainage. It is done so that the lymph can carry waste products away from the tissues and back to the heart.

ori_sentence: Butenafine, sold under the brand names Lotrimin Ultra, Mentax, and Butop (India), is a synthetic benzylamine antifungal.
simple_sent: Butenafine (also known as Lotrimin Ultra and Butop in India) is a chemical compound. It is an antifungal.

ori_sentence: An inhaler (also known as a puffer, pump or allergy spray) is a medical device used for delivering medicines into the lungs through the work of a person's breathing.
simple_sent: An inhaler (also known as a puffer, pump or allergy spray) is a tool that people use to help them breathe easier when they take drugs.

ori_sentence: Seborrhoeic dermatitis, sometimes inaccurately referred to as seborrhoea, is a long-term skin disorder.
simple_sent: Seborrhoeic dermatitis, also known as seborrhoea, is a long-term disease of the skin.

simple_sent: An alveolar macrophage, pulmonary macrophage, or dust cell is a type of phagocyte. They are found in the alveoli in the lungs, but they are not part of the walls of the alveoli.

simple_sent: The brachial plexus is a network of nerves in the middle of the human body. It is made up of the lower four cervical nerves and the first thoracic nerve.

simple_sent: A syndesmophyte is a bony growth that comes from inside a ligament. Most often, syndesmophytes are found in the ligaments of the spine, especially the joints between the vertebrae.

ori_sentence: Perilymph is an extracellular fluid located within the inner ear.
simple_sent: Perilymph is a fluid in the inner ear. It is an extracellular fluid.

ori_sentence: Myocardial stunning or transient post-ischemic myocardial dysfunction is a state of mechanical cardiac dysfunction that can occur in a portion of myocardium without necrosis after a brief interruption in perfusion, despite the timely restoration of normal coronary blood flow.
simple_sent: Myocardial stunning or transient post-ischemic myocardial dysfunction is a condition in which the heart does not work as well as it should. After a short interruption in blood flow to the heart, the part of the myocardium that carries blood can become damaged.

ori_sentence: Peliosis hepatis is an uncommon vascular condition characterised by multiple, randomly distributed, blood-filled cavities throughout the liver.
simple_sent: Peliosis hepatis is a rare vascular condition. In this condition, there are many blood-filled cavities all over the liver.

ori_sentence: El Tor is a particular strain of the bacterium Vibrio cholerae, the causative agent of cholera.
simple_sent: Cholera is caused by a bacterium called Vibrio cholerae. El Tor is a type of Vibrio.

ori_sentence: Senescence (/sɪˈnɛsəns/) or biological aging is the gradual deterioration of functional characteristics in living organisms.
simple_sent: Senescence (or biological aging) is when a living thing gets older. It happens over time and is not a disease.

ori_sentence: Peritoneal carcinomatosis (PC) is intraperitoneal dissemination (carcinosis) of any form of cancer that does not originate from the peritoneum itself.
simple_sent: Peritoneal carcinomatosis (PC) is cancer that spreads from the peritoneum to the rest of the body. It is a life long disease.

ori_sentence: Patent ductus arteriosus (PDA) is a medical condition in which the ductus arteriosus fails to close after birth: this allows a portion of oxygenated blood from the left heart to flow back to the lungs by flowing from the aorta, which has a higher pressure, to the pulmonary artery.
simple_sent: Patent ductus arteriosus (PDA) is a medical condition in which the ductus arteriosus does not close when a baby is born. This allows blood from the left heart to flow back to the lungs, but at a higher pressure than when it came from the aorta.

ori_sentence: A variant of eccrine spiradenoma which can be multiple on the scalp and can coalesce to form a 'Turban' tumour.
simple_sent: A type of spiradenoma that can be multiple on the scalp. These tumours can form a 'Turban' tumour.

ori_sentence: The term macrocytic is from Greek words meaning "large cell".
simple_sent: The word "macrocytic" comes from the Greek word "macro".

ori_sentence: Glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase deficiency (G6PDD) is an inborn error of metabolism that predisposes to red blood cell breakdown.
simple_sent: Glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase (G6PDD) is a defect in metabolism. It makes red blood cells not work properly.

ori_sentence: Niemann–Pick type C (NPC) (colloquially, "Childhood Alzheimer's") is a lysosomal storage disease associated with mutations in NPC1 and NPC2 genes.
simple_sent: Childhood Alzheimer's disease, also called Niemann-Pick type C, is a lysosomal storage disease. It is caused by mutations in two genes.

ori_sentence: Lichen planus (LP) is a chronic inflammatory and immune-mediated disease that affects the skin, nails, hair, and mucous membranes.
simple_sent: Lichen planus (LP) is a disease that affects the skin. It is an immune-mediated disease, meaning it does not go away.

ori_sentence: Potassium dichromate, K2Cr2O7, is a common inorganic chemical reagent, most commonly used as an oxidizing agent in various laboratory and industrial applications.
simple_sent: Potassium dichromate, K2Cr2O7, is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is K2Cr2O7. It is a common inorganic chemical reagent.

ori_sentence: In anatomy, the precordium or praecordium is the portion of the body over the heart and lower chest.
simple_sent: In anatomy, the precordium (or praecordium) is the lower part of the human body.

ori_sentence: A sedative or tranquilliser is a substance that induces sedation by reducing irritability or excitement.
simple_sent: A sedative or tranquilliser is a drug that helps people to sleep. It does this by reducing excitement.

ori_sentence: Familial dysbetalipoproteinemia or type III hyperlipoproteinemia is a condition characterized by increased total cholesterol and triglyceride levels, and decreased HDL levels.
simple_sent: Familial dysbetalipoproteinemia or type III hyperlipoproteinemia is a condition in which people have higher levels of cholesterol in their blood.

ori_sentence: Cardiomyopathy is a group of diseases that affect the heart muscle.
simple_sent: Cardiomyopathy is a disease that affects the heart muscle.

ori_sentence: An imperforate hymen is a congenital disorder where a hymen without an opening completely obstructs the vagina.
simple_sent: If there is no opening at all, the hymen will not come out at all. This is called an imperforate hymen.

ori_sentence: Polycystic liver disease (PLD) usually describes the presence of multiple cysts scattered throughout normal liver tissue.
simple_sent: Polycystic liver disease (PLD) is when there are many cysts in the liver. Usually, they are all in one place.

ori_sentence: Trichlormethiazide (INN, currently being sold under the brand names of Achletin, Diu-Hydrin and Triflumen) is a diuretic with properties similar to those of hydrochlorothiazide.
simple_sent: Trichlormethiazide (also known as Achletin, Diu-Hydrin and Triflumen) is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is HCl2O3. It is a diuretic.

ori_sentence: Dumping syndrome occurs when food, especially sugar, moves too quickly from the stomach to the duodenum—the first part of the small intestine—in the upper gastrointestinal (GI) tract.
simple_sent: Dumping syndrome happens when food moves too fast from the stomach to the duodenum. The duodenum is the first part of the small intestine.

ori_sentence: The ciliary muscle is an intrinsic muscle of the eye formed as a ring of smooth muscle in the eye's middle layer, uvea or (vascular layer).
simple_sent: The ciliary muscle is a muscle in the eye. It is a ring of smooth muscle in the middle layer of the eye, called the uvea.

ori_sentence: Amelogenesis imperfecta (AI) is a congenital disorder which presents with a rare abnormal formation of the enamel or external layer of the crown of teeth, unrelated to any systemic or generalized conditions.
simple_sent: Amelogenesis imperfecta (AI) is a rare disorder in which the crown of teeth does not form properly. It is not related to other conditions in the body or to other diseases.

ori_sentence: Cyclothymia, also known as cyclothymic disorder, is a mental and behavioural disorder that involves numerous periods of symptoms of depression and periods of symptoms of elevated mood.
simple_sent: Cyclothymia, also known as cyclothymic disorder, is a mental and behavioural disorder. People who suffer from cyclothymia have a number of different symptoms.

ori_sentence: Cysticercosis is a tissue infection caused by the young form of the pork tapeworm.
simple_sent: Cysticercosis is a disease. It is caused by a tapeworm when it is young.

ori_sentence: Milrinone, commonly known and marketed under the brand name Primacor, is a pulmonary vasodilator used in patients who have heart failure.
simple_sent: Primacor, also known as Milrinone, is a pulmonary vasodilator. It is used to help people with heart failure.

ori_sentence: Ventricular fibrillation (V-fib or VF) is an abnormal heart rhythm in which the ventricles of the heart quiver do not pump normally.
simple_sent: Ventricular fibrillation (also called VF or V-Fib) is a heart problem. When this happens, the heart does not pump properly.

ori_sentence: Pleomorphic adenoma is a common benign salivary gland neoplasm characterised by neoplastic proliferation of parenchymatous glandular cells along with myoepithelial components, having a malignant potentiality.
simple_sent: Pleomorphic adenoma is a common benign salivary gland neoplasm. It is made up of parenchymatous glandular cells and myoepithelial cells. It can become malignant if it is not treated.

ori_sentence: The fovea centralis is a small, central pit composed of closely packed cones in the eye.
simple_sent: The fovea centralis is a small part of the eye. It is a small, central pit.

ori_sentence: Interstitial nephritis, also known as tubulointerstitial nephritis, is inflammation of the area of the kidney known as the renal interstitium, which consists of a collection of cells, extracellular matrix, and fluid surrounding the renal tubules.
simple_sent: Interstitial nephritis, also known as tubulointerstitial nephritis, is an inflammation of the area of the kidney called the renal interstitium. The interstitium is made up of cells, fluid, and extracellular matrix.

ori_sentence: Sclerodactyly is a localized thickening and tightness of the skin of the fingers or toes.
simple_sent: Sclerodactyly is when the skin around the fingers or toes becomes too tight.

ori_sentence: Cyclizine, sold under a number of brand names, is a medication used to treat and prevent nausea, vomiting and dizziness due to motion sickness or vertigo.
simple_sent: Cyclizine is a medication that is used to treat motion sickness or vertigo. It is also used to prevent nausea and vomiting.

ori_sentence: Foam cells, also called lipid-laden macrophages, are a type of cell that contain cholesterol.
simple_sent: Foam cells are a type of cell. They contain cholesterol and are called lipid-laden macrophages.

ori_sentence: Hematoxylin and eosin stain (or haematoxylin and eosin stain or hematoxylin-eosin stain; often abbreviated as H&E stain or HE stain) is one of the principal tissue stains used in histology.
simple_sent: Hematoxylin and eosin stain (or haematoxylin and eosin stain or hematoxylin-eosin stain or H&E stain) is a stain that can be found on blood and tissue.

ori_sentence: Tinea nigra, also known as superficial phaeohyphomycosis and Tinea nigra palmaris et plantaris, is a superficial fungal infection, a type of phaeohyphomycosis rather than a tinea, that causes usually a single 1–5 cm dark brown-black, non-scaly, flat, painless patch on the palms of the hands and the soles of the feet of healthy people.
simple_sent: Tinea nigra, also known as superficial phaeohyphomycosis and Tinea nigra palmaris et plantaris, is a fungal infection of the hands and feet. A person who has the infection will have a small, dark brown-black area on the palms of their hands and on the soles of their feet.

ori_sentence: Nocturia is defined by the International Continence Society (ICS) as “the complaint that the individual has to wake at night one or more times for voiding (i.e. to urinate).”
simple_sent: The International Continence Society (ICS) defines nocturia as "the complaint that the individual has to wake at night one or more times for the purpose of urinating".

simple_sent: A dislocated shoulder is when the shoulder joint is not properly attached to the head of the humerus.

ori_sentence: Bulbar palsy refers to a range of different signs and symptoms linked to impairment of function of the glossopharyngeal nerve (CN IX), the vagus nerve (CN X), the accessory nerve (CN XI), and the hypoglossal nerve (CN XII).
simple_sent: Bulbar palsy is caused by a nerve injury to the glossopharyngeal nerve. There are four main parts of the nerve: the vagus nerve, the accessory nerve, the hypoglossal nerve, and the glossopharyngeal nerve.

ori_sentence: Complex post-traumatic stress disorder (C-PTSD; also known as complex trauma disorder) is a psychological disorder that can develop in response to prolonged, repeated experience of interpersonal trauma in a context in which the individual perceives little or no chance of escape.
simple_sent: Complex post-traumatic stress disorder (C-PTSD; also known as complex trauma disorder) is a psychological disorder. People who suffer from it are said to have been through a lot of trauma in their lives, and this has affected them in a bad way.

ori_sentence: Meibomian glands (also called tarsal glands) are holocrine type exocrine glands, along the rims of the eyelid inside the tarsal plate.
simple_sent: Meibomian glands (also called tarsal glands) are glands in the tarsal plate of the foot. They are a type of exocrine glands.

ori_sentence: The tuber cinereum is a hollow eminence of the middle–ventral hypothalamus, specifically the arcuate nucleus, situated between the mammillary bodies and the optic chiasm.
simple_sent: The tuber cinereum is a hollow part of the hypothalamus. The arcuate nucleus of the tuber cinereum is found between the mammillary bodies and the optic chiasm.

ori_sentence: Pirfenidone is a medication used for the treatment of idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis.
simple_sent: Pirfenidone is used to treat idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis (IPF).

ori_sentence: Microangiopathic hemolytic anemia (MAHA) is a microangiopathic subgroup of hemolytic anemia (loss of red blood cells through destruction) caused by factors in the small blood vessels.
simple_sent: Microangiopathic hemolytic anemia (MAHA) is a subgroup of hemolytic anemia. It causes loss of red blood cells because of damage to the small blood vessels.

ori_sentence: A separated shoulder, also known as acromioclavicular joint injury, is a common injury to the acromioclavicular joint.
simple_sent: A separated shoulder is a common injury to the shoulder. It is also called an acromioclavicular joint injury.

ori_sentence: Dacryoadenitis is inflammation of the lacrimal glands.
simple_sent: Dacryoadenitis is a medical condition.

simple_sent: Subacute combined degeneration of spinal cord, also known as Lichtheim's disease or Putnam-Dana syndrome, is a disease where the spinal cord gets shorter and shorter. This happens because the body does not get enough vitamin B12 and vitamin E.

simple_sent: Rectal prolapse is when the walls of the rectum become too wide. When this happens, it can be seen outside the body.

simple_sent: A renal cyst is a fluid build-up in the kidney.

simple_sent: Coronary artery disease (CAD), also called coronary heart disease (CHD), ischemic heart disease (IHD), or simply heart disease, is a disease where the heart can not pump blood well. The main cause of coronary heart disease is heart disease.

ori_sentence: Cystoscopy is endoscopy of the urinary bladder via the urethra.

ori_sentence: Anisometropia is when two eyes have unequal refractive power.

ori_sentence: Savant syndrome is a rare condition in which someone with significant mental disabilities demonstrates certain abilities far in excess of average.
simple_sent: Savant syndrome is a rare condition. In this case, a person has a mental disability, but they still have many more skills than average.

simple_sent: The term fibromatosis refers to a group of soft tissue tumors which have certain characteristics in common, including an infiltrative growth pattern, a histology consistent with well-differentiated fibroblasts, a lack of cytologic and clinical malignant features, and with frequent local recurrence.

ori_sentence: Angiography or arteriography is a medical imaging technique used to visualize the inside, or lumen, of blood vessels and organs of the body, with particular interest in the arteries, veins, and the heart chambers.
simple_sent: Angiography or arteriography is a type of medical imaging. It shows the inside of blood vessels and organs of the body. The main parts of the body that are shown are the arteries and veins.

ori_sentence: Ecthyma is a variation of impetigo, presenting at a deeper level of tissue.
simple_sent: Ecthyma is a different type of impetigo. It shows at a deeper level.

ori_sentence: The primitive streak is a structure that forms in the blastula during the early stages of avian, reptilian and mammalian embryonic development.
simple_sent: The primitive streak is a structure that forms in the blastula during the early stages of embryonic development in birds and mammals.

ori_sentence: Adenocarcinoma of the lung is the most common type of lung cancer, and like other forms of lung cancer, it is characterized by distinct cellular and molecular features.
simple_sent: Adenocarcinoma of the lung is the most common type of lung cancer. There are many different types of lung cancer, but adenocarcinoma is the most common.

ori_sentence: Carnitine is a quaternary ammonium compound involved in metabolism in most mammals, plants, and some bacteria.
simple_sent: Carnitine is a chemical compound. It is an important chemical in most mammals, plants, and bacteria.

simple_sent: Percutaneous transhepatic cholangiography (also called percutaneous hepatic cholangiogram or percutaneous transhepatic cholangiography and drainage) is a type of medical imaging.

ori_sentence: Waxy flexibility is a psychomotor symptom of catatonia as associated with schizophrenia, bipolar disorder, or other mental disorders which leads to a decreased response to stimuli and a tendency to remain in an immobile posture.
simple_sent: Waxy flexibility is a psychomotor symptom of catatonia. It may be caused by schizophrenia, bipolar disorder, or other mental disorders. With this, the body does not react as much to things that are near it.

ori_sentence: Hepatorenal syndrome (often abbreviated HRS) is a life-threatening medical condition that consists of rapid deterioration in kidney function in individuals with cirrhosis or fulminant liver failure.
simple_sent: Hepatorenal syndrome (often called HRS) is a life-threatening medical condition. It happens when the kidney does not work the way it should, and it does not get better with time.

ori_sentence: A port-wine stain (nevus flammeus) is a discoloration of the human skin caused by a vascular anomaly (a capillary malformation in the skin).
simple_sent: A port-wine stain (nevus flammeus) is a discoloration of the human skin. It is usually caused by a blood clot in the skin.

ori_sentence: Chromosome 5q deletion syndrome is an acquired, hematological disorder characterized by loss of part of the long arm (q arm, band 5q33.1) of human chromosome 5 in bone marrow myelocyte cells.
simple_sent: Chromosome 5q deletion syndrome is a hematological disorder. People who have it have lost part of the long arm (q arm, band 5q33.1) of human chromosome 5 in bone marrow.

ori_sentence: Fibrous dysplasia is a disorder where normal bone and marrow is replaced with fibrous tissue, resulting in formation of bone that is weak and prone to expansion.
simple_sent: Fibrous dysplasia is a disease where the normal bone and marrow are replaced by fibrous tissue. This makes the bone become weak and can grow back.

ori_sentence: A convulsion is a medical condition where body muscles contract and relax rapidly and repeatedly, resulting in uncontrolled shaking.
simple_sent: A convulsion is when the body muscles contract and relax very quickly. This makes the whole body shake very badly.

ori_sentence: A gastroenterostomy is the surgical creation of a connection between the stomach and the jejunum.
simple_sent: A gastroenterostomy is a special kind of surgery. It is done to open up the stomach.

ori_sentence: Periventricular leukomalacia (PVL) is a form of white-matter brain injury, characterized by the necrosis (more often coagulation) of white matter near the lateral ventricles.
simple_sent: Periventricular leukomalacia (PVL) is a form of brain injury. It happens when white matter near the lateral ventricles of the brain becomes damaged.

ori_sentence: Diabetic neuropathy refers to various types of nerve damage associated with diabetes mellitus.
simple_sent: Diabetic neuropathy is a condition that happens when people with diabetes get nerve damage.

ori_sentence: A hemangioma or haemangioma is a usually benign vascular tumor derived from blood vessel cell types.
simple_sent: A hemangioma or haemangioma is a tumor in the blood. Usually, it is a benign tumor.

ori_sentence: Acute pancreatitis (AP) is a sudden inflammation of the pancreas.
simple_sent: Acute pancreatitis is when the pancreas becomes very sick.

ori_sentence: Chorioamnionitis, also known as intra-amniotic infection (IAI), is inflammation of the fetal membranes (amnion and chorion), usually due to bacterial infection.
simple_sent: Chorioamnionitis, also known as intra-amniotic infection (IAI), is an infection of theamnion and chorion during fetal development.

ori_sentence: Schizotypal personality disorder (STPD), also known as schizotypal disorder, is a mental and behavioural disorder.
simple_sent: Schizotypal personality disorder (STPD) is a mental disorder. People who have it are called schizotypal.

ori_sentence: Ketamine is a medication primarily used for induction and maintenance of anesthesia.
simple_sent: Ketamine is a drug. It is used to make anesthesia more comfortable for people.

ori_sentence: Paracoccidioidomycosis (PCM), also known as South American blastomycosis, is a fungal infection that can occur as a mouth and skin type, lymphangitic type, multi-organ involvement type (particularly lungs), or mixed type.
simple_sent: Paracoccidioidomycosis (PCM), also known as South American blastomycosis, is a fungal infection of the mouth and skin. It can also happen in other parts of the body, such as the lungs or lymphatic system.

ori_sentence: Hypsarrhythmia is very chaotic and disorganized brain electrical activity with no recognizable pattern, whereas a normal brain electrical activity shows clear separation between each signal and visible pattern.
simple_sent: Hypsarrhythmia is when the brain does not make any electrical activity at all. In a normal brain activity, there is a clear line between each signal and what is seen as a pattern.

ori_sentence: Corneal dystrophy is a group of rare hereditary disorders characterised by bilateral abnormal deposition of substances in the transparent front part of the eye called the cornea.
simple_sent: Corneal dystrophy is a disease that happens to people in rare cases. It is caused by chemicals getting into the front part of the eye, called the cornea.

ori_sentence: Page kidney or Page phenomena is a potentially reversible form of secondary arterial hypertension caused by external compression of the renal parenchyma by some perirenal process.
simple_sent: Page kidney or page phenomena is a form of secondary arterial hypertension. It can be treated if it is treated early, and it can be reversed if it is treated.

ori_sentence: Concretion in the palpebral conjunctiva, is called conjunctival concretion, that is a (or a cluster of) small, hard, yellowish-white calcified matter, superficially buried beneath the palpebral conjunctiva.
simple_sent: Concretion in the palpebral conjunctiva is called conjunctival concretion. It is made of small, hard, yellowish-white calcified matter, which is usually covered by the palpebral conjunctiva.

simple_sent: Tarsal tunnel syndrome (TTS) is a painful condition of the foot. It happens when the tibial nerve gets compressed when it goes through the tarsal tunnel.

simple_sent: Fibrodysplasia ossificans progressiva (FOP), also known as Münchmeyer disease, is a rare disease. It happens to people who have a mutation in the ACVR1 gene.

ori_sentence: The cochlear duct (bounded by the scala media) is an endolymph filled cavity inside the cochlea, located between the tympanic duct and the vestibular duct, separated by the basilar membrane and the vestibular membrane (Reissner's membrane) respectively.
simple_sent: The cochlear duct is an endolymph filled cavity inside the cochlea. It is between the tympanic duct and the vestibular duct. The basilar membrane and the vestibular membrane separate the duct from the tympanic duct.

ori_sentence: In human anatomy, the ulnar nerve is a nerve that runs near the ulna bone.
simple_sent: The ulnar nerve is an important nerve in the human body.

ori_sentence: Aminophylline is a compound of the bronchodilator theophylline with ethylenediamine in 2:1 ratio.
simple_sent: Aminophylline is a chemical compound. It contains the theophylline and ethylenediamine ions.

itemLabel: periodic fever, aphthous stomatitis, pharyngitis and adenitis
ori_sentence: Periodic fever, aphthous stomatitis, pharyngitis and adenitis syndrome is a medical condition, typically starting in young children, in which high fever occurs periodically at intervals of about 3-5 weeks, frequently accompanied by aphthous-like ulcers, pharyngitis and/or cervical adenitis (cervical lymphadenopathy).
simple_sent: Periodic fever, aphthous stomatitis, pharyngitis and adenitis syndrome is a medical condition. It usually starts in young children and lasts for about 3-5 weeks, but it can happen in adults as well. People who have periodic fever often get pharyngitis and/or cervical adenitis.

ori_sentence: Visceral leishmaniasis (VL), also known as kala-azar, is the most severe form of leishmaniasis and, without proper diagnosis and treatment, is associated with high fatality.
simple_sent: Visceral leishmaniasis (VL), also known as kala-azar, is the most serious form of leishmaniasis. Without proper treatment, many people die from this disease.

ori_sentence: Laryngeal cancers are mostly squamous-cell carcinomas, reflecting their origin from the epithelium of the larynx.
simple_sent: Laryngeal cancer is cancer of the larynx. The most common type of laryngeal cancer is squamous cell cancer.

ori_sentence: Lansoprazole, sold under the brand name Selanz SR among others, is a medication which reduces stomach acid.
simple_sent: Lansoprazole (also known as Selanz SR) is a medication. It is used to reduce stomach acid.

ori_sentence: Trioxsalen (trimethylpsoralen (TMP), trioxysalen (INN) or Trisoralen) is a furanocoumarin and a psoralen derivative.
simple_sent: Trioxsalen (trimethylpsoralen) is a furanocoumarin. It is also known as trioxysalen or Trisoralen.

ori_sentence: Heterochromia is a variation in coloration.
simple_sent: Heterochromia can cause different colors.

ori_sentence: The basal ganglia (or basal nuclei) are a group of subcortical nuclei, of varied origin, in the brains of vertebrates.
simple_sent: The basal ganglia (or basal nuclei) are a part of the brain. They are located in the lower part of the brain.

ori_sentence: Cytopenia is a reduction in the number of mature blood cells.
simple_sent: Cytopenia is when there are less mature blood cells.

ori_sentence: Surgical scissors are surgical instruments usually used for cutting.
simple_sent: Surgical scissors are tools that are used to cut things.

ori_sentence: Natamycin, also known as pimaricin, is an antifungal medication used to treat fungal infections around the eye.
simple_sent: Natamycin (also known as pimaricin) is a drug. It is used to stop fungal infections from happening.

ori_sentence: Multiple myeloma (MM), also known as plasma cell myeloma and simply myeloma, is a cancer of plasma cells, a type of white blood cell that normally produces antibodies.
simple_sent: Multiple myeloma (MM) is a cancer of the plasma cells. Plasma cells are a type of white blood cell. People who have this cancer are called plasma cell myeloma.

ori_sentence: The amnion is a membrane that closely covers the human and various other embryos when first formed.
simple_sent: The amnion membrane is a special membrane. It covers the human body when it is first formed.

ori_sentence: Refractive error, also known as refraction error, is a problem with focusing light accurately on the retina due to the shape of the eye and or cornea.
simple_sent: Refractive error, also known as refraction error, is a problem. Because of the shape of the eye, light can not get into the eye very well.

ori_sentence: Amino acid transport disorders are medical conditions associated with a failure of amino acids to be absorbed from the kidney or intestine.
simple_sent: Amino acid transport disorders happen when the body does not get enough amino acids from the kidney or intestine.

ori_sentence: Prolotherapy, also called proliferation therapy is an injection-based treatment used in chronic musculoskeletal conditions.
simple_sent: Prolotherapy (also called proliferation therapy) is a medical treatment. It is given by injection.

ori_sentence: Caput succedaneum is a neonatal condition involving a serosanguinous, subcutaneous, extraperiosteal fluid collection with poorly defined margins caused by the pressure of the presenting part of the scalp against the dilating cervix (tourniquet effect of the cervix) during delivery.
simple_sent: Caput succedaneum is a neonatal condition in which a large amount of fluid collects in the scalp during delivery. This fluid is made by the pressure of the presenting part of the scalp against the cervix when the baby is born.

ori_sentence: Ganglioglioma is a rare, slow-growing primary central nervous system (CNS) tumor which most frequently occurs in the temporal lobes of children and young adults.
simple_sent: Ganglioglioma is a small, slow-growing tumor in the central nervous system. Most people who have it have it in the temporal lobes of the brain.

ori_sentence: A pseudoallergy is a condition named for its similar presentation to a true allergy, though due to different causes.
simple_sent: A pseudoallergy is a condition. It looks like a true allergy, but it does not work the same way.

ori_sentence: Neuroleptic malignant syndrome (NMS) is a rare but life-threatening reaction that can occur in response to neuroleptic or antipsychotic medication.
simple_sent: Neuroleptic malignant syndrome (NMS) is a rare but life-threatening reaction. It happens when a person takes a drug called neuroleptic.

ori_sentence: Hutchinson's teeth is a sign of congenital syphilis.
simple_sent: This condition is called congenital syphilis.

ori_sentence: B-cell prolymphocytic leukemia, referred to as B-PLL, is a rare blood cancer.
simple_sent: B-cell prolymphocytic leukemia is a very rare blood cancer.

ori_sentence: Hemosiderosis is a form of iron overload disorder resulting in the accumulation of hemosiderin.
simple_sent: Hemosiderosis is an iron overload disorder. This causes the body to build up hemosiderin.

ori_sentence: Diclofenac, sold under the brand name Voltaren among others, is a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) used to treat pain and inflammatory diseases such as gout.
simple_sent: Diclofenac (also known as Voltaren) is a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug. It is used to treat pain and inflammatory diseases, like gout.

ori_sentence: Alpha-mannosidosis is a lysosomal storage disorder, first described by Swedish physician Okerman in 1967.
simple_sent: Alpha-mannosidosis is a lysosomal storage disorder. The disorder was first described in 1967.

ori_sentence: Prothrombin G20210A is a genetic condition that increases the risk of blood clots including from deep vein thrombosis, and of pulmonary embolism.
simple_sent: Prothrombin G20210A is a genetic condition. People with this condition have a higher risk of getting a deep vein thrombosis.

ori_sentence: A primary tumor is a tumor growing at the anatomical site where tumor progression began and proceeded to yield a cancerous mass.
simple_sent: A primary tumor is a tumor that has started to grow at an area of the body. It then grows into a cancerous mass.

ori_sentence: Pyramidal cells, or pyramidal neurons, are a type of multipolar neuron found in areas of the brain including the cerebral cortex, the hippocampus, and the amygdala.
simple_sent: Pyramidal cells, or pyramidal neurons, are a type of neuron. They are found in the brain in three areas: the hippocampus, the cerebral cortex, and the amygdala.

ori_sentence: Pseudopterygium is the conjunctival adhesion to cornea caused by limbal or corneal inflammation or trauma.
simple_sent: Pseudopterygium is an adhesion to the cornea. It is usually caused by trauma to the cornea.

ori_sentence: Transcortical sensory aphasia (TSA) is a kind of aphasia that involves damage to specific areas of the temporal lobe of the brain, resulting in symptoms such as poor auditory comprehension, relatively intact repetition, and fluent speech with semantic paraphasias present.
simple_sent: Transcortical sensory aphasia (TSA) is a kind of aphasia. In this case, the damage is to certain areas of the brain. This causes symptoms such as poor hearing, but the person can still talk, even if they do not know what they are saying.

ori_sentence: Vaginal bleeding is any expulsion of blood from the vagina.
simple_sent: Vaginal bleeding is when blood comes out of the vagina.

ori_sentence: Porcelain gallbladder is a calcification of the gallbladder believed to be brought on by excessive gallstones, although the exact cause is not clear.
simple_sent: Porcelain gallbladder Porcelain gallbladder is caused by too many gallstones. The exact cause of porcelain gallbladder is not clear.

ori_sentence: Aplasia cutis congenita is a rare disorder characterized by congenital absence of skin.
simple_sent: Aplasia cutis congenita is a very rare condition. It causes a person to have no skin.

ori_sentence: Haloperidol, sold under the brand name Haldol among others, is a typical antipsychotic medication.
simple_sent: Haloperidol, also known as Haldol, is an anti-psychotic drug. It is sold under the name Haldol.

ori_sentence: Tetrasomy 18p is a genetic condition that is caused by the presence of an isochromosome composed of two copies of the short arm of chromosome 18 in addition to the two normal copies of the chromosome.
simple_sent: Tetrasomy 18p is a genetic condition. It is caused by an isochromosome. The isochromosome is made up of two copies of a chromosome, one on each side of the body.

ori_sentence: Kawasaki disease is a syndrome of unknown cause that results in a fever and mainly affects children under 5 years of age.
simple_sent: Kawasaki disease is a disease. People who have the disease have a fever. Most people have it when they are 5 years old.

ori_sentence: In medicine, prolapse is a condition in which organs fall down or slip out of place.
simple_sent: In medicine, prolapse is when organs fall out of place, or break down.

ori_sentence: Parry–Romberg syndrome (PRS) is a rare disease characterized by progressive shrinkage and degeneration of the tissues beneath the skin, usually on only one side of the face (hemifacial atrophy) but occasionally extending to other parts of the body.
simple_sent: Parry-Romberg syndrome (PRS) is a rare disease that causes the face to become smaller and smaller. This usually happens on only one side of the face (hemifacial atrophy) but can also happen in other parts of the body.

ori_sentence: Pharyngitis is inflammation of the back of the throat, known as the pharynx.
simple_sent: The back of the throat, called the pharynx, is affected by pharyngitis.

ori_sentence: Acute coronary syndrome (ACS) is a syndrome (a set of signs and symptoms) due to decreased blood flow in the coronary arteries such that part of the heart muscle is unable to function properly or dies.
simple_sent: Acute coronary syndrome (ACS) is a disease. It is caused by not enough blood getting to the heart. When there is not enough blood to the heart, the heart muscle can not work properly.

ori_sentence: Ghon's complex is a lesion seen in the lung that is caused by tuberculosis.
simple_sent: Ghon's complex is a disease. It is usually caused by tuberculosis.

ori_sentence: Prosopagnosia (from Greek prósōpon, meaning "face", and agnōsía, meaning "non-knowledge"), also called face blindness, is a cognitive disorder of face perception in which the ability to recognize familiar faces, including one's own face (self-recognition), is impaired, while other aspects of visual processing (e.g., object discrimination) and intellectual functioning (e.g., decision-making) remain intact.
simple_sent: Prosopagnosia (from Greek prósōpon, meaning "face", and agnōsía, meaning "non-knowledge"), also called face blindness, is a cognitive disorder in which a person's face can not be recognized (self-recognition), while other aspects of visual processing (e.g., object discrimination) and intellectual functioning (e.g., decision-making) remain intact.

ori_sentence: A nail disease or onychosis is a disease or deformity of the nail.
simple_sent: A nail disease or onychosis is when the nails do not grow properly.

ori_sentence: Prune belly syndrome is a rare, genetic birth defect affecting about 1 in 40,000 births.
simple_sent: Prune belly syndrome is a very rare birth defect. About 1 in 40,000 people have it.

ori_sentence: Paroxysmal hypertension is episodic and volatile high blood pressure, which may be due to stress of any sort, or from a pheochromocytoma, a type of tumor involving the adrenal medulla.
simple_sent: Paroxysmal hypertension is high blood pressure that comes and goes. It can be caused by stress of any sort, or it can be caused by a tumor in the adrenal medulla.

ori_sentence: Lymphadenopathy or adenopathy is a disease of the lymph nodes, in which they are abnormal in size or consistency.
simple_sent: Lymphadenopathy or adenopathy is a disease of the lymph nodes. In it, the lymph nodes are not the same size.

ori_sentence: Running amok, sometimes referred to as simply amok or having gone amok, also spelled amuck or amuk, is the act of behaving disruptively or uncontrollably.
simple_sent: Running amok, also spelled amuck, having gone amok, or simply amok, is when a person or group of people behave badly or uncontrollably.

ori_sentence: Night sweats, or also referred to as nocturnal hyperhidrosis
simple_sent: Night sweats can also be called nocturnal hyperhidrosis.

ori_sentence: Aggressive fibromatosis or desmoid tumor is a rare condition.
simple_sent: Aggressive fibromatosis or desmoid tumor is not common.

ori_sentence: Citrullinemia is an autosomal recessive urea cycle disorder that causes ammonia and other toxic substances to accumulate in the blood.
simple_sent: Citrullinemia is a life long disease. People who have the disease have ammonia and other toxic substances in their blood.

ori_sentence: Ampicillin is an antibiotic used to prevent and treat a number of bacterial infections, such as respiratory tract infections, urinary tract infections, meningitis, salmonellosis, and endocarditis.
simple_sent: Apicillin is an antibiotic. It is used to prevent and treat certain bacterial infections. These include infections of the respiratory tract, urinary tract, and central nervous system.

ori_sentence: Bladder exstrophy is a congenital anomaly that exists along the spectrum of the exstrophy-epispadias complex, and most notably involves protrusion of the urinary bladder through a defect in the abdominal wall.
simple_sent: Bladder exstrophy is a condition in which the urinary bladder does not fit properly in the body. This condition is caused by a defect in the abdominal wall, which causes the bladder to not fit properly.

ori_sentence: Respiratory epithelium, or airway epithelium, is a type of ciliated columnar epithelium found lining most of the respiratory tract as respiratory mucosa, where it serves to moisten and protect the airways.
simple_sent: Respiratory epithelium (also called airway epithelium) is a thin layer of cells that line the airways in the human body. The epithelium protects and moistens the airways.

ori_sentence: Sweat glands, also known as sudoriferous or sudoriparous glands, from Latin sudor 'sweat', are small tubular structures of the skin that produce sweat.
simple_sent: Sweat glands (also called sudoriferous or sudoriparous) are small structures in the skin. The name comes from the Latin word sudor.

ori_sentence: Bone metastases, or osseous metastatic disease, is a category of cancer metastases that results from primary tumor invasion to bone.
simple_sent: Bone metastases, also known as osseous metastatic disease, is a cancer of the bone. It usually starts in the bone.

ori_sentence: Pinealoblastoma is a malignant tumor of the pineal gland.
simple_sent: Pinealoblastoma is a malignant brain tumor.

ori_sentence: Gaucher's disease or Gaucher disease (/ɡoʊˈʃeɪ/)
simple_sent: Gaucher's disease is a rare genetic disease.

ori_sentence: The pharyngeal arches, also known as visceral arches, are structures seen in the embryonic development of vertebrates that are recognisable precursors for many structures.
simple_sent: The pharyngeal arches, also known as visceral arches, are structures in the development of the human body. They are seen during embryonic development.

ori_sentence: Leflunomide, sold under the brand name Arava among others, is an immunosuppressive disease-modifying antirheumatic drug (DMARD), used in active moderate-to-severe rheumatoid arthritis and psoriatic arthritis.
simple_sent: Leflunomide is a drug that is used to treat rheumatoid arthritis and psoriatic arthritis. It is sold under the brand name Arava in the United States and in other countries.

ori_sentence: Allergic bronchopulmonary aspergillosis (ABPA) is a condition characterised by an exaggerated response of the immune system (a hypersensitivity response) to the fungus Aspergillus (most commonly Aspergillus fumigatus).
simple_sent: Allergic bronchopulmonary aspergillosis (ABPA) is a condition in which the body's immune system becomes too sensitive to a fungus. The fungus in question is Aspergillus fumigatus.

ori_sentence: Otitis is a general term for inflammation or infection of the ear, in both humans and other animals.
simple_sent: Otitis is an infection of the ear. It usually happens in both humans and animals.

ori_sentence: Myositis is inflammation or swelling of the muscles.
simple_sent: Myositis is a muscle swelling condition.

ori_sentence: Acetohydroxamic acid (also known as AHA or by the trade name Lithostat) is a drug that is a potent and irreversible enzyme inhibitor of the urease enzyme in various bacteria and plants; it is usually used for urinary tract infections.
simple_sent: Acetohydroxamic acid (also known as AHA or by the trade name Lithostat) is a drug that is used to treat urinary tract infections. It works by blocking the enzyme urease in many bacteria and plants.

ori_sentence: Pulmonary edema (PE), also known as pulmonary congestion, is liquid accumulation in the tissue and air spaces of the lungs.
simple_sent: Pulmonary edema (PE) is a fluid build-up in the air spaces of the lungs. It is also called pulmonary congestion.

ori_sentence: Eosinophilic esophagitis (EoE) is an allergic inflammatory condition of the esophagus that involves eosinophils, a type of white blood cell.
simple_sent: Eosinophilic esophagitis (EoE) is an infection of the esophagus. It is caused by eosinophils, a type of white blood cell.

ori_sentence: Café au lait spots, or café au lait macules, are flat, hyperpigmented birthmarks.
simple_sent: Café au lait spots are birthmarks. They are flat, and look like macules.

ori_sentence: Trisomy 22 is a chromosomal disorder in which three copies of chromosome 22 are present rather than two.
simple_sent: Trisomy 22 is a genetic condition. In this case, there are three copies of chromosome 22.

ori_sentence: Dental fluorosis is a common disorder, characterized by hypomineralization of tooth enamel caused by ingestion of excessive fluoride during enamel formation.
simple_sent: Dental fluorosis is a condition where tooth enamel does not develop properly. This happens when people take too much fluoride in at one time.

ori_sentence: Osteomalacia is a disease characterized by the softening of the bones caused by impaired bone metabolism primarily due to inadequate levels of available phosphate, calcium, and vitamin D, or because of resorption of calcium.
simple_sent: Osteomalacia is a disease where the bones become weak because the body does not get enough calcium, phosphate, and vitamin D. This is because the body does not use up the calcium or because the body does not use up the calcium.

ori_sentence: Tioconazole is an antifungal medication of the imidazole class used to treat infections caused by a fungus or yeast.
simple_sent: Tioconazole is an anti-fungal drug. It is used to treat infections that are caused by fungus or yeast.

ori_sentence: Thrombosis (from Ancient Greek θρόμβωσις thrómbōsis "clotting”) is the formation of a blood clot inside a blood vessel, obstructing the flow of blood through the circulatory system.
simple_sent: Thrombosis is when a blood clot forms inside a blood vessel. When this happens, the blood can not move easily through the blood vessels and the blood can not flow properly.

ori_sentence: Halo nevus (also known as "Leukoderma acquisitum centrifugum," "Perinevoid vitiligo," and "Sutton nevus") is a mole that is surrounded by a depigmented ring or 'halo'.
simple_sent: Halo nevus (also called "Leukoderma acquisitum centrifugum" and "Sutton nevus") is a type of skin condition. It looks like a mole with a ring around it.

ori_sentence: Flavoxate is an anticholinergic with antimuscarinic effects.
simple_sent: Flavoxate is a chemical compound. It is an anticholinergic.

ori_sentence: Cerebral venous sinus thrombosis (CVST), cerebral venous and sinus thrombosis or cerebral venous thrombosis (CVT), is the presence of a blood clot in the dural venous sinuses (which drain blood from the brain), the cerebral veins, or both.
simple_sent: Cerebral venous sinus thrombosis (CVST) or cerebral venous thrombosis (CVT) is a disease. It happens when a blood clot forms in one of the brain's two main blood vessels, the dural venous sinuses or the cerebral veins.

ori_sentence: Kyasanur forest disease (KFD) is a tick-borne viral haemorrhagic fever endemic to South-western part of India.
simple_sent: Kyasanur forest disease (KFD) is a disease. It is caused by ticks. It is found in the southwestern part of India.

ori_sentence: Pickardt syndrome denotes a rare form of tertiary hypothyroidism that is caused by interruption of the portal veins connecting hypothalamus and pituitary.
simple_sent: Pickardt syndrome is a rare form of hypothyroidism. It happens when the veins that connect the pituitary and hypothalamus are not working properly.

ori_sentence: Arachnodactyly ("spider fingers") is a condition in which the fingers and toes are abnormally long and slender, in comparison to the palm of the hand and arch of the foot.
simple_sent: Arachnodactyly ("spider fingers") is a condition in which the fingers and toes of a person are very long. This is because spiders have long, thin fingers.

ori_sentence: Parapsoriasis refers to one of a group of skin disorders that are characterized primarily by their resemblance to psoriasis (red, scaly lesions), rather than by their underlying cause.
simple_sent: Parapsoriasis is a condition of the skin. It is similar to psoriasis. The main difference is that parapsoriasis is found on the skin, rather than on the body.

ori_sentence: Cilostazol, sold under the brand name Pletal among others, is a medication used to help the symptoms of intermittent claudication in peripheral vascular disease.
simple_sent: Cilostazol (also known as Pletal) is a medication that is used to help people with peripheral vascular disease. It is sold under the name Pletal.

ori_sentence: Nevus of Ota is a hyperpigmentation that occurs on the face, most often appearing on the white of the eye.
simple_sent: Nevus of Ota is a type of skin condition. It usually appears on the face, usually on the white eye.

ori_sentence: Intraoral dental sinus (also termed a parulis and commonly, a gumboil) is an oral lesion characterized by a soft erythematous papule (red spot) that develops on the alveolar process in association with a non-vital tooth and accompanying dental abscess.
simple_sent: Intraoral dental sinus (also called a parulis and commonly, a gumboil) is an oral lesion that develops on the alveolar process. It is a soft erythematous papule (red spot) that develops on the alveolar process.

ori_sentence: The bony labyrinth (also osseous labyrinth or otic capsule) is the rigid, bony outer wall of the inner ear in the temporal bone.
simple_sent: The bony labyrinth (also osseous labyrinth or otic capsule) is the outer wall of the inner ear. It is made of bony bone.

ori_sentence: Condylomata lata or condyloma latum, is a cutaneous condition characterized by wart-like lesions on the genitals.
simple_sent: Condylomata lata or condyloma latum is a condition. It looks like a wart, but it is not.

ori_sentence: Myalgia (also called muscle pain and muscle ache in layman's terms) is the medical term for muscle pain.
simple_sent: Myalgia (also called muscle pain and muscle ache) is a pain in the body that is not usually felt.

ori_sentence: Apraxia of speech (AOS, also called verbal apraxia) is a speech sound disorder affecting an individual's ability to translate conscious speech plans into motor plans, which results in limited and difficult speech ability.
simple_sent: Apraxia of speech (AOS, also called verbal apraxia) is a speech sound problem. This means that it is hard for the person to understand what they are saying, and it makes it hard for them to talk.

ori_sentence: A bone is a rigid tissue that constitutes part of the skeleton in most vertebrate animals.
simple_sent: A bone is a hard tissue. Most animals' bones are made of this tissue in some form.

ori_sentence: Pulmonary atresia is a congenital malformation of the pulmonary valve in which the valve orifice fails to develop.
simple_sent: Pulmonary atresia is a birth defect. In this case, the pulmonary valve does not develop as it should.

ori_sentence: The Amsler grid, used since 1945, is a grid of horizontal and vertical lines used to monitor a person's central visual field.
simple_sent: The Amsler grid has been used since 1945. It has horizontal lines and vertical lines for the human eye.

ori_sentence: Learning disability, learning disorder, or learning difficulty (British English) is a condition in the brain that causes difficulties comprehending or processing information and can be caused by several different factors.
simple_sent: A learning disability, learning disorder, or learning difficulty (British English) is a condition in the brain where it is hard for the person to understand or process information.

ori_sentence: The occipital lobe is one of the four major lobes of the cerebral cortex in the brain of mammals.
simple_sent: The occipital lobe is a part of the brain. In mammals, it is one of the four major lobes.

ori_sentence: Amusia is a musical disorder that appears mainly as a defect in processing pitch but also encompasses musical memory and recognition.
simple_sent: Amusia is a musical disorder. People with it have problems with hearing pitch, but also with musical memory and recognition.

ori_sentence: Pancreatic juice is a liquid secreted by the pancreas, which contains a number of digestive enzymes, including trypsinogen, chymotrypsinogen, elastase, carboxypeptidase, pancreatic lipase, nucleases and amylase.
simple_sent: Pancreatic juice is a liquid made by the pancreas. It has many digestive enzymes in it, like trypsinogen, chymotrypsinogen, elastase, carboxypeptidase, nucleases, and amylase.

ori_sentence: Van Buchem disease, or hyperostosis corticalis generalisata is an autosomal recessive skeletal disease which is characterised by uninhibited bone growth, especially in the mandible, skull and ribs.
simple_sent: Van Buchem disease, also called hyperostosis corticalis generalisata, is a bone disease. People who have the disease have very fast bone growth, especially in the skull and ribs.

ori_sentence: Aspergillosis is a fungal infection of usually the lungs, caused by the genus Aspergillus, a common mold that is breathed in frequently from the air around, but does not usually affect most people.
simple_sent: Aspergillosis is a fungal infection of the lungs. It is usually caused by the genus Aspergillus, a common mold that is usually found in the air around people.

ori_sentence: In medicine, a muscle biopsy is a procedure in which a piece of muscle tissue is removed from an organism and examined microscopically.
simple_sent: In medicine, a muscle biopsy is when a piece of muscle tissue is taken from the body. It is then looked at microscopically.

ori_sentence: Thrombotic thrombocytopenic purpura (TTP) is a blood disorder that results in blood clots forming in small blood vessels throughout the body.
simple_sent: Thrombotic thrombocytopenic purpura (TTP) is a blood condition. It happens when blood forms clots in small blood vessels.

ori_sentence: Cryotherapy, sometimes known as cold therapy, is the local or general use of low temperatures in medical therapy.
simple_sent: Cryotherapy, sometimes called cold therapy, is a medical treatment that uses low temperatures to help people.

ori_sentence: Extravasation is the leakage of a fluid out of its container into the surrounding area, especially blood or blood cells from vessels.
simple_sent: Extravasation is when something goes out of its container into the area around it. For example, blood or blood cells go out.

ori_sentence: A macular hole is a small break in the macula, located in the center of the eye's light-sensitive tissue called the retina.
simple_sent: A macular hole is a small hole in the eye. It is located in the middle of the macula, in the middle of the eye.

ori_sentence: The lambdoid suture (or lambdoidal suture) is a dense, fibrous connective tissue joint on the posterior aspect of the skull that connects the parietal bones with the occipital bone.
simple_sent: The lambdoid suture (or lambdoidal suture) is a joint on the back of the skull. It connects the parietal bones (bottom bones) with the occipital bone (top bones).

ori_sentence: The lateral pterygoid nerve (or external pterygoid nerve) is a branch of the anterior division of the mandibular nerve.
simple_sent: The lateral pterygoid nerve is part of the mandibular nerve. The lateral pterygoid nerve is located on the left side.

ori_sentence: Acute myeloid leukemia (AML) is a cancer of the myeloid line of blood cells, characterized by the rapid growth of abnormal cells that build up in the bone marrow and blood and interfere with normal blood cell production.
simple_sent: Acute myeloid leukemia (AML) is a cancer of the bone marrow and blood. Acute myeloid leukemia is different from most other types of leukemia because it usually starts in the bone marrow.

ori_sentence: Fairbank's disease or multiple epiphyseal dysplasia (MED) is a rare genetic disorder (dominant form: 1 in 10,000 births) that affects the growing ends of bones.
simple_sent: Fairbank's disease or multiple epiphyseal dysplasia is a rare disease. About 1 in 10,000 people in the world have the disease.
