ori_sentence: Craniofacial prostheses are prostheses made by individuals trained in anaplastology or maxillofacial prosthodontics who medically help rehabilitate those with facial defects caused by disease (mostly progressed forms of skin cancer, and head and neck cancer), trauma or birth defects (microtia, anophthalmia).
simple_sent: Craniofacial prostheses are prostheses made by people who have been trained in anaplastology or maxillofacial prosthodontics. They are used to help people who have problems with their face because of disease, trauma or birth defects, for example skin cancer or head and neck cancer.

ori_sentence: A cyanotic heart defect is any congenital heart defect (CHD) that occurs due to deoxygenated blood bypassing the lungs and entering the systemic circulation, or a mixture of oxygenated and unoxygenated blood entering the systemic circulation.
simple_sent: A cyanotic heart defect is any congenital heart defect (CHD) that happens when the blood does not have enough oxygen. When the blood does not have enough oxygen, the heart does not work properly.

ori_sentence: Stupor is the lack of critical mental function and a level of consciousness, in which an affected person is almost entirely unresponsive and responds only to intense stimuli such as pain.
simple_sent: Stupor is the lack of critical mental function and a level of consciousness. In this state, the person is not able to do anything for themselves, except to feel pain.

ori_sentence: Keratoglobus (from Greek: kerato- horn, cornea; and Latin: globus round) is a degenerative non-inflammatory disorder of the eye in which structural changes within the cornea cause it to become extremely thin and change to a more globular shape than its normal gradual curve.
simple_sent: Keratoglobus (from Greek: kerato- horn, cornea; and Latin: globus round) is a disease that causes the cornea to become very thin. The cornea does not normally change in this way, but Keratoglobus causes the cornea to change in this way.

ori_sentence: Micropenis is an unusually small penis.
simple_sent: Micropenis is a very small penis.

ori_sentence: Tooth ankylosis is the pathological fusion between alveolar bone and the cementum of teeth, which is a rare phenomenon in the deciduous dentition and even more uncommon in permanent teeth.
simple_sent: Tooth ankylosis is when the cementum of the teeth comes together with the alveolar bone. This happens very rarely in teeth that are not permanent, like baby teeth.

ori_sentence: The vulva (plural: vulvas or vulvae; derived from Latin for wrapper or covering) consists of the external female sex organs.
simple_sent: The vulva (plural: vulvas or vulvae) is the body part of a woman that covers her sex organs. It is called a vulva.

ori_sentence: Common variable immunodeficiency (CVID) is an immune disorder characterized by recurrent infections and low antibody levels, specifically in immunoglobulin (Ig) types IgG, IgM and
simple_sent: Common variable immunodeficiency (CVID) is an immune disorder. People with CVID have recurrent infections and their levels of antibodies are very low.

ori_sentence: Hypertriglyceridemia is the presence of high amounts of triglycerides in the blood.
simple_sent: Hypertriglyceridemia is when triglycerides are high in the blood.

ori_sentence: The mesonephros (Greek: middle kidney) is one of three excretory organs that develop in vertebrates.
simple_sent: The mesonephros is the middle kidney in vertebrates. It is one of the three main kidney organs.

ori_sentence: A coloboma (from the Greek κολόβωμα, meaning defect) is a hole in one of the structures of the eye, such as the iris, retina, choroid, or optic disc.
simple_sent: A coloboma is a hole in the eye. The word coloboma comes from the Greek, and means a defect in one of the eye's main structures, the iris.

ori_sentence: Froment's sign is a special test of the wrist for palsy of the ulnar nerve, specifically, the action of adductor pollicis.
simple_sent: Froment's sign is a special test to see if you have palsy of the ulnar nerve. The test is done on your wrist.

ori_sentence: Placenta praevia is when the placenta attaches inside the uterus but in an abnormal position near or over the cervical opening.
simple_sent: Placenta praevia is when the placenta is not attached to the uterus but is attached to the outside of the uterus.

ori_sentence: Primitive reflexes are reflex actions originating in the central nervous system that are exhibited by normal infants, but not neurologically intact adults, in response to particular stimuli.
simple_sent: Primitive reflexes are actions that the central nervous system makes in response to certain stimuli. They are seen by normal infants, but not by normal adults.

ori_sentence: Pemphigus foliaceus is an autoimmune blistering disease (bullous disorder) of the skin.
simple_sent: Pemphigus foliaceus is a skin disease. It is an autoimmune disease.

ori_sentence: Cryptococcosis is a potentially fatal fungal infection of mainly the lungs, presenting as a pneumonia, and brain, where it appears as a meningitis.
simple_sent: Cryptococcosis is a fungal infection of the lungs. It can be very dangerous, and can cause death if not treated early enough.

ori_sentence: Atopic dermatitis (AD), also known as atopic eczema, is a long-term type of inflammation of the skin (dermatitis).
simple_sent: Atopic dermatitis (also called atopic eczema) is a condition where the skin is too sensitive to the touch.

ori_sentence: Nevirapine (NVP), sold under the brand name Viramune among others, is a medication used to treat and prevent HIV/AIDS, specifically HIV-1.
simple_sent: Nevirapine (also known as Viramune and Nevirapine) is a medication. It is used to treat or prevent HIV/AIDS.

ori_sentence: Holoprosencephaly (HPE) is a cephalic disorder in which the prosencephalon (the forebrain of the embryo) fails to develop into two hemispheres.
simple_sent: Holoprosencephaly (HPE) is a disorder. In it, the forebrain (the part of the embryo that is before the brain) does not develop.

ori_sentence: Nephrotoxicity is toxicity in the kidneys.
simple_sent: Nephrotoxicity is a kidney disease.

ori_sentence: Bloom syndrome (often abbreviated as BS in literature) is a rare autosomal recessive genetic disorder characterized by short stature, predisposition to the development of cancer, and genomic instability.
simple_sent: Bloom syndrome (often abbreviated as BS in literature) is a rare genetic disorder. People with Bloom syndrome have short stature, and they are more likely to develop cancer.

ori_sentence: Decompressive craniectomy (crani- + -ectomy) is a neurosurgical procedure in which part of the skull is removed to allow a swelling brain room to expand without being squeezed.
simple_sent: Decompressive craniectomy (crani- + -ectomy) is a surgery to remove part of the skull. This is done to let the brain room to expand without being squeezed.

ori_sentence: Anesthesia dolorosa or anaesthesia dolorosa or deafferentation pain is pain felt in an area (usually of the face) which is completely numb to touch.
simple_sent: Anesthesia dolorosa, also known as deafferentation pain, is pain that does not feel at all. It is usually felt on the face.

ori_sentence: Ciprofloxacin is a fluoroquinolone (flor-o-KWIN-o-lone) antibiotic used to treat a number of bacterial infections.
simple_sent: Ciprofloxacin (also known as fluoroquinolone) is an antibiotic. It is used to treat bacterial infections.

ori_sentence: The clitoris (/ˈklɪtərɪs/ or /klɪˈtɔːrɪs/) is a female sex organ present in mammals, ostriches and a limited number of .
simple_sent: The clitoris is a female sex organ in mammals. Only a small number of animals, like ostriches, have a clitoris.

ori_sentence: Cilazapril is an angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitor (ACE inhibitor) used for the treatment of hypertension and congestive heart failure.
simple_sent: Cilazapril is a drug that stops an enzyme called angiotensin-converting enzyme (ACE inhibitor) from working.

ori_sentence: The ear canal (external acoustic meatus, external auditory meatus, EAM) is a pathway running from the outer ear to the middle ear.
simple_sent: The ear canal is a part of the human body. It goes from the outside of the ear to the inside of the middle ear.

ori_sentence: A chemical burn occurs when living tissue is exposed to a corrosive substance (such as a strong acid, base or oxidizer) or a cytotoxic agent (such as mustard gas, lewisite or arsine).
simple_sent: A chemical burn occurs when living tissue is exposed to a strong acid, base or oxidizer. For example, a strong acid like sulfuric acid can cause a chemical burn.

ori_sentence: Apomorphine, sold under the brand name Apokyn among others, is a type of aporphine having activity as a non-selective dopamine agonist which activates both D2-like and, to a much lesser extent, D1-like receptors.
simple_sent: Apomorphine, sold under the brand name Apokyn among others, is a type of aporphine that acts as a non-selective dopamine agonist. This means that it works on both D2 and D1 receptors.

ori_sentence: Procyclidine is an anticholinergic drug principally used for the treatment of drug-induced parkinsonism, akathisia and acute dystonia; Parkinson disease; and idiopathic or secondary dystonia.
simple_sent: Procyclidine is a drug that is used to treat Parkinson's disease, akathisia and acute dystonia. It is also used to treat people with secondary dystonia or idiopathic dystonia.

ori_sentence: Eosinophilic pustular folliculitis of infancy is a cutaneous condition characterized by recurrent pruritic crops of follicular vesiculopustular lesions.
simple_sent: Eosinophilic pustular folliculitis of infancy is a cutaneous condition. There are many different types of follicular pustular lesions.

ori_sentence: Candidiasis is a fungal infection due to any type of Candida (a type of yeast).
simple_sent: Candidiasis is a fungal infection. Candida is a kind of yeast or fungus.

ori_sentence: The tensor tympani is a muscle within the middle ear, located in the bony canal above the bony part of the auditory tube, and connects to the malleus bone.
simple_sent: The tensor tympani is a muscle in the middle ear. It is found in the bony part of the auditory tube, and connects to the malleus bone in the middle ear.

ori_sentence: Foix-Chavany-Marie Syndrome (FCMS), also known as Bilateral Opercular Syndrome, is a neuropathological disorder characterized by paralysis of the facial, tongue, pharynx, and masticatory muscles of the mouth that aid in chewing.
simple_sent: Foix-Chavany-Marie Syndrome (FCMS), also known as Bilateral Opercular Syndrome, is a disorder that makes the muscles of the mouth and pharynx not work properly. This makes it hard for the person to eat.

ori_sentence: Neutropenia is an abnormally low concentration of neutrophils (a type of white blood cell) in the blood.
simple_sent: Neutropenia is when there are too few neutrophils in the blood. neutrophils are a type of white blood cell.

ori_sentence: Prazepam is a benzodiazepine derivative drug developed by Warner-Lambert in the 1960s.
simple_sent: Prazepam is a drug that was developed in the 1960s. It is a benzodiazepine.

ori_sentence: Anaplastic large cell lymphoma (ALCL) refers to a group of non-Hodgkin lymphomas in which aberrant T cells proliferate uncontrollably.
simple_sent: Anaplastic large cell lymphoma (ALCL) is a cancer. It is the most common type of non-Hodgkin's lymphoma.

ori_sentence: Chilblains, also known as pernio, is a medical condition in which damage occurs to capillary beds in the skin, most often in the hands or feet, when blood perfuses into the nearby tissue resulting in redness, itching, inflammation, and possibly blisters.
simple_sent: Chilblains, also known as pernio, is a medical condition in which damage occurs to blood vessels in the skin. This usually happens in the hands or feet, and can cause redness, itching, inflammation, and possibly blisters.

ori_sentence: Pyoderma means any skin disease that is pyogenic (has pus).
simple_sent: Pyoderma is a disease of the skin. It has pus in it.

ori_sentence: Spondyloepimetaphyseal dysplasia, Strudwick type is an inherited disorder of bone growth that results in dwarfism, characteristic skeletal abnormalities, and problems with vision.
simple_sent: Spondyloepimetaphyseal dysplasia, Strudwick type is an inherited disorder of bone growth. This results in a person having short stature and problems with vision.

ori_sentence: Folie à deux ('folly of two', or 'madness [shared] by two'), also known as shared psychosis or shared delusional disorder (SDD), is a psychiatric syndrome in which symptoms of a delusional belief, and sometimes hallucinations, are transmitted from one individual to another.
simple_sent: Folie à deux ('folly of two', or 'madness [shared] by two'), also known as shared psychosis or shared delusional disorder (SDD), is a condition in which one person (or a group of people) shows symptoms of a mental illness but another person does not.

ori_sentence: Hypersexuality is extremely frequent or suddenly increased libido.
simple_sent: Hypersexuality is very common. It can also happen suddenly.

ori_sentence: In anatomy, the meninges (/məˈnɪndʒiːz/, singular: meninx (/ˈmiːnɪŋks/ or /ˈmɛnɪŋks/), from Ancient Greek: μῆνιγξ, romanized: mēninx, lit. 'membrane', adjectival: meningeal /məˈnɪndʒəl/) are the three membranes that envelop the brain and spinal cord.
simple_sent: In anatomy, the meninges are the three membranes that surround the brain and spinal cord. The meninges are also called the meningeal membranes or meningeal membranes.

ori_sentence: Anal fistula is a chronic abnormal communication between the epithelialised surface of the anal canal and usually the perianal skin.
simple_sent: Anal fistula is an abnormal communication between the skin around the anal canal and the outside of the body.

ori_sentence: An anal fissure is a break or tear in the skin of the anal canal.
simple_sent: An anal fissure is a break or tear in the wall of the anus.

ori_sentence: Tangier disease or hypoalphalipoproteinemia is an extremely rare inherited disorder characterized by a severe reduction in the amount of high density lipoprotein (HDL), often referred to as "good cholesterol", in the bloodstream.
simple_sent: Tangier disease or hypoalphalipoproteinemia is a very rare disease. People who have the disease will have a very big reduction in the amount of high density lipoprotein (HDL) in their blood.

ori_sentence: Anaplastic astrocytoma is a rare WHO grade III type of astrocytoma, which is a type of cancer of the brain.
simple_sent: Anaplastic astrocytoma is a type of brain cancer. It is the third most common type of brain cancer.

ori_sentence: Cardiotoxicity is the occurrence of heart electrophysiology dysfunction or muscle damage.
simple_sent: Cardiotoxicity is when the heart does not work properly, or there is muscle damage.

ori_sentence: Glutaric acidemia type 1 is an inherited disorder in which the body is unable to completely break down the amino acids lysine, hydroxylysine and tryptophan.
simple_sent: Glutaric acidemia type 1 is an inherited disease. It happens when the body can not break down certain amino acids, especially Lysine and Tryptophan.

ori_sentence: Fasciolopsiasis results from an infection by the trematode Fasciolopsis buski, the largest intestinal fluke of humans (up to 7.5 cm in length).
simple_sent: Fasciolopsiasis is a disease. It is caused by an infection of the largest fluke in the human body, the Fasciolopsis buski.

ori_sentence: Green tea is a type of tea that is made from Camellia sinensis leaves and buds that have not undergone the same withering and oxidation process used to make oolong teas and black teas.
simple_sent: Green tea is a type of tea. It is made from leaves and buds that have not gone through the same process that black tea and oolong tea go through.

ori_sentence: Synostosis (plural: synostoses) is fusion of two or more bones.
simple_sent: Synostosis is when two or more bones are joined together.

ori_sentence: Collagen disease is a term previously used to describe systemic autoimmune diseases (e.g., rheumatoid arthritis, systemic lupus erythematosus, and systemic sclerosis), but now is thought to be more appropriate for diseases associated with defects in collagen, which is a component of the connective tissue.
simple_sent: Collagen disease is a term that used to be used for autoimmune diseases (e.g. rheumatoid arthritis, lupus erythematosus, and systemic sclerosis), but now is used for diseases where the collagen in the tissue is not strong enough to fight off the disease.

ori_sentence: Cellulitis is a bacterial infection involving the inner layers of the skin.
simple_sent: Cellulitis is an infection of the skin. It is a bacterial infection.

ori_sentence: Amaurosis fugax (Greek amaurosis meaning darkening, dark, or obscure, Latin fugax meaning fleeting) is a painless temporary loss of vision in one or both eyes.
simple_sent: Amaurosis fugax is a temporary loss of vision in one or both eyes. The name comes from the Greek amaurosis, meaning dark or obscure, and fugax, meaning fleeting.

ori_sentence: A menstrual disorder is characterized as any abnormal condition with regards to a person's menstrual cycle.
simple_sent: A menstrual disorder is any condition that affects a person's menstrual cycle in a different way.

ori_sentence: Tafluprost (trade names Taflotan by Santen Pharmaceutical and Zioptan by Merck in the US) is a prostaglandin analogue.
simple_sent: Tafluprost (also known as Taflotan and Zioptan) is a drug. It is an analogue of prostaglandin.

ori_sentence: Lateral medullary syndrome is a neurological disorder causing a range of symptoms due to ischemia in the lateral part of the medulla oblongata in the brainstem.
simple_sent: Lateral medullary syndrome is a neurological disorder. It happens when the lateral part of the brain, called the medulla oblongata, is damaged.

ori_sentence: An analeptic, in medicine, is a central nervous system stimulant.
simple_sent: An analeptic is a drug that helps the central nervous system.

ori_sentence: Anaplasia (from Ancient Greek: ἀνά ana, "backward" + πλάσις plasis, "formation") is a condition of cells with poor cellular differentiation, losing the morphological characteristics of mature cells and their orientation with respect to each other and to endothelial cells.
simple_sent: Anaplasia (from Ancient Greek: ἀνά ana, "backward" + πλάσις plasis, "formation") is a condition in which cells do not develop into mature cells. The cells also do not be able to tell the difference between different types of cells.

ori_sentence: Coccidioidomycosis (/kɒkˌsɪdiɔɪdoʊmaɪˈkoʊsɪs/, kok-sid-ee-oy-doh-my-KOH-sis), commonly known as cocci, Valley Fever, as well as California Fever, desert rheumatism, or San Joaquin Valley Fever, is a mammalian fungal disease caused by Coccidioides immitis or Coccidioides posadasii.
simple_sent: Coccidioidomycosis (also known as cocci, Valley Fever, California Fever, or San Joaquin Valley Fever) is a disease. It is caused by a fungus called Coccidioides immitis or Coccidioides posadasii.

ori_sentence: In neuroanatomy, habenula (diminutive of Latin habena meaning rein) originally denoted the stalk of the pineal gland (pineal habenula; pedunculus of pineal body), but gradually came to refer to a neighboring group of nerve cells with which the pineal gland was believed to be associated, the habenular nucleus.
simple_sent: In neuroanatomy, habenula (diminutive of Latin habena meaning rein) originally meant the stalk of the pineal gland (pineal habenula; pedunculus of pineal body), but now means a neighboring group of nerve cells, the habenular nucleus, which is found in the middle of the pineal gland.

ori_sentence: Transvestism is the practice of dressing in a manner traditionally associated with the opposite sex.
simple_sent: Transvestism is when a person dresses in a way that shows that they are the opposite sex.

ori_sentence: Aminocaproic acid (also known as ε-aminocaproic acid, ε-Ahx, or 6-aminohexanoic acid) is a derivative and analogue of the amino acid lysine, which makes it an effective inhibitor for enzymes that bind that particular residue.
simple_sent: Aminocaproic acid, also known as 6-aminohexanoic acid, 6-aminocaproic acid, or 6-aminocaproic acid, is a chemical compound. It is an amino acid that is found in many living things.

ori_sentence: Restrictive cardiomyopathy (RCM) is a form of cardiomyopathy in which the walls of the heart are rigid (but not thickened).
simple_sent: Restrictive cardiomyopathy (RCM) is a type of heart disease. In this case, the heart wall is not very thick.

ori_sentence: Atransferrinemia is an autosomal recessive metabolic disorder in which there is an absence of transferrin, a plasma protein that transports iron through the blood.
simple_sent: Atransferrinemia is an autosomal recessive disorder. It happens when a person's blood does not have enough transferrin, a protein that carries iron.

ori_sentence: Blackwater fever is a complication of malaria infection in which red blood cells burst in the bloodstream (hemolysis), releasing hemoglobin directly into the blood vessels and into the urine, frequently leading to kidney failure.
simple_sent: Blackwater fever is a disease where red blood cells burst in the blood (hemolysis). This makes hemoglobin go directly into the blood vessels. This makes the blood have too much hemoglobin.

ori_sentence: An imperforate anus or anorectal malformations (ARMs) are birth defects in which the rectum is malformed.
simple_sent: An imperforate anus or anorectal malformations (ARMs) is when the anus is not properly shaped.

ori_sentence: A nail clipper (also called nail clippers, a nail trimmer, a nail cutter or nipper type) is a hand tool used to trim fingernails, toenails and hangnails.
simple_sent: A nail clipper (also called a nail trimmer or a nail cutter) is a tool that people use to cut their fingernails and toenails.

ori_sentence: Intestinal metaplasia is the transformation (metaplasia) of epithelium (usually of the stomach or the esophagus) into a type of epithelium resembling that found in the intestine.
simple_sent: Intestinal metaplasia is when a part of the epithelium (usually the stomach or the esophagus) is changed so that it looks like the epithelium in the intestine.

ori_sentence: Waldenström hyperglobulinemic purpura is a skin condition that presents with episodic showers of petechiae (small red or purple spots) occurring on all parts of the body, most profusely on the lower extremities.
simple_sent: Waldenström hyperglobulinemic purpura is a skin condition that does not go away after a while. People who have it get small red or purple spots that appear on all parts of the body.

ori_sentence: Mantle cell lymphoma (MCL) is a type of non-Hodgkin's lymphoma (NHL), comprising about 6% of NHL cases.
simple_sent: Mantle cell lymphoma is a non-Hodgkin's lymphoma. About 6% of people who get it get it in the NHL.

ori_sentence: Mazindol (brand names Mazanor, Sanorex) is a stimulant drug which is used as an appetite suppressant.
simple_sent: Mazindol (brand names Sanorex and Mazanor) is a drug. It is an appetite suppressant and stimulant.

ori_sentence: Perampanel, sold under the brand name Fycompa, is an anti-epileptic medication developed by Eisai Co. that is used in addition to other drugs to treat partial seizures and generalized tonic-clonic seizures for people older than twelve years.
simple_sent: Perampanel (also known as Fycompa) is an anti-epileptic drug that is used to treat seizures. It is used to treat people who have partial seizures and who have generalized tonic-clonic seizures.

ori_sentence: α-Linolenic acid (ALA), (from Greek linon, meaning flax), is an n−3, or omega-3, essential fatty acid.
simple_sent: Linolenic acid is an essential fatty acid. Its name comes from the Greek word linon, meaning flax.

ori_sentence: Rhinosinusitis is a simultaneous infection of the nasal mucosa (rhinitis) and an infection of the mucosa of the paranasal sinuses (sinusitis).
simple_sent: Rhinosinusitis is an infection of the nasal mucosa. The two parts of the nasal mucosa are called the paranasal sinuses and the nasal mucosa.

ori_sentence: A prostatic stent is a stent used to keep open the male urethra and allow the passing of urine in cases of prostatic obstruction and lower urinary tract symptoms (LUTS).
simple_sent: A prostatic stent is a stent that is placed in the male urethra to keep it open. When the male urethra is closed, urine can not come out of it.

ori_sentence: The fractional excretion of sodium (FENa) is the percentage of the sodium filtered by the kidney which is excreted in the urine.
simple_sent: The fractional excretion of sodium (FENa) is the percentage of sodium in the urine that is not taken in by the kidney.

ori_sentence: The ethmoid sinuses or ethmoid air cells of the ethmoid bone are one of the four paired paranasal sinuses.
simple_sent: The ethmoid sinuses are the two largest sinuses in the human body. They are located in the paranasal sinuses.

ori_sentence: Muscle weakness is a lack of muscle strength.
simple_sent: Muscle weakness is when the muscles are weak.

ori_sentence: Capsaicin (8-methyl-N-vanillyl-6-nonenamide) is an active component of chili peppers, which are plants belonging to the genus Capsicum.
simple_sent: Capsaicin (8-methyl-N-vanillyl-6-nonenamide) is a chemical that is in chili peppers. It is the main ingredient in chili peppers.

ori_sentence: Porphyria is a group of liver disorders in which substances called porphyrins build up in the body, negatively affecting the skin or nervous system.
simple_sent: Porphyria is a disease of the liver. In this disease, substances called porphyrins build up in the body and cause problems with the skin.

ori_sentence: In human anatomy, the subclavian arteries are paired major arteries of the upper thorax, below the clavicle.
simple_sent: The subclavian arteries are two major arteries in the human body. They are located below the clavicle.

ori_sentence: A blood test is a laboratory analysis performed on a blood sample that is usually extracted from a vein in the arm using a hypodermic needle, or via fingerprick.
simple_sent: A blood test is a test to see if someone has a disease. A blood sample is taken from a vein in the arm, either with a needle, or with a fingerprick.

ori_sentence: The conjunctiva is a tissue that lines the inside of the eyelids and covers the sclera (the white of the eye).
simple_sent: The conjunctiva is the part of the eye that covers the white part of the eye. It is on the inside of the eyelids.

ori_sentence: A repetitive strain injury (RSI) is an injury to part of the musculoskeletal or nervous system caused by repetitive use, vibrations, compression or long periods in a fixed position.
simple_sent: A repetitive strain injury (RSI) is an injury to the part of the body that controls movement. It can be caused by repetitive use or long periods in a fixed position.

ori_sentence: Chloramphenicol is an antibiotic useful for the treatment of a number of bacterial infections.
simple_sent: Chloramphenicol is an antibiotic. It is used to treat certain types of infections.

ori_sentence: A nucleic acid sequence is a succession of bases signified by a series of a set of five different letters that indicate the order of nucleotides forming alleles within a DNA (using GACT) or RNA (GACU) molecule.
simple_sent: A nucleic acid sequence is the sequence of bases in a DNA molecule. The sequence is made up of a series of five letters and tells us the order of nucleotides in the DNA molecule.

ori_sentence: Bone marrow suppression also known as myelotoxicity or myelosuppression, is the decrease in production of cells responsible for providing immunity (leukocytes), carrying oxygen (erythrocytes), and/or those responsible for normal blood clotting (thrombocytes).
simple_sent: Bone marrow suppression (also called myelosuppression or myelotoxicity) is when the cells in the bone marrow do not produce as many white blood cells (called leukocytes) or red blood cells (called thrombocytes).

ori_sentence: Bleeding time is a medical test done on someone to assess their platelets function.
simple_sent: Bleeding time is a medical test to see if platelets are working properly.

ori_sentence: Mucopolysaccharidoses are a group of metabolic disorders caused by the absence or malfunctioning of lysosomal enzymes needed to break down molecules called glycosaminoglycans (GAGs).
simple_sent: Mucopolysaccharidoses are a group of metabolic disorders. They are caused by not having the enzymes needed to break down certain molecules, called glycosaminoglycans.

ori_sentence: A blood culture is a medical laboratory test used to detect bacteria or fungi in a person's blood.
simple_sent: A blood culture is a test to see if bacteria or fungi are in a person's blood.

ori_sentence: Diabetic ketoacidosis (DKA) is a potentially life-threatening complication of diabetes mellitus.
simple_sent: Diabetic ketoacidosis (DKA) can be very dangerous for people with diabetes.

ori_sentence: Incisors (from Latin incidere, "to cut") are the front teeth present in most mammals.
simple_sent: The word incisor comes from the Latin incidere. It means "to cut".

ori_sentence: Hypotension is low blood pressure.
simple_sent: Hypotension is high blood pressure.

ori_sentence: Variegate porphyria, also known by , is an autosomal dominant porphyria that can have acute (severe but usually not long-lasting) symptoms along with symptoms that affect the skin.
simple_sent: Variegate porphyria, also known as Variegate porphyria, is an autosomal dominant porphyria. It can have severe symptoms, but usually they do not last long.

ori_sentence: A shoulder presentation refers to a malpresentation at childbirth where the baby is in a transverse lie (its vertebral column is perpendicular to that of the mother), thus the leading part (the part that first enters the birth canal) is an arm, a shoulder, or the trunk.
simple_sent: A shoulder presentation is when the baby is in a transverse lie (the back of the body is against the body of the mother). When the baby is in a transverse lie, the leading part (the part that first enters the birth canal) is the shoulder.

ori_sentence: Pemphigoid is a group of rare autoimmune blistering diseases of the skin, and mucous membranes.
simple_sent: Pemphigoid is a group of rare diseases. They cause blistering of the skin and mucous membranes.

ori_sentence: Velamentous cord insertion is a complication of pregnancy where the umbilical cord is inserted in the fetal membranes.
simple_sent: Velamentous cord insertion is when the umbilical cord is put into the fetal membranes too early in a pregnancy.

ori_sentence: A periorbital hematoma, commonly called a black eye or "a shiner" (associated with boxing or stick sports such as hockey), is bruising around the eye commonly due to an injury to the face rather than to the eye.
simple_sent: A periorbital hematoma, commonly called a black eye or "a shiner" is bruising around the eye. The most common cause of periorbital hematoma is an injury to the face, like a blow to the eye.

ori_sentence: Pseudopseudohypoparathyroidism (PPHP) is an inherited disorder, named for its similarity to pseudohypoparathyroidism in presentation.
simple_sent: Pseudopseudohypoparathyroidism (PPHP) is an inherited disorder. It is named because it looks like pseudohypoparathyroidism.

ori_sentence: Spinal stenosis is an abnormal narrowing of the spinal canal or neural foramen that results in pressure on the spinal cord or nerve roots.
simple_sent: Spinal stenosis is when the spinal canal or neural foramen gets too narrow. This causes pressure on the nerve roots or spinal cord.

ori_sentence: Blue rubber bleb nevus syndrome is a rare disorder that consists mainly of abnormal blood vessels affecting the skin or internal organs – usually the gastrointestinal tract.
simple_sent: Blue rubber bleb nevus syndrome is a rare disorder. People who have the disease have abnormal blood vessels in their skin, or in their gastrointestinal tract.

ori_sentence: Pemphigus (/ˈpɛmfɪɡəs/ or /pɛmˈfaɪɡəs/) is a rare group of blistering autoimmune diseases that affect the skin and mucous membranes.
simple_sent: Pemphigus (pronounced \/O/ pÉ mphÊ gus \/O/ or \/O/ pÉ mÉ gus \/O/) is a rare autoimmune disease. It affects the skin and mucous membranes.

ori_sentence: Cold is the presence of low temperature, especially in the atmosphere.
simple_sent: Cold is when the temperature is very low, especially in air.

ori_sentence: Pure autonomic failure (PAF) is a form of dysautonomia that first occurs in middle age or later in life; diagnosed more often in men than in women.
simple_sent: Pure autonomic failure (PAF) happens more often in men than in women. It usually happens in middle age or later in life.

ori_sentence: Placentitis is an inflammation of the placenta.
simple_sent: Placentitis is a disease of the placenta.

ori_sentence: Osteopoikilosis is a benign, autosomal dominant sclerosing dysplasia of bone characterized by the presence of numerous bone islands in the skeleton.
simple_sent: Osteopoikilosis is a disease of bone. It is caused by a gene in the human body that causes many bone islands to form in the skeleton.

ori_sentence: Paroxysmal nocturnal hemoglobinuria (PNH) is a rare, acquired, life-threatening disease of the blood characterized by destruction of red blood cells by the complement system, a part of the body's innate immune system.
simple_sent: Paroxysmal nocturnal hemoglobinuria (PNH) is a life-threatening disease of the blood. It happens when the body's complement system, a part of the body's immune system, breaks down red blood cells.

ori_sentence: Porphyria cutanea tarda is the most common subtype of porphyria.
simple_sent: Porphyria cutanea tarda is the most common type of tree.

ori_sentence: Hypoxemia is an abnormally low level of oxygen in the blood.
simple_sent: Hypoxemia is when the blood has a low level of oxygen.

ori_sentence: Pneumaturia is the passage of gas or "air" in urine.
simple_sent: Pneumaturia is when there is air in the urine.

ori_sentence: Periostitis, also known as periostalgia, is a medical condition caused by inflammation of the periosteum, a layer of connective tissue that surrounds bone.
simple_sent: Periostitis, also known as periostalgia, is an inflammation of the periosteum. The periosteum is a layer of tissue that surrounds the bone.

ori_sentence: Situs inversus (also called situs transversus or oppositus) is a congenital condition in which the major visceral organs are reversed or mirrored from their normal positions.
simple_sent: Situs inversus (also called situs transversus or oppositus) is a condition in which the major organs of the body are moved from their normal positions.

ori_sentence: Schizencephaly (from Greek skhizein 'to split', and enkephalos 'brain') is a rare birth defect characterized by abnormal clefts lined with grey matter that form the ependyma of the cerebral ventricles to the pia mater.
simple_sent: Schizencephaly (from Greek skhizein 'to split', and enkephalos 'brain') is a birth defect in which the brain does not form the normal shape it should. There are abnormal clefts in the brain.

ori_sentence: Short QT syndrome (SQT) is a very rare genetic disease of the electrical system of the heart, and is associated with an increased risk of abnormal heart rhythms and sudden cardiac death.
simple_sent: Short QT syndrome (SQT) is a very rare disease. People who have it are more likely to have abnormal heart rhythms, which can lead to sudden cardiac death.

ori_sentence: A blastoma is a type of cancer, more common in children, that is caused by malignancies in precursor cells, often called blasts.
simple_sent: A blastoma is a type of cancer. It is more common in children, but it can also occur in adults.

ori_sentence: Keratinocytes are the primary type of cell found in the epidermis, the outermost layer of the skin.
simple_sent: Keratinocytes are the cells that make up the skin. They are the main cells of the epidermis.

ori_sentence: Spinocerebellar ataxia (SCA) is a progressive, degenerative, genetic disease with multiple types, each of which could be considered a neurological condition in its own right.
simple_sent: Spinocerebellar ataxia (SCA) is a genetic disease. There are many different types of SCA, and each one can be considered a neurological condition in its own right.

ori_sentence: Nasal vestibulitis is the diffuse dermatitis of nasal vestibule.
simple_sent: Nasal vestibulitis is an inflammation of the nasal cavity.

ori_sentence: The vestibular nerve is one of the two branches of the vestibulocochlear nerve (the cochlear nerve being the other).
simple_sent: The vestibular nerve is a nerve. It is the second most important nerve in the ear after the cochlear nerve.

ori_sentence: Madelung's deformity is usually characterized by malformed wrists and wrist bones and is often associated with Léri-Weill dyschondrosteosis.
simple_sent: People with Madelung's have malformed wrists and wrist bones. This condition is also called Léri-Weill dyschondrosteosis.

ori_sentence: Legius syndrome (LS) is an autosomal dominant condition characterized by cafe au lait spots.
simple_sent: Legius syndrome (LS) is a rare condition. People who have it have cafe au lait spots.

ori_sentence: Conjugate gaze palsies are neurological disorders affecting the ability to move both eyes in the same direction.
simple_sent: Conjugate gaze palsies happen when a person can not move both eyes in the same direction at the same time.

ori_sentence: Angular cheilitis (AC) is inflammation of one or both corners of the mouth.
simple_sent: Angular cheilitis is an infection of the mouth. It is called AC.

ori_sentence: Blepharospasm is any abnormal contraction of the orbicularis oculi muscle.
simple_sent: Blepharospasm is a muscle group in the back of the neck.

ori_sentence: The cavernous sinus within the human head is one of the dural venous sinuses creating a cavity called the lateral sellar compartment bordered by the temporal bone of the skull and the sphenoid bone, lateral to the sella turcica.
simple_sent: The cavernous sinus within the human head is one of the dural venous sinuses. The place where the cavernous sinus is is called the lateral sellar compartment. It is between the temporal bone and the sphenoid bone.

ori_sentence: Bradypnea is abnormally slow breathing.
simple_sent: Bradypnea is a very slow breathing.

ori_sentence: Sensory overload occurs when one or more of the body's senses experiences over-stimulation from the environment.
simple_sent: Sensory overload is when one or more of the body's senses are over-stimulated. This is usually a bad thing.

ori_sentence: Argininemia, is an autosomal recessive urea cycle disorder where a deficiency of the enzyme arginase causes a buildup of arginine and ammonia in the blood.
simple_sent: Argininemia is a disease. It is caused by an enzyme called arginase not working properly. This makes arginine and ammonia in the blood.

ori_sentence: Pulmonary toxicity is the medical name for side effects on the lungs.
simple_sent: Pulmonary toxicity is when the lungs are affected by something.

ori_sentence: Boutonneuse fever (also called, Mediterranean spotted fever, fièvre boutonneuse, Kenya tick typhus, Indian tick typhus, Marseilles fever, or Astrakhan fever) is a fever as a result of a rickettsial infection caused by the bacterium Rickettsia conorii and transmitted by the dog tick Rhipicephalus sanguineus.
simple_sent: Boutonneuse fever (also called Mediterranean spotted fever, fièvre boutonneuse, Kenya tick typhus, Indian tick typhus, Marseilles fever, or Astrakhan fever) is a disease. The disease is caused by a bacterium called Rickettsia conorii, which is spread by ticks from dogs.

ori_sentence: Bonnet–Dechaume–Blanc syndrome, also known as Wyburn-Mason syndrome, is a rare congenital disorder characterized by arteriovenous malformations of the brain, retina or facial nevi.
simple_sent: Bonnet-Dechaume-Blanc syndrome (also known as Wyburn-Mason syndrome) is a rare disorder. People who have it will have abnormally shaped brain, retina, or face.

ori_sentence: Pityriasis commonly refers to flaking (or scaling) of the skin.
simple_sent: Pityriasis is a skin condition. It causes scaling of the skin.

ori_sentence: Venlafaxine, sold under the brand name Effexor among others, is an antidepressant medication of the serotonin-norepinephrine reuptake inhibitor (SNRI) class.
simple_sent: Venlafaxine (also known as Effexor) is an antidepressant drug. It works by blocking the release of serotonin and norepinephrine.

ori_sentence: Bowenoid papulosis is a cutaneous condition characterized by the presence of pigmented verrucous papules on the body of the penis.
simple_sent: Bowenoid papulosis is a cutaneous condition. People who have the condition will have dark papules on their penis.

ori_sentence: Immunohistochemistry (IHC) is the most common application of immunostaining.
simple_sent: Immunohistochemistry is the most common type of immunostaining.

ori_sentence: Hereditary angioedema (HAE) is a disorder that results in recurrent attacks of severe swelling.
simple_sent: Hereditary angioedema Hereditary angioedema can cause severe swelling in the face.

ori_sentence: Pneumocephalus is the presence of air or gas within the cranial cavity.
simple_sent: Pneumocephalus is when there is air or gas in the brain.

ori_sentence: Cefdinir, sold under the brand name Omnicef among others, is an antibiotic used to treat pneumonia, otitis media, strep throat, and cellulitis.
simple_sent: Cefdinir (also known as Omnicef) is an antibiotic. It is used to treat several diseases, including strep throat and pneumonia.

ori_sentence: Bosutinib (rINN/USAN; codenamed SKI-606, marketed under the trade name Bosulif) is a small molecule BCR-ABL and src tyrosine kinase inhibitor used for the treatment of chronic myelogenous leukemia.
simple_sent: Bosutinib (also known as SKI-606, marketed under the trade name Bosulif) is a small molecule drug. It is used to treat people with chronic myelogenous leukemia.

ori_sentence: One of the most common locations for a foreign body is the alimentary tract.
simple_sent: The alimentary tract is the most common location for foreign bodies.

ori_sentence: Local anesthesia is any technique to induce the absence of sensation in a specific part of the body, generally for the aim of inducing local analgesia, that is, local insensitivity to pain, although other local senses may be affected as well.
simple_sent: Local anesthesia is any method to cause the absence of feeling in a specific part of the body. The goal is to cause local analgesia, which means that the body does not feel any pain, even if it is very close to the area in question.

ori_sentence: The celiac ganglia or coeliac ganglia are two large irregularly shaped masses of nerve tissue in the upper abdomen.
simple_sent: The celiac ganglia are two large areas of nerve tissue in the upper abdomen. They are called coeliac ganglia.

ori_sentence: Legg–Calvé–Perthes disease (LCPD), is a childhood hip disorder initiated by a disruption of blood flow to the head of the femur.
simple_sent: Legg-Calvé-Perthes disease (LCPD) is a disease of the hip. It starts when the blood flow to the head of the femur is cut off.

ori_sentence: A medical certificate or doctor's certificate is a written statement from a physician or another medically qualified health care provider which attests to the result of a medical examination of a patient.
simple_sent: A medical certificate or doctor's certificate is a written statement from a doctor or other health care provider that shows a medical examination has been done on a patient.

ori_sentence: Polytrauma and multiple trauma are medical terms describing the condition of a person who has been subjected to multiple traumatic injuries, such as a serious head injury in addition to a serious burn.
simple_sent: Polytrauma (or multiple trauma) is a condition where a person has been hurt many times in a short period of time. This can include a serious head injury, or even a serious burn.

ori_sentence: Pantothenate kinase-associated neurodegeneration (PKAN), formerly called Hallervorden–Spatz syndrome, is a genetic degenerative disease of the brain that can lead to parkinsonism, dystonia, dementia, and ultimately death.
simple_sent: Pantothenate kinase-associated neurodegeneration (PKAN) is a genetic disease of the brain. People who have this disease have parkinsonism, dystonia, dementia, and eventually death.

ori_sentence: Confusional arousals are classified as “partial awakenings in which the state of consciousness remains impaired for several minutes without any accompanying major behavioural disorders or severe autonomic responses”.
simple_sent: Confusional arousals are classified as "partial awakenings" where the person's state of consciousness is impaired for several minutes. They do not usually cause any major problems or autonomic responses.

ori_sentence: The central retinal artery (retinal artery) branches off the ophthalmic artery, running inferior to the optic nerve within its dural sheath to the eyeball.
simple_sent: The central retinal artery (retinal artery) goes to the eyeball. The ophthalmic artery goes to the optic nerve and the retinal artery goes to the eye.

ori_sentence: The posterior inferior cerebellar artery (PICA) is the largest branch of the vertebral artery.
simple_sent: The posterior inferior cerebellar artery (PICA) is an important blood vessel.

ori_sentence: In human anatomy, the superficial temporal artery is a major artery of the head.
simple_sent: The superficial temporal artery is a major blood vessel in the head.

ori_sentence: A sacral dimple (also termed pilonidal dimple or spinal dimple) is a small depression in the skin, located just above the buttocks.
simple_sent: A sacral dimple (also called a spinal dimple or pilonidal dimple) is a small dimple in the skin just above the buttocks.

ori_sentence: Dapiprazole (brand name Rev-Eyes) is an alpha-1 blocker.
simple_sent: Dapiprazole (also known as Rev-Eyes) is a drug.

ori_sentence: Dehydrocholic acid is a synthetic bile acid, manufactured by the oxidation of cholic acid.
simple_sent: Dehydrocholic acid is a chemical compound. It is made by oxidation of cholic acid.

ori_sentence: Fluticasone furoate is a corticosteroid for the treatment of non-allergic and allergic rhinitis administered by a nasal spray.
simple_sent: Fluticasone furoate is a corticosteroid. It is used to treat people with allergic rhinitis or other problems.

ori_sentence: A winged scapula (scapula alata) is a skeletal medical condition in which the shoulder blade protrudes from a person's back in an abnormal position.
simple_sent: A winged scapula (scapula alata) is a medical condition. In this condition, the shoulder blade sticks out from the back of the body.

ori_sentence: The occipital artery arises from the external carotid artery opposite the facial artery.
simple_sent: The carotid artery and occipital artery are the main blood vessels in the body.

ori_sentence: Adenoid hypertrophy (enlarged adenoids) is the unusual growth (hypertrophy) of the adenoid (pharyngeal tonsil) first described in 1868 by the Danish physician Wilhelm Meyer (1824–1895) in Copenhagen.
simple_sent: Adenoid hypertrophy (enlarged adenoids) is an unusual growth (hypertrophy) of the adenoid in the tonsil. The condition was first described in 1868 by a Danish doctor.

ori_sentence: Congenital diaphragmatic hernia (CDH) is a birth defect of the diaphragm.
simple_sent: Congenital diaphragmatic hernia is a birth defect of the diaphragm.

ori_sentence: Malingering is the fabrication, feigning, or exaggeration of physical or psychological symptoms designed to achieve a desired outcome, such as relief from duty or work.
simple_sent: Malingering is the making up, pretending, or exaggerating of physical or psychological symptoms so that someone will feel better so they can do something.

ori_sentence: Probenecid, also sold under the brand name Probalan, is a medication that increases uric acid excretion in the urine.
simple_sent: Probenecid (also known as Probalan) is a drug. It helps to increase the amount of uric acid in the urine.

ori_sentence: The stapes or stirrup is a bone in the middle ear of humans and other animals which is involved in the conduction of sound vibrations to the inner ear.
simple_sent: The stapes or stirrup is a bone in the middle ear of humans and other animals. It carries sound to the inner ear through vibrations.

ori_sentence: The accessory nerve is a cranial nerve that supplies the sternocleidomastoid and trapezius muscles.
simple_sent: The accessory nerve is a nerve in the brain. It supplies the trapezius and sternocleidomastoid muscles.

ori_sentence: The ectoderm is one of the three primary germ layers formed in early embryonic development.
simple_sent: The ectoderm is the first part of the embryo. It is the first stage of development.

ori_sentence: Riociguat (trade name Adempas) is a drug by Bayer that is a stimulator of soluble guanylate cyclase (sGC).
simple_sent: Riociguat (also known as Adempas) is a drug that helps guanylate cyclase (sGC) to work better.

ori_sentence: The amniotic fluid is the protective liquid contained by the amniotic sac of a gravid amniote.
simple_sent: The amniotic fluid is a liquid in the body when a baby is growing. It is called amniotic fluid.

ori_sentence: A branchial cleft cyst is a cyst as a swelling in the upper part of neck anterior to sternocleidomastoid.
simple_sent: A cleft cyst is a swelling in the upper part of the neck. This is called a branchial cleft cyst.

ori_sentence: Mestranol, sold under the brand names Enovid, Norinyl, and Ortho-Novum among others, is an estrogen medication which has been used in birth control pills, menopausal hormone therapy, and the treatment of menstrual disorders.
simple_sent: Mestranol (also known as Enovid, Norinyl, and Ortho-Novum) is an estrogen medication. It is used as a birth control pill, to treat menopause, and as a treatment for menstrual disorders.

ori_sentence: The mammillary bodies are a pair of small round bodies, located on the undersurface of the brain that, as part of the diencephalon, form part of the limbic system.
simple_sent: The mammillary bodies are a pair of small round bodies on the outside of the brain. They form part of the limbic system and are found on the outside of the brain.

ori_sentence: Marjolin's ulcer refers to an aggressive ulcerating squamous cell carcinoma presenting in an area of previously traumatized, chronically inflamed, or scarred skin.
simple_sent: Marjolin's ulcer is an aggressive squamous cell carcinoma. It is usually found in an area of skin that has already been scarred or traumatized.

ori_sentence: Coccidiosis is a parasitic disease of the intestinal tract of animals caused by coccidian protozoa.
simple_sent: Coccidiosis is a disease in animals. It is caused by a protozoan called coccidiosis.

ori_sentence: Spondylitis is an inflammation of the vertebrae.
simple_sent: Spondylitis is a condition of the spine.

ori_sentence: A plantar wart, or verruca, is a wart occurring on the bottom of the foot or toes.
simple_sent: A plantar wart is a wart that can be found on the bottom of the foot or toes.

ori_sentence: Paramyotonia congenita (PC), is a rare congenital autosomal dominant neuromuscular disorder characterized by “paradoxical” myotonia.
simple_sent: Paramyotonia congenita (PC) is a rare disorder. It is when a person is born with an autosomal dominant neuromuscular disorder.

ori_sentence: Neuromuscular disease is a broad term that encompasses many diseases and ailments that impair the functioning of the muscles, either directly, being pathologies of the voluntary muscle, or indirectly, being pathologies of nerves or neuromuscular junctions.
simple_sent: Neuromuscular disease is a term that is used to describe many diseases and ailments that affect the muscles of the body. There are two types of neuromuscular disease: nerve diseases and muscle diseases.

ori_sentence: Repaglinide is an antidiabetic drug in the class of medications known as meglitinides, and was invented in 1983.
simple_sent: Repaglinide is a drug that helps to control blood sugar. It is an antidiabetic drug, and was invented in 1983.

ori_sentence: The basilar artery (/ˈbæz.ɪ.lər/) is one of the arteries that supplies the brain with oxygen-rich blood.
simple_sent: The basilar artery is an important artery in the human body. It carries blood to the brain.

ori_sentence: The nasal septum (Latin: septum nasi) separates the left and right airways of the nasal cavity, dividing the two nostrils.
simple_sent: The nasal septum is a part of the nasal cavity. It separates the left and right nostrils in the human body.

ori_sentence: Erythema ab igne (EAI), also known as hot water bottle rash, is a skin condition caused by long-term exposure to heat (infrared radiation).
simple_sent: Erythema ab igne (EAI), also known as hot water bottle rash, is a condition of the skin. It is caused by too much heat.

ori_sentence: The posterior auricular artery is a small artery that arises from the external carotid artery, above the digastric muscle and stylohyoid muscle, opposite the apex of the styloid process.
simple_sent: The posterior auricular artery is a small artery. It comes from the external carotid artery and goes to the heart. It goes to the heart above the digastric muscle.

ori_sentence: Omenn syndrome is an autosomal recessive severe combined immunodeficiency.
simple_sent: Omenn syndrome is a rare disease. It is called severe combined immunodeficiency.

ori_sentence: Cerebellar hypoplasia is characterized by reduced cerebellar volume, even though cerebellar shape is (near) normal.
simple_sent: Cerebellar hypoplasia means that the cerebellar body does not work properly. The shape of the cerebellar body is normal.

ori_sentence: Diastole (/daɪˈæstəli/ dy-AST-ə-lee) is the part of the cardiac cycle during which the heart refills with blood after the emptying is done during systole (contraction).
simple_sent: Diastole is a part of the cardiac cycle. When the heart is pumping blood, it is called systole. When the heart is pumping, it is called diastole.

ori_sentence: The subclavian vein is a paired large vein, one on either side of the body, that is responsible for draining blood from the upper extremities, allowing this blood to return to the heart.
simple_sent: The subclavian vein is a large vein. It is located on either side of the body. It takes blood from the upper body and gives it to the heart in the lower body.

ori_sentence: Transcortical motor aphasia (TMoA), also known as commissural dysphasia or white matter dysphasia, results from damage in the anterior superior frontal lobe of the language-dominant hemisphere.
simple_sent: Transcortical motor aphasia (TMoA), also known as white matter dysphasia or commissural dysphasia, is a condition in which the brain can not use its motor skills.

ori_sentence: Pseudoporphyria is a bullous photosensitivity that clinically and histologically mimics porphyria cutanea tarda.
simple_sent: Pseudoporphyria is a disease of the skin. It is similar to porphyria cutanea tarda.

ori_sentence: Teratospermia or teratozoospermia is a condition characterized by the presence of sperm with abnormal morphology that affects fertility in males.
simple_sent: Teratospermia or teratozoospermia is a condition in which sperm are not normal. This can affect a male's fertility.

ori_sentence: The ascending pharyngeal artery is an artery in the neck that supplies the pharynx, developing from the proximal part of the embryonic second aortic arch.
simple_sent: The ascending pharyngeal artery is an artery in the neck. It goes up to the top of the pharynx, and carries food and oxygen to the pharynx.

ori_sentence: A psammoma body is a round collection of calcium, seen microscopically.
simple_sent: The body of a psammoma is a round object. It can be seen microscopically.

ori_sentence: The choroid, also known as the choroidea or choroid coat, is the vascular layer of the eye, containing connective tissues, and lying between the retina and the sclera.
simple_sent: The choroid (also called the choroidea or choroid coat) is a thin layer of skin on the outside of the eye. It is between the retina and the sclera.

ori_sentence: The popliteal artery entrapment syndrome is a rather uncommon pathology, which results in claudication and chronic leg ischemia.
simple_sent: The popliteal artery entrapment syndrome is very rare. If it does happen, it can cause chronic leg ischemia.

ori_sentence: Allergic rhinitis, of which the seasonal type is called hay fever, is a type of inflammation in the nose that occurs when the immune system overreacts to allergens in the air.
simple_sent: Allergic rhinitis, also called hay fever, is an infection of the nose. It happens when the body's immune system tries to fight off all the allergens in the air.

ori_sentence: Todd's paresis (or postictal paresis/paralysis, "after seizure") is focal weakness in a part or all of the body after a seizure.
simple_sent: Todd's paresis (also called postictal paresis or postictal paresis) is a disease. It happens after a seizure.

ori_sentence: A seborrheic keratosis is a non-cancerous (benign) skin tumour that originates from cells in the outer layer of the skin.
simple_sent: A seborrheic keratosis is a non-cancerous growth on the skin. It usually starts in the outer layer of the skin.

ori_sentence: The posterior cerebral artery (PCA) is one of a pair of cerebral arteries that supply oxygenated blood to the occipital lobe, part of the back of the human brain.
simple_sent: The posterior cerebral artery (PCA) is a blood vessel in the brain. It goes to the back part of the human brain, where the occipital lobe is.

ori_sentence: Nateglinide (INN, trade name Starlix) is a drug for the treatment of type 2 diabetes.
simple_sent: Nateglinide is a drug. It is used to treat type 2 diabetes mellitus.

ori_sentence: Chronic granulomatous disease (CGD), also known as Bridges–Good syndrome, chronic granulomatous disorder, and Quie syndrome, is a diverse group of hereditary diseases in which certain cells of the immune system have difficulty forming the reactive oxygen compounds (most importantly the superoxide radical due to defective phagocyte NADPH oxidase) used to kill certain ingested pathogens.
simple_sent: Chronic granulomatous disease (CGD), also known as Bridges-Good syndrome, chronic granulomatous disorder, and Quie syndrome, is a disease where the immune system is not able to fight off infections. This happens because some cells of the immune system, called phagocytes, are not able to make the reactive oxygen compounds needed to kill pathogens.

ori_sentence: The superior thyroid artery arises from the external carotid artery just below the level of the greater cornu of the hyoid bone and ends in the thyroid gland.
simple_sent: The superior thyroid artery comes from the external carotid artery. It goes through the hyoid bone and ends in the thyroid gland.

ori_sentence: Trichinosis, also known as trichinellosis, is a parasitic disease caused by roundworms of the Trichinella type.
simple_sent: Trichinosis, also known as trichinellosis, is a disease. It is caused by roundworms (Trichinella).

ori_sentence: Retinoblastoma (Rb) is a rare form of cancer that rapidly develops from the immature cells of a retina, the light-detecting tissue of the eye.
simple_sent: Retinoblastoma is a rare type of cancer. It starts in the early stages of development of the retina, the light-detecting tissue of the eye.

ori_sentence: Uterine rupture is when the muscular wall of the uterus tears during pregnancy or childbirth.
simple_sent: Uterine rupture is when the wall of the uterus is broken. This usually happens during pregnancy.

ori_sentence: Desonide (INN) is a low-potency topical corticosteroid anti-inflammatory that has been available since the 1970s.
simple_sent: Desonide is an anti-inflammatory drug that has been available since the 1970s. It is a low-potency drug.

ori_sentence: Travoprost, sold under the brand name Travatan among others, is a medication used to treat high pressure inside the eye including glaucoma.
simple_sent: Travoprost (also known as Travatan) is a medication. It is used to treat glaucoma and other problems with the eye.

ori_sentence: Eosinopenia is a form of agranulocytosis where the number of eosinophil granulocytes is lower than expected.
simple_sent: Eosinopenia is a form of agranulocytosis. In this case, there are less granulocytes than expected.

ori_sentence: Ainhum (from Portuguese, pronounced /aj.ˈɲũ/), also known as dactylolysis spontanea, is a painful constriction of the base of the fifth toe frequently followed by bilateral spontaneous autoamputation a few years later.
simple_sent: Ainhum (from Portuguese, pronounced /aj.ˈɲũ/), also known as dactylolysis spontanea, is a condition where the base of the fifth toe of the foot gets smaller. It is very painful.

ori_sentence: Ranolazine, sold under the brand name Ranexa among others, is a medication used to treat heart related chest pain.
simple_sent: Ranolazine, also known as Ranexa, is a drug. It is used to treat chest pain caused by the heart.

ori_sentence: In human anatomy, the internal thoracic artery (ITA), previously commonly known as the internal mammary artery (a name still common among surgeons), is an artery that supplies the anterior chest wall and the breasts.
simple_sent: The internal thoracic artery (ITA) is an artery in the human body. Before it was known as the internal mammary artery, this is because it goes through the front of the chest and into the breasts.

ori_sentence: The ophthalmic artery (OA) is the first branch of the internal carotid artery distal to the cavernous sinus.
simple_sent: The ophthalmic artery is an important artery in the human body. It goes into the sinus cavity.

ori_sentence: The maxillary artery supplies deep structures of the face.
simple_sent: The maxillary artery provides the face's deep structure.

ori_sentence: Galactorrhea (also spelled galactorrhoea) (galacto- + -rrhea) or lactorrhea (lacto- + -rrhea) is the spontaneous flow of milk from the breast, unassociated with childbirth or nursing.
simple_sent: Galactorrhea (also spelled galactorrhoea) (galacto- + -rrhea) or lactorrhea (lacto- + -rrhea) is when milk comes out of a woman's breast without any warning.

ori_sentence: Incontinentia pigmenti achromians (also known as "hypomelanosis of Ito") is a cutaneous condition characterized by various patterns of bilateral or unilateral hypopigmentation following the lines of Blaschko.
simple_sent: Incontinentia pigmenti achromians (also known as "hypomelanosis of Ito") is a condition in which the skin does not color properly. There are many different types of hypopigmentation.

ori_sentence: Magnetic resonance angiography (MRA) is a group of techniques based on magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) to image blood vessels.
simple_sent: Magnetic resonance angiography (MRA) is a type of medical imaging. It uses magnetic resonance to look at blood vessels.

ori_sentence: Hereditary elliptocytosis, also known as ovalocytosis, is an inherited blood disorder in which an abnormally large number of the person's red blood cells are elliptical rather than the typical biconcave disc shape.
simple_sent: Hereditary elliptocytosis, also known as ovalocytosis, is an inherited blood disorder. In people who have this disease, their red blood cells have an elliptical shape instead of a biconcave shape.

ori_sentence: Bumetanide, sold under the brand name Bumex among others, is a medication used to treat swelling and high blood pressure.
simple_sent: Bumetanide (also known as Bumex) is a medication. It is used to treat high blood pressure and swelling.

ori_sentence: Phthisis bulbi is a shrunken, non-functional eye.
simple_sent: Phthisis bulbi is an eye that does not work.

ori_sentence: Melphalan, sold under the trade name Alkeran among others, is a chemotherapy medication used to treat multiple myeloma, ovarian cancer, melanoma, and AL amyloidosis.
simple_sent: Melphalan (also known as Alkeran) is a chemotherapy drug. It is used to treat cancer of the blood. It is used to treat multiple myeloma.

ori_sentence: The triquetral bone (/traɪˈkwɛtrəl, -ˈkwiː-/; also called triquetrum, pyramidal, three-faced, and formerly cuneiform bone) is located in the wrist on the medial side of the proximal row of the carpus between the lunate and pisiform bones.
simple_sent: The triquetral bone (also called triquetrum, pyramidal, three-faced, and cuneiform) is a bone in the wrist. It is between the lunate and pisiform bones and is the main bone of the wrist.

ori_sentence: Hidradenitis is any disease in which the histologic abnormality is primarily an inflammatory infiltrate around the eccrine glands.
simple_sent: Hidradenitis is any disease where there is an abnormality in the cells of the eccrine glands.

ori_sentence: Membranoproliferative glomerulonephritis (MPGN) is a type of glomerulonephritis caused by deposits in the kidney glomerular mesangium and basement membrane (GBM) thickening, activating complement and damaging the glomeruli.
simple_sent: Membranoproliferative glomerulonephritis (MPGN) is a form of glomerulonephritis. It is caused by a thickening of the mesangium and basement membrane in the kidney. This thickens the glomeruli.

ori_sentence: Cracked tooth syndrome (CTS) is where a tooth has incompletely cracked but no part of the tooth has yet broken off.
simple_sent: Cracked tooth syndrome (CTS) is when a tooth is cracked, but no part of the tooth has broken off yet.

ori_sentence: Plerixafor (INN and USAN, trade name Mozobil) is an immunostimulant used to mobilize hematopoietic stem cells in cancer patients into the bloodstream.
simple_sent: Plerixafor is an immunostimulant. It is used to get hematopoietic stem cells from patients with cancer into the blood.

ori_sentence: Thiamylal (Surital) is a barbiturate derivative invented in the 1950s.
simple_sent: Thiamylal is a barbiturate. It was first discovered in the 1950s.

ori_sentence: Vorinostat (rINN) also known as suberanilohydroxamic acid (suberoyl+anilide+hydroxamic acid abbreviated as SAHA) is a member of a larger class of compounds that inhibit histone deacetylases (HDAC).
simple_sent: Vorinostat, also known as suberanilohydroxamic acid (SAHA), is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula issuberoyl+anilide+hydroxamic acid.

ori_sentence: Tiagabine (trade name Gabitril) is an anticonvulsant medication produced by Cephalon that is used in the treatment of epilepsy.
simple_sent: Tiagabine (also known as Gabitril) is a drug that is used to treat epilepsy. It has the trade name Gabitril.

ori_sentence: The lingual artery arises from the external carotid artery between the superior thyroid artery and facial artery.
simple_sent: The lingual artery is an important artery in the human body. It comes from the external carotid artery.

ori_sentence: Viloxazine, sold under the brand name Qelbree among others, is a medication which is used in the treatment of attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) in children and depression.
simple_sent: Viloxazine (also known as Qelbree) is a medication that is used to treat depression and attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) in children.

ori_sentence: Trilostane, sold under the brand names Modrenal and Vetoryl among others, is a medication which has been used in the treatment of Cushing's syndrome, Conn's syndrome, and postmenopausal breast cancer in humans.
simple_sent: Trilostane, also known as Modrenal and Vetoryl, is a chemical compound. It is used to treat Cushing's syndrome and Conn's syndrome. It is also used to treat breast cancer in humans.

ori_sentence: Idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis (IPF) is a rare, progressive illness of the respiratory system, characterized by the thickening and stiffening of lung tissue, associated with the formation of scar tissue.
simple_sent: Idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis (IPF) is a rare and progressive disease of the lung. The disease causes the lung tissue to stiffen and become more difficult to breathe in and out.

ori_sentence: Lindane, also known as gamma-hexachlorocyclohexane (γ-HCH), gammaxene, Gammallin and sometimes incorrectly called benzene hexachloride (BHC), is an organochlorine chemical and an isomer of hexachlorocyclohexane that has been used both as an agricultural insecticide and as a pharmaceutical treatment for lice and scabies.
simple_sent: Lindane, also known as gamma-hexachlorocyclohexane (γ-HCH), gammaxene, Gammallin and sometimes incorrectly called benzene hexachloride (BHC), is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is BHC. It is also known as gamma-hexachlorocyclohexane or gammaxene.

ori_sentence: The Bowman's membrane (Bowman's layer, anterior limiting lamina, anterior elastic lamina) is a smooth, acellular, nonregenerating layer, located between the superficial epithelium and the stroma in the cornea of the eye.
simple_sent: Bowman's membrane (also called Bowman's layer, anterior limiting lamina, or anterior elastic lamina) is a layer in the cornea of the eye. It is a smooth, acellular, nonregenerating layer.

ori_sentence: Gastrointestinal bleeding (GI bleed), also called gastrointestinal hemorrhage (GIB), is all forms of bleeding in the gastrointestinal tract, from the mouth to the rectum.
simple_sent: Gastrointestinal bleeding (GI bleed), also called gastrointestinal hemorrhage (GIB), is bleeding in the gastrointestinal tract (where food goes into the body).

ori_sentence: Proteus syndrome is a rare disorder with a genetic background that can cause tissue overgrowth involving all three embryonic lineages.
simple_sent: Proteus syndrome is a rare disorder. It can cause tissue overgrowth. It can happen to all three types of human embryos.

ori_sentence: A nabothian cyst (or nabothian follicle) is a mucus-filled cyst on the surface of the cervix.
simple_sent: A nabothian cyst (or nabothian follicle) is a cyst. It is made of mucus and fat.

ori_sentence: The glucose tolerance test is a medical test in which glucose is given and blood samples taken afterward to determine how quickly it is cleared from the blood.
simple_sent: The glucose tolerance test is a medical test. In the test, glucose is given to a person and blood samples are taken to see how quickly it goes away.

ori_sentence: Pseudohermaphroditism is a condition in which an individual has a matching chromosomal and gonadal tissue (ovary or testis) sex, but mismatching external genitalia.
simple_sent: Pseudohermaphroditism is a condition. In this case, the person has the same sex at birth, but they do not have the same sex organs or sex organs.

ori_sentence: Male infertility refers to a sexually mature male's inability to impregnate a fertile female.
simple_sent: Male infertility is when a male is able to have children, but they are not fertile.

ori_sentence: Lactic acidosis is a medical condition characterized by the buildup of lactate (especially L-lactate) in the body, with formation of an excessively low pH in the bloodstream.
simple_sent: Lactic acidosis is a medical condition. In it, the body makes too much lactate (especially L-lactate) in the body. This makes the pH in the blood too low.

ori_sentence: Gas gangrene (also known as clostridial myonecrosis and myonecrosis) is a bacterial infection that produces tissue gas in gangrene.
simple_sent: Gas gangrene (also known as clostridial myonecrosis and myonecrosis) is when a person gets an infection that makes gas.

ori_sentence: Surfer's ear is the common name for an exostosis or abnormal bone growth within the ear canal.
simple_sent: Surfer's ear is a condition where bone grows outside the ear canal. This is called exostosis.

ori_sentence: Patau syndrome is a syndrome caused by a chromosomal abnormality, in which some or all of the cells of the body contain extra genetic material from chromosome 13.
simple_sent: Patau syndrome is a condition where some or all of the cells of the body have extra genetic material from chromosome 13. This is called a chromosome abnormality.

ori_sentence: Sexual arousal disorder is characterized by a lack or absence of sexual fantasies and desire for sexual activity in a situation that would normally produce sexual arousal, or the inability to attain or maintain typical responses to sexual arousal.
simple_sent: Sexual arousal disorder is when a person does not have any sexual fantasies or desire for sexual activity. When they are in a situation where they would normally have sexual arousal, they do not have it.

ori_sentence: Hemiparesis, or unilateral paresis, is weakness of one entire side of the body (hemi- means "half").
simple_sent: Hemiparesis or unilateral paresis is when one side of the body is weaker than the other.

ori_sentence: Stickler syndrome (hereditary progressive arthro-ophthalmodystrophy) is a group of very rare genetic disorders affecting connective tissue, specifically collagen.
simple_sent: Stickler syndrome (also called hereditary progressive arthro-ophthalmodystrophy) is a rare disease. It happens to people who have certain genes.

ori_sentence: Gastrointestinal stromal tumors (GISTs) are the most common mesenchymal neoplasms of the gastrointestinal tract.
simple_sent: Gastrointestinal stromal tumors (GISTs) are cancer of the gastrointestinal tract. They are very common.

ori_sentence: Nalidixic acid (tradenames Nevigramon, Neggram, Wintomylon and WIN 18,320) is the first of the synthetic quinolone antibiotics.
simple_sent: Nalidixic acid (also known as Nevigramon, Neggram, Wintomylon and WIN 18,320) is a chemical compound.

ori_sentence: A joint effusion is the presence of increased intra-articular fluid.
simple_sent: A joint effusion is when there is more fluid in the joint.

ori_sentence: Copper deficiency, or hypocupremia, is defined either as insufficient copper to meet the needs of the body, or as a serum copper level below the normal range.
simple_sent: Copper deficiency, or hypocupremia, is when there is not enough copper in the body. This means that people's blood levels of copper are lower than normal.

ori_sentence: Terazosin, sold under the brand name Hytrin among others, is a medication used to treat symptoms of an enlarged prostate and high blood pressure.
simple_sent: Terazosin, sold under the brand name Hytrin among others, is a drug that is used to treat high blood pressure and prostate cancer.

ori_sentence: Glioblastoma, also known as glioblastoma multiforme (GBM), is the most aggressive type of cancer that begins within the brain.
simple_sent: Glioblastoma multiforme, also known as glioblastoma, is a cancer of the brain. It is the most common brain cancer.

ori_sentence: The facial artery (external maxillary artery in older texts) is a branch of the external carotid artery that supplies structures of the superficial face.
simple_sent: The facial artery is a blood vessel in the human body. It is a branch of the carotid artery and supplies blood to the face.

ori_sentence: An insulinoma is a tumor of the pancreas that is derived from beta cells and secretes insulin.
simple_sent: An insulinoma is a tumor in the pancreas. The insulin is made by the beta cells.

ori_sentence: Polyneuropathy (poly- + neuro- + -pathy) is damage or disease affecting peripheral nerves (peripheral neuropathy) in roughly the same areas on both sides of the body, featuring weakness, numbness, and burning pain.
simple_sent: Polyneuropathy (poly- + neuro- + -pathy) is a disease that affects nerves on both sides of the body. People with polyneuropathy usually have weakness, numbness, and burning pain.

ori_sentence: Robinow syndrome is an extremely rare genetic disorder characterized by short-limbed dwarfism, abnormalities in the head, face, and external genitalia, as well as vertebral segmentation.
simple_sent: Robinow syndrome is a very rare genetic disorder. People with Robinow syndrome have short-limbed legs, problems with the head, face and body, and problems with the sex organs.

ori_sentence: Atrial flutter (AFL) is a common abnormal heart rhythm that starts in the atrial chambers of the heart.
simple_sent: Atrial flutter is a heart rhythm problem. It usually starts in the atrial chambers of the heart.

ori_sentence: Ochronosis is a syndrome caused by the accumulation of homogentisic acid in connective tissues.
simple_sent: Ochronosis is a disease. In it, homogentisic acid builds up in the connective tissues.

ori_sentence: Hyperglycemia is a condition in which an excessive amount of glucose circulates in the blood plasma.
simple_sent: Hyperglycemia is when there is too much glucose in the blood. This is called hyperglycemia.

ori_sentence: Leukopenia (from Greek λευκός (leukos) 'white', and πενία (penia) 'deficiency') is a decrease in the number of leukocytes.
simple_sent: Leukopenia is a condition in which there is a decrease in the number of white blood cells (leukocytes).

ori_sentence: Drug withdrawal, drug withdrawal syndrome, or substance withdrawal syndrome, is the group of symptoms that occur upon the abrupt discontinuation or decrease in the intake of medicational or recreational drugs.
simple_sent: Drug withdrawal, drug withdrawal syndrome, or substance withdrawal syndrome, is a group of symptoms. When a person takes a certain drug, he or she may have some withdrawal symptoms.

ori_sentence: Perindopril is a medication used to treat high blood pressure, heart failure, or stable coronary artery disease.
simple_sent: Perindopril is a drug. It is used to treat high blood pressure, heart disease, or heart failure.

ori_sentence: Bronchospasm or a bronchial spasm is a sudden constriction of the muscles in the walls of the bronchioles.
simple_sent: Bronchospasm or bronchial spasm is when the muscles in the bronchioles become too tight.

ori_sentence: Polycystic ovary syndrome, or PCOS, is the most common endocrine disorder in women of reproductive age.
simple_sent: Polycystic ovary syndrome, also known as PCOS, is a condition that makes women's ovaries not work.

ori_sentence: Triamcinolone acetonide is a synthetic corticosteroid medication used topically to treat various skin conditions, to relieve the discomfort of mouth sores, and intra-articularly by proceduralists to treat various joint conditions.
simple_sent: Triamcinolone acetonide is a synthetic corticosteroid medication. It is used to treat various skin conditions. It is also used to relieve the discomfort of mouth sores, and to treat various joint conditions.

ori_sentence: Cartilage (cartilaginous tissue) is a resilient and smooth elastic tissue, rubber-like padding that covers and protects the ends of long bones at the joints and nerves, and is a structural component of the rib cage, the ear, the nose, the bronchial tubes, the intervertebral discs, and many other body components.
simple_sent: Cartilage (cartilaginous tissue) is a soft, elastic tissue in the body. It covers and protects the ends of long bones at the joints and nerves, and is a very important part of the human body. Cartilage is also a very important part of the human ear.

ori_sentence: Scaphocephaly is a type of cephalic disorder which occurs when there is a premature fusion of the sagittal suture.
simple_sent: Scaphocephaly is a type of cephalic disorder. It happens when the sagittal suture is not properly closed.
