ori_sentence: Gastric antral vascular ectasia (GAVE) is an uncommon cause of chronic gastrointestinal bleeding or iron deficiency anemia.
simple_sent: Gastric antral vascular ectasia (GAVE) is a condition. It can cause bleeding in the stomach or intestines.

ori_sentence: In internal medicine, relapse or recidivism is a recurrence of a past (typically medical) condition.
simple_sent: In internal medicine, relapse or recidivism is when a condition (usually medical) happens again.

ori_sentence: A tophus (Latin: "stone", plural tophi) is a deposit of monosodium urate crystals, in people with longstanding high levels of uric acid in the blood, a condition known as hyperuricemia.
simple_sent: A tophus (Latin: "stone", plural tophi) is a deposit of monosodium urate in the blood. This condition is known as hyperuricemia, when the blood has too much uric acid.

ori_sentence: Lymphangitis is an inflammation or an infection of the lymphatic channels that occurs as a result of infection at a site distal to the channel.
simple_sent: Lymphangitis is an inflammation or an infection of the lymphatic system. The most common cause of lymphangitis is left heart disease.

ori_sentence: The systole (/ˈsɪstəli/ SIST-ə-lee) is the part of the cardiac cycle during which some chambers of the heart muscle contract after refilling with blood.
simple_sent: The systole is a part of the cardiac cycle. When the heart is pumping blood, some of the chambers of the heart contract.

ori_sentence: Nemaline myopathy (also called rod myopathy or nemaline rod myopathy) is a congenital, often hereditary neuromuscular disorder with many symptoms that can occur such as muscle weakness, hypoventilation, swallowing dysfunction, and impaired speech ability.
simple_sent: Nemaline myopathy (also called rod myopathy or nemaline rod myopathy) is a disease that affects the muscles of the body. There are many symptoms, but the main ones are muscle weakness and problems with swallowing.

ori_sentence: Sulfhemoglobinemia is a rare condition in which there is excess sulfhemoglobin
simple_sent: Sulfhemoglobinemia is a condition. It is a rare disease.

ori_sentence: The tunica intima (New Latin "inner coat"), or intima for short, is the innermost tunica (layer) of an artery or vein.
simple_sent: The tunica intima, or intima for short, is the inner layer of an artery. It is also called the inner coat.

ori_sentence: The renal calyces are chambers of the kidney through which urine passes.
simple_sent: The renal calyces are two small chambers in the kidney.

ori_sentence: An intervertebral disc (or intervertebral fibrocartilage) lies between adjacent vertebrae in the vertebral column.
simple_sent: An intervertebral disc or intervertebral fibrocartilage is a disc in the middle of the vertebral column.

ori_sentence: The brachial artery is the major blood vessel of the (upper) arm.
simple_sent: The brachial artery is an important blood vessel in the body.

ori_sentence: Hemoperitoneum (also haemoperitoneum, sometimes also hematoperitoneum) is the presence of blood in the peritoneal cavity.
simple_sent: Hemoperitoneum is when there is blood in the peritoneal cavity. It is also called haemoperitoneum.

ori_sentence: Sanfilippo syndrome, also known as mucopolysaccharidosis type III (MPS III), is a rare autosomal recessive lysosomal storage disease that primarily affects the brain and spinal cord.
simple_sent: Sanfilippo syndrome, also known as mucopolysaccharidosis type III (MPS III), is a disease that affects the brain and spinal cord. People with Sanfilippo syndrome are very sick.

ori_sentence: The spermatid is the haploid male gametid that results from division of secondary spermatocytes.
simple_sent: The spermatid is the haploid male gametid. It is made up of two cells called spermatocytes.

ori_sentence: The uvea (/ˈjuːviə/; Lat. uva, "grape"), also called the uveal layer, uveal coat, uveal tract, vascular tunic or vascular layer is the pigmented middle of the three concentric layers that make up an eye.
simple_sent: The uvea (Latin: uva, "grape"), also called the uveal layer, uveal coat, uveal tract, or vascular layer, is the middle layer of the eye. It is the most pigmented part of the eye.

ori_sentence: Sucrose intolerance or genetic sucrase-isomaltase deficiency (GSID) is the condition in which sucrase-isomaltase, an enzyme needed for proper metabolism of sucrose (sugar) and starch (e.g., grains), is not produced or the enzyme produced is either partially functional or non-functional in the small intestine.
simple_sent: Sucrose intolerance or genetic sucrase-isomaltase deficiency (GSID) is when a person can not make the enzyme sucrase-isomaltase. This enzyme is needed to break down sugar (sugar) and starch (starch is a type of food), into other things people can eat.

ori_sentence: Tympanosclerosis is a condition caused by hyalinization and subsequent calcification of subepithelial connective tissue of TM and middle ear, sometimes resulting in a detrimental effect to hearing.
simple_sent: Tympanosclerosis is a disease of the middle ear and TM. It is caused by calcification of the connective tissue between the middle ear and the TM, and can cause hearing loss.

ori_sentence: The middle ear is the portion of the ear internal to the eardrum, and external to the oval window of the inner ear.
simple_sent: The middle ear is the part of the ear that is inside the body. The inside of the ear is called the eardrum.

ori_sentence: Papillary thyroid cancer or papillary thyroid carcinoma is the most common type of thyroid cancer, representing 75 percent to 85 percent of all thyroid cancer cases.
simple_sent: Thyroid cancer is cancer of the thyroid gland. It is the most common cancer in women, and it is the most common cancer in women worldwide.

ori_sentence: Umbilical granuloma, is the most common umbilical abnormality in neonates, causing inflammation and drainage.
simple_sent: Umbilical granuloma: This is the most common umbilical abnormality in babies. It causes swelling and drainage.

ori_sentence: Gallstone ileus is a rare form of small bowel obstruction caused by an impaction of a gallstone within the lumen of the small intestine.
simple_sent: Gallstone ileus is a very rare form of small bowel obstruction. It happens when a gallstone gets stuck in the small intestine.

ori_sentence: Taeniasis is an infection within the intestines by adult tapeworms belonging to the genus Taenia.
simple_sent: Taeniasis is a disease. It is caused by adult tapeworms of the Taenia genus.

ori_sentence: Subacute bacterial endocarditis, abbreviated SBE, is a type of endocarditis (more specifically, infective endocarditis).
simple_sent: Subacute bacterial endocarditis, also called SBE, is an infection of the heart. It is a type of endocarditis.

ori_sentence: Rapidly progressive glomerulonephritis (RPGN) is a syndrome of the kidney that is characterized by a rapid loss of kidney function, (usually a 50% decline in the glomerular filtration rate (GFR) within 3 months) with glomerular crescent formation seen in at least 50% or 75% of glomeruli seen on kidney biopsies.
simple_sent: Rapidly progressive glomerulonephritis (RPGN) is a disease of the kidney. It is characterized by a rapid loss of kidney function, usually within 3 months, with at least 50% or 75% of glomeruli seen on kidney biopsies, and a glomerular crescent formation seen in at least 50% of glomeruli.

ori_sentence: Exhalation (or expiration) is the flow of the breath out of an organism.
simple_sent: Exhalation (or expiration) is when an organism's breath goes out.

ori_sentence: Autoimmune pancreatitis (AIP) is an increasingly recognized type of chronic pancreatitis that can be difficult to distinguish from pancreatic carcinoma but which responds to treatment with corticosteroids, particularly prednisone.
simple_sent: Autoimmune pancreatitis (AIP) is a type of pancreatitis that does not go away after a few years. People who have this disease have a hard time telling it apart from pancreatic carcinoma.

ori_sentence: The incus or anvil is a bone in the middle ear.
simple_sent: The incus bone is a small bone in the ear.

ori_sentence: Gangliosidosis contains different types of lipid storage disorders caused by the accumulation of lipids known as gangliosides.
simple_sent: Gangliosidosis is a medical condition. It is caused by a build-up of lipids in the body, called gangliosides.

ori_sentence: The pterygopalatine ganglion (aka Meckel's ganglion, nasal ganglion, or sphenopalatine ganglion) is a parasympathetic ganglion found in the pterygopalatine fossa.
simple_sent: The pterygopalatine ganglion, also called Meckel's ganglion, sphenopalatine ganglion, or nasal ganglion, is a parasympathetic ganglion.

ori_sentence: The superior cervical ganglion (SCG) is part of the autonomic nervous system (ANS), more specifically it is part of the sympathetic nervous system, a division of the ANS most commonly associated with the fight or flight response.
simple_sent: The superior cervical ganglion (SCG) is a part of the autonomic nervous system (ANS). The SCG helps the body to fight or flight when there is a danger that someone is going to attack it.

ori_sentence: The posterior cranial fossa is part of the cranial cavity, located between the foramen magnum and tentorium cerebelli.
simple_sent: The posterior cranial fossa is located between the foramen magnum and the tentorium cerebelli in the back of the head.

ori_sentence: Noise-induced hearing loss (NIHL) is a hearing impairment resulting from exposure to loud sound.
simple_sent: Noise-induced hearing loss (NIHL) happens when people are exposed to loud noise.

ori_sentence: The nucleus accumbens (NAc or NAcc; also known as the accumbens nucleus, or formerly as the nucleus accumbens septi, Latin for "nucleus adjacent to the septum") is a region in the basal forebrain rostral to the preoptic area of the hypothalamus.
simple_sent: The nucleus accumbens (NAc or NAcc; also known as the accumbens nucleus, or formerly as the nucleus accumbens septi, Latin for "nucleus adjacent to the septum") is a part of the brain that helps control movement in the brain.

ori_sentence: An operating microscope or surgical microscope is an optical microscope specifically designed to be used in a surgical setting, typically to perform microsurgery.
simple_sent: An operating microscope or surgical microscope is a special kind of microscope. It is made to be used during surgery, to look at parts of the body.

ori_sentence: Linagliptin, sold under the brand name Tradjenta among others, is a medication used to treat diabetes mellitus type 2.
simple_sent: Tradjenta, also known as Linagliptin, is a diabetes treatment. It is used to treat diabetes mellitus type 2.

ori_sentence: Nalbuphine, sold under the brand names Nubain among others, is an opioid analgesic which is used in the treatment of pain.
simple_sent: Nalbuphine (also known as Nubain and Naloxone) is a pain-killing drug. It is used to treat pain.

ori_sentence: Uveitis (/ˌjuːvɪaɪtɪs/) is the inflammation of the uvea, the pigmented layer that lies between the inner retina and the outer fibrous layer composed of the sclera and cornea.
simple_sent: Uveitis is an inflammation of the uvea. The uvea is the layer of skin between the inner retina and the outer layer of skin. The uvea is a very pigmented layer.

ori_sentence: Eptifibatide (Integrilin, Millennium Pharmaceuticals, also co-promoted by Schering-Plough/Essex), is an antiplatelet drug of the glycoprotein IIb/IIIa inhibitor class.
simple_sent: Eptifibatide (Integrilin) is an antiplatelet drug. It is a glycoprotein IIb/IIIa inhibitor, which means it can stop blood vessels from working.

ori_sentence: Tenosynovitis is the inflammation of the fluid-filled sheath (called the synovium) that surrounds a tendon, typically leading to joint pain, swelling, and stiffness.
simple_sent: Tenosynovitis is the inflammation of the fluid-filled sheath (called the synovium) that surrounds a tendon. It usually causes joint pain and stiffness.

ori_sentence: Galactosialidosis, also known as Neuraminidase deficiency with beta-galactosidase deficiency, is a genetic lysosomal storage disease.
simple_sent: Galactosialidosis, also known as beta-galactosidase deficiency, is a genetic disease. It affects the nervous system.

ori_sentence: Biliary sludge refers to a viscous mixture of small particles derived from bile.
simple_sent: Biliary sludge is a thick liquid. It is made up of small particles from bile.

ori_sentence: The Mantoux test or Mendel–Mantoux test (also known as the Mantoux screening test, tuberculin sensitivity test, Pirquet test, or PPD test for purified protein derivative) is a tool for screening for tuberculosis (TB) and for tuberculosis diagnosis.
simple_sent: The Mendel-Mantoux test (also known as the Mantoux screening test, tuberculin sensitivity test, or Pirquet test) is a test to see if a person has tuberculosis. It is used to find out if someone has tuberculosis.

ori_sentence: Alcoholic cardiomyopathy is a disease in which the chronic long-term heavy use of alcohol (i.e., ethanol) leads to heart failure.
simple_sent: Alcoholic cardiomyopathy is a disease. In it, long-term heavy use of alcohol causes the heart to stop working properly.

ori_sentence: Hypochromic anemia is a generic term for any type of anemia in which the red blood cells are paler than normal.
simple_sent: Hypochromic anemia means that the red blood cells in the body are paler than they should be.

ori_sentence: The renal cortex is the outer portion of the kidney between the renal capsule and the renal medulla.
simple_sent: The outside of the kidney is called the renal cortex. The inside of the kidney is called the renal capsule.

ori_sentence: Schlemm's canal is a circular lymphatic-like vessel in the eye.
simple_sent: Schlemm's canal is a small blood vessel in the eye.

ori_sentence: The bronchioles or bronchioli are the smaller branches of the bronchial airways in the respiratory tract.
simple_sent: The bronchioles or bronchioli are two small parts of the respiratory system. They are called bronchioli.

ori_sentence: Inert gas asphyxiation is a form of asphyxiation which results from breathing a physiologically inert gas in the absence of oxygen, or a low amount of oxygen, rather than atmospheric air (which is composed largely of nitrogen and oxygen).
simple_sent: Inert gas asphyxiation is when a person breathes in a gas without any oxygen in it. This can happen when there is not enough oxygen in the air, or when there is very little oxygen in the air.

ori_sentence: Binge eating is a pattern of disordered eating which consists of episodes of uncontrollable eating.
simple_sent: Binge eating is a pattern of eating. It is when a person wants to eat too much at one time.

ori_sentence: Organic acidemia, is a term used to classify a group of metabolic disorders which disrupt normal amino acid metabolism, particularly branched-chain amino acids, causing a buildup of acids which are usually not present.
simple_sent: Organic acidemia is a term used to describe a group of metabolic disorders. These disorders cause problems with the normal metabolism of amino acids, especially branched-chain amino acids.

ori_sentence: Neuritis (/njʊəˈraɪtɪs/) is inflammation of a nerve or the general inflammation of the peripheral nervous system.
simple_sent: Neuritis is an inflammation of the nervous system. The most common cause of neuritis is an injury to a nerve.

ori_sentence: Glossoptosis is a medical condition and abnormality which involves the downward displacement or retraction of the tongue.
simple_sent: Glossoptosis is a medical condition. It causes the tongue to move down instead of up, like a normal tongue.

ori_sentence: Ischemic colitis (also spelled ischaemic colitis) is a medical condition in which inflammation and injury of the large intestine result from inadequate blood supply.
simple_sent: Ischemic colitis (also spelled ischaemic colitis) is a disease. It happens when the blood can not get to the part of the large intestine that it should.

ori_sentence: Scheuermann's disease is a self-limiting skeletal disorder of childhood.
simple_sent: Scheuermann's disease is a childhood disease that makes people short.

ori_sentence: Sweet syndrome (SS), or acute febrile neutrophilic dermatosis, is a skin disease characterized by the sudden onset of fever, an elevated white blood cell count, and tender, red, well-demarcated papules and plaques that show dense infiltrates by neutrophil granulocytes on histologic examination.
simple_sent: Sweet syndrome (SS), also called acute febrile neutrophilic dermatosis, is a skin disease. It happens when a person has a sudden fever, a lot of white blood cells in their blood, and red, well-defined papules and plaques on the skin.

ori_sentence: Tardive dyskinesia (TD) is a disorder that results in involuntary, repetitive body movements, which may include grimacing, sticking out the tongue, or smacking the lips.
simple_sent: Tardive dyskinesia (TD) is a disorder where the body does not want to do certain things. These things can include grimacing, sticking out the tongue or smacking the lips.

ori_sentence: Libman–Sacks endocarditis (LSE) is a form of non-bacterial endocarditis that is seen in association with systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE), antiphospholipid syndrome, and malignancies.
simple_sent: Libman-Sacks endocarditis (LSE) is a form of non-bacterial endocarditis. It is usually seen in patients with systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) or other autoimmune diseases.

ori_sentence: Discitis, or diskitis, is an infection in the intervertebral disc space that affects different age groups.
simple_sent: Discitis, or diskitis, is an infection of the intervertebral disc space. It mainly affects older people.

ori_sentence: Microhematuria, also called microscopic hematuria (both usually abbreviated as MH), is a medical condition in which urine contains small amounts of blood; the blood quantity is too low to change the color of the urine (otherwise, it is known as gross hematuria).
simple_sent: Microhematuria, also called microscopic hematuria (both usually abbreviated as MH), is a medical condition where the urine has small amounts of blood in it. The color of the urine does not change because the blood does not have enough blood in it.

ori_sentence: Separation anxiety disorder (SAD) is an anxiety disorder in which an individual experiences excessive anxiety regarding separation from home and/or from people to whom the individual has a strong emotional attachment (e.g., a parent, caregiver, significant other, or siblings).
simple_sent: Separation anxiety disorder (SAD) is an anxiety disorder. People with SAD have a lot of anxiety about being away from home and/or from people with whom they have a strong emotional connection (for example, a parent, a significant other, or a sibling).

ori_sentence: An arteriole is a small-diameter blood vessel in the microcirculation that extends and branches out from an artery and leads to capillaries.
simple_sent: An arteriole is a small blood vessel. It is made of thin blood cells and it goes from the heart to the outside of the body.

ori_sentence: Sorbitan monooleate is a food additive with the E number E494.
simple_sent: Sorbitan monooleate is a chemical compound. It has the number E494.

ori_sentence: Frontal fibrosing alopecia is the frontotemporal hairline recession and eyebrow loss in postmenopausal women that is associated with perifollicular erythema, especially along the hairline.

ori_sentence: Zalcitabine (2′-3′-dideoxycytidine, ddC), also called dideoxycytidine, is a nucleoside analog reverse-transcriptase inhibitor (NRTI) sold under the trade name Hivid.
simple_sent: Zalcitabine (also known as ddC) is a nucleoside analog reverse-transcriptase inhibitor (NRTI). It is sold under the trade name Hivid.

ori_sentence: Dysphoria (from Greek: δύσφορος (dysphoros), δυσ-, difficult and φέρειν, to bear) is a profound state of unease or dissatisfaction.
simple_sent: Dysphoria (from Greek: Î Î Î Î Î Î, Dysphoros, difficult to bear) is a state of unease or dissatisfaction (not being happy).

ori_sentence: Staining is a technique used to enhance contrast in samples, generally at the microscopic level.
simple_sent: Staining is a way to make samples look better. It is usually done at the microscopic level.

ori_sentence: Expressive aphasia, also known as Broca's aphasia, is a type of aphasia characterized by partial loss of the ability to produce language (spoken, manual, or written), although comprehension generally remains intact.
simple_sent: Expressive aphasia, also known as Broca's aphasia, is a type of aphasia. In this case, the person can not speak (spoken, written), but they can write their names and numbers.

ori_sentence: SAPHO syndrome includes a variety of inflammatory bone disorders that may be associated with skin changes.
simple_sent: SAPHO syndrome includes many different bone disorders. Some of them can be caused by skin changes.

ori_sentence: The parahippocampal gyrus (or hippocampal gyrus) is a grey matter cortical region of the brain that surrounds the hippocampus and is part of the limbic system.
simple_sent: The parahippocampal gyrus (or hippocampal gyrus) is a part of the brain. It is located in the middle part of the brain, near the hippocampus.

ori_sentence: Beta-mannosidosis, also called lysosomal beta-mannosidase deficiency, is a disorder of oligosaccharide metabolism caused by decreased activity of the enzyme beta-mannosidase.
simple_sent: Beta-mannosidosis, also called lysosomal beta-mannosidase deficiency, is a disease. It happens when an enzyme called beta-mannosidase is not working properly.

ori_sentence: Piebaldism refers to the absence of mature melanin-forming cells (melanocytes) in certain areas of the skin and hair.
simple_sent: Piebaldism is when there are not enough melanin cells. This happens in certain areas of the skin and hair.

ori_sentence: In genetics, a nonsense mutation is a point mutation in a sequence of DNA that results in a premature stop codon, or a nonsense codon in the transcribed mRNA, and in a truncated, incomplete, and usually nonfunctional protein product.
simple_sent: In genetics, a nonsense mutation is a point mutation in a sequence of DNA. When this happens, a piece of DNA called a stop codon will stop working properly. This results in a truncated, incomplete protein product.

ori_sentence: Acute septic arthritis, infectious arthritis, suppurative arthritis, osteomyelitis, or joint infection is the invasion of a joint by an infectious agent resulting in joint inflammation.
simple_sent: Acute septic arthritis is when an infectious agent (such as bacteria or viruses) goes into a joint and causes inflammation. It is also called suppurative arthritis.

ori_sentence: Hydromorphone, also known as dihydromorphinone, and sold under the brand name Dilaudid among others, is an opioid used to treat moderate to severe pain.
simple_sent: Hydromorphone (also known as dihydromorphinone) is a drug that is used to treat pain. It is sold under the brand name Dilaudid.

ori_sentence: Tetany or tetanic seizure is a medical sign consisting of the involuntary contraction of muscles, which may be caused by disorders that increase the action potential frequency of muscle cells or the nerves that innervate them.
simple_sent: Tetany or tetanic seizure is a medical sign that means the muscles in the body are not working properly. It can be caused by many things, but the most common thing is an increase in the number of nerve impulses.

ori_sentence: Mefenamic acid is a member of the anthranilic acid derivatives (or fenamate) class of nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs), and is used to treat mild to moderate pain.
simple_sent: Mefenamic acid (also known as fenamate) is a chemical compound. It is a type of nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAIDs), and is used to treat pain.

ori_sentence: Psoriatic arthritis is a long-term inflammatory arthritis that occurs in people affected by the autoimmune disease psoriasis.
simple_sent: Psoriatic arthritis is a long-term disease that causes inflammation in the joints. People who have it have psoriasis.

ori_sentence: Eosinophilic fasciitis (/ˌiːəˌsɪnəˈfɪlɪk ˌfæʃiˈaɪtɪs, ˌiːoʊ-, -ˌfæsi-/), also known as Shulman's syndrome, is an inflammatory disease that affects the fascia, other connective tissues, surrounding muscles, blood vessels and nerves.
simple_sent: Eosinophilic fasciitis, also known as Shulman's syndrome, is an inflammatory disease of the fascia. It can also affect the surrounding muscles, blood vessels and nerves.

ori_sentence: De Quervain syndrome is inflammation of two tendons that control movement of the thumb and their tendon sheath.
simple_sent: De Quervain syndrome is an inflammation of the thumb. The two tendons that control movement are involved.

ori_sentence: Dactylitis or sausage digit is inflammation of an entire digit (a finger or toe), and can be painful.
simple_sent: Dactylitis or dactylitis is an infection of the finger or toe. It can be very painful.

ori_sentence: Krabbe disease (KD) (also known as globoid cell leukodystrophy or galactosylceramide lipidosis) is a rare and often fatal lysosomal storage disease that results in progressive damage to the nervous system.
simple_sent: Krabbe disease (also known as globoid cell leukodystrophy or galactosylceramide lipidosis) is a disease that happens to very few people. It causes damage to the nervous system.

ori_sentence: Androgen insensitivity syndrome (AIS) is a disorder of sex development involving hormonal resistance due to androgen receptor dysfunction.
simple_sent: Androgen insensitivity syndrome (AIS) is a disease. It happens when a person's sex development is affected by androgen receptors.

ori_sentence: The coeliac (/ˈsiːli.æk/) artery, also known as the coeliac trunk, or truncus coeliacus, is the first major branch of the abdominal aorta.
simple_sent: The coeliac artery is an important part of the aorta. It is also called the coeliac trunk, or truncus coeliacus.

ori_sentence: Aagenaes syndrome is a syndrome characterised by congenital hypoplasia of lymph vessels, which causes lymphedema of the legs and recurrent cholestasis in infancy, and slow progress to hepatic cirrhosis and giant cell hepatitis with fibrosis of the portal tracts.
simple_sent: Aagenaes syndrome is a syndrome in which the child has a defect in lymph vessels. This causes lymphedema of the legs and cholestasis in infancy. As the child grows, this condition gets worse and becomes hepatic cirrhosis.

ori_sentence: Abacavir, sold under the brand name Ziagen, is a medication used to prevent and treat HIV/AIDS.
simple_sent: Abacavir (also known as Ziagen) is a drug. It is used to treat or prevent HIV/AIDS.

ori_sentence: Fluocinolone acetonide is a corticosteroid primarily used in dermatology to reduce skin inflammation and relieve itching.
simple_sent: Fluocinolone acetonide is a corticosteroid. It is used to reduce itching and inflammation of the skin.

ori_sentence: Oxybenzone or benzophenone-3 or BP-3 (trade names
simple_sent: Oxybenzone is a chemical compound.

ori_sentence: Myiasis is the parasitic infestation of the body of a live animal by fly larvae (maggots) which grow inside the host while feeding on its tissue.
simple_sent: Myiasis is a disease. It is when fly larvae (maggots) grow inside the body of an animal and cause problems for the animal.

ori_sentence: Naloxone, sold under the brand name Narcan among others, is a medication used to block the effects of opioids.
simple_sent: Naloxone, also known as Narcan, is a drug. It is used to help people stop the effects of opioids.

ori_sentence: Propylparaben, the n-propyl ester of p-hydroxybenzoic acid, occurs as a natural substance found in many plants and some insects, although it is manufactured synthetically for use in cosmetics, pharmaceuticals, and foods.
simple_sent: Propylparaben, the n-propyl ester of p-hydroxybenzoic acid, is a natural substance that is found in many plants. It is used in some foods, as well as in some pharmaceuticals and cosmetics.

ori_sentence: Irritant diaper dermatitis (IDD, also called a diaper rash) is a generic term applied to skin rashes in the diaper area that are caused by various skin disorders and/or irritants.
simple_sent: Irritant diaper dermatitis (IDD, also called a diaper rash) is a condition of the skin. It is usually caused by something in the baby's diaper that irritates the skin.

ori_sentence: Urethral meatal stenosis is a narrowing (stenosis) of the opening of the urethra at the external meatus /miːˈeɪtəs/, thus constricting the opening through which urine leaves the body from the urinary bladder.
simple_sent: Urethral meatal stenosis is a condition in which the opening of the urethra at the outside of the body of the body becomes smaller. This makes it harder for urine to leave the body.

ori_sentence: The fibula or calf bone is a leg bone on the lateral side of the tibia, to which it is connected above and below.
simple_sent: The fibula is the lower leg bone in the human body. It is located on the left side of the tibia.

ori_sentence: Cefoperazone is a third-generation cephalosporin antibiotic, marketed by Pfizer under the name Cefobid.
simple_sent: Cefoperazone is a third-generation cephalosporin antibiotic. It is manufactured by Pfizer.

ori_sentence: Macroglossia is the medical term for an unusually large tongue.
simple_sent: Macroglossia is when a person's tongue is very large.

ori_sentence: Ichthyosis is a family of genetic skin disorders characterized by dry, thickened, scaly skin.
simple_sent: Ichthyosis is a family of skin disorders. People with Ichthyosis have dry, scaly skin.

ori_sentence: Sinus tachycardia (also colloquially known as sinus tach or sinus tachy) is an elevated sinus rhythm characterized by an increase in the rate of electrical impulses arising from the sinoatrial node.
simple_sent: Sinus tachycardia (also called sinus tach or sinus tachy) is when the heart rate is higher than normal. It is caused by an increase in electrical impulses coming from the sinoatrial node.

ori_sentence: The Kocher–Debré–Semelaigne syndrome is hypothyroidism in infancy or childhood characterised by lower extremity or generalized muscular hypertrophy, myxoedema, short stature and cretinism.
simple_sent: The Kocher-Debré-Semelaigne syndrome (Kocher-Debré-Semelaigne syndrome) is when a person is young and has hypothyroidism. They have lower extremity or muscular hypertrophy.

ori_sentence: Neuromyotonia (NMT) is a form of peripheral nerve hyperexcitability that causes spontaneous muscular activity resulting from repetitive motor unit action potentials of peripheral origin.
simple_sent: Neuromyotonia (NMT) is a form of peripheral nerve hyperexcitability. It is caused by repetitive action potentials of the peripheral nervous system.

ori_sentence: Polycythemia (also known as polycythaemia or polyglobulia) is a disease state in which the hematocrit (the volume percentage of red blood cells in the blood)
simple_sent: Polycythemia (also known as polycythaemia or polyglobulia) is a disease where the red blood cells in the blood are too small.

ori_sentence: Polysyndactyly is an hereditary anatomical malformation combining polydactyly and syndactyly.
simple_sent: Polysyndactyly is a malformation of the body. It is also called polydactyly or syndactyly.

ori_sentence: The adrenal medulla (Latin: medulla glandulae suprarenalis) is part of the adrenal gland.
simple_sent: The adrenal medulla is a part of the adrenal glands. It is found in the brain.

ori_sentence: A craniotomy is a surgical operation in which a bone flap is temporarily removed from the skull to access the brain.
simple_sent: A craniotomy is a special surgery. During the surgery, a bone flap is taken away from the skull.

ori_sentence: Supraventricular tachycardia (SVT) is an umbrella term for fast heart rhythms arising from the upper part of the heart.
simple_sent: Supraventricular tachycardia (SVT) is a fast heart beat. It usually happens in the upper part of the heart.

ori_sentence: Reflux nephropathy is kidney damage (nephropathy) due to urine flowing backward (reflux) from the bladder toward the kidneys; the latter is called vesicoureteral reflux (VUR).
simple_sent: Reflux nephropathy is kidney damage (nephropathy) that happens when urine from the bladder goes back into the kidneys. This is called vesicoureteral reflux (VUR).

ori_sentence: The internal carotid artery (Latin: arteria carotis interna) is located in the inner side of the neck in contrast to the external carotid artery.
simple_sent: The carotid artery is a blood vessel in the neck. The carotid artery carries blood to the brain and is a very important part of life.

ori_sentence: Post-transplant lymphoproliferative disorder (PTLD) is the name given to a B-cell proliferation due to therapeutic immunosuppression after organ transplantation.
simple_sent: Post-transplant lymphoproliferative disorder (PTLD) is when B-cell numbers go down because the body does not get the new blood cells it needs.

ori_sentence: Erythromelalgia or Mitchell's disease (after Silas Weir Mitchell), is a rare vascular peripheral pain disorder in which blood vessels, usually in the lower extremities or hands, are episodically blocked (frequently on and off daily), then become hyperemic and inflamed.
simple_sent: Erythromelalgia or Mitchell's disease is a rare pain disorder. It happens when blood vessels in the lower extremities, usually in the hands or feet, become blocked for a short time every day, then become hyperemic and inflamed.

ori_sentence: β-Carotene is an organic, strongly coloured red-orange pigment abundant in fungi, plants, and fruits.
simple_sent: Carotene is a strong red-orange pigment. It can be found in many different plants and animals.

ori_sentence: Self-neglect is a behavioral condition in which an individual neglects to attend to their basic needs, such as personal hygiene, appropriate clothing, feeding, or tending appropriately to any medical conditions they have.
simple_sent: Self-neglect is when a person does not take care of themselves. This can include things like personal hygiene, proper clothing, feeding, or taking care of any medical conditions they have.

ori_sentence: A pseudohallucination (from Ancient Greek: ψευδής (pseudḗs)
simple_sent: The word pseudohallucination comes from the Greek word pseudos.

ori_sentence: Abarelix, sold under the brand name Plenaxis, is an injectable gonadotropin-releasing hormone antagonist (GnRH antagonist) which is marketed in Germany and the Netherlands.
simple_sent: Abarelix (also known as Plenaxis) is an injectable drug. It works by blocking the hormone gonadotropin-releasing hormone (GnRH).

ori_sentence: Cushing reflex (also referred to as the vasopressor response, the Cushing effect, the Cushing reaction, the Cushing phenomenon, the Cushing response, or Cushing's Law) is a physiological nervous system response to increased intracranial pressure (ICP) that results in Cushing's triad of increased blood pressure, irregular breathing, and bradycardia.
simple_sent: The Cushing reflex (also called the Cushing effect, the Cushing reaction, the Cushing phenomenon, the Cushing response, or Cushing's Law) is a reflex in the nervous system. When there is an increase in blood pressure, the body makes a reflex to lower its blood pressure.

ori_sentence: Anisocoria is a condition characterized by an unequal size of the eyes' pupils.
simple_sent: Anisocoria is a condition. In it, the eyes' pupils are not the same size.

ori_sentence: Heparin-induced thrombocytopenia (HIT) is the development of thrombocytopenia (a low platelet count), due to the administration of various forms of heparin, an anticoagulant.
simple_sent: Heparin-induced thrombocytopenia (HIT) is the development of thrombocytopenia (a low platelet count) when people take heparin for too long.

ori_sentence: Strongyloidiasis is a human parasitic disease caused by the nematode called Strongyloides stercoralis, or sometimes the closely related S. fülleborni.
simple_sent: Strongyloidiasis is a disease in humans. It is caused by a nematode called Strongyloides stercoralis, or sometimes S. fülleborni.

ori_sentence: Cutaneous larva migrans (abbreviated CLM) is a skin disease in humans, caused by the larvae of various nematode parasites of the hookworm family (Ancylostomatidae).
simple_sent: Cutaneous larva migrans (abbreviated CLM) is a skin disease in humans. The disease is caused by the larvae of many different kinds of parasites.

ori_sentence: Prochlorperazine, formerly sold under the brand name Compazine among others, is a medication used to treat nausea, schizophrenia, migraines, and anxiety.
simple_sent: Prochlorperazine (also known as Compazine) is a drug that is used to treat nausea. It is also used to treat migraines and anxiety.

ori_sentence: Palinopsia (Greek: palin for "again" and opsia for "seeing") is the persistent recurrence of a visual image after the stimulus has been removed.
simple_sent: Palinopsia (Greek: palin for "again" and opsia for "seeing") is when an image appears again after a stimulus has been removed.

ori_sentence: Short bones are designated as those bones that are as wide as they are long.
simple_sent: Short bones are as wide as they are long, and long bones are longer.

ori_sentence: The tympanic cavity is a small cavity surrounding the bones of the middle ear.
simple_sent: The tympanic cavity is a small space in the middle ear. It is very small.

ori_sentence: Multiple endocrine neoplasia (abbreviated MEN) is a condition which encompasses several distinct syndromes featuring tumors of endocrine glands, each with its own characteristic pattern.
simple_sent: Multiple endocrine neoplasia (abbreviated MEN) is a condition in which many different types of tumors occur in the endocrine glands. Each tumor has a different pattern.

ori_sentence: Hemoglobinuria is a condition in which the oxygen transport protein hemoglobin is found in abnormally high concentrations in the urine.
simple_sent: Hemoglobinuria is when the hemoglobin in the urine is too high. This means that there is too much hemoglobin in the urine.

ori_sentence: Cholic acid, also known as 3α,7α,12α
simple_sent: Cholic acid is a chemical compound.

ori_sentence: Osteonecrosis of the jaw (ONJ) is a severe bone disease (osteonecrosis) that affects the jaws (the maxilla and the mandible).
simple_sent: Osteonecrosis of the jaw (ONJ) is a disease of the bones. It mainly affects the teeth and the bones of the jaw.

ori_sentence: Ineffective erythropoiesis is active erythropoiesis with premature death of red blood cells, a decreased output of RBCs from the bone marrow, and, consequently, anemia.
simple_sent: In poor erythropoiesis, red blood cells die before they reach the bone marrow. This causes anemia (not having enough red blood cells) and sometimes even death.

ori_sentence: In medicine, hepatopulmonary syndrome is a syndrome of shortness of breath and hypoxemia (low oxygen levels in the blood of the arteries) caused by vasodilation (broadening of the blood vessels) in the lungs of patients with liver disease.
simple_sent: Hepatopulmonary syndrome (HPS) is a disease where people with liver disease get shortness of breath and have low oxygen levels in their blood. This is because the blood vessels in the lungs are too narrow.

ori_sentence: Pyelonephritis is inflammation of the kidney, typically due to a bacterial infection.
simple_sent: Pyelonephritis is an infection of the kidney. Usually, it is a bacterial infection.

ori_sentence: Oxybuprocaine (INN), also known as benoxinate or BNX, is an ester-type local anesthetic, which is used especially in ophthalmology and otolaryngology.
simple_sent: Oxybuprocaine (also known as benoxinate or BNX) is a local anesthetic. It is used to help people who are very sick.

ori_sentence: Orthokeratology (also referred to as Night lenses, Ortho-K, OK, Overnight Vision Correction, Corneal Refractive Therapy (CRT), Accelerated Orthokeretology, Cornea Corrective Contacts, Eccentricity Zero Molding and Gentle Vision Shaping System (GVSS)) refers to the use of gas-permeable contact lenses that temporarily reshape the cornea to reduce refractive errors such as myopia, hyperopia and astigmatism.
simple_sent: Orthokeratology (also referred to as Night lenses, Ortho-K, OK, Overnight Vision Correction, Corneal Refractive Therapy (CRT), Accelerated Orthokeretology, Eccentricity Zero Molding and Gentle Vision Shaping System (GVSS)) is a type of eye care that uses gas-permeable contact lenses to temporarily reshape the cornea to reduce refractive errors such as myopia, hyperopia and astigmatism.

ori_sentence: Sulconazole (trade name Exelderm) is an antifungal medication of the imidazole class.
simple_sent: Sulconazole is an antifungal drug. It is also known by its trade name Exelderm.

ori_sentence: Isotretinoin, also known as 13-cis-retinoic acid and sold under the brand name Accutane among others, is a medication primarily used to treat severe acne.
simple_sent: Isotretinoin (also known as 13-cis-retinoic acid) is a chemical compound. It is used to treat acne. It is sold under the name Accutane.

ori_sentence: Vitreous hemorrhage is the extravasation, or leakage, of blood into the areas in and around the vitreous humor of the eye.
simple_sent: Vitreous hemorrhage is when blood flows into the eye. It usually happens in the areas around the vitreous humor.

ori_sentence: Saber shin is a malformation of the tibia.
simple_sent: Saber shin is a type of shin bone.

ori_sentence: Paraphasia is a type of language output error commonly associated with aphasia, and characterized by the production of unintended syllables, words, or phrases during the effort to speak.
simple_sent: Paraphasia is a sign of aphasia. It means that when a person tries to speak, they make unintended syllables, words, or phrases when they are trying to speak.

ori_sentence: Trifluridine (also called trifluorothymidine; abbreviation TFT or FTD) is an anti-herpesvirus antiviral drug, used primarily on the eye.
simple_sent: Trifluridine (also called trifluorothymidine, TFT or FTD) is a drug. It is used to treat eye disease and other diseases.

ori_sentence: Aphonia is defined as the inability to produce voiced sound.
simple_sent: Aphonia is when there is no sound at all.

ori_sentence: A tree nut allergy is a hypersensitivity to dietary substances from tree nuts and edible tree seeds causing an overreaction of the immune system which may lead to severe physical symptoms.
simple_sent: A tree nut allergy is an allergy to tree nuts. When people eat tree nuts, their immune system gets worked up. This can cause them to have bad physical symptoms.

ori_sentence: Anabolic steroids, also known more properly as anabolic–androgenic steroids (AAS), are steroidal androgens that include natural androgens like testosterone as well as synthetic androgens that are structurally related and have similar effects to testosterone.
simple_sent: Anabolic steroids, also known more properly as anabolic-androgenic steroids (AAS), are steroidal androgens that work the same way as testosterone. They work the same way as testosterone, but they work a different way.

ori_sentence: Blind loop syndrome (BLS), also known as stagnant loop syndrome, is a state that occurs when the normal bacterial flora of the small intestine proliferates to numbers that cause significant derangement to the normal physiological processes of digestion and absorption.
simple_sent: Blind loop syndrome (BLS), also known as stagnant loop syndrome, is a condition in which the normal amount of bacteria in the small intestine becomes very high. This causes problems with the normal digestion and absorption of food.

ori_sentence: A hairball is a small collection of hair or fur formed in the stomach of animals, and uncommonly in humans, that is occasionally vomited up when it becomes too big.
simple_sent: A hairball is a small ball of hair or fur that is made in the stomach of an animal. It is sometimes thrown up by humans when it becomes too big.

ori_sentence: Thin basement membrane disease (TBMD, also known as benign familial hematuria and thin basement membrane nephropathy or TBMN) is, along with IgA nephropathy, the most common cause of hematuria without other symptoms.
simple_sent: Thin basement membrane disease (TBMD) is the most common cause of hematuria without other symptoms. It is also known as benign familial hematuria and thin basement membrane nephropathy or TBMN.

ori_sentence: Hypoplasia (from Ancient Greek ὑπo- hypo- 'under' + πλάσις plasis 'formation'; adjective form hypoplastic) is underdevelopment or incomplete development of a tissue or organ.
simple_sent: Hypoplasia (from Ancient Greek) is a condition where a tissue or organ does not develop properly. It is also called hypoplastic.

ori_sentence: Genu valgum, commonly called "knock-knee", is a condition in which the knees angle in and touch each other when the legs are straightened.
simple_sent: Genu valgum (also called knock-knee) is a condition. When the legs are straightened, the knees come in contact with each other.

ori_sentence: Thrombophilia (sometimes called hypercoagulability or a prothrombotic state) is an abnormality of blood coagulation that increases the risk of thrombosis (blood clots in blood vessels).
simple_sent: Thrombophilia (sometimes called hypercoagulability or a prothrombotic state) is when the blood does not clot as well as it should. This makes the risk of thrombosis higher.

ori_sentence: Aase syndrome or Aase–Smith syndrome is a rare inherited disorder characterized by anemia with some joint and skeletal deformities.
simple_sent: Aase syndrome or Aase-Smith syndrome is a rare disease. People who have it will have some deformities in their bones.

ori_sentence: Hallux varus is a deformity of the great toe joint where the hallux (great toe) is deviated medially (towards the midline of the body) away from the first metatarsal bone.
simple_sent: Hallux varus is a problem with the great toe. In this condition, the hallux (great toe) of the human body is moved away from the first metatarsal bone.

ori_sentence: Flat bones are bones whose principal function is either extensive protection or the provision of broad surfaces for muscular attachment.
simple_sent: Flat bones are bones whose main function is to provide protection. They also provide a wide surface for muscles to be attached to.

ori_sentence: Chlorcyclizine (Di-Paralene, Mantadil, Pruresidine, Trihistan) is a first-generation antihistamine of the diphenylmethylpiperazine group marketed in the United States and certain other countries.
simple_sent: Chlorcyclizine (Di-Paralene, Mantadil, Pruresidine, Trihistan) is a first-generation antihistamine. It is sold in the United States and some other countries under the name Chloroform.

ori_sentence: Syringomas are benign eccrine sweat duct tumors, typically found clustered on eyelids, although they may also be found in the armpits, abdomen, chest, neck, scalp, or groin area, including genitals, in a symmetric pattern.
simple_sent: Syringomas are usually found on the eyelids, but they may also be found in the armpits, abdomen, chest, neck, scalp, or groin area. They usually appear in a symmetric pattern.

ori_sentence: The sinoatrial node (also known as the sinuatrial node, SA node or sinus node) is a group of cells known as pacemaker cells, located in the wall of the right atrium of the heart.
simple_sent: The sinoatrial node (also known as the sinuatrial node, SA node or sinus node) is a part of the heart. The cells that make up the sinoatrial node are called pacemaker cells.

ori_sentence: Pantoprazole, sold under the brand name Protonix, among others, is a medication used for the treatment of stomach ulcers, short-term treatment of erosive esophagitis due to gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD), maintenance of healing of erosive esophagitis, and pathological hypersecretory conditions including Zollinger–Ellison syndrome.
simple_sent: Pantoprazole, sold under the brand name Protonix, among others, is a medication that is used to treat stomach ulcers, maintenance of healing of erosive esophagitis, and pathological hypersecretory conditions including Zollinger-Ellison syndrome. It is also used to treat gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD).

ori_sentence: Acneiform eruptions are a group of dermatoses including acne vulgaris, rosacea, folliculitis, and perioral dermatitis.
simple_sent: These include acne vulgaris, rosacea, folliculitis, and perioral dermatitis (inflammation of the skin).

ori_sentence: The pulmonary valve (sometimes referred to as the pulmonic valve) is a valve of the heart that lies between the right ventricle and the pulmonary artery and has three cusps.
simple_sent: The pulmonary valve is a valve of the heart. It is located between the right ventricle and the pulmonary artery. The pulmonary valve has three cusps.

ori_sentence: Ollier disease is a rare sporadic nonhereditary skeletal disorder in which typically benign cartilaginous tumors (enchondromas) develop near the growth plate cartilage.
simple_sent: Ollier disease is a rare disorder of the bones. In this disease, small, benign tumors (calledenchondromas) grow near the growth plate cartilage.

ori_sentence: Hemifacial spasm (HFS) is a rare neuromuscular disease characterized by irregular, involuntary muscle contractions (spasms) on one side (hemi-) of the face (-facial).
simple_sent: Hemifacial spasm (HFS) is a rare disease. It is caused by muscle contractions on one side of the face (the face) that are not controlled by the body.

ori_sentence: Microphthalmia (Greek: μικρός mikros = small; ὀφθαλμός
simple_sent: Microphthalmia is a condition that is small.

ori_sentence: Encainide (trade name Enkaid) is a class Ic antiarrhythmic agent.
simple_sent: Encainide is an antiarrhythmic drug. It is also called Enkaid.

ori_sentence: Paratonia is the inability to relax muscles during muscle tone assessment.
simple_sent: Paratonia is when muscles are not relaxed during muscle tone tests.

ori_sentence: Clostridial necrotizing enteritis (CNE) is a severe and potentially fatal type of food poisoning caused by a β-toxin of Clostridium perfringens,
simple_sent: Clostridial necrotizing enteritis (CNE) is a disease. It is caused by a bacterium, Clostridium perfringens, and can be very dangerous.

ori_sentence: Hematemesis is the vomiting of blood.
simple_sent: Hematemesis is when blood is lost.

ori_sentence: Vulvodynia is a chronic pain syndrome that affects the vulvar area and occurs without an identifiable cause.
simple_sent: Vulvodynia is a chronic pain syndrome. It usually happens for a long time and has no known cause.

ori_sentence: The pubic symphysis is a secondary cartilaginous joint between the left and right superior rami of the pubis of the hip bones.
simple_sent: The pubic symphysis is a cartilaginous joint in the hip bone. It is between the left and right hip bones.

ori_sentence: Wernicke encephalopathy (WE), also Wernicke's encephalopathy, is the presence of neurological symptoms caused by of the central nervous system after exhaustion of B-vitamin reserves, in particular thiamine (vitamin B1).
simple_sent: Wernicke's encephalopathy (also known as Wernicke's encephalopathy) is a disease. It is caused by the central nervous system not getting enough thiamine, the main vitamin B1, from food.

ori_sentence: Nattō (納豆) is a traditional Japanese food made from soybeans that have been fermented with Bacillus subtilis var.
simple_sent: Nattō is a traditional Japanese food. It is made from soybeans, and it is usually served with a dipping sauce.

ori_sentence: Magnesium sulfate or magnesium sulphate (in British English) is a chemical compound, a salt with the formula MgSO4, consisting of magnesium cations
simple_sent: Magnesium sulfate is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is MgSO4. It has magnesium and sulfate ions in it.

ori_sentence: A symblepharon is a partial or complete adhesion of the palpebral conjunctiva of the eyelid to the bulbar conjunctiva of the eyeball.
simple_sent: A symblepharon is an adhesion between the eyelid and the bulbar conjunctiva of the eyeball. This is called a partial adhesion.

ori_sentence: Gliosis is a nonspecific reactive change of glial cells in response to damage to the central nervous system (CNS).
simple_sent: Gliosis is when glial cells change because of damage to the central nervous system (CNS).

ori_sentence: An oropharyngeal airway (also known as an oral airway, OPA or Guedel pattern airway) is a medical device called an airway adjunct used to maintain or open a patient's airway.
simple_sent: An oropharyngeal airway (also known as an oral airway, OPA or Guedel pattern airway) is an airway that is usually not easily accessible by the human body.

ori_sentence: Bimatoprost, sold under the brand name Lumigan among others, is a medication used to treat high pressure inside the eye including glaucoma.
simple_sent: Bimatoprost (also known as Lumigan) is a medication. It is used to treat glaucoma and high pressure in the eye.

ori_sentence: The posterior auricular muscle is a muscle behind the auricle of the outer ear.
simple_sent: The posterior auricular muscle is a small muscle. It is behind the outer ear.

ori_sentence: Carotid artery stenosis is a narrowing or constriction of any part of the carotid arteries, usually caused by atherosclerosis.
simple_sent: Carotid artery stenosis is when the carotid arteries become smaller. This is usually caused by atherosclerosis.

ori_sentence: Hypoaldosteronism is an endocrinological disorder characterized by decreased levels of the hormone aldosterone.
simple_sent: Hypoaldosteronism is an endocrinological disorder. It happens when the aldosterone level is low.

ori_sentence: Synchysis scintillans is a degenerative condition of the eye resulting in liquefied vitreous humor and the accumulation of cholesterol crystals within the vitreous.
simple_sent: Synchysis scintillans is a degenerative condition of the eye. It causes the vitreous humor to become hard and thick, and cholesterol to build up.

ori_sentence: Alkalosis is the result of a process reducing hydrogen ion concentration of arterial blood plasma (alkalemia).
simple_sent: Alkalosis is a disease. It happens when the hydrogen ion concentration in the blood becomes too low.

ori_sentence: Bronchophony is the abnormal transmission of sounds from the lungs or bronchi.
simple_sent: Bronchophony is when sounds come out of the lungs in a different way.

ori_sentence: Trimethylaminuria (TMAU), also known as fish odor syndrome or fish malodor syndrome, is a rare metabolic disorder that causes a defect in the normal production of an enzyme named flavin-containing monooxygenase 3 (FMO3).
simple_sent: Trimethylaminuria (TMAU), also known as fish odor syndrome or fish malodor syndrome, is a disease. It happens when an enzyme called FMO3, which normally makes flavin, does not work properly.

ori_sentence: Zafirlukast is an orally administered leukotriene receptor antagonist (LTRA) used for the chronic treatment of asthma.
simple_sent: Zafirlukast is an anti-leukotriene (LTRA) drug. It is used to treat asthma and other respiratory diseases.

ori_sentence: Trismus, commonly called lockjaw, is reduced opening of the jaws (limited jaw range of motion).
simple_sent: Trismus, or lockjaw, is a reduced opening of the jaws. This is called a limited jaw.

ori_sentence: A fascia (/ˈfæʃ(i)ə/; plural fasciae /ˈfæʃii/; adjective fascial; from Latin: "band") is a band or sheet of connective tissue, primarily collagen, beneath the skin that attaches to, stabilizes, encloses, and separates muscles and other internal organs.
simple_sent: A fascia (from Latin: "band") is a band or sheet of connective tissue under the skin. It helps to keep the skin together, and it also helps to keep muscles and other internal organs together.

ori_sentence: The interventricular septum (IVS, or ventricular septum, or during development septum inferius) is the stout wall separating the ventricles, the lower chambers of the heart, from one another.
simple_sent: The interventricular septum (IVS) is the wall between the two chambers of the heart. The interventricular septum separates the left and right ventricles.

ori_sentence: Neurapraxia is a disorder of the peripheral nervous system in which there is a temporary loss of motor and sensory function due to blockage of nerve conduction, usually lasting an average of six to eight weeks before full recovery.
simple_sent: Neurapraxia is a disease of the peripheral nervous system. It causes a short-term loss of motor and sensory function. It usually takes about six to eight weeks for the person to get better after Neurapraxia.

ori_sentence: Sheehan's syndrome, also known as postpartum pituitary gland necrosis, is hypopituitarism (decreased functioning of the pituitary gland), caused by ischemic necrosis due to blood loss and hypovolemic shock during and after childbirth.
simple_sent: Sheehan's syndrome, also known as postpartum pituitary gland necrosis, is a condition where the pituitary gland does not work as well because of blood loss. This can happen after childbirth.

ori_sentence: Sycosis is an inflammation of hair follicles, especially of the beard area, and generally classified as papulopustular and chronic.
simple_sent: Sycosis is an inflammation of the hair follicles. Usually, it is found in the beard area, but it can be in other areas.

ori_sentence: The perineurium is a protective sheath that surrounds a nerve fascicle.
simple_sent: The perineurium surrounds the nerve fascicle to protect it.

ori_sentence: Aleutian disease, also known as mink plasmacytosis, is a disease which causes spontaneous abortion and death in minks and ferrets.
simple_sent: Aleutian disease, also known as mink plasmacytosis, is a disease. Minks and ferrets get the disease and they die.

ori_sentence: Choroideremia (/kɒˌrɔɪdɪˈriːmiə/; CHM) is a rare, X-linked recessive form of hereditary retinal degeneration that affects roughly 1 in 50,000 males.
simple_sent: Choroideremia is a rare form of retinal degeneration. About 1 in 50,000 males in the world have the condition, and it can be very dangerous.

ori_sentence: Barium sulfate (or sulphate) is the inorganic compound with the chemical formula BaSO4.
simple_sent: Barium sulfate is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is BaSO4.

ori_sentence: Angelman syndrome or Angelman's syndrome (AS) is a genetic disorder that mainly affects the nervous system.
simple_sent: Angelman syndrome or Angelman's syndrome is a disease. People with Angelman syndrome have many problems.

ori_sentence: In anatomy, the Eustachian tube, also known as the auditory tube or pharyngotympanic tube, is a tube that links the nasopharynx to the middle ear, of which it is also a part.
simple_sent: The Eustachian tube is a tube in the human body. It connects the nasopharynx to the middle ear. It is also called the auditory tube or pharyngotympanic tube.

ori_sentence: Anxiety disorders are a cluster of mental disorders characterized by significant and uncontrollable feelings of anxiety and fear such that a person's social, occupational, and personal function are significantly impaired.
simple_sent: Anxiety disorders are a group of mental disorders. People with anxiety disorders have bad, uncontrollable feelings of anxiety and fear. These feelings make it hard for them to function properly.

ori_sentence: The ischium ( /ˈɪskiəm/) forms the lower and back part of the hip bone (os coxae).
simple_sent: The ischium bone is the lower part of the hip bone. It is called the hip bone.

ori_sentence: Canavan disease, or Canavan-Van Bogaert-Bertrand disease, is a rare and fatal autosomal recessive degenerative disorder that causes progressive damage to nerve cells and loss of white matter in the brain.
simple_sent: Canavan disease, also called Canavan-Van Bogaert-Bertrand disease, is a rare disease. It causes damage to nerve cells in the brain. People who have the disease die very quickly.

ori_sentence: A tensilon test, also called a edrophonium test, is a pharmacological test used for the diagnosis of certain neural diseases, especially myasthenia gravis.
simple_sent: A tensilon test, also called an edrophonium test, is a test to see if a person has a disease called myasthenia gravis.

ori_sentence: Anhedonia is a diverse array of deficits in hedonic function, including reduced motivation or ability to experience pleasure.
simple_sent: Anhedonia can cause many different problems. It can also mean that you are less likely to experience pleasure.

ori_sentence: A bicornuate uterus or bicornate uterus (from the Latin cornū, meaning "horn"), is a type of mullerian anomaly in the human uterus, where there is a deep indentation at the fundus (top) of the uterus.
simple_sent: A bicornuate uterus or bicornate uterus (from the Latin cornū, meaning "horn") is a condition in which the top part of the uterus (called the fundus) is not level with the floor.

ori_sentence: The metatarsal bones, or metatarsus, are a group of five long bones in the foot, located between the tarsal bones of the hind- and mid-foot and the phalanges of the toes.
simple_sent: The metatarsal bones are five long bones in the foot. They are located between the toes and between the tarsal bones. They are the longest bones in the foot.

ori_sentence: The ascending aorta (AAo) is a portion of the aorta commencing at the upper part of the base of the left ventricle, on a level with the lower border of the third costal cartilage behind the left half of the sternum.
simple_sent: The ascending aorta is the part of the aorta that goes up. It starts at the top of the left ventricle and goes all the way down to the left side of the heart.

ori_sentence: Triamcinolone hexacetonide (brand name Aristospan; also known as triamcinolone acetonide 21-tebutate) is a synthetic glucocorticoid corticosteroid.
simple_sent: Triamcinolone hexacetonide, also known as Aristospan, is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is triamcinolone acetonide.

ori_sentence: Posterior urethral valve (PUV) disorder is an obstructive developmental anomaly in the urethra and genitourinary system of male newborns.
simple_sent: Posterior urethral valve (PUV) disorder is a birth defect. In male newborns, the urethra and genitourinary system are not ready.

ori_sentence: A spider angioma or spider naevus (plural: spider naevi), also nevus araneus, is a type of telangiectasis (swollen blood vessels) found slightly beneath the skin surface, often containing a central red spot and deep reddish extensions (see Blood color) which radiate outwards like a spider's web or a spider's legs.
simple_sent: A spider angioma or spider naevus (plural: spider naevi), also nevus araneus, is a condition where the blood vessels in the skin become too big. It usually has a red spot on the top of the skin, but sometimes it has a red area on the bottom, like a spider's web or a spider's legs.

ori_sentence: Haversian canals (sometimes canals of Havers) are a series of microscopic tubes in the outermost region of bone called cortical bone.
simple_sent: Haversian canals (sometimes called Haversian canals) are small tubes in the outermost part of bone, called cortical bone.

ori_sentence: Reactive airway disease (RAD) is an informal label that physicians apply to patients with symptoms similar to those of asthma.
simple_sent: Reactive airway disease (RAD) is a disease. People who have this disease have symptoms that look like asthma.

ori_sentence: Invasive lobular carcinoma is breast cancer arising from the lobules of the mammary glands.
simple_sent: Invasive lobular carcinoma is breast cancer that does not go away after treatment.

ori_sentence: Trypanosomiasis or trypanosomosis is the name of several diseases in vertebrates caused by parasitic protozoan trypanosomes of the genus Trypanosoma.
simple_sent: Trypanosomiasis or trypanosomosis is a disease. It is caused by a protozoan called the Trypanosoma, which infects vertebrates.

ori_sentence: A spiral fracture (a.k.a. torsion fracture) is a bone fracture occurring when torque (a rotating force) is applied along the axis of a bone.
simple_sent: A spiral fracture (also called a torsion fracture) is a fracture of the bone. It happens when a force is applied to the bone.

ori_sentence: Popliteal pterygium syndrome (PPS) is an inherited condition affecting the face, limbs, and genitalia.
simple_sent: Popliteal pterygium syndrome (PPS) is a rare condition. People with PPS have a different face.

ori_sentence: Pseudolymphoma is a benign lymphocytic infiltrate that resembles cutaneous lymphoma histologically, clinically, or both.
simple_sent: Pseudolymphoma is a benign lymphocytic infiltrate. It looks like a cutaneous lymphoma, but it is not.

ori_sentence: Heartburn, also known as pyrosis, cardialgia or acid indigestion, is a burning sensation in the central chest or upper central abdomen.
simple_sent: Heartburn, also called acid indigestion or pyrosis, is a burning feeling in the chest. It can also be called cardialgia.

ori_sentence: Mediastinitis is inflammation of the tissues in the mid-chest, or mediastinum.
simple_sent: Mediastinitis is an inflammation of the mid-chest area. It is called mediastinum.

ori_sentence: Total mesorectal excision (TME) is a standard surgical technique for treatment of rectal cancer, first described in 1982 by Professor Bill Heald at the UK's Basingstoke District Hospital.
simple_sent: Total mesorectal excision (TME) is a surgery. It is used to treat rectal cancer. The surgery was first used in the United Kingdom in 1982 by Professor Bill Heald.

ori_sentence: Trandolapril is an ACE inhibitor used to treat high blood pressure.
simple_sent: Trandolapril is a drug. It is used to treat high blood pressure.

ori_sentence: The brachiocephalic artery (or brachiocephalic trunk or innominate artery) is an artery of the mediastinum that supplies blood to the right arm and the head and neck.
simple_sent: The brachiocephalic artery (or brachiocephalic trunk) is a major blood vessel in the central nervous system. It supplies blood to the head and neck.

ori_sentence: Malignant hyperthermia (MH) is a type of severe reaction that occurs in response to particular medications used during general anesthesia, among those who are susceptible.
simple_sent: Malignant hyperthermia (MH) is a type of severe reaction. It usually happens when certain drugs are taken during surgery, or when people are very sick.

ori_sentence: Cutaneous horns, also known by the Latin name cornu cutaneum, are unusual keratinous skin tumors with the appearance of horns, or sometimes of wood or coral.
simple_sent: Cutaneous horns, also known as cornu cutaneum, are tumors on the skin. They look like horns, and sometimes they are made of wood or coral.

ori_sentence: A wheeze is a continuous, coarse, whistling sound produced in the respiratory airways during breathing.
simple_sent: A wheeze is a sound that is made when someone breathes hard. It is like a whistling sound.

ori_sentence: Acetyl-L-carnitine, ALCAR or ALC, is an acetylated form of L-carnitine.
simple_sent: Acetyl-L-carnitine is a chemical compound. It is also called ALCAR.

ori_sentence: Rett syndrome (RTT) is a genetic disorder that typically becomes apparent after 6–18 months of age in females.
simple_sent: Rett syndrome (RTT) is a genetic disorder. People with Rett syndrome are usually born with it.

ori_sentence: Abdominal angina is abdominal pain after eating that occurs in individuals with ongoing poor blood supply to their small intestines known as chronic mesenteric ischemia.
simple_sent: Abdominal angina is abdominal pain after eating. People who have chronic mesenteric ischemia (poor blood getting to their small intestines) have abdominal angina.

ori_sentence: Theobromine poisoning, also informally called chocolate poisoning, is an overdosage reaction to the xanthine alkaloid theobromine, found in chocolate, tea, cola beverages, and some other foods.
simple_sent: Theobromine poisoning, also called chocolate poisoning, is when people take too much of the chemical theobromine. It is in chocolate, tea, cola, and some other foods.

ori_sentence: Conductive hearing loss (CHL) occurs when there is a problem transferring sound waves anywhere along the pathway through the outer ear, tympanic membrane (eardrum), or middle ear (ossicles).
simple_sent: Conductive hearing loss (CHL) happens when the sound waves can not get from the outside of the body to the inside of the body. This usually happens in the outer ear.

ori_sentence: β-Alanine (or beta-alanine) is a naturally occurring beta amino acid, which is an amino acid in which the amino group is attached to the β-carbon (i.e. the carbon two atoms away from the carboxylate group) instead of the more usual α-carbon for alanine (α-alanine).
simple_sent: Alanine (or beta-alanine) is an amino acid. It is an amino acid in which the carbon two atoms away from the carboxylate group of the amino acidalanine is attached to the carbon two atoms away from the carboxylate group.

ori_sentence: Peritonsillar abscess (PTA), also known as quinsy, is an accumulation of pus due to an infection behind the tonsil.
simple_sent: Peritonsillar abscess (PTA) is an infection behind the tonsil. It is also called quinsy.

ori_sentence: The vertebral arteries are major arteries of the neck.
simple_sent: The vertebral arteries are the main neck arteries.

ori_sentence: Onychomycosis, also known as tinea unguium, is a fungal infection of the nail.
simple_sent: Onychomycosis is a fungal disease. It is also called tinea unguium.

ori_sentence: Salicylamide (o-hydroxybenzamide or amide of salicyl) is a non-prescription drug with analgesic and antipyretic properties.
simple_sent: Salicylamide is a non-prescription drug. Its chemical formula is o-hydroxybenzamide or amide of salicyl.

ori_sentence: Cardiac tamponade, also known as pericardial tamponade (/ˌtæm.pəˈneɪd/), is the buildup of fluid in the pericardium (the sac around the heart), resulting in compression of the heart.
simple_sent: Cardiac tamponade, also known as pericardial tamponade, is when fluid builds up in the pericardium (the sac around the heart). This makes the heart work harder.

ori_sentence: The frontal sinuses are one of the four pairs of paranasal sinuses that are situated behind the brow ridges.
simple_sent: The frontal sinuses are behind the brow ridges. There are four pairs of sinuses in the frontal sinuses.

ori_sentence: Schindler disease, also known as Kanzaki disease and alpha-N-acetylgalactosaminidase deficiency is a rare disease found in humans.
simple_sent: Schindler disease is a rare disease. It is also called Kanzaki disease and alpha-N-acetylgalactosaminidase deficiency.

ori_sentence: A urethral stricture is a narrowing of the urethra caused by injury, instrumentation, infection, and certain non-infectious forms of urethritis.
simple_sent: A urethral stricture is a narrowing of the urethra. This can happen because of injury, infection, or other things.

ori_sentence: Hypoparathyroidism is decreased function of the parathyroid glands with underproduction of parathyroid hormone (PTH).
simple_sent: Hypoparathyroidism is when the parathyroid glands do not make enough parathyroid hormone. This is called hypoparathyroidism.

ori_sentence: The palmomental reflex (PMR) is a primitive reflex consisting of a twitch of the chin muscle elicited by stroking a specific part of the palm.
simple_sent: The palmomental reflex (PMR) is a reflex. When a person is touched on the palm, their chin will twitch in a certain way.

ori_sentence: Tinea manuum is a fungal infection of the hand, mostly a type of dermatophytosis, often part of two feet-one hand syndrome.
simple_sent: Tinea manuum is a fungal infection of the hand. Most of the time it is caused by a fungus called dermatophytosis.

ori_sentence: An epidural blood patch is a surgical procedure that uses autologous blood in order to close one or many holes in the dura mater of the spinal cord, usually as a result of a previous lumbar puncture.
simple_sent: An epidural blood patch is a surgical procedure that uses autologous blood to close a hole in the spinal cord. The blood is taken from the outside of the body and pumped into the hole.

ori_sentence: Genu varum (also called bow-leggedness, bandiness, bandy-leg, and tibia vara) is a varus deformity marked by (outward) bowing at the knee, which means that the lower leg is angled inward (medially) in relation to the thigh's axis, giving the limb overall the appearance of an archer's bow.
simple_sent: Genu varum (also called bow-leggedness, bandiness, bandy-leg, and tibia vara) is a condition in which the lower leg is bent at the knee. This makes the leg look like an archer's bow, because it is angled inward (medially) in relation to the thigh's axis.

ori_sentence: A greenstick fracture is a fracture in a young, soft bone in which the bone bends and breaks.
simple_sent: A greenstick fracture is a fracture in a young bone. The bone is usually very soft.

ori_sentence: Balantidiasis is a protozoan infection caused by infection with Balantidium coli.
simple_sent: Balantidiasis is a disease. It is caused by a protozoan called Balantidium.

ori_sentence: Annular pancreas is a rare condition in which the second part of the duodenum is surrounded by a ring of pancreatic tissue continuous with the head of the pancreas.
simple_sent: In an annular pancreas, the second part of the duodenum is covered by a ring of pancreatic tissue. This is not common, but it can happen.

ori_sentence: Retroperitoneal fibrosis or Ormond's disease is a disease featuring the proliferation of fibrous tissue in the retroperitoneum, the compartment of the body containing the kidneys, aorta, renal tract, and various other structures.
simple_sent: Retroperitoneal fibrosis or Ormond's disease is a disease that happens when fibrous tissue in the retroperitoneum (the part of the body where the kidneys and aorta live) gets too big.

ori_sentence: The nasociliary nerve is a branch of the ophthalmic nerve, itself a branch of the trigeminal nerve (CN V).
simple_sent: The nasociliary nerve is a nerve in the nose. It is a branch of the ophthalmic nerve.

ori_sentence: Butalbital is a barbiturate with an intermediate duration of action.
simple_sent: Butalbital is a barbiturate. It has a short and long action.

ori_sentence: Arteriovenous malformation is an abnormal connection between arteries and veins, bypassing the capillary system.
simple_sent: Arteriovenous malformation is when the connection between the veins and the arteries is not right.

ori_sentence: Sensorineural hearing loss (SNHL) is a type of hearing loss in which the root cause lies in the inner ear or sensory organ (cochlea and associated structures) or the vestibulocochlear nerve (cranial nerve VIII).
simple_sent: Sensorineural hearing loss (SNHL) is a type of hearing loss. The cause of hearing loss is usually in the inner ear, but it can also be in other parts of the body, like the nose or the throat.

ori_sentence: Multiple familial trichoepithelioma is a cutaneous condition characterized by multiple cystic and solid nodules appearing on the face.
simple_sent: Multiple familial trichoepithelioma is a cutaneous condition. People with this condition have many nodules on their face.

ori_sentence: Liver disease (also called hepatic disease) is a type of damage to or disease of the liver.
simple_sent: Liver disease is a disease where the liver does not work properly. It is also called hepatic disease.

ori_sentence: Adrenocortical carcinoma (ACC) is an aggressive cancer originating in the cortex (steroid hormone-producing tissue) of the adrenal gland.
simple_sent: Adrenocortical carcinoma (ACC) is a cancer of the adrenal glands. It is the most common cancer of the adrenal gland.

ori_sentence: Cystitis cystica is a rare chronic reactive inflammatory disorder thought to be caused by chronic irritation of the urothelium because of infection, calculi, outlet obstruction, or tumor resulting in multiple small filling defects in the bladder wall.
simple_sent: Cystitis cystica is a rare disease. It is thought to be caused by the urothelium (the wall of the bladder) getting irritated all the time. This could cause many small defects in the wall of the bladder.

ori_sentence: The zygomatic nerve is a branch of the maxillary nerve, itself a branch of the trigeminal nerve (CN V).
simple_sent: The zygomatic nerve is a nerve in the brain. It is also called the maxillary nerve.

ori_sentence: Synovitis is the medical term for inflammation of the synovial membrane.
simple_sent: Synovitis is an inflammation of the synovial membrane.

ori_sentence: Urogenital tuberculosis is a form of tuberculosis that affects the urogenital system.
simple_sent: Urogenital tuberculosis is a disease that affects the urogenital system.

ori_sentence: Sofosbuvir, sold under the brand name Sovaldi among others, is a medication used to treat hepatitis C.
simple_sent: Sofosbuvir, also known as Sovaldi, is a drug. It is used to treat Hepatitis C/O.

ori_sentence: Allergen immunotherapy, also known as desensitization or hypo-sensitization, is a medical treatment for environmental allergies, such as insect bites, and asthma.
simple_sent: Allergen immunotherapy, also called desensitization or hypo-sensitization, is a medical treatment. It helps people who have allergies.

ori_sentence: A lensmeter or lensometer, also known as a focimeter or vertometer, is an ophthalmic instrument.
simple_sent: A lensmeter or lensometer is a tool that is used to measure the eye.

ori_sentence: Left ventricular hypertrophy (LVH) is thickening of the heart muscle of the left ventricle of the heart, that is, left-sided ventricular hypertrophy.
simple_sent: Left ventricular hypertrophy (LVH) is a growth of heart muscle in the left side of the heart. This is called left side ventricular hypertrophy.

ori_sentence: Torsades de pointes, torsade de pointes or torsades des pointes (TdP) (/tɔːˌsɑːd
simple_sent: Torsades de pointes, torsade de pointes or torsades des pointes is a French word.

ori_sentence: Cataplexy is a sudden and transient episode of muscle weakness accompanied by full conscious awareness, typically triggered by emotions such as laughing, crying, or terror.
simple_sent: Cataplexy is a sudden and short-lived feeling of muscle weakness. It is usually caused by strong emotions, such as laughing, crying, or fear.

ori_sentence: Uncombable hair syndrome is a rare structural anomaly of the hair with a variable degree of effect.
simple_sent: Uncombable hair syndrome is a rare condition. It causes hair to not grow straight or even at all.

ori_sentence: Juvenile myoclonic epilepsy (JME), also known as Janz syndrome, is a fairly common form of generalized epilepsy of presumed genetic origin (previously known an idiopathic generalized epilepsy), representing 5-10% of all epilepsy cases.
simple_sent: Juvenile myoclonic epilepsy (JME), also known as Janz syndrome, is a fairly common form of generalized epilepsy. About 5-10% of all epilepsy cases are this type of epilepsy, and it is the most common form of epilepsy.

ori_sentence: Hypoventilation (also known as respiratory depression) occurs when ventilation is inadequate (hypo meaning "below") to perform needed respiratory gas exchange.
simple_sent: Hypoventilation (also known as respiratory depression) happens when there is not enough ventilation. This is called hypo meaning "below".
