ori_sentence: Neonatal Hemochromatosis is a rare and severe liver disease of unknown origin, though research suggests that it may be alloimmune condition.
simple_sent: Neonatal Hemochromatosis is a rare liver disease. The cause of the disease is not known, but it may be related to other things.

ori_sentence: Penbutolol (brand names
simple_sent: Penbutolol can mean:

ori_sentence: Mixed connective tissue disease commonly abbreviated as MCTD, is an autoimmune disease characterized by the presence of elevated blood levels of a specific autoantibody, now called anti-U1 ribonucleoprotein (RNP) together with a mix of symptoms of systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE), scleroderma, and polymyositis.
simple_sent: Mixed connective tissue disease (often shortened to MCTD) is an autoimmune disease. People who have the disease have elevated blood levels of a certain autoantibody, called anti-U1 ribonucleoprotein (RNP). They also have symptoms of lupus erythematosus (SLE), scleroderma, and polymyositis.

ori_sentence: Hereditary spherocytosis is an abnormality of red blood cells, or erythrocytes.
simple_sent: Hereditary spherocytosis is when there are not enough red blood cells.

ori_sentence: Bronopol (INN; chemical name 2-bromo-2-nitro-1,3-propanediol) is an organic compound that is used as an antimicrobial.
simple_sent: Bronopol is a chemical compound. Its chemical name is 2-bromo-2-nitro-1,3-propanediol. It is an organic compound.

ori_sentence: Hypothenar hammer syndrome (HHS) is a vascular occlusion in humans in the region of the ulna.
simple_sent: Hypothenar hammer syndrome (HHS) happens to people. It happens in the area of the ulna.

ori_sentence: Microglia are a type of neuroglia (glial cell) located throughout the brain and spinal cord.
simple_sent: Microglia are found in the brain and in the spinal cord. They are called neuroglia.

ori_sentence: Keratoconjunctivitis is inflammation ("-itis") of the cornea and conjunctiva.
simple_sent: Keratoconjunctivitis is a disease of the eye. It causes inflammation.

ori_sentence: Sialolithiasis (also termed salivary calculi, or salivary stones), is a condition where a calcified mass or sialolith forms within a salivary gland, usually in the duct of the submandibular gland (also termed "Wharton's duct").
simple_sent: Sialolithiasis (also called salivary calculi, or salivary stones) is a condition in which a calcified mass (or sialolith) forms within a salivary gland. This is usually found in the submandibular gland.

ori_sentence: Hyperostosis is an excessive growth of bone.
simple_sent: Hyperostosis is too much bone growth.

ori_sentence: Lichen sclerosus (LS) is a chronic, inflammatory skin disease of unknown cause which can affect any body part of any person but has a strong preference for the genitals (penis, vulva) and is also known as balanitis xerotica obliterans (BXO) when it affects the penis.
simple_sent: Lichen sclerosus (LS) is a chronic, inflammatory skin disease of unknown cause. The disease can affect any body part of any person, but it is most often seen in men. When it affects the penis, the disease is also known as balanitis xerotica obliterans.

ori_sentence: Cervicitis is inflammation of the uterine cervix.
simple_sent: Cervicitis is a disease of the cervix.

ori_sentence: Gastroparesis (gastro- from Ancient Greek γαστήρ - gaster, "stomach"; and -paresis, πάρεσις - "partial paralysis"), also called delayed gastric emptying, is a medical disorder consisting of weak muscular contractions (peristalsis) of the stomach, resulting in food and liquid remaining in the stomach for a prolonged period of time.
simple_sent: Gastroparesis, also called delayed gastric emptying, is a medical disorder that happens when the stomach does not empty completely. This happens because the muscles of the stomach do not contract properly, and food and liquid stay in the stomach for a long time.

ori_sentence: Hyperalgesia (/ˌhaɪpərælˈdʒiːziə/ or /-siə/; 'hyper' from Greek ὑπέρ (huper, “over”), '-algesia' from Greek algos, ἄλγος (pain)) is an abnormally increased sensitivity to pain, which may be caused by damage to nociceptors or peripheral nerves and can cause hypersensitivity to stimulus.
simple_sent: Hyperalgesia is an abnormally high sensitivity to pain. It can be caused by damage to nerves in the body, such as damage to the nociceptors or peripheral nerves.

ori_sentence: Hypoplastic left heart syndrome (HLHS) is a rare congenital heart defect in which the left side of the heart is severely underdeveloped and incapable of supporting the systemic circulation.
simple_sent: Hypoplastic left heart syndrome (HLHS) is a rare heart defect. In this case, the left side of the heart is smaller than the right side, and can not pump blood well.

ori_sentence: Marie Unna hereditary hypotrichosis is an autosomal dominant condition characterized by scalp hair that is sparse or absent at birth, with variable coarse, wiry hair regrowth in childhood, and potential loss again at puberty.
simple_sent: Marie Unna hereditary hypotrichosis is an autosomal dominant condition. This means that people with the condition have hair that is very short or absent at birth, or that grows back in different ways.

ori_sentence: Hyperdontia is the condition of having supernumerary teeth, or teeth that appear in addition to the regular number of teeth (32 in the average adult).
simple_sent: Hyperdontia is when people have more teeth than normal. In the average adult, there are 32 teeth, but some people have extra teeth.

ori_sentence: Walker–Warburg syndrome (WWS), also called Warburg syndrome, Chemke syndrome, HARD syndrome (Hydrocephalus, Agyria and Retinal Dysplasia), Pagon syndrome, cerebroocular dysgenesis (COD) or cerebroocular dysplasia-muscular dystrophy syndrome (COD-MD), is a rare form of autosomal recessive congenital muscular dystrophy.
simple_sent: Walker-Warburg syndrome (WWS) is a rare form of muscular dystrophy. It is also called cerebroocular dysgenesis (COD) or cerebroocular dysplasia-muscular dystrophy syndrome (COD-MD). People with Walker-Warburg syndrome have a lot of problems with seeing.

ori_sentence: Hypoesthesia or numbness is a common side effect of various medical conditions which manifests as a reduced sense of touch or sensation, or a partial loss of sensitivity to sensory stimuli.
simple_sent: Hypoesthesia or numbness is a side effect of many medical conditions. It usually means that a person does not have the same sense of touch or sensation that he or she normally has.

ori_sentence: The hepatic artery proper (also proper hepatic artery) is the artery that supplies the liver and gallbladder.
simple_sent: The hepatic artery is an important blood vessel. It carries blood to the liver and gallbladder.

ori_sentence: Anophthalmia, (Greek: ἀνόφθαλμος, "without eye"), is the medical term for the absence of one or both eyes.
simple_sent: Anophthalmia is when one or both eyes are not working. The Greek word means "without eye".

ori_sentence: Hypogonadism means diminished functional activity of the gonads—the testes or the ovaries—that may result in diminished production of sex hormones.
simple_sent: Hypogonadism is when the gonads (the testes or the ovaries) do not work the way they should. This can make sex hormones not work.

ori_sentence: Purpura (/ˈpɜːrpjʊərə/) is a condition of red or purple discolored spots on the skin that do not blanch on applying pressure.
simple_sent: Purpura is a condition where red or purple spots appear on the skin. The spots do not blanch when pressure is applied to them.

ori_sentence: Thiourea (/ˌθaɪoʊjʊəˈriːə/) is an organosulfur compound with the formula SC(NH2)2.
simple_sent: Thiourea is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is SC(NH2)2.

ori_sentence: The diaphysis is the main or midsection (shaft) of a long bone.
simple_sent: The diaphysis is a long bone in the human body.

ori_sentence: Micropsia is a condition affecting human visual perception in which objects are perceived to be smaller than they actually are.
simple_sent: Micropsia is a condition in which the human visual system thinks that objects are smaller than they actually are.

ori_sentence: Premature ejaculation (PE) occurs when a man expels semen (and most likely experiences orgasm) soon after beginning sexual activity, and with minimal penile stimulation.
simple_sent: Premature ejaculation (PE) is when a man does not have an orgasm for a long time after he has had sex. He also does not have an orgasm when he first starts.

ori_sentence: The hypoglossal nerve is the twelfth cranial nerve, and innervates all the extrinsic and intrinsic muscles of the tongue, except for the palatoglossus which is innervated by the vagus nerve.
simple_sent: The hypoglossal nerve is a nerve in the tongue. It is the twelfth nerve in the human body, and it controls all the muscles in the tongue (except the palatoglossus).

ori_sentence: DiGeorge syndrome, also known as 22q11.2 deletion syndrome, is a syndrome caused by a microdeletion on the long arm of chromosome 22.
simple_sent: DiGeorge syndrome, also known as 22q11.2 deletion syndrome, is a genetic disease. It is caused by a small change in chromosome 22.

ori_sentence: Orchitis is inflammation of the testes.
simple_sent: Orchitis is a disease of the testes.

ori_sentence: Testicular cancer is cancer that develops in the testicles, a part of the male reproductive system.
simple_sent: Testicular cancer is cancer of the testicles. It is the second most common cancer in men.

ori_sentence: Tunnel vision is the loss of peripheral vision with retention of central vision, resulting in a constricted circular tunnel-like field of vision.
simple_sent: Tunnel vision is when the central vision is lost, and the peripheral vision stays the same. This makes a tunnel-like field of vision.

ori_sentence: An abortifacient ("that which will cause a miscarriage" from Latin: abortus "miscarriage" and faciens "making") is a substance that induces abortion.
simple_sent: An abortifacient (from Latin abortus "miscarriage" and faciens "making") is a chemical or drug that causes an abortion.

ori_sentence: Colorado tick fever (CTF) is a viral infection (Coltivirus) transmitted from the bite of an infected Rocky Mountain wood tick (Dermacentor andersoni).
simple_sent: Colorado tick fever (CTF) is a disease. It is caused by a tick (Dermacentor andersoni), and can be caught from a tick bite.

ori_sentence: Infective endocarditis is an infection of the inner surface of the heart, usually the valves.
simple_sent: Endocarditis is an infection of the heart. The most common cause of endocarditis is heart disease.

ori_sentence: A myofibril (also known as a muscle fibril or sarcostyle) is a basic rod-like organelle of a muscle cell.
simple_sent: A myofibril is a basic organelle of a muscle cell. It is also called a muscle fibril or sarcostyle.

ori_sentence: Apathy is a lack of feeling, emotion, interest, or concern about something.
simple_sent: Apathy is not feeling something, or having an interest in something.

ori_sentence: Echolalia is the unsolicited repetition of vocalizations made by another person (when repeated by the same person, it is called palilalia).
simple_sent: Echolalia is when a person repeats a sound that another person has said. When two people say echolalia, it is called palilalia.

ori_sentence: Triflupromazine (Vesprin) is an antipsychotic medication of the phenothiazine class.
simple_sent: Triflupromazine (also known as Vesprin) is an antipsychotic drug.

ori_sentence: Laryngoscopy (/ˌlærɪŋˈɡɒskəpi/) is endoscopy of the larynx, a part of the throat.
simple_sent: Laryngoscopy is when doctors look at the larynx to see what is going on in it.

ori_sentence: Esophageal atresia is a congenital medical condition (birth defect) that affects the alimentary tract.
simple_sent: Esophageal atresia is a birth defect. It means that the esophagus is not working properly.

ori_sentence: Cefoxitin is a second-generation cephamycin antibiotic developed by Merck & Co., Inc. from Cephamycin C in the year following its discovery, 1972.
simple_sent: Cefoxitin is a second-generation cephamycin antibiotic. Cephamycin C was the first antibiotic that was discovered in 1972, by Merck.

ori_sentence: The Listeriaceae are a family of Gram-positive bacteria.
simple_sent: Listeriaceae is a family of bacteria.

ori_sentence: Dexrazoxane hydrochloride (Zinecard, Cardioxane) is a cardioprotective agent.
simple_sent: Dexrazoxane is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is Zinecard.

ori_sentence: Intubation (sometimes entubation) is a medical procedure involving the insertion of a tube into the body.
simple_sent: Intubation (sometimes called entubation) is when a person is taken to the hospital by air.

ori_sentence: Posterior cord syndrome (PCS), also known as posterior spinal artery syndrome (PSA), is a type of incomplete spinal cord injury.
simple_sent: Posterior cord syndrome (PCS) is an injury to the spinal cord. It can also be called posterior spinal artery syndrome.

ori_sentence: The abducens nerve (or abducent nerve) is the sixth cranial nerve (CNVI), in humans, that controls the movement of the lateral rectus muscle, responsible for outward gaze.
simple_sent: The abducens nerve is a nerve in the brain. In humans, it is the sixth cranial nerve (CNVI), and it controls how the lateral rectus muscle moves.

ori_sentence: A skin infection is an infection of the skin in humans and other animals, that can also affect the associated soft tissues such as loose connective tissue and mucous membranes.
simple_sent: A skin infection is an infection of the skin. In humans and other animals, it is the most common cause of skin cancer, and the most common cause of death.

ori_sentence: Ketotifen, sold under the brand name Zaditor among others, is a second-generation noncompetitive H1-antihistamine and mast cell stabilizer.
simple_sent: Ketotifen, sold under the brand name Zaditor among others, is a non-competitive H1-antihistamine drug in the United States.

ori_sentence: Radiation colitis is injury to the colon caused by radiation therapy.
simple_sent: Radiation colitis is an injury to the colon when radiation is used.

ori_sentence: Azlocillin is an acylampicillin antibiotic with an extended spectrum of activity and greater in vitro potency than the carboxy penicillins.
simple_sent: Azlocillin is an antibiotic. It is an acylampicillin that works better than other penicillins, but not as well as azlocillin.

ori_sentence: Motion sickness occurs due to a difference between actual and expected motion.
simple_sent: Motion sickness is caused by the difference between expected and actual motion.

ori_sentence: Anencephaly is the absence of a major portion of the brain, skull, and scalp that occurs during embryonic development.
simple_sent: Anencephaly is when the brain, skull, and scalp do not develop properly during the early stages of development.

ori_sentence: Congenital hypothyroidism (CH) is thyroid hormone deficiency present at birth.
simple_sent: Congenital hypothyroidism (CH) is when the person does not have enough thyroid.

ori_sentence: Aneuploidy is the presence of an abnormal number of chromosomes in a cell, for example a human cell having 45 or 47 chromosomes instead of the usual 46.
simple_sent: Aneuploidy is when there are more than one number of chromosomes in a cell. For example, a human cell has 46 chromosomes, but it has 45.

ori_sentence: The mesoderm is the middle layer of the three germ layers that develop during gastrulation in the very early development of the embryo of most animals.
simple_sent: The mesoderm is the middle layer of the three germ layers. When an embryo is very early in development, the mesoderm develops during gastrulation.

ori_sentence: Nocturnal enuresis, also called bedwetting, is involuntary urination while asleep after the age at which bladder control usually begins.
simple_sent: Nocturnal enuresis, also called bedwetting, is when a person starts to urinate while they are asleep, but does not realize it.

ori_sentence: In medicine (gastroenterology), angiodysplasia is a small vascular malformation of the gut.
simple_sent: In medicine (gastroenterology), angiodysplasia is a condition where the gut is small.

ori_sentence: Fibromyalgia (FM) is a medical condition characterized by chronic widespread pain and a heightened pain response to pressure.
simple_sent: Fibromyalgia (FM) is a medical condition that causes pain all the time. It is also called chronic pain.

ori_sentence: Recurrent corneal erosion is a disorder of the eyes characterized by the failure of the cornea's outermost layer of epithelial cells to attach to the underlying basement membrane (Bowman's layer).
simple_sent: Recurrent corneal erosion is a disease of the eyes. It happens when the outer layer of the cornea (called the Bowman's layer) does not stick to the basement membrane.

ori_sentence: Atypical fibroxanthoma of the skin is a low-grade malignancy related to malignant fibrous histiocytoma, which it resembles histologically.
simple_sent: Atypical fibroxanthoma of the skin is a low-grade malignancy. It looks like a fibrous histiocytoma, but it is not.

ori_sentence: The internal iliac artery (formerly known as the hypogastric artery) is the main artery of the pelvis.
simple_sent: The internal iliac artery is an important artery in the body. It goes into the pelvis.

ori_sentence: Postpartum depression (PPD), also called postnatal depression, is a type of mood disorder associated with childbirth, which can affect both sexes.
simple_sent: Postpartum depression (PPD), also called postnatal depression, is a mental condition. It can also be called post-traumatic stress disorder.

ori_sentence: Anisocytosis is a medical term meaning that a patient's red blood cells are of unequal size.
simple_sent: Anisocytosis is when a person's red blood cells are not all the same size.

ori_sentence: Acrodermatitis enteropathica is an autosomal recessive metabolic disorder affecting the uptake of zinc through the inner lining of the bowel, the mucous membrane.
simple_sent: Acrodermatitis enteropathica is an autosomal recessive disease. This means that it affects a person's body's ability to uptake zinc from the mucous membrane.

ori_sentence: Osteomyelitis (OM) is an infection of bone.
simple_sent: Osteomyelitis is a bone disease.

ori_sentence: Scleritis is a serious inflammatory disease that affects the white outer coating of the eye, known as the sclera.
simple_sent: Scleritis is a disease that makes the sclera (the outer layer of the eye) white. It is very bad.

ori_sentence: Activated protein C resistance (APCR) is a hypercoagulability (an increased tendency of the blood to clot) characterized by a lack of a response to activated protein C (APC), which normally helps prevent blood from clotting excessively.
simple_sent: Activated protein C resistance (APCR) is a condition in which the blood is more likely to clot. This is because the body does not react to activated protein C (APC), which would help stop the blood from clotting too much.

ori_sentence: Esophagitis, also spelled oesophagitis, is a disease characterized by inflammation of the esophagus.
simple_sent: Esophagitis is a disease of the esophagus. It is also called oesophagitis or oesophagitis.

ori_sentence: Colitis is an inflammation of the colon.
simple_sent: Colitis is a disease of the colon.

ori_sentence: Fenoldopam mesylate (Corlopam) is a drug and synthetic benzazepine derivative which acts as a selective D1 receptor partial agonist.
simple_sent: Fenoldopam mesylate, also known as Corlopam, is a chemical compound. It is a derivative of benzazepine.

ori_sentence: Adenosine monophosphate (AMP), also known as 5'-adenylic acid, is a nucleotide.
simple_sent: Adenosine monophosphate is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is AMP.

ori_sentence: The pulmonary veins are the veins that transfer oxygenated blood from the lungs to the heart.
simple_sent: Pulmonary veins carry blood from the heart to the lungs. They carry oxygenated blood.

ori_sentence: A hamartoma is a mostly benign, local malformation of cells that resembles a neoplasm of local tissue but is usually due to an overgrowth of multiple aberrant cells, with a basis in a systemic genetic condition, rather than a growth descended from a single mutated cell (monoclonality), as would typically define a benign neoplasm/tumor.
simple_sent: A hamartoma is a local malformation of cells that looks like a tumor of local tissue but is usually not. The cause of hamartoma is usually a genetic condition that causes an overgrowth of multiple aberrant cells, rather than a growth that comes from a single mutated cell (monoclonality).

ori_sentence: Dependent personality disorder (DPD) is characterized by a pervasive psychological dependence on other people.
simple_sent: Dependent personality disorder (DPD) is a mental illness. People with DPD have many problems.

ori_sentence: A struma ovarii (literally: goitre of the ovary) is a rare form of monodermal teratoma that contains mostly thyroid tissue, which may cause hyperthyroidism.
simple_sent: A struma ovarii (literally: goitre of the ovary) is a tumor on the outside of the body. It is a rare form of teratoma.

ori_sentence: FG syndrome (FGS) is a rare genetic syndrome caused by one or more recessive genes located on the X chromosome and causing physical anomalies and developmental delays.
simple_sent: FG syndrome (FGS) is a rare genetic condition. It is caused by two or more genes on the X chromosome. This causes problems with development.

ori_sentence: The vestibulocochlear nerve (auditory vestibular nerve), known as the eighth cranial nerve, transmits sound and equilibrium (balance) information from the inner ear to the brain.
simple_sent: The vestibulocochlear nerve is the eighth cranial nerve. It goes from the inner ear (where sound comes from) to the brain (where it is processed by the brain).

ori_sentence: The trochlear nerve (/ˈtrɒklɪər/), also called the fourth cranial nerve or CN IV, is a motor nerve (a somatic efferent nerve) that innervates just one muscle: the superior oblique muscle of the eye, which operates through the pulley-like trochlea.
simple_sent: The trochlear nerve (also called the fourth cranial nerve or CN IV) is a nerve in the back of the eye. It is the main nerve that controls the eye muscle, the superior oblique muscle in the back of the eye.

ori_sentence: Chyle (from the Greek word χυλός chylos, "juice") is a milky bodily fluid consisting of lymph and emulsified fats, or free fatty acids (FFAs).
simple_sent: The word chyle comes from the Greek word chylos, which means "juice". Chyle is made up of fat and lymphatic cells, or free fatty acids.

ori_sentence: Mastoiditis is the result of an infection that extends to the air cells of the skull behind the ear.
simple_sent: Mastoiditis is an infection of the air cells of the skull. It usually starts behind the ear.

ori_sentence: Serum iron is a medical laboratory test that measures the amount of circulating iron that is bound to transferrin (90%) and serum ferritin (10%).
simple_sent: Serum iron is a test to see how much iron there is in your body. It measures how much iron is in your blood (90%) and in your serum (10%).

ori_sentence: Becker muscular dystrophy is an X-linked recessive inherited disorder characterized by slowly progressing muscle weakness of the legs and pelvis.
simple_sent: Becker muscular dystrophy is an inherited disease. People with Becker muscular dystrophy have weak muscles in their legs and in their pelvis.

ori_sentence: A joint dislocation, also called luxation, occurs when there is an abnormal separation in the joint, where two or more bones meet.
simple_sent: A joint dislocation, also called luxation, is when two or more bones meet too close. This is called a separation.

ori_sentence: Cardiogenic shock (CS) is a medical emergency resulting from inadequate blood flow due to the dysfunction of the ventricles of the heart.
simple_sent: Cardiogenic shock (CS) is a medical emergency. It happens when the heart can not pump blood properly because of problems.

ori_sentence: Bromfenac is a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) marketed in the US as an ophthalmic solution (brand names Prolensa and Bromday, prior formulation brand name Xibrom, which has since been discontinued) by ISTA Pharmaceuticals for short-term, local use.
simple_sent: Bromfenac (also known as Prolensa and Bromday) is a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID). In the United States, it is sold under the brand names Prolensa and Bromday by ISTA Pharmaceuticals for short-term, local use.

ori_sentence: Tricuspid Valve Stenosis is a valvular heart disease that narrows the opening of the heart's tricuspid valve.
simple_sent: Tricuspid Valve Stenosis is a disease of the heart. It causes the tricuspid valve to become smaller.

ori_sentence: In the anatomy of humans and homologous primates, the ascending colon is the part of the colon located between the cecum and the transverse colon.
simple_sent: In humans, the ascending colon is located between the cecum and the transverse colon. In animals, the ascending colon is located above the cecum.

ori_sentence: An adrenergic agonist is a drug that stimulates a response from the adrenergic receptors.
simple_sent: An adrenergic agonist is a drug that helps the adrenergic system to work.

ori_sentence: In the anatomy of humans and homologous primates, the descending colon is the part of the large intestine from the splenic flexure to the beginning of the sigmoid colon.
simple_sent: The descending colon is the part of the large intestine that goes down. In humans, it is the last part of the large intestine before the colon begins.

ori_sentence: Pulsus paradoxus, also paradoxic pulse or paradoxical pulse, is an abnormally large decrease in stroke volume, systolic blood pressure and pulse wave amplitude during inspiration.
simple_sent: Pulsus paradoxus, also called paradoxic pulse or paradoxical pulse, is an abnormally large drop in blood pressure when a person is having a stroke.

ori_sentence: Pupillary hippus, also known as pupillary athetosis, is spasmodic, rhythmic, but regular dilating and contracting pupillary movements between the sphincter and dilator muscles.
simple_sent: Pupillary hippus, also known as pupillary athetosis, is a movement in the nose. The pupillary muscles contract and contract in a rhythmic pattern.

ori_sentence: Hirsutism is excessive body hair on parts of the body where hair is normally absent or minimal.
simple_sent: Hirsutism is when there is a lot of hair on one part of the body, but not on other parts.

ori_sentence: Neural tube defects (NTDs) are a group of birth defects in which an opening in the spine or cranium remains from early in human development.
simple_sent: Neural tube defects (NTDs) are birth problems where an opening in the brain or spine remains when a person is born.

ori_sentence: Cefepime is a fourth-generation cephalosporin antibiotic.
simple_sent: Cefepime is a cephalosporin-based antibiotic.

ori_sentence: Endocrine glands are ductless glands of the endocrine system that secrete their products, hormones, directly into the blood.
simple_sent: Endocrine glands are glands that release hormones into the blood. They are part of the endocrine system.

ori_sentence: Endoderm is the innermost of the three primary germ layers in the very early embryo.
simple_sent: The endoderm is the first part of the embryo. It is the most inner layer.

ori_sentence: A hydrogen breath test (or HBT) is used as a diagnostic tool for small intestine bacterial overgrowth and carbohydrate malabsorption, such as lactose, fructose, and sorbitol malabsorption.
simple_sent: A hydrogen breath test (or HBT) is a test to see if a person's small intestine is too full of bacteria. If it is, this is because the person has too much sugar or fructose.

ori_sentence: Bone marrow is a semi-solid tissue found within the spongy (also known as cancellous) portions of bones.
simple_sent: Bone marrow is a soft tissue in the bones of the human body. It is also called cancellous tissue.

ori_sentence: Lupus nephritis is an inflammation of the kidneys caused by systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE), an autoimmune disease.
simple_sent: Lupus nephritis is a disease of the kidneys. It is caused by an autoimmune disease called lupus erythematosus.

ori_sentence: POEMS syndrome (also termed osteosclerotic myeloma, Crow–Fukase syndrome, Takatsuki disease, or PEP syndrome) is a rare paraneoplastic syndrome caused by a clone of aberrant plasma cells.
simple_sent: POEMS syndrome (also called osteosclerotic myeloma, Takatsuki disease, or PEP syndrome) is a rare disease. It is caused by a clone of abnormal plasma cells.

ori_sentence: Renal vein thrombosis (RVT) is the formation of a clot in the vein that drains blood from the kidneys, ultimately leading to a reduction in the drainage of one or both kidneys and the possible migration of the clot to other parts of the body.
simple_sent: Renal vein thrombosis (RVT) is when a blood clot forms in a renal vein. This causes the kidneys to not be able to carry blood to other parts of the body, and in some cases, people die because of this disease.

ori_sentence: Cinchonism is a pathological condition caused by an overdose of quinine or its natural source, cinchona bark.
simple_sent: Cinchonism is a disease. It happens when people take too much quinine or its source, cinchona bark.

ori_sentence: A spinal nerve is a mixed nerve, which carries motor, sensory, and autonomic signals between the spinal cord and the body.
simple_sent: A spinal nerve is a nerve that is found in the spinal cord. It carries signals between the body and the brain.

ori_sentence: Iodixanol is an iodine-containing non-ionic radiocontrast agent.
simple_sent: Iodixanol is a chemical compound. It has iodine and alcohol ions.

ori_sentence: A medical specialty is a branch of medical practice that is focused on a defined group of patients, diseases, skills, or philosophy.
simple_sent: A medical specialty is a branch of medical practice that focuses on a certain group of people or a certain disease.

ori_sentence: Nasopharyngeal angiofibroma is an angiofibroma also known as juvenile nasal angiofibroma, fibromatous hamartoma, and angiofibromatous hamartoma of the nasal cavity.
simple_sent: Nasopharyngeal angiofibroma is an angiofibroma in the nasal cavity. It can also be called juvenile nasal angiofibroma or fibromatous hamartoma.

ori_sentence: Skew deviation is an unusual ocular deviation (strabismus), wherein the eyes move upward (hypertropia) in opposite directions.
simple_sent: Skew deviation is an unusual condition. In this case, the eyes move from one side to the other, in opposite directions.

ori_sentence: Donohue syndrome (also known as leprechaunism) is an extremely rare and severe genetic disorder.
simple_sent: Donohue syndrome is a very rare genetic disorder. It is also called leprechaunism.

ori_sentence: Ventricular hypertrophy (VH) is thickening of the walls of a ventricle (lower chamber) of the heart.
simple_sent: Ventricular hypertrophy is when the walls of a heart chamber become too thick.

ori_sentence: Tracheitis is an inflammation of the trachea.
simple_sent: Tracheitis is a medical condition.

ori_sentence: Giardiasis is a parasitic disease caused by Giardia duodenalis (also known as G. lamblia and G. intestinalis).
simple_sent: Giardiasis is a disease. It is caused by a parasite called Giardia duodenalis or G. lamblia.

ori_sentence: Dolutegravir (DTG), sold under the brand name Tivicay, is an antiretroviral medication used, together with other medication, to treat HIV/AIDS.
simple_sent: Dolutegravir (also known as Tivicay) is an antiretroviral drug. It is used to treat people with HIV/AIDS.

ori_sentence: Subacute sclerosing panencephalitis (SSPE)—also known as Dawson disease—is a rare form of chronic, progressive brain inflammation caused by slow infection with certain defective strains of hypermutated measles virus.
simple_sent: Subacute sclerosing panencephalitis (SSPE), also known as Dawson disease, is a disease that affects the brain. It is caused by a virus (Measles virus) that infects the brain slowly.

ori_sentence: Mucolipidosis type IV (ML IV, ganglioside sialidase deficiency, or ML4) is an autosomal recessive lysosomal storage disorder.
simple_sent: Mucolipidosis type IV (also called ganglioside sialidase deficiency or ML4) is a genetic disease.

ori_sentence: Wagner's disease is a familial disease of the eye that can cause reduced visual acuity.
simple_sent: Wagner's disease is a family disease. It can cause vision problems in the eye.

ori_sentence: Hemiballismus or hemiballism is a basal ganglia syndrome resulting from damage to the subthalamic nucleus in the basal ganglia.
simple_sent: Hemiballismus or hemiballism is a disease of the basal ganglia. It happens when the subthalamic nucleus is damaged.

ori_sentence: Hereditary folate malabsorption (HFM) is a rare autosomal recessive disorder caused by loss-of-function mutations in the proton-coupled folate transporter (PCFT) gene, resulting in systemic folate deficiency and impaired delivery of folate to the brain.
simple_sent: Hereditary folate malabsorption (HFM) is a rare disease. It is caused by mutations in the folate transporter gene. If there is not enough folate in the body, people will not be able to get enough folate from food.

ori_sentence: Ertapenem (trade name Invanz) is a carbapenem antibiotic medication for the treatment of infections of the abdomen, the lungs, the upper part of the female reproductive system, and diabetic foot, used in the form of infusions or injections.
simple_sent: Ertapenem (trade name Invanz) is a carbapenem antibiotic medication. It is used to treat infections of the stomach, the lungs, the upper part of the female reproductive system, and diabetic foot.

ori_sentence: The infraorbital nerve is a branch of the maxillary nerve, itself a branch of the trigeminal nerve (CN V).
simple_sent: The infraorbital nerve is a nerve in the nose. It is a branch of the maxillary nerve.

ori_sentence: A scotoma is an area of partial alteration in the field of vision consisting of a partially diminished or entirely degenerated visual acuity that is surrounded by a field of normal – or relatively well-preserved – vision.
simple_sent: A scotoma is an area in the field of vision where vision is not as good as it should be. The visual acuity is not as good as it should be, and it is surrounded by a field of normal vision.

ori_sentence: Cutaneous small-vessel vasculitis (CSVV), also known as hypersensitivity vasculitis, cutaneous leukocytoclastic vasculitis, hypersensitivity angiitis, cutaneous leukocytoclastic angiitis, cutaneous necrotizing vasculitis and cutaneous necrotizing venulitis, is inflammation of small blood vessels (usually post-capillary venules in the dermis), characterized by palpable purpura.
simple_sent: Cutaneous small-vessel vasculitis (CSVV), also known as hypersensitivity vasculitis, cutaneous leukocytoclastic vasculitis, cutaneous leukocytoclastic angiitis, cutaneous necrotizing vasculitis, or cutaneous necrotizing venulitis, is an inflammation of the small blood vessels in the skin. The most common cause of cutaneous small-vessel vasculitis is thrombocytopenia.

ori_sentence: The renal medulla is the innermost part of the kidney.
simple_sent: The renal medulla is the last part of the kidney.

ori_sentence: Tetraplegia, also known as quadriplegia, is paralysis caused by illness or injury that results in the partial or total loss of use of all four limbs and torso; paraplegia is similar but does not affect the arms.

ori_sentence: Hypercalciuria is the condition of elevated calcium in the urine.
simple_sent: Hypercalciuria is when calcium levels are high in the urine.

ori_sentence: Gallbladder cancer is a relatively uncommon cancer, with an incidence of fewer than 2 cases per 100,000 people per year in the United States.
simple_sent: In the United States, there are less than 2 cases of gallbladder cancer per 100,000 people per year. In Europe, there are more.

ori_sentence: The interatrial septum is the wall of tissue that separates the right and left atria of the heart.
simple_sent: The interatrial septum is the wall of the heart. It separates the right and left atria.

ori_sentence: Cornea verticillata, also called vortex keratopathy or whorl keratopathy, is a condition characterised by corneal deposits at the level of the forming a faint golden-brown whorl pattern.

simple_sent: Balanitis plasmacellularis is a benign inflammatory skin condition. It is characterized by a benign inflammatory skin lesion.

ori_sentence: Posthitis (pronounced pos-THI-tis) is the inflammation of the foreskin (prepuce) of the penis.
simple_sent: Posthitis is an inflammation of the penis. The name comes from the Greek word pos-THI-tis.

ori_sentence: Bouchard's nodes are hard, bony outgrowths or gelatinous cysts on the proximal interphalangeal joints (the middle joints of fingers or toes).
simple_sent: Bouchard's nodes are hard, bony cysts on the middle joints of the hand or foot. These cysts are called interphalangeal nodes.

ori_sentence: Cerebral edema is excess accumulation of fluid (edema) in the intracellular or extracellular spaces of the brain.
simple_sent: Cerebral edema is when there is a lot of fluid in the brain. This fluid is called edema.

ori_sentence: Leukocytosis is a condition in which the white cell (leukocyte count) is above the normal range in the blood.
simple_sent: Leukocytosis is when the number of white cells (leukocytes) in the blood is higher than normal.

ori_sentence: Oligodactyly (from the Ancient Greek oligos meaning "few" and δάκτυλος daktylos meaning "finger") is the presence of fewer than five fingers or toes on a hand or foot.
simple_sent: The word oligodactyly comes from the Greek word oligos meaning "few" and daktylos meaning "finger". It means that there are less than five fingers on one hand or foot.

ori_sentence: Treprostinil, sold under the brand names Remodulin for infusion, Orenitram for oral, and Tyvaso for inhalation, is a vasodilator that is used for the treatment of pulmonary arterial hypertension.
simple_sent: Treprostinil (also known as Remodulin, Orenitram and Tyvaso) is a drug that is used to treat pulmonary arterial hypertension. It is sold under the brand names Remodulin and Orenitram.

simple_sent: Taurodontism is a condition in which the body of the tooth and pulp chamber are larger than the roots. This happens in the molar teeth of humans.

ori_sentence: In vascular diseases, endothelial dysfunction is a systemic pathological state of the endothelium.
simple_sent: In vascular diseases, the endothelium can not function properly, and this can be dangerous.

ori_sentence: Cefapirin (INN, also spelled cephapirin) is an injectable, first-generation cephalosporin antibiotic.
simple_sent: Cefapirin (also known as cephapirin) is an antibiotic. It is an injectable medicine.

ori_sentence: Palindromic rheumatism (PR) is a syndrome characterised by recurrent, self-resolving inflammatory attacks in and around the joints, consists of arthritis or periarticular soft tissue inflammation.
simple_sent: Palindromic rheumatism (PR) is a type of rheumatic disease. It is characterized by repeated, self-resolving inflammatory attacks in and around the joints.

ori_sentence: Adamantinoma (from the Greek word adamantinos, meaning "very hard") is a rare bone cancer, making up less than 1% of all bone cancers.
simple_sent: The word adamantinoma comes from the Greek word adamantinos. It is a very rare bone cancer, as it does not happen very often.

simple_sent: Ulipristal acetate, also known as Ella, is a prescription drug. It is used to prevent pregnancy and to treat uterine fibroids.

simple_sent: Laryngeal papillomatosis, also known as recurrent respiratory papillomatosis (RRP) or glottal papillomatosis, is a condition in which the airways in the throat are blocked.

ori_sentence: Erythema marginatum is a type of erythema (redness of the skin or mucous membranes) involving pink rings on the torso and inner surfaces of the limbs which come and go for as long as several months.
simple_sent: Erythema marginatum is a type of erythema (redness of the skin or mucous membranes). People who have this disease often have pink rings on their arms and legs that go away after a few months.

simple_sent: A pericardial rub (also called a pericardial friction rub) is a medical sign that a person has pericarditis.

ori_sentence: Paragonimiasis is a food-borne parasitic infection caused by the lung fluke, most commonly Paragonimus westermani.
simple_sent: Paragonimiasis is a food-borne infection. It is caused by a bacterium called Paragonimus westermani.

ori_sentence: Juxtaglomerular cells (JG cells), also known as granular cells are cells in the kidney that synthesize, store, and secrete the enzyme renin.
simple_sent: The Juxtaglomerular cells (JG cells) are special cells in the kidney. They make the enzyme renin and store it in the cells.

ori_sentence: A spasm is a sudden involuntary contraction of a muscle, a group of muscles, or a hollow organ such as the bladder.
simple_sent: A spasm is a sudden contraction of a muscle. It can also happen when a muscle or organ is not working properly.

ori_sentence: Cefamandole (INN, also known as cephamandole) is a second-generation broad-spectrum cephalosporin antibiotic.
simple_sent: Cefamandole (also known as cephamandole) is an antibiotic. It is a broad-spectrum antibiotic.

ori_sentence: Allochiria is a neurological disorder in which the patient responds to stimuli presented to one side of their body as if the stimuli had been presented at the opposite side.

ori_sentence: Hydranencephaly is a condition in which the brain's cerebral hemispheres are absent to a great degree and the remaining cranial cavity is filled with cerebrospinal fluid.
simple_sent: Hydranencephaly is a condition in which the brain's two main areas, the cerebral hemispheres, are missing. The rest of the cranial cavity is filled with fluid.

ori_sentence: Tabes dorsalis is a late consequence of neurosyphilis, characterized by the slow degeneration (specifically, demyelination) of the neural tracts primarily in the dorsal root ganglia of the spinal cord (nerve root).
simple_sent: Tables dorsalis is a late consequence of neurosyphilis. It is caused by the slow degeneration of the neural tissues in the spinal cord (nerve root). This is called demyelination.

ori_sentence: Hyperphosphatemia is an electrolyte disorder in which there is an elevated level of phosphate in the blood.
simple_sent: Hyperphosphatemia is an electrolyte disorder. In this case, the blood has too much phosphate.

ori_sentence: Acne aestivalis also known as acne mallorca, is a special kind of polymorphous light eruption induced by ultra violet A radiation.
simple_sent: Acne aestivalis, also known as acne mallorca, is caused by ultra violet radiation. It is a special kind of light eruption.

simple_sent: Neonatal acne, also known as acne neonatorum, is acne that starts in the first 4-6 weeks of life. People who have it have open and closed comedones on the cheeks, chin, and forehead.

ori_sentence: Infectious bovine keratoconjunctivitis (IBK), also known as pinkeye, New Forest eye or blight, is a veterinary infection of cattle caused by Moraxella bovis, a Gram-negative, β-haemolytic, aerobic, rod-shaped bacterium.
simple_sent: Infectious bovine keratoconjunctivitis (IBK), also known as pinkeye, New Forest eye or blight, is an infection of the eye. It is caused by a bacterium called Moraxella bovis.

simple_sent: Alexander disease is a very rare disease. It is caused by changes in the myelin in the brain. This is called an autosomal dominant leukodystrophy.

simple_sent: Pasteurellosis is a disease. It is caused by a bacteria called Pasteurella. It is found in humans and animals.

ori_sentence: Sinus arrhythmia is a commonly encountered variation of normal sinus rhythm.
simple_sent: Sinus arrhythmia is when the heart is beating too hard or too fast.

ori_sentence: The saccule is a bed of sensory cells in the inner ear.
simple_sent: The saccule is a special part of the inner ear.

simple_sent: Mal de debarquement (or mal de débarquement) syndrome (also known as disembarkment syndrome) is a condition where the brain does not work properly. It usually happens after a cruise.

ori_sentence: XY gonadal dysgenesis, also known as Swyer syndrome, is a type of hypogonadism in a person whose karyotype is 46,XY.

ori_sentence: Leishmaniasis is a wide array of clinical manifestations caused by parasites of the trypanosome genus Leishmania.
simple_sent: Leishmaniasis is a disease. It is caused by Leishmania, a genus of trypanosome parasites.

ori_sentence: Overbite medically refers to the extent of vertical (superior-inferior) overlap of the maxillary central incisors over the mandibular central incisors, measured relative to the incisal ridges.

simple_sent: The most common form of leishmaniasis is in people. It is called cutaneous leishmaniasis.

ori_sentence: Postoperative cognitive dysfunction (POCD) is a decline in cognitive function (especially in memory and executive functions) that may last from 1–12 months after surgery, or longer.
simple_sent: Postoperative cognitive dysfunction (POCD) is a decline in cognitive function after surgery. It usually starts 1-12 months after the surgery, and can last for a long time.

ori_sentence: Labetalol is a medication used to treat high blood pressure and in long term management of angina.
simple_sent: Labetalol is used to treat high blood pressure. It can also be used to treat angina.

ori_sentence: A counterirritant is a substance which creates irritation or mild inflammation in one location with the goal of lessening discomfort and/or inflammation in another location.
simple_sent: A counterirritant is a substance that makes irritation or mild inflammation in one place, but does not make it go away in another place, or in a different way.

ori_sentence: Russell's sign, named after British psychiatrist Gerald Russell, is a sign defined as calluses on the knuckles or back of the hand due to repeated self-induced vomiting over long periods of time.
simple_sent: Russell's sign, named after the British psychiatrist Gerald Russell, is a sign that people get after they throw up a lot. It looks like calluses on the hand or the back of the hand.

simple_sent: A gastric chief cell (or peptic cell, or gastric zymogenic cell) is a cell found in the top of the stomach. It releases pepsinogen and gastric lipase when there is a lot of food in the stomach.

simple_sent: Ankyloglossia, also known as tongue-tie, is a condition where the tip of the tongue is not able to come out of the mouth as easily. It is caused by an unusually short, thick part of the tongue called the lingual frenulum.

ori_sentence: The postcentral sulcus of the parietal lobe lies parallel to, and behind, the central sulcus in the human brain.

ori_sentence: Psychological pain, mental pain, or emotional pain is an unpleasant feeling (a suffering) of a psychological, non-physical origin.
simple_sent: Mental pain, psychological pain, or emotional pain is a feeling. It can be physical, but it can also be psychological.

simple_sent: Degenerative disease is the result of changes in the cells of the body. These changes affect tissues or organs, and they get worse over time.

ori_sentence: CFU-GEMM is a colony forming unit that generates myeloid cells.
simple_sent: The CFU-GEMM is a special unit that makes myeloid cells.

simple_sent: Argentine hemorrhagic fever (AHF) or O'Higgins disease is an infectious disease. It is also known as mal de los rastrojos (stubble disease) in Argentina.

simple_sent: Hyperpigmentation is when an area of skin or nails gets dark because of too much melanin.

ori_sentence: Radial head fractures are a common type of elbow fracture that typically occurs after a fall on an outstretched arm.
simple_sent: Radial head fractures are the most common type of elbow fracture. They usually happen after a fall.

simple_sent: Hyperkinesia is when there is an increase in muscular activity. This can be a normal movement, an abnormal movement, or a combination of both.

simple_sent: An ovarian follicle is a small group of cells. They are found in the ovaries.

simple_sent: 2q37 monosomy is a rare genetic disorder. It happens when a section of chromosome 2 is changed.

ori_sentence: In human anatomy, the carotid sinus is a dilated area at the base of the internal carotid artery just superior to the bifurcation of the internal carotid and external carotid at the level of the superior border of thyroid cartilage.
simple_sent: In human anatomy, the carotid sinus is a dilated area at the base of the internal carotid artery. The carotid sinus is located at the point where the internal carotid artery meets the external carotid artery.

simple_sent: Hamman's sign (sometimes called Hammond's sign or Hammond's crunch) is a sound that can be heard when someone has emphysema. It is like a crunching, rasping sound.

ori_sentence: Shwartzman phenomenon is a rare reaction of a body to particular types of toxins, called endotoxins, which cause thrombosis in the affected tissue.
simple_sent: The Shwartzman phenomenon is a rare reaction of a body to a certain toxin. The body does not normally have this reaction.

simple_sent: Hidradenitis suppurativa (also called acne inversa or Verneuil's disease) is a condition where the skin becomes inflamed and swollen. It can last for a long time.

simple_sent: Abnormal posturing is an extension or flexion of the arms or legs that does not need to be done.

simple_sent: Acrivastine is a medication. It is used to treat hay fever and allergies.

simple_sent: Coxa valga is a birth defect of the hip. In this condition, the angle between the head of the femur and the shaft of the pelvis is increased.

simple_sent: Cherubism is a rare condition. It causes the face to look lower in the lower part.

simple_sent: Lipiduria is when there are too many lipids in the urine.

ori_sentence: Neck pain, also known as cervicalgia, is a common problem, with two-thirds of the population having neck pain at some point in their lives.
simple_sent: neck pain, also known as cervicalgia, is a common problem. About two-thirds of people in the United States have neck pain.

simple_sent: Acamprosate (also known as Campral) is a medication. It is used to treat people with alcohol use disorder.

simple_sent: Aceruloplasminemia is a rare disease. In it, the liver can not make the protein ceruloplasmin properly. This protein is needed for copper to move around in the blood.

simple_sent: König's syndrome (also called ileocaecal valve syndrome) is a medical condition. People who have this condition have abdominal pain, diarrhea, gurgling sounds (especially in the right iliac fossa), and abdominal distension.

simple_sent: Melnick-Needles syndrome (also called Melnick-Needles osteodysplasty) is a very rare condition. It affects the development of bones in the body.

simple_sent: Muenke syndrome, also known as FGFR3-related craniosynostosis, is a condition in which certain bones of the skull do not form properly during development. This affects the shape of the head and face.

simple_sent: Barmah Forest virus is a small, non-spherical virus.

simple_sent: Grisel's syndrome is a non-traumatic joint problem. It happens when the atlanto-axial joint becomes too wide.

ori_sentence: McKusick–Kaufman syndrome is a genetic condition associated with MKKS.
simple_sent: McKusick-Kaufman syndrome (MKKS) is a rare genetic disease.

ori_sentence: Aphagia is the inability or refusal to swallow.
simple_sent: Aphagia is not being able to swallow.

simple_sent: Thymoma with immunodeficiency (also known as Good syndrome) is a rare disorder. In people who have this disorder, their immune system does not work properly, and thymoma (usually benign) develops very quickly.

simple_sent: Slipping rib syndrome (SRS) happens when the interchondral ligaments (the bones that connect the back to the front of the body) become weak. This causes the cartilage tips to move.

ori_sentence: Lytico-bodig (also Lytigo-bodig) disease, Guam disease, or amyotrophic lateral sclerosis-parkinsonism-dementia (ALS-PDC) is a neurodegenerative disease of uncertain etiology endemic to the Chamorro people of the island of Guam in Micronesia.
simple_sent: Lytico-bodig (also Lytigo-bodig) disease, Guam disease, or amyotrophic lateral sclerosis-parkinsonism-dementia (ALS-PDC) is a disease that affects the Chamorro people. They live on the island of Guam in the United States.

ori_sentence: The zona glomerulosa (sometimes, glomerular zone) of the adrenal gland is the most superficial layer of the adrenal cortex, lying directly beneath the renal capsule.
simple_sent: The zona glomerulosa (sometimes called the glomerular zone) is a small part of the adrenal cortex. It is directly below the renal capsule.

ori_sentence: Urodynamic testing or urodynamics is a study that assesses how the bladder and urethra are performing their job of storing and releasing urine.
simple_sent: Urodynamic testing or urodynamics is a test to see how well the bladder and urethra are working. It is done to check health.

ori_sentence: Acariasis is an infestation with mites.
simple_sent: Acariasis is a mite infestation.

ori_sentence: The amygdala (/əˈmɪɡdələ/; plural: amygdalae /əˈmɪɡdəli, -laɪ/ or amygdalas; also corpus amygdaloideum; Latin from Greek, ἀμυγδαλή, amygdalē, 'almond', 'tonsil') is one of two almond-shaped clusters of nuclei located deep and medially within the temporal lobes of the brain's cerebrum in complex vertebrates, including humans.
simple_sent: The amygdala (from Greek, 'almond', 'tonsil' or ' amygdalae' or ' corpus amygdaloideum ') is an almond-shaped part of the brain. It is found in the temporal lobes of the brain in all vertebrates, including humans.

ori_sentence: Vortioxetine, sold under the brand names Trintellix and Brintellix among others, is a medication used to treat major depressive disorder.
simple_sent: Vortioxetine (also known as Trintellix and Brintellix) is a drug. It is used to treat major depressive disorder.

ori_sentence: Joint stiffness may be either the symptom of pain on moving a joint, the symptom of loss of range of motion or the physical sign of reduced range of motion.
simple_sent: Joint stiffness may be either a physical sign of reduced range of motion or a symptom of pain when moving a joint.

ori_sentence: Anthelmintics or antihelminthics are a group of antiparasitic drugs that expel parasitic worms (helminths) and other internal parasites from the body by either stunning or killing them and without causing significant damage to the host.
simple_sent: Anthelmintics or antihelminthics are a group of drugs that help to kill or remove parasites from the body. They do this by either stunning or killing the parasites, and they do not cause any damage to the host.

ori_sentence: Hypobetalipoproteinemia is a disorder consisting of low levels of LDL cholesterol or apolipoprotein B, below the 5th percentile.
simple_sent: Hypobetalipoproteinemia: This condition causes low levels of apolipoprotein B and/or LDL cholesterol.

ori_sentence: Erotophobia is a term coined by a number of researchers in the late 1970s and early 1980s to describe one pole on a continuum of attitudes and beliefs about sexuality.
simple_sent: Erotophobia is a term that was created by some people in the late 1970s and early 1980s. They wanted to show that there were many different views about sexuality.

simple_sent: Many people have more than one hamartoma. This is called multiple hamartoma.

ori_sentence: Adenoiditis is the inflammation of the adenoid tissue usually caused by an infection.
simple_sent: Adenoiditis is an inflammation of the adenoids. It usually happens during an infection.

ori_sentence: Melioidosis is an infectious disease caused by a Gram-negative bacterium called Burkholderia pseudomallei.
simple_sent: Melioidosis is a disease. It is caused by a bacterium, Burkholderia pseudomallei.

ori_sentence: Eisenmenger's syndrome is defined as the process in which a long-standing left-to-right cardiac shunt caused by a congenital heart defect (typically by a ventricular septal defect, atrial septal defect, or less commonly, patent ductus arteriosus) causes pulmonary hypertension and eventual reversal of the shunt into a cyanotic right-to-left shunt.
simple_sent: Eisenmenger's syndrome is a condition in which a left-to-right cardiac shunt is turned into a cyanotic right-to-left shunt. This happens because of a congenital heart defect, usually a ventricular septal defect, atrial septal defect, or less commonly, patent ductus arteriosus.

ori_sentence: A rectocele
simple_sent: A diaphragm

ori_sentence: Brimonidine is a medication used to treat open-angle glaucoma, ocular hypertension, and rosacea.
simple_sent: Brimonidine is a medication. It is used to treat rosacea and open-angle glaucoma.

ori_sentence: Optic neuritis describes any condition that causes inflammation of the optic nerve; it may be associated with demyelinating diseases, or infectious or inflammatory processes.
simple_sent: Optic neuritis describes any condition that causes inflammation of the optic nerve. There are two main types of optic neuritis: acute and chronic.

ori_sentence: Diaphragmatic paradox or paradoxical diaphragm phenomenon is an abnormal medical sign observed during respiration, in which the diaphragm moves opposite to the normal directions of its movements.
simple_sent: The diaphragmatic paradox or paradoxical diaphragm phenomenon is a medical sign. When someone breathes, their diaphragm moves in a different direction than what is normal.

simple_sent: Testicular dysgenesis syndrome is a condition in which the male sex organs do not work properly. There are symptoms and disorders such as cryptorchidism and poor semen quality.

ori_sentence: The hymen is a thin piece of mucosal tissue that surrounds or partially covers the external vaginal opening.
simple_sent: The hymen is a thin piece of tissue. It covers the opening of the vaginal opening, called the hymen.

ori_sentence: Chondrocalcinosis or cartilage calcification is calcification (accumulation of calcium salts) in hyaline cartilage and/or fibrocartilage.
simple_sent: Chondrocalcinosis, also known as cartilage calcification, is a condition where calcium salts build up in cartilage.

ori_sentence: Organic personality disorder (OPD), irrespective of the apparent nomenclature, is not included in the group of personality disorders.

simple_sent: Chlorothiazide, also known as Diuril, is a chemical compound. It is used as a diuretic to reduce water retention.

ori_sentence: Crackles are the clicking, rattling, or crackling noises that may be made by one or both lungs of a human with a respiratory disease during inhalation.
simple_sent: Crackles are sounds that a human makes when he or she breathes in air. They may be clicking, rattling, or crackling noises.

simple_sent: Epidermodysplasia verruciformis (EV), also known as treeman syndrome, is a rare disease. People who have this condition have a higher risk of getting skin cancer.

ori_sentence: Sulindac is a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) of the arylalkanoic acid class that is marketed as Clinoril.

ori_sentence: A cervical rib in humans is an extra rib which arises from the seventh cervical vertebra.
simple_sent: A cervical rib is an extra rib in humans. It comes from the seventh cervical vertebra.

ori_sentence: Anterograde amnesia is a loss of the ability to create new memories after the event that caused amnesia, leading to a partial or complete inability to recall the recent past, while long-term memories from before the event remain intact.
simple_sent: Anterograde amnesia is a loss of the ability to create new memories after an event. This can cause a person to not be able to remember things from the past, even though they have long-term memories of what happened.

ori_sentence: Pseudomyxoma peritonei (PMP) is a clinical condition caused by cancerous cells (mucinous adenocarcinoma) that produce abundant mucin or gelatinous ascites.
simple_sent: Pseudomyxoma peritonei (PMP) is a cancer of the peritoneal cavity. It is caused by mucinous adenocarcinoma, a type of cancer.

ori_sentence: Lymphedema–distichiasis syndrome is a medical condition associated with the FOXC2 gene.
simple_sent: Lymphedema-distichiasis syndrome is a disease. It is caused by the FOXC2 gene.

ori_sentence: Timothy syndrome is a rare autosomal-dominant disorder characterized by physical malformations, as well as neurological and developmental defects, including heart QT-prolongation, heart arrhythmias, structural heart defects, syndactyly (webbing of fingers and toes), and autism spectrum disorders.
simple_sent: Timothy syndrome is a rare disorder. People with Timothy syndrome have physical problems, as well as neurological and developmental problems. People with Timothy syndrome have heart problems, heart arrhythmias, heart defects, and problems with the fingers and toes.

ori_sentence: Enuresis is a repeated inability to control urination.
simple_sent: Enuresis is when the person can not control urination.

ori_sentence: Gestational trophoblastic disease (GTD) is a term used for a group of pregnancy-related tumours.
simple_sent: Gestational trophoblastic disease (GTD) is a disease that happens during pregnancy.

ori_sentence: Hand-foot-genital syndrome (HFGS) is characterized by limb malformations and urogenital defects.
simple_sent: Hand-foot-genital syndrome (HFGS) is a birth defect. It causes problems with the feet.

ori_sentence: Occipital horn syndrome (OHS), formerly considered a variant of Ehlers–Danlos syndrome, is an X-linked recessive mitochondrial and connective tissue disorder.
simple_sent: Occipital horn syndrome (OHS) is a rare disorder. It is similar to Ehlers-Danlos syndrome, but Occipital horn syndrome is different.

simple_sent: Anti-mitochondrial antibodies (AMA) are antibodies that are made by the body. They are made against mitochondria, which are cells in the liver.

ori_sentence: In vertebrates, thoracic vertebrae compose the middle segment of the vertebral column, between the cervical vertebrae and the lumbar vertebrae.
simple_sent: The thoracic vertebrae are the middle group of vertebrae in the human body. They are located between the lumbar and cervical vertebrae.

ori_sentence: Waardenburg Syndrome Type 1 is a congenital disorder that caused by a mutation in the PAX3 gene that results in abnormal development in the neural crest during early development.
simple_sent: Waardenburg Syndrome Type 1 is a genetic disorder. It is caused by a change in a gene called PAX3. This changes the way the brain develops early in life.

ori_sentence: Spondylolisthesis is the displacement of one spinal vertebra compared to another.
simple_sent: Spondylolisthesis is when one spinal vertebra is moved forward or backward.

ori_sentence: Gingival recession, also known as receding gums, is the exposure in the roots of the teeth caused by a loss of gum tissue and/or retraction of the gingival margin from the crown of the teeth.
simple_sent: Gingival recession, also known as receding gums, is when the roots of the teeth become exposed. This is because the gingival margin (the part of the gum that sticks out from the crown) is lost.

ori_sentence: The nasal cannula (NC) is a device used to deliver supplemental oxygen or increased airflow to a patient or person in need of respiratory help.
simple_sent: A nasal cannula (NC) is a machine that is used to give a person more oxygen when they need more oxygen, or to help their breathing.

ori_sentence: Tachypnea, also spelt tachypnoea, is a respiratory rate greater than normal, resulting in abnormally rapid breathing.
simple_sent: Tachypnea, also called tachypnoea, is when a person's breathing is faster than normal. This is called rapid breathing.

ori_sentence: Antibiotic-associated diarrhea (AAD) results from an imbalance in the colonic microbiota caused by antibiotics.
simple_sent: Antibiotic-associated diarrhea (AAD) is a disease. It is caused by taking certain antibiotics.

ori_sentence: Sedation is the reduction of irritability or agitation by administration of sedative drugs, generally to facilitate a medical procedure or diagnostic procedure.
simple_sent: Sedation is the reduction of a person's irritability or agitation by giving them drugs. This is usually done to help a medical procedure.

ori_sentence: Dubowitz syndrome is a rare genetic disorder characterized by microcephaly, stunted growth, and a receding chin.
simple_sent: Dubowitz syndrome is a rare disease. People with Dubowitz syndrome have small heads, and a receding chin.

ori_sentence: Rhythmic movement disorder (RMD) is a neurological disorder characterized by repetitive movements of large muscle groups immediately before and during sleep often involving the head and neck.
simple_sent: Rhythmic movement disorder (RMD) is a neurological disorder. It is caused by repeated movements of the head and neck, especially during sleep.

simple_sent: Neurodevelopmental disorders are a group of disorders that affect the development of the nervous system. These disorders can cause problems with memory, learning, emotion, and other things.

simple_sent: Diffuse large B-cell lymphoma (DLBCL) is a cancer of the B cells. B cells are a type of immune cells.

ori_sentence: In human anatomy, the superior mesenteric artery (SMA) arises from the anterior surface of the abdominal aorta, just inferior to the origin of the celiac trunk, and supplies blood to the intestine from the lower part of the duodenum through two-thirds of the transverse colon, as well as the pancreas.
simple_sent: In human anatomy, the superior mesenteric artery (SMA) comes from the anterior surface of the abdominal aorta. It supplies blood to the intestine from the lower part of the duodenum through two-thirds of the transverse colon, as well as the pancreas.

ori_sentence: Neonatal alloimmune thrombocytopenia (NAITP, NAIT, NATP or NAT) is a disease that affects babies in which the platelet count is decreased because the mother's immune system attacks her fetus' or newborn's platelets.
simple_sent: Neonatal alloimmune thrombocytopenia (NAITP, NAIT, NATP or NAT) is a disease that happens when the baby's blood does not have enough platelets. This is because the baby's immune system attacks its platelets.

ori_sentence: Latrodectism (/lætrəˈdɛktɪzəm/) is the illness caused by the bite of Latrodectus spiders (the black widow spider and related species).
simple_sent: Latrodectism is a disease. It is caused by the bite of a black widow spider. There are many different kinds of Latrodectus spiders.

simple_sent: Dissociative disorders (DD) happen when a person's memory, awareness, or perception is affected in a bad way.

simple_sent: An antiemetic is a drug that helps to stop nausea and vomiting.

simple_sent: CADASIL or CADASIL syndrome is the most common form of hereditary stroke disorder. It involves cerebral autosomal dominant arteriopathy with subcortical infarcts and leukoencephalopathy, and is thought to be caused by mutations in the Notch 3 gene.

simple_sent: CHARGE syndrome (also called CHARGE association) is a rare disease. It is caused by a gene.

simple_sent: The inferior colliculus (IC) is the main midbrain nucleus of the auditory pathway. It receives input from several other nuclei in the brain (the brainstem nuclei), as well as from the part of the brain called the auditory cortex.

simple_sent: A hemothorax is an area of blood inside the pleural cavity. The word comes from hemo- [blood] + thorax [chest].

ori_sentence: A major organ of the endocrine system, the anterior pituitary (also called the adenohypophysis or pars anterior) is the glandular, anterior lobe that together with the posterior lobe (posterior pituitary, or the neurohypophysis) makes up the pituitary gland (hypophysis).
simple_sent: The anterior pituitary (also called the adenohypophysis or pars anterior) is the anterior lobe of the pituitary gland. The posterior lobe of the pituitary gland is called the neurohypophysis and is the other part of the endocrine system.

simple_sent: Polymyositis (PM) is an inflammation of the muscles. It is similar to dermatomyositis and inclusion body myositis, but it is more common.

simple_sent: Labored respiration or labored breathing is an abnormal way of breathing. It means that it takes more effort to breathe, and that the muscles that help breathing are not working properly.

simple_sent: Secondary hypertension (or, less commonly, inessential hypertension) is when a person's blood pressure is too high. It is usually caused by other things.

simple_sent: The zona reticularis is the innermost layer of the adrenal cortex. It is sometimes called the reticulate zone or reticulate layer.

simple_sent: The entorhinal cortex (EC) is an area of the brain in the medial temporal lobe. The entorhinal cortex is an important part of the brain, and is located in the medial temporal lobe.

simple_sent: HIV in pregnancy is when a woman has an infection while she is pregnant.

simple_sent: Group B streptococcal infection, also known as Group B streptococcal disease or just Group B strep, is a disease. The bacterium that causes Group B streptococcal infection is Streptococcus agalactiae.

simple_sent: Arhinia is when a baby does not have a nose when they are born.

simple_sent: Morquio syndrome, also known as Mucopolysaccharidosis Type IV (MPS IV), is a disease. It happens when a person's body can not process certain sugar molecules, called GAGs, properly.

simple_sent: A gluten-free diet (GFD) is a diet that does not include any foods that have gluten in them. This includes all the proteins that are found in wheat, as well as other grains like barley, rye, and oats.

simple_sent: Tofacitinib (also known as Xeljanz) is a prescription drug. It is used to treat rheumatoid arthritis, psoriatic arthritis, and ulcerative colitis.

simple_sent: Dextrocardia (from Latin dexter, meaning "right," and Greek kardia, meaning "heart") is a condition in which the heart is not in the right place in the body at all.

simple_sent: Keratosis pilaris atrophicans faciei starts when the child is young, as follicular papules.

simple_sent: Phlegmasia alba dolens (also known as milk leg or white leg) is a disease. It is related to deep vein thrombosis and is the most common cause of pulmonary edema.

ori_sentence: Otoplasty (Greek: οὖς, oûs, "ear" + πλάσσειν, plássein, "to shape") denotes the surgical and non-surgical procedures for correcting the deformities and defects of the pinna (external ear), and for reconstructing a defective, or deformed, or absent external ear, consequent to congenital conditions (e.g. microtia, anotia, etc.)
simple_sent: Otoplasty (Greek: ã ã ã ã ã ã ã, oûs, "ear" + ã ã ã ã ã, plássein, "to shape") is a surgical and non-surgical procedure. It is done to correct the deformities and defects of the pinna (external ear), and to make an external ear that is better, or to replace one that is missing.

ori_sentence: An incisional hernia is a type of hernia caused by an incompletely-healed surgical wound.
simple_sent: An incisional hernia is a hernia that has not been fully healed after surgery.

simple_sent: The jejunal arteries supply blood to the jejunum. They are branches of the superior mesenteric artery.

simple_sent: Polyhydramnios is when there is too much amniotic fluid in the amniotic sac.

simple_sent: Bolivian hemorrhagic fever (BHF), also known as black typhus or Ordog Fever, is a disease. It is caused by a virus called Machupo mammarenavirus.

ori_sentence: The cough reflex has both sensory (afferent) and motor (efferent) components, the former mainly via the vagus nerve.
simple_sent: The cough reflex has both motor and sensory components. The motor part is controlled by the vagus nerve.

ori_sentence: Acute leukemia or acute leukaemia is a family of serious medical conditions relating to an original diagnosis of leukemia.
simple_sent: Acute leukemia or acute leukaemia is a disease. People who have been diagnosed with acute leukemia are called acute.

ori_sentence: Dystrophic calcification (DC) is the calcification occurring in degenerated or necrotic tissue, as in hyalinized scars, degenerated foci in leiomyomas, and caseous nodules.
simple_sent: Dystrophic calcification (DC) is the growth of calcification in tissue that has become weak or dead. This can be seen in hyalinized scars and leiomyomas.

simple_sent: A synovial sarcoma (also known as malignant synovioma) is a type of cancer. It is a type of cancer that does not usually occur in children and usually does not affect the arms or legs.

ori_sentence: The stomach is a muscular, hollow organ in the gastrointestinal tract of humans and many other animals, including several invertebrates.
simple_sent: The stomach is a large, hollow organ in the human body. Many animals, including some invertebrates, have a stomach.

ori_sentence: Accessory breasts, also known as polymastia, supernumerary breasts, or mammae erraticae, is the condition of having an additional breast.
simple_sent: Accessory breasts, also known as polymastia, supernumerary breasts, or mammae erraticae, is when a woman has more than one breast.

ori_sentence: Hypoproteinemia is a condition where there is an abnormally low level of protein in the blood.
simple_sent: Hypoproteinemia is when the level of protein in the blood is too low.

simple_sent: Sparfloxacin is an antibiotic. It is a type of fluoroquinolone drug.
