simple_sent: Trifascicular block is a problem with the electrical signal going from the atrioventricular node to the ventricles. The three main parts of the heart are called fascicles.

ori_sentence: Delavirdine (DLV) (brand name Rescriptor) is a non-nucleoside reverse transcriptase inhibitor (NNRTI) marketed by ViiV Healthcare.
simple_sent: Delavirdine (also known as Rescriptor) is a non-nucleoside reverse transcriptase inhibitor. It is marketed by ViiV Healthcare.

ori_sentence: A saddle sore in humans is a skin ailment on the buttocks due to, or exacerbated by, horse riding or cycling on a bicycle saddle.
simple_sent: A saddle sore is a skin problem on the buttocks. It can be caused by riding a horse, or riding a bicycle with a saddle.

ori_sentence: Achilles bursitis is bursitis (inflammation of synovial sac) of bursa situated above the insertion of tendon to calcaneus.
simple_sent: Achilles bursitis is bursitis of the bursa above the tendon to calcaneus. This is called synovial sac bursitis.

ori_sentence: Angiosarcoma is a rare and aggressive cancer that starts in the endothelial cells that line the walls of blood vessels or lymphatic vessels.
simple_sent: Angiosarcoma is a rare type of cancer. It starts in the cells that line the walls of blood vessels, called endothelial cells.

ori_sentence: Cangrelor, sold under the brand name Kengreal in the United States, CANREAL in India ( MSN Labs ) and Kengrexal in the European Union) is a P2Y12 inhibitor FDA approved as of June 2015 as an antiplatelet drug for intravenous application.
simple_sent: Cangrelor (also known as Kengreal in the United States and Kengrexal in the European Union) is an antiplatelet drug. It is sold under the brand name Kengreal in the United States and CANREAL in India.

ori_sentence: Sandifer syndrome (or Sandifer's syndrome) is an eponymous paediatric medical disorder, characterised by gastrointestinal symptoms and associated neurological features.
simple_sent: Sandifer syndrome (also called Sandifer's syndrome) is a medical disorder. People who have the disease have gastrointestinal symptoms.

ori_sentence: Vancomycin-resistant Enterococcus, or vancomycin-resistant enterococci (VRE), are bacterial strains of the genus Enterococcus that are resistant to the antibiotic vancomycin.
simple_sent: Vancomycin-resistant Enterococcus (VRE) is a group of bacteria. These bacteria are resistant to the antibiotic vancomycin, but they still get sick.

ori_sentence: Essential hypertension (also called primary hypertension, or idiopathic hypertension) is the form of hypertension that by definition has no identifiable secondary cause.
simple_sent: Essential hypertension (also called primary hypertension or idiopathic hypertension) is when the blood pressure in the body is too high.

ori_sentence: The transverse colon is the longest and most movable part of the colon.
simple_sent: The transverse colon is the part of the colon that is moving.

ori_sentence: Heberden's nodes are hard or bony swellings that can develop in the distal interphalangeal joints (DIP) (the joints closest to the end of the fingers and toes).
simple_sent: Heberden's nodes are hard or bony swelling in the joints of the hand and foot. These joints are called interphalangeal joints (DIP).

ori_sentence: First-degree atrioventricular block (AV block) is a disease of the electrical conduction system of the heart in which electrical impulses conduct from the cardiac atria to the ventricles through the atrioventricular node (AV node) more slowly than normal.
simple_sent: First-degree atrioventricular block (AV block) is a disease of the heart. In it, the electrical signals that go from the heart's atria to the ventricles go through the atrioventricular node (AV node) more slowly than normal.

ori_sentence: Caput medusae is the appearance of distended and engorged superficial epigastric veins, which are seen radiating from the umbilicus across the abdomen.
simple_sent: Caput medusae is the appearance of large, open, superficial veins in the abdomen. These veins can be seen from the umbilicus.

ori_sentence: The mitral valve (/ˈmaɪtrəl/), also known as the bicuspid valve or left atrioventricular valve, is one of the four heart valves.
simple_sent: The mitral valve, also called the left atrioventricular valve or bicuspid valve, is a valve in the heart.

ori_sentence: Chauffeur's fracture, also known as Hutchinson fracture, is a type of oblique fracture of the radial styloid process in the forearm.
simple_sent: Chauffeur's fracture, also known as Hutchinson fracture, is a fracture of the radial bone in the forearm.

ori_sentence: Isodicentric 15, also called marker chromosome 15 syndrome, idic(15), partial tetrasomy 15q, or inverted duplication 15
simple_sent: Isodicentric 15 syndrome, also called idic(15), inverted duplication 15 or marker chromosome 15 syndrome

ori_sentence: Ximelagatran (Exanta or Exarta, H 376/95) is an anticoagulant that has been investigated extensively as a replacement for warfarin that would overcome the problematic dietary, drug interaction, and monitoring issues associated with warfarin therapy.
simple_sent: Ximelagatran (also known as Exanta or Exarta, H 376/95) is an anticoagulant that is being studied as a replacement for warfarin. Warfarin is a drug that helps people with blood pressure problems.

ori_sentence: Thrombocytopenia is a condition characterized by abnormally low levels of platelets, also known as thrombocytes, in the blood.
simple_sent: Thrombocytopenia is a condition in which the blood has very low levels of platelets. These platelets are called thrombocytes.

ori_sentence: Frequent urination is the need to urinate more often than usual.
simple_sent: Frequent urination: The need to urinate more than usual.

ori_sentence: A double inlet left ventricle (DILV) or "single ventricle", is a congenital heart defect appearing in 5 in 100,000 newborns, where both the left atrium and the right atrium feed into the left ventricle.
simple_sent: A double inlet left ventricle (DILV) or "single ventricle", is a defect in the heart. In this case, the right atrium and left atrium both feed into the left ventricle.

ori_sentence: Acne keloidalis nuchae (also known as "acne keloidalis", "dermatitis papillaris capillitii", "folliculitis keloidalis", "
simple_sent: Acne keloidalis nuchae (also known as dermatitis papillaris capillitii) is a skin condition.

ori_sentence: Erythrokeratodermia variabilis (also known as "erythrokeratodermia figurata variabilis", "keratosis extremitatum progrediens", "
simple_sent: Erythrokeratodermia figurata variabilis (also known as Erythrokeratodermia figurata variabilis) is a type of bone cancer.

ori_sentence: Adapalene is a third-generation topical retinoid primarily used in the treatment of mild-moderate acne, and is also used off-label to treat keratosis pilaris as well as other skin conditions.
simple_sent: Adapalene is a third-generation topical retinoid that is used to treat mild-moderate acne. It is also used to treat other skin conditions, such as keratosis pilaris.

ori_sentence: Congenital adrenal hyperplasia (CAH) is a group of autosomal recessive disorders characterized by impaired cortisol synthesis.
simple_sent: Congenital adrenal hyperplasia (CAH) is a disease. It is caused by a defect in the production of cortisol.

ori_sentence: Medial to the opening for the carotid canal and close to its posterior border, in front of the jugular fossa, is a triangular depression; at the apex of this is a small opening, the aquaeductus cochleae (or cochlear aqueduct, or aqueduct of cochlea), which lodges a tubular prolongation of the dura mater establishing a communication between the perilymphatic space and the subarachnoid space, and transmits a vein from the cochlea to join the internal jugular vein.
simple_sent: Medial to the opening for the carotid canal and close to its posterior border, in front of the jugular fossa, is a triangular depression; at the apex of this is a small opening, the aquaeductus cochleae (or cochlear aqueduct, or aqueduct of cochlea), which allows blood to flow from the perilymphatic space to the subarachnoid space, and from the subarachnoid space to the internal jugular vein.

ori_sentence: Clofibrate (trade name Atromid-S) is a lipid-lowering agent used for controlling the high cholesterol and triacylglyceride level in the blood.
simple_sent: Clofibrate (also known as Atromid-S) is a chemical compound. It is used to lower the level of cholesterol in the blood.

ori_sentence: Papulonecrotic tuberculid is usually an asymptomatic, chronic skin disorder, presenting in successive crops, skin lesions symmetrically distributed on the extensor extremities.
simple_sent: Papulonecrotic tuberculid is usually an asymptomatic, chronic skin disorder. The skin lesions appear on the extensor extremities of the body without warning.

ori_sentence: Bruxism is excessive teeth grinding or jaw clenching.
simple_sent: Bruxism is when the teeth are too close together.

ori_sentence: The Lachman test is a clinical test used to diagnose injury of the anterior cruciate ligament (ACL).
simple_sent: The Lachman test is a test to see if a player's right anterior cruciate ligament is damaged.

ori_sentence: Salpingitis is an infection and inflammation in the Fallopian tubes (salpinges).
simple_sent: Salpingitis is an infection of the fallopian tubes. It is called salpingitis.

ori_sentence: Fludrocortisone, sold under the brand name Florinef, among others, is a corticosteroid used to treat adrenogenital syndrome, postural hypotension, and adrenal insufficiency.
simple_sent: Fludrocortisone, also known as Florinef, is a corticosteroid. It is used to treat adrenal insufficiency, postural hypotension, and adrenogenital syndrome.

ori_sentence: As a medical term, malaise is a feeling of general discomfort, uneasiness, or pain, and often the first sign of an infection or other disease.
simple_sent: As a medical term, malaise is a feeling of general discomfort, uneasiness, or pain. It can also be a sign of a disease or infection.

ori_sentence: Molar incisor hypomineralisation (MIH) is a type of enamel defect affecting, as the name suggests, the first molars and incisors in the permanent dentition.
simple_sent: Molar incisor hypomineralisation (MIH) is a problem with the teeth. The problem usually happens to the first molars and incisors in the mouth.

ori_sentence: Descemet's membrane (or the Descemet membrane) is the basement membrane that lies between the corneal proper substance, also called stroma, and the endothelial layer of the cornea.
simple_sent: Descemet's membrane (or the Descemet membrane) is a membrane in the middle of the cornea. It is the part of the cornea that is between the stroma and the endothelial layer.

ori_sentence: Familial hypercholesterolemia (FH) is a genetic disorder characterized by high cholesterol levels, specifically very high levels of low-density lipoprotein (LDL, "bad cholesterol"), in the blood and early cardiovascular disease.
simple_sent: Familial hypercholesterolemia (FH) is a genetic disorder. People who have the disease will have very high levels of bad cholesterol in their blood, and they will have early cardiovascular disease.

ori_sentence: Thyrotoxic periodic paralysis (TPP) is a condition featuring attacks of muscle weakness in the presence of hyperthyroidism (overactivity of the thyroid gland).
simple_sent: Thyrotoxic periodic paralysis (TPP) is a medical condition. When a person has overactivity of the thyroid gland, they may have muscle weakness.

ori_sentence: Antiphospholipid syndrome, or antiphospholipid antibody syndrome (APS or APLS), is an autoimmune, hypercoagulable state caused by antiphospholipid antibodies.
simple_sent: Antiphospholipid syndrome or antiphospholipid antibody syndrome (APS or APLS) is a disease. People who have it will have many problems.

ori_sentence: Froin's syndrome – coexistence of xanthochromia, high protein level and marked coagulation of cerebrospinal fluid (CSF).
simple_sent: Froin's syndrome. This condition has a high protein level, and the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) is coagulated.

ori_sentence: The thoracic cavity (or chest cavity) is the chamber of the body of vertebrates that is protected by the thoracic wall (rib cage and associated skin, muscle, and fascia).
simple_sent: The thoracic cavity (or chest cavity) is the chamber of the body where the heart, intestines, and large intestines are. It is protected by the thoracic wall.

ori_sentence: Miller syndrome, also known as Genée–Wiedemann syndrome, Wildervanck–Smith syndrome or postaxial acrofacial dystosis, is an extremely rare genetic condition that manifests as craniofacial, limb and eye deformities.
simple_sent: Miller syndrome, also known as Genée-Wiedemann syndrome, Wildervanck-Smith syndrome, or postaxial acrofacial dystosis, is a condition where a person's face and body do not look the same.

ori_sentence: Gynecologic ultrasonography or gynecologic sonography refers to the application of medical ultrasonography to the female pelvic organs (specifically the uterus, the ovaries, and the fallopian tubes) as well as the bladder, the adnexa, and the recto-uterine pouch.
simple_sent: Gynecologic ultrasonography or gynecologic sonography is a medical test to see if the inside of a woman's body is clear. It can be used to look at the uterus, the ovaries, the fallopian tubes, the bladder, and the adnexa.

ori_sentence: The rete testis (/ˈriːti ˈtɛstɪs/ REE-tee TES-tis) is an anastomosing network of delicate tubules located in the hilum of the testicle (mediastinum testis) that carries sperm from the seminiferous tubules to the efferent ducts.
simple_sent: The rete testis (Greek: REE-tee TES-tis) is a network of small tubules in the part of the testicle that carries sperm. The testicles are located in the part of the human body that is called the testicle.

ori_sentence: Anterior ischemic optic neuropathy (AION) is a medical condition involving loss of vision caused by damage to the optic nerve as a result of insufficient blood supply (ischemia).
simple_sent: Anterior ischemic optic neuropathy (AION) is a medical condition that can cause loss of vision. This happens when the optic nerve can not get enough blood.

ori_sentence: Narcosis while diving (also known as nitrogen narcosis, inert gas narcosis, raptures of the deep, Martini effect) is a reversible alteration in consciousness that occurs while diving at depth.
simple_sent: Narcosis while diving (also called nitrogen narcosis, inert gas narcosis, or raptures of the deep) is a change in consciousness that happens when you go underwater.

ori_sentence: Meningioma, also known as meningeal tumor, is typically a slow-growing tumor that forms from the meninges, the membranous layers surrounding the brain and spinal cord.
simple_sent: Meningioma, also known as meningeal tumor, is a cancer of the meninges. The meninges are the layers of tissue around the brain and spinal cord.

ori_sentence: The yolk sac is a membranous sac attached to an embryo, formed by cells of the hypoblast adjacent to the embryonic disk.
simple_sent: The yolk sac is a small sac inside an embryo. The cells that make up the yolk sac are called hypoblast cells.

ori_sentence: Gray baby syndrome (also termed Gray or Grey syndrome) is a rare but serious, even fatal, side effect that occurs in newborn infants (especially premature babies) following the accumulation of antibiotic chloramphenicol.
simple_sent: Gray baby syndrome (also called Gray or Grey syndrome) is a very bad side effect. It happens to newborn babies, especially when they have taken an antibiotic for a long time, like chloramphenicol.

ori_sentence: 3-Methylglutaconic aciduria (MGA) is any of at least five metabolic disorders that impair the body's ability to make energy in the mitochondria.
simple_sent: 3-Methylglutaconic aciduria (MGA) is a disease. There are many different types of MGA, and they all affect how the body makes energy.

ori_sentence: Balsalazide is an anti-inflammatory drug used in the treatment of inflammatory bowel disease.
simple_sent: Balsalazide is an anti-inflammatory drug. It is used to treat inflammatory bowel disease.

ori_sentence: Busulfan (Myleran, GlaxoSmithKline, Busulfex IV, Otsuka America Pharmaceutical, Inc.) is a chemotherapy drug in use since 1959.
simple_sent: Busulfan (also known as Myleran and Busulfex) is a chemotherapy drug. It has been used since 1959.

ori_sentence: A language delay is a language disorder in which a child fails to develop language abilities at the usual age-appropriate period in their developmental timetable.
simple_sent: A language delay is when a child does not learn a language at an age when they should be learning it, but instead they wait until they are older.

ori_sentence: A factitious disorder is a condition in which a person, without a malingering motive, acts as if they have an illness by deliberately producing, feigning, or exaggerating symptoms, purely to attain (for themselves or for another) a patient's role.
simple_sent: A factitious disorder is a condition in which a person acts as if they have an illness, even though they do not. The person may make up symptoms, or pretend they have them, to make themselves look better, or to get attention.

ori_sentence: Valdecoxib is a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) used in the treatment of osteoarthritis, rheumatoid arthritis, and painful menstruation and menstrual symptoms.
simple_sent: Valdecoxib is a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID). It is used to treat rheumatoid arthritis, osteoarthritis, and other conditions.

ori_sentence: In psychology, avoidance coping is a coping mechanism and form of experiential avoidance.
simple_sent: In psychology, avoidance coping is when a person tries to avoid something.

ori_sentence: Leiner's disease is a systemic disease, a skin disorder and extends to erythroderma, typically diagnosed in early infancy.
simple_sent: Leiner's disease is a disease of the skin. It can also be called erythroderma. People usually get it in early childhood.

ori_sentence: Mitochondrial encephalopathy, lactic acidosis, and stroke-like episodes (MELAS) is one of the family of mitochondrial diseases, which also include MERRF syndrome, and Leber's hereditary optic neuropathy.
simple_sent: Mitochondrial encephalopathy, lactic acidosis, and stroke-like episodes (MELAS) is a disease. People who have this disease have also been found to have MERRF syndrome and Leber's neuropathy.

ori_sentence: Juvenile xanthogranuloma is a form of histiocytosis, classified as "non-Langerhans cell histiocytosis", or more specifically, "type 2".
simple_sent: Young xanthogranuloma is a form of histiocytosis. This type of histiocytosis is called type 2 or non-Langerhans cell histiocytosis.

ori_sentence: Arachnoiditis is an inflammatory condition of the arachnoid mater or 'arachnoid', one of the membranes known as meninges that surround and protect the nerves of the central nervous system, including the brain and spinal cord.
simple_sent: Arachnoiditis is an infection of the arachnoid mater or 'arachnoid'. The arachnoid is the part of the body where the nerves of the brain and spinal cord are. The arachnoid is part of the meninges.

ori_sentence: Cefuroxime axetil, sold under the brand name Ceftin among others, is a second generation oral cephalosporin antibiotic.
simple_sent: Cefuroxime axetil is a second generation oral cephalosporin antibiotic. It is sold under the brand name Ceftin.

ori_sentence: Double outlet right ventricle (DORV) is a form of congenital heart disease where both of the great arteries connect (in whole or in part) to the right ventricle (RV).
simple_sent: Double outlet right ventricle (DORV) is a heart disease. In this disease, both of the main arteries in the right ventricle are not working properly.

ori_sentence: Superfetation (also spelled superfoetation – see fetus) is the simultaneous occurrence of more than one stage of developing offspring in the same animal.
simple_sent: Superfetation (also spelled superfoetation) means that in the same animal, more than one stage of development takes place at the same time.

ori_sentence: The external iliac arteries are two major arteries which bifurcate off the common iliac arteries anterior to the sacroiliac joint of the pelvis.
simple_sent: The external iliac arteries are two major arteries in the pelvis. They separate the iliac joint from the other two arteries in the pelvis.

ori_sentence: Pancreatic divisum is a congenital anomaly in the anatomy of the ducts of the pancreas in which a single pancreatic duct is not formed, but rather remains as two distinct dorsal and ventral ducts.
simple_sent: Pancreatic divisum is a condition in which there are two different ducts in the pancreas. In a normal pancreas, there is a single duct, but in this case there are two different ducts.

ori_sentence: Liver biopsy is the biopsy (removal of a small sample of tissue) from the liver.
simple_sent: Liver biopsy is when a small piece of tissue is removed from the liver.

itemLabel: malignant migrating partial seizures in infancy
ori_sentence: Malignant migrating partial seizures of infancy (MMPSI) is a rare epileptic syndrome that onsets before 6 months of age, commonly in the first few weeks of life.
simple_sent: Malignant migrating partial seizures of infancy (MMPSI) is a rare condition. It usually starts in the first few weeks of life, before 6 months of age.

ori_sentence: The irregular bones are bones which, from their peculiar form, cannot be grouped as long, short, flat or sesamoid bones.
simple_sent: The irregular bones are bones which are not like other bones. They do not look like long, short, flat bones.

ori_sentence: Microgenia is the medical term for an unusually small or deformed chin.
simple_sent: Microgenia is when a person's chin is unusually small or deformed.

ori_sentence: Carbenicillin is a bactericidal antibiotic belonging to the carboxypenicillin subgroup of the penicillins.
simple_sent: Carbenicillin is an antibiotic. It is a carboxypenicillin, which means it can kill bacteria.

ori_sentence: Conversion disorder (CD), or functional neurologic symptom disorder, is a diagnostic category used in some psychiatric classification systems.
simple_sent: Conversion disorder (also called functional neurologic symptom disorder) is a type of mental illness. It is a symptom disorder.

ori_sentence: Raccoon eyes (also known in the United Kingdom and Ireland as panda eyes) or periorbital ecchymosis is a sign of basal skull fracture or subgaleal hematoma, a craniotomy that ruptured the meninges, or (rarely) certain cancers.
simple_sent: Raccoon eyes (also known in the United Kingdom as panda eyes) or periorbital ecchymosis is a condition where the inside of the skull is broken. This can be caused by a skull fracture or a subgaleal hematoma.

ori_sentence: A Penrose drain is a soft, flexible rubber tube used as a surgical drain, to prevent the buildup of fluid in a surgical site.
simple_sent: A Penrose drain is a soft, flexible rubber tube. It is used as a surgical drain, to stop fluid from building up.

ori_sentence: Elotuzumab, sold under the brand name Empliciti, is a humanized IgG1 monoclonal antibody medication used in combination with lenalidomide and dexamethasone, for adults that have received 1 to 3 prior therapies for the treatment of multiple myeloma.
simple_sent: Elotuzumab (Empliciti) is a humanized IgG1 monoclonal antibody drug that is taken in combination with dexamethasone and lenalidomide. It is used to treat multiple myeloma in adults.

ori_sentence: The peritoneal cavity is a potential space between the parietal peritoneum (the peritoneum that surrounds the abdominal wall) and visceral peritoneum (the peritoneum that surrounds the internal organs).
simple_sent: The peritoneal cavity is a small space in the middle of the body. When people talk about the peritoneum, they usually mean the part of the body that contains the peritoneum.

ori_sentence: Cauda equina syndrome (CES) is a condition that occurs when the bundle of nerves below the end of the spinal cord known as the cauda equina is damaged.
simple_sent: Cauda equina syndrome (CES) is a disease. It happens when the nerves below the end of the spinal cord get damaged, and can not be fixed.

ori_sentence: Carbinoxamine is an antihistamine and anticholinergic agent.
simple_sent: Carbinoxamine is a chemical compound. It is an antihistamine.

ori_sentence: Epiblepharon is a condition characterised by a congenital horizontal fold of skin near the margin of the upper or lower eyelid caused by the abnormal insertion of muscle fibres.
simple_sent: Epiblepharon is a condition where the upper or lower eyelid of an animal has a horizontal fold of skin. This is caused by muscle fibres getting stuck in the skin.

ori_sentence: Capillariasis is a disease caused by nematodes in the genus Capillaria.
simple_sent: Capillariasis is a disease. The disease is caused by nematodes.

ori_sentence: Elastofibroma dorsi is an ill-defined fibroelastic tumor-like condition made up of enlarged and irregular elastic fibers.
simple_sent: Elastofibroma dorsi is a tumor-like condition. It is a condition where the elastic fibers in the skin are too short.

ori_sentence: The cauda equina (from Latin horse's tail) is a bundle of spinal nerves and spinal nerve rootlets, consisting of the second through fifth lumbar nerve pairs, the first through fifth sacral nerve pairs, and the coccygeal nerve, all of which arise from the lumbar enlargement and the conus medullaris of the spinal cord.
simple_sent: The cauda equina (from Latin horse's tail) is a bundle of spinal nerves and spinal nerve rootlets. The cauda equina is made up of the second through fifth lumbar nerve pairs, the first through fifth sacral nerve pairs, and the coccygeal nerve pairs.

ori_sentence: Infantile esotropia is an ocular condition of early onset in which one or either eye turns inward.
simple_sent: Infantile esotropia happens very early in life. When this happens, one eye turns inward.

ori_sentence: Campomelic dysplasia (CMD) is a genetic disorder characterized by bowing of the long bones and many other skeletal and extraskeletal features.
simple_sent: Campomelic dysplasia (CMD) is a genetic disorder. People with the disorder have long bones and their bones do not fit together well.

ori_sentence: Chlorobutanol (trichloro-2-methyl-2-propanol) is a preservative, sedative, hypnotic and weak local anesthetic similar in nature to chloral hydrate.
simple_sent: Chlorobutanol (trichloro-2-methyl-2-propanol) is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is Trichloro-2-methyl-2-propanol.

ori_sentence: Benzaldehyde (C6H5CHO) is an organic compound consisting of a benzene ring with a formyl substituent.
simple_sent: Benzaldehyde is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is C6H5CHO. It has a benzene ring.

ori_sentence: Subdural empyema is a form of empyema – a collection of pus, in the subdural space.
simple_sent: Subdural empyema is when there is pus in the subdural space. This is called empyema.

ori_sentence: Epidermolysis bullosa acquisita is a chronic subepidermal blistering disease associated with autoimmunity to type VII collagen within anchoring fibril structures that are located at the dermoepidermal junction.
simple_sent: Epidermolysis bullosa acquisita is a chronic disease of the epidermal layer of the skin. It is caused by an immune response to type VII collagen inside fibril structures at the dermoepidermal junction.

ori_sentence: Congenital ichthyosiform erythroderma (CIE), also known as Nonbullous congenital ichthyosiform erythroderma is a rare type of the ichthyosis family of skin diseases which occurs in 1 in 200,000 to 300,000 births.
simple_sent: Congenital ichthyosiform erythroderma (CIE), also known as Nonbullous congenital ichthyosiform erythroderma, is a skin disease. About 1 in 200,000 to 300,000 people in the world get it.

ori_sentence: Retinoschisis is an eye disease characterized by the abnormal splitting of the retina's neurosensory layers, usually in the outer plexiform layer.
simple_sent: Retinoschisis is a disease of the eye. It causes the retina to split apart. This usually happens in the outer layer of the retina.

ori_sentence: Duct ectasia of the breast, mammary duct ectasia or plasma cell mastitis is a condition that occurs when a milk duct beneath the nipple widens, the duct walls thicken, and the duct fills with fluid.
simple_sent: Duct ectasia of the breast (also called mammary duct ectasia or plasma cell mastitis) is when the milk duct under the nipple gets bigger. When this happens, fluid gets into the duct.

ori_sentence: Dyskeratosis congenita (DKC),also known as Zinsser-Engman-Cole syndrome, is a rare progressive congenital disorder with a highly variable phenotype.
simple_sent: Dyskeratosis congenita, also known as Zinsser-Engman-Cole syndrome, is a rare disease. It happens to people all over the world.

ori_sentence: Craniometaphyseal dysplasia is a rare skeletal disorder that results from a mutation in the ANKH or GJA1 genes.
simple_sent: Craniometaphyseal dysplasia is a very rare condition. It happens when a person's genes change.

ori_sentence: Hypokinesia is one of the classifications of movement disorders, and refers to decreased bodily movement.
simple_sent: Hypokinesia is a movement disorder. It means that there is less movement in the body.

ori_sentence: Mesangial proliferative glomerulonephritis (MesPGN) is a morphological pattern characterized by a numerical increase in mesangial cells and expansion of the extracellular matrix within the mesangium of the glomerulus.
simple_sent: Mesangial proliferative glomerulonephritis (MesPGN) is a condition in which there are more mesangial cells in the glomerulus. There is also an increase in extracellular matrix in the mesangium.

ori_sentence: A functional murmur (innocent murmur, physiologic murmur) is a heart murmur that is primarily due to physiologic conditions outside the heart, as opposed to structural defects in the heart itself.
simple_sent: A heart murmur that is not functional is called a "innocent murmur". The cause of a heart murmur is usually not in the heart itself, but somewhere else in the body.

simple_sent: Keratosis can mean:

ori_sentence: Anaplastic thyroid cancer (ATC), also known as anaplastic thyroid carcinoma, is an aggressive form of thyroid cancer characterized by uncontrolled growth of cells in the thyroid gland.
simple_sent: Anaplastic thyroid cancer (ATC) is a cancer of the thyroid gland. It is the most common type of thyroid cancer and the second most common cancer in women.

ori_sentence: Blepharochalasis is an inflammation of the eyelid that is characterized by exacerbations and remissions of eyelid edema, which results in a stretching and subsequent atrophy of the eyelid tissue, leading to the formation of redundant folds over the lid margins.
simple_sent: Blepharochalasis is an inflammation of the eyelid that is characterized by exacerbations and remissions of eyelid edema (a fluid build-up on the outside of the eyelid), which can cause the eyelids to become too narrow and hard to open.

ori_sentence: Dysphagia lusoria (or Bayford-Autenrieth dysphagia) is an abnormal condition characterized by difficulty in swallowing caused by an aberrant right subclavian artery.
simple_sent: Dysphagia lusoria (or Bayford-Autenrieth dysphagia) is an abnormal condition. People who have the condition will have difficulty swallowing.

ori_sentence: Anetoderma is a localized laxity of the skin with herniation or outpouching resulting from abnormal dermal elastic tissue.
simple_sent: Anetoderma is a localized problem with the skin. It is caused by abnormal tissue in the dermal area.

ori_sentence: Anisindione (brand name Miradon) is a synthetic anticoagulant and an 1,3-indandione derivative.
simple_sent: Anisindione (brand name Miradon) is a chemical compound. It is an anticoagulant.

ori_sentence: Eales disease is a type of obliterative vasculopathy, also known as angiopathia retinae juvenilis, periphlebitis retinae, primary perivasculitis of the retina.
simple_sent: Eales disease is a disease of the retina. It is also called periphlebitis retinae, primary perivasculitis of the retina and angiopathia retinae juvenilis.

ori_sentence: Beta thalassemias (β thalassemias) are a group of inherited blood disorders.
simple_sent: Beta thalassemias are different from normal thalassemias.

ori_sentence: Antiprotozoal agents (ATC code: ATC P01) is a class of pharmaceuticals used in treatment of protozoan infection.
simple_sent: Antiprotozoal agents (ATC code: ATC P01) are a class of drugs. They are used to treat protozoan infections.

simple_sent: Dofetilide is a chemical compound.

simple_sent: Butanone, also known as methyl ketone, is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is MEK.

simple_sent: Gonadotropin-releasing hormone antagonists (GnRH antagonists) are a type of drugs that work by attacking the gonadotropin-releasing hormone receptor (GnRH receptor). This makes the hormone not released at all.

simple_sent: Secondary hyperparathyroidism is when the parathyroid glands make too much parathyroid hormone. This happens when there is low blood calcium in the blood, and the parathyroid glands make too much parathyroid hormone.

ori_sentence: Mechanical ventilation, assisted ventilation or intermittent mandatory ventilation (IMV), is the medical term for using a machine called a ventilator to fully or partially provide artificial ventilation.
simple_sent: Mechanical ventilation is the medical term for using a machine called a ventilator to provide air to a patient. Sometimes this ventilation is done all the time.

simple_sent: Billroth I, also called Billroth operation

simple_sent: A papule is a small bump in the skin, usually small.

simple_sent: A psychoactive drug, psychopharmaceutical, psychoactive agent, or psychotropic drug is a drug that changes the way the human brain works. It changes the way the brain thinks, feels, and behaves.

simple_sent: Third-degree atrioventricular block (AV block) is a medical condition in which the heart can not pump blood well. The cause is usually a problem with the nerves in the atrium of the heart.

ori_sentence: In pathology, an apudoma is an endocrine tumour that arises from an APUD cell from structures such as the ampulla of Vater.
simple_sent: In medicine, an apudoma is an endocrine tumour that comes from an APUD cell. The most common cause of apudoma is cancer.

ori_sentence: Fibrillation is the rapid, irregular, and unsynchronized contraction of muscle fibers.

simple_sent: Alastrim (also known as variola minor) is a virus. It is the cause of smallpox.

simple_sent: Enteropathic arthropathy or enteropathic arthritis is an inflammatory condition. It is when the body does something to itself that makes the arthritis worse.

ori_sentence: A Malone antegrade continence enema is a surgical procedure used to create a continent pathway proximal to the anus that facilitates fecal evacuation using enemas.
simple_sent: A Malone antegrade continence enema is a surgery. It is done to create a path for feces to come out of the anus. This helps fecal evacuation.

ori_sentence: Carney complex and its subsets LAMB syndrome and NAME syndrome are autosomal dominant conditions comprising myxomas of the heart and skin, hyperpigmentation of the skin (lentiginosis), and endocrine overactivity.
simple_sent: Carney complex and its subsets LAMB syndrome and NAME syndrome are autosomal dominant conditions. These conditions are caused by an overactivity of the endocrine system in the body.

simple_sent: A vascular ring is a birth defect. When a person is born with it, their aorta and/or blood vessels are not normal.

ori_sentence: Marasmus is a form of severe malnutrition characterized by energy deficiency.
simple_sent: Marasmus is a form of severe malnutrition. It is caused by lack of energy.

ori_sentence: Vascular dementia (VaD) is dementia caused by problems in the supply of blood to the brain, typically a series of minor strokes, leading to worsening cognitive abilities, the decline occurring step by step.
simple_sent: Vascular dementia (VaD) is a form of dementia. It is caused by problems in the blood supply to the brain. This usually happens in a series of minor strokes.

simple_sent: Besifloxacin is an antibiotic. It is a type of fluoroquinolone.

ori_sentence: Adenosquamous carcinoma is a type of cancer that contains two types of cells: squamous cells (thin, flat cells that line certain organs) and gland-like cells.
simple_sent: Adenosquamous carcinoma is a cancer of the skin. It is caused by two types of cells: squamous cells (small, flat cells) and gland-like cells.

ori_sentence: Fluticasone is a manufactured glucocorticoid used to treat nasal symptoms.

ori_sentence: Hypothermia is defined as a body core temperature below 35.0 °C (95.0 °F) in humans.
simple_sent: Hypothermia is when the human body's core temperature is less than 35.0 °C.

simple_sent: Benazepril (also known as Lotensin) is a prescription drug. It is used to treat high blood pressure, heart failure, and diabetes.

ori_sentence: Tubulopathy is a disease affecting the renal tubules of the nephron.
simple_sent: The tubules of the nephron are called the renal tubules.

ori_sentence: Brief psychotic disorder ⁠— according to the classifications of mental disorders DSM-IV-TR and DSM-5 ⁠— is a psychotic condition involving the sudden onset of at least one psychotic symptom (such as incoherence, delusions, hallucinations, or grossly disorganized or catatonic behavior) lasting 1 day to 1 month, often accompanied by emotional turmoil.
simple_sent: Brief psychotic disorder (BPD) is a mental condition where one or more symptoms (such as incoherence, delusions, hallucinations, or grossly disorganized or catatonic behavior) occur very suddenly, and last from one day to one month. It is one of the most common mental disorders in the United States.

simple_sent: Adrenocorticotropic hormone deficiency is when the pituitary gland does not produce enough adrenocorticotropic hormone (ACTH).

simple_sent: Antithrombin III deficiency is when antithrombin III is not in the body at all.

simple_sent: Chronic mucocutaneous candidiasis is a disease of the immune system. It is caused by Candida bacteria that live in the skin, mucosal surfaces, and nails.

simple_sent: Lactation suppression is when a person tries to stop lactation. This can be done with medication.

simple_sent: Avobenzone (also known as Parsol 1789, Milestab 1789, Eusolex 9020, Escalol 517, Neo Heliopan 357 and others, INCI Butyl Methoxydibenzoylmethane) is a chemical compound. It is an oil-soluble compound.

simple_sent: Drug-induced lupus erythematosus is when a person takes certain drugs for a long time.

ori_sentence: Amsacrine (synonyms: m-AMSA, acridinyl anisidide) is an antineoplastic agent.
simple_sent: Amsacrine is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is m-AMSA.

simple_sent: Chronic recurrent multifocal osteomyelitis (CRMO) is a very rare condition. In this condition, the bones become very sick.

ori_sentence: Retinal migraine is a retinal disease often accompanied by migraine headache and typically affects only one eye.
simple_sent: Retinal migraine is a disease of the eye. It usually causes a headache in one eye, and not in the other.

simple_sent: Opisthorchiasis is a disease. The disease is caused by a parasite (Opisthorchis viverrini or Opisthorchis felineus).

simple_sent: Essential fructosuria is caused by a lack of an enzyme in the liver called hepatic fructokinase. This causes fructose to not go through its metabolism in the liver, and it ends up in the urine.

simple_sent: Erb's palsy is a paralysis of the arm. It is caused by damage to the upper part of the arm's main nerves, which are called the trunk nerves.

simple_sent: Rickettsialpox is a disease caused by bacteria. The bacteria that cause Rickettsialpox are called Rickettsia.

ori_sentence: Demeclocycline (INN, BAN, USAN) (brand names Declomycin, Declostatin, Ledermycin, Bioterciclin, Deganol, Deteclo), also known under the brand names Detravis, Meciclin, Mexocine, Clortetrin, is a tetracycline antibiotic which was derived from a mutant strain of Streptomyces aureofaciens.
simple_sent: Demeclocycline (also known as Declomycin, Declostatin, Ledermycin, Bioterciclin, Deganol, Deteclo, Detravis, Meciclin, Mexocine and Clortetrin) is a tetracycline antibiotic. It is an antibiotic that is used to treat bacterial infections.

simple_sent: Bullous keratopathy, also known as pseudophakic bullous keratopathy (PBK), is a condition in which the cornea becomes too small. Small vesicles called bullae are made in the cornea.

simple_sent: Hematuria is when there are too many blood cells in the urine. This is called haematuria.

ori_sentence: Elbow fractures are any broken bone around the elbow joint.

simple_sent: Darunavir (also known as Prezista and Darunavir) is an antiretroviral drug. It is used to treat or prevent HIV/AIDS.

itemLabel: heart failure with preserved ejection fraction
ori_sentence: Heart failure with preserved ejection fraction (HFpEF) is a form of heart failure in which the ejection fraction – the percentage of the volume of blood ejected from the left ventricle with each heartbeat divided by the volume of blood when the left ventricle is maximally filled – is normal, defined as greater than 50%; this may be measured by echocardiography or cardiac catheterization.
simple_sent: Heart failure with preserved ejection fraction (HFpEF) is a form of heart failure in which the ejection fraction (the amount of blood that comes out of the left ventricle) is higher than it should be. This means that when the left ventricle is filled with blood, the amount of blood that comes out of the left ventricle is lower than it should be.

ori_sentence: Mirabegron, sold under the brand name Myrbetriq among others, is a medication used to treat overactive bladder.
simple_sent: Mirabegron (also known as Myrbetriq) is a drug. It is used to treat people with an overactive bladder.

simple_sent: The auriculotemporal nerve is a nerve in the side of the head. It is a branch of the mandibular nerve. The auriculotemporal nerve runs with the superficial temporal artery and vein.

simple_sent: Bacterial pneumonia is a disease. It is caused by bacteria.

ori_sentence: Etonogestrel is a medication which is used as a means of birth control for women.
simple_sent: Etonogestrel is a medication. It is used as a birth control for women.

ori_sentence: Conduct disorder (CD) is a mental disorder diagnosed in childhood or adolescence that presents itself through a repetitive and persistent pattern of behavior that includes theft, lies, physical violence that may lead to destruction and wanton breaking of rules, in which the basic rights of others or major age-appropriate norms are violated.
simple_sent: Conduct disorder (CD) is a mental disorder that usually starts in childhood or adolescence. People who have conduct disorder usually have a pattern of behavior that is not changing very often. This behavior may include stealing, lying, physical violence, or breaking rules.

ori_sentence: Miosis, or myosis, is excessive constriction of the pupil.
simple_sent: Miosis or myosis is when the pupil is too big.

simple_sent: A rectovaginal fistula is a problem in which the rectum and vagina do not connect properly. This is called a fistula.

ori_sentence: Sulfinpyrazone is a uricosuric medication used to treat gout.
simple_sent: Sulfinpyrazone is a medicine. It is used to treat gout.

ori_sentence: Hydroflumethiazide (or Saluron) is a diuretic.
simple_sent: Hydroflumethiazide is a chemical compound.

ori_sentence: Esophageal cancer is cancer arising from the esophagus—the food pipe that runs between the throat and the stomach.
simple_sent: Esophageal cancer is cancer of the esophagus. The esophagus is the part of the body that carries food.

ori_sentence: A subdural hygroma (SDG) is a collection of cerebrospinal fluid (CSF), without blood, located under the dural membrane of the brain.
simple_sent: A subdural hygroma (SDG) is a part of the brain. It is made up of cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) without any blood.

ori_sentence: Narcissistic personality disorder (NPD) is a mental disorder characterized by a life-long pattern of exaggerated feelings of self-importance, an excessive craving for admiration, and a diminished ability to empathize with other's feelings.
simple_sent: Narcissistic personality disorder (NPD) is a mental disorder. People with NPD usually have a life-long pattern of feelings of self-importance. They also have an excessive craving for admiration.

ori_sentence: Haverhill fever (or epidemic arthritic erythema) is a systemic illness caused by the bacterium Streptobacillus moniliformis, an organism common in rats and mice.
simple_sent: Haverhill fever (or epidemic arthritic erythema) is a disease. It is caused by a bacterium, Streptobacillus moniliformis, which is found in rats and mice.

ori_sentence: Cryptophthalmos is a rare congenital anomaly in which the skin is continuous over the eyeball with absence of eyelids.
simple_sent: Cryptophthalmos is a rare condition. In this case, the skin is all over the eyeball, and there are no eyelids.

ori_sentence: The azygos vein is a vein running up the right side of the thoracic vertebral column draining itself towards the superior vena cava.
simple_sent: The azygos vein is a vein in the right side of the body. It goes from the right thoracic vertebral column to the superior vena cava.

ori_sentence: The zona incerta (ZI) is a horizontally elongated region of gray matter in the subthalamus below the thalamus.
simple_sent: The zona incerta is a part of the brain. It is located in the subthalamus, below the thalamus.

ori_sentence: Myotonia congenita is a congenital neuromuscular channelopathy that affects skeletal muscles (muscles used for movement).
simple_sent: Myotonia congenita is a disease of the skeletal muscles. It affects the muscles that are used for movement.

ori_sentence: Takotsubo cardiomyopathy or Takotsubo syndrome (TTS), also known as stress cardiomyopathy, is a type of non-ischemic cardiomyopathy in which there is a sudden temporary weakening of the muscular portion of the heart.
simple_sent: Takotsubo cardiomyopathy or Takotsubo syndrome (also known as stress cardiomyopathy) is a medical condition. In it, the heart muscle becomes weak for a short period of time.

ori_sentence: Bullous pemphigoid is an autoimmune pruritic skin disease preferentially in older people, aged over 60, that may involve the formation of blisters (bullae) in the space between the epidermal and dermal skin layers.
simple_sent: Bullous pemphigoid is an autoimmune skin disease that usually starts in older people. People who have the disease are more likely to have blisters in the space between the epidermal and dermal skin layers.

ori_sentence: Stress incontinence, also known as stress urinary incontinence (SUI) or effort incontinence is a form of urinary incontinence.
simple_sent: Stress incontinence, also called stress urinary incontinence, is when the urine can not come out on its own.

ori_sentence: Cerebral contusion, Latin contusio cerebri, a form of traumatic brain injury, is a bruise of the brain tissue.
simple_sent: Cerebral contusion (Latin: contusio cerebri) is a bruise of the brain. It can be a serious injury.

ori_sentence: A rhinolith is a stone present in the nasal cavity.
simple_sent: A rhinolith is a small stone in the nose.

ori_sentence: Phenacemide (INN, BAN) (brand name Phenurone), also known as phenylacetylurea, is an anticonvulsant of the ureide (acetylurea) class.
simple_sent: Phenacemide, also known as phenylacetylurea, is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is ureide (acetylurea).

ori_sentence: An ingrown nail, also known as onychocryptosis from Greek: ὄνυξ (onyx) 'nail' and κρυπτός (kryptos) 'hidden', is a common form of nail disease.
simple_sent: An ingrown nail, also known as onychocryptosis, is a disease of the nails. The word onychocryptosis comes from the Greek words onyx and kryptos.

ori_sentence: Heart murmurs are heart sounds produced when blood is pumped across a heart valve and creates a sound loud enough to be heard with a stethoscope.
simple_sent: Heart murmurs are heart sounds made when blood is going to the heart. When the blood is going to the heart, it makes a loud sound.

ori_sentence: Cryptotia is the condition where an ear appears to have its upper portion buried underneath the side of the head.
simple_sent: Cryptotia is when an ear looks like it is buried under the side of the head, or is not attached to the head.

ori_sentence: A myeloid sarcoma (chloroma, granulocytic sarcoma, extramedullary myeloid tumor), is a solid tumor composed of immature white blood cells called myeloblasts.
simple_sent: A myeloid sarcoma (also called granulocytic sarcoma, extramedullary myeloid tumor) is a cancer of the white blood cells. It is a solid tumor.

ori_sentence: Hypertrichosis is an abnormal amount of hair growth over the body.
simple_sent: Hypertrichosis is an abnormal amount of hair growth in the body.

ori_sentence: Burkitt lymphoma is a cancer of the lymphatic system, particularly B lymphocytes found in the germinal center.
simple_sent: Burkitt lymphoma is a cancer of the lymphatic system. The most common cause of Burkitt lymphoma is bone cancer.

ori_sentence: Tropical sprue is a malabsorption disease commonly found in tropical regions, marked with abnormal flattening of the villi and inflammation of the lining of the small intestine.
simple_sent: Tropical sprue is a malabsorption disease. It is usually found in tropical regions, where the climate is too hot for normal body temperature.

ori_sentence: Brown-Séquard syndrome (also known as Brown-Séquard's hemiplegia, Brown-Séquard's paralysis, hemiparaplegic syndrome, hemiplegia et hemiparaplegia spinalis, or spinal hemiparaplegia) is caused by damage to one half of the spinal cord, i.e. hemisection of the spinal cord resulting in paralysis and loss of proprioception on the same (or ipsilateral) side as the injury or lesion, and loss of pain and temperature sensation on the opposite (or contralateral) side as the lesion.
simple_sent: Brown-Séquard syndrome (also known as Brown-Séquard's hemiplegia, Brown-Séquard's paralysis, hemiparaplegic syndrome, hemiplegia et hemiparaplegia spinalis, or spinal hemiparaplegia) is a condition in which one side of the spinal cord (the left side) is damaged. This causes paralysis and loss of sensation of pain and temperature on the other side of the spinal cord (the right side).

ori_sentence: Toxic megacolon is an acute form of colonic distension.
simple_sent: A toxic megacolon can cause serious health problems.

ori_sentence: Fosfestrol, sold under the brand name Honvan and also known as diethylstilbestrol diphosphate (DESDP), is an estrogen medication which is used in the treatment of prostate cancer in men.
simple_sent: Fosfestrol, also known as diethylstilbestrol diphosphate (DESDP), is a chemical compound. It is used to treat prostate cancer, and it is sold under the brand name Honvan.

ori_sentence: A Smith's fracture, is a fracture of the distal radius.
simple_sent: Smith's fracture is a fracture of the radius of life.

ori_sentence: Cocaine dependence is a neurological disorder that is characterized by withdrawal symptoms upon cessation from cocaine use.
simple_sent: Cocaine dependence is a neurological disorder. When people stop using cocaine, they experience withdrawal symptoms.

ori_sentence: Cardiac output (CO), also known as heart output denoted by the symbols , or , is a term used in cardiac physiology that describes the volume of blood being pumped by the heart, by the left and right ventricle, per unit time.
simple_sent: Cardiac output (CO), also known as heart output, is the amount of blood that is pumped into and out of the heart per unit time. The term is used in cardiac physiology to show how much blood is going into and out of the heart.

ori_sentence: La Crosse encephalitis is an encephalitis caused by an arbovirus (the La Crosse virus) which has a mosquito vector (Ochlerotatus triseriatus synonym Aedes triseriatus).
simple_sent: La Crosse encephalitis is a disease. It is caused by an arbovirus (the La Crosse virus), which is spread by mosquitoes. The virus is named after La Crosse.

ori_sentence: Brudziński's sign or a Brudziński sign is any of three medical signs, all of which may occur in meningitis or meningism.
simple_sent: Brudziński's sign or a Brudziński sign is a medical sign. It can be seen when people have meningitis or meningism.

ori_sentence: Vesicovaginal fistula (VVF) is a subtype of female urogenital fistula (UGF).
simple_sent: The Vesicovaginal fistula is a fistula in women. It is a type of Urogenital fistula.

ori_sentence: Esotropia is a form of strabismus in which one or both eyes turns inward.
simple_sent: This is called strabismus. In this case, one or both eyes turn inward.

ori_sentence: Kikuchi disease was described in 1972 in Japan.
simple_sent: The disease was first found in Japan in 1972.

ori_sentence: Quinapril, sold under the brand name Accupril among others, is a medication used to treat high blood pressure, heart failure, and diabetic kidney disease.
simple_sent: Quinapril (also known as Accupril) is a prescription drug. It is used to treat high blood pressure, heart failure, and diabetes.

ori_sentence: Hydroxyprogesterone caproate (OHPC), sold under the brand names Proluton and Makena among others, is a progestin medication which is used to prevent preterm birth in pregnant women with a history of the condition and to treat gynecological disorders.
simple_sent: Hydroxyprogesterone caproate (OHPC), sold under the brand names Makena and Proluton in the United States, is a progestin medication that is used to treat gynecological disorders and to prevent preterm birth in pregnant women.

ori_sentence: A papillary hidradenoma, also hidradenoma papilliferum, is a sharply circumscribed nodule or benign tumor of the apocrine gland usually found on the labia majora or the interlabial folds.
simple_sent: A papillary hidradenoma, also called hidradenoma papilliferum, is a benign tumor of the apocrine gland. It is usually found on the area around the labia majora.

ori_sentence: Breast prostheses are breast forms intended to look like breasts.
simple_sent: A breast prosthesis is a device that makes the breast look bigger.

ori_sentence: Thiethylperazine (Torecan) is an antiemetic of the phenothiazine class.
simple_sent: Thiethylperazine is a chemical compound. It is an antiemetic.

ori_sentence: Dysgraphia is a deficiency in the ability to write, primarily handwriting, but also coherence.
simple_sent: Dysgraphia is a problem with writing. It mostly affects the handwriting, but also other things.

ori_sentence: MALT lymphoma (MALToma) is a form of lymphoma involving the mucosa-associated lymphoid tissue (MALT), frequently of the stomach, but virtually any mucosal site can be afflicted.
simple_sent: MALT lymphoma (MALToma) is a type of cancer. It usually affects the mucosa-associated lymphoid tissue (MALT), but it can happen in any part of the body.

ori_sentence: A compartment syndrome is an increased pressure within a muscular compartment that compromises the circulation to the muscles.
simple_sent: A compartment syndrome is an increased pressure in a part of the body. This makes it hard for the muscles to move.

ori_sentence: Lymphomatoid granulomatosis (LYG or LG) is a very rare lymphoproliferative disorder first characterized in 1972.
simple_sent: Lymphomatoid granulomatosis (LYG or LG) is a very rare disease. It was first discovered in 1972.

ori_sentence: Oxycephaly is a type of cephalic disorder where the top of the skull is pointed or conical due to premature closure of the coronal suture plus any other suture, like the lambdoid, or it may be used to describe the premature fusion of all sutures.
simple_sent: Oxycephaly is a type of cephalic disorder where the top of the skull is pointed or conical because the coronal suture was not closed all the way through. This condition is called a lambdoid because it has two different sutures.

ori_sentence: The glottis is the opening between the vocal folds (the rima glottidis).
simple_sent: The glottis is where the voice is made. It is between the vocal folds.

ori_sentence: Pralidoxime (2-pyridine aldoxime methyl chloride) or 2-PAM, usually as the chloride or iodide salts, belongs to a family of compounds called oximes that bind to organophosphate-inactivated acetylcholinesterase.
simple_sent: Pralidoxime, also known as 2-pyridine aldoxime methyl chloride or 2-PAM, is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is 2-pyridine aldoxime. It has chloride and iodide ions in it.

ori_sentence: Acetylcysteine, also known as N-acetylcysteine (NAC), is a medication that is used to treat paracetamol (acetaminophen) overdose, and to loosen thick mucus in individuals with chronic bronchopulmonary disorders like pneumonia and bronchitis.
simple_sent: Acetylcysteine, also known as N-acetylcysteine (NAC), is a medication. It is used to treat people who get too much paracetamol (acetaminophen) or who have problems with their breathing, like pneumonia or bronchitis.

ori_sentence: Gender dysphoria (GD) is the distress a person feels due to a mismatch between their gender identity—their personal sense of their own gender—and their sex assigned at birth.
simple_sent: Gender dysphoria (GD) is when a person feels that their sex at birth is not right, or that their gender identity is not right, even though they know it is.

ori_sentence: Flavin mononucleotide (FMN), or riboflavin-5′-phosphate, is a biomolecule produced from riboflavin (vitamin B2) by the enzyme riboflavin kinase and functions as the prosthetic group of various oxidoreductases, including NADH dehydrogenase, as well as cofactor in biological blue-light photo receptors.
simple_sent: Flavin mononucleotide (FMN), also known as riboflavin-5′-phosphate, is a chemical compound. It is made from riboflavin (vitamin B2) by the enzyme riboflavin kinase. It is also an important part of NADH dehydrogenase and other oxidoreductases.

ori_sentence: Paraplegia is an impairment in motor or sensory function of the lower extremities.
simple_sent: Paraplegia is when the lower extremities can not do anything for themselves.

ori_sentence: Medroxyprogesterone acetate (MPA), also known as depot medroxyprogesterone acetate (DMPA) in injectable form and sold under the brand name Depo-Provera among others, is a hormonal medication of the progestin type.
simple_sent: Medroxyprogesterone acetate (MPA), also known as depot medroxyprogesterone acetate (DMPA), is a type of hormone. It is taken in the form of a tablet and is sold under the brand name Depo-Provera.

ori_sentence: Lipoid pneumonia is a specific form of lung inflammation (pneumonia) that develops when lipids enter the bronchial tree.
simple_sent: Lipoid pneumonia is a type of lung disease. When lipids enter the bronchial tree, the lung becomes inflamed.

ori_sentence: Omsk hemorrhagic fever is a viral hemorrhagic fever caused by a Flavivirus.
simple_sent: Omsk hemorrhagic fever is a disease. It is caused by a virus.

ori_sentence: The subthalamus or prethalamus is a part of the diencephalon.
simple_sent: The subthalamus helps the diencephalon to work.

ori_sentence: Meclofenamic acid (used as meclofenamate sodium, brand name Meclomen) is a drug used for joint, muscular pain, arthritis and dysmenorrhea.
simple_sent: Meclofenamic acid, also known as meclofenamate sodium, is a chemical compound. It is used to treat pain in the joints.

ori_sentence: Tiludronic acid (INN; also known as tiludronate) is a bisphosphonate used for treatment of Paget's disease of bone (osteitis deformans) in human medicine.
simple_sent: Tiludronic acid, also known as tiludronate, is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is bisphosphonate.

ori_sentence: Succinic semialdehyde dehydrogenase deficiency (SSADHD), is a rare autosomal recessive disorder of the degradation pathway of the inhibitory neurotransmitter γ-aminobutyric acid, or GABA.
simple_sent: Succinic semialdehyde dehydrogenase deficiency (SSADHD), also known as GABA deficiency, is a rare disorder. It happens when a person's gene for this enzyme is faulty.

ori_sentence: Insulin resistance (IR) is a pathological condition in which cells fail to respond normally to the hormone insulin.
simple_sent: Insulin resistance (IR) is a disease. In this condition, the cells do not respond to insulin normally.

ori_sentence: Avolition, as a symptom of various forms of psychopathology, is the decrease in the ability to initiate and persist in self-directed purposeful activities.
simple_sent: Avolition, as a symptom of various forms of psychopathology, is the loss of the ability to start and carry on purposeful activities by themselves.

ori_sentence: Superior vena cava syndrome (SVCS), is a group of symptoms caused by obstruction of the superior vena cava ("SVC"), a short, wide vessel carrying circulating blood into the heart.
simple_sent: Superior vena cava syndrome (SVCS) is a medical condition. It is caused by the blood vessels superior vena cava and inferior vena cava not being properly connected.

ori_sentence: Juvenile polyposis syndrome is an autosomal dominant genetic condition characterized by the appearance of multiple juvenile polyps in the gastrointestinal tract.
simple_sent: Juvenile polyposis syndrome is a genetic condition. People who have the condition will have multiple polyps in their gastrointestinal tract.

ori_sentence: In cardiology, hibernating myocardium is a state when some segmentsof the myocardium exhibit abnormalities of contractile function.
simple_sent: In cardiology, hibernating myocardium is when some parts of the myocardium do not work properly because they are cold.

ori_sentence: The outer ear, external ear, or auris externa is the external part of the ear, which consists of the auricle (also pinna) and the ear canal .
simple_sent: The outer ear is the part of the ear that is outside the body. It is made up of the auricle and the inside of the ear canal.

ori_sentence: Septo-optic dysplasia (SOD), known also as de Morsier syndrome, is a rare congenital malformation syndrome that features a combination of the underdevelopment of the optic nerve, pituitary gland dysfunction, and absence of the septum pellucidum (a midline part of the brain).Two or more of these features need to be present for a clinical diagnosis — only 30% of patients have all three.
simple_sent: Septo-optic dysplasia (SOD), also known as de Morsier syndrome, is a rare condition in which the optic nerve is not developed properly. In addition, there is a lack of the septum pellucidum (a midline part of the brain), and in some cases, the pituitary gland can not function properly.

ori_sentence: AA amyloidosis is a form of amyloidosis, a disease characterized by the abnormal deposition of fibers of insoluble protein in the extracellular space of various tissues and organs.
simple_sent: AA amyloidosis is a form of amyloidosis. It is a disease where abnormal fibers of insoluble protein are found in the extracellular space of many different tissues and organs.

ori_sentence: Bowman's capsule (or the Bowman capsule, capsula glomeruli, or glomerular capsule) is a cup-like sac at the beginning of the tubular component of a nephron in the mammalian kidney that performs the first step in the filtration of blood to form urine.
simple_sent: Bowman's capsule (or the Bowman capsule, capsula glomeruli, or glomerular capsule) is a part of the kidney. It is a cup-like sac at the beginning of the nephron (the part of the kidney that carries blood and urine).

ori_sentence: Complex regional pain syndrome (CRPS), also known as reflex sympathetic dystrophy (RSD), describes an array of painful conditions that are characterized by a continuing (spontaneous and/or evoked) regional pain that is seemingly disproportionate in time or degree to the usual course of any known trauma or other lesion.
simple_sent: Complex regional pain syndrome (CRPS), also known as reflex sympathetic dystrophy (RSD), is a condition in which the pain does not go away after a while. It is caused by something happening in the body that does not go away after a short time, or by a trauma.

ori_sentence: Ocular larva migrans (OLM), also known as ocular toxocariasis, is the ocular form of the larva migrans syndrome that occurs when Toxocara canis (dog roundworm) larvae invade the eye.
simple_sent: Ocular larva migrans (OLM) is a disease. It happens when Toxocara canis (dog roundworm) larvae get into the eye of a person. It is also called ocular toxocariasis.

ori_sentence: Polysplenia is a congenital disease manifested by multiple small accessory spleens, rather than a single, full-sized, normal spleen.
simple_sent: Polysplenia is a disease. It happens when a person is born with many small spleens, instead of a single big spleen.

ori_sentence: A hammer toe or contracted toe is a deformity of the muscles and ligaments of the proximal interphalangeal joint of the second, third, fourth, or fifth toe causing it to be bent, resembling a hammer.
simple_sent: A hammer toe or contracted toe is a problem where the muscles and ligaments of the second, third, fourth, or fifth toe are bent at the base of the foot. This looks like a hammer.

ori_sentence: Monobenzone, also called 4-(Benzyloxy)phenol and monobenzyl ether of hydroquinone (MBEH) is an organic chemical in the phenol family with chemical formula C6H5CH2OC6H4OH.
simple_sent: Monobenzone is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is C6H5CH2OC6H4OH. It is also known as 4-(Benzyloxy)phenol and monobenzyl ether of hydroquinone.

ori_sentence: Telithromycin is the first ketolide antibiotic to enter clinical use and is sold under the brand name of Ketek.
simple_sent: Telithromycin was the first ketolide antibiotic to be used in clinical use. It is now sold as Ketek.

ori_sentence: Premenstrual dysphoric disorder (PMDD) is a severe and disabling form of premenstrual syndrome affecting 1.8–5.8% of menstruating women.
simple_sent: Premenstrual dysphoric disorder (PMDD) is a condition. About 1.8 to 5.8% of women in the United States have this disorder.

ori_sentence: Desquamation, commonly called skin peeling, is the shedding of the outermost membrane or layer of a tissue, such as the skin.
simple_sent: Desquamation (also called skin peeling) is when the outermost layer of tissue, such as the skin, is shed.

ori_sentence: Elvitegravir (EVG) is an integrase inhibitor used to treat HIV infection.
simple_sent: Elvitegravir is a drug. It is used to treat people with HIV.

ori_sentence: Factor XII deficiency is a deficiency in the production of factor XII (FXII), a plasma glycoprotein and clotting factor that participates in the coagulation cascade and activates factor XI.
simple_sent: Factor XII deficiency is when there is a lack of factor XII (FXII). This is a plasma glycoprotein and clotting factor. It helps to make blood thicker and thicker.

ori_sentence: Acropachy refers to a dermopathy associated with Graves' disease.
simple_sent: Acropachy is a skin disease. It is related to Graves disease.

ori_sentence: Venous thrombosis is thrombosis in a vein, caused by a thrombus (blood clot).
simple_sent: Venous thrombosis is when a blood clot forms in a vein.

ori_sentence: Cutis laxa or pachydermatocele is a group of rare connective tissue disorders in which the skin becomes inelastic and hangs loosely in folds.
simple_sent: Cutis laxa or pachydermatocele is a condition of the skin. In this condition, the skin becomes weak and hangs loosely in folds.

ori_sentence: Pigment dispersion syndrome (PDS) is an eye disorder that can lead to a form of glaucoma known as pigmentary glaucoma.
simple_sent: Pigment dispersion syndrome (PDS) is an eye disease. It can lead to glaucoma, which is when the eye can not see.

ori_sentence: Zinc gluconate is the zinc salt of gluconic acid.
simple_sent: It has zinc and gluconate ions in it.

ori_sentence: The saccule is the smaller sized vestibular sac (the utricle being the other larger size vestibular sac); it is globular in form, and lies in the recessus sphæricus near the opening of the scala vestibuli of the cochlea.
simple_sent: The saccule is the smaller part of the vestibular sac. The other part of the vestibular sac is called the utricle. The saccule is located in the recessus sphæricus near the opening of the cochlea.

ori_sentence: The popliteal vein is a vein of the lower limb.
simple_sent: The popliteal vein is an important vein.

ori_sentence: Morning sickness, also called nausea and vomiting of pregnancy (NVP), is a symptom of pregnancy that involves nausea or vomiting.
simple_sent: Morning sickness, also called nausea and vomiting during pregnancy, is a symptom of being pregnant. It can be very bad.

ori_sentence: Etidronic acid, also known as etidronate, is a bisphosphonate used as a medication, detergent, water treatment, and cosmetic.
simple_sent: Etidronic acid, also known as etidronate, is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is bisphosphonate.

ori_sentence: Latamoxef (or moxalactam) is an oxacephem antibiotic usually grouped with the cephalosporins.
simple_sent: Latamoxef, also known as moxalactam, is an antibiotic. It is an oxacephem antibiotic.

ori_sentence: Geniospasm is movement disorder of the mentalis muscle.
simple_sent: Geniospasm is a muscle movement problem.

ori_sentence: Glomerulonephritis (GN) is a term used to refer to several kidney diseases (usually affecting both kidneys).
simple_sent: Glomerulonephritis is a disease. There are many different types of glomerulonephritis, and they all affect both kidneys.

ori_sentence: Cholinergic urticaria (CU) presents with tiny very itchy wheals and small bumps on a reddish background.
simple_sent: Cholinergic urticaria (CU) causes small red bumps on the skin that look like wheals.

ori_sentence: A synovial joint, also known as diarthrosis, joins bones or cartilage with a fibrous joint capsule that is continuous with the periosteum of the joined bones, constitutes the outer boundary of a synovial cavity, and surrounds the bones' articulating surfaces.
simple_sent: A synovial joint, also known as diarthrosis, is a joint that joins two or more bones together. The synovial joint is made up of a fibrous capsule that surrounds the bones' articulating surfaces and holds them together.

ori_sentence: Medronic acid (conjugate base, medronate), also known as methylene diphosphonate, is the smallest bisphosphonate.
simple_sent: Medronic acid, also known as methylene diphosphonate, is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is medronate.

ori_sentence: Diverticulitis, specifically colonic diverticulitis, is a gastrointestinal disease characterized by inflammation of abnormal pouches—diverticula—which can develop in the wall of the large intestine.
simple_sent: Diverticulitis, also called colonic diverticulitis, is a disease of the large intestine. It is caused by the build-up of diverticula in the wall of the large intestine.

ori_sentence: The colorectal adenoma is a benign of the colon and the rectum.
simple_sent: A colorectal adenoma is a cancer of the colon or rectum.

ori_sentence: Susac's syndrome (retinocochleocerebral vasculopathy) is a very rare form of microangiopathy characterized by encephalopathy, branch retinal artery occlusions and hearing loss.
simple_sent: Susac's syndrome (retinocochleocerebral vasculopathy) is a very rare form of microangiopathy. In this case, there is no brain damage, but there is loss of hearing.

ori_sentence: Hesperidin is a flavanone glycoside found in citrus fruits.
simple_sent: Hesperidin is a chemical compound. It is found in citrus fruits.

ori_sentence: Larva currens (Latin for racing larva) is an itchy, cutaneous condition caused by infections with Strongyloides stercoralis.
simple_sent: Larva currens (Latin for racing larva) is an itchy, itchy condition. It is caused by Stercoralis infection.

ori_sentence: Tooth fusion arises through union of two normally separated tooth germs, and depending upon the stage of development of the teeth at the time of union, it may be either complete or incomplete.
simple_sent: Tooth fusion happens when two different types of tooth germs come together. The stage of development of the teeth at the time that this happens can either be complete or incomplete.

ori_sentence: Biological rhythms are repetitive biological processes.
simple_sent: The biological rhythm is a regular process.

ori_sentence: In human anatomy, an azygos lobe is a normal anatomical variation of the upper lobe of the right lung.
simple_sent: In human anatomy, the azygos lobe is in the right side of the body. It is called the upper lobe.

ori_sentence: The superior rectal artery (superior hemorrhoidal artery) is an artery that descends into the pelvis to supply blood to the rectum.
simple_sent: The superior rectal artery (also called the superior hemorrhoidal artery) is a blood vessel that goes into the rectum.

ori_sentence: Granulosa cell tumours are tumours that arise from granulosa cells.
simple_sent: Granulosa cell tumours are cancer of the granulosa cells.

ori_sentence: The ileocecal valve (ileal papilla, ileocaecal valve, Tulp's valve, Tulpius valve, Bauhin's valve, ileocecal eminence, valve of Varolius or colic valve) is a sphincter muscle valve that separates the small intestine and the large intestine.
simple_sent: The ileocecal valve (also called Tulp's valve, Tulpius valve, Bauhin's valve, or Varolius valve) is a sphincter muscle valve. It separates the small intestine from the large intestine.

ori_sentence: Acute erythroid leukemia is a rare form of acute myeloid leukemia (less than 5% of AML cases) where the myeloproliferation is of erythroblastic precursors.
simple_sent: Acute erythroid leukemia is a rare form of acute myeloid leukemia. In less than 5% of cases, erythroblastic precursors cause the disease.

ori_sentence: Dihydrocodeine is a semi-synthetic opioid analgesic prescribed for pain or severe dyspnea, or as an antitussive, either alone or compounded with paracetamol (acetaminophen) (as in co-dydramol) or aspirin.
simple_sent: Dihydrocodeine (also known as co-dydramol and paracetamol) is a semi-synthetic opioid analgesic. It is used as a treatment for pain or severe dyspnea, or as an antitussive.

ori_sentence: Cheilitis is a medical condition characterized by inflammation of the lips.
simple_sent: Cheilitis is a medical condition. It causes the lips to become red.

ori_sentence: Bronchorrhea is the production of more than 100 mL per day of watery sputum.
simple_sent: Bronchorrhea makes more than 100 mL of watery sputum every day.

ori_sentence: Cholecystitis is inflammation of the gallbladder.
simple_sent: Cholecystitis is a common gallbladder disease.

ori_sentence: Desoximetasone is a medication belonging to the family of medications known as topical corticosteroids.
simple_sent: Desoximetasone is a topical corticosteroid medication. It is part of the corticosteroid family.

ori_sentence: Myositis ossificans comprises two syndromes characterized by heterotopic ossification (calcification) of muscle.
simple_sent: Myositis ossificans is a medical condition. It is characterized by muscle calcification in two parts.

ori_sentence: Urinary urgency is a sudden, compelling urge to urinate.
simple_sent: Urinary urgency is a feeling that you need to urinate.

ori_sentence: Propylthiouracil (PTU) is a medication used to treat hyperthyroidism.
simple_sent: Propylthiouracil is a drug. It is used to treat hyperthyroidism.

ori_sentence: The ulnar artery is the main blood vessel, with oxygenated blood, of the medial aspects of the forearm.
simple_sent: The ulnar artery is the main blood vessel in the forearm. It carries oxygen-rich blood.

ori_sentence: Enanthem or enanthema is a rash (small spots) on the mucous membranes.
simple_sent: Enanthem or enanthema is a small red rash. It is usually small.

ori_sentence: Tuberculous meningitis, also known as TB meningitis or tubercular meningitis, is a specific type of bacterial meningitis caused by the Mycobacterium tuberculosis infection of the meninges—the system of membranes which envelop the central nervous system.
simple_sent: Tuberculous meningitis, also known as TB meningitis or tubercular meningitis, is a disease. It is caused by a bacterium called Mycobacterium tuberculosis, which infects the meninges, a part of the human nervous system.

ori_sentence: The anterior cruciate ligament (ACL) is one of a pair of cruciate ligaments (
simple_sent: The anterior cruciate ligament (ACL) is an important ligament in football.

ori_sentence: Dens evaginatus is a rare odontogenic developmental anomaly that is found in teeth where the outer surface appears to form an extra bump or cusp.
simple_sent: Dens evaginatus is a rare condition. In this condition, the outer surface of the teeth appears to form an extra bump or cusp.

ori_sentence: The mesovarium is the portion of the broad ligament of the uterus that suspends the ovaries.
simple_sent: The mesovarium is the part of the uterus where the ovaries are. It is a broad ligament.

ori_sentence: Pseudofolliculitis barbae (PFB) is a persistent irritation caused by shaving.
simple_sent: Pseudofolliculitis barbae is a skin infection. It is caused by shaving.

ori_sentence: Peri-implantitis is a destructive inflammatory process affecting the soft and hard tissues surrounding dental implants.
simple_sent: Peri-implantitis is a dangerous inflammatory process. It affects both the hard and soft tissue around the implant.

ori_sentence: In advanced airway management, rapid sequence induction (RSI) – also referred to as rapid sequence intubation or as rapid sequence induction and intubation (RSII) or as crash induction – is a special process for endotracheal intubation that is used where the patient is at a high risk of pulmonary aspiration.
simple_sent: In advanced airway management, rapid sequence induction (RSI) (also called rapid sequence intubation (RSII), rapid sequence induction and intubation (RSII)), or rapid sequence intubation (RSI), is a procedure that is used when a patient has a high risk of pulmonary aspiration.

ori_sentence: Gemfibrozil, sold under the brand name Lopid among others, is a medication used to treat abnormal blood lipid levels.
simple_sent: Gemfibrozil, also known as Lopid, is a medication. It is used to treat high blood lipid levels.

ori_sentence: The fourth ventricle is one of the four connected fluid-filled cavities within the human brain.
simple_sent: The fourth ventricle in the human brain is one of the four main blood vessels.

ori_sentence: An enamel pearl is a condition of teeth where enamel is found in locations where enamel is not supposed to be, such as on a root surface.
simple_sent: An enamel pearl is a condition of teeth where the enamel is not where it should be. This is usually found in the root of the teeth.

ori_sentence: Dens invaginatus (DI), also known as tooth within a tooth, is a rare dental malformation where there is an infolding of enamel into dentine.
simple_sent: Dens invaginatus (DI), also known as tooth within a tooth, is a dental malformation. It happens when teeth become too hard.
