ori_sentence: Keratoconus (KC) is a disorder of the eye that results in progressive thinning of the cornea.
simple_sent: Keratoconus (KC) is a disease of the eye. It causes the cornea to become smaller.

ori_sentence: Sternal clefts are rare congenital malformations that result from defective embryologic fusion of paired mesodermal bands in the ventral midline.
simple_sent: Sternal clefts are a rare birth defect. They are caused by a defect in the paired mesodermal bands in the ventral midline.

ori_sentence: Surgical suture is a medical device used to hold body tissues together after an injury or surgery.
simple_sent: Surgical suture is a medical device. It is used to hold parts of the body together.

ori_sentence: Tethered cord syndrome (TCS) refers to a group of neurological disorders that relate to malformations of the spinal cord.
simple_sent: Tethered cord syndrome (TCS) is a medical condition. It is caused by problems with the spinal cord.

ori_sentence: The mandibular nerve (V3) is the largest of the three divisions of the trigeminal nerve, the fifth cranial nerve (CN V).
simple_sent: The mandibular nerve is a part of the trigeminal nerve. The mandibular nerve is the largest part of the nerve.

ori_sentence: Placental abruption is when the placenta separates early from the uterus, in other words separates before childbirth.
simple_sent: Placental abruption is when the placenta comes out too early. This usually happens during pregnancy.

ori_sentence: Mafenide (INN; usually as mafenide acetate, trade name Sulfamylon) is a sulfonamide-type medication used as an antibiotic.
simple_sent: Mafenide is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is mafenide acetate. It is used as an antibiotic.

ori_sentence: Sclerema neonatorum is a rare and severe skin condition that is characterized by diffuse hardening of the subcutaneous tissue with minimal inflammation.
simple_sent: Sclerema neonatorum is a skin condition that does not usually happen. It causes the skin to harden all over the place with very little inflammation.

ori_sentence: Lymphocytosis is an increase in the number or proportion of lymphocytes in the blood.
simple_sent: Lymphocytosis is an increase in the number of lymphocytes in the blood.

ori_sentence: Anuria is nonpassage of urine, in practice is defined as passage of less than 100 milliliters of urine in a day.
simple_sent: Anuria is when there is no urine passing through the body. This is less than 100 milliliters a day.

ori_sentence: Xeroderma pigmentosum (XP) is a genetic disorder in which there is a decreased ability to repair DNA damage such as that caused by ultraviolet (UV) light.
simple_sent: Xeroderma pigmentosum (XP) is a genetic disorder. People with it are less able to repair damage to their DNA from ultraviolet (UV) light.

ori_sentence: Rose spots are red macules 2-4 millimeters in diameter occurring in patients with enteric fever (which includes typhoid and paratyphoid).
simple_sent: Rose spots are red macules 2-4 millimeters in diameter. They are usually found in people who have enteric fever.

ori_sentence: In general surgery, a Roux-en-Y anastomosis, or Roux-en-Y, is an end-to-side surgical anastomosis of bowel used to reconstruct the gastrointestinal tract.
simple_sent: In general surgery, a Roux-en-Y anastomosis, or Roux-en-Y, is a surgery where the bowel is cut open. This is called anastomosis.

ori_sentence: Galant reflex, or truncal incurvation reflex, is a newborn reflex, named after neurologist .
simple_sent: The Galant reflex, or truncal incurvation reflex, is a reflex that babies make when they are born.

ori_sentence: Roberts syndrome, or sometimes called pseudothalidomide syndrome, is an extremely rare autosomal recessive genetic disorder that is characterized by mild to severe prenatal retardation or disruption of cell division, leading to malformation of the bones in the skull, face, arms, and legs.
simple_sent: Roberts syndrome, or sometimes called pseudothalidomide syndrome, is a rare disease. People who have the disease will have mild to severe birth defects, or problems with cell division. This will cause problems with the bones in the skull, face, arms, and legs.

ori_sentence: Periapical periodontitis or apical periodontitis (AP) is an acute or chronic inflammatory lesion around the apex of a tooth root, most commonly caused by bacterial invasion of the pulp of the tooth.

simple_sent: Azatadine (also known as Optimine) is an antihistamine. It was first released in 1973 by Schering-Plough.

simple_sent: Eribulin (also known as Halaven) is a cancer treatment. It is used to treat breast cancer and liposarcoma.

simple_sent: Theophylline (also known as 1,3-dimethylxanthine) is a drug that is used to treat asthma and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD). It works by inhibiting the enzyme phosphodiesterase.

ori_sentence: Resveratrol (3,5,4′-trihydroxy-trans-stilbene) is a stilbenoid, a type of natural phenol, and a phytoalexin produced by several plants in response to injury or when the plant is under attack by pathogens, such as bacteria or fungi.

ori_sentence: An aortic aneurysm is an enlargement (dilatation) of the aorta to greater than 1.5 times normal size.

ori_sentence: Hip dysplasia is an abnormality of the hip joint where the socket portion does not fully cover the ball portion, resulting in an increased risk for joint dislocation.

ori_sentence: The cricoid cartilage /ˌkraɪkɔɪd ˈkɑːrtɪlɪdʒ/, or simply cricoid (from the Greek krikoeides meaning "ring-shaped") or cricoid ring, is the only complete ring of cartilage around the trachea.

ori_sentence: Recurrent brief depression (RBD) defines a mental disorder characterized by intermittent depressive episodes, not related to menstrual cycles in women, occurring between approximately 6–12 times per year, over at least one year or more fulfilling the diagnostic criteria for major depressive episodes (DSM-IV and ICD-10) except for duration which in RBD is less than 14 days, typically 5–7 days.

People who have recurrent brief depression usually have episodes that last less than 14 days, but some people have episodes that last longer than 14 days.

ori_sentence: Vagotonia is the state of the autonomic nervous system in which the equilibrium between the sympathetic and parasympathetic nervous system is biased towards the parasympathetic, the opposite phenomenon being .There is an associated clinical syndrome with low blood pressure (hypotension), low heart rate (bradycardia), miosis, often cold hands and feet, a cold and clammy diaphoresis, severe fatigue, and sometimes vasovagal syncope.
simple_sent: Vagotonia is a state of the autonomic nervous system. It happens when the sympathetic and parasympathetic nervous system are both working too hard and the parasympathetic nervous system is working too hard. This results in low blood pressure (hypotension), low heart rate (bradycardia), often cold hands and feet, a cold and clammy diaphoresis, severe fatigue, and sometimes vasovagal syncope.

simple_sent: Fluoxymesterone (also known as Halotestin and Ultandren) is an androgen and anabolic steroid medication. It is used to treat low levels of testosterone in men, breast cancer in women, anemia in women, and delayed puberty in boys.

simple_sent: Algaemia is a condition where green algae ( algae that are not normal) enter the bloodstream.

simple_sent: Aspartylglucosaminuria (AGU) is an inherited disease. People with the disease experience a decline in mental function and an increase in skin and bone problems.

simple_sent: Macular corneal dystrophy, also known as Fehr corneal dystrophy, is a disease that affects the cornea. The condition is named after Oskar Fehr (1871-1959).

simple_sent: Alcohol septal ablation (ASA) is a percutaneous, minimally invasive procedure performed by an interventional cardiologist to relieve symptoms and improve functional status in patients with severe hypertrophic cardiomyopathy (HCM). The procedure is usually performed by a cardiologist.

simple_sent: Ceftaroline fosamil (also known as Teflaro in the United States and Zinforo in Europe) is a cephalosporin antibiotic. It is an antibiotic.

simple_sent: Autoimmune polyendocrine syndromes (APSs), also called polyglandular autoimmune syndromes (PGASs) or polyendocrine autoimmune syndromes (PASs), are a group of rare diseases in which one or more organs of the body are affected by an autoimmune disease.

ori_sentence: Androstenedione, or 4-androstenedione (abbreviated as A4 or Δ4-dione), also known as androst-4-ene-3,17-dione, is an endogenous weak androgen steroid hormone and intermediate in the biosynthesis of estrone and of testosterone from dehydroepiandrosterone (DHEA).

simple_sent: Acute pericarditis usually lasts less than 6 weeks. It is when the pericardium (the part of the heart surrounding the heart) is hurt.

simple_sent: Alcaftadine is used to prevent allergic conjunctivitis from happening.

simple_sent: Arbutamine is an important drug.

simple_sent: Pontiac fever is a disease. It is caused by bacteria. The bacteria that cause Pontiac fever are from the genus Legionella.

simple_sent: Arthralgia means joint pain in Greek. The word comes from Greek arthro-, joint.

simple_sent: Annular erythema of infancy is a skin condition that usually happens to children about six months old. The skin lesions usually go away after about eleven months.

simple_sent: Aortocaval compression syndrome happens when a pregnant woman lies on her back. The uterus compresses the aorta and the inferior vena cava inside the uterus.

simple_sent: Arakawa's syndrome II is an autosomal dominant metabolic disorder. It is caused by a lack of an enzyme called tetrahydrofolate-methyltransferase. Without this enzyme, methylcobalamin can not be made.

simple_sent: Global aphasia is a severe form of nonfluent aphasia. It is caused by damage to the left side of the brain. This damage can affect language skills, including the ability to talk, read, and write.

ori_sentence: Campylobacteriosis is an infection by the Campylobacter bacterium, most commonly C. jejuni.
simple_sent: Campylobacteriosis is a disease. It is caused by a bacterium called Campylobacter.

ori_sentence: Tullio phenomenon, sound-induced vertigo, dizziness, nausea or eye movement (nystagmus) was first described in 1929 by the Italian biologist Prof. Pietro Tullio.
simple_sent: The Tullio phenomenon, or Tullio effect, is when people feel dizziness, nausea or eye movement because of sound. It was first described by Pietro Tullio.

simple_sent: Generalized pustular psoriasis (GPP) is a very rare form of psoriasis. There are many different types.

simple_sent: Anti-smooth muscle antibodies are antibodies that are made against smooth muscle.

simple_sent: A gemistocyte (/dʒɛˈmɪstəsaɪt/ jem-ISS-tə-syte) is an astrocyte. The word comes from the Greek word,gemizo.

simple_sent: Generalized epilepsy is a form of epilepsy that does not seem to have any cause at all.

simple_sent: Genu recurvatum is a problem with the knee. This makes the knee bend backwards.

simple_sent: Laron syndrome (also known as growth hormone insensitivity) is an autosomal recessive disorder. People who have the condition will not be able to produce insulin-like growth factor 1 (IGF-1) in response to growth hormone.

ori_sentence: Simvastatin, sold under the brand name Zocor among others, is a lipid-lowering medication.

ori_sentence: An anti-LKM antibody (anti–liver-kidney microsomal antibody or LKM antibody) is any of several autoantibodies that are detected in the serum of patients with different types of acute or chronic liver disease.
simple_sent: An anti-LKM antibody (anti-liver-kidney microsomal antibody or LKM antibody) is an antibody that can be found in the blood of people with liver disease. There are many types of liver disease.

simple_sent: Ghosal hematodiaphyseal dysplasia, is a rare disease. It is an autosomal recessive disease, and people who have it have long bones (diaphyseal dysplasia).

simple_sent: Generalized vaccinia is a cutaneous condition that happens 6-9 days after being vaccinated. It is caused by a virus in the Vaccinia virus.

ori_sentence: Gillespie syndrome, also called aniridia, cerebellar ataxia and mental deficiency.
simple_sent: Gillespie syndrome is also called mental deficiency or cerebellar ataxia.

ori_sentence: Giant cell fibroblastoma (GCF) is a rare type of soft-tissue tumor marked by painless nodules in the dermis (the inner layer of the two main layers of tissue that make up the skin) and subcutaneous (beneath the skin) tissue.
simple_sent: Giant cell fibroblastoma (GCF) is a rare type of soft tissue tumor that does not cause pain. It is found in the dermis (the inner layer of the skin) and in the subcutaneous (under the skin) tissue.

ori_sentence: Geniculate ganglionitis or geniculate neuralgia (GN), also called nervus intermedius neuralgia, Ramsay Hunt syndrome, or Hunt's neuralgia, is a rare disorder characterized by severe paroxysmal neuralgic pain deep in the ear, that may spread to the ear canal, outer ear, mastoid or eye regions.
simple_sent: Geniculate ganglionitis or geniculate neuralgia (GN), also called nervus intermedius neuralgia, Ramsay Hunt syndrome, or Hunt's neuralgia, is a disease that causes severe pain in the ear. People who have geniculate ganglionitis often have pain in their ear for a long time.

ori_sentence: Genitopatellar syndrome is a rare disorder with characteristic craniofacial features, congenital flexion contractures of the lower limbs, absent or abnormal patellae, urogenital anomalies, and developmental delay.
simple_sent: Genitopatellar syndrome is a rare disorder. People who have it have special craniofacial features, and their lower limbs do not move properly. They also have absent or abnormal patellae.

ori_sentence: Gerodermia osteodysplastica (GO), is a rare autosomal recessive connective tissue disorder included in the spectrum of cutis laxa syndromes.
simple_sent: Gerodermia osteodysplastica is a rare connective tissue disorder. It is also called cutis laxa disorder, but is not the same.

ori_sentence: Gigantiform cementoma is a rare, autosomal dental tumor.
simple_sent: Gigantiform cementoma is a very rare dental condition.

ori_sentence: The anterior longitudinal ligament is a ligament that runs down the anterior surface of the spine.
simple_sent: The anterior longitudinal ligament is a ligament that runs down the front of the spine.

ori_sentence: Gestational choriocarcinoma is a malignant trophoblastic tumour arising from any gestational event during pregnancy in the reproductive female.
simple_sent: Gestational choriocarcinoma is a malignant tumor that can occur during pregnancy. It is usually found during pregnancy.

ori_sentence: Nicolaides–Baraitser syndrome (NCBRS) is a rare genetic condition caused by de novo missense mutations in the SMARCA2 gene and has only been reported in fewer than 200 cases worldwide.
simple_sent: Nicolaides-Baraitser syndrome (NCBRS) is a rare genetic condition. There are only about 200 people in the world who have this condition, but it can happen to anyone.

ori_sentence: Giant-cell carcinoma of the lung (GCCL) is a rare histological form of large-cell lung carcinoma, a subtype of undifferentiated lung cancer, traditionally classified within the non-small-cell lung carcinomas (NSCLC).
simple_sent: Giant-cell carcinoma of the lung (GCCL) is a rare form of lung cancer. It is a type of large-cell lung carcinoma, and is the most common type of lung cancer in women.

ori_sentence: Pulmonary alveolar microlithiasis (PAM) is a rare, inherited disorder of lung phosphate balance that is associated with small stone formation in the airspaces of the lung.
simple_sent: Pulmonary alveolar microlithiasis (PAM) is a rare disease that causes small stones to form in the airspaces of the lung. It is an inherited disorder.

ori_sentence: Geotrichosis is a mycosis caused by Geotrichum candidum.
simple_sent: Geotrichosis is a disease. It is caused by fungi.

ori_sentence: A spermatogonium (plural: spermatogonia) is an undifferentiated male germ cell.
simple_sent: A spermatogonium is a male germ cell. It is also called spermatogonia.

ori_sentence: Sacrohysteropexy is a surgical procedure to correct uterine prolapse.
simple_sent: Sacrohysteropexy is a surgery to fix the prolapse of the uterus.

ori_sentence: A subdural hematoma (SDH) is a type of bleeding in which a collection of blood—usually associated with a traumatic brain injury—gathers between the inner layer of the dura mater and the arachnoid mater of the meninges surrounding the brain.
simple_sent: A subdural hematoma (SDH) is a type of bleeding in the brain. It happens when blood collects between the inner layer of the brain, called the dura mater, and the inner layer of the meninges, called the arachnoid mater.

ori_sentence: Aromatase excess syndrome (AES or AEXS) is a rare genetic and endocrine syndrome which is characterized by an overexpression of aromatase, the enzyme responsible for the biosynthesis of the estrogen sex hormones from the androgens, in turn resulting in excessive levels of circulating estrogens and, accordingly, symptoms of hyperestrogenism.
simple_sent: Aromatase excess syndrome (AES or AEXS) is a rare genetic and endocrine syndrome. It happens when a person has an increase in the amount of aromatase in their body. aromatase is an enzyme that breaks down sex hormones from the androgens into estrogens.

ori_sentence: An arsenical keratosis is a growth of keratin on the skin caused by arsenic, which occurs naturally in the earth's crust and is widely distributed in the environment, Arsenical compounds are used in industrial, agricultural, and medicinal substances.
simple_sent: Arsenical keratosis is a growth of keratin on the skin caused by arsenic. Arsenical is found naturally in the earth's crust and is widely distributed in the environment. Arsenical compounds are used in many things.

ori_sentence: Aseptic meningitis is the inflammation of the meninges, a membrane covering the brain and spinal cord, in patients whose cerebral spinal fluid test result is negative with routine bacterial cultures.
simple_sent: Aseptic meningitis is an infection of the meninges. The meninges are a membrane that cover the brain and spinal cord. Aseptic meningitis usually starts in the brain.

ori_sentence: A hemangiopericytoma is a type of soft-tissue sarcoma that originates in the pericytes in the walls of capillaries.
simple_sent: A hemangiopericytoma is a type of soft-tissue sarcoma. The cells that cause hemangiopericytoma are capillaries.

ori_sentence: Ataxic cerebral palsy is clinically in approximately 5–10% of all cases of cerebral palsy, making it the least frequent form of cerebral palsy diagnosed.
simple_sent: Ataxic cerebral palsy occurs in about 5% to 10% of all cases of cerebral palsy. It is also the least common form of cerebral palsy.

ori_sentence: Hypoalgesia or hypalgesia denotes a decreased sensitivity to painful stimuli.
simple_sent: Hypoalgesia or hypalgesia is when a person can not feel things very well.

ori_sentence: Arteriosclerosis obliterans is an occlusive arterial disease most prominently affecting the abdominal aorta and the small- and medium-sized arteries of the lower extremities, which may lead to absent dorsalis pedis, posterior tibial, and/or popliteal artery pulses.
simple_sent: Arteriosclerosis obliterans is an arterial disease that usually affects the small and medium-sized arteries in the lower extremities of the body. When this happens, the dorsalis pedis, posterior tibial, and/or popliteal artery can become absent.

ori_sentence: Hyperproteinemia is the state of having overly high levels of protein in the blood.
simple_sent: Hyperproteinemia is when the blood has too much protein in it.

ori_sentence: Astroblastoma is a rare glial tumor derived from the astroblast, a type of cell that closely resembles spongioblastoma and astrocytes.
simple_sent: Astroblastoma is a very rare type of glial tumor. It comes from the astroblast, a type of cell. It looks like a sponge.

ori_sentence: The washing out or cleaning out the contents (blood, fluid or loose debris) inside a joint space is generally termed as Arthroscopic lavage.
simple_sent: The cleaning out or washing out of the contents inside a joint space is called arthroscopic lavage, or simply cleaning.

ori_sentence: Ascher's syndrome, is a rare disorder first described in 1920.
simple_sent: Ascher's syndrome is a very rare condition. It was found in 1920.

ori_sentence: Arthritis mutilans is a rare medical condition involving severe inflammation damaging the joints of the hands and feet, and resulting in deformation and problems with moving the affected areas; it can also affect the spine.
simple_sent: Arthritis mutilans is a rare medical condition. It causes severe inflammation in the joints of the hands and feet. This makes the joints not work properly. It can also affect the spine.

ori_sentence: Artificial bone refers to bone-like material created in a laboratory that can be used in bone grafts, to replace human bone that was lost due to severe fractures, disease, etc.
simple_sent: Artificial bone is a type of bone that is made in a laboratory. It can be used to replace human bone that has been lost because of disease or other reasons.

ori_sentence: Myostatin-related muscle hypertrophy is a rare genetic condition characterized by reduced body fat and increased skeletal muscle size.
simple_sent: Myostatin-related muscle hypertrophy is a rare condition. In it, the body fat is reduced and muscle mass is increased.

ori_sentence: Asymmetric crying facies (ACF), also called partial unilateral facial paresis and hypoplasia of depressor angula oris muscle, is a minor congenital anomaly caused by agenesis or hypoplasia of the depressor anguli oris muscle, one of the muscles that control the movements of the lower lip.
simple_sent: Asymmetric crying facies (ACF), also called partial unilateral facial paresis and hypoplasia of depressor angula oris muscle, is a condition in which the lower lip of the face is not fully formed. This is caused by a muscle in the face called the depressor anguli oris muscle.

ori_sentence: Arteriolosclerosis is a form of cardiovascular disease involving hardening and loss of elasticity of arterioles or small arteries and is most often associated with hypertension and diabetes mellitus.
simple_sent: Arteriolosclerosis is a disease of the heart. It causes hardening and loss of elasticity of small arteries in the heart. People who have this disease have high blood pressure and diabetes.

ori_sentence: Ataxic respiration is an abnormal pattern of breathing characterized by complete irregularity of breathing, with irregular pauses and increasing periods of apnea.
simple_sent: Ataxic respiration is a pattern of breathing that is not normal. The breathing does not come out right, there are pauses in the breathing, and it gets longer.

ori_sentence: Asteroid hyalosis is a degenerative condition of the eye involving small white opacities in the vitreous humor.
simple_sent: Asteroid hyalosis is a disease of the eye. It causes small white spots to develop in the eye.

ori_sentence: An upper motor neuron lesion (also known as pyramidal insufficiency) Is an injury or abnormality that occurs in the neural pathway above the anterior horn cell of the spinal cord or motor nuclei of the cranial nerves.
simple_sent: An upper motor neuron lesion (also known as pyramidal insufficiency) is an injury to the upper motor neurons of the spinal cord. It happens when the nerve roots above the anterior horn cell.

ori_sentence: Glomerulosclerosis is hardening of the glomeruli in the kidney.
simple_sent: Glomerulosclerosis is a disease of the kidney.

ori_sentence: Abdominal migraine is a psychogenic pain disorder.
simple_sent: Abdominal migraine is a major pain condition.

ori_sentence: Abnormal basal metabolic rate refers to a high or low basal metabolic rate (BMR).
simple_sent: If your basal metabolic rate is low, you may have problems with your health.

ori_sentence: The Gosselin fracture is a V-shaped fracture of the distal tibia which extends into the ankle joint and fractures the tibial plafond into anterior and posterior fragments.
simple_sent: The Gosselin fracture is a fracture of the tibia. It is a V-shaped fracture of the distal tibia, which means it goes into the ankle joint.

ori_sentence: The goblet cell carcinoid (GCC) is a rare biphasic gastrointestinal tract tumour that consists of a neuroendocrine component and a conventional carcinoma, histologically arising from Paneth cells.
simple_sent: The goblet cell carcinoid (GCC) is a rare tumour of the gastrointestinal tract. It has both a neuroendocrine component and a conventional carcinoma, and is found only in certain people.

ori_sentence: Hyperchlorhydria, sometimes called chlorhydria, sour stomach or acid stomach, refers to the state in the stomach where gastric acid levels are higher than the reference range.
simple_sent: Hyperchlorhydria, sometimes called sour stomach or acid stomach, is when there is too much acid in the stomach. This makes it hard for the stomach to digest food.

ori_sentence: The term gonadal artery is a generic term for a paired artery, with one arising from the abdominal aorta for each gonad.
simple_sent: A gonadal artery is an artery that is found in both sides of the body. It comes from the abdominal aorta.

ori_sentence: Glycogen storage disease type 0 is a disease characterized by a deficiency in the glycogen synthase enzyme (GSY).
simple_sent: Glycogen storage disease type 0 is a disease. It is caused by a lack of glycogen synthase in the body.

ori_sentence: A bimalleolar fracture is a fracture of the ankle that involves the lateral malleolus and the medial malleolus.
simple_sent: A bimalleolar fracture is a fracture of the ankle. The two parts of the ankle that are affected are:

simple_sent: Bilateral frontoparietal polymicrogyria is a genetic disorder. It is caused by a gene in the human family.

ori_sentence: A leiomyoma, also known as a fibroid, is a benign smooth muscle tumor that very rarely becomes cancer (0.1%).
simple_sent: A leiomyoma, also known as a fibroid, is a small tumor in the muscle. It is not usually cancerous.

ori_sentence: Neonatal herpes simplex is a rare but serious condition, usually caused by vertical transmission of the herpes simplex virus from mother to newborn.
simple_sent: Neonatal herpes simplex is a very serious condition. It happens when a baby gets the herpes simplex virus from his or her mother.

ori_sentence: Femoral hernias occur just below the inguinal ligament, when abdominal contents pass through a naturally occurring weakness in the abdominal wall called the femoral canal.
simple_sent: Femoral hernias occur when the abdominal contents pass through a weakness in the abdominal wall, called the femoral canal. This weakness is naturally present.

ori_sentence: Bier spots are small, light macules usually found on the arms and legs of young adults, in which the intervening skin may seem erythematous but blanches with pressure so that these light macules disappear.
simple_sent: Bier spots are small, light macules. They are usually found on the arms and legs of young adults. The skin may look like it is covered in erythematous cells, but when pressure is applied to it, it blanches.

ori_sentence: The foreskin is the double-layered fold of smooth muscle tissue, blood vessels, neurons, skin, and mucous membrane part of the penis that covers and protects the glans penis and the urinary meatus.
simple_sent: The foreskin is the part of the penis that covers and protects the glans penis. It is made up of smooth muscle tissue, blood vessels, neurons, skin, and a mucous membrane.

ori_sentence: AREDYLD stands for acral renal ectodermal dysplasia lipoatrophic diabetes.
simple_sent: AREDYLD stands for acral renal dysplasia and is a life long disease.

ori_sentence: Bitolterol mesylate (Tornalate) is a short-acting β2 adrenergic receptor agonist used for the relief of bronchospasm in conditions such as asthma and COPD.
simple_sent: Bitolterol mesylate, also known asornalate, is a short-acting drug. It is used in the treatment of asthma and other respiratory conditions.

ori_sentence: Exploding head syndrome (EHS) is an abnormal sensory perception during sleep in which a person experiences unreal noises that are loud and of short duration when falling asleep or waking up.
simple_sent: Exploding head syndrome (EHS) is an abnormal experience during sleep. When a person falls asleep and wakes up, they may experience loud noises that do not make sense.

ori_sentence: Glucarpidase (Voraxaze) is an FDA-approved intravenous drug for the treatment of elevated levels of methotrexate (defined as 1 micromol/L) during treatment of cancer patients who have impaired kidney function (and thus cannot reduce the drug to safe levels sufficiently after the drug has been given).
simple_sent: Glucarpidase (Voraxaze) is an FDA-approved intravenous drug. It is used to treat cancer patients who have high levels of methotrexate (1 micromol/L) in their blood. After the drug has been given, the drug must be reduced to a safe level.

ori_sentence: The globulomaxillary cyst is a cyst that appears between a maxillary lateral incisor and the adjacent canine.
simple_sent: Globulomaxillary cyst A globulomaxillary cyst is a cyst that can be seen in the front of the mouth.

ori_sentence: An abdominal mass is any localized enlargement or swelling in the human abdomen.
simple_sent: An abdominal mass is a swelling in the human abdomen, usually small.

ori_sentence: A biphasic disease is a disease which has two distinct phases or components.
simple_sent: A biphasic disease is a disease that has two different parts.

ori_sentence: Epidermolysis bullosa simplex (EBS), is a disorder resulting from mutations in the genes encoding keratin 5 or keratin 14.
simple_sent: Epidermolysis bullosa simplex, or EBS, is a disease. It is caused by changes in the genes that make keratin.

ori_sentence: Glomeruloid hemangioma is a distinctive vascular tumor first described in 1990 when found to be associated with POEMS syndrome and Castleman disease.
simple_sent: Glomeruloid hemangioma is a type of vascular tumor. It was first discovered in 1990, when people were found to have POEMS syndrome.

ori_sentence: Bicipital tenosynovitis is tendinitis or inflammation of the tendon and sheath lining of the biceps muscle.
simple_sent: Bicipital tenosynovitis is an inflammation of the biceps muscle. It is a type of tendinitis.

ori_sentence: Graham-Little syndrome is a cutaneous condition characterized by lichen planus-like skin lesions.
simple_sent: Graham-Little syndrome is a skin condition. People who have it have lichen planus-like skin.

ori_sentence: In medicine, bilirubinuria is an abnormality in which conjugated bilirubin is detected in the urine.
simple_sent: Bilirubinuria is when there is too much bilirubin in the urine. This is called bilirubinuria.

ori_sentence: Glomangiosarcoma is a low grade tumor of the soft tissue.
simple_sent: Glomangiosarcoma is a small soft tissue tumor.

ori_sentence: Glucose-galactose malabsorption is a rare condition in which the cells lining the intestine cannot take in the sugars glucose and galactose, which prevents proper digestion of these molecules and larger molecules made from them.
simple_sent: Glucose-galactose malabsorption is a rare condition. In it, the cells that line the intestine can not take in the glucose and galactose. This makes it hard for the cells to digest the sugar.

simple_sent: The gluteal tuberosity is a ridge on the outside of the femur bone.

ori_sentence: In medicine, Goodell's sign is an indication of pregnancy.
simple_sent: In medicine, the sign can also mean that you are pregnant.

ori_sentence: Gluteal gait is an abnormal gait caused by neurological problems.
simple_sent: Gluteal gait is a type of movement. It is an abnormal gait.

simple_sent: A Graham Steell murmur is a heart murmur. People who have it often have pulmonary regurgitation.

ori_sentence: Bipolar I disorder (BD-I; pronounced "type one bipolar disorder") is a type of bipolar spectrum disorder characterized by the occurrence of at least one manic episode, with or without mixed or psychotic features.
simple_sent: Bipolar I disorder (BD-I) is a type of bipolar disorder. People who have this disorder usually have at least one manic episode in their lives, and sometimes more than one at a time.

ori_sentence: Absent adrenal gland is a rare condition where the adrenal gland is absent at birth.
simple_sent: An absent adrenal gland is when the adrenal gland is not working properly.

ori_sentence: Birdshot chorioretinopathy now commonly named "birdshot uveitis" or "HLA-A29 uveitis" is a rare form of bilateral posterior uveitis affecting both eyes.
simple_sent: Birdshot chorioretinopathy is a rare form of uveitis that affects both eyes. It is often called "birdshot uveitis" or "HLA-A29 uveitis".

simple_sent: Gougerot-Blum syndrome is a form of purpuric dermatitis. It is a condition where the skin has small, rust-colored, lichenoid papules. These papules tend to fuse into plaques of different colors.

ori_sentence: ANOTHER syndrome consists of alopecia, nail dystrophy, ophthalmic complications, thyroid dysfunction, hypohidrosis, ephelides and enteropathy, and respiratory tract infections.
simple_sent: It also includes alopecia, nail dystrophy, eye problems, thyroid problems, hypohidrosis, enteropathy and respiratory tract infections.

ori_sentence: Bifascicular block is a conduction abnormality in the heart where two of the three main fascicles of the His/Purkinje system are blocked.
simple_sent: Bifascicular block is a problem in the heart. In this case, two of the three main fascicles of the heart are not working properly.

ori_sentence: A Graham patch is a surgical technique that is used to close duodenal perforations.
simple_sent: A Graham patch is used to close perforations in the duodenum.

ori_sentence: A gingival disease is the term given to any disorder primarily affecting the gingiva.
simple_sent: A gingival disease is a disease of the gingiva. It mainly affects the teeth.

ori_sentence: Gram-negative toe web infection is a skin condition that often begins with dermatophytosis.
simple_sent: Gram-negative toe web infection is a skin condition. It usually starts in the feet.

ori_sentence: Glipizide, sold under the brand name Glucotrol among others, is an anti-diabetic medication of the sulfonylurea class used to treat type 2 diabetes.
simple_sent: Glipizide (also known as Glucotrol) is an anti-diabetic drug. It is used to treat people with type 2 diabetes.

ori_sentence: Pretibial myxedema (myxoedema (UK), also known as Graves' dermopathy, thyroid dermopathy, Jadassohn-Dösseker disease or Myxoedema tuberosum) is an infiltrative dermopathy, resulting as a rare complication of Graves' disease, with an incidence rate of about 1-5%.
simple_sent: Pretibial myxedema (myxoedema (UK), also known as Graves' dermopathy, thyroid dermopathy, Jadassohn-Dösseker disease or Myxoedema tuberosum) is an infection of the skin. About 1-5 people in the world get this disease every year.

ori_sentence: Glutathionuria is the presence of glutathione in the urine, and is a rare inborn error of metabolism.
simple_sent: Glutathionuria is when there is too much glutathione in the urine. This is a rare condition.

ori_sentence: A gonadoblastoma is a complex neoplasm composed of a mixture of gonadal elements, such as large primordial germ cells, immature Sertoli cells or granulosa cells of the sex cord, and gonadal stromal cells.
simple_sent: A gonadoblastoma is a cancer of the gonads. It is made up of a mixture of different cells, including germ cells, stromal cells, and immature Sertoli cells of the sex cord.

ori_sentence: Resistant ovary syndrome, previously known as Savage syndrome, is a cause of ovarian failure that can lead to secondary amenorrhea.
simple_sent: Resistant ovary syndrome, also known as Savage syndrome, is when the ovary does not work properly. It can cause ovarian failure.

ori_sentence: Glycerol kinase deficiency (GKD) is an X-linked recessive enzyme defect that is heterozygous in nature.
simple_sent: Glycerol kinase deficiency (GKD) is a disease. It is caused by an enzyme that is not working properly.

ori_sentence: Chin augmentation using surgical implants can alter the underlying structure of the face, providing better balance to the facial features.
simple_sent: Surgical chin augmentation can change the face's underlying structure. This gives a better balance to the facial features.

ori_sentence: Bisalbuminemia is the, sometimes inherited, condition of having two types of serum albumin that differ in mobility during electrophoresis.
simple_sent: Bisalbuminemia is a condition in which two different types of albumin in the blood move differently during electrophoresis.

ori_sentence: Granulosis rubra nasi is a rare familial disease of children, occurring on the nose, cheeks, and chin, characterized by diffuse redness, persistent excessive sweating, and small dark red papules that disappear on diascopic pressure.
simple_sent: Granulosis rubra nasi is a rare disease of children. It usually occurs on the nose, cheeks, and chin. People with Granulosis rubra nasi have a red nose, a lot of sweating, and small dark red papules.

simple_sent: Amyloid light-chain (AL) amyloidosis is the most common form of amyloidosis in the United States. It is also called primary amyloidosis.

simple_sent: Abruzzo-Erickson syndrome is a condition. People who have it have short stature, deafness, protruding ears, and a cleft palate or palatal rugosity.

ori_sentence: Benign cephalic histiocytosis not to be confused with "Neonatal cephalic pustulosis"
simple_sent: Benign cephalic histiocytosis: This condition does not usually cause cancer.

ori_sentence: Hemorrhagic cystitis or haemorrhagic cystitis is an inflammation of the bladder defined by lower urinary tract symptoms that include dysuria, hematuria, and hemorrhage.
simple_sent: Hemorrhagic cystitis or haemorrhagic cystitis is an infection of the urinary bladder. The symptoms include bleeding, dysuria, and hematuria.

ori_sentence: Anaplastic carcinoma is a general term for a malignant neoplasm arising from the uncontrolled proliferation of transformed cells of epithelial origin, or showing some epithelial characteristics, but that reveal no cytological or architectural features associated with more differentiated tumors, such as the glandular formation or special cellular junctions that are typical of adenocarcinoma and squamous cell carcinoma, respectively.
simple_sent: Anaplastic carcinoma is a malignant tumor that does not show any characteristics associated with more differentiated tumors, such as the glandular formation or special cellular junctions that are typical for adenocarcinoma and squamous cell carcinoma. It is caused by the uncontrolled proliferation of transformed cells of epithelial origin, or that show some epithelial characteristics.

simple_sent: Harding ataxia is a rare disease. It is caused by an abnormality in the brain.

ori_sentence: Anal dysplasia is a pre-cancerous condition which occurs when the lining of the anal canal undergoes abnormal changes.
simple_sent: Anal dysplasia is a condition. It happens when the lining of the anal canal does not work the way it should.

ori_sentence: Hemoglobinemia (or haemoglobinaemia) is a medical condition in which there is an excess of hemoglobin in the blood plasma.
simple_sent: Hemoglobinemia is a medical condition. When there is too much hemoglobin in the blood, it is called haemoglobinaemia.

ori_sentence: Amorphosynthesis, also called a hemi-sensory deficit, is a neuropsychological condition in which a patient experiences unilateral inattention to sensory input.
simple_sent: Amorphosynthesis, also called a hemi-sensory deficit, is a condition. It happens when a person can not pay attention to what is around them.

simple_sent: Harlequin syndrome is a medical condition. People who have it will experience sweating and flushing in the upper thoracic region.

ori_sentence: Heat urticaria presents within five minutes after the skin has been exposed to heat above 43 degrees Celsius
simple_sent: Heat urticaria starts within 5 minutes if the skin has been exposed to heat more than 43 degrees.

simple_sent: An anesthetic vaporizer (American English) or anaesthetic vaporiser (British English) is a device that is attached to an anesthetic machine. The vapor is given to the patient by the machine.

ori_sentence: Android fat distribution describes the distribution of human adipose tissue mainly around the buttocks and upper body, in areas such as the abdomen, chest, shoulder and nape of the neck.
simple_sent: Android fat distribution describes the distribution of human adipose tissue in different parts of the body. The most common areas are the chest, abdomen, and upper body.

ori_sentence: Heat and Moisture Exchangers (HME) are devices used in mechanically ventilated patients intended to help prevent complications due to "drying of the respiratory mucosa, such as mucus plugging and endotracheal tube (ETT) occlusion."
simple_sent: Heat and Moisture Exchangers (HME) are devices used in mechanically ventilated patients. They are used to help stop the mucus plugging and other problems that can happen when the airways in the lungs are dried out.

ori_sentence: Heart valve repair is a surgical technique used to fix defects in heart valves in valvular heart diseases, and provides an alternative to valve replacement.
simple_sent: Heart valve repair is a surgery. It is done to fix problems with the heart valves. It can help people with heart disease or other problems.

ori_sentence: Anemic infarcts (also called white infarcts or pale infarcts) are white or pale infarcts caused by , and are usually seen in the heart, kidney and spleen.

ori_sentence: Heller myotomy is a surgical procedure in which the muscles of the cardia (lower esophageal sphincter or LES) are cut, allowing food and liquids to pass to the stomach.
simple_sent: A Heller myotomy is a surgery. In it, the muscles of the lower esophageal sphincter are cut. This allows food and liquids to pass to the stomach.

ori_sentence: Hapnes Boman Skeie syndrome is a rare genetic disorder in which subcutaneous angiolipomas form around the wrists, knees, and ankles.
simple_sent: Hapnes Boman-Skeie syndrome is a rare disease. People who have it will have growths around the wrists, knees, and ankles.

ori_sentence: Hemoglobin D-Punjab is one of the sub-variants of Hemoglobin D, a variant of hemoglobin found in human blood.
simple_sent: Hemoglobin D-Punjab is a type of hemoglobin that is not found in normal blood. It is a red blood cell.

simple_sent: Hennekam syndrome is an autosomal recessive disorder. It is also known as intestinal lymphagiectasia–lymphedema–mental retardation syndrome. People with Hennekam syndrome have a small amount of growth on their face, some facial anomalies, and some lymphedema.

simple_sent: Amoebic brain abscess is an infection of the brain. It is caused by an anaerobic parasite.

ori_sentence: Hawkinsinuria, is an autosomal dominant metabolic disorder affecting the metabolism of tyrosine.
simple_sent: Hawkinsinuria is a genetic disease. It affects the metabolism of tyrosine in the body.

ori_sentence: A health assessment is a plan of care that identifies the specific needs of a person and how those needs will be addressed by the healthcare system or skilled nursing facility.
simple_sent: A health assessment is a plan of care that identifies a person's specific needs and how the healthcare system or skilled nursing facility will address those needs.

ori_sentence: Heat cramps, a type of heat illness, are muscle spasms that result from loss of large amount of salt and water through exercise.
simple_sent: Heat cramps, a type of heat illness, are muscle spasms that happen because the body loses too much water and salt.

ori_sentence: Heat edema is a cutaneous condition characterized by dependent edema from vasodilatory pooling.
simple_sent: Heat edema is a cutaneous condition. The most common cause of heat edema is an infection.

ori_sentence: An ameloblastic fibroma is a fibroma of the ameloblastic tissue, that is, an odontogenic tumor arising from the enamel organ or dental lamina.
simple_sent: An ameloblastic fibroma is a growth on the teeth. It is called an ameloblastic fibroma because it grows from the enamel organ.

ori_sentence: Anemia of prematurity (AOP) refers to a form of anemia affecting preterm infants with decreased hematocrit.
simple_sent: Anemia of prematurity (AOP) is a form of anemia. It happens to babies who are born too early.

ori_sentence: A hearing test provides an evaluation of the sensitivity of a person's sense of hearing and is most often performed by an audiologist using an audiometer.
simple_sent: A hearing test is a test to see how good a person's hearing is. It is usually done by an audiologist with a device called an audiometer.

ori_sentence: Amnion nodosum are nodules found on the amnion, and is frequently present in oligohydramnios.
simple_sent: Amnion nodosum are nodules on the amnion. They are often found in oligohydramnios.

ori_sentence: Hemangioendotheliomas are a family of vascular neoplasms of intermediate malignancy.
simple_sent: The Hemangioendotheliomas are a family of malignancy in the blood.

ori_sentence: In anatomy of animals, the paleocortex, or paleopallium, is a region within the telencephalon in the vertebrate brain.
simple_sent: The paleocortex is a part of the brain. It is located in the telencephalon, which is a part of the brain.

ori_sentence: Rofecoxib was a COX-2 selective nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID).
simple_sent: Rofecoxib is an anti-inflammatory drug. It is a COX-2 selective drug.

ori_sentence: Acromicric dysplasia is an extremely rare inherited disorder characterized by abnormally short hands and feet, growth retardation and delayed bone maturation leading to short stature.
simple_sent: Acromicric dysplasia is a very rare disorder. People who have it have abnormally short hands and feet. They also have slow growth and development, and they are short.

ori_sentence: Aluminium carbonate (Al2(CO3)3), is a carbonate of aluminium.
simple_sent: Aluminium carbonate is a chemical compound.

ori_sentence: Actinomycetoma is a chronic bacterial subcutaneous infection caused by Actinomyces that affect the skin and connective tissue.
simple_sent: Actinomycetoma is an infection of the skin. It is caused by bacteria, and it can be very bad for the skin.

ori_sentence: Ambrisentan (U.S. trade name Letairis; E.U. trade name Volibris; India trade name Pulmonext by MSN labs) is a drug indicated for use in the treatment of pulmonary hypertension.
simple_sent: Ambrisentan (U.S. trade name Letairis; E.U. trade name Volibris; India trade name Pulmonext) is a drug that is used to treat pulmonary hypertension.

ori_sentence: Bertielliasis is the infection of Bertiella, a cestode tapeworm parasite that primarily infects nonhuman primates, rodents and Australian marsupials.
simple_sent: Bertielliasis is a disease. It is caused by a tapeworm called Bertiella. Bertiella is a cestode tapeworm.

ori_sentence: Actinic prurigo is a rare sunlight-induced, pruritic, papular or nodular skin eruption.
simple_sent: Actinic prurigo is a very rare skin eruption. It is caused by sunlight.

ori_sentence: Activated clotting time (ACT), also known as activated coagulation time, is a test of coagulation.
simple_sent: Activated clotting time (ACT) is a test to see if coagulation has taken place.

ori_sentence: Acute myeloblastic leukemia with maturation (M2) is a subtype of acute myeloid leukemia (AML).
simple_sent: Acute myeloid leukemia (AML) is a cancer. It is the most common type of leukemia.

ori_sentence: Epilepsia partialis continua is a rare type of brain disorder in which a patient experiences recurrent motor epileptic seizures that are focal (hands and face), and recur every few seconds or minutes for extended periods (days to years).
simple_sent: Epilepsia partialis continua is a rare type of brain disorder. People who have this disorder have seizures every few seconds or minutes, but they also have seizures for long periods of time, like days or even years.

ori_sentence: Benign paroxysmal vertigo of childhood is an uncommon neurological disorder which presents with recurrent episodes of dizziness.
simple_sent: Benign paroxysmal vertigo of childhood is a rare neurological disorder. People who have it often have episodes of dizziness.

ori_sentence: Bepridil (trade name Vascor) is an diamine calcium channel blocker once used to treat angina pectoris.
simple_sent: Bepridil (also known as Vascor) is a medication. It is used to treat angina pectoris.

ori_sentence: Berdon syndrome, also called Megacystis-microcolon-intestinal hypoperistalsis syndrome (MMIH syndrome), is an autosomal recessive fatal genetic disorder affecting newborns.
simple_sent: Berdon syndrome (also called Megacystis-microcolon-intestinal hypoperistalsis syndrome or MMIH syndrome) is a rare genetic disorder. People who have it are very sick.

ori_sentence: Cabot rings are thin, red-violet staining, threadlike strands in the shape of a loop or figure-8 that are found on rare occasions in red blood cells (erythrocytes).
simple_sent: Cabot rings are thin, red-violet strands in the shape of a loop or figure-8. They are usually found in red blood cells (erythrocytes), but not always.

ori_sentence: Subepithelial mucinous corneal dystrophy (SMCD) is a rare form of corneal dystrophy.
simple_sent: Subepithelial mucinous corneal dystrophy is a very rare condition.

ori_sentence: Benzquinamide is a discontinued antiemetic drug used in post-operative care.
simple_sent: Benzquinamide is an antiemetic drug. It is used after surgery.

ori_sentence: Beta-ketothiolase deficiency is a rare, autosomal recessive metabolic disorder in which the body cannot properly process the amino acid isoleucine or the products of lipid breakdown.
simple_sent: Beta-ketothiolase deficiency is a rare disease. In it, the body can not process the amino acid isoleucine or the products of lipid breakdown properly.

ori_sentence: Berlin's edema (commotio retinae) a common condition caused by blunt injury to the eye.
simple_sent: Berlin's edema (commotio retinae) is when the eye gets too much fluid.

ori_sentence: Iohexol, sold under the trade name Omnipaque among others, is a contrast agent used for X-ray imaging.
simple_sent: Iohexol (also known as Omnipaque) is a chemical compound. It is used to make X-ray images.

ori_sentence: A tuberculoma is a clinical manifestation of tuberculosis which conglomerates tubercles into a firm lump, and so can mimic cancer tumors of many types in medical imaging studies.
simple_sent: A tuberculoma is a disease of the skin. It is caused by tuberculosis. When people get tuberculosis, they get many tubercles in their skin.

ori_sentence: Hydrocodone is an opioid used to treat pain and as a cough suppressant.
simple_sent: Hydrocodone is used to treat pain. It is also used to stop coughs.

ori_sentence: Alopecia totalis is the loss of all skull and facial hair.
simple_sent: Alopecia totalis is a hair loss condition.

ori_sentence: In aviation and underwater diving, alternobaric vertigo is dizziness resulting from unequal pressures being exerted between the ears due to one Eustachian tube being less patent than the other.
simple_sent: In aviation and underwater diving, it can cause dizziness when there is too much pressure between the ears. This is because there is less patent in one ear than the other.

ori_sentence: Cavernous sinus thrombosis (CST) is the formation of a blood clot within the cavernous sinus, a cavity at the base of the brain which drains deoxygenated blood from the brain back to the heart.
simple_sent: Cavernous sinus thrombosis (CST) is when a blood clot forms in the cavernous sinus. This is a cavity at the base of the brain, and it takes blood from the brain to the heart.

ori_sentence: The nerve to tensor veli palatini is a small nerve which is unique in that it is the only branch of the mandibular nerve providing motor innervation to the palate.
simple_sent: The nerve to tensor veli palatini is a small nerve. It is the only part of the mandibular nerve that is used to move the palate.

ori_sentence: Acute cutaneous lupus erythematosus is a cutaneous condition characterized by a bilateral malar rash (also known as a "butterfly rash") and lesions that tend to be transient, and that follow sun exposure.
simple_sent: Acute cutaneous lupus erythematosus is a cutaneous condition. It is characterized by a bilateral malar rash (also known as a "butterfly rash") and usually goes away after a short time.

ori_sentence: Acute fatty liver of pregnancy is a rare life-threatening complication of pregnancy that occurs in the third trimester or the immediate period after delivery.
simple_sent: Acute fatty liver of pregnancy is a very rare disease. It usually happens during the third trimester of pregnancy, and can be very dangerous.

ori_sentence: Acute motor axonal neuropathy (AMAN) is a variant of Guillain–Barré syndrome.
simple_sent: Acute motor axonal neuropathy, also called AMAN, is a rare disease.

ori_sentence: Betamethasone dipropionate is a glucocorticoid steroid with anti-inflammatory and immunosuppressive abilities.
simple_sent: Betamethasone (also known as Betamethasone dipropionate) is a glucocorticoid drug. It is a steroid.

ori_sentence: Amcinonide (trade name Cyclocort) is a topical glucocorticoid used to treat itching, redness and swelling associated with several dermatologic conditions such as atopic dermatitis and allergic contact dermatitis.
simple_sent: Cyclocort (also known as Amcinonide) is a glucocorticoid drug. It is used to treat atopic dermatitis and allergic contact dermatitis, which are skin conditions that cause redness and swelling.

ori_sentence: Benzoyl peroxide is a chemical compound (specifically, an organic peroxide) with structural formula (C6H5−C(=O)O−)2, often abbreviated as (BzO)2.
simple_sent: Benzoyl peroxide is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is (C6H5−C(=O)O−)2. It is also known as (BzO)2.

ori_sentence: Acrocallosal syndrome (also known as ACLS) is an extremely rare autosomal recessive syndrome characterized by corpus callosum agenesis, polydactyly, multiple dysmorphic features, motor and intellectual disabilities, and other symptoms.
simple_sent: Acrocallosal syndrome (also known as ACLS) is an extremely rare disease. People who have Acrocallosal syndrome have polydactyly, multiple dysmorphic features, motor and intellectual disabilities, and other symptoms.

ori_sentence: Acrofrontofacionasal dysostosis is an extremely rare disorder, characterized by intellectual disability, short stature, hypertelorism, broad notched nasal tip, cleft lip/palate, postaxial camptobrachypolysyndactyly, fibular hypoplasia, and anomalies of foot structure.
simple_sent: Acrofrontofacionasal dysostosis is an extremely rare disorder. People with Acrofrontofacionasal dysostosis have short stature, a broad notched nasal tip, cleft lip/palate, postaxial camptobrachypolysyndactyly, fibular hypoplasia, and anomalies of foot structure.

ori_sentence: Acute myeloblastic leukemia without maturation is a quickly progressing disease in which too many immature white blood cells (not lymphocytes) are found in the blood and bone marrow.
simple_sent: Acute myeloblastic leukemia without maturation is a disease. In this disease, too many white blood cells (called lymphocytes) are found in the blood and bone marrow.

ori_sentence: Bepotastine (Talion, Bepreve) is a 2nd generation antihistamine.
simple_sent: Bepotastine is a chemical compound. It is an antihistamine.

ori_sentence: Acropectoral syndrome is an autosomal dominant skeletal dysplasia syndrome affecting the hands, feet, sternum, and lumbosacral spine.
simple_sent: Acropectoral syndrome affects the hands, feet and lumbosacral spine. It is an autosomal dominant skeletal dysplasia syndrome.

ori_sentence: Betazole (also known as ametazole) is a histamine H2 receptor agonist.
simple_sent: Betazole is a chemical compound. It is also known as ametazole.

ori_sentence: Cantharidin is an odorless, colorless fatty substance of the terpenoid class, which is secreted by many species of blister beetles.
simple_sent: Cantharidin is a chemical compound. Cantharidin is a colorless, odorless, fatty substance, of the terpenoid class.

ori_sentence: Famotidine, sold under the brand name Pepcid among others, is a histamine H2 receptor antagonist medication that decreases stomach acid production.
simple_sent: Famotidine (also known as Pepcid) is an anti- histamine drug. It works by decreasing the production of stomach acid.

ori_sentence: Benzodiazepine overdose describes the ingestion of one of the drugs in the benzodiazepine class in quantities greater than are recommended or generally practiced.
simple_sent: Benzodiazepine overdose is when a person takes more benzodiazepine than is recommended. This can happen when the drug is taken in large amounts.

ori_sentence: Bertolotti's syndrome is a commonly missed cause of back pain which occurs due to lumbosacral transitional vertebrae (LSTV).
simple_sent: Bertolotti's syndrome is a common cause of back pain. People usually do not realize that they have it.

ori_sentence: Beryllium granulomas is a skin condition caused by granulomatous inflammation of the skin which may follow accident laceration, usually in the occupational setting.
simple_sent: Beryllium granulomas are a condition of the skin. They are caused by granulomatous inflammation of the skin, usually after an accident.

ori_sentence: Diphenylpyraline (DPP; sold as Allergen, Arbid, Belfene, Diafen, Hispril, Histyn, Lergobine, Lyssipol, Mepiben, Neargal) is a first-generation antihistamine with anticholinergic effects of the diphenylpiperidine class.
simple_sent: Diphenylpyraline (also known as Allergen, Arbid, Belfene, Diafen, Hispril, Histyn, Lergobine, Lyssipol, Mepiben, Neargal) is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is DDP.

ori_sentence: Acrodermatitis /ac·ro·der·ma·ti·tis/ is a childhood form of dermatitis selectively affecting the hands and feet and may be accompanied by mild symptoms of fever and malaise.
simple_sent: Acrodermatitis /ac·ro·der·ma·ti·tis/ is a form of dermatitis. It mainly affects the hands and feet, but can also affect other parts of the body.

ori_sentence: Acrokeratosis verruciformis is a rare autosomal dominant disorder appearing at birth or in early childhood, characterized by skin lesions that are small, verrucous, flat papules resembling warts along with palmoplantar punctate keratoses and pits.
simple_sent: Acrokeratosis verruciformis is a rare disorder of the skin. People who have the disease at birth or in early childhood have small, flat papules that look like warts. They also have punctate keratoses and pits.

ori_sentence: Acromioplasty is an arthroscopic surgical procedure of the acromion.
simple_sent: Acromioplasty is a surgical procedure to remove an acromion.

ori_sentence: Amazia refers to a condition where one or both of the mammary glands is absent (the nipple and areola remain present).
simple_sent: Amazia is when one or both of the mammary glands are not working properly. The nipple and areola are still there.

ori_sentence: An ameboma, also known as an amebic granuloma, is a rare complication of Entamoeba histolytica infection, where in response to the infecting amoeba there is formation of annular colonic granulation, which results in a large local lesion of the bowel.
simple_sent: An ameboma, also known as an amebic granuloma, is an infection of the colon by an amoeba. When the amoeba touches the area of the colon, it causes an annular colonic granulation to form.

ori_sentence: Mauriac syndrome is a rare complication of type 1 diabetes characterized by extreme liver enlargement due to glycogen deposition, along with growth failure and delayed puberty.
simple_sent: Mauriac syndrome is a rare complication of type 1 diabetes. People with Mauriac syndrome have a large amount of glycogen in their liver, which makes their liver become bigger.

ori_sentence: Aripiprazole, sold under the brand names Abilify and Aristada among others, is an atypical antipsychotic.
simple_sent: Aripiprazole is an atypical antipsychotic drug. It is sold under the brand names Abilify and Aristada.

ori_sentence: Acropustulosis refers to acrodermatitis with pustular involvement.
simple_sent: Acropustulosis is the most common cause of acrodermatitis.

ori_sentence: Actinic granuloma is a cutaneous condition characterized histologically by a dermal infiltrate of macrophages.
simple_sent: Actinic granuloma is a cutaneous condition. It is characterized by macrophages getting into the body.

ori_sentence: The acute chest syndrome is a vaso-occlusive crisis of the pulmonary vasculature commonly seen in people with sickle cell anemia.
simple_sent: The most common cause of acute chest syndrome is sickle cell anemia. This causes a crisis of the pulmonary vasculature.

ori_sentence: Acute megakaryoblastic leukemia (AMKL) is life-threatening leukemia in which malignant megakaryoblasts proliferate abnormally and injure various tissues.
simple_sent: Acute megakaryoblastic leukemia (AMKL) is the most common type of leukemia. It is a life-threatening disease, and many people die from it.

ori_sentence: Hyperphenylalaninemia is a medical condition characterized by mildly or strongly elevated concentrations of the amino acid phenylalanine in the blood.
simple_sent: Hyperphenylalaninemia is a medical condition. It happens when the levels of the amino acid phenylalanine in the blood are very high.

ori_sentence: A gaze palsy is the paresis of conjugate eye movements.
simple_sent: Gaze palsy is when the eye movements are not straight.

ori_sentence: Iodinated contrast is a form of intravenous radiocontrast agent containing iodine, which enhances the visibility of vascular structures and organs during radiographic procedures.
simple_sent: Iodinated contrast is a form of radiocontrast that is given to the patient. It gives the doctor a better view of the organs and vascular structures in the body.

ori_sentence: Inborn errors of purine–pyrimidine metabolism are a class of inborn error of metabolism disorders specifically affecting purine metabolism and pyrimidine metabolism.
simple_sent: Inborn errors of purine-pyrimidine metabolism are errors in the metabolism of purine and pyrimidine. They usually do not occur naturally.

ori_sentence: Acid–base homeostasis is the homeostatic regulation of the pH of the body's extracellular fluid (ECF).
simple_sent: Acid-base homeostasis is how the pH of the extracellular fluid (ECF) is controlled by the body.

ori_sentence: Idelalisib, sold under the brand name Zydelig, is a medication used to treat certain blood cancers.
simple_sent: Zydelig, also known as Idelalisib, is a drug. It is used to treat certain blood cancers.

ori_sentence: A sebaceous adenoma, a type of adenoma, a cutaneous condition characterized by a slow-growing tumor usually presenting as a pink, flesh-coloured, or yellow papule or nodule.
simple_sent: A sebaceous adenoma is a slow-growing tumor on the skin. It is usually a pink, flesh-coloured, or yellow papule or nodule, and it does not need to be treated.

ori_sentence: Debakey forceps are a type of atraumatic tissue forceps used in vascular procedures to avoid tissue damage during manipulation.
simple_sent: Debakey forceps are a type of forceps. They are used to take tissue out of the body and put it back in.

ori_sentence: A hormone-receptor-positive (HR+) tumor is a tumor which consists of cells that express receptors for certain hormones.
simple_sent: A hormone-receptor-positive (HR+) tumor is a tumor that can only be found in certain areas of the body.

ori_sentence: Isovaleric acidemia is a rare autosomal recessive metabolic disorder which disrupts or prevents normal metabolism of the branched-chain amino acid leucine.
simple_sent: Isovaleric acidemia is a rare disease. It is an autosomal recessive disorder, which means that it does not normally happen.

ori_sentence: Fetor hepaticus or foetor hepaticus (see spelling differences), also known as breath of the dead or hepatic foetor, is a condition seen in portal hypertension where portosystemic shunting allows thiols to pass directly into the lungs.
simple_sent: Fetor hepaticus or foetor hepaticus (also known as breath of the dead or hepatic foetor) is a disease where thiols (chemicals in the blood) are allowed to go directly into the lungs.

ori_sentence: Periorbital puffiness, also known as puffy eyes, or swelling around the eyes, is the appearance of swelling in the tissues around the eyes, called the orbits.
simple_sent: Periorbital puffiness, also known as puffy eyes, or swelling around the eyes, is a swelling in the area around the eyes, called the orbits.

ori_sentence: A trichilemmal cyst is a common cyst that forms from a hair follicle, most often on the scalp, and is smooth, mobile, and filled with keratin, a protein component found in hair, nails, skin, and horns.
simple_sent: A trichilemmal cyst is a cyst that forms from a hair follicle. The hair follicle is usually on the scalp, and the cyst is usually found on the top of the hair.

ori_sentence: Roussy–Lévy syndrome, also known as Roussy–Lévy hereditary areflexic dystasia, is a rare genetic disorder of humans that results in progressive muscle wasting.
simple_sent: Roussy-Lévy syndrome, also called hereditary areflexic dystasia or Roussy-Lévy syndrome, is a rare disease. People who have it will lose muscle mass.

ori_sentence: Multiple disabilities is a term for a person with a combination of disabilities, for instance, someone with both a sensory disability and a motor disability.
simple_sent: A person with a disability may have more than one type of disability. For example, someone with a motor disability and a sensory disability.

ori_sentence: A Hollenhorst plaque is a cholesterol embolus that is seen in a blood vessel of the retina.
simple_sent: A Hollenhorst plaque is a blockage of blood vessels. It can be seen in the retina.

ori_sentence: Histrelin acetate, sold under the brand names Vantas and Supprelin LA among others, is a nonapeptide analogue of gonadotropin-releasing hormone (GnRH) with added potency.
simple_sent: Histrelin acetate, also known as Supprelin LA or Vantas, is a nonapeptide hormone. It is used to increase the production of gonadotropin-releasing hormone.

ori_sentence: Z-plasty is a versatile plastic surgery technique that is used to improve the functional and cosmetic appearance of scars.
simple_sent: Z-plasty is a versatile plastic surgery technique. It is used to improve the appearance and function of scars.

ori_sentence: Holocarboxylase synthetase deficiency is an inherited metabolic disorder in which the body is unable to use the vitamin biotin effectively.
simple_sent: Holocarboxylase synthetase deficiency is a disease. It happens when a person's body does not produce enough Holocarboxylase.

ori_sentence: Blood lead level (BLL), is a measure of the amount of lead in the blood.
simple_sent: Blood lead level (BLL) is how much lead there is in your blood.

ori_sentence: The lacrimal nerve is the smallest branch of the ophthalmic nerve (V1), itself a branch of the trigeminal nerve (CN V).
simple_sent: The lacrimal nerve is a nerve in the eye. The lacrimal nerve is a small branch of the ophthalmic nerve.

ori_sentence: Butcher's wart is a cutaneous (skin) condition with a prevalence of 8.5% to 23.8% among butchers and other meat-handling professions caused by a small group of viruses that infect the skin.
simple_sent: Butcher's wart is a condition that affects about 8.5% to 23.8% of all people who work with meat. It is caused by a small group of viruses that infect the skin.

ori_sentence: The frontal nerve is the largest branch of the ophthalmic nerve (V1), itself a branch of the trigeminal nerve (CN V).
simple_sent: The frontal nerve is an important nerve in the head. It is also called the ophthalmic nerve.

ori_sentence: Levobupivacaine (rINN)
simple_sent: Riboflavin (rINN)

ori_sentence: Bullous impetigo is a bacterial skin infection caused by Staphylococcus aureus that results in the formation of large blisters called bullae, usually in areas with skin folds like the armpit, groin, between the fingers or toes, beneath the breast, and between the buttocks.
simple_sent: Impetigo is a bacterial skin infection caused by Staphylococcus aureus. The infection causes large blisters to form on the skin, usually in areas where the skin is moist, such as the armpit, the groin, or between the fingers or toes.

ori_sentence: Amphotericin B is an antifungal medication used for serious fungal infections and leishmaniasis.
simple_sent: Amphotericin B is an antifungal drug. It is used to stop fungal infections from happening.

ori_sentence: Tamoxifen, sold under the brand name Nolvadex among others, is a selective estrogen receptor modulator used to prevent breast cancer in women and treat breast cancer in women and men.
simple_sent: Tamoxifen (also known as Nolvadex) is a drug that is used to treat breast cancer. It works by changing the way estrogen in the body works.

ori_sentence: Iron pentacarbonyl, also known as iron carbonyl, is the compound with formula Fe(CO)5.
simple_sent: Iron pentacarbonyl is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is Fe(CO)5.

ori_sentence: Calcinosis cutis is a type of calcinosis wherein calcium deposits form in the skin.
simple_sent: Carcinosis cutis is a type of Calcinosis. The skin gets calcium deposits.

ori_sentence: Catel–Manzke syndrome is a rare genetic disorder characterized by distinctive abnormalities of the index fingers; the classic features of Pierre Robin syndrome; occasionally with additional physical findings.
simple_sent: Catel-Manzke syndrome is a rare genetic disorder. People with the syndrome have different fingers. They have the classic features of Pierre Robin syndrome, but sometimes they have more.

ori_sentence: CD30+ cutaneous T-cell lymphoma, also known as primary cutaneous anaplastic large cell lymphoma, is a cutaneous (skin) condition characterized by solitary or localized skin lesions that have a tendency to ulcerate.
simple_sent: CD30+ cutaneous T-cell lymphoma, also known as primary cutaneous anaplastic large cell lymphoma, is a cancer of the skin. People who have the condition will have skin lesions.

ori_sentence: Gluteoplasty (Greek gloutόs, rump + plassein, to shape) denotes the plastic surgery and the liposuction procedures for the correction of the congenital, traumatic, and acquired defects and deformities of the buttocks and the anatomy of the gluteal region; and for the aesthetic enhancement (by augmentation or by reduction) of the contour of the buttocks.
simple_sent: Gluteoplasty (Greek gloutόs, rump + plassein, to shape) is a type of plastic surgery. The goal of the surgery is to correct congenital or acquired defects and deformities of the buttocks. The goal of the surgery is also to improve the appearance of the buttocks and the anatomy of the gluteal region.

ori_sentence: Ethylene glycol poisoning is poisoning caused by drinking ethylene glycol.
simple_sent: Ethylene glycol can be very dangerous to people. It can cause poisoning.

ori_sentence: Butacaine is a white crystalline ester used as a local anesthetic.
simple_sent: Butacaine is a local anesthetic. It is a white crystalline substance.

ori_sentence: Caliber persistent artery is a common vascular anomaly where a main arterial branch extends into superficial tissues without a reduction of diameter.
simple_sent: A Caliber persistent artery is a common vascular abnormality. In this case, a main arterial branch goes into some other tissues.

ori_sentence: Acatalasia is an autosomal recessive peroxisomal disorder caused by absent or very low levels of the enzyme catalase.
simple_sent: Acatalasia is an autosomal recessive disorder. It happens when an enzyme called catalase is not working properly.

ori_sentence: c-ANCAs, or PR3-ANCA, or antineutrophil cytoplasmic antibodies, are a type of autoantibody, an antibody produced by the body that acts against one of its own proteins.
simple_sent: c-ANCAs, or PR3-ANCA, or antineutrophil cytoplasmic antibodies, are antibodies made by the body. They act against a protein that the body thinks is bad.

ori_sentence: Cantú syndrome is a rare condition characterized by hypertrichosis, osteochondrodysplasia, and cardiomegaly.
simple_sent: Cantú syndrome is a rare condition. People who have it have hypertrichosis and osteochondrodysplasia.

ori_sentence: The calcifying epithelial odontogenic tumor (CEOT), also known as a Pindborg tumor, is an odontogenic tumor first recognized by the Danish pathologist Jens Jørgen Pindborg in 1955.
simple_sent: The calcifying epithelial odontogenic tumor (CEOT), also known as a Pindborg tumor, is a tumor that grows on the teeth. People who have the tumor get sick.

ori_sentence: Renovascular hypertension is a condition in which high blood pressure is caused by the kidneys' hormonal response to narrowing of the arteries supplying the kidneys.
simple_sent: Renovascular hypertension is a condition in which the blood pressure in the arteries that supply the kidneys gets higher and higher.

ori_sentence: Heavy legs is a condition described as an unpleasant sensation of pain and heaviness in the lower limbs.
simple_sent: Heavy legs is a feeling in the lower limbs. People who have it say it is an unpleasant feeling.

ori_sentence: A cardiac shunt is a pattern of blood flow in the heart that deviates from the normal circuit of the circulatory system.
simple_sent: A cardiac shunt is when the blood flow to the heart is different than it should be. This is called a heart defect.

ori_sentence: Microcytic anaemia is any of several types of anaemia characterized by small red blood cells (called microcytes).
simple_sent: Microcytic anaemia is different because the small red blood cells (called microcytes) in the blood do not work.

ori_sentence: Camisa disease is the variant form of Vohwinkel syndrome, characterized by ichthyosis and normal hearing.
simple_sent: Camisa disease is a different form of Vohwinkel syndrome. People with Camisa disease have normal hearing.

ori_sentence: Ammonium persulfate (APS) is the inorganic compound with the formula (NH4)2S2O8.
simple_sent: Ammonium persulfate is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is (NH4)2S2O8.

ori_sentence: Yohimbine (/joʊˈhɪmbiːn/), also known as quebrachine, is an indole alkaloid derived from the bark of the African tree Pausinystalia johimbe; also from the bark of the unrelated South American tree Aspidosperma quebracho-blanco.
simple_sent: Yohimbine, also known as quebrachine, is an indole alkaloid. It comes from the bark of the African tree Pausinystalia johimbe, but it also comes from another tree in South America, Aspidosperma quebracho-blanco.

ori_sentence: Carphologia (or carphology) is a lint-picking behavior that is often a symptom of a delirious state.
simple_sent: Carphologia (or carphology) is a behavior that many people experience when they are very drunk.

ori_sentence: Rubeosis iridis, is a medical condition of the iris of the eye in which new abnormal blood vessels (formed by neovascularization) are found on the surface of the iris.
simple_sent: Rubeosis iridis is a medical condition. In it, the iris of the eye gets new blood vessels. These new blood vessels are called new blood vessels.

ori_sentence: Canalicular adenoma is a benign, epithelial salivary gland neoplasm arranged in interconnecting cords of columnar cells.
simple_sent: Canalicular adenoma is a small, benign tumor in the salivary gland. It is made up of thin cords of columnar cells.

ori_sentence: An Isograft is a graft of tissue between two individuals who are genetically identical (i.e. monozygotic twins).
simple_sent: An isograft is a tissue graft between two people. The tissue is usually made from animal cells.

ori_sentence: Butamben is a local anesthetic.
simple_sent: Butamben is a general anesthetic.
