ori_sentence: Familial encephalopathy with neuroserpin inclusion bodies (FENIB) is a progressive disorder of the nervous system that is characterized by a loss of intellectual functioning (dementia) and seizures.
simple_sent: Familial encephalopathy with neuroserpin inclusion bodies (FENIB) is a progressive disorder. People who have this disease have a loss of memory (dementia) and problems with thinking.

ori_sentence: Familial male-limited precocious puberty, often abbreviated as FMPP, also known as familial sexual precocity or gonadotropin-independent testotoxicosis, is a form of gonadotropin-independent precocious puberty in which boys experience early onset and progression of puberty.
simple_sent: Familial male-limited precocious puberty (FMPP), also known as familial sexual precocity or gonadotropin-independent precocious puberty, is a stage of puberty in which boys experience early onset and development of puberty.

ori_sentence: A fat pad (aka haversian gland) is a mass of closely packed fat cells surrounded by fibrous tissue septa.
simple_sent: A fat pad (also called the haversian gland) is a large mass of fat. It is made up of fat cells.

ori_sentence: Extramedullary hematopoiesis (EMH or sometimes EH) refers to hematopoiesis occurring outside of the medulla of the bone (bone marrow).
simple_sent: Extramedullary hematopoiesis (EMH or sometimes EH) is when the bone marrow outside the medulla gets blood.

ori_sentence: Familial progressive hyperpigmentation is characterized by patches of hyperpigmentation, present at birth, which increase in size and number with age.
simple_sent: Familial progressive hyperpigmentation occurs when a child is born with small areas of hyperpigmentation. These areas increase in size with age.

ori_sentence: Temsirolimus, sold under the brand name Torisel, is an intravenous drug for the treatment of renal cell carcinoma (RCC), developed by Wyeth Pharmaceuticals and approved by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) in May 2007, and was also approved by the European Medicines Agency (EMA) in November 2007.
simple_sent: Temsirolimus (also known as Torisel) is a drug that is taken intravenously. It is used to treat renal cell carcinoma. The drug was approved by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) in May 2007, and by the European Medicines Agency (EMA) in November 2007.

ori_sentence: In medicine, systolic hypertension is defined as an elevated systolic blood pressure (SBP).If the systolic blood pressure is elevated (>140) with a normal (<90) diastolic blood pressure (DBP), it is called "isolated systolic hypertension".
simple_sent: Systolic blood pressure (SBP) is a measure of blood pressure. If the systolic blood pressure is higher than 140/90, it is called hypertension. If the systolic blood pressure is lower than 90, it is called diabetes.

ori_sentence: Telangiectasia macularis eruptiva perstans is persistent, pigmented, asymptomatic eruption of macules usually less than 0.5 cm in diameter with a slightly reddish-brown tinge.
simple_sent: Telangiectasia macularis eruptiva perstans is a long-lasting, red-brown eruption of macules. The macules are usually not more than 0.5 cm in diameter.

ori_sentence: A gangliocytic paraganglioma is a rare tumour that is typically found in the duodenum and consists of three components: (1) ganglion cells, (2) epithelioid cells (paraganglioma-like)
simple_sent: A gangliocytic paraganglioma is a very rare tumour. It is usually found in the duodenum and is made up of two parts: ganglion cells and epithelioid cells.

ori_sentence: Taussig–Bing syndrome is a cyanotic congenital heart defect in which the patient has both double outlet right ventricle (DORV) and ventricular septal defect (VSD).
simple_sent: Taussig-Bing syndrome is a birth defect. In this case, the right ventricle of the heart does not work properly, and the left ventricle does not work properly.

ori_sentence: A gallop rhythm refers to a (usually abnormal) rhythm of the heart on auscultation.
simple_sent: A gallop rhythm is a heart beat that is not normal. It is called auscultation.

ori_sentence: Ganglioneuroblastoma is a variant of neuroblastoma that is surrounded by ganglion cells.
simple_sent: Ganglioneuroblastoma is a type of brain cancer. It is caused by ganglion cells.

ori_sentence: Targetoid hemosiderotic hemangioma (also known as a "Hobnail hemangioma") is a cutaneous condition characterized by a central brown or violaceous papule that is surrounded by an ecchymotic halo.
simple_sent: A targetoid hemosiderotic hemangioma (also known as a "Hobnail hemangioma") is a condition in which the central area of the body has a brown or violaceous papule.

ori_sentence: Gandy–Gamna nodules or Gandy-Gamna bodies, sometimes known as Gamna-Gandy bodies or Gamna-Gandy nodules, are small yellow-brown, brown, or rust-colored foci found in the spleen in patients with splenomegaly due to portal hypertension, as well as sickle cell disease.
simple_sent: Gandy-Gamna nodules or Gandy-Gamna bodies, sometimes known as Gamna-Gandy bodies or Gamna-Gandy nodules, are nodules found in the spleen. They can be small yellow-brown, brown, or rust-colored foci.

ori_sentence: Surface epithelial-stromal tumors are a class of ovarian neoplasms that may be benign or malignant.
simple_sent: Surface epithelial-stromal tumors are cancer of the surface of the skin. They may be benign.

ori_sentence: Suvorexant, sold under the trade name Belsomra, is a medication for the treatment of insomnia.
simple_sent: Suvorexant (also known as Belsomra) is a medication. It is used to treat insomnia.

ori_sentence: Swan neck deformity is a deformed position of the finger, in which the joint closest to the fingertip is permanently bent toward the palm while the nearest joint to the palm is bent away from it (DIP flexion with PIP hyperextension).
simple_sent: Swan neck deformity is a deformity of the finger. In this condition, the joint closest to the palm of the hand is bent toward the palm, while the joint farthest away from the palm is bent away from the palm.

ori_sentence: Systematized epidermal nevus is a cutaneous condition, an epidermal nevus with a diffuse or extensive distribution involving a large portion of a person's body surface.
simple_sent: Systematized epidermal nevus is an epidermal condition that does not appear on the skin itself. It affects a large portion of a person's body surface.

ori_sentence: Synpolydactyly is a joint presentation of syndactyly (fusion of digits) and polydactyly (production of supernumerary digits).
simple_sent: Synpolydactyly is a form of polydactyly. It is a combination of syndactyly and polydactyly in one form or another.

ori_sentence: Syringofibroadenoma is a cutaneous condition characterized by a hyperkeratotic nodule or plaque involving the extremities.
simple_sent: Syringofibroadenoma Syringofibroadenoma is a cutaneous condition. It is usually found in the extremities.

ori_sentence: A DNA repair-deficiency disorder is a medical condition due to reduced functionality of DNA repair.
simple_sent: A DNA repair-deficiency disorder is a medical condition. It does not work the way it should.

ori_sentence: The eye is made up of the sclera, the iris, and the pupil, a black hole located at the center of the eye with the main function of allowing light to pass to the retina.
simple_sent: The eye is made up of three parts: the sclera, the iris, and the pupil. The pupil is a black hole in the center of the eye that lets light in.

ori_sentence: Talimogene laherparepvec is a biopharmaceutical drug to treat melanoma that cannot be operated on; it is injected directly into a subset of lesions which generates a systemic immune response against the patient's cancer.
simple_sent: Talimogene laherparepvec is a biopharmaceutical drug to treat melanoma. The drug is injected directly into the affected area of the skin, where the cancer is located, and it starts an immune response.

ori_sentence: Tandem gait is a gait (method of walking or running) where the toes of the first foot touch the heel of the next one at each step.
simple_sent: Tandem gait is a way of walking or running. At each step, the toes of the first foot touch the toes of the second foot.

ori_sentence: Tar melanosis is an occupational dermatosis that occurs among tar handlers after several years of exposure, characterized by a severe widespread itching that is soon followed by the appearance of reticular pigmentation, telangiectases, and a shiny appearance of the skin.
simple_sent: Tar melanosis is an occupational dermatosis. After several years of working with tar, people who have the condition will experience severe itching. This itching will soon turn into reticular pigmentation, telangiectases and a shiny appearance of the skin.

ori_sentence: Tasimelteon, sold under the brand name Hetlioz, is a medication approved by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) in January 2014, for the treatment of non-24-hour sleep–wake disorder (also called non-24, N24 and N24HSWD).
simple_sent: Tasimelteon, sold under the brand name Hetlioz, is a drug that is taken for the treatment of non-24-hour sleep-wake disorder. This condition is also called non-24, N24 and N24HSWD.

ori_sentence: Symbrachydactyly is a congenital abnormality, characterized by limb anomalies consisting of brachydactyly, cutaneous syndactyly and global hypoplasia of the hand or foot.
simple_sent: Symbrachydactyly is a congenital abnormality of the hand or foot. People who have it have brachydactyly, cutaneous syndactyly and global hypoplasia of the hand or foot.

ori_sentence: A syphilid is any of the cutaneous and mucous membrane lesions characteristic of secondary and tertiary syphilis.
simple_sent: A syphilid is any of the cutaneous and mucous membrane lesions that can be caused by syphilis.

ori_sentence: Systolic heart murmurs are heart murmurs heard during systole,
simple_sent: Systolic heartbeats are when the heart is working hard.

ori_sentence: Syringocystadenoma papilliferum is a benign apocrine tumor.
simple_sent: Syringocystadenoma papilliferum is a small cancer.

ori_sentence: T cell deficiency is a deficiency of T cells, caused by decreased function of individual T cells, it causes an immunodeficiency of cell-mediated immunity.
simple_sent: T cell deficiency is a disease. It is caused by a lack of T cells. When there are not enough T cells, the body can not fight off infections.

ori_sentence: In electrocardiography, the T wave represents the repolarization of the ventricles.
simple_sent: In electrocardiography, the T wave shows how the heart is working.

ori_sentence: TEMPI Syndrome is an orphan disease where the patients share five characteristics from which the acronym is derived: telangiectasias, elevated erythropoietin and erythrocytosis, monoclonal gammopathy, perinephric fluid collection, and intrapulmonary shunting.
simple_sent: TEMPI Syndrome is an orphan disease where the patients share five characteristics. These characteristics are telangiectasias, elevated erythropoietin and erythrocytosis, perinephric fluid collection, and intrapulmonary shunting.

ori_sentence: The mastoid antrum (tympanic antrum, antrum mastoideum, Valsalva's antrum) is an air space in the petrous portion of the temporal bone, communicating posteriorly with the mastoid cells and anteriorly with the epitympanic recess of the middle ear via the aditus to mastoid antrum (entrance to the mastoid antrum).
simple_sent: The mastoid antrum (also called thetympanic antrum or mastoid antrum) is an air space in the middle ear. It is part of the temporal bone, and it connects the epitympanic recess of the middle ear with the mastoid cells and with the aditus to mastoid antrum.

ori_sentence: Empiric therapy or empirical therapy is medical treatment or therapy based on experience and,
simple_sent: Empiric therapy is a type of therapy. It is a therapy that is based on experience.

ori_sentence: Majocchi's granuloma is a skin condition characterized by deep, pustular plaques, and is a form of tinea corporis.
simple_sent: Majocchi's granuloma is a skin condition. People who have the condition have deep, pustular plaques.

ori_sentence: Fungal meningitis refers to meningitis caused by a fungal infection.
simple_sent: Fungal meningitis A fungal infection can cause meningitis.

ori_sentence: Stunted growth is a reduced growth rate in human development.
simple_sent: Stunted growth is a very slow growth rate in people.

ori_sentence: An endolymphatic sac tumor (ELST) is a very uncommon papillary epithelial neoplasm arising within the endolymphatic sac or endolymphatic duct.
simple_sent: An endolymphatic sac tumor (ELST) is a tumor in the endolymphatic sac. It is a very rare papillary epithelial neoplasm.

simple_sent: Empagliflozin is a drug that is used to treat type 2 diabetes. It is sold under the brand name Jardiance in the United States.

ori_sentence: Gadoversetamide is a gadolinium-based MRI contrast agent, particularly for imaging of the brain, spine and liver.
simple_sent: Gadoversetamide is a gadolinium-based contrast agent. It is used to improve MRI images of the brain.

ori_sentence: Stenosis of the pulmonary artery is a condition where the pulmonary artery is subject to an abnormal constriction (or stenosis).
simple_sent: Stenosis of the pulmonary artery is when the pulmonary artery becomes too narrow. This is called pulmonary stenosis.

ori_sentence: GRACILE syndrome is a very rare lethal autosomal recessive genetic disorder, one of the Finnish heritage diseases.
simple_sent: GRACILE syndrome is a very rare genetic disorder. It is the most common Finnish heritage disease.

ori_sentence: Stereoblindness (also stereo blindness) is the inability to see in 3D using stereopsis, or stereo vision, resulting in an inability to perceive stereoscopic depth by combining and comparing images from the two eyes.
simple_sent: Stereoblindness (also called stereo blindness) is when a person can not see in 3D with two eyes. This is called stereo vision, because the two eyes can not see the same thing at the same time.

simple_sent: Steroid-induced rosacea is an iatrogenic condition. It happens when the patient or doctor uses steroids, either systemic or topical.

ori_sentence: Stimmler syndrome is a rare autosomal recessive congenital disorder first described by Stimmler et al.
simple_sent: Stimmler syndrome is a rare disease. It is an autosomal recessive disorder, meaning it happens to everyone.

ori_sentence: Subacute cutaneous lupus erythematosus is a clinically distinct subset of cases of lupus erythematosus that is most often present in white women aged 15 to 40, consisting of skin lesions that are scaly and evolve as poly-cyclic annular lesions or plaques similar to those of plaque psoriasis.
simple_sent: Subacute cutaneous lupus erythematosus is a very rare form of lupus erythematosus that only occurs in white women between the ages of 15 and 40. It is characterized by skin lesions that are scaly and change into poly-cyclic lesions or plaques as with plaque psoriasis.

ori_sentence: Steatocystoma simplex is a skin condition characterized by a skin lesion that occurs with equal frequency in adult women and men, and is typically found on the face, trunk, or extremities.
simple_sent: Steatocystoma simplex is a skin condition that happens to both men and women. It is usually found on the face, the trunk of the body, or on the extremities of the body.

simple_sent: Subacute myelo-optic neuropathy (SMON) is a disease that affects the central nervous system. It can cause paralysis and even death.

simple_sent: Staphylococcal enteritis is a disease. It is usually caused by a bacterium called Staphylococcus aureus.

ori_sentence: Gallbladder polyps are growths or lesions resembling growths (polypoid lesions) in the wall of the gallbladder.
simple_sent: Gallbladder polyps are growths in the wall of the gallbladder. They look like growths or lesions.

ori_sentence: Status marmoratus is a congenital condition due to maldevelopment of the corpus striatum associated with choreoathetosis, in which the striate nuclei have a marble-like appearance caused by altered myelination in the putamen, caudate, and thalamus (there are bilateral hyperdensities restricted to the thalamus).

simple_sent: Gabapentin enacarbil (Horizant (IR) (U.S.), Regnite (in Japan)) is a medication. It is used to treat gabapentin deficiency and other related symptoms.

simple_sent: Galactokinase deficiency, is an autosomal recessive metabolic disorder. It happens when a person's blood does not have enough galactose and galactitol, the two things that galactose and galactitol are made from.

simple_sent: Ixabepilone (also known as azaepothilone B) is a cancer drug. Bristol-Myers Squibb makes this drug as a treatment for people with certain types of cancer.

ori_sentence: Steroid diabetes is a medical term referring to prolonged hyperglycemia due to glucocorticoid therapy for another medical condition.
simple_sent: Steroid diabetes is a medical term. It is when a person's blood sugar is too high because of another medical condition.

ori_sentence: The Snout reflex (also orbicularis oris reflex) or a "Pout" is a pouting or pursing of the lips that is elicited by light tapping of the closed lips near the midline.
simple_sent: The Snout reflex (also orbicularis oris reflex) or a "Pout" is a reflex to close the lips when something is near the midline of the mouth.

simple_sent: Endometrial stromal sarcoma is a cancer of the endometrium. It is different from most cancers because it starts in the stroma, the tissue around the endometrium.

simple_sent: An Allis clamp is a surgical tool. It is also called the Allis forceps.

simple_sent: Functio laesa is a term in medicine. It means a loss of function or a problem with function.

simple_sent: Fundal height, or McDonald's rule, is how big a woman's uterus is during pregnancy. It is a measure of how big a baby is.

simple_sent: Funisitis is an infection of the umbilical cord. Chorioamnionitis is the main cause.

simple_sent: GAPO syndrome is a rare disease. It causes very slow growth. It has not been found in children more than 30 times before 2011.

simple_sent: From the posterior wall of the saccule a canal, the endolymphatic duct, is given off. simple_sent: Steroid acne is an adverse reaction to corticosteroids. People with steroid acne usually get pimples on their forehead, cheeks, and chest.

ori_sentence: The stria medullaris is a part of the epithalamus.
simple_sent: It is called the stria medullaris.

simple_sent: A stress ulcer is a single or multiple problem areas in the body. It can be caused by stress or by upper gastrointestinal bleeding.

simple_sent: Emanuel syndrome, also known as derivative 22 syndrome, or der(22) syndrome, is a rare disorder. People who have Emanuel syndrome have an intellectual disability, and they have problems with their body when they are born.

simple_sent: Degenerative disc disease (DDD) is a medical condition in which one or more intervertebral discs in the spine start to not work properly. People who have the disease will have symptoms.

ori_sentence: Emedastine (trade name Emadine) is a second generation antihistamine used in eye drops to alleviate the symptoms of allergic conjunctivitis.
simple_sent: Emedastine (also known as Emadine) is a second generation antihistamine. It is used in eye drops to help people with allergies.

simple_sent: Endocardial fibroelastosis (EFE) is a rare heart disease. Most people who have it are young children.

simple_sent: Vein of Galen aneurysmal malformations (VGAM) and Vein of Galen aneurysmal dilations (VGAD) are two types of arteriovenous malformations.

simple_sent: Isopropyl myristate is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is IPM.

simple_sent: Ulnar neuropathy is a disease that affects the ulnar nerve.

simple_sent: Underactive bladder syndrome (UAB) is a condition where it is hard to empty the bladder. People who have this condition often have a poor or intermittent stream of urine.

simple_sent: Undervirilization is a medical term that describes a male's body after he has had sex for a long time. His body, especially the genitalia, shows evidence of androgen effects.

ori_sentence: Artemether is a medication used for the treatment of malaria.

ori_sentence: Pentamidine is an antimicrobial medication used to treat African trypanosomiasis, leishmaniasis, Balamuthia infections, babesiosis, and to prevent and treat pneumocystis pneumonia (PCP) in people with poor immune function.

simple_sent: Dacarbazine (also known as imidazole carboxamide) is a chemotherapy drug. It is used to treat certain types of cancer.

simple_sent: Prasugrel (also known as Effient in the United States and Efient in the European Union) is a medication that helps to prevent blood clots.

simple_sent: Sumatriptan (also known as Imitrex) is a prescription drug. It is used to treat migraine headaches and cluster headaches.

simple_sent: Spectinomycin, also known as Trobicin, is an antibiotic. It is used to treat people who have gonorrhea.

ori_sentence: Carisoprodol, sold under the brand name Soma among others, is a medication used for musculoskeletal pain.
simple_sent: Carisoprodol (also known as Soma) is a pain medication. It is sold under the brand name Soma.

ori_sentence: In the field of psychology, the term grandiosity refers to an unrealistic sense of superiority, characterized by a sustained view of one's self as better than others, which is expressed by disdainfully criticising them, overinflating one's own capability and belittling them as inferior; and refers to a sense of personal uniqueness, the belief that few other people have anything in common with oneself, and that one can only be understood by a few, very special people.

ori_sentence: Tedizolid (formerly torezolid, trade name Sivextro), is an oxazolidinone-class antibiotic.
simple_sent: Tedizolid is an antibiotic. Its trade name is Sivextro and it is an oxazolidinone.

ori_sentence: Multiple evanescent white dot syndrome (MEWDS) is an uncommon inflammatory condition of the retina that typically affects otherwise healthy young females in the second to fourth decades of life.
simple_sent: Multiple evanescent white dot syndrome (MEWDS) is a rare disease. People who have the condition are usually in their second to fourth decades of life, and are otherwise healthy.

ori_sentence: A tracheoesophageal fistula (TEF, or TOF; see spelling differences) is an abnormal connection (fistula) between the esophagus and the trachea.
simple_sent: A tracheoesophageal fistula is an abnormal connection between the esophagus and the trachea. It is also called a tracheal fistula.

ori_sentence: Toxic anterior segment syndrome is an acute, sterile anterior segment inflammation following generally uneventful cataract and anterior segment surgery.
simple_sent: Toxic anterior segment syndrome occurs after cataract and anterior segment surgery. It is an acute, sterile inflammation of the anterior segment.

ori_sentence: Toxoplasma chorioretinitis, more simply known as ocular toxoplasmosis, is possibly the most common cause of infections in the back of the eye (posterior segment) worldwide.
simple_sent: Toxoplasma chorioretinitis, also known as ocular toxoplasmosis, is an infection of the back of the eye. It is the most common eye infection.

ori_sentence: Marfanoid (or Marfanoid habitus) is a constellation of symptoms resembling those of Marfan syndrome, including long limbs, with an arm span that is at least 1.03 of the height of the individual, and a crowded oral maxilla, sometimes with a high arch in the palate, arachnodactyly, and hyperlaxity.
simple_sent: Marfanoid (or Marfanoid habitus) is a condition where the person has long limbs, with an arm span that is at least 1.03 of the height of the individual. The person also has a crowded oral maxilla, sometimes with a high arch in the palate, and hyperlaxity.

ori_sentence: Napkin psoriasis, or psoriasis in the diaper area, is characteristically seen in infants between two and eight months of age.
simple_sent: Napkin psoriasis, or psoriasis in the diaper area, is usually seen when a baby is between two and eight months old.

ori_sentence: Tracheobronchomalacia or TBM is a condition characterized by flaccidity of the tracheal support cartilage which leads to tracheal collapse.
simple_sent: Tracheobronchomalacia or TBM is a condition where the tracheal support cartilage does not work properly. This makes the tracheal collapse.

ori_sentence: Tixocortol is a corticosteroid used as an intestinal anti-inflammatory and decongestant.
simple_sent: Tixocortol is an anti-inflammatory drug. It is also used as a decongestant.

ori_sentence: Marshall syndrome is a genetic disorder of the connective tissue which can cause hearing loss.
simple_sent: Marshall syndrome is a genetic condition. It can cause loss of hearing in some people.

simple_sent: Mantleoma is a benign neoplasm with mantle differentiation and they tend to occur on the face. Early forms of the disease only consist of columns of undifferentiated epithelial cells.

simple_sent: Munro's microabscess is an abscess (collection of neutrophils) in the stratum corneum of the epidermis. When neutrophils get into the epidermal stratum corneum, they can cause infections.

ori_sentence: Muscle fatigue is the decline in ability of muscles to generate force.
simple_sent: Muscle fatigue is when muscles do not work as hard as they can.
