ori_sentence: Testicular trauma is an injury to one or both testicles.
simple_sent: Testicular trauma is when one or both testicles are hurt.

ori_sentence: Mitotane, sold under the brand name Lysodren, is a steroidogenesis inhibitor and cytostatic antineoplastic medication which is used in the treatment of adrenocortical carcinoma and Cushing's syndrome.
simple_sent: Mitotane (also known as Lysodren) is a chemical compound. It is used to treat Cushing's syndrome and adrenocortical carcinoma of the adrenal glands.

ori_sentence: Tertiary Hyperparathyroidism is a condition involving the overproduction of the hormone, parathyroid hormone, produced by the parathyroid glands.
simple_sent: Hyperparathyroidism is when the parathyroid hormone is too much. The parathyroid hormone is made by the parathyroid glands.

ori_sentence: Febuxostat, sold under the brand names Uloric and Adenuric among others, is a medication used long-term to treat gout due to high uric acid levels.
simple_sent: Febuxostat, also known as Uloric and Adenuric, is a long-term treatment for gout. It works by reducing the levels of uric acid.

ori_sentence: Atomoxetine, sold under the brand name Strattera, among others, is a medication used to treat attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD).
simple_sent: Atomoxetine (also known as Strattera) is a medication. It is used to treat people with Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder.

ori_sentence: Insulin glargine [GLAR geen], sold under the brand name Lantus among others, is a long-acting insulin, used in the management of type I and type II diabetes.
simple_sent: Insulin glargine [GLAR geen], sold under the brand name Lantus among others, is a long-acting insulin that helps people with diabetes control their blood sugar.

ori_sentence: Testicular microlithiasis is an unusual condition diagnosed on testicular ultrasound.
simple_sent: Testicular microlithiasis is a rare condition. It is usually found on ultrasound.

ori_sentence: Pimecrolimus is an immunomodulating agent of the calcineurin inhibitor class used in the treatment of atopic dermatitis (eczema).
simple_sent: Pimecrolimus is an immunomodulating drug. It is used to treat eczema (atopic dermatitis) and other skin conditions.

ori_sentence: Testicular rupture is a rip or tear in the tunica albuginea resulting in extrusion of the testicular contents, including the seminiferous tubules.
simple_sent: Testicular rupture is a tear or rip in the testicle. The testicles are exposed and the testicles, including the seminiferous tubules, are exposed.

ori_sentence: Tetrasomy 9p (also known tetrasomy 9p syndrome) is a rare chromosomal disorder characterized by the presence of two extra copies of the short arm of chromosome 9 (called the p arm), in addition to the usual two.
simple_sent: Tetrasomy 9p (also known as tetrasomy 9p syndrome) is a rare disorder. It happens when there are two extra copies of a gene on the chromosome 9, called the p arm, instead of the usual two.

ori_sentence: Testicular self-examination (TSE) is a procedure where a man examines his own testicles and scrotum for possible lumps or swelling.
simple_sent: Testicular self-examination (TSE) is a test to see if there are any lumps or other problems in your testicles.

ori_sentence: Teunissen–Cremers syndrome is a genetic disorder that presents with skeleton defects some of which can include the bones of the inner ear, fingers and toes.
simple_sent: Teunissen-Cremers syndrome is a genetic disorder. People with the disorder have problems with their bones, especially their fingers and toes.

ori_sentence: Mepenzolate is an antimuscarinic.
simple_sent: Mepenzolate is a chemical.

ori_sentence: Mephentermine is a cardiac stimulant.
simple_sent: Mephentermine can cause heart attack.

ori_sentence: Craniopagus twins are conjoined twins that are fused at the cranium.
simple_sent: Craniopagus twins are twins that are joined at the head.

ori_sentence: Metanephric adenoma (MA)is a rare, benign tumour of the kidney, that can have a microscopic appearance similar to a nephroblastoma (Wilms tumours), or a papillary renal cell carcinoma.
simple_sent: Metanephric adenoma (MA) is a small, benign tumour of the kidney. It looks like a small tumor, but it is not, because it does not cause any damage to the kidney.

ori_sentence: Mesoridazine (Serentil) is a piperidine neuroleptic drug belonging to the class of drugs called phenothiazines, used in the treatment of schizophrenia.
simple_sent: Mesoridazine (Serentil) is a drug that is used to treat schizophrenia. It is a piperidine neuroleptic drug, which means it makes you sleepy.

ori_sentence: Metachondromatosis is an autosomal dominant, incompletely penetrant skeletal disorder affecting the growth of bones, leading to multiple enchondromas and osteochondromas.
simple_sent: Metachondromatosis is an autosomal dominant disorder that affects the growth of bones. People with this disease have many enchondromas and osteochondromas.

ori_sentence: Cricopharyngeal myotomy is a surgical sectioning of the cricopharyngeus muscle, also known as the upper esophageal sphincter, that has been advocated for the treatment of cricopharyngeal spasm, or cricopharyngeal achalasia, that leads to cervical dysphagia in the clinical setting.
simple_sent: Cricopharyngeal myotomy is a surgical sectioning of the upper esophageal sphincter to treat cricopharyngeal spasm. The cricopharyngeus muscle is also known as the upper esophageal sphincter, and is usually called the cricopharyngeus muscle.

ori_sentence: Metabolic myopathies are myopathies that result from defects in biochemical metabolism that primarily affect muscle.
simple_sent: Metabolic myopathies are diseases that are caused by problems with metabolism. They mainly affect muscle.

ori_sentence: Methantheline is an antimuscarinic.
simple_sent: Methantheline is a chemical.

ori_sentence: Metirosine (INN and BAN; α-Methyltyrosine, Metyrosine USAN, AMPT) is an antihypertensive drug.
simple_sent: Metirosine is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is α-Methyltyrosine.

ori_sentence: Medrysone (INN, USAN) (brand names HMS, Medrocort, others; former developmental code name NSC-63278), also known as hydroxymethylprogesterone, methylhydroxyprogesterone, or hydroxymesterone, as well as 6α-methyl-11β-hydroxyprogesterone or 6α-methyl-11β-hydroxypregn-4-ene-3,20-dione, is a synthetic glucocorticoid that is or has been used in the treatment of inflammatory eye diseases.
simple_sent: Medrysone (also known as hydroxymethylprogesterone, methylhydroxyprogesterone, hydroxymesterone, 6α-methyl-11β-hydroxyprogesterone, 6α-methyl-11β-hydroxypregn-4-ene-3,20-dione, and 6α-methyl-11β-hydroxypregn-4-ene-3,20-dione) is a synthetic glucocorticoid. It is also known as hydroxymethylprogesterone.

ori_sentence: Subcutaneous T-cell lymphoma (also known as a "panniculitis-like T-cell lymphoma") is a cutaneous condition that most commonly presents in young adults, and is characterized by subcutaneous nodules.
simple_sent: Subcutaneous T-cell lymphoma (also known as a "panniculitis-like T-cell lymphoma") is a cancer of the skin. It usually happens in young adults, but it can also happen in children.

ori_sentence: Succinyl-CoA:3-oxoacid CoA transferase deficiency is an inborn error of ketone body utilization.
simple_sent: Succinyl-CoA:3-oxoacid CoA transferase is needed to break down ketones into other chemicals.

ori_sentence: Corneodermatosseous syndrome is an autosomal dominant condition with onset in infancy, characterized by corneal dystrophy, photophobia, diffuse palmoplantar keratoderma, distal onycholysis, skeletal abnormalities, with brachydactyly, short stature, and medullary narrowing of digits.
simple_sent: Corneodermatosseous syndrome is an autosomal dominant condition with onset in infancy. It is characterized by corneal dystrophy, photophobia, skeletal abnormalities, with brachydactyly, short stature, and medullary narrowing of digits.

ori_sentence: Sulzberger–Garbe syndrome is a cutaneous condition, a type of therapy resistant nummular eczema.
simple_sent: Sulzberger-Garbe syndrome is a cutaneous condition. It does not usually get better with treatment.

ori_sentence: Metaxalone, sold under the brand name Skelaxin, is a muscle relaxant medication used to relax muscles and relieve pain caused by strains, sprains, and other musculoskeletal conditions.
simple_sent: Metaxalone (also known as Skelaxin) is a muscle relaxant medication. It is used to help muscles relax and ease pain from strains, sprains, and other problems.

ori_sentence: Sulfabenzamide is an antibacterial/antimicrobial.
simple_sent: Sulfabenzamide is an anti-bacterial drug.

ori_sentence: Sulisobenzone (benzophenone-4) is an ingredient in some sunscreens which protects the skin from damage by UVB and UVA ultraviolet light.
simple_sent: Sulzobenzone (benzophenone-4) is an ingredient in some sunscreens. It helps to protect the skin from ultraviolet (UVA) light.

ori_sentence: Methyclothiazide is a thiazide diuretic.
simple_sent: Methyclothiazide is a diuretic, too.

ori_sentence: A cranioclast (from Greek κρανίον kranion "head, scull" and -κλάστης -klastes "breaker") is surgical instrument akin to a strong forceps.
simple_sent: A cranioclast (from Greek, kranion "head" and klastes "breaker") is a special tool used in surgery. It looks like a strong forceps.

ori_sentence: Craniofrontonasal dysplasia (craniofrontonasal syndrome, craniofrontonasal dysostosis, CFND) is a very rare X-linked malformation syndrome caused by mutations in the ephrin-B1 gene (EFNB1).
simple_sent: Craniofrontonasal dysplasia (also called Craniofrontonasal dysostosis, CFND) is a rare disease. People who have the disease have mutations in the ephrin-B1 gene.

ori_sentence: Craniosynostosis–anal anomalies–porokeratosis syndrome (also known as "CAP syndrome") is a cutaneous condition inherited in an autosomal recessive fashion.
simple_sent: Craniosynostosis-anal anomalies-porokeratosis is a cutaneous condition. It is an autosomal recessive condition and is also known as "CAP syndrome".

ori_sentence: Cranioschisis (Greek: κρανιον kranion, "skull", and σχίσις schisis, "split"), or dysraphism, is a neural tube defect involving the skull.
simple_sent: Cranioschisis (Greek: kranion, split, and schisis, split) is a defect of the neural tube in the skull. It is also called dysraphism.

ori_sentence: Cooks syndrome is a hereditary disorder which is characterized in the hands by bilateral nail hypoplasia on the thumb, index finger, and middle finger, absence of fingernails (anonychia) on the ring finger and little finger, lengthening of the thumbs, and bulbousness of the fingers.
simple_sent: Cooks syndrome is a genetic disorder. People with Cooks syndrome have short fingernails on the thumb, index finger, and middle finger, long fingernails on the ring finger and little finger, bulbousness of the fingers, and longer thumbs than normal people.

ori_sentence: Subungual exostoses are a type of non-cancerous bone tumor of the chondrogenic type, and consists of bone and cartilage.
simple_sent: Subungual exostoses are non-cancerous bone tumors. They are made of bone and cartilage, and are not cancerous.

ori_sentence: Megarectum is a large rectum as a result of underlying nerve supply abnormalities or muscle dysfunction, which remains after disimpaction of the rectum.
simple_sent: The megarectum is a large rectum because of muscle dysfunction or nerve problems. After the rectum is not working properly, this happens.

ori_sentence: Superficial vein thrombosis (SVT) is a blood clot formed in a superficial vein, a vein near the surface of the body.
simple_sent: Superficial vein thrombosis (SVT) is a blood clot. It happens when a blood clot forms in a superficial vein.

ori_sentence: Coronary artery anomalies are variations of the coronary circulation, affecting <1% of the general population.
simple_sent: Coronary artery disease is a disease. About 1% of the general population have coronary artery disease.

ori_sentence: Costochondritis, also known as chest wall pain syndrome or costosternal syndrome, is a benign inflammatory condition affecting the upper costochondral junctions and costosternal joints.
simple_sent: Costochondritis, also known as chest wall pain syndrome or costosternal syndrome, is an inflammatory disease. It affects the joints in the upper part of the chest.

ori_sentence: Cor triatriatum (or triatrial heart) is a congenital heart defect where the left atrium (cor triatriatum sinistrum) or right atrium
simple_sent: Cor triatriatum (or triatrial heart) is a heart defect. In a normal heart, the left atrium is bigger than the right atrium.

ori_sentence: Cordectomy is the surgical removal of a cord.
simple_sent: Cordectomy is when a cord is cut.

ori_sentence: Couvelaire uterus (also known as uteroplacental apoplexy) is a life-threatening condition in which loosening of the placenta (abruptio placentae) causes bleeding that penetrates into the uterine myometrium forcing its way into the peritoneal cavity.this condition make the uterus very tense and rigidity..
simple_sent: Couvelaire uterus (also known as uteroplacental apoplexy) is a life-threatening condition in which the placenta becomes loose and sticks to the uterus. This makes the uterus very rigid and makes it hard for the placenta to go into the peritoneal cavity.

ori_sentence: Cranial nerve disease is an impaired functioning of one of the twelve cranial nerves.
simple_sent: Cranial nerve disease is a disease that affects the central nervous system.

ori_sentence: Cricopharyngeal spasms occur in the cricopharyngeus muscle of the pharynx.
simple_sent: The cricopharyngeus muscle is the main muscle of the pharynx.

ori_sentence: Metaplastic carcinoma, otherwise known as metaplastic carcinoma of the breast (MCB), is a heterogeneous group of cancers that exhibit varied patterns of metaplasia and differentiation along multiple cell lines.
simple_sent: Metaplastic carcinoma of the breast, also known as metaplastic carcinoma of the breast (MCB), is a cancer of the breast. It is one of the most common cancers in women.

ori_sentence: Megestrol acetate (MGA), sold under the brand name Megace among others, is a progestin medication which is used mainly as an appetite stimulant to treat wasting syndromes such as cachexia.
simple_sent: Megestrol acetate (MGA), also known as Megace, is a progestin medication. It is used to help people with wasting disorders, such as cachexia, get more food.

ori_sentence: Bisacodyl (INN) is an organic compound that is used as a stimulant laxative drug.
simple_sent: Bisacodyl is a chemical compound. It is an organic chemical compound.

ori_sentence: Montelukast, sold under the brand name Singulair among others, is a medication used in the maintenance treatment of asthma.
simple_sent: Montelukast is a drug that is used to treat asthma. It is sold under the brand name Singulair in many countries.

ori_sentence: Gefitinib, sold under the brand name Iressa, is a medication used for certain breast, lung and other cancers.
simple_sent: Gefitinib, also known as Iressa, is a cancer treatment. It is used to treat breast and lung cancer.

ori_sentence: A mesenteric cyst (MeSH C04.182.473) is a cyst in the mesenterium, and is one of the rarest abdominal tumors, with approximately 822 cases reported since 1507.
simple_sent: A mesenteric cyst (MeSH C04.182.473) is a cyst in the mesenterium. About 822 cases have been reported since 1507, and it is one of the rarest tumors.

ori_sentence: Subepidermal calcified nodule is a type of Calcinosis cutis.
simple_sent: A subepidermal calcified nodule is an example of this.

ori_sentence: Metabolic bone disease is an abnormality of bones caused by a broad spectrum of disorders.
simple_sent: Metabolic bone disease is a disease of the bones. There are many different types.

ori_sentence: Cotton wool spots are an abnormal finding on funduscopic exam of the retina of the eye.
simple_sent: Cotton wool spots are an abnormal finding when the eye is looked at closely.

ori_sentence: Superior limbic keratoconjunctivitis (SLK, Théodore's syndrome) is a disease of the eye characterized by episodes of recurrent inflammation of the superior cornea and limbus, as well as of the superior tarsal and bulbar conjunctiva.
simple_sent: Superior limbic keratoconjunctivitis (SLK, Théodore's syndrome) is a disease of the eye. In it, the cornea and limbus of the superior eye become very inflamed, as well as the tarsal surface of the eye.

ori_sentence: Oxymetazoline, sold under the brand name Afrin among others, is a topical decongestant and vasoconstrictor medication.
simple_sent: Oxymetazoline (also known as Afrin) is a topical medication. It is used to reduce nasal congestion.

ori_sentence: Sulfacytine is a short-acting sulfonamide antibiotic, taken orally for treatment against bacterial infections.
simple_sent: Sulfacytine is an antibiotic. It is a short-acting antibiotic that can be taken orally.

ori_sentence: Corneal perforation is an anomaly in the cornea resulting from damage to the corneal surface.
simple_sent: Corneal perforation is an abnormality in the cornea. It is usually caused by damage.

ori_sentence: Contact stomatitis is inflammation or pain of the oral mucosa caused by external stimuli.
simple_sent: Contact stomatitis is when the oral mucosa is hurt by something outside the body.

ori_sentence: Superficial pustular folliculitis is a superficial folliculitis with thin-walled pustules at the follicular openings.
simple_sent: Superficial Pustular folliculitis Superficial pustular folliculitis is very common in men and women.

ori_sentence: A supernumerary kidney is an additional kidney to the number usually present in an organism.
simple_sent: A supernumerary kidney is an extra kidney. It does not usually exist in an organism.

ori_sentence: Supernumerary roots is a condition found in teeth when there may be a larger number of roots than expected.
simple_sent: Supernumerary roots is a condition in teeth. It happens when there are more roots than expected.

ori_sentence: Coral dermatitis is a cutaneous condition caused by injury from the exoskeleton of certain corals.
simple_sent: Coral dermatitis is a cutaneous condition. It is usually caused by damage to the skin.

ori_sentence: Subglottic stenosis is a congenital or acquired narrowing of the subglottic airway.
simple_sent: Subglottic stenosis is a narrowing of the airway in the back of the throat.

ori_sentence: Crandall syndrome is a very rare congenital disorder characterised by progressive sensorineural hearing loss, hair loss associated with pili torti, and hypogonadism demonstrated through low levels of luteinising hormone and growth hormone.
simple_sent: Crandall syndrome is a very rare disorder. People with Crandall syndrome have progressive hearing loss, hair loss, and hypogonadism. This is because they have low levels of luteinising hormone and growth hormone.

ori_sentence: In human anatomy, the subtalar joint, also known as thetalocalcaneal joint, is a joint of the foot.
simple_sent: The subtalar joint (also called thetalocalcaneal joint) is a joint in the foot.

ori_sentence: Coronary steal (with its symptoms termed coronary steal syndrome or cardiac steal syndrome) is a phenomenon where an alteration of circulation patterns leads to a reduction in the blood flow directed to the coronary circulation.
simple_sent: Coronary steal (with its symptoms termed coronary steal syndrome or cardiac steal syndrome) is when the blood flow to the heart is cut off because the blood does not move as fast as it used to.

ori_sentence: Superficial spreading melanoma (SSM) is usually characterized as the most common form of cutaneous melanoma in Caucasians.
simple_sent: Superficial spreading melanoma (SSM) is the most common type of skin cancer in Caucasians, and it usually does not cause cancer.

ori_sentence: Metastatic carcinoma is able to grow at sites distant from the primary site of origin; thus, dissemination to the skin may occur with any malignant neoplasm, and these infiltrates may result from direct invasion of the skin from underlying tumors, may extend by lymphatic or hematogenous spread, or may be introduced by therapeutic procedures.
simple_sent: Metastatic carcinoma is able to grow at sites far from where it was first found. Because of this, it can spread to the skin from where it first came from. These spread may come from direct invasion of the skin from underlying tumors, or may come from lymphatic or hematogenous spread.

ori_sentence: Metastatic calcinosis cutis is a cutaneous condition characterized by calcification of the skin resulting from the deposition of calcium and phosphorus, and associated with an internal malignancy.
simple_sent: Metastatic calcinosis cutis is a cutaneous condition that causes the skin to become calcified. It is caused by calcium and phosphorus getting into the body.

ori_sentence: A supracondylar humerus fracture is a fracture of the distal humerus just above the elbow joint.
simple_sent: A humerus fracture is a break of the humerus near the elbow. This is called a supracondylar fracture.

ori_sentence: The supraorbital nerve is one of two branches of the frontal nerve, itself a branch of the ophthalmic nerve.
simple_sent: The supraorbital nerve is an important nerve in the head. It is one of two frontal nerve branches.

ori_sentence: Coral cuts are a severe type of skin injury that may occur from the cuts of coral skeletons.
simple_sent: Coral cuts are a type of injury to the skin. They happen when coral skeletons get cut.

ori_sentence: Unicompartmental knee arthroplasty (UKA) is a surgical procedure used to relieve arthritis in one of the knee compartments in which the damaged parts of the knee are replaced.
simple_sent: Unicompartmental knee arthroplasty (UKA) is a surgery to replace the damaged parts of the knee. It is used to reduce arthritis in one of the knee compartments.

ori_sentence: Magnesium stearate is the chemical compound with the formula Mg(C18H35O2)2.
simple_sent: Its chemical formula is Mg(C18H35O2)2. It has magnesium and stearate ions.

ori_sentence: Mucositis is the painful inflammation and ulceration of the mucous membranes lining the digestive tract, usually as an adverse effect of chemotherapy and radiotherapy treatment for cancer.
simple_sent: Mucositis is a painful inflammation and ulcer of the mucous membranes that line the digestive tract. It usually happens as a result of cancer treatment, such as chemotherapy.

ori_sentence: Teniposide (trade name Vumon) is a chemotherapeutic medication used in the treatment of childhood acute lymphocytic leukemia (ALL), Hodgkin's lymphoma, certain brain tumours, and other types of cancer.
simple_sent: Teniposide (also known as Vumon) is a chemotherapeutic drug. It is used to treat people with acute lymphocytic leukemia (ALL), Hodgkin's lymphoma, and other types of cancer.

ori_sentence: Money disorders are the maladaptive patterns of financial beliefs and behaviors that lead to clinically significant distress, impairment in social or occupational functioning, due to financial strain or an inability to appropriately enjoy one's financial resources.
simple_sent: Money disorders are maladaptive patterns of thinking and behavior about money. They can cause serious health problems, problems with social or occupational functioning, because of financial stress or not being able to enjoy one's money properly.

ori_sentence: MonoMAC syndrome is a rare autosomal dominant syndrome associated with: monocytopenia, B and NK cell lymphopenia; mycobacterial, viral, fungal, and bacterial opportunistic infections; and virus infection-induced cancers.
simple_sent: MonoMAC syndrome is a rare autosomal dominant syndrome. It is caused by a combination of viral, bacterial, and fungal infections. It also can cause B and NK cell lymphopenia and cancer of the blood.

ori_sentence: Drug-induced pseudolymphoma results from exposure to medications, which results in cutaneous inflammatory patterns that resemble lymphoma
simple_sent: Drug-induced pseudolymphoma is caused by taking certain medications. It causes the skin to become inflamed like a lymphoma.

ori_sentence: Muehrcke's nails or Muehrcke's lines (apparent leukonychia striata) are changes in the fingernail that may be a sign of an underlying medical condition.
simple_sent: Muehrcke's nails or Muehrcke's lines are changes in the fingernail. They may be a sign of a medical condition, but they are not always.

ori_sentence: Dysexecutive syndrome (DES) consists of a group of symptoms, usually resulting from brain damage, that fall into cognitive, behavioural and emotional categories and tend to occur together.
simple_sent: Dyssexecutive syndrome (DES) is a group of symptoms. These symptoms usually result from damage to the brain, but it can also be caused by other things.

ori_sentence: Mucinous cystadenoma is a benign cystic tumor lined by a mucinous epithelium.
simple_sent: Mucinous cystadenoma A mucinous cystadenoma is a benign tumor in the nose.

ori_sentence: Mucopurulent discharge is the emission or secretion of fluid containing mucus and pus (muco- pertaining to mucus and purulent pertaining to pus) from the eye, nose, cervix, vagina or other part of the body due to infection and inflammation.
simple_sent: Mucopurulent discharge is the emission or secretion of fluid containing mucus and pus from the eye, nose, cervix, vagina or other part of the body because of an infection or because of a medical condition.

ori_sentence: Monoclonal B-cell lymphocytosis (MBL) is an asymptomatic condition in which individuals have increased blood levels of particular subtypes of monoclonal lymphocytes (i.e. an aberrant and potentially malignant group of lymphocytes produced by a single ancestral cell).
simple_sent: Monoclonal B-cell lymphocytosis (MBL) is an asymptomatic condition in which a person's blood levels of certain types of monoclonal lymphocytes increase. This is because a single cell in the body produces a certain type of lymphocytes.

ori_sentence: A unicameral bone cyst, also known as a simple bone cyst, is a cavity filled with a yellow-colored fluid.
simple_sent: A simple bone cyst, also called a unicameral bone cyst, is a cyst that does not look like a cyst.

ori_sentence: Nager acrofacial dysostosis, also known as Nager syndrome, is a genetic disorder which displays several or all of the following characteristics: underdevelopment of the cheek and jaw area, down-sloping of the opening of the eyes, lack or absence of the lower eyelashes, kidney or stomach reflux, hammer toes, shortened soft palate, lack of development of the internal and external ear, possible cleft palate, underdevelopment or absence of the thumb, hearing loss (see hearing loss with craniofacial syndromes) and shortened forearms, as well as poor movement in the elbow, and may be characterized by accessory tragi.
simple_sent: Nager acrofacial dysostosis, also known as Nager syndrome, is a genetic disorder in which the child has a lower opening of the eyes, an underdevelopment of the cheek and jaw area, hammer toes, shortened soft palate, lack of development of the internal and external ear, possible cleft palate, underdevelopment or absence of the thumb, hearing loss (see hearing loss with craniofacial syndromes) and poor movement in the elbow, and may be characterized by accessory tragi.

ori_sentence: Doucas and Kapetanakis pigmented purpura is a skin condition characterized by scaly and eczematous patches, which also have petechiae and hemosiderin staining.
simple_sent: Pigmented purpura is a skin condition that looks like scaly and eczematous patches. The patches also have petechiae and hemosiderin staining.

ori_sentence: Nefazodone, sold formerly under the brand names Serzone, Dutonin, and Nefadar among others, is an atypical antidepressant which was first marketed by Bristol-Myers Squibb in 1994 but has since largely been discontinued.
simple_sent: Nefazodone (also known as Serzone, Dutonin, and Nefadar) is an atypical antidepressant. It was first sold by Bristol-Myers Squibb in 1994, but has not been sold by them since then.

ori_sentence: Urachal cancer is a very rare type of cancer arising from the urachus or its remnants.
simple_sent: Urachal cancer is a cancer of the urachus. It is a very rare type of cancer.

ori_sentence: A urethrectomy is a surgical procedure to remove all or part of the male urethra, a tube that connects the urinary bladder to the genitals for the removal of fluids out of the body.
simple_sent: A urethrectomy is a surgery to remove part or all of the male urethra. The urethra is a tube in the body that lets fluids out of the body through the urinary bladder.

ori_sentence: Unilateral nevoid telangiectasia presents with fine, threadlike telangiectases, developing in a unilateral, sometimes dermatomal, distribution, with the areas most often involved being the trigeminal and C3 and C4 or adjacent areas.
simple_sent: Unilateral nevoid telangiectasia presents with fine, threadlike telangiectases. The areas most often involved are the trigeminal and C3 and C4 or adjacent areas, and sometimes the skin itself.

ori_sentence: Nedocromil sodium is a medication considered as mast cell stabilizer which acts to prevent wheezing, shortness of breath, and other breathing problems caused by asthma.
simple_sent: Nedocromil sodium is a medication that helps people with asthma to stop wheezing. It also helps people with shortness of breath.

ori_sentence: Pyrazinamide is a medication used to treat tuberculosis.
simple_sent: Pyrazinamide is a drug. It is used to treat tuberculosis.

ori_sentence: Drug-induced purpura is a skin condition that may be related to platelet destruction, vessel fragility, interference with platelet function, or vasculitis.
simple_sent: Drug-induced purpura is a condition of the skin. It may be caused by damage to the blood platelets, or by interference with platelet function.

ori_sentence: Dupilumab, sold under the brand name Dupixent, is a monoclonal antibody blocking interleukin 4 and interleukin 13, used for allergic diseases such as eczema (atopic dermatitis), asthma and nasal polyps which result in chronic sinusitis.
simple_sent: Dupilumab (also known as Dupixent) is a monoclonal antibody that blocks interleukin 4 and interleukin 13. It is used to treat allergic diseases like eczema, asthma, and nasal polyps that cause chronic sinusitis.

ori_sentence: A mixed tumor is a tumor that derives from multiple tissue types.
simple_sent: A mixed tumor is a tumor that has many different types.

ori_sentence: Dyschromatosis symmetrica hereditaria (also known as "reticulate acropigmentation of Dohi", and "symmetrical dyschromatosis of the extremities") is a rare autosomally inherited dermatosis.
simple_sent: Dyschromatosis symmetrica hereditaria is a rare type of skin disease. It is also known as reticulate acropigmentation of Dohi and as dyschromatosis of the extremities.

ori_sentence: Doxercalciferol (or 1-hydroxyergocalciferol, trade name Hectorol) is drug for secondary hyperparathyroidism and metabolic bone disease.
simple_sent: Doxercalciferol (also known as Hectorol) is a drug. It is used to treat secondary hyperparathyroidism and metabolic bone disease.

ori_sentence: Drug-induced urticaria occurs by immunologic and nonimmunologic mechanisms, urticaria most commonly caused by aspirin and NSAIDs.
simple_sent: Drug-induced urticaria is caused by drugs. The most common drugs that cause urticaria are aspirin and certain NSAIDs.

ori_sentence: Diversion colitis is an inflammation of the colon which can occur as a complication of ileostomy or colostomy, where symptoms may occur between one month and three years following surgery.
simple_sent: Diversion colitis is an inflammation of the colon. People who have had an ileostomy (a catheter placed in the colon) will have symptoms after the surgery.

ori_sentence: The dysfibrinogenemias consist of three types of fibrinogen disorders in which a critical blood clotting factor, fibrinogen, circulates at normal levels but is dysfunctional.
simple_sent: There are three types of dysfibrinogenemias. In these disorders, a very important blood clotting factor, fibrinogen, does not work as it should.

ori_sentence: Universal angiomatosis (also known as "Generalized telangiectasia") is a bleeding disease that affects the blood vessels of the skin and mucous membranes as well as other parts of the body.
simple_sent: Universal angiomatosis (also known as generalized telangiectasia) is a disease that causes bleeding in all parts of the body. This includes the skin and mucous membranes.

ori_sentence: In urology, the Mitrofanoff principle is the creation of a passageway for urine or enema fluid that, by its (surgical) construction, has a valve mechanism to allow continence.
simple_sent: In urology, the Mitrofanoff principle is the creation of a passageway for urine or enema fluid. When this is done, a valve mechanism is created to allow continence.

ori_sentence: Ureteral cancer is cancer of the ureters, muscular tubes that propel urine from the kidneys to the urinary bladder.
simple_sent: Ureteral cancer is cancer of the ureters. The ureters carry urine from the kidneys to the bladder.

ori_sentence: Duverney fractures are isolated pelvic fractures involving only the iliac wing.
simple_sent: Duverney fractures are very rare. They only happen in the iliac wing.

ori_sentence: Monoamniotic twins are identical or semi-identical twins that share the same amniotic sac within their mother's uterus.
simple_sent: Monoamniotic twins are twins that share the same amniotic sac. They are either identical or semi-identical.

ori_sentence: Drug-induced autoimmune hemolytic anemia is a form of hemolytic anemia.
simple_sent: The most common cause of hemolytic anemia is left heart failure.

ori_sentence: Drug-induced thrombocytopenic purpura is a skin condition result from a low platelet count due to drug-induced anti-platelet antibodies caused by drugs such as heparin, sulfonamines, digoxin, quinine, and quinidine.
simple_sent: Drug-induced thrombocytopenic purpura is a condition of the skin. It happens when a person's platelet count is low because of drugs like quinine, heparin, sulfonamines, and digoxin.

ori_sentence: Monochorionic twins are monozygotic (identical) twins that share the same placenta.
simple_sent: Monochorionic twins: They are the only type of twins that have the same placenta.

ori_sentence: Hidradenoma refers to a benign adnexal tumor of the apical sweat gland.
simple_sent: Hidradenoma is a cancer of the adnexal glands. It is a benign tumor.

ori_sentence: Double aortic arch is a relatively rare congenital cardiovascular malformation.
simple_sent: Double aortic arch is a very rare condition. It does not happen often.

ori_sentence: A mitotic inhibitor is a drug that inhibits mitosis, or cell division.
simple_sent: A mitotic inhibitor is a drug. It helps to stop cell division.

ori_sentence: Pus is an exudate, typically white-yellow, yellow, or yellow-brown, formed at the site of inflammation during bacterial or fungal infection.
simple_sent: Pus is an exudate, usually white-yellow, yellow, or yellow-brown. It is usually made when a person has an infection.

ori_sentence: Thiotepa (INN), sold under the brand name Tepadina, is a medication used to treat cancer.
simple_sent: Thiotepa is a cancer treatment. It is sold under the brand name Tepadina.

ori_sentence: Mixed receptive-expressive language disorder (DSM-IV 315.32) is a communication disorder in which both the receptive and expressive areas of communication may be affected in any degree, from mild to severe.
simple_sent: Mixed receptive-expressive language disorder (DSM-IV 315.32) is a communication disorder. People with this disorder can have problems with both receptive and expressive language.

ori_sentence: Sunitinib, sold under the brand name Sutent, is a medication used to treat cancer.
simple_sent: Sunitinib is a cancer treatment. It is sold under the brand name Sutent.

ori_sentence: Procainamide (PCA) is a medication of the antiarrhythmic class used for the treatment of cardiac arrhythmias.
simple_sent: Procainamide (PCA) is an antiarrhythmic drug. It is used to treat people who have heart problems.

ori_sentence: Monostotic fibrous dysplasia is a form of fibrous dysplasia where only one bone is involved.
simple_sent: Monostotic fibrous dysplasia: In this case, only one bone is affected by the disease.

ori_sentence: Upington disease, is an extremely rare autosomal dominant malformation disorder.
simple_sent: Upington disease is a very rare disorder. It is an autosomal dominant disorder.

ori_sentence: Urban–Rogers–Meyer syndrome, also known as Prader–Willi habitus, osteopenia, and camptodactyly or Urban syndrome, is an extremely rare inherited congenital disorder first described by Urban et al.
simple_sent: Urban-Rogers-Meyer syndrome (also called Prader-Willi habitus, osteopenia, and camptodactyly) is a very rare disorder. People who have this disorder are called Urban-Rogers-Meyer syndrome.

ori_sentence: A double-contrast barium enema is a form of contrast radiography in which x-rays of the colon and rectum are taken using two forms of contrast to make the structures easier to see.
simple_sent: A double-contrast barium enema is a way to take x-rays of the colon and rectum. The x-rays are taken with two types of contrast so that they can be seen better.

ori_sentence: Dolichostenomelia is a human condition or in which the limbs are unusually long.
simple_sent: Dolichostenomelia is a condition. In this case, the limbs are too long.

ori_sentence: Dyschromatosis universalis hereditaria is a rare genodermatosis characterized by reticulate hyper- and hypo- pigmentated macules in a generalized distribution.
simple_sent: Dyschromatosis universalis hereditaria is a rare form of genodermatosis. In this case, the macules have no pigment, and are pale in color.

ori_sentence: Drug induced pigmentation may take on many different appearances, one of the most common being a change in the color, or pigmentation, of the skin.
simple_sent: Drug-induced changes in the skin's color may take many different looks. The most common change is the color of the skin itself.

ori_sentence: Monofixation syndrome (MFS) (also: microtropia or microstrabismus) is an eye condition defined by less-than-perfect binocular vision.
simple_sent: Monofixation syndrome (also called microtropia or microstrabismus) is when an individual's vision is not as good as it should be.

ori_sentence: EAST syndrome is a syndrome consisting of epilepsy, ataxia (a movement disorder), sensorineural deafness (deafness because of problems with the hearing nerve) and salt-wasting renal tubulopathy (salt loss caused by kidney problems).
simple_sent: East syndrome includes epilepsy, ataxia (a movement disorder), sensorineural deafness (deafness because of problems with the hearing nerve), and salt-wasting renal tubulopathy (kidney problems make the blood have less salt).

ori_sentence: Molybdenum deficiency refers to the clinical consequences of inadequate supplies of molybdenum in the diet.
simple_sent: Molybdenum deficiency is when people do not have enough molybdenum in their diet. This can be very bad.

ori_sentence: Mitochondrial trifunctional protein deficiency (MTP deficiency or MTPD) is an autosomal recessive fatty acid oxidation disorder that prevents the body from converting certain fats to energy, particularly during periods without food.
simple_sent: Mitochondrial trifunctional protein deficiency (MTP deficiency or MTPD) is a disease. It happens when a person's body does not have the right kind of fats. This makes it hard for the body to use fats for energy.

ori_sentence: Mulberry molars are a dental condition usually associated with congenital syphilis, characterized by multiple rounded rudimentary enamel cusps on the permanent first molars.
simple_sent: Mulberry molars are a dental condition. People who have the condition as a child will have many rounded rudimentary enamel cusps on the permanent first molars.

ori_sentence: Mucinoses are a group of cutaneous diseases caused by fibroblasts producing abnormally large amounts of acid mucopolysaccharides (i.e. mucin), usually hyaluronic acid.
simple_sent: Mucinoses are a group of diseases of the skin. They are caused by abnormal production of mucin by fibroblasts, usually hyaluronic acid.

ori_sentence: Unconsciousness is a state which occurs when the ability to maintain an awareness of self and environment is lost.
simple_sent: Unconsciousness is when a person does not know what is going on. They also do not know who they are.

ori_sentence: Multicystic dysplastic kidney (MCDK) is a condition that results from the malformation of the kidney during fetal development.
simple_sent: Multicystic dysplastic kidney (MCDK) is a disease. It happens when the kidney of a person is too big.

ori_sentence: Multifocal choroiditis and panuveitis (MCP) is an inflammatory disorder of unknown etiology, affecting the choroid, retina, and vitreous of the eye that presents asymmetrically, most often in young myopic women with photopsias, enlargement of the physiologic blind spot and decreased vision.
simple_sent: Multifocal choroiditis and panuveitis (MCP) is an inflammatory disorder of unknown cause. It affects the choroid, retina, and vitreous of the eye. In young myopic women with photopsias, the vision in the back of the eye is affected, and this can be very bad.

ori_sentence: Norfloxacin, sold under the brand name Noroxin among others, is an antibiotic that belongs to the class of fluoroquinolone antibiotics.
simple_sent: Norfloxacin, also known as Noroxin, is an antibiotic. It belongs to the class of drugs called fluoroquinolone.

ori_sentence: Specific gravity, in the context of clinical pathology, is a urinalysis parameter commonly used in the evaluation of kidney function and can aid in the diagnosis of various renal diseases.
simple_sent: Specific gravity, in the context of clinical pathology, is the amount of fluid in the urine that shows up when a test is done to see if the kidney is working properly.

ori_sentence: Terfenadine is an antihistamine formerly used for the treatment of allergic conditions.
simple_sent: Terfenadine is an antihistamine. It is used to treat people with allergies.

ori_sentence: Shell shock is a term coined in World War I by British psychologist Charles Samuel Myers to describe the type of post traumatic stress disorder
simple_sent: Shell shock is a word that was first used in World War I. It was created by a British psychologist named Charles Samuel Myers.

ori_sentence: Numerous genetic disorders are caused by errors in fatty acid metabolism.
simple_sent: Many genetic diseases are caused by fatty acid metabolism problems.

ori_sentence: Cyproheptadine, sold under the brand name Periactin among others, is a first-generation antihistamine with additional anticholinergic, antiserotonergic, and local anesthetic properties.
simple_sent: Cyproheptadine, sold under the brand name Periactin among others, is a first-generation antihistamine. It is also used as a local anesthetic in some parts of the world.

ori_sentence: Vilanterol (INN, USAN) is an ultra-long-acting β2 adrenoreceptor agonist (ultra-LABA), which was approved in May 2013 in combination with fluticasone furoate for sale as Breo Ellipta by GlaxoSmithKline for the treatment of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD)..
simple_sent: Vilanterol (INN, USAN) is an ultra-long-acting β2 adrenoreceptor agonist (ultra-LABA), which was approved in May 2013 for the treatment of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) in combination with fluticasone furoate.

ori_sentence: A urethropexy is a surgical procedure where support is provided to the urethra.
simple_sent: A urethropexy is a surgery where the urethra is supported.

ori_sentence: A urethrotomy is an operation which involves incision of the urethra, especially for relief of a stricture.
simple_sent: A urethrotomy is an operation where the urethra is cut open. This is done to help relieve a stricture.

ori_sentence: Anotia ("no ear") describes a rare congenital deformity that involves the complete absence of the pinna, the outer projected portion of the ear, and narrowing or absence of the ear canal.
simple_sent: Anotia ("no ear") is a rare condition. In this case, there is no ear at all. The pinna, the outer part of the ear, is gone, and there is no ear canal at all.

ori_sentence: Urethral syndrome is defined as symptoms suggestive of a lower urinary tract infection but in the absence of significant bacteriuria with a conventional pathogen.
simple_sent: Urethral syndrome is defined as symptoms that look like a lower urinary tract infection, but there is no bacteria in the urine, or no bacteria at all.

ori_sentence: Uterine incarceration is an obstetrical complication whereby a growing retroverted uterus becomes wedged into the pelvis after the first trimester of pregnancy.
simple_sent: Uterine incarceration is when a growing uterus gets stuck in the pelvis. This usually happens during the first trimester of pregnancy.

ori_sentence: Uterine inversion is when the uterus turns inside out, usually following childbirth.
simple_sent: Uterine inversion is when the uterus turns inside out. This usually happens after birth.

ori_sentence: A uterine septum is a form of a congenital malformation where the uterine cavity is partitioned by a longitudinal septum; the outside of the uterus has a normal typical shape.
simple_sent: A uterine septum is a defect in the development of the uterus. The outside of the uterus has a normal shape, but the inside of the uterus is not normal.

ori_sentence: Urine osmolality is a measure of urine concentration, in which large values indicate concentrated urine and small values indicate diluted urine.
simple_sent: Urine osmolality is a measure of how much urine there is in the body. A large number means that there is a lot of urine.

ori_sentence: Uterine tachysystole is a condition of excessively frequent uterine contractions during pregnancy.
simple_sent: Uterine tachysystole is when the uterine contractions are very often during pregnancy.

ori_sentence: Sufentanil, sold under the brand names Dsuvia and Sufenta, is a synthetic opioid analgesic drug approximately 5 to 10 times as potent as its parent drug, fentanyl, and 500 times as potent as morphine.
simple_sent: Sufentanil (also known as Dsuvia and Sufenta) is a very powerful pain-killer. It is about 5 to 10 times as powerful as the drug fentanyl, and 500 times as powerful as morphine.

ori_sentence: Megaduodenum is a congenital or acquired dilation and elongation of the duodenum with hypertrophy of all layers that presents as a feeling of gastric fullness, abdominal pain, belching, heartburn, and nausea with vomiting sometimes of food eaten 24 hours prior.
simple_sent: Megaduodenum is a condition in which the duodenum is stretched too far into the stomach. This causes a feeling of gastric fullness, abdominal pain, belching, heartburn, and nausea, sometimes with vomiting of food eaten 24 hours before.

ori_sentence: Thyroid neoplasm is a neoplasm or tumor of the thyroid.
simple_sent: Thyroid cancer is cancer of the thyroid gland.

ori_sentence: Urticarial allergic eruption is a cutaneous condition characterized by annular or gyrate urticarial plaques that persist for greater than 24 hours.
simple_sent: Urticarial allergic eruption is an allergic reaction to something in the skin. It usually lasts for more than 24 hours.

ori_sentence: Remifentanil is a potent, short-acting synthetic opioid analgesic drug.
simple_sent: Remifentanil is a short-acting synthetic opioid analgesic drug.

ori_sentence: Uterine adenosarcoma is an uncommon form of cancer that arises from mesenchymal tissue of the uterus and has a benign glandular component.
simple_sent: Uterine adenosarcoma is a rare form of cancer. It starts in the mesenchymal tissue of the uterus, and it does not cause cancer.

ori_sentence: Potassium metabisulfite, K2S2O5, also known as potassium pyrosulfite, is a white crystalline powder with a pungent odour.
simple_sent: Potassium metabisulfite, also known as potassium pyrosulfite, is a chemical compound. It is a white powder.

ori_sentence: Linear and whorled nevoid hypermelanosis (also known as "Linear nevoid hyperpigmentation," "Progressive cribriform and zosteriform hyperpigmentation," "Reticulate and zosteriform hyperpigmentation," "Reticulate hyperpigmentation of Iijima and Naito and Uyeno," "Zebra-like hyperpigmentation in whorls and streaks," and "Zebra-line hyperpigmentation") is a disorder of pigmentation that develops within a few weeks of birth and progresses for one to two years before stabilizing.
simple_sent: Linear and whorled nevoid hypermelanosis (also known as "Linear nevoid hyperpigmentation," "Progressive cribriform and zosteriform hyperpigmentation," "Reticulate and zosteriform hyperpigmentation," "Reticulate hyperpigmentation of Iijima and Naito and Uyeno," "Zebra-like hyperpigmentation in whorls and streaks," and "Zebra-line hyperpigmentation") is a condition in which the skin has a lot of different colors.

ori_sentence: Palatine tonsils, commonly called the tonsils and occasionally called the faucial tonsils, are tonsils located on the left and right sides at the back of the throat, which can often be seen as flesh-colored, pinkish lumps.
simple_sent: The palatine tonsils are on the left and right sides of the throat. They can often be seen as flesh-colored, pinkish lumps. People who have palatine tonsils usually have better health.

ori_sentence: Urticarial vasculitis (also known as "chronic urticaria as a manifestation of venulitis", "hypocomplementemic urticarial vasculitis syndrome", "hypocomplementemic vasculitis" and "unusual lupus-like syndrome") is a skin condition characterized by fixed urticarial lesions that appear histologically as a vasculitis.
simple_sent: Urticarial vasculitis (also known as "chronic urticaria as a manifestation of venulitis" and "unusual lupus-like syndrome") is a disease of the skin. The most common cause of urticarial vasculitis is an infection of the skin called urticarial fever.

ori_sentence: Urine organic acids is a medical diagnostic test that measures organic acid metabolites in the urine.
simple_sent: Urine organic acids is a medical test to find out how much organic acid there is in the urine.

ori_sentence: Nintedanib, sold under the brand names Ofev and Vargatef, is an oral medication used for the treatment of idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis and along with other medications for some types of non-small-cell lung cancer.
simple_sent: Nintedanib (also known as Ofev and Vargatef) is a drug that is taken orally. It is used to treat idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis. It is also used to treat certain types of lung cancer.

ori_sentence: Colic or cholic is a form of pain that starts and stops abruptly.
simple_sent: Cric or cholic pain is pain that does not go away after a while.

ori_sentence: Erythroid dysplasia is a condition in which immature red blood cells in the bone marrow are abnormal in size
simple_sent: Erythroid dysplasia is a condition in which the bone marrow does not produce enough red blood cells.

ori_sentence: Erythromelanosis follicularis faciei et colli is an erythematous pigmentary disease involving the follicles, characterized by a reddish-brown, sharply demarcated, symmetrical discoloration involving the preauricular and maxillary regions.
simple_sent: Erythromelanosis follicularis faciei et colli is an erythematous disease of the hair follicles. It is characterized by a reddish-brown, symmetrical discoloration of the hair follicles in the preauricular and maxillary areas.

ori_sentence: An esophageal food bolus obstruction is a medical emergency caused by the obstruction of the esophagus by an ingested foreign body.
simple_sent: An esophageal food bolus is when food goes into the esophagus from the outside, and can not come out.

ori_sentence: Estradiol cypionate (EC), sold under the brand name Depo-Estradiol among others, is an estrogen medication which is used in hormone therapy for menopausal symptoms and low estrogen levels in cis women, in hormone therapy for trans women, and in hormonal birth control for cis women.
simple_sent: Estradiol cypionate (EC), sold under the brand name Depo-Estradiol among others, is an estrogen medication. It is used to treat menopausal symptoms and low levels of estrogen in women. It is also used to treat transgender women.

ori_sentence: Estropipate, also known as piperazine estrone sulfate and sold under the brand names Harmogen, Improvera, Ogen, Ortho-Est, and Sulestrex among others, is an estrogen medication which is used mainly in menopausal hormone therapy in the treatment of menopausal symptoms.
simple_sent: Estropipate, also known as piperazine estrone sulfate and sold under the brand names Harmogen, Improvera, Ogen, Ortho-Est, and Sulestrex among others, is a chemical compound that is used to replace estrogen in the human body.

ori_sentence: Phacolytic glaucoma (PG) is a form of glaucoma which is caused due to a leaking mature or immature cataract.
simple_sent: Phacolytic glaucoma (PG) is the most common form of glaucoma. It is caused by a leaking cataract.

ori_sentence: Linear IgA bullous dermatosis is a rare immune-mediated blistering skin disease frequently associated with medication exposure, especially vancomycin, with men and women being equally affected.
simple_sent: Linear IgA bullous dermatosis is a rare disease of the skin. It is usually caused by exposure to certain drugs, especially vancomycin. Both men and women are affected.

ori_sentence: Esthiomene is a medical term referring to elephantiasis of the female genitals.
simple_sent: Esthiomene is a medical term. It is a condition of the female sex organs.

ori_sentence: Exercise-induced asthma, or E.I.A., occurs when the airways narrow as a result of exercise.
simple_sent: Exercise-induced asthma, or E.I.A., happens when exercise narrows the airways.

ori_sentence: Exhaled breath condensate (EBC) is the exhalate from breath, that has been condensed, typically via cooling using a collection device (commonly to 4 °C or subzero temperatures using a refrigerating device).
simple_sent: Exhaled breath condensate (EBC) is the exhalate from breath, that has been condensed (thawed out) and put back in the air. This is done by cooling the breath with air at a low temperature.

ori_sentence: Desloratadine (trade name Clarinex and Aerius) is a tricyclic H1 antagonist that is used to treat allergies.
simple_sent: Desloratadine is a drug that is used to treat allergies. It is also known as Clarinex and Aerius.

ori_sentence: Sertindole, sold under the brand name Serdolect among others, is an antipsychotic medication.
simple_sent: Sertindole is an anti-psychotic medication. It is sold under the brand name Serdolect.

ori_sentence: Dimethyl fumarate (DMF) is the methyl ester of fumaric acid and is named after the earth smoke plant (Fumaria officinalis).
simple_sent: Dimethyl fumarate is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is DMF. It is named after the earth smoke plant.

ori_sentence: Exercise intolerance is a condition of inability or decreased ability to perform physical exercise at the normally expected level or duration for people of that age, size, sex, and muscle mass.
simple_sent: Exercise intolerance is a condition where a person can not do physical exercise at a normal level or for a long time. It depends on their age, size, sex, and muscle mass.

ori_sentence: Ethoheptazine (trade name Zactane) is an opioid analgesic from the phenazepane family.
simple_sent: Ethoheptazine (also known as Zactane) is a chemical compound. It is an opioid.

ori_sentence: Ethylnorepinephrine (Etanor, Bronkephrine, Butanefrine) is a sympathomimetic and bronchodilator related to norepinephrine.
simple_sent: Ethylnorepinephrine is a chemical compound. It is related to the chemical norepinephrine and bronchodilator.

ori_sentence: Erythrokeratodermia is a group of keratinization disorders.
simple_sent: Erythrokeratodermia is a medical condition.

ori_sentence: An esophageal stent is a stent (tube) placed in the esophagus to keep a blocked area open
simple_sent: An esophageal stent is a tube that is put in the esophagus to help the blood flow.

ori_sentence: A benign esophageal stricture, or peptic stricture, is a narrowing or tightening of the esophagus that causes swallowing difficulties.
simple_sent: A benign esophageal stricture, or peptic stricture, does not cause any problems when people try to eat.

ori_sentence: Estradiol valerate (EV), sold for use by mouth under the brand name Progynova and for use by injection under the brand names Delestrogen and Progynon Depot among others, is an estrogen medication.
simple_sent: Estradiol valerate, also known as Progynova and Delestrogen, is an estrogen medication. It is sold under the brand names Progynova, Delestrogen and Progynon Depot.

ori_sentence: Esophageal candidiasis is an opportunistic infection of the esophagus by Candida albicans.
simple_sent: Esophageal candidiasis is an infection of the esophagus. Candida albicans causes it.

ori_sentence: Pindolol, sold under the brand name Visken among others, is a nonselective beta blocker which is used in the treatment of hypertension.
simple_sent: Pindolol (also known as Visken) is a nonselective beta blocker. It is used to treat high blood pressure.

ori_sentence: Tricho-hepato-enteric syndrome (THE), also known as syndromic or phenotypic diarrhea, is an extremely rare congenital bowel disorder which manifests itself as intractable diarrhea in infants with intrauterine growth retardation, hair and facial abnormalities.
simple_sent: Tricho-hepato-enteric syndrome (THE), also known as syndromic or phenotypic diarrhea, is a very rare disorder of the bowel. People who have the disorder will have diarrhea for a long time, and they will also have problems with their hair and face.

ori_sentence: Traumatic alopecia is a cutaneous condition that results from the forceful pulling out of the scalp hair.
simple_sent: Traumatic alopecia is a cutaneous condition. It happens when the hair on your scalp gets pulled out.

ori_sentence: Erosio interdigitalis blastomycetica (EIB) is a skin condition caused by a Candida albicans infection, characterized by an oval-shaped area of macerated white skin on the web between and extending onto the sides of the fingers.
simple_sent: Erosio interdigitalis blastomycetica (EIB) is a disease of the skin. It is caused by Candida albicans, a bacteria. People who have the disease have an oval-shaped area of white skin on the web between fingers.

ori_sentence: Eruptive vellus hair cysts (or EVHC) are small lesions that occur most often in the chest wall, abdomen and extremities, often with a crusted surface.
simple_sent: Eruptive vellus hair cysts (or EVHC) are small lesions in the body. They are most often found in the chest, abdomen and extremities.

ori_sentence: Erythrocyanosis crurum is a skin condition, a variant of acrocyanosis caused by chronic exposure to cold.
simple_sent: Erythrocyanosis crurum is a condition of the skin. It is a form of acrocyanosis.

ori_sentence: Epithelioid cell histiocytoma is a rare skin condition that is considered to be a variant of a dermatofibroma.
simple_sent: Epithelioid cell histiocytoma is a rare type of skin condition. It is similar to a dermatofibroma.

ori_sentence: Tricho–dento–osseous syndrome (TDO) is a rare, systemic, autosomal dominant genetic disorder that causes defects in hair, teeth, and bones respectively.
simple_sent: Tricho-dento-osseous syndrome (TDO) is a rare genetic disorder. People who have it will have problems with their hair, teeth, and bones.

ori_sentence: Epilepsy is the most common childhood brain disorder in the United States.
simple_sent: Epilepsy is the most common childhood brain disorder in the United States.

ori_sentence: Triparesis is a medical condition, similar to triplegia, but the major difference between the two is primarily that triplegia is total loss of function in three limbs, and triparesis denotes weakening of three limbs.
simple_sent: Triparesis is a medical condition. It is similar to triplegia, but the main difference is that triplegia is total loss of function in three limbs, while triparesis only affects one or two of the limbs.

ori_sentence: Erythema elevatum diutinum is a form of vasculitis.
simple_sent: Erythema elevatum diutinum is a medical condition.

ori_sentence: Erythema multiforme is usually a reaction of the skin and mucous membranes that occurs suddenly.
simple_sent: Erythema multiforme usually happens suddenly. The skin and mucous membranes usually react.

ori_sentence: Traumatic asphyxia, or Perthes's syndrome, is a medical emergency caused by an intense compression of the thoracic cavity, causing venous back-flow from the right side of the heart into the veins of the neck and the brain.
simple_sent: Traumatic asphyxia, or Perthes's syndrome, is a medical emergency. It happens when the right side of the heart becomes too narrow. This causes blood to flow back into the neck and brain.

ori_sentence: Enteropathy-associated T-cell lymphoma (EATL), previously termed enteropathy-associated T-cell lymphoma, type I and at one time termed enteropathy-type T-cell lymphoma (ETTL), is a complication of coeliac disease in which a malignant T-cell lymphoma develops in areas of the small intestine afflicted by the disease's intense inflammation.
simple_sent: Enteropathy-associated T-cell lymphoma (EATL), previously termed enteropathy-associated T-cell lymphoma, type I and at one time termed enteropathy-type T-cell lymphoma (ETTL), is a cancer of the small intestine. People who have coeliac disease are more likely to have enteropathy-associated T-cell lymphoma.

ori_sentence: Entomophthoramycosis (or Entomophthoromycosis) is a mycosis caused by Entomophthorales.
simple_sent: Entomophthoramycosis, also called entomophthoromycosis, is a disease.

simple_sent: Hypouricemia is when the level of uric acid in the blood is lower than normal.

ori_sentence: Epidermolytic acanthomas are a cutaneous condition characterized by discrete keratotic papules in adults.
simple_sent: Epidermolytic acanthomas are small papules on the skin. In adults, they are usually small.

simple_sent: A coronary stent is a tube-shaped device that is placed in the coronary arteries to help keep the blood flowing to the heart. It is used to treat heart disease.

ori_sentence: Trimethobenzamide (trade names Tebamide, Tigan) is an antiemetic used to prevent nausea and vomiting.
simple_sent: Trimethobenzamide (also known as Tebamide and Tigan) is a chemical compound.

ori_sentence: In medicine, enophthalmia describes eyes that are abnormally sunken into their sockets.

simple_sent: Fomepizole (also known as 4-methylpyrazole) is a drug. It is used to stop people from drinking methanol.

ori_sentence: Epithelial-myoepithelial carcinoma (EMCa) is a rare malignant tumour that typically arises in a salivary gland and consists of both an epithelial and myoepithelial component.
simple_sent: Epithelial-myoepithelial carcinoma (EMCa) is a rare type of cancer. It usually starts in a salivary gland, and both the epithelial and myoepithelial cells are involved.

ori_sentence: Epicondylitis is a type of musculoskeletal disorder that refers to an inflammation of an epicondyle.
simple_sent: Epicondylitis is an inflammation of the epicondyle. It is a type of musculoskeletal disorder.

ori_sentence: Iron(II) fumarate, also known as ferrous fumarate, is the iron(II) salt of fumaric acid, occurring as a reddish-orange powder, used to supplement iron intake.
simple_sent: Iron(II) fumarate, also known as ferrous fumarate, is a chemical compound. It is made by reacting iron with fumaric acid.

simple_sent: Diphenoxylate (also known as phenylpiperidine) is a drug that is used to treat diarrhea. It is an opioid that has many different active parts.

ori_sentence: Chlortetracycline (trade name Aureomycin, Lederle Laboratories) is a tetracycline antibiotic, the first tetracycline to be identified.
simple_sent: Chlortetracycline (also known as Aureomycin) is a tetracycline antibiotic. Its trade name is Lederle Laboratories.

ori_sentence: Trepopnea /tɹɛpəʊpˈniːə/ is dyspnea (shortness of breath) that is sensed while lying on one side but not on the other (lateral recumbent position).
simple_sent: Tropical dyspnea (shortness of breath) can be felt when you are lying on one side, but not on the other. This is called lateral recumbent position.

simple_sent: Epidermal nevus syndrome (also known as "Feuerstein and Mims syndrome", and "Solomon's syndrome") is a rare disease. People who have the disease have problems with their central nervous system (CNS), skeleton, skin, cardiovascular system, eyes, and gastrointestinal system.

ori_sentence: Clear-cell carcinoma also known as clear cell adenocarcinoma and mesonephroma is an epithelial cell derived carcinoma characterized by the presence of clear cells observed during histological, diagnostic assessment.
simple_sent: Clear-cell carcinoma (also known as clear cell adenocarcinoma and mesonephroma) is a type of cancer. It is a type of cancer that does not appear in other parts of the body.

simple_sent: Trichorrhexis nodosa is a defect in the hair shaft. It causes the hair to break off easily because the hair shaft becomes too thick.

ori_sentence: Tridihexethyl (which is commonly used as its chloride salt, tridihexethyl chloride) is an anticholinergic, antimuscarinic and antispasmodic drug.
simple_sent: Tridihexethyl (also known as tridihexethyl chloride) is a chemical compound. It is an anticholinergic and antimuscarinic drug.

simple_sent: Eosinophilic cellulitis, also known as Wells' syndrome, is a skin disease. People who have the disease have painful, red, raised, and warm patches of skin.

simple_sent: A trichodiscoma is a tumor on the skin. It is usually small, and usually only shows up on the face or upper trunk.

simple_sent: Enteroendocrine cells are special cells. They are found in the pancreas and gastrointestinal tract.

ori_sentence: Enthesophytes are abnormal bony projections at the attachment of a tendon or ligament.
simple_sent: Enthesophytes are special plants. They have bony projections on their ends.

simple_sent: Epithelioid sarcoma is a rare soft tissue sarcoma. It starts in the mesenchymal tissue, which is a part of the body.

simple_sent: Epulis fissuratum is a benign hyperplasia of connective tissue. It develops because the flange of a poorly fitting denture causes chronic mechanical irritation.

simple_sent: The metacarpophalangeal joints (MCP) are bones in the hand. They are located between the metacarpal bones.

simple_sent: Cefotaxime is an antibiotic. It is used to treat certain diseases.

simple_sent: Cromoglicic acid, also known as cromolyn (USAN), cromoglycate (former BAN), or cromoglicate, is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is sodium cromoglicate. It is commonly sold as sodium cromoglicate or cromolyn sodium.

simple_sent: Ezetimibe is a drug that is used to treat high blood cholesterol and other lipid problems.

simple_sent: Trichostasis spinulosa is a condition of the hair follicles that looks like blackheads, but it is not. The hair follicles are filled with funnel-shaped, horny plugs that are bundles of vellus hairs.

simple_sent: True hermaphroditism is an intersex condition. This means that a person is born with both ovarian and testicular tissue, but not both at the same time.

simple_sent: Transvenous cardiac pacing, also called endocardial pacing, is a medical treatment. It can save a person's life if it is done right.

simple_sent: A traumatic neuroma is a type of neuroma. It usually happens when a surgery is performed on a nerve.

simple_sent: Trichilemmoma (also known as "tricholemmoma") is a cancer of the skin. It is usually found in the area around the mouth.

simple_sent: Trichilemmal carcinoma is usually found on sun-exposed areas. The most common areas are the face and ears.

simple_sent: The trigeminal motor nucleus contains motor neurons that innervate the muscles of the first branchial arch. The muscles of the first branchial arch are the mastication muscles and the tensor tympani.

simple_sent: Tropical acne happens more often in the tropics. It happens when the weather is hot and humid.

simple_sent: Fracture blisters occur on skin overlying a fractured bone. In orthopedics, the development of overlying blisters remains a clinical dilemma.

simple_sent: Frank-Ter Haar syndrome (FTHS), also known as Ter Haar-syndrome, is a rare disease. It affects the development of the bone, heart, and eye.

simple_sent: Thyrotropin-releasing hormone (TRH) is a hormone that is released by the hypothalamus in the central nervous system of the human body. It stimulates the release of thyroid hormone and prolactin.

simple_sent: Testosterone undecanoate, also known as Andriol or Aveed, is an androgen and anabolic steroid (AAS) medication. It is used to treat men who have low levels of testosterone.

simple_sent: The anterior cruciate ligament (ACL) is the main ligament in the body that goes from the knee to the shin.

simple_sent: Avibactam is an anti-lactam drug. It was first made by Actavis, then by AstraZeneca, then by Teva.

simple_sent: Lymphocytic colitis is a type of colitis. People who have this disease have non-bloody watery diarrhea.

simple_sent: Periodic limb movement disorder (PLMD) is a sleep disorder. People with the disorder move their arms and legs randomly during sleep, or sometimes when they are not sleeping.

simple_sent: Macitentan (also known as Opsumit) is a drug that is used to treat pulmonary arterial hypertension (PAH). It works by attacking the endothelin receptor.

simple_sent: Hymenolepiasis is caused by two types of tapeworms.

simple_sent: Male breast cancer is a cancer that does not usually happen to men. It is a rare cancer.

ori_sentence: Eastern equine encephalitis (EEE), commonly called Triple E or sleeping sickness (not to be confused with African trypanosomiasis), is a disease caused by a zoonotic mosquito vectored Togavirus that is present in North, Central, and South America, and the Caribbean.
simple_sent: Eastern equine encephalitis (EEE), also known as Triple E or sleeping sickness, is a disease. It is caused by a togavirus that is spread by mosquitoes. The disease is found in North America, Central America, and the Caribbean.

simple_sent: Madras motor neuron disease is a rare disease. It is found only in India.

simple_sent: MASA syndrome is a rare neurological disorder. It belongs in the group of hereditary spastic paraplegias. People with MASA syndrome have more stiffness and spasticity in the lower limbs.

simple_sent: Ischemic fasciities (IF), also called decubital ischemic fasciitis or atypical decubital fibroplasia, is a very rare tumor. It is often mistaken for a sarcoma.

simple_sent: Majocchi's disease (also known as Purpura annularis telangiectodes of Majocchi) is a rare disease of the skin. People who have the disease have purple/bluish-red areas on their skin that are 1- to 3-cm wide.

simple_sent: Factor X deficiency (X as Roman numeral ten) is a condition in which the body does not produce enough of a protein called factor X. This protein causes blood to clot.

ori_sentence: Lymphoepithelioma-like carcinoma (LELC) is a medical term referring to a histological variant of malignant tumor arising from the uncontrolled mitosis of transformed cells originating in epithelial tissue (or in cells that display epithelial characteristics) that bear microscopic resemblance to lymphoepithelioma (nasopharyngeal carcinoma).
simple_sent: Lymphoepithelioma-like carcinoma (LELC) is a medical term referring to a type of malignant tumor that looks like a lymphoepithelioma (a type of cancer of the lymphatic system). The cells that cause lymphoepithelioma come from the outside of the body, in epithelial tissue (or in cells that show epithelial characteristics).

ori_sentence: Macroorchidism is a disorder found in males where a subject has abnormally large testes.
simple_sent: Macroorchidism is a disorder. In this case, the male has very large testes.

ori_sentence: The cataract-microcornea syndrome is the association of congenital cataract and microcornea.
simple_sent: Cataract-microcornea syndrome is when a person has both a cataract and a microcornea.

ori_sentence: Factor VII deficiency is a bleeding disorder characterized by a lack in the production of Factor VII (FVII) (proconvertin), a protein that causes blood to clot in the coagulation cascade.
simple_sent: Factor VII deficiency is a bleeding disorder. People who do not have Factor VII (FVII) (proconvertin) will not be able to stop the blood from clotting.

ori_sentence: A malignant acrospiroma is a sweat gland carcinoma of the hand, which may recur locally in 50% of patients after excision, with distant metastases occurring in 60% of patients.
simple_sent: A malignant acrospiroma is a cancer of the hand. About 50% of patients get this cancer again after surgery, and about 60% of patients get new cancer.

ori_sentence: Marginal zone B-cell lymphomas, also known as marginal zone lymphomas (MZLs), are a heterogeneous group of lymphomas that derive from the malignant transformation of marginal zone B-cells.
simple_sent: Marginal zone B-cell lymphomas, also known as marginal zone lymphomas (MZLs), are malignant tumors in the central nervous system (CNS).

simple_sent: Reality testing is a psychotherapeutic function. It shows the observer how the real world, or real life, compares to what they think it is.

simple_sent: Conjunctival squamous cell carcinoma, also known as SCC

ori_sentence: The congenital heart block (CHB) is the heart block that is diagnosed in fetus (in utero) or within the first 28 days after birth (neonatal period), some studies also include the diagnosis during early childhood to the definition of CHB.
simple_sent: A congenital heart block (CHB) is a heart problem that does not go away after the baby is born. People usually get a heart block in the first 28 days after the baby is born, called the neonatal period.

simple_sent: Nightmare disorder is a sleep disorder. People who have it often have nightmares a lot of the time.

simple_sent: Majeed syndrome is an inherited skin disorder. People with Majeed syndrome have chronic osteomyelitis, dyserythropoietic anemia, and a neutrophilic dermatosis.

ori_sentence: Congenital dermal sinus is an uncommon form of cranial or spinal dysraphism.
simple_sent: Congenital dermal sinus is a rare condition. It is found in children.

simple_sent: Lodoxamide is an anti-inflammatory drug.

simple_sent: White superficial onychomycosis is an infection of the nail plate. It mainly affects the outside of the nail.

simple_sent: Padimate O is an organic compound. Its chemical formula is PABA. It is similar to 4-aminobenzoic acid, which is a water-soluble compound.

simple_sent: Wildervanck syndrome or cervico-oculo-acoustic syndrome is a medical condition.

simple_sent: Woolly hair nevus (also spelled Wooly hair nevus) is a condition. When a person is born with the condition, their hair will be kinked or woolly.

simple_sent: Wound contracture is a process that may occur during wound healing. A normal healing process, when too much wound contraction takes place, causes the skin to constrict and make it hard for the body to work.

simple_sent: Loin pain hematuria syndrome (LPHS) is a medical condition. People who have the condition will experience pain in thelin and flank and sometimes blood in the urine.

simple_sent: A bundle branch block is a defect in the heart's electrical conduction system. It is found in the bundle branches.

simple_sent: Uremia is when the blood has high levels of urea.

simple_sent: Worster-Drought syndrome is a form of cerebral palsy. It happens to some children when they are born.

simple_sent: The respiratory tract is a part of the respiratory system. It is the part of the system that moves air around.

simple_sent: A localized disease is a disease that does not spread from person to person, but only affects one organ system or area of the body. An example of a localized disease is a sprained ankle.

simple_sent: Lobular pneumonia is a form of pneumonia that affects a large and continuous area of the lobe of a lung. It is characterized by inflammatory exudate within the intra-alveolar space.

simple_sent: Limb body wall complex (LBWC) is a rare birth defect. It is not known why.

simple_sent: Ganciclovir (also known as Cytovene) is an antiviral drug. It is used to treat cytomegalovirus (CMV) infections.

simple_sent: Spondweni fever is a disease. The disease is caused by a virus.

simple_sent: Westerhof syndrome is a cutaneous condition. People who have it have been born with congenital hypopigmented macules.

simple_sent: Warty dyskeratoma, also known as an Isolated dyskeratosis follicularis, is a benign (not cancerous) growth on the outside of the body that looks like a small mole, but is actually a benign (not cancerous) growth on the inside of the body. It has a central mark or depression that looks like a navel.

simple_sent: A vascular anomaly can be any of many different things. It can be a simple birthmark, or a large tumor.

simple_sent: A venous lake (also known as phlebectasis) is a small, soft, dark blue to violaceous papule, 0.2- to 1-cm in size, that can be found on the outside of the body when it is in the sun.

simple_sent: Vici syndrome, also called immunodeficiency with cleft lip/palate, cataract, hypopigmentation and absent corpus callosum (or absent corpus callosum cataract immunodeficiency), is a rare disorder. simple_sent: Valve replacement surgery is when a person has to have a surgery to replace one or more heart valves. This can be done using an artificial heart valve or a bioprosthesis.

simple_sent: Hanhart syndrome (also called Aglossia adactylia, Hypoglossia-hypodactylia, or Peromelia with micrognathia) is a birth defect. It causes a person to not have a properly developed tongue.

simple_sent: Vitreomacular adhesion (VMA) is a medical condition in which the vitreous humour of the human eye sticks to the retina very well. This is called vitreous gel.

simple_sent: CLOVES syndrome is a very rare condition. It is an overgrowth syndrome.

simple_sent: Norgestimate (also known as Ortho Tri-Cyclen and Previfem) is a progestin-based medication. It is used as a birth control for women, and as a menopausal hormone therapy.

simple_sent: Nonthrombocytopenic purpura is not related to thrombocytopenia. It is a red or purple color on the skin.

simple_sent: A Zahn infarct is a pseudo-infarction of the liver. It has an area of congestion, but there is no death. It usually happens because a branch of the portal vein is blocked.

simple_sent: Nuchal-type fibroma is a rare benign growth in the dermis and subcutaneous tissues. It is a collection of dense, hypocellular bundles of collagen with entrapped small nerves and adipocytes.

simple_sent: A nonstress test (NST) is a test to check the health of the fetus during pregnancy. It measures the fetal heart rate.

simple_sent: Nuclear sclerosis is an age-related change in how the nucleus of the eye works. It happens to all older animals.
