simple_sent: Okamoto syndrome (OS) is a very rare genetic condition. People with Okamoto syndrome have low muscle tone, heart defects, an intellectual disability, and they do not have the usual facial features that most people have.

ori_sentence: Multisystemic smooth muscle dysfunction syndrome (MSMDS) is a genetic disorder caused by R179 missense mutations in the ACTA2 gene.
simple_sent: Multisystemic smooth muscle dysfunction syndrome (MSMDS) is a disease. It is caused by a mutation in the ACTA2 gene.

simple_sent: Nonunion is when a broken bone does not heal properly. It will not heal unless surgery is done.

simple_sent: XXXY syndrome is a genetic condition. It happens when a person has two extra X chromosomes, instead of one.

simple_sent: Xanthoma disseminatum is a rare cutaneous condition that mainly affects males in childhood. It is characterized by small, yellow-red to brown papules and nodules that spread over the body very quickly.

simple_sent: ZAP70 deficiency, or ZAP70 deficient SCID, is a rare form of combined immunodeficiency. Without ZAP70, a person will not be able to make any T cells.

simple_sent: XXYY is a sex chromosome abnormality. In this case, males have an extra X chromosome.

simple_sent: Zika fever, also called Zika disease, is a disease. It is caused by a virus called the Zika virus.

ori_sentence: Y chromosome microdeletion (YCM) is a family of genetic disorders caused by missing genes in the Y chromosome.
simple_sent: Y chromosome microdeletion is a disease. It happens when some genes on the Y chromosome are not working properly.

ori_sentence: Yemenite deaf-blind hypopigmentation syndrome is a condition caused by a mutation on the SRY-related HMG-box gene 10 (not SOX10).
simple_sent: Yemenite deaf-blind hypopigmentation syndrome is a disease. It is caused by a change in a gene called the HMG-box gene.

simple_sent: Noma neonatorum is a cutaneous condition. It is usually caused by an infection, usually Pseudomonas aeruginosa sepsis, but can also be caused by other causes.

ori_sentence: The term nonpuerperal mastitis describes inflammatory lesions of the breast (mastitis) that occur unrelated to pregnancy and breastfeeding.
simple_sent: Non-puerperal mastitis is when the disease does not affect pregnancy or breastfeeding. It is an inflammatory disease of the breast.

ori_sentence: Nodular vasculitis is a skin condition characterized by crops of small, tender, erythematous nodules on the legs, mostly on the calves and shins.
simple_sent: Nodular vasculitis is a disease of the skin. People who have it get small, tender, erythematous nodules on their legs, mostly their legs.

ori_sentence: OSLAM syndrome is a rare autosomal dominant hereditary disorder.
simple_sent: OSLAM syndrome is a rare genetic disease. It is inherited.

ori_sentence: Wrist drop is a medical condition in which the wrist and the fingers cannot extend at the metacarpophalangeal joints.
simple_sent: Wrist drop is a medical condition. When this happens, the wrist and fingers can not go as far as they should.

ori_sentence: Nevus unius lateris is a cutaneous condition, an epidermal nevus in which the skin lesions are distributed on one-half of the body.
simple_sent: Nevus unius lateris is a condition of the skin. People who have this condition have lesions on one-half of the body.

ori_sentence: The postictal state is the altered state of consciousness after an epileptic seizure.
simple_sent: The postictal state is when the person does not remember anything after the seizure.

ori_sentence: A nipple adenoma is a rare benign tumour of the breast.
simple_sent: A nipple adenoma is a small cancer of the breast.

ori_sentence: Fasciolosis is a parasitic worm infection caused by the common liver fluke Fasciola hepatica as well as by Fasciola gigantica.
simple_sent: Fasciolosis is a disease. It is caused by a worm called Fasciola. The most common type of Fasciola is the liver fluke.

ori_sentence: Gadoxetic acid is a gadolinium-based MRI contrast agent.
simple_sent: Gadoxetic acid is a contrast agent in MRI.

ori_sentence: Nodular melanoma (NM) is the most aggressive form of melanoma.
simple_sent: Nodular melanoma (NM) is the most common type of melanoma.

ori_sentence: Obstructive sleep apnea (OSA) is the most common sleep-related breathing disorder and is characterized by recurrent episodes of complete or partial obstruction of the upper airway leading to reduced or absent breathing during sleep.
simple_sent: Obstructive sleep apnea (OSA) is the most common sleep-related breathing disorder. People with OSA have episodes where the upper airway is blocked for a long time, and they have trouble breathing during sleep.

ori_sentence: Transtracheal jet ventilation refers to a type of high-frequency ventilation, low tidal volume ventilation provided via a laryngeal catheter by specialized ventilators that are usually only available in the operating room or intensive care unit.
simple_sent: Transtracheal jet ventilation is a type of high-frequency ventilation that is usually only available in the operating room or intensive care unit. It uses a laryngeal catheter to provide high-frequency ventilation to the patient.

simple_sent: Hyoid suspension, also known as hyoid myotomy and suspension or hyoid advancement, is a surgery. In it, the hyoid bone and muscle attachments to the tongue and airway are pulled forward. simple_sent: The zygomaticofacial nerve or zygomaticofacial branch of the zygomatic nerve (malar branch) passes through the zygomatic bone to reach the skin of the malar area. The zygomaticofacial nerve passes through the zygomatic bone to reach the skin of the malar area.

simple_sent: Dentition analyses are systems of tooth and jaw measurement. They are used in orthodontics to find out where the teeth should be and how long they should be.

simple_sent: Pneumoparotitis (also called surgical mumps, wind parotitis, or pneumosialadenitis) is a disease. It happens when the parotid glands become inflamed (swollen) because of too much air going through the parotid duct.

simple_sent: Ataxia-pancytopenia syndrome is a rare disorder. People who have it have cerebellar ataxia, peripheral neuropathies, pancytopenia, and a tendency to get acute myeloid leukemia.

simple_sent: COACH syndrome is a rare genetic disease. It is also called Joubert syndrome with hepatic defect.

simple_sent: MGUS polyneuropathy or polyneuropathy associated with an M component is a rare neurological disease. It is characterized by inflammation of the peripheral nervous system (PNS).

simple_sent: Sweat diagnostics is a non-invasive technique that is used to find out how the human body is doing.

simple_sent: Laryngeal cysts are cysts in the larynx. Other places where laryngeals can be found are the epiglottis and vallecula.

simple_sent: The Ocular tilt reaction (OTR), is a reaction that happens when a person tilts their head from side to side. It is also called a head tilt.

simple_sent: Sialectasis (also called sialectasia or siadochiectasis) is when the salivary glands become too large.

simple_sent: Urushiol is a chemical compound. It is an oily mixture of organic compounds. It is found in some plants, especially those that cause allergic reactions.

simple_sent: Necrotizing pneumonia (NP) is a very serious disease. It is also called cavitary pneumonia or cavitatory necrosis.

simple_sent: Paliperidone palmitate (PP), also known as Invega Sustenna, is an atypical antipsychotic drug. It is used to treat people with schizophrenia and schizoaffective disorder.

simple_sent: Plasmablastic lymphoma (PBL) is a type of large B-cell lymphoma. The World Health Organization (WHO) said in 2017 that plasmablastic lymphoma is a type of lymphoma that is not in the normal blood.

ori_sentence: Alcohol intolerance is due to a genetic polymorphism of the enzyme alcohol dehydrogenase, the enzyme that metabolises ingested alcohol.

ori_sentence: Inferior alveolar nerve block (abbreviated to IANB, and also termed inferior alveolar nerve anesthesia or inferior dental block) is a nerve block technique which induces anesthesia (numbness) in the areas of the mouth and face innervated by one of the inferior alveolar nerves which are paired on the left and right side.

ori_sentence: Alcoholic ketoacidosis (AKA) is a specific group of symptoms and metabolic state related to alcohol use.

ori_sentence: A quadricuspid aortic valve (QAV) is a rare congenital heart defect characterized by the presence of four cusps, instead of the usual three found normally in the aortic valve.

simple_sent: A thermal burn is a burn that happens when hot objects come in contact with it. For example, hot water or steam can cause a thermal burn.

ori_sentence: Musicogenic seizure, also known as music-induced seizure, is a rare type of seizure, with an estimated prevalence of 1 in 10,000,000 individuals, that arises from disorganized or abnormal brain electrical activity when a person hears or is exposed to a specific type of sound or musical stimuli.
simple_sent: Musicogenic seizure, also known as music-induced seizure, is a rare type of seizure. About 1 in 10,000,000 people in the world have a musicogenic seizure. This happens when they hear a certain type of sound or when they are exposed to a certain amount of music.

ori_sentence: 'Xiphodynia or Xiphoidalgia’ is thought to be a rare musculoskeletal syndrome that involves referred pain referred from the xiphisternal joint or the structures attached to the xiphoid process.
simple_sent: Xiphodynia or Xiphoidalgia is a rare disease of the musculoskeletal system. People who have the disease have pain in the xiphisternal joint or the structures around it.

ori_sentence: Hyperandrogenism is a medical condition characterized by high levels of androgens.
simple_sent: Hyperandrogenism is a medical condition. It causes people to have too many androgens.

ori_sentence: SYNGAP1-related intellectual disability is a monogenetic developmental and epileptic encephalopathy that affects the central nervous system.
simple_sent: SYNGAP1-related intellectual disability is a disease that affects the central nervous system. It is a monogenetic condition.

ori_sentence: Macular scarring is formation of the fibrous tissue in place of the normal retinal tissue on the macular area of the retina which provides the sharpest vision in the eyes.
simple_sent: Macular scarring is the development of tissue in place of the normal retinal tissue. This tissue is found in the macular area of the retina in the back of the eyes.

ori_sentence: Virginia (/vərˈdʒɪnjə/), officially the Commonwealth of Virginia, is a state in the Mid-Atlantic and Southeastern regions of the United States, between the Atlantic Coast and the Appalachian Mountains.
simple_sent: Virginia (officially the Commonwealth of Virginia) is a state in the eastern part of the United States. The state is located between the Atlantic Ocean and the Appalachian Mountains.

ori_sentence: Neonatal hypocalcemia is an abnormal clinical and laboratory hypocalcemia condition that is frequently observed in infants.
simple_sent: Neonatal hypocalcemia is a medical condition. It is when a baby does not do well in school or at home.

ori_sentence: Stippled epiphyses is a pattern of focal bone calcification.
simple_sent: Stippled epiphyses is a calcification of the epiphyses.

ori_sentence: Hepatic artery thrombosis occurs when a blood clot forms in the artery that provides blood flow to the liver.
simple_sent: Hepatic artery thrombosis happens when a blood clot forms in the liver. The blood flow to the liver is cut off.

ori_sentence: Cytochrome b5 deficiency is a rare condition and form of isolated 17,20-lyase deficiency caused by deficiency in cytochrome b5, a small hemoprotein that acts as an allosteric factor to facilitate the interaction of CYP17A1 (17α-hydroxylase/17,20-lyase) with P450 oxidoreductase (POR), thereby allowing for the 17,20-lyase activity of CYP17A1.
simple_sent: Cytochrome b5 deficiency is a rare condition and form of isolated 17,20-lyase deficiency. It is caused by a lack of cytochrome b5, a small hemoprotein that helps 17,20-lyase (CYP17A1) and P450 oxidoreductase (POR) to work together. Without cytochrome b5, CYP17A1 and P450 can not work together.

ori_sentence: Tropical ataxic neuropathy (TAN, also known as Strachan-Scott Syndrome and prisoners of war neuropathy) is a disease or category of diseases that commonly causes disability and increases mortality.
simple_sent: Tropical ataxic neuropathy (TAN) is a disease. It is also known as Strachan-Scott Syndrome and prisoners of war neuropathy. People who have this disease have many problems.

ori_sentence: Idiopathic granulomatous hepatitis is a rare medical condition characterised by granulomas in the liver, recurrent fever, myalgia, and fatigue.
simple_sent: Idiopathic granulomatous hepatitis is a rare disease. People who have the disease have a fever, granulomas in the liver, and fatigue.

ori_sentence: Multicentric carpotarsal osteolysis syndrome (MCTO) is a rare autosomal dominant condition.
simple_sent: Multicentric carpotarsal osteolysis syndrome is a condition that does not happen often.

ori_sentence: Vitreous touch syndrome, is a late complication of intra capsular cataract extraction wherein the vitreous bulges through the pupillary aperture, and touches and attaches to the corneal endothelium.
simple_sent: Vitreous touch syndrome, is a late complication of cataract. When the cataract is removed, the vitreous bulges through the pupillary aperture and attaches to the corneal endothelium.

ori_sentence: Arteriosclerotic heart disease (ASHD), is a thickening and hardening of the walls of the coronary arteries.
simple_sent: Arteriosclerotic heart disease is a disease of the heart. It causes the walls of the arteries to become hard.

ori_sentence: Manganese is a chemical element with the symbol Mn and atomic number 25.
simple_sent: It has the chemical symbol Mn. It has the atomic number 25.

ori_sentence: Molybdenum is a chemical element with the symbol Mo and atomic number 42.
simple_sent: It has the chemical symbol Mo. It has the atomic number 42.

ori_sentence: A malignant chondroid syringoma (also known as a "malignant mixed tumour" or "MCS" ) is a very uncommon cutaneous (skin) condition characterised by an adnexal eccrine tumour.
simple_sent: A malignant chondroid syringoma (also known as a "malignant mixed tumour" or "MCS") is a very rare type of skin cancer. It is caused by an adnexal eccrine tumour.

ori_sentence: Tracheobronchitis is inflammation of the trachea and bronchi.
simple_sent: Tracheobronchitis is a disease of the trachea and bronchi.

ori_sentence: Sickle cell retinopathy can be defined as retinal changes due to blood vessel damage in the eye of a person with a background of sickle cell disease.
simple_sent: Sickle cell retinopathy changes the vision in the eye. This is because the blood vessel in the eye has been damaged by sickle cell disease.

ori_sentence: In ophthalmology, accommodative excess (also known as excessive accommodation or accommodation excess) occurs when an individual uses more than normal accommodation (focusing on close objects) for performing certain near work.
simple_sent: In ophthalmology, accommodative excess (also known as excessive accommodation or accommodation excess) is when people use more accommodation than is normal. This is usually done to help them see better.

ori_sentence: A fundic gland polyp is a type of polyp, found in the fundus of the stomach.
simple_sent: A fundic gland polyp is a kind of polyp. They are found in the stomach.

ori_sentence: Haab's striae, or Descemet's tears, are horizontal breaks in the Descemet membrane associated with congenital glaucoma.
simple_sent: Haab's striae, or Descemet's tears, are breaks in the Descemet membrane. They are a sign of glaucoma.

ori_sentence: Permanent junctional reciprocating tachycardia (PJRT) is a rare cardiac arrhythmia.
simple_sent: Permanent junctional reciprocating tachycardia is a cardiac arrhythmia, but it is not common.

ori_sentence: The term chronic subjective dizziness (CSD) is used to describe a commonly encountered type of dizziness that is not easily categorized into one of several other types, and for which the physical examination is typically normal.
simple_sent: The term chronic subjective dizziness (CSD) is used to describe a type of dizziness that people usually get all the time. There are many other types of dizziness, but chronic subjective dizziness is different.

ori_sentence: Pituitary stalk interruption syndrome (PSIS) is a congenital disorder characterised by the triad of an absent or exceedingly thin pituitary stalk, an ectopic or absent posterior pituitary and/or absent or hypoplastic anterior pituitary.
simple_sent: Pituitary stalk interruption syndrome (PSIS) is a condition where the pituitary gland is not working properly. People with PSIS have an absent or very thin pituitary stalk, an ectopic pituitary, and an absent anterior pituitary.

ori_sentence: Dysorgasmia is the experience of pain after an orgasm, usually in the abdomen.
simple_sent: Dysorgasmia is a pain in the abdomen after having an orgasm.

ori_sentence: Language disorders or language impairments are disorders that involve the processing of linguistic information.
simple_sent: Language disorders or language impairments make it hard for people to understand what others are saying.

ori_sentence: A disease is a particular abnormal condition that negatively affects the structure or function of all or part of an organism, and that is not due to any immediate external injury.
simple_sent: A disease is an abnormal condition in which all or part of an organism is damaged or does not work properly. The disease can not be caused by external injury.

ori_sentence: Amnesia is a deficit in memory caused by brain damage or disease, but it can also be caused temporarily by the use of various sedatives and hypnotic drugs.
simple_sent: Amnesia is a short-term loss of memory. It can happen because of brain damage or disease, but it can also be caused by other things, like drugs.

ori_sentence: The small intestine or small bowel is an organ in the gastrointestinal tract where most of the of nutrients from food takes place.
simple_sent: The small intestine (or small bowel) is a small part of the body. It is where food goes into the body.

ori_sentence: The scaphoid bone is one of the carpal bones of the wrist.
simple_sent: The scaphoid bone is a bone in the hand and wrist.

ori_sentence: Isopropyl alcohol (IUPAC name propan-2-ol and also called isopropanol or 2-propanol) is a colorless, flammable chemical compound (chemical formula CH3CHOHCH3) with a strong odor.
simple_sent: Isopropyl alcohol, also known as propan-2-ol, is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is CH3CHOHCH3. It is a colorless, flammable chemical compound.

ori_sentence: Malaria is a mosquito-borne infectious disease that affects humans and other animals.
simple_sent: Malaria is a disease that is spread by mosquitoes. It affects humans and animals.

ori_sentence: The endocrine system is a messenger system comprising feedback loops of the hormones released by internal glands of an organism directly into the circulatory system, regulating distant target organs.
simple_sent: The endocrine system is a messenger system. It is made up of many different parts, but the most important part is the hormones. These hormones are released by glands in the body.

ori_sentence: The common cold, also known simply as a cold, is a viral infectious disease of the upper respiratory tract that primarily affects the respiratory mucosa of the nose, throat, sinuses, and larynx.
simple_sent: The common cold, also known simply as cold, is a disease of the upper respiratory tract. The most common parts of the respiratory tract are the nose, throat, sinuses, and larynx.

ori_sentence: The liver is an organ of the digestive system only found in vertebrates which detoxifies various metabolites, synthesizes proteins and produces biochemicals necessary for digestion and growth.
simple_sent: The liver is an organ of the digestive system. It is found in all vertebrates. The liver is an important part of the digestive system and helps the body digest food.

ori_sentence: Adenine (/ˈædɪnɪn/) (symbol A or Ade) is a nucleobase (a purine derivative).
simple_sent: Adenine (symbol A or Ade) is a chemical element. It is a purine derivative.

ori_sentence: Alzheimer's disease (AD) is a neurodegenerative disease that usually starts slowly and progressively worsens.
simple_sent: Alzheimer's disease is a neurodegenerative disease. It usually starts slowly and gets worse over time.

ori_sentence: The prostate is both an accessory gland of the male reproductive system and a muscle-driven mechanical switch between urination and ejaculation.
simple_sent: The prostate is a gland in the male sex organs. It helps the male body to change the direction of urination and ejaculation.

ori_sentence: The uterus (from Latin "uterus", plural uteri) or womb
simple_sent: The uterus (Latin:uterus) is a part of the body.

ori_sentence: The skull is a bone structure that forms the head in vertebrates.
simple_sent: The skull is the largest bone in the human body.

ori_sentence: Cancer is a group of diseases involving abnormal cell growth with the potential to invade or spread to other parts of the body.
simple_sent: Cancer is a group of diseases where abnormal cell growth takes place. These cells can then spread to other parts of the body.

ori_sentence: The kidneys are two reddish-brown bean-shaped organs found in vertebrates.
simple_sent: The kidneys are two large, round, round organs. They are shaped like beans.

ori_sentence: An artery (plural arteries) (from Greek ἀρτηρία (artēríā) 'windpipe, artery') is a blood vessel in humans, and most other animals that takes blood away from the heart to one or more parts of the body (tissues, lungs, brain etc.).
simple_sent: An artery (plural arteries) is a blood vessel in humans and most other animals. It takes blood away from the heart and goes to other parts of the body. The word artery comes from the Greek word meaning "windpipe".

ori_sentence: Deafness has varying definitions in cultural and medical contexts.
simple_sent: Deafness has different definitions in different places.

ori_sentence: A mental disorder, also called a mental illness or psychiatric disorder, is a behavioral or mental pattern that causes significant distress or impairment of personal functioning.
simple_sent: A mental disorder, also called a mental illness or psychiatric disorder, is a mental condition where the person can not remember things from the past or present.

ori_sentence: The large intestine, also known as the large bowel, is the last part of the gastrointestinal tract and of the digestive system in vertebrates.
simple_sent: The large intestine (also called the large bowel) is a large part of the human body. It is the last part of the gastrointestinal system.

ori_sentence: A myocardial infarction (MI), commonly known as a heart attack, occurs when blood flow decreases or stops to the coronary artery of the heart, causing damage to the heart muscle.
simple_sent: A heart attack or myocardial infarction (MI) is when the blood can not get to the heart properly. This causes the heart to work harder and cause damage to the heart muscle.

ori_sentence: In humans and many other primates, the calcaneus (/kælˈkeɪniəs/; from the Latin calcaneus or calcaneum, meaning heel) or heel bone is a bone of the tarsus of the foot which constitutes the heel.
simple_sent: The calcaneus (from the Latin calcaneus or calcaneum, meaning heel) is a bone in the foot. In humans, it is the bone in the middle of the foot which is called the heel.

ori_sentence: Tuberculosis (TB) is an infectious disease usually caused by Mycobacterium tuberculosis (MTB) bacteria.
simple_sent: Tuberculosis is a disease. It is caused by a bacteria called Mycobacterium tuberculosis.

ori_sentence: The lunate bone (semilunar bone) is a carpal bone in the human hand.
simple_sent: The lunate bone is a small bone in the hand. It is a carpal bone.

ori_sentence: The scalp is the anatomical area bordered by the human face at the front, and by the neck at the sides and back.
simple_sent: The human face is at the front of the scalp. The neck is at the sides and the back of the scalp.

ori_sentence: The urinary bladder, or simply bladder, is a hollow muscular organ in humans and other vertebrates that stores urine from the kidneys before disposal by urination.
simple_sent: The urinary bladder, or simply bladder, is an organ in the human body. It takes urine from the kidneys and puts it into the bladder where it can be used.

ori_sentence: Smallpox was an infectious disease caused by one of two virus variants, and Variola minor.
simple_sent: Smallpox was an infectious disease. It was caused by a virus called Variola minor.

ori_sentence: Diabetes mellitus, commonly known as just diabetes, is a group of metabolic disorders characterized by a high blood sugar level over a prolonged period of time.
simple_sent: Diabetes mellitus, also known as diabetes, is a condition where the blood sugar level is too high. It usually happens over a long period of time.

ori_sentence: Segmental arterial mediolysis (SAM) is a rare disorder of the arteries characterized by the development of aneurysms, blood clots, narrowing of the arteries (stenoses), and blood collections (hematomas) in the affected distribution.
simple_sent: Segmental arterial mediolysis (SAM) is a rare disorder of the arteries. In people with SAM, there are more blood clots, more aneurysms in the arteries, and more blood collections (hematomas) in the affected areas.

ori_sentence: Ankle problems are of frequent occurrence and feature symptoms which include pain or discomfort experienced in the ankles.
simple_sent: Ankle problems are very common and feature symptoms. These symptoms include pain or discomfort in the ankles.

ori_sentence: Pedophilia (alternatively spelt paedophilia) is a psychiatric disorder in which an adult or older adolescent experiences a primary or exclusive sexual attraction to prepubescent children.
simple_sent: Pedophilia (also spelt paedophilia) is a mental disorder. It is when an adult or an older person has a sexual interest in young children, even if they are not interested in them.

ori_sentence: The larynx (/ˈlærɪŋks/), commonly called the voice box, is an organ in the top of the neck involved in breathing, producing sound and protecting the trachea against food aspiration.
simple_sent: The larynx (or voice box) is an organ in the top of the neck. It helps with breathing, making sound, and protecting the trachea from getting stuck in the throat.

ori_sentence: The pancreas is an organ of the digestive system and endocrine system of vertebrates.
simple_sent: The pancreas is a large organ in the human body. It is an endocrine system.

ori_sentence: Fatigue describes a state of tiredness that does not resolve with rest or sleep.
simple_sent: Fatigue is a feeling of tiredness. It does not go away with sleep or rest.

ori_sentence: Bacteria (/bækˈtɪəriə/; common noun bacteria, singular bacterium) are ubiquitous, mostly free-living organisms often consisting of one biological cell.
simple_sent: Bacteria (common noun bacteria, singular bacterium) are all living things. They are mostly free-living organisms, with only one cell per cell.

ori_sentence: The Scianna blood antigen system consists of seven antigens.
simple_sent: The Scianna blood antigen system has seven different parts.

ori_sentence: Hemoglobin O-Arab (American English) or Haemoglobin O-Arab (British English) is a rare alternation of Hemoglobin (American English) or Haemoglobin (British English), characterised with the presence of β^121Glu → Lys (Hb O-Arab).
simple_sent: Hemoglobin O-Arab (American English) or Haemoglobin O-Arab (British English) is a rare form of hemoglobin. It is made of two different parts: beta-glucose (Hb O-Arab) and Lys (Hb O-Arab).

ori_sentence: Disruptive mood dysregulation disorder (DMDD) is a mental disorder in children and adolescents characterized by a persistently irritable or angry mood and frequent temper outbursts that are disproportionate to the situation and significantly more severe than the typical reaction of same-aged peers.
simple_sent: Disruptive mood dysregulation disorder (DMDD) is a mental disorder in children and adolescents. People with DMDD usually have a very irritable or angry mood all the time, and they also have many temper outbursts that are not normal for their age.

ori_sentence: Ulcerative colitis (UC) is a long-term condition that results in inflammation and ulcers of the colon and rectum.
simple_sent: Ulcerative colitis (UC) is a condition that makes the colon and rectum very painful and inflamed.

ori_sentence: Carbon monoxide (chemical formula CO) is a colorless, odorless, tasteless, flammable gas that is slightly less dense than air.
simple_sent: Carbon monoxide (CO) is a colorless, odorless, tasteless, flammable gas. It is slightly less dense than air.

ori_sentence: The ovary is an organ found in the female reproductive system that produces an ovum.
simple_sent: The ovary is a part of the female body. When a woman has an ovary, she has an ovum.

ori_sentence: Zoophilia is a paraphilia involving a sexual fixation on non-human animals.
simple_sent: Zoophilia is a sexual interest in non-human animals. It is a paraphilia.

ori_sentence: A nose is a protuberance in vertebrates that houses the nostrils, or nares, which receive and expel air for respiration alongside the mouth.
simple_sent: A nose is a part of a mammal or other animal's body. It houses the nostrils, or nares, and lets air out through the mouth.

ori_sentence: An atom is the smallest unit of ordinary matter that forms a chemical element.
simple_sent: An atom is a very small object. It is the smallest unit of matter.

ori_sentence: The peritoneum is the serous membrane forming the lining of the abdominal cavity or coelom in amniotes and some invertebrates, such as annelids.
simple_sent: The peritoneum is the lining of the abdominal cavity. Some invertebrates, such as annelids, have a membrane inside it, called coelom.

ori_sentence: Anaplastic oligodendroglioma is a neuroepithelial tumor which is believed to originate from oligodendrocytes, a cell type of the glia.
simple_sent: Anaplastic oligodendroglioma is a type of brain tumor. People who have it have been told that it comes from oligodendrocytes.

ori_sentence: The urethra (from Greek οὐρήθρα – ourḗthrā) is a tube that connects the urinary bladder to the urinary meatus for the removal of urine from the body of both females and males.
simple_sent: The urethra is a tube in the human body. It connects the urinary bladder to the urinary meatus and helps the body to get rid of urine from the body.

ori_sentence: The tongue is a muscular organ in the mouth of a typical vertebrate.
simple_sent: The tongue is a muscle group in the mouth. Most animals have it.

ori_sentence: A hydrofluoric acid burn is a chemical burn from hydrofluoric acid.
simple_sent: A burn can be caused by hydrofluoric acid, for example.

ori_sentence: Xenon is a chemical element with the symbol Xe and atomic number 54.
simple_sent: It has the chemical symbol Xe. It has the atomic number 54.

ori_sentence: Eyes are organs of the visual system.
simple_sent: The eyes are the visual system's organ.

ori_sentence: Blood is a body fluid in humans and other animals that delivers necessary substances such as nutrients and oxygen to the cells and transports metabolic waste products away from those same cells.
simple_sent: Blood is a liquid in the body. In humans and other animals, it is a part of the body that gives nutrients to cells and oxygen to the cells. It also carries waste products from cells.

ori_sentence: The circulatory system, also called the cardiovascular system or the vascular system, is an organ system that permits blood to circulate and transport nutrients (such as amino acids and electrolytes), oxygen, carbon dioxide, hormones, and blood cells to and from the cells in the body to provide nourishment and help in fighting diseases, stabilize temperature and pH, and maintain homeostasis.
simple_sent: The circulatory system (also called the cardiovascular system or the vascular system) is the part of the body that carries blood and oxygen. The circulatory system is the part of the body that carries blood and oxygen to and from the cells in the body. The circulatory system is an important part of the human body.

ori_sentence: Multiple sclerosis (MS), also known as encephalomyelitis disseminata, is the most common demyelinating disease, in which the insulating covers of nerve cells in the brain and spinal cord are damaged.
simple_sent: Multiple sclerosis (MS), also known as encephalomyelitis disseminata, is a disease that causes damage to the brain and spinal cord. People who have MS get the disease early in their lives.

ori_sentence: Myasthenia gravis (MG) is a long-term neuromuscular disease that leads to varying degrees of skeletal muscle weakness.
simple_sent: Myasthenia gravis (MG) is a long-term disease. People who have the disease will have some muscle weakness.

ori_sentence: The spleen is an organ found in all vertebrates.
simple_sent: The spleen is an important organ in life.

ori_sentence: A joint or articulation (or articular surface) is the connection made between bones in the body which link the skeletal system into a functional whole.
simple_sent: A joint or articulation (or articular surface) is the connection between two or more bones in the body. These bones are called bones.

ori_sentence: In animal anatomy, the mouth, also known as the oral cavity, buccal cavity, or in Latin cavum oris, is the opening through which many animals take in food and issue vocal sounds.
simple_sent: In animal anatomy, the mouth is the opening through which animals take in food. It is also called the oral cavity, buccal cavity, or in Latin cavum oris.

ori_sentence: Veins are blood vessels in humans, and most other animals that carry blood towards the heart.
simple_sent: In humans and most other animals, the blood goes to the heart through the veins.

ori_sentence: Crohn's disease is a type of inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) that may affect any segment of the gastrointestinal tract from the mouth to the anus.
simple_sent: Crohn's disease is an inflammatory bowel disease. People with Crohn's disease usually get it from the mouth to the anus.

ori_sentence: Occult macular dystrophy (OMD) is a rare inherited degradation of the retina, characterized by progressive loss of function in the most sensitive part of the central retina (macula), the location of the highest concentration of light-sensitive cells (photoreceptors) but presenting no visible abnormality.
simple_sent: Occult macular dystrophy (OMD) is a rare disease of the retina. Over time, it causes a loss of function in the most sensitive part of the central retina. This is the part of the retina where light sensitive cells (photoreceptors) are found.

ori_sentence: Addison's disease, also known as primary adrenal insufficiency, is a rare long-term endocrine disorder characterized by inadequate production of the steroid hormones cortisol and aldosterone by the two outer layers of the cells of the adrenal glands (adrenal cortex), causing adrenal insufficiency.
simple_sent: Addison's disease, also known as primary adrenal insufficiency, is a rare long-term endocrine disorder in which the two outer layers of the cells of the adrenal glands (adrenal cortex) do not produce enough of the steroid hormones cortisol and aldosterone.

ori_sentence: Amino acids are organic compounds that contain amino (−NH+3) and carboxylate −CO−2 functional groups, along with a side chain (R group) specific to each amino acid.
simple_sent: Amino acids are chemical compounds that have a side chain (R group) that is specific to each amino acid. These side chain groups are called functional groups.

ori_sentence: Parkinson's disease (PD), or simply Parkinson's, is a long-term degenerative disorder of the central nervous system that mainly affects the motor system.
simple_sent: Parkinson's disease or simply Parkinson's disease is a disease. It is a long-term disease that affects the central nervous system.

ori_sentence: Birk-Barel syndrome is a rare genetic disorder associated with the KCNK9 gene.
simple_sent: Birk-Barel syndrome is a very rare disease. It is caused by a gene.

ori_sentence: Choledochoduodenostomy (CDD) is a surgical procedure to create an anastomosis, a surgical connection, between the common bile duct (CBD) and an alternative portion of the duodenum.
simple_sent: Choledochoduodenostomy (CDD) is a surgery to make a connection between the common bile duct (CBD) and a part of the duodenum. This is called an anastomosis.

ori_sentence: Intravascular hemolysis describes hemolysis that happens mainly inside the vasculature.
simple_sent: Intravascular hemolysis takes place inside the blood vessels. This is called hemolysis.

ori_sentence: The neck is the part of the body on many vertebrates that connects the head with the torso and provides the mobility and movements of the head.
simple_sent: The neck is the part of the body on many animals that connects the head to the rest of the body. It is the part where the head is.

ori_sentence: The ureters are tubes made of smooth muscle that propel urine from the kidneys to the urinary bladder.
simple_sent: The ureters carry urine from the kidneys to the urinary bladder. They are made of smooth muscle.

ori_sentence: The thoracic diaphragm, or simply the diaphragm (Ancient Greek: διάφραγμα, romanized: diáphragma, lit. 'partition'), is a sheet of internal skeletal muscle in humans and other mammals that extends across the bottom of the thoracic cavity.
simple_sent: The thoracic diaphragm (or simply the diaphragm) is a piece of muscle in the human body. In humans and other mammals, the diaphragm is located at the bottom of the thoracic cavity, near the ribcage.

ori_sentence: Menstrual suppression refers to the practice of using hormonal management to stop or reduce menstrual bleeding.
simple_sent: Menstrual suppression is a medical treatment. It is used to stop or reduce menstrual bleeding.

ori_sentence: The spinal cord is a long, thin, tubular structure made up of nervous tissue, which extends from the medulla oblongata in the brainstem to the lumbar region of the vertebral column.
simple_sent: The spinal cord is a long thin tube made up of nervous tissue. It goes from the brain in the brainstem to the lumbar region of the vertebral column in the back of the body.

ori_sentence: Lanthanum is a chemical element with the symbol La and atomic number 57.
simple_sent: It has the chemical symbol La. It has the atomic number 57.

ori_sentence: Axillary dissection is a surgical procedure that incises the axilla, usually in order to identify, examine, or take out lymph nodes.
simple_sent: Axillary dissection is a surgery where the doctor cuts the axilla away. This is usually done to find out where lymph nodes are.

ori_sentence: Carbon dioxide (chemical formula CO2) is an acidic colorless gas with a density about 53% higher than that of dry air.
simple_sent: Carbon dioxide (CO2) is a colorless gas. Its density is about 53% higher than dry air, so it is very hot.

ori_sentence: Nasopharyngeal cyst refers to cystic swelling arising from midline and lateral wall of the nasopharynx.
simple_sent: A nasopharyngeal cyst is a cyst on the nasopharynx. It is usually found near the middle of the throat.

ori_sentence: Influenza, commonly known as "the flu", is an infectious disease caused by influenza viruses.
simple_sent: Influenza, also called the flu, is a disease. It is caused by many different viruses.

ori_sentence: Toxic vacuolation, also known as toxic vacuolization, is the formation of vacuoles in the cytoplasm of neutrophils in response to severe infections or inflammatory conditions.
simple_sent: Toxic vacuolation, also known as toxic vacuolization, is when neutrophils make too many vacuoles in the cytoplasm. This is called toxic vacuolization.

ori_sentence: Anemia, also spelled anaemia and sometimes called erythrocytopenia, is a decrease in the total amount of red blood cells (RBCs) or hemoglobin in the blood or a lowered ability of the blood to carry oxygen.
simple_sent: Anemia, also spelled anemia and sometimes erythrocytopenia, is a condition in which the blood does not have enough red blood cells (RBCs). The blood does not have enough hemoglobin, either.

ori_sentence: Milk is a nutrient-rich liquid food produced by the mammary glands of mammals.
simple_sent: Milk is a liquid food. It is made by the mammary glands of mammals.

ori_sentence: The ear is the organ that enables hearing and, in mammals, balance.
simple_sent: The ear is an important organ in mammals. It helps mammals hear.

ori_sentence: The human penis is an external male intromittent organ that additionally serves as the urinal duct.
simple_sent: The human penis is an external male organ. It is usually called the "penis" in English.

ori_sentence: The lungs are the primary organs of the respiratory system in humans and most other animals including a few fish, and some snails.
simple_sent: In humans and most other animals, the lungs are the main organs of the respiratory system. A few fish and some snails have lungs.

ori_sentence: The respiratory system (also respiratory apparatus, ventilatory system) is a biological system consisting of specific organs and structures used for gas exchange in animals and plants.
simple_sent: The respiratory system (also called the respiratory apparatus or ventilatory system) is the part of the body that moves air from one place to another.

ori_sentence: The sternum or breastbone is a long flat bone located in the central part of the chest.
simple_sent: The sternum is a long flat bone in the chest. It is also called the breastbone.

ori_sentence: In biology, the classical doctrine of the nervous system determines that it is a highly complex part of an animal that coordinates its actions and sensory information by transmitting signals to and from different parts of its body.
simple_sent: In biology, the nervous system is a very important part of an animal's body. It helps the animal to move its body and to feel things around it. It does this by sending signals to and from different parts of its body.

ori_sentence: Testicle or testis (plural testes) is the male reproductive gland or gonad in all animals, including humans.
simple_sent: The testicles or testis (plural testes) are the parts of a man's body that he uses to have sex.

ori_sentence: Blue cone monochromacy (BCM) is an inherited eye disease that causes severely impaired color discrimination, low vision, nystagmus and photophobia due to the absence of functionality of red (L) and green (M) cone photoreceptor cells in the retina.
simple_sent: Blue cone monochromacy (BCM) is an eye disease that causes poor color discrimination. This is because the red (L) and green (M) cone photoreceptor cells in the retina can not do their job, and people who have this disease have poor vision.

ori_sentence: Donath–Landsteiner hemolytic anemia (DLHA) is a result of cold-reacting antibody immunoglobulin (Ig) induced hemolytic response inside vessels leading to anemia and, thus, a cold antibody autoimmune hemolytic anemias (CAAHA).
simple_sent: Donath-Landsteiner hemolytic anemia (DLHA) is a disease. It is caused by a cold-reacting immunoglobulin (Ig) response inside blood vessels. This causes the body to make too much hemoglobin.

ori_sentence: Nutmeg oil is a volatile essential oil from nutmeg (Myristica fragrans).
simple_sent: Nutmeg oil is an important oil. It comes from the nutmeg plant.

ori_sentence: Glutaminase deficiency is a rare genetic disorder that presents in childhood.
simple_sent: Glutaminase deficiency is a rare disease. It usually starts in childhood.

ori_sentence: Acral myxoinflammatory
simple_sent: Myxo inflammatory disease

ori_sentence: Eustachian tube dysfunction (ETD) is defined as pressure abnormalities in the middle ear which result in symptoms.
simple_sent: Eustachian tube dysfunction (ETD) happens when the pressure in the middle ear is too high or too low.

ori_sentence: Truncal ataxia (or trunk ataxia) is a wide-based "drunken sailor" gait characterised by uncertain starts and stops, lateral deviations and unequal steps.
simple_sent: Truncal ataxia (or trunk ataxia) is a type of walking that looks like a drunk sailor. It has no clear starts and stops, and can be very slow.

ori_sentence: Semen, also known as seminal fluid, is an organic fluid created to contain spermatozoa.
simple_sent: Semen (also called seminal fluid) is a fluid in the human body. It is made up of sperm.

ori_sentence: Nifedipine, sold under the brand name Adalat among others, is a calcium channel blocker medication used to manage angina, high blood pressure, Raynaud's phenomenon, and premature labor.
simple_sent: Nifedipine (also known as Adalat) is a calcium channel blocker medication. It is used to control high blood pressure, Raynaud's syndrome, and premature labor.

ori_sentence: Rabies is a viral disease that causes inflammation of the brain in humans and other mammals.
simple_sent: Rabies is a disease. In humans and other mammals, it causes inflammation of the brain.

ori_sentence: A mitochondrion (/ˌmaɪtəˈkɒndriən/; pl. mitochondria) is a double-membrane-bound organelle found in most eukaryotic organisms.
simple_sent: A mitochondrion is a double-membrane organelle in most eukaryotic organisms. It is also called a mitochondrion.

ori_sentence: A dog bite is a bite upon a person or other animal by a dog, including from a rabid dog.
simple_sent: A dog bite is a bite by a dog on a person. It can also happen when the dog is drunk.

ori_sentence: Schizophrenia is a mental disorder characterized by continuous or relapsing episodes of psychosis.
simple_sent: Schizophrenia is a mental disorder. People who have it often have episodes of psychosis.

ori_sentence: A stress fracture is a fatigue-induced bone fracture caused by repeated stress over time.
simple_sent: A stress fracture is a fracture of the bone. It happens when there is too much stress.

ori_sentence: Hyperuricaemia or hyperuricemia is an abnormally high level of uric acid in the blood.
simple_sent: Hyperuricaemia is when the level of uric acid in the blood is too high.

ori_sentence: Halothane, sold under the brand name Fluothane among others, is a general anaesthetic.
simple_sent: Halothane, also known as Fluothane, is a general anesthetic drug.

ori_sentence: Cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) is a clear, colorless body fluid found within the tissue that surrounds the brain and spinal cord of all vertebrates.
simple_sent: Cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) is a clear, colorless fluid. It is found in the brain and spinal cord of all vertebrates and is very important.

ori_sentence: Epiploic appendagitis (EA) is an uncommon, benign, self-limiting inflammatory process of the epiploic appendices.
simple_sent: Eppiploic appendagitis is an inflammation of the epiploic appendices. It is not common, and it is self-limiting.

ori_sentence: Major depressive disorder (MDD), also known simply as depression, is a mental disorder characterized by at least two weeks of pervasive low mood, low self-esteem, and loss of interest or pleasure in normally enjoyable activities.
simple_sent: Major depressive disorder (MDD), also known simply as depression, is a mental illness. People who have this disorder usually have a low mood for at least two weeks, and they also have low self-esteem.

ori_sentence: Cocaine (from French: cocaïne, from Spanish: coca, ultimately from Quechua: kúka) is a tropane alkaloid and stimulant drug obtained primarily from the leaves of two coca species native to South America, Erythroxylum coca and Erythroxylum novogranatense.
simple_sent: Cocaine (from French: cocaïne, from Spanish: coca, ultimately from Quechua: kúka) is a drug that is made from the leaves of the plant Erythroxylum coca. There are two species of Erythroxylum: coca and novogranatense.

ori_sentence: Chickenpox, also known as varicella, is a highly contagious disease caused by the initial infection with varicella zoster virus (VZV).
simple_sent: Chickenpox, also known as varicella, is a disease. The virus that causes it is called varicella zoster virus (VZV).

ori_sentence: The western blot (sometimes called the protein immunoblot), or western blotting, is a widely used analytical technique in molecular biology and immunogenetics to detect specific proteins in a sample of tissue homogenate or extract.
simple_sent: The western blot (sometimes called the protein immunoblot), or western blotting, is a way to test for certain proteins in a sample of tissue. It is used in molecular biology and immunogenetics.

ori_sentence: A diabetic foot is any pathology that results directly from peripheral arterial disease (PAD)
simple_sent: A diabetic foot is a foot disease. It is caused by a disease called peripheral arterial disease.

ori_sentence: Syphilis is a sexually transmitted infection caused by the bacterium Treponema pallidum subspecies pallidum.
simple_sent: Syphilis is a disease. It is caused by a bacterium, Treponema pallidum, and is a sexually transmitted disease.

ori_sentence: Hemorrhoids (or haemorrhoids), also known as piles, are vascular structures in the anal canal.
simple_sent: Hemorrhoids (or haemorrhoids) are a problem with the anus. They are also known as piles.

ori_sentence: A neuron or nerve cell is an electrically excitable cell that communicates with other cells via specialized connections called synapses.
simple_sent: A neuron or nerve cell is a special cell in the human body. It can talk to other cells through special connections called synapses.

ori_sentence: The central nervous system (CNS) is the part of the nervous system consisting primarily of the brain and spinal cord.
simple_sent: The central nervous system (CNS) is the part of the nervous system that controls movement and health.

ori_sentence: Urea, also known as carbamide, is an organic compound with chemical formula CO(NH2)2.
simple_sent: Urea is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is CO(NH2)2. It is also called carbamide.

ori_sentence: Fever, also referred to as pyrexia, is defined as having a temperature above the normal range due to an increase in the body's temperature set point.
simple_sent: Fever, also called pyrexia, is when the body's temperature is higher than it should be. This is because the body is too warm.

ori_sentence: Anal stricture or anal stenosis is a narrowing of the anal canal.
simple_sent: Anal stricture is when the anal canal is very narrow.

ori_sentence: Vanillin is an organic compound with the molecular formula C8H8O3.
simple_sent: Vanillin is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is C8H8O3.

ori_sentence: Exhibitionism is the act of exposing in a public or semi-public context one's intimate parts – for example, the breasts, genitals or buttocks.
simple_sent: Exhibitionism is the act of showing one's most private parts in public. This can include the breasts, the genitals, or the buttocks.

ori_sentence: Swine influenza is an infection caused by any one of several types of swine influenza viruses.
simple_sent: Swine influenza is a disease. There are many different types of swine influenza virus.

ori_sentence: Autism is a neurodevelopmental disorder characterized by difficulties with social interaction and communication, and by restricted and repetitive behavior.
simple_sent: Autism is a neurodevelopmental disorder. People with autism have problems with social interaction, communication, and learning.

ori_sentence: In human anatomy, the forehead is an area of the head bounded by three features, two of the skull and one of the scalp.
simple_sent: In human anatomy, the forehead is an area of the head where the two main parts of the skull meet.

ori_sentence: Allergies, also known as allergic diseases, are a number of conditions caused by hypersensitivity of the immune system to typically harmless substances in the environment.
simple_sent: Allergies, also known as allergic diseases, are conditions in which the body's immune system is not able to fight off certain things, usually harmless.

ori_sentence: Cholesterol is any of a class of certain organic molecules.
simple_sent: Cholesterol is a type of organic chemical compound.

ori_sentence: The basement membrane is a thin, pliable sheet-like type of extracellular matrix, that provides cell and tissue support and acts as a platform for complex signalling.
simple_sent: The basement membrane is a thin, pliable sheet-like type of extracellular matrix in cells. It supports cells and gives tissue support.

ori_sentence: The hippocampus (via Latin from Greek ἱππόκαμπος, 'seahorse') is a major component of the brain of humans and other vertebrates.
simple_sent: The hippocampus is a part of the brain. In humans and other vertebrates, it is the largest part of the brain.

ori_sentence: Acetone, or propanone, is an organic compound with the formula (CH3)2CO.
simple_sent: Acetone is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is (CH3)2CO.

ori_sentence: Diarrhea, also spelled diarrhoea, is the condition of having at least three loose, liquid, or watery bowel movements each day.
simple_sent: Diarrhea, also called diarrhoea, is when a person has at least three bowel movements in a day that are not normal.

ori_sentence: Progesterone (P4) is an endogenous steroid and progestogen sex hormone involved in the menstrual cycle, pregnancy, and embryogenesis of humans and other species.
simple_sent: Progesterone (P4) is a sex hormone. It plays a role in the menstrual cycle, pregnancy, and in the development of the human body.

ori_sentence: Autoimmune hemolytic anemia (AIHA) occurs when antibodies directed against the person's own red blood cells (RBCs) cause them to burst (lyse), leading to an insufficient number of oxygen-carrying red blood cells in the circulation.
simple_sent: Autoimmune hemolytic anemia (AIHA) happens when the body's own red blood cells (RBCs) stop working properly. This means there are not enough red blood cells to carry oxygen around in the body.

ori_sentence: Impetigo is a bacterial infection that involves the superficial skin.
simple_sent: Impetigo is an infection of the skin. It is a bacterial infection.

ori_sentence: Leukemia (also spelled leukaemia and pronounced /luːˈkiːmiːə/ loo-KEE-mee-ə), is a group of blood cancers that usually begin in the bone marrow and result in high numbers of abnormal blood cells.
simple_sent: Leukemia (also spelled leukaemia and pronounced /luːˈkiːmiːə/ loo-KEE-mee-ə) is a cancer of the blood. People who have the disease will have a high number of abnormal blood cells.

ori_sentence: An antibiotic is a type of antimicrobial substance active against bacteria.
simple_sent: An antibiotic is a drug that helps to stop bacteria from growing.

ori_sentence: The xiphoid process /ˈzaɪfɔɪd/, or xiphisternum or metasternum, is a small cartilaginous process (extension) of the inferior (lower) part of the sternum, which is usually ossified in the adult human.
simple_sent: The xiphoid process (also called xiphisternum or metasternum) is a part of the sternum. It is a small cartilaginous process (extension) of the lower part of the sternum.

ori_sentence: Miliary tuberculosis is a form of tuberculosis that is characterized by a wide dissemination into the human body and by the tiny size of the lesions (1–5 mm).
simple_sent: Miliary tuberculosis is different from other forms of tuberculosis because the small size of the lesions (1-5 mm) are all over the human body.

ori_sentence: Intermittent explosive disorder (sometimes abbreviated as IED) is a behavioral disorder characterized by explosive outbursts of anger and/or violence, often to the point of rage, that are disproportionate to the situation at hand (e.g., impulsive shouting, screaming or excessive reprimanding triggered by relatively inconsequential events).
simple_sent: Intermittent explosive disorder (sometimes called IED) is a behavioral disorder. People who have this disorder often have outbursts of anger and/or violence, often to the point of rage, that are disproportionate to the situation at hand (e.g. shouting, screaming, or hitting someone).

ori_sentence: A cough is a sudden expulsion of air through the large breathing passages that can help clear them of fluids, irritants, foreign particles and microbes.
simple_sent: Coughing out air through the large breathing passages helps to clear the body of foreign particles, fluids, and other things from the body.

ori_sentence: The human shoulder is made up of three bones: the clavicle (collarbone), the scapula (shoulder blade), and the humerus (upper arm bone) as well as associated muscles, ligaments and tendons.
simple_sent: The shoulder is made up of three bones: the clavicle (collarbone), the scapula (shoulder blade), and the humerus (upper arm bone). All of these bones are joined together by muscles.

ori_sentence: The face is the front of an animal's head that features three of the head's sense organs, the eyes, nose, and mouth, and through which animals express many of their emotions.
simple_sent: The face is the front part of an animal's head. It has the eyes, the nose, and the mouth. The face is where the animals feel and show their emotions.

ori_sentence: A head is the part of an organism which usually includes the ears, brain, forehead, cheeks, chin, eyes, nose, and mouth, each of which aid in various sensory functions such as sight, hearing, smell, and taste, respectively.
simple_sent: A head is the part of an organism which includes the ears, brain, forehead, cheeks, chin, eyes, nose, and mouth. The parts of the head that help people to feel things are the ears, brain, eyes, nose, and taste.

ori_sentence: Connective tissue is one of the four basic types of animal tissue, along with epithelial tissue, muscle tissue, and nervous tissue.
simple_sent: Connective tissue is a type of tissue. It is the second most important tissue in the body after muscle tissue.

ori_sentence: Tropicamide, sold under the brand name Mydriacyl among others, is a medication used to dilate the pupil and help with examination of the eye.
simple_sent: Tropicamide (also known as Mydriacyl) is a medication. It is used to make the pupil of the eye bigger so that it can see better.

ori_sentence: Pulmonary fibrosis is a condition in which the lungs become scarred over time.
simple_sent: Pulmonary fibrosis is a disease that affects the lungs over time.

ori_sentence: Eosinophilic pneumonia is a disease in which an eosinophil, a type of white blood cell, accumulates in the lungs.
simple_sent: Eosinophilic pneumonia is a disease. In it, white blood cells (called eosinophils) build up in the lungs.

ori_sentence: In the United States, a state is a constituent political entity, of which there are currently 50.
simple_sent: In the United States, a state is a political place. There are currently 50 states in the United States.

ori_sentence: Primary progressive aphasia (PPA) is a type of neurological syndrome in which language capabilities slowly and progressively become impaired.
simple_sent: Primary progressive aphasia (PPA) is a condition. In it, the person's language skills gradually become less and less good.

ori_sentence: Semantic dementia (SD), also known as semantic variant primary progressive aphasia (svPPA), is a progressive neurodegenerative disorder characterized by loss of semantic memory in both the verbal and non-verbal domains.
simple_sent: Semantic dementia (SD), also known as semantic variant primary progressive aphasia (svPPA), is a disease where the brain loses the ability to remember words. It happens over time.

ori_sentence: The clavicle, or collarbone, is a slender, S-shaped long bone approximately 6 inches (15 cm) long that serves as a strut between the shoulder blade and the sternum (breastbone).
simple_sent: The clavicle is a long bone in the shoulder. It is about 6 inches (15 cm) long. The clavicle is between the shoulder blade and the sternum (breastbone).

ori_sentence: The ethmoid bone (/ˈɛθmɔɪd/; from Greek ethmos, "sieve") is an unpaired bone in the skull that separates the nasal cavity from the brain.
simple_sent: The ethmoid bone is a bone in the skull. It separates the nasal cavity from the brain. The name comes from the Greek ethmos, "sieve".

ori_sentence: Hypothyroidism (also called underactive thyroid, low thyroid or hypothyreosis) is a disorder of the endocrine system in which the thyroid gland does not produce enough thyroid hormone.
simple_sent: Hypothyroidism (also called low thyroid or underactive thyroid) is when the thyroid gland does not make enough thyroid hormone. This is called hypothyreosis.

ori_sentence: The foot (plural: feet) is an anatomical structure found in many vertebrates.
simple_sent: The foot (plural: feet) is the body part that people walk on.

ori_sentence: Aspirin, also known as acetylsalicylic acid (ASA), is a medication used to reduce pain, fever, or inflammation.
simple_sent: Aspirin, also known as acetylsalicylic acid (ASA), is a drug that helps to reduce pain and other problems.

ori_sentence: Parathyroid carcinoma is a rare cancer resulting in parathyroid adenoma to carcinoma progression.
simple_sent: Parathyroid adenoma is a cancer of the parathyroid glands. It is a rare cancer.

ori_sentence: Calcium carbonate is a chemical compound with the formula CaCO3.
simple_sent: Its chemical formula is CaCO3. It has calcium and carbonate ions.

ori_sentence: Telogen effluvium is a scalp disorder characterized by the thinning or shedding of hair resulting from the early entry of hair in the telogen phase (the resting phase of the hair follicle).
simple_sent: Telogen effluvium is a condition of the scalp. It causes hair to fall out because the hair follicle in the telogen phase (when the hair is growing) is too young.

ori_sentence: The hyoid bone (lingual bone or tongue-bone) (/ˈhaɪɔɪd/) is a horseshoe-shaped bone situated in the anterior midline of the neck between the chin and the thyroid cartilage.
simple_sent: The hyoid bone is a bone in the neck. It is a horseshoe-shaped bone. The hyoid bone is between the chin and the thyroid cartilage in the front of the neck.

ori_sentence: In anatomy, the scapula (plural scapulae or scapulas), also known as the shoulder bone, shoulder blade, wing bone, speal bone or blade bone, is the bone that connects the humerus (upper arm bone) with the clavicle (collar bone).
simple_sent: The scapula (plural scapulae or scapulas) is a bone in the upper arm. It is the main bone that connects the humerus (upper arm bone) with the clavicle (collar bone). It is also called the shoulder bone.

ori_sentence: Intraocular lens (IOL) is a lens implanted in the eye as part of a treatment for cataracts or myopia.
simple_sent: Intraocular lens (IOL) is a lens that is put into the eye. It is used to help with myopia.

ori_sentence: Irritability is the excitatory ability that living organisms have to respond to changes in their environment.
simple_sent: Irritability is the ability that living things have to make changes in their environment exciting.

ori_sentence: Progressive nonfluent aphasia (PNFA) is one of three clinical syndromes associated with frontotemporal lobar degeneration.
simple_sent: Progressive nonfluent aphasia (PNFA) is a disease. It happens to people who have frontotemporal lobar degeneration.

ori_sentence: Bermuda (/bərˈmjuːdə/; historically known as the Bermudas or Somers Isles) is a British Overseas Territory in the North Atlantic Ocean.
simple_sent: Bermuda is a territory of the United Kingdom. It was originally called the Bermudas or Somers Isles and was a British colony.

ori_sentence: In mathematics and statistics, the arithmetic mean ( /ˌærɪθˈmɛtɪk ˈmiːn/, stress on first and third syllables of "arithmetic"), or simply the mean or the average
simple_sent: In mathematics and statistics, the arithmetic mean (or simply mean) is the number that shows how many things are the same or how many things are different.

ori_sentence: Metformin, sold under the brand name Glucophage among others, is the first-line medication for the treatment of type 2 diabetes, particularly in people who are overweight.
simple_sent: Metformin, sold under the brand name Glucophage among others, is a drug that helps people with type 2 diabetes control their blood sugar.

ori_sentence: Xylometazoline, also spelled xylomethazoline, is a medication used to reduce symptoms of nasal congestion, allergic rhinitis, and sinusitis.
simple_sent: Xylometazoline (also known as xylomethazoline) is a medication. It is used to reduce the symptoms of allergic rhinitis.

ori_sentence: Chancroid (/ˈʃæŋkrɔɪd/ SHANG-kroyd) is a bacterial sexually transmitted infection characterized by painful sores on the genitalia.
simple_sent: Chancroid is a bacterial sexually transmitted infection. People who have the infection will have painful sores on their genitalia.

ori_sentence: The auditory cortex is the part of the temporal lobe that processes auditory information in humans and many other vertebrates.
simple_sent: The auditory cortex is the part of the brain that deals with hearing. It is located in the temporal lobe.

ori_sentence: Hair is a protein filament that grows from follicles found in the dermis.
simple_sent: Hair is a protein filament that grows in the human body.

ori_sentence: The motor cortex is the region of the cerebral cortex involved in the planning, control, and execution of voluntary movements.
simple_sent: The motor cortex is the part of the brain that controls voluntary movements. It is located in the cerebral cortex.

ori_sentence: Dengue fever is a mosquito-borne tropical disease caused by the dengue virus.
simple_sent: Dengue fever is a disease. The disease is caused by a virus called dengue.

ori_sentence: A staphylococcal infection or staph infection is an infection caused by members of the Staphylococcus genus of bacteria.
simple_sent: A staphylococcal infection or staph infection is a disease. Staphylococcus is a genus of bacteria.

ori_sentence: Toothpaste is a paste or gel dentifrice used with a toothbrush to clean and maintain the aesthetics and health of teeth.
simple_sent: Toothpaste is a paste that is put on a toothbrush to clean the teeth. It also helps to keep the teeth healthy.

ori_sentence: Miscarriage, also known in medical terms as a spontaneous abortion and pregnancy loss, is the natural loss of an embryo or fetus before it is able to survive independently.
simple_sent: Miscarriage, also called spontaneous abortion and pregnancy loss, is when an embryo or fetus does not make it through the first trimester of pregnancy.

ori_sentence: Headache is the symptom of pain in the face, head, or neck.
simple_sent: A headache is a feeling of pain in the head or face.

ori_sentence: A hand is a prehensile, multi-fingered appendage located at the end of the forearm or forelimb of primates such as humans, chimpanzees, monkeys, and lemurs.
simple_sent: A hand is a prehensile, multi-fingered part of the body. It is usually found at the end of the forearm in humans, chimpanzees, and lemurs.

ori_sentence: The temporal bones are situated at the sides and base of the skull, and lateral to the temporal lobes of the cerebral cortex.
simple_sent: The temporal bones are located at the base of the skull. They are located near the top of the skull, at the sides.

ori_sentence: Leprosy, also known as Hansen's disease (HD), is a long-term infection by the bacteria Mycobacterium leprae or Mycobacterium lepromatosis.
simple_sent: Leprosy, also called Hansen's disease or lepromatosis, is a disease. It is caused by a bacteria called Mycobacterium leprae.

ori_sentence: Azathioprine (AZA), sold under the brand name Imuran, among others, is an immunosuppressive medication.
simple_sent: Azathioprine (also known as Imuran) is an immunosuppressive drug. It is sold under the name Imuran.

ori_sentence: In humans and other primates, the knee joins the thigh with the leg and consists of two joints: one between the femur and tibia (tibiofemoral joint), and one between the femur and patella (patellofemoral joint).
simple_sent: In humans, the knee joins the thigh with the leg. There are two main parts of the knee: the femur and the tibia. The femur and the tibia are joined together by a joint called the tibiofemoral joint.

ori_sentence: Red blood cells (RBCs), also referred to as red cells, red blood corpuscles (in humans or other animals not having nucleus in red blood cells), haematids, erythroid cells or erythrocytes (from Greek erythros for "red" and kytos for "hollow vessel", with -cyte translated as "cell" in modern usage), are the most common type of blood cell and the vertebrate's principal means of delivering oxygen (O2) to the body tissues—via blood flow through the circulatory system.
simple_sent: Red blood cells (RBCs), also referred to as red cells, red blood corpuscles (in humans or other animals not having nucleus in red blood cells), haematids, erythroid cells or erythrocytes (from Greek erythros for "red" and kytos for "hollow vessel"), are cells in the blood that transport oxygen from the inside of the body to the outside. Red blood cells are a very important part of the blood's circulatory system.

ori_sentence: Methanol, also known as methyl alcohol, amongst other names, is a chemical and the simplest alcohol, with the formula CH3OH (a methyl group linked to a hydroxyl group, often abbreviated MeOH).
simple_sent: Methanol, also known as methyl alcohol, is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is CH3OH. It contains a methyl group attached to a hydroxyl group.

ori_sentence: Tretinoin, also known as all-trans retinoic acid (ATRA), is medication used for the treatment of acne and acute promyelocytic leukemia.
simple_sent: Tretinoin, also known as all-trans retinoic acid (ATRA), is a chemical compound. It is a type of retinoic acid.

ori_sentence: Plummer–Vinson syndrome is a rare disease characterized by difficulty swallowing, iron-deficiency anemia, glossitis, cheilosis and esophageal webs.
simple_sent: Plummer-Vinson syndrome is a rare disease. People who have it have trouble swallowing, and they have glossitis, cheilosis, and esophageal webs.

ori_sentence: Sleep is a naturally recurring state of mind and body, characterized by altered consciousness, relatively inhibited sensory activity, reduced muscle activity and inhibition of nearly all voluntary muscles during rapid eye movement (REM) sleep, and reduced interactions with surroundings.
simple_sent: Sleep is a naturally recurring state of mind and body, characterized by reduced muscle activity and inhibition of nearly all voluntary muscles during rapid eye movement (REM) sleep and increased activity of the central nervous system during REM sleep.

ori_sentence: Bronchiectasis is a disease in which there is permanent enlargement of parts of the airways of the lung.
simple_sent: Bronchiectasis is a disease where the airways in the lung become bigger and bigger all the time.

ori_sentence: Obesity is a medical condition in which excess body fat has accumulated to an extent that it may have a negative effect on health.
simple_sent: Obesity is a medical condition where people get too much fat in their bodies. It can have a bad effect on their health.

ori_sentence: Synesthesia (American English) or synaesthesia (British English) is a perceptual phenomenon in which stimulation of one sensory or cognitive pathway leads to involuntary experiences in a second sensory or cognitive pathway.
simple_sent: Synesthesia (American English) or synaesthesia (British English) is a feeling or experience. When something is done to one part of the body, it causes another part of the body to feel something different.

ori_sentence: The occipital bone (/ˌɒkˈsɪpɪtəl/) is a cranial dermal bone and the main bone of the occiput (back and lower part of the skull).
simple_sent: The occipital bone is a bone in the skull. It is the main bone in the occiput, which is the lower part of the skull.

ori_sentence: The frontal bone is a bone in the human skull.
simple_sent: The top of the skull is called the frontal bone.

ori_sentence: The parietal bones (/pəˈraɪ.ɪtəl/) are two bones in the skull which, when joined together at a fibrous joint, form the sides and roof of the cranium.
simple_sent: The parietal bones are two bones in the skull. They form the sides and roof of the skull when they are joined together at a fibrous joint.

ori_sentence: The sphenoid bone is an unpaired bone of the neurocranium.
simple_sent: The sphenoid bone is the second largest bone in the skull.

ori_sentence: Hyperthyroidism is the condition that occurs due to excessive production of thyroid hormones by the thyroid gland.
simple_sent: Hyperthyroidism is when the thyroid gland makes too many hormones. This makes the body have problems.

ori_sentence: Doxorubicin, sold under the brand name Adriamycin among others, is a chemotherapy medication used to treat cancer.
simple_sent: Doxorubicin (also known as Adriamycin) is a chemotherapy drug. It is used to treat cancer.

ori_sentence: Frontotemporal dementia (FTD), or frontotemporal degeneration disease, or frontotemporal neurocognitive disorder, encompasses several types of dementia involving the frontal and temporal lobes.
simple_sent: Frontotemporal dementia (FTD), also called frontotemporal neurocognitive disorder, frontotemporal degeneration disease, or frontotemporal dementia, is a form of dementia.

ori_sentence: Transient global amnesia (TGA) is a neurological disorder whose key defining characteristic is a temporary but almost total disruption of short-term memory with a range of problems accessing older memories.
simple_sent: Transient global amnesia (TGA) is a disease. It is different from other diseases because it only affects short-term memory, and older memories are not affected as much.

ori_sentence: Visual agnosia is an impairment in recognition of visually presented objects.
simple_sent: Visual agnosia is a problem where it is hard to see things clearly.

ori_sentence: The adrenal cortex is the outer region and also the largest part of an adrenal gland.
simple_sent: The adrenal cortex is the largest part of the adrenal gland. It is the outer region.

ori_sentence: Brachycephaly (derived from the Ancient Greek βραχύς, "short" and κεφαλή, "head") is the shape of a skull shorter than typical for its species.
simple_sent: Brachycephaly is a condition in which the skull of an animal is shorter than it should be. The name comes from the Ancient Greek βραχύς, "short" and κεφαλή, "head".

ori_sentence: Rimantadine (INN, sold under the trade name Flumadine) is an orally administered antiviral drug used to treat, and in rare cases prevent, influenzavirus A infection.
simple_sent: Rimantadine (also known as Flumadine) is an antiviral drug that is taken orally. It is used to treat influenzavirus A infections.

ori_sentence: White blood cells (WBCs), also called leukocytes or leucocytes, are the cells of the immune system that are involved in protecting the body against both infectious disease and foreign invaders.
simple_sent: White blood cells (WBCs), also called leukocytes or leucocytes, are cells in the human body that help the body fight infection. They are also called immune cells.

ori_sentence: Epithelium /ˌɛpɪˈθiːliəm/ is one of the four basic types of animal tissue, along with connective tissue, muscle tissue and nervous tissue.
simple_sent: Epithelium is a type of tissue. It is one of the four basic types of tissue, the other three being muscle tissue, connective tissue and nervous tissue.

ori_sentence: Pleurisy, also known as pleuritis, is inflammation of the membranes that surround the lungs and line the chest cavity (pleurae).
simple_sent: Pleurisy, also known as pleuritis, is an infection of the lining of the chest (pleurae). This is called pleuritis.

ori_sentence: Caffeine is a central nervous system (CNS) stimulant of the methylxanthine class.
simple_sent: Caffeine is an important stimulant in the central nervous system.

ori_sentence: Nortriptyline, sold under the brand name Pamelor, among others, is a medication used to treat depression, neuropathic pain, attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD), smoking cessation and anxiety.
simple_sent: Nortriptyline (also known as Pamelor) is a prescription drug. It is used to treat depression, attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD), anxiety, and to stop smoking.

ori_sentence: Tetanus, also known as lockjaw, is a bacterial infection characterized by muscle spasms.
simple_sent: Tetanus (also called lockjaw) is a disease. It is a bacterial infection.

ori_sentence: Down syndrome or Down's syndrome, also known as trisomy 21, is a genetic disorder caused by the presence of all or part of a third copy of chromosome 21.
simple_sent: Down syndrome, also known as trisomy 21, is a genetic disorder. People with Down syndrome have either one or two extra copies of chromosome 21.

ori_sentence: Loxapine, sold under the brand names Loxitane and Adasuve (inhalation only) among others, is a typical antipsychotic medication used primarily in the treatment of schizophrenia.
simple_sent: Loxapine (also known as Loxitane and Adasuve) is an anti-psychotic drug. It is used to treat schizophrenia, which is a mental illness.

ori_sentence: The chief complaint, formally known as CC in the medical field, or termed presenting complaint (PC) in Europe and Canada, forms the second step of medical history taking.
simple_sent: The chief complaint, formally known as CC in the medical field, is the second step in taking a medical history. It is also called presenting complaint (PC).

ori_sentence: Pethidine, also known as meperidine and sold under the brand name Demerol among others, is a synthetic opioid pain medication of the phenylpiperidine class.
simple_sent: Pethidine (also known as meperidine and Demerol) is a pain-killer. It is a chemical compound, that is, a type of opioid drug.

ori_sentence: Benzyl alcohol is an aromatic alcohol with the formula C6H5CH2OH.
simple_sent: Benzyl alcohol is an alcohol. Its chemical formula is C6H5CH2OH.

ori_sentence: Meningitis is an acute inflammation of the protective membranes covering the brain and spinal cord, known collectively as the meninges.
simple_sent: Meningitis is an infection of the meninges. The meninges are the protective membranes that cover the brain and spinal cord.

ori_sentence: Thioridazine (Mellaril or Melleril) is a first generation antipsychotic drug belonging to the phenothiazine drug group and was previously widely used in the treatment of schizophrenia and psychosis.
simple_sent: Thioridazine (also known as Mellaril or Melleril) is an antipsychotic drug. It is a member of the phenothiazine group. It is used to treat schizophrenia and psychosis.

ori_sentence: Histamine is an organic nitrogenous compound involved in local immune responses, as well as regulating physiological function in the gut and acting as a neurotransmitter for the brain, spinal cord, and uterus.
simple_sent: Histamine is an organic nitrogenous compound that is important for local immune responses. It also helps the gut function, and it is important for the brain, spinal cord, and uterus.
