ori_sentence: The hamate bone (from Latin hamatus, "hooked"), or unciform bone (from Latin uncus, "hook"), Latin os hamatum and occasionally abbreviated as just hamatum, is a bone in the human wrist readily distinguishable by its wedge shape and a hook-like process ("hamulus") projecting from its palmar surface.
simple_sent: The hamate bone (from Latin hamatus, "hooked"), or unciform bone (from Latin uncus, "hook"), Latin os hamatum and sometimes called just hamatum, is a bone in the human wrist. It looks like a wedge with a hook-like process coming out of it and is covered with cartilage.

ori_sentence: An eyelid is a thin fold of skin that covers and protects an eye.
simple_sent: An eyelid is a fold of skin on the outside of the eye.

ori_sentence: Imipramine, sold under the brand name Tofranil, among others, is a tricyclic antidepressant (TCA) mainly used in the treatment of depression.
simple_sent: Imipramine (also known as Tofranil) is a tricyclic antidepressant. It is used to treat depression and other mental health problems.

ori_sentence: In vertebrates, the gallbladder, also known as the cholecyst, is a small hollow organ where bile is stored and concentrated before it is released into the small intestine.
simple_sent: In vertebrates, the gallbladder is a small hollow organ in the middle of the body. The bile in the gallbladder is released into the small intestine.

ori_sentence: An adverse drug reaction (ADR) is an injury caused by taking medication.
simple_sent: An adverse drug reaction (ADR) happens when a drug is taken.

ori_sentence: Progestogens, also sometimes written progestagens or gestagens, are a class of steroid hormones that bind to and activate the progesterone receptor (PR).
simple_sent: Progestogens, also called progestagens or gestagens, are steroid hormones. They bind to a receptor on the skin called the progesterone receptor.

ori_sentence: Lung cancer, also known as lung carcinoma, since about 98–99% of all lung cancers are carcinomas, is a malignant lung tumor characterized by uncontrolled cell growth in tissues of the lung.
simple_sent: Lung cancer, also known as lung carcinoma, is a cancer of the lung. About 98% of all lung cancers are cancer of the lung. When people get lung cancer, they get many problems.

ori_sentence: Xenotransplantation (xenos- from the Greek meaning "foreign" or strange), or heterologous transplant, is the transplantation of living cells, tissues or organs from one species to another.
simple_sent: Xenotransplantation (from the Greek word "xenos" which means " stranger" or "different") is when living cells or organs are taken from one species and given to another.

ori_sentence: Amitriptyline, sold under the brand name Elavil among , is a tricyclic antidepressant primarily used to treat major depressive disorder and a variety of pain syndromes from neuropathic pain to fibromyalgia to migraine and tension headaches.
simple_sent: Amitriptyline, sold under the brand name Elavil among others, is a tricyclic antidepressant that is used to treat major depressive disorder. It is also used to treat certain types of pain, such as fibromyalgia and migraine.

ori_sentence: Fluphenazine, sold under the brand names Prolixin among others, is a high-potency typical antipsychotic medication.
simple_sent: Fluphenazine, also known as Prolixin, is an anti-psychotic medication. It is sold under the brand name Prolixin.

ori_sentence: Ankylosing spondylitis (AS) is a type of arthritis in which there is a long-term inflammation of the joints of the spine.
simple_sent: Ankylosing spondylitis (AS) is a long-term condition in which the joints of the spine become inflamed.

ori_sentence: Plantar fasciitis is a disorder of the plantar fascia, which is the connective tissue which supports the arch of the foot.
simple_sent: Plantar fasciitis is a disease of the plantar fascia. The plantar fascia is the tissue that supports the foot.

ori_sentence: Ventricular tachycardia (V-tach or VT) is a fast heart rate arising from the lower chambers of the heart.
simple_sent: Ventricular tachycardia (also known as VT) is a heart rate problem. It is a fast heart rate.

ori_sentence: Paracetamol, also known as acetaminophen, is a medication used to treat fever and mild to moderate pain.
simple_sent: Paracetamol (also known as acetaminophen) is a pain medication. It is used to treat fever.

ori_sentence: The cheeks (Latin: buccae) constitute the area of the face below the eyes and between the nose and the left or right ear. "
simple_sent: The cheeks are the part of the face where people's eyes are. They are also the part of the face where their teeth are.

ori_sentence: An anxiolytic (/ˌæŋksiəˈlɪtɪk, ˌæŋksioʊ-/; also antipanic or antianxiety agent) is a medication or other intervention that reduces anxiety.
simple_sent: An anxiolytic (also called anti-anxiety agent, anti-anxiety drug, or antianxiety agent) is a medication that helps to reduce anxiety.

ori_sentence: Amoxapine, sold under the brand name Asendin among others, is a tricyclic antidepressant (TCAs).
simple_sent: Amoxapine (also known as Asendin) is an antidepressant drug. It is a tricyclic antidepressant.

ori_sentence: Clomipramine, sold under the brand name Anafranil among others, is a tricyclic antidepressant (TCA).
simple_sent: Clomipramine (also known as Anafranil and Clomipramine) is an antidepressant drug.

ori_sentence: Laryngopharyngeal reflux (LPR) is the retrograde flow of gastric contents into the larynx, oropharynx and/or the nasopharynx.
simple_sent: Laryngopharyngeal reflux (LPR) is when food goes backwards through the body. This happens in the larynx and oropharynx.

ori_sentence: Decompression sickness (abbreviated DCS; also called divers' disease, the bends, aerobullosis, and caisson disease) is a medical condition caused by dissolved gases emerging from solution as bubbles inside the body tissues during decompression.
simple_sent: Decompression sickness (abbreviated DCS; also called divers' disease, the bends, aerobullosis, and caisson disease) is a disease. It is caused by dissolved gases coming out of a solution and getting into the body.

ori_sentence: The unhappy triad, also known as a blown knee among other names, is an injury to the anterior cruciate ligament, medial collateral ligament, and meniscus.
simple_sent: The unhappy triad (also called a blown knee) is an injury to the meniscus and the anterior cruciate ligament in the knee.

ori_sentence: Electrical injury is a physiological reaction caused by electric current passing through the body.
simple_sent: Electrical injury is when an electric current goes through the body and makes things go wrong.

ori_sentence: An aspergilloma is a clump of mold which exists in a body cavity such as a paranasal sinus or an organ such as the lung.
simple_sent: An aspergilloma is a clump of mold. It is usually found in a body cavity, like the paranasal sinus or the lung.

ori_sentence: A luxating patella, sometimes called a trick knee, is a condition in which the patella, or kneecap, dislocates or moves out of its normal location.
simple_sent: A luxating patella is a condition in which the patella, or kneecap, moves out of its normal place. This is sometimes called a trick knee.

ori_sentence: Aberrant subclavian artery, or aberrant subclavian artery syndrome, is a rare anatomical variant of the origin of the right or left subclavian artery.
simple_sent: Aberrant subclavian artery syndrome is a rare condition. Usually, the right or left subclavian artery is affected, and the left is not.

ori_sentence: Complete androgen insensitivity syndrome (CAIS) is an AIS condition that results in the complete inability of the cell to respond to androgens.
simple_sent: Complete androgen insensitivity syndrome (CAIS) is an AIS condition. In this condition, the cell can not respond to androgens.

ori_sentence: Infantile acne is a form of acneiform eruption that occurs in infants from 6 weeks to 1 year of age.
simple_sent: Infantile acne happens in babies from 6 weeks to 1 year old. It is a form of acneiform eruption.

ori_sentence: Achilles tendon rupture is when the Achilles tendon, at the back of the ankle, breaks.
simple_sent: Achilles tendon disease is when the tendon at the back of the foot becomes damaged.

ori_sentence: Analgesic nephropathy is injury to the kidneys caused by analgesic medications such as aspirin, bucetin, phenacetin, and paracetamol.
simple_sent: Analgesic nephropathy is an injury to the kidneys. It can be caused by certain drugs, like paracetamol or aspirin.

ori_sentence: Oral mucocele (also mucous extravasation cyst, mucous cyst of the oral mucosa, and mucous retention and extravasation phenomena.) is a condition caused by two related phenomena: mucus extravasation phenomenon and mucous retention cyst.
simple_sent: Oral mucocele (also mucous extravasation cyst, mucous cyst of the oral mucosa, and mucous retention and extravasation phenomena) is a condition. It is caused by a cyst in the oral mucosa (where the teeth are).

ori_sentence: Bennett fracture is a fracture of the base of the first metacarpal bone which extends into the carpometacarpal (CMC) joint.
simple_sent: The first metacarpal bone is at the base of the hand. The second metacarpal bone is at the top of the hand.

ori_sentence: Noise pollution, also known as environmental noise or sound pollution, is the propagation of noise with ranging impacts on the activity of human or animal life, most of them harmful to a degree.
simple_sent: Noise pollution, also known as environmental noise or sound pollution, is when there is a lot of noise in a place. This noise can affect human and animal life in different ways.

ori_sentence: Gianotti–Crosti syndrome (/dʒəˈnɒti ˈkrɒsti/), also known as infantile papular acrodermatitis, papular acrodermatitis of childhood, and papulovesicular acrolocated syndrome, is a reaction of the skin to a viral infection.
simple_sent: Gianotti-Crosti syndrome, also known as infantile papular acrodermatitis, papular acrodermatitis of childhood, or papulovesicular acrolocated syndrome, is a condition of the skin.

ori_sentence: Paget–Schroetter disease (also known as venous thoracic outlet syndrome), is a form of upper extremity deep vein thrombosis (DVT), a medical condition in which blood clots form in the deep veins of the arms.
simple_sent: Paget-Schroetter disease (also known as venous thoracic outlet syndrome) is a disease that happens when blood clots form in the deep veins in the arms. It is a form of deep vein thrombosis.

ori_sentence: Saddle nose is a condition associated with nasal trauma, congenital syphilis, relapsing polychondritis, granulomatosis with polyangiitis, cocaine abuse, and leprosy, among other conditions.
simple_sent: Saddle nose is a condition that can be caused by trauma to the nose. It can also be caused by congenital syphilis, polychondritis, cocaine abuse, or leprosy.

ori_sentence: Thallium poisoning is poisoning due to thallium and its compounds which are often highly toxic.
simple_sent: Thallium poisoning is when thallium is in a person's blood. This is because of thallium.

ori_sentence: Neurosis is a class of functional mental disorders involving chronic distress, but neither delusions nor hallucinations.
simple_sent: Neurosis is a group of mental disorders. These people have problems all the time, but not always.

ori_sentence: Coenurosis, also known as caenurosis, coenuriasis, gid or sturdy, is a parasitic infection that develops in the intermediate hosts of some tapeworm species (Taenia multiceps, T. serialis, T. brauni, or T. glomerata).
simple_sent: Coenurosis, also known as caenurosis, coenuriasis, gid or sturdy, is a disease caused by a tapeworm (Taenia multiceps, T. serialis, T. brauni, or T. glomerata).

ori_sentence: Auditory processing disorder (APD), rarely known as King-Kopetzky syndrome or auditory disability with normal hearing (ADN), is a neurodevelopmental disorder affecting the way the brain processes auditory information.
simple_sent: Auditory processing disorder (APD), also known as King-Kopetzky syndrome or auditory disability with normal hearing (ADN), is a disorder that causes problems with the brain's ability to process sound.

ori_sentence: Benzodiazepine dependence defines a situation in which one has developed one or more of either tolerance, withdrawal symptoms, drug seeking behaviors, such as continued use despite harmful effects, and maladaptive pattern of substance use, according to the DSM-IV.
simple_sent: Benzodiazepine dependence means that a person has developed one or more of the following: tolerance (not wanting to give up), withdrawal symptoms, drug seeking behaviors, continued use despite harmful effects, and maladaptive pattern of substance use.

ori_sentence: A sprain, also known as a torn ligament, is the stretching or tearing of ligaments within a joint, often caused by an injury abruptly forcing the joint beyond its functional range of motion.
simple_sent: A sprain, also known as a torn ligament, is when ligaments within a joint get stretched out or torn. This usually happens when an injury happens suddenly.

ori_sentence: Necrophilia, also known as necrophilism, necrolagnia, necrocoitus, necrochlesis, and thanatophilia, is sexual attraction towards or a sexual act involving corpses.
simple_sent: Necrophilia, also known as thanatophilia or necrophilism, is a sexual interest in dead bodies. It can also be a sexual act with a corpse.

ori_sentence: Minamata disease is a neurological disease caused by severe mercury poisoning.
simple_sent: Minamata disease is a very bad disease. It is caused by mercury poisoning.

ori_sentence: Hyperinsulinism refers to an above normal level of insulin in the blood of a person or animal.
simple_sent: Hyperinsulinism is when a person or animal has more insulin in their blood than is normal.

ori_sentence: Oropouche fever is a tropical viral infection transmitted by biting midges and mosquitoes from the blood of sloths to humans.
simple_sent: Oropouche fever is a viral infection. It is spread from sloths to humans through contact with their blood.

ori_sentence: Nose-picking is the act of extracting nasal mucus with one's finger (rhinotillexis) and may include the subsequent ingestion of the extracted mucus (mucophagy).
simple_sent: Nose-picking is the act of taking out mucus from the nose with one's finger. It may also include taking some of the mucus to eat (mucophagy).

ori_sentence: Stokes–Adams syndrome or Adams–Stokes syndrome is a periodic fainting spell in which there is intermittent complete heart block or other high-grade arrhythmia that results in loss of spontaneous circulation and inadequate blood flow to the brain.
simple_sent: Stokes-Adams syndrome (also called Adams-Stokes syndrome or Adams-Stokes syndrome) is a medical condition. When a person has this syndrome, their heart stops working properly, and they get tired and faint.

ori_sentence: An aneurysm is an outward bulging, likened to a bubble or balloon, caused by a localized, abnormal, weak spot on a blood vessel wall.
simple_sent: An aneurysm looks like a bubble or balloon when it first appears. It is caused by a weak spot on the wall of a blood vessel.

ori_sentence: Nongonococcal urethritis (NGU) is an inflammation of the urethra that is not caused by gonorrheal infection.
simple_sent: Nongonococcal urethritis (NGU) is an infection of the urethra. It is not related to gonorrheal disease.

ori_sentence: Drowning is a type of suffocation induced by the submersion or immersion of the mouth and nose in a liquid.
simple_sent: Drowning is when the mouth and nose are put in a liquid, and the person can not breathe or move.

ori_sentence: Disorganized schizophrenia, or hebephrenia, was a subtype of schizophrenia prior to 2013.
simple_sent: Disorganized schizophrenia is a type of schizophrenia. Before 2013, it was called hebephrenia.

ori_sentence: Cementoblastoma, or benign cementoblastoma, is a relatively rare benign neoplasm of the cementum of the teeth.
simple_sent: Cementoblastoma, or benign cementoblastoma, is a cancer of the teeth. It is not very common.

ori_sentence: Freckles are clusters of concentrated melaninized cells which are most easily visible on people with a fair complexion.
simple_sent: Freckles are small areas of dark skin cells. They are most easily seen in people with a fair skin color.

ori_sentence: Heart failure (HF), also known as congestive heart failure (CHF) and (congestive) cardiac failure (CCF), is a set of manifestations caused by the failure of the heart's function as a pump supporting the blood flow through the body; its signs and symptoms result from a structural and/or functional abnormality of the heart, that disrupts its filling with blood or its ejecting of it during each heart beat.
simple_sent: Heart failure (HF), also known as congestive heart failure (CHF) and (congestive) cardiac failure (CCF), is a condition in which the heart can not pump blood well. The symptoms of heart failure are usually the same as those of other diseases, but in heart failure, the symptoms are usually more severe, and can last for a longer period of time.

ori_sentence: Homelessness is lacking stable and appropriate housing.
simple_sent: Homelessness does not have proper and stable housing.

ori_sentence: Growth hormone deficiency (GHD), or human growth hormone deficiency, is a medical condition resulting from not enough growth hormone (GH).
simple_sent: Growth hormone deficiency (GHD) is a medical condition. It happens when a person does not have enough growth hormone.

ori_sentence: Anosmia, also known as smell blindness, is the loss of the ability to detect one or more smells.
simple_sent: Anosmia (also called smell blindness) is when you can not smell anything at all.

ori_sentence: Emergence delirium is a condition in which emergence from general anesthesia is accompanied by psychomotor agitation.
simple_sent: Emergence delirium is a medical condition. People who have been under general anesthesia may become delirious.

ori_sentence: Coprophilia (from Greek κόπρος, kópros 'excrement' and φιλία, philía 'liking, fondness'), also called scatophilia or scat (Greek: σκατά, skatá 'feces'), is the paraphilia involving sexual arousal and pleasure from feces.
simple_sent: Coprophilia (from Greek, kópros 'excrement' and philía 'liking, fondness'), also called scatophilia or scat (Greek: skatá 'feces '), is a sexual interest in feces and the parts that come from it.

ori_sentence: Diaphragmatic rupture (also called diaphragmatic injury or tear) is a tear of the diaphragm, the muscle across the bottom of the ribcage that plays a crucial role in breathing.
simple_sent: A diaphragmatic tear (also called diaphragmatic injury or tear) is a tear of the diaphragm. The diaphragm is the part of the human body that controls breathing.

ori_sentence: Nephrogenic adenoma is a benign growth typically found in the urinary bladder.
simple_sent: Nephrogenic adenoma is a small growth in the urinary bladder.

ori_sentence: Basophilia is the condition of having greater than 200 basophils/
simple_sent: Basophilia is when people have more than 200 basophils.

ori_sentence: An assault is the act of inflicting physical harm or unwanted physical contact upon a person or, in some specific legal definitions, a threat or attempt to commit such an action.
simple_sent: An assault is when someone does physical harm to another person. It can also be when a person tries to hurt another person or when they try to do something to someone.

ori_sentence: A hip fracture is a break that occurs in the upper part of the femur (thigh bone).
simple_sent: A hip fracture happens when the upper part of the femur bone gets broken.

ori_sentence: Neonatal conjunctivitis is a form of conjunctivitis (inflammation of the outer eye) which affects newborn babies following birth.
simple_sent: Neonatal conjunctivitis is an infection of the eye. It usually starts after the baby is born and goes away after a few days.

ori_sentence: XX male syndrome, also known as de la Chapelle syndrome, is a rare congenital intersex condition in which an individual with a 46, XX karyotype (otherwise associated with females) has phenotypically male characteristics that can vary among cases.
simple_sent: XX male syndrome, also known as de la Chapelle syndrome, is a rare condition. A person with a 46, XX karyotype (otherwise called a female's karyotype) is born with a body of a man, but his mind is a woman's.

ori_sentence: Full trisomy 9 is a lethal chromosomal disorder caused by having three copies (trisomy) of chromosome number 9.
simple_sent: Full trisomy 9 is a life-threatening disease. It is caused by having three copies of the same chromosome.

ori_sentence: Oxygen toxicity is a condition resulting from the harmful effects of breathing molecular oxygen (O2) at increased partial pressures.
simple_sent: Oxygen toxicity is a condition. It happens when someone breathes in too much oxygen or when the pressure is too high.

ori_sentence: Psychomotor agitation is a symptom related to a spectrum of disorders characterized by unintentional and purposeless motions and restlessness, often but not always accompanied by emotional distress.
simple_sent: Psychomotor agitation is a symptom of many different disorders. People with it often do not know why they are doing it, and it is often not accompanied by emotional distress.

ori_sentence: Dhat syndrome (Sanskrit: धातु दोष, IAST: Dhātu doṣa) is a condition found in the cultures of South Asia (including Pakistan, India, Bangladesh, Nepal, and Sri Lanka) in which male patients report that they suffer from premature ejaculation or impotence, and believe that they are passing semen in their urine.
simple_sent: Dhat syndrome (Sanskrit: Dhat, IAST: Dhātu doṣa) is a condition that happens to many men in South Asia. The people who suffer from Dhat syndrome say that they have premature ejaculation or impotence, and that they think that they are passing semen in their urine.

ori_sentence: A hematoma, also spelled haematoma, or blood suffusion is a localized bleeding outside of blood vessels, due to either disease or trauma including injury or surgery and may involve blood continuing to seep from broken capillaries.
simple_sent: A hematoma, also spelled haematoma, or blood suffusion is bleeding outside of blood vessels. It can happen as a result of either disease or trauma, such as an injury or surgery.

ori_sentence: Terson syndrome or Terson's syndrome is the occurrence of a vitreous hemorrhage of the human eye in association with subarachnoid hemorrhage.
simple_sent: Terson syndrome or Terson's syndrome is when the human eye is affected by a hemorrhage. It is also called subarachnoid hemorrhage.

ori_sentence: Organic brain syndrome, also known as organic brain disease, organic brain disorder, organic mental syndrome, or organic mental disorder, refers to any syndrome or disorder of mental function whose cause is alleged to be known as organic (physiologic) rather than purely of the mind.
simple_sent: Organic brain syndrome, also known as organic brain disease, organic brain disorder, organic mental syndrome, or organic mental disorder, is when people say that their mind does not work the way it should, or that their mind is not working properly.

ori_sentence: Carbon monoxide poisoning typically occurs from breathing in carbon monoxide (CO) at excessive levels.
simple_sent: Carbon monoxide poisoning happens when people breathe in too much carbon monoxide.

ori_sentence: Transvestic fetishism is a psychiatric diagnosis applied to men who are thought to have an excessive sexual or erotic interest in cross-dressing; this interest is often expressed in autoerotic behavior.
simple_sent: Transvestic fetishism is a medical diagnosis. It is when men think that they have too much sexual or erotic interest in cross-dressing, or that it makes them sexually aroused.

ori_sentence: Chloracne is an acne-like eruption of blackheads, cysts, and pustules associated with exposure to certain halogenated aromatic compounds, such as chlorinated dioxins and dibenzofurans.
simple_sent: Chloracne is an acne-like eruption of blackheads, cysts, and pustules. People who have been exposed to chlorinated dioxins or dibenzofurans can get chloracne.

ori_sentence: Jet lag is a physiological condition that results from alterations to the body's circadian rhythms caused by rapid long-distance trans-meridian (east–west or west–east) travel.
simple_sent: Jet lag is a medical condition. It is caused by a change in the body's circadian rhythms when a person travels from one place to another very quickly.

ori_sentence: AV-nodal reentrant tachycardia (AVNRT) is a type of abnormal fast heart rhythm.
simple_sent: AV-nodal reentrant tachycardia is a heart rhythm that is not normal.

ori_sentence: An acute abdomen refers to a sudden, severe abdominal pain.
simple_sent: An acute abdomen is a very bad pain in the stomach.

ori_sentence: Bordetella bronchiseptica is a small, gram-negative, rod-shaped bacterium of the genus Bordetella.
simple_sent: Bordetella bronchiseptica is a bacterium. It is a small, rod-shaped, gram-negative bacterium.

ori_sentence: Yersinia enterocolitica is a Gram-negative, bacillus-shaped bacterium, belonging to the family Yersiniaceae.
simple_sent: Yersinia enterocolitica is a bacterium. It is a Gram-negative, bacillus-shaped bacterium.

ori_sentence: The Western equine encephalomyelitis virus is the causative agent of relatively uncommon viral disease
simple_sent: The Western equine encephalomyelitis virus causes this disease. It is not a common viral disease.

ori_sentence: Yersinia pseudotuberculosis is a Gram-negative bacterium that causes Far East scarlet-like fever in humans, who occasionally get infected zoonotically, most often through the food-borne route.
simple_sent: Yersinia pseudotuberculosis is a bacterium. It causes a scarlet-like fever in some people, called a Far East scarlet fever. This is because the bacterium is in food.

ori_sentence: Anisakis is a genus of parasitic nematodes that have life cycles involving fish and marine mammals.
simple_sent: Anisakis is a genus of nematodes. These nematodes live in the water and eat fish and mammals.

ori_sentence: Hypomania (literally "under mania" or "less than mania") is a mental and behavioural disorder, characterised essentially by an apparently non-contextual elevation of mood (euphoria) which contributes to persistently disinhibited behaviour.
simple_sent: Hypomania (literally "under mania" or "less than mania") is a mental and behavioural disorder. People who suffer from hypomania think that their mood is higher than it really is, and that this makes them act badly.

ori_sentence: Transient tachypnea of the newborn is a respiratory problem that can be seen in the newborn shortly after delivery.
simple_sent: Transient tachypnea of the newborn can be seen right after the baby is born. It is a respiratory problem.

ori_sentence: Enterotoxigenic Escherichia coli (ETEC) is a type of Escherichia coli and one of the leading bacterial causes of diarrhea in the developing world, as well as the most common cause of travelers' diarrhea.
simple_sent: Enterotoxigenic Escherichia coli (ETEC) is a type of Escherichia coli. It is the most common cause of diarrhea in the developing world, and one of the leading causes of food poisoning.

ori_sentence: Hospitalism (or anaclitic depression in its sublethal form) was a pediatric diagnosis used in the 1930s to describe infants who wasted away while in hospital.

simple_sent: Psychogenic pain is pain that is caused by things in the mind or body that are not physical.

simple_sent: Boutonniere deformity is a deformed position of the fingers or toes. This happens when the joint near the knuckle (the proximal interphalangeal joint, or PIP) is always bent toward the palm, while the joint farther away (the distal interphalangeal joint, or DIP) is always bent back away.

simple_sent: Pellucid marginal degeneration (PMD), also known as keratoconus, is a disease of the eye.

simple_sent: Panic attacks are sudden periods of intense fear and pain. They may include heart palpitations, sweating, chest pain, shortness of breath, shaking, numbness, or a feeling of not being able to breathe.

simple_sent: Blunt splenic trauma occurs when the spleen is badly injured. This can happen when the spleen is hit by a hard object, such as a car.

simple_sent: Renal agenesis is when one or both of the fetal kidneys do not develop properly. This is called unilateral.

ori_sentence: Raynaud syndrome, also known as Raynaud's phenomenon, eponymously named after the physician

ori_sentence: A cephalic presentation or head presentation or head-first presentation is a situation at childbirth where the fetus is in a longitudinal lie and the head enters the pelvis first; the most common form of cephalic presentation is the vertex presentation, where the occiput is the leading part (the part that first enters the birth canal).
simple_sent: A cephalic presentation (also called head presentation or head-first presentation) is when a baby's head is first in the pelvis when it is born. The most common form of cephalic presentation is when the baby's head is first in the pelvis when it is still in the mother's body.

simple_sent: Claude's syndrome is a form of brainstem stroke syndrome. People who have Claude's syndrome have an ipsilateral oculomotor nerve palsy, contralateral hemiparesis, contralateral ataxia, and contralateral hemiplegia.

simple_sent: Hyperventilation syndrome (HVS), also known as chronic hyperventilation syndrome (CHVS), dysfunctional breathing hyperventilation syndrome (DBS), and central neuronal hyper excitability syndrome (NHS), is a medical condition that causes the sufferer to breathe too quickly or too deep when they try to breathe.

simple_sent: Burping (also called belching and eructation) is when an animal lets out gas through its mouth. It is done through the esophagus and stomach.

simple_sent: Biliary pruritus is a disease of the liver. It is caused by a disease of the liver called obstructive jaundice.

ori_sentence: Cocaine intoxication refers to the subjective, desired and adverse effects of cocaine on the mind and behavior of users.
simple_sent: Cocaine intoxication means that a person takes too much of the drug. It also means the effects on the user's mind.

ori_sentence: Lentigo maligna is where melanocyte cells have become malignant and grow continuously along the stratum basale of the skin, but have not invaded below the epidermis.

simple_sent: Cigar cells are red blood cells that are shaped like a cigar. They are also called pencil cells because they look like a pencil.

ori_sentence: Heat syncope is fainting or dizziness as a result of overheating (syncope is the medical term for fainting).
simple_sent: Heat syncope is fainting because of too much heat. syncope is the medical term for fainting.

simple_sent: Intention tremor is a dyskinetic disorder. People with this disorder have a broad, coarse, and low frequency tremor that can be seen even when they are trying not to do something.

simple_sent: Capillariasis is a disease. It is caused by the nematode Capillaria philippinensis.

ori_sentence: External compression headache is caused by any type of headwear.

simple_sent: The most common type of transfusion reaction is a non-hemolytic transfusion reaction.

simple_sent: Factitial lymphedema (also known as "Hysterical edema") is a condition of the skin. It happens when an elastic bandage, cord, or shirt is wrapped around an extremity, such as the hand or foot.

simple_sent: Enteroinvasive Escherichia coli (EIEC) is a type of bacteria. The bacteria cause shigellosis, a disease where the person has bad diarrhea and a high fever.

simple_sent: American tick bite fever (also called Rickettsia parkeri infection) is a disease. It is caused by a bacterium called Rickettsia parkeri.

simple_sent: Amastia is a rare condition. In it, both breast tissue and nipple are not present.

simple_sent: Adult-onset immunodeficiency syndrome is a disease. People who have it are not healthy.

simple_sent: Nicorette is the brand name of a number of products that contain nicotine. These products are called NRT.

simple_sent: Anticonvulsant/sulfonamide hypersensitivity syndrome is a possible serious hypersensitivity reaction that can be seen with certain types of drugs. These drugs include: aromatic anticonvulsants (e.g. diphenylhydantoin, phenobarbital, phenytoin, carbamazepine, lamotrigine), sulfonamides, or other medications with an aromatic amine (e.g. procainamide).

simple_sent: Burning feet syndrome, also known as Grierson-Gopalan syndrome, is a medical condition. People who have the condition will experience burning and aching of the feet and a lot of sweating.

simple_sent: Post-concussion syndrome (PCS) is a set of symptoms after a concussion. These symptoms can last for weeks, months, or even a year after the injury.

simple_sent: Cerebellar stroke syndrome is a medical condition. In it, the blood can not get to the part of the brain called the cerebellum that controls voluntary movement, called the cerebellum.

simple_sent: Arterial embolism is when blood flow to an organ or body part is cut off because of a blood clot. The main type of embolus is a blood clot that sticks to the wall of an artery, stopping the flow of blood.

simple_sent: Cervarix is a human papillomavirus (HPV) vaccine. It is used to prevent cancer.

ori_sentence: Atypical facial pain (AFP) is a type of chronic facial pain which does not fulfill any other diagnosis.
simple_sent: Atypical facial pain (AFP) is a type of pain in the face that does not get better with time.

ori_sentence: Basopenia (or basocytopenia) is a form of agranulocytosis associated with a deficiency of basophils.

simple_sent: Basidiobolomycosis is a disease. It is caused by a fungus.

simple_sent: Battered woman syndrome (BWS) is a pattern of signs and symptoms. A woman who has been through a lot of violence from her male partner (whether physical, sexual, or psychological) will show these signs.

simple_sent: Autonomic dysreflexia (AD) is a medical emergency. People who have it usually have high blood pressure and bradycardia, but tachycardia can also happen.

ori_sentence: Intertrigo refers to a type of inflammatory rash (dermatitis) of the superficial skin that occurs within a person's body folds.
simple_sent: Intertrigo is a type of skin disease. It is a type of inflammation of the superficial skin, called dermatitis.

ori_sentence: Pulmonary aspiration is the entry of material such as pharyngeal secretions, food or drink, or stomach contents from the oropharynx or gastrointestinal tract, into the larynx (voice box) and lower respiratory tract, the portions of the respiratory system from the trachea (windpipe) to the lungs.
simple_sent: Pulmonary aspiration is the entry of material from the stomach or oropharynx into the lower respiratory tract. The lower respiratory tract is the part of the respiratory system that goes from the trachea (windpipe) to the lungs.

ori_sentence: Visual impairment, also known as vision impairment or vision loss, is a decreased ability to see to a degree that causes problems not fixable by usual means, such as glasses.
simple_sent: Visual impairment, also known as vision loss or vision loss, is when a person can not see as well as they used to. This can cause problems that can not be fixed.

simple_sent: Abnormal uterine bleeding (also known as atypical vaginal bleeding) is bleeding in the vagina that is not normal. It can also be called abnormal because the bleeding is not normal at all.

ori_sentence: Congenital distal spinal muscular atrophy is a hereditary condition characterized by muscle wasting (atrophy), particularly of distal muscles in legs and hands, and by early-onset contractures (permanent shortening of a muscle or joint) of the hip, knee, and ankle.
simple_sent: Congenital distal spinal muscular atrophy is a hereditary condition that causes the muscles in the legs and hands to get shorter. The muscles in the hip, knee, and ankle also get shorter, and this can cause problems when they walk or run.

ori_sentence: Congenital cataracts refers to a lens opacity which is present at birth.
simple_sent: Congenital cataracts: This condition happens when a child is born.

ori_sentence: Combined small cell lung carcinoma (or c-SCLC, and rarely rendered as "small-cell lung carcinoma") is a form of multiphasic lung cancer that is diagnosed by a pathologist when a malignant tumor arising from transformed cells originating in lung tissue contains a component of small cell lung carcinoma (SCLC) admixed with one (or more) components of non-small cell lung carcinoma (NSCLC).
simple_sent: Combined small cell lung carcinoma (or c-SCLC, and rarely rendered as "small-cell lung carcinoma") is a cancer of the lung. It is different from small cell lung carcinoma, which is only found in the small cells of the lung, and non-small cell lung carcinoma, which is only found in the large cells of the lung.
