simple_sent: Congenital dyserythropoietic anemia type IV (CDA IV) does not look like CDA II, but it also does not have the other symptoms.

ori_sentence: Congenital dyserythropoietic anemia type III
simple_sent: Dyserythropoietic anemia is a disease.

ori_sentence: The congenital melanocytic nevus is a type of melanocytic nevus (or mole) found in infants at birth.
simple_sent: The congenital melanocytic nevus (also called congenital melanocytic nevus) is a disease.

ori_sentence: Congenital stenosis of vena cava is a congenital anomaly in which the superior vena cava or inferior vena cava has an aberrant interruption or coarctation.
simple_sent: The two main types of vena cava in the human body are the superior vena cava and the inferior vena cava. The superior vena cava is larger.

ori_sentence: Conidiobolomycosis is a rare long-term fungal infection that is typically found just under the skin of the nose, sinuses, cheeks and upper lips.
simple_sent: Conidiobolomycosis is a very rare long-term fungal infection. It is usually found in the skin just under the nose and in the sinuses.

ori_sentence: Cornea plana 1 (CNA1) is an extremely rare congenital hereditary deformity of the eye surface, leading to severe decrease in corneal curvature.
simple_sent: Cornea plana 1 (CNA1) is a very rare condition. It is a deformity of the eye surface. Without it, the corneal curvature is reduced.

ori_sentence: Concrescence is a condition of teeth where the cementum overlying the roots of at least two teeth join together.
simple_sent: Concrescence is when the roots of at least two teeth join together (become one).

ori_sentence: Congenital fourth nerve palsy is a condition present at birth characterized by a vertical misalignment of the eyes due to a weakness or paralysis of the superior oblique muscle.
simple_sent: Congenital fourth nerve palsy is a condition in which the eyes are not straight at birth. This is because the superior oblique muscle is not strong enough to support them.

ori_sentence: A sprained ankle, also known as a twisted ankle, or rolled ankle is an injury where sprain occurs on one or more ligaments of the ankle.
simple_sent: A sprained ankle is an injury to the ankle. It can also be called a twisted ankle, a rolled ankle, or a sprained ankle.

ori_sentence: Complex partial status epilepticus (CPSE) is one of the non-convulsive forms of status epilepticus, a rare form of epilepsy defined by its recurrent nature.
simple_sent: Complex partial status epilepticus (CPSE) is a rare form of epilepsy. It is one of the non-convulsive forms of status epilepticus.

ori_sentence: Condensing osteitis is a periapical inflammatory disease that results from a reaction to a dental related infection.
simple_sent: Condensing osteitis is a periapical inflammatory disease. It is usually caused by a dental infection.

ori_sentence: Congenital dyserythropoietic anemia type II (CDA II), or hereditary erythroblastic multinuclearity with positive acidified serum lysis test (HEMPAS) is a rare genetic anemia in humans characterized by hereditary erythroblastic multinuclearity with positive acidified serum lysis test.
simple_sent: Congenital dyserythropoietic anemia type II (CDA II), hereditary erythroblastic multinuclearity with positive acidified serum lysis test (HEMPAS) and hereditary erythroblastic multinuclearity with positive acidified serum lysis test are all very rare.

ori_sentence: Hydroxyurea dermopathy is caused by chronic use of hydroxyurea for chronic myelogenous leukemia, thrombocytosis, or psoriasis, and presents with skin lesions characteristic of dermatomyositis.
simple_sent: Hydroxyurea dermopathy is caused by long-term use of hydroxyurea for psoriasis, chronic myelogenous leukemia, or thrombocytosis. People with hydroxyurea dermopathy have skin lesions.

ori_sentence: Convergence insufficiency is a sensory and neuromuscular anomaly of the binocular vision system, characterized by a reduced ability of the eyes to turn towards each other, or sustain convergence.
simple_sent: Convergence insufficiency is an abnormality of the binocular vision system. This means that the eyes can not turn towards each other, or stay in one place for long periods of time.

ori_sentence: An upper respiratory tract infection (URTI) is an illness caused by an acute infection, which involves the upper respiratory tract, including the nose, sinuses, pharynx, larynx or trachea.
simple_sent: An upper respiratory tract infection (URTI) is an infection of the upper respiratory tract. This includes the nose, the sinuses, the throat, the larynx, and the trachea.

ori_sentence: Hypnic headaches are benign primary headaches that affect the elderly, with an average age of onset at 63 ± 11 years.
simple_sent: Hypnic headaches are more common in older people. The average age when they start is 63 ± 11 years.

ori_sentence: Quadrantanopia, quadrantanopsia, refers to an anopia affecting a quarter of the field of vision.
simple_sent: Quadrantanopia: This condition affects a quarter of the vision. It is called quadrantanopsia.

ori_sentence: Proctalgia fugax, a variant of levator ani syndrome, is a severe, episodic pain in the regions of the rectum and anus.
simple_sent: Proctalgia fugax is a pain in the rectum and anus that does not go away after a while. It is like levator ani syndrome.

ori_sentence: Hyperchloremic acidosis is a form of metabolic acidosis associated with a normal anion gap, a decrease in plasma bicarbonate concentration, and an increase in plasma chloride concentration (see anion gap for a fuller explanation).
simple_sent: Hyperchloremic acidosis is a form of metabolic acidosis. When there is a normal anion gap, there is a lower concentration of bicarbonate in the blood, and a higher concentration of chloride in the blood.

ori_sentence: Intimate partner violence (IPV) is domestic violence by a current or former spouse or partner in an intimate relationship against the other spouse or partner.
simple_sent: Intimate partner violence (IPV) is when one partner uses violence against the other partner. It can happen at any time in a relationship.

ori_sentence: Hunner's ulcers or Hunner's lesions occur in 5 to 10 percent of people who have the bladder disease Interstitial cystitis.
simple_sent: Hunner's ulcers or Hunner's lesions are peptic ulcers in the urinary bladder. About 5 to 10 people get them every year.

ori_sentence: Hypercoagulability in pregnancy is the propensity of pregnant women to develop thrombosis (blood clots).
simple_sent: Hypercoagulability during pregnancy is when women get blood clots when they are pregnant.

ori_sentence: A Spitz nevus is a benign skin lesion.
simple_sent: Spitz nevus is a common skin disease.

ori_sentence: A lightning strike or lightning bolt is an electric discharge between the atmosphere and the ground.
simple_sent: When lightning strikes the ground, it makes an electric current go through the ground.

ori_sentence: Copper toxicity (or Copperiedus) is a type of metal poisoning caused by an excess of copper in the body.
simple_sent: Copper toxicity (or Copperiedus) is when copper in the body makes people sick because of it.

ori_sentence: Leukonychia (or leuconychia), is a medical term for white discolouration appearing on nails.
simple_sent: Leukonychia, or leuconychia, is a white discoloration on the nails of some people.

ori_sentence: Dysorthography is a specific dysgraphic disorder of spelling which accompanies dyslexia by a direct consequence of the phonological disorder.
simple_sent: Dysorthography is a special form of dyslexia. It is caused by the phonological disorder dyslexia, which makes spelling difficult.

ori_sentence: Stillbirth is typically defined as fetal death at or after 20 or 28 weeks of pregnancy, depending on the source.
simple_sent: Stillbirths usually happen during the 20th or 28th week of pregnancy, but they can happen during any time.

ori_sentence: Reticular erythematous mucinosis (REM) is a skin condition caused by fibroblasts producing abnormally large amounts of mucopolysaccharides.
simple_sent: Reticular erythematous mucinosis (REM) is a condition of the skin. It happens when fibroblasts make too much mucopolysaccharides.

ori_sentence: Plagiocephaly, also known as flat head syndrome, is a condition characterized by an asymmetrical distortion (flattening of one side) of the skull.
simple_sent: Plagiocephaly, also known as flat head syndrome, is a condition where one side of the skull is smaller than the other.

ori_sentence: Metatarsalgia, literally metatarsal pain and colloquially known as a stone bruise, is any painful foot condition affecting the metatarsal region of the foot.
simple_sent: Metatarsalgia, also called metatarsal pain or stone bruise, is a pain in the foot. It usually affects the metatarsal region of the foot.

ori_sentence: Gnathitis is jaw inflammation.
simple_sent: Gnathitis is a disease.

ori_sentence: Hypereosinophilic syndrome is a disease characterized by a persistently elevated eosinophil count (≥ 1500 eosinophils/mm³) in the blood for at least six months without any recognizable cause, with involvement of either the heart, nervous system, or bone marrow.
simple_sent: Hypereosinophilic syndrome is a disease. In it, the eosinophil count in the blood is very high for at least six months without any clear cause. The heart, nervous system, or bone marrow may be affected by the disease.

ori_sentence: Superior oblique myokymia is a neurological disorder affecting vision and was named by Hoyt and Keane in 1970.
simple_sent: Superior oblique myokymia is a disease. Hoyt and Keane found out about it in 1970, in Australia.

ori_sentence: A spider bite, also known as arachnidism, is an injury resulting from the bite of a spider.
simple_sent: A spider bite, also called arachnidism, is when a spider bites someone.

ori_sentence: Lacunar amnesia is the loss of memory about a specific event.
simple_sent: Lacunar amnesia is a memory loss, but not a temporary one.

ori_sentence: Alcohol-related brain damage alters both the structure and function of the brain as a result of the direct neurotoxic effects of alcohol intoxication or acute alcohol withdrawal.
simple_sent: Alcohol-related brain damage changes both the structure and function of the brain. The direct effects of alcohol on the brain are called neurotoxic effects.

ori_sentence: A vesicointestinal fistula (or intestinovesical fistula) is a form of fistula between the bladder and the bowel.
simple_sent: A vesicointestinal fistula (or intestinovesical fistula) is a fistula in the small intestine.

ori_sentence: Idiopathic giant-cell myocarditis (IGCM) is a cardiovascular disease of the muscle of the heart (myocardium).
simple_sent: Idiopathic giant-cell myocarditis (IGCM) is a disease. It causes problems with the heart muscle.

ori_sentence: An opioid overdose is toxicity due to excessive consumption of opioids, such as morphine, heroin, fentanyl, tramadol, and methadone.
simple_sent: An opioid overdose is when a person takes too many opioids. These include morphine, heroin, fentanyl, and tramadol.

ori_sentence: Homicidal ideation is a common medical term for thoughts about homicide.
simple_sent: Homicidal ideation is when a person thinks about killing themselves.

ori_sentence: Salivary gland hyperplasia is hyperplasia of the terminal duct of salivary glands.
simple_sent: Salivary gland hyperplasia is when the salivary glands are not working properly.

ori_sentence: Febrile infection-related epilepsy syndrome (FIRES) is an epilepsy syndrome in which (NORSE) is preceded by febrile illness 24 hours to 2 weeks prior to the onset of seizures.
simple_sent: Febrile infection-related epilepsy syndrome (FIRES) happens when a person has a bad infection 24 hours to 2 weeks before they have their first seizures.

ori_sentence: Neonatal hypoglycemia occurs when the neonate's blood glucose level is less than the newborn's body requirements for factors such as cellular energy and metabolism.
simple_sent: Neonatal hypoglycemia happens when the baby's blood glucose level is lower than what is normal. This means that the baby does not have enough energy.

ori_sentence: Excess skin is an effect of surplus skin and fat after expansion during pregnancy or adipositas and following a massive and considerable weight loss.
simple_sent: Excess skin is an effect of excess skin and fat after a significant weight loss and after expansion during pregnancy or adipositas.

ori_sentence: Cervical agenesis is a congenital disorder of the female genital system that manifests itself in the absence of a cervix, the connecting structure between the uterus and vagina.
simple_sent: Cervical agenesis is a condition in which a child is born without a cervix. The cervix is the part of the female body that connects the uterus to the vagina.

ori_sentence: Psychasthenia is a psychological disorder characterized by phobias, obsessions, compulsions, or excessive anxiety.
simple_sent: Psychasthenia is a mental disorder. People with it often have phobias, obsessions, or too much anxiety.

ori_sentence: Atypical hemolytic uremic syndrome (aHUS) is an extremely rare, life-threatening, progressive disease that frequently has a genetic component.
simple_sent: Atypical hemolytic uremic syndrome (aHUS) is a very rare disease. It is a life-threatening disease, and people who have it often die.

ori_sentence: Congenital malaria is an extremely rare condition which occurs due to transplacental transmission of maternal infection.
simple_sent: Congenital malaria is a very rare condition. It happens when a mother gets an infection during pregnancy.

ori_sentence: Locked twins is a rare complication of multiple pregnancy where two fetuses become interlocked during presentation before birth.
simple_sent: Locked twins is a very rare condition. In this case, two babies become interlocked (joined together) before birth.

ori_sentence: Osteochondritis is a painful type of osteochondrosis where the cartilage or bone in a joint is inflamed.
simple_sent: Osteochondritis is when the cartilage or bone in a joint becomes inflamed. It is a painful condition.

itemLabel: other specified feeding or eating disorder
ori_sentence: Other specified feeding or eating disorder (OSFED) is a DSM-5 category that, along with unspecified feeding or eating disorder (UFED), replaces the category formerly called eating disorder not otherwise specified (EDNOS) in the DSM-IV-TR.
simple_sent: Other specified feeding or eating disorder (OSFED) is a new group in the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders (DSM-5). It replaces the old eating disorder not otherwise specified (EDNOS).

ori_sentence: Aqueductal stenosis is a narrowing of the aqueduct of Sylvius which blocks the flow of cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) in the ventricular system.
simple_sent: Aqueductal stenosis is a blockage of the aqueduct of Sylvius. This blocks the flow of cerebrospinal fluid (CSF).

ori_sentence: Hyperprolinemia is a condition which occurs when the amino acid proline is not broken down properly by the enzymes proline oxidase or pyrroline-5-carboxylate dehydrogenase, causing a buildup of proline in the body.
simple_sent: Hyperprolinemia is when there is too much proline in the body. This happens when the enzyme proline oxidase or the enzyme pyrroline-5-carboxylate dehydrogenase do not work properly.

ori_sentence: Minor's disease, a syndrome involving the sudden onset of back pain and paralysis caused by haemorrhage into the spinal cord substance, was named after the Russian neurologist, Lazar Salomowitch Minor (1855–1942).
simple_sent: Minor's disease is a disease where people suddenly have back pain and can not move. The disease is named after a Russian neurologist, Lazar Salomowitch Minor (1855 â "1942), who discovered the disease.

ori_sentence: Haemophilus meningitis is a form of bacterial meningitis caused by the Haemophilus influenzae bacteria.
simple_sent: Haemophilus influenzae meningitis is the most common form of meningitis. It is a bacterial disease.

ori_sentence: Dysgeusia, also known as parageusia, is a distortion of the sense of taste.
simple_sent: Dysgeusia, also called parageusia, is a problem with taste.

ori_sentence: Vaginal adenosis is a benign abnormality in the vagina, commonly thought to be caused by intrauterine and neonatal exposure of diethylstilbestrol and other progestogens and nonsteroidal estrogens, however it has also been observed in otherwise healthy women and has been considered at times idiopathic or congenital.
simple_sent: Vaginal adenosis is a benign abnormality in the vagina. Most people think it is caused by exposure to diethylstilbestrol and other estrogens during pregnancy, but it has also been seen in otherwise healthy women, and has been thought to be either idiopathic or congenital.

ori_sentence: Salivary gland hypoplasia is relative underdevelopment of the Salivary glands.
simple_sent: Salivary gland hypoplasia is when the salivary glands are not working properly.

ori_sentence: Metaphyseal dysplasia, or Pyle disease, is a disorder of the bones.
simple_sent: Metaphyseal dysplasia is a bone disease. It is called Pyle disease.

ori_sentence: Mild androgen insensitivity syndrome (MAIS) is a condition that results in a mild impairment of the cell's ability to respond to androgens.
simple_sent: Mild androgen insensitivity syndrome (MAIS) is a condition. In it, the cells are not able to respond to androgens very well.

ori_sentence: Metastrongylosis is a parasitic disease that affects wild boars and pigs which live outdoors.
simple_sent: Metastrongylosis is a disease. It can be found in wild boars and pigs, especially in Europe.

ori_sentence: Human papillomavirus-positive oropharyngeal cancer (HPV-positive OPC or HPV+OPC), is a cancer (squamous cell carcinoma) of the throat caused by the human papillomavirus type 16 virus (HPV16).
simple_sent: Human papillomavirus-positive oropharyngeal cancer (HPV-positive OPC or HPV+OPC) is a cancer of the throat. The cause of oropharyngeal cancer is human papillomavirus type 16.

ori_sentence: Haber syndrome is a cutaneous disorder of hyperpigmentation characterized by reticulated pigmentation of the person's skin.
simple_sent: Haber syndrome is a cutaneous disorder. People with Haber syndrome have reticulated pigmentation on their skin.

ori_sentence: Dennie–Marfan syndrome is a syndrome in which there is association of spastic paraplegia of the lower limbs and mental retardation in children with congenital syphilis.
simple_sent: Dennie-Marfan syndrome is a disease. In people with Dennie-Marfan syndrome, the lower limbs of the body become shorter, and the mind becomes slower.

ori_sentence: Wernicke–Korsakoff syndrome (WKS) is the combined presence of Wernicke encephalopathy (WE) and Korsakoff syndrome.
simple_sent: Wernicke-Korsakoff syndrome (WKS) is a disease. It is caused by a mix of Wernicke syndrome and Korsakoff syndrome.

ori_sentence: Dental avulsion is the complete displacement of a tooth from its socket in alveolar bone owing to trauma.
simple_sent: Dental avulsion is when a tooth is moved from its socket in the alveolar bone because of trauma.

ori_sentence: Generalized granuloma annulare is a skin condition of unknown cause, tending to affect women in the fifth and sixth decades, presenting as a diffuse but symmetrical, papular or annular eruption of more than ten skin lesions, and often hundreds.
simple_sent: Generalized granuloma annulare is a skin condition that usually starts in women in their fifth or sixth decades. This condition has a symmetrical, papular or annular eruption of more than ten skin lesions, and often hundreds.

ori_sentence: Depressive personality disorder (also known as melancholic personality disorder) is a psychiatric diagnosis that denotes a personality disorder with depressive features.
simple_sent: Depressive personality disorder (also called melancholic personality disorder) is a personality disorder. People who have this disorder are very sad.

ori_sentence: Haltlose personality disorder is a personality disorder in which affected individuals possess psychopathic traits built upon short-sighted selfishness and irresponsible hedonism, combined with an inability to anchor one's identity to a future or past.
simple_sent: Haltlose personality disorder (HPD) is a personality disorder. People who have this disorder have short-sighted selfishness and hedonism. They also have an inability to think about the future or their past.

ori_sentence: Generalized lymphadenopathy is swollen lymph glands in many areas of the body.
simple_sent: Generalized lymphadenopathy happens in many parts of the body.

ori_sentence: Dentigerous cyst, also known as follicular cyst is an epithelial-lined developmental cyst formed by accumulation of fluid between the reduced enamel epithelium and crown of an unerupted tooth.
simple_sent: Dentigerous cyst, also known as follicular cyst, is a developmental cyst. It is formed when the crown of an unerupted tooth gets filled with fluid from inside the tooth.

ori_sentence: Pustulosis palmaris et plantaris is a chronic recurrent pustular dermatosis (that is, a pustulosis or pustular psoriasis) localized on the palms and soles only, characterized histologically by intraepidermal pustules filled with neutrophils.
simple_sent: Pustulosis palmaris et plantaris, also called pustular psoriasis, pustular dermatosis, or pustular dermatosis, is a condition where the skin has many pustules. These pustules are filled with neutrophils.

ori_sentence: A giant solitary trichoepithelioma is a cutaneous condition characterized by a skin lesion that may be up to several centimeters in diameter.
simple_sent: A giant solitary trichoepithelioma is a cancer of the skin. The tumor can be up to several centimeters in diameter.

ori_sentence: Gingivostomatitis is a combination of gingivitis and stomatitis, or an inflammation of the oral mucosa and gingiva.
simple_sent: Gingivostomatitis is a disease of the gingiva and oral mucosa. It is also called gingivitis or stomatitis.

ori_sentence: Germinal matrix hemorrhage is a bleeding into the subependymal germinal matrix with or without subsequent rupture into the lateral ventricle.
simple_sent: Germinal matrix hemorrhage is a bleeding into the lateral ventricle. It can also happen when the germinal matrix has already been broken.

ori_sentence: Congenital cystic eye (also known as CCE or cystic eyeball) is an extremely rare ocular malformation where the eye fails to develop correctly in utero and is replaced by benign, fluid-filled tissue.
simple_sent: Congenital cystic eye (also known as CCE or cystic eyeball) is a very rare condition. In this case, the eye does not develop properly in utero and becomes filled with fluid.

ori_sentence: Gonococcemia (also known as "Disseminated gonococcal infection") is a rare complication of mucosal Neisseria gonorrhoeae infection, or Gonorrhea, that occurs when the bacteria invade the bloodstream.
simple_sent: Gonococcemia (also known as disseminated gonococcal infection) is a very rare disease. It happens when the bacteria Neisseria gonorrhoeae invade the blood, and cause Gonorrhea.

ori_sentence: A perforated eardrum (tympanic membrane perforation) is a hole in the eardrum.
simple_sent: A perforated eardrum is a hole in the eardrum. This is called a tympanic membrane.

ori_sentence: Gram-negative folliculitis occurs in patients who have had moderately inflammatory acne for long periods and have been treated with long-term antibiotics, mainly tetracyclines, a disease in which cultures of lesions usually reveals a species of Klebsiella, Escherichia coli, Enterobacter, or, from the deep cystic lesions, Proteus.
simple_sent: Gram-negative folliculitis occurs in patients who have had moderately inflammatory acne for long periods and have been treated with long-term antibiotics, mainly tetracyclines. The bacteria that cause Gram-negative folliculitis are usually Klebsiella, Escherichia coli, Enterobacter, or Proteus.

ori_sentence: Cœur en sabot, (French for "clog-shaped heart"), is a radiological sign seen most commonly in patients with Tetralogy of Fallot, a cyanotic congenital heart disease.
simple_sent: Cœur en sabot, (French for "clog-shaped heart"), is a sign that your heart is not working properly. Most people who have this disease have it this way.

ori_sentence: Hagemoser–Weinstein–Bresnick syndrome is an autosomal dominant genetic disorder first described by Hagemoser et al.
simple_sent: Hagemoser-Weinstein-Bresnick syndrome is a rare genetic disorder. People who have it are called Hagemoser-Weinstein-Bresnick.

ori_sentence: Phocomelia is a condition that involves malformations of human arms and legs.
simple_sent: Phocomelia is a disease. It causes people to have bad arms and legs.

ori_sentence: Radicular pain, or radiculitis, is pain "radiated" along the dermatome (sensory distribution) of a nerve due to inflammation or other irritation of the nerve root (radiculopathy) at its connection to the spinal column.
simple_sent: Radicular pain, or radiculitis, is pain that is "radiated" along a nerve. This is because the nerve root is irritated (radiculopathy) at the place where the pain is felt, called the dermatome.

ori_sentence: A varus deformity is an excessive inward angulation (medial angulation, that is, towards the body's midline) of the distal segment of a bone or joint.
simple_sent: A varus deformity is an abnormality of the distal segment of a bone or joint. This segment is usually towards the body's midline.

ori_sentence: Odynophagia is pain when swallowing.
simple_sent: Odynophagia can cause pain.

ori_sentence: Absence seizures are one of several kinds of generalized seizures.
simple_sent: Absence seizures are different from regular seizures.

ori_sentence: Stimulant use disorder is a type of substance use disorder that involves the non-medical use of stimulants.
simple_sent: Stimulant use disorder is a medical condition. It is when people use stimulants outside of medical therapy.

ori_sentence: Tachycardia-induced cardiomyopathy (TIC) is a disease where prolonged tachycardia (a fast heart rate) or arrhythmia (an irregular heart rhythm) causes an impairment of the myocardium (heart muscle), which can result in heart failure.
simple_sent: Tachycardia-induced cardiomyopathy (TIC) is a disease where the heart muscle can not pump blood as fast as it should. If the heart muscle can not pump blood as fast as it should, it can cause heart failure.

ori_sentence: The side effects of penicillin are bodily responses to penicillin and closely related antibiotics that do not relate directly to its effect on bacteria.
simple_sent: The side effects of penicillin are not directly related to its effect on bacteria, but rather to how the body reacts to it.

ori_sentence: Passive–aggressive personality disorder, also called negativistic personality disorder, is characterized by procrastination, covert obstructionism, inefficiency and stubbornness.
simple_sent: Passive-aggressive personality disorder (PAD) is a personality disorder. People with PAD have problems with procrastination, inefficiency, and stubbornness.

ori_sentence: In medicine, a drug eruption is an adverse drug reaction of the skin.
simple_sent: In medicine, a drug eruption is when a drug causes problems.

ori_sentence: Hangman's fracture is the colloquial name given to a fracture of both pedicles, or partes interarticulares, of the axis vertebra (C2).
simple_sent: Hangman's fracture is a fracture of the axis vertebra. It happens when one or both of the pedicles of the vertebra break.

ori_sentence: Shift work sleep disorder (SWSD) is a circadian rhythm sleep disorder characterized by insomnia, excessive sleepiness, or both affecting people whose work hours overlap with the typical sleep period.
simple_sent: Shift work sleep disorder (SWSD) is a sleep disorder that affects people who work shift work. People with this disorder usually have insomnia and sleepiness all the time.

ori_sentence: Non-progressive congenital ataxia (NPCA) is a non-progressive form of cerebellar ataxia which can occur with or without cerebellar hypoplasia.
simple_sent: Non-progressive congenital ataxia (NPCA) happens when the brain does not work properly. It can also happen without cerebellar hypoplasia.

ori_sentence: Premature thelarche (PT) is a medical condition, characterised by isolated breast development in female infants.
simple_sent: Premature thelarche (PT) is a medical condition. In female infants, the breast does not grow at all.

ori_sentence: Anaplasmosis is a tick-borne disease affecting ruminants, dogs, and horses, and is caused by Anaplasma bacteria.
simple_sent: Anaplasmosis is a disease that is spread by ticks. It mostly affects cattle, dogs, and horses.

ori_sentence: Exophoria is a form of heterophoria in which there is a tendency of the eyes to deviate outward.
simple_sent: Exophoria is a type of heterophoria. In this case, the eyes move outward from the body.

ori_sentence: Alcohol withdrawal syndrome (AWS) is a set of symptoms that can occur following a reduction in alcohol use after a period of excessive use.
simple_sent: Alcohol withdrawal syndrome (AWS) is a set of symptoms. It usually happens after a person has stopped using alcohol for a long time.

ori_sentence: An atonic seizure (also called drop seizure, akinetic seizure or drop attack) is a type of seizure that consists of partial or complete loss of muscle tone that is caused by temporary alterations in brain function.
simple_sent: An atonic seizure (also called drop seizure, akinetic seizure or drop attack) is when the brain does not work properly. This makes the muscles in the body not work as hard as they should.

ori_sentence: Psychotic depression, also known as depressive psychosis, is a major depressive episode that is accompanied by psychotic symptoms.
simple_sent: Psychotic depression, also known as depressive psychosis, is a condition where the person feels depressed all the time.

ori_sentence: Claudication is a medical term usually referring to impairment in walking, or pain, discomfort, numbness, or tiredness in the legs that occurs during walking or standing and is relieved by rest.
simple_sent: Claudication is a medical term that usually means loss of ability to walk, or pain, discomfort, numbness, or tiredness in the legs when a person walks or stands for a long time.

ori_sentence: Mayaro virus disease is a mosquito-borne zoonotic pathogen endemic to certain humid forests of tropical South America.
simple_sent: Mayaro virus disease is a disease that is spread by mosquitoes. It is found mostly in tropical South America.

ori_sentence: Fluoride toxicity is a condition in which there are elevated levels of the fluoride ion in the body.
simple_sent: Fluoride toxicity is when the fluoride ion in the body is too high for the body to handle.

ori_sentence: Bitot's spots are the buildup of keratin located superficially in the conjunctiva of human's eyes.
simple_sent: Bitot's spots are a build-up of keratin in the human eye. They can be found superficially.

ori_sentence: Low-set ears are a clinical feature in which the ears are positioned lower on the head than usual.
simple_sent: Low-set ears are when the ears are lower on the head than normal. This is usually a medical feature.

ori_sentence: Small fiber peripheral neuropathy is a type of peripheral neuropathy that occurs from damage to the small unmyelinated and myelinated peripheral nerve fibers.
simple_sent: Small fiber peripheral neuropathy is a type of peripheral neuropathy. It happens when nerve fibers in the small parts of the body get damaged.

ori_sentence: Sexual addiction, also known as sex addiction, is a state characterized by compulsive participation or engagement in sexual activity, particularly sexual intercourse, despite negative consequences.
simple_sent: Sexual addiction, also known as sex addiction, is when a person wants to have sexual intercourse with other people, even if it will cause them to have problems in the future.

ori_sentence: Gardasil, technically known as recombinant human papillomavirus vaccine [types 6, 11, 16, 18], is a vaccine for use in the prevention of certain strains of human papillomavirus (HPV), developed by Merck &
simple_sent: Gardasil (also known as recombinant human papillomavirus vaccine [types 6, 11, 16, 18]) is a human papillomavirus (HPV) vaccine. The vaccine was developed by Merck in the United States.

ori_sentence: Pott disease is tuberculosis of the spine, usually due to haematogenous spread from other sites, often the lungs.
simple_sent: Pott disease is a disease of the spine. It usually starts in the lungs, but can spread to other places.

ori_sentence: Reinke's edema is the swelling of the vocal cords due to fluid (edema) collected within the Reinke's space.
simple_sent: Reinke's edema is when the vocal cords get too wet. A lot of fluid gets into the Reinke's space.

ori_sentence: Biliary colic, also known as symptomatic cholelithiasis, a gallbladder attack or gallstone attack, is when a colic (sudden pain) occurs due to a gallstone temporarily blocking the cystic duct.
simple_sent: Biliary colic, also known as symptomatic cholelithiasis, a gallbladder attack, or a gallstone attack, is a sudden pain in the biliary system. It is usually caused by a gallstone.

ori_sentence: Hostility is seen as form of emotionally charged aggressive behavior.
simple_sent: Hostility is seen as aggressive behavior when it is emotional.

ori_sentence: Frotteurism is a paraphilic interest in rubbing, usually one's pelvic area or erect penis, against a non-consenting person for sexual pleasure.
simple_sent: Frotteurism is a sexual activity where a person rubs their pelvic area or erect penis against someone else for sexual pleasure.

ori_sentence: Systemic inflammatory response syndrome (SIRS), is an inflammatory state affecting the whole body.
simple_sent: Systemic inflammatory response syndrome (SIRS) is a disease. It affects the whole body.

ori_sentence: Livedo refers to a form of skin discoloration.
simple_sent: Livedo is a type of skin problem.

ori_sentence: Early-onset Alzheimer's disease, also called younger-onset Alzheimer's, familial Alzheimer's disease (FAD) or early-onset familial Alzheimer's disease (EOFAD), is Alzheimer's disease diagnosed before the age of 65.
simple_sent: Early-onset Alzheimer's disease, also called younger-onset Alzheimer's, early-onset familial Alzheimer's disease, or just early-onset Alzheimer's is a disease that does not seem to get better with age.

ori_sentence: A diabetic bulla is a cutaneous condition characterized by a noninflammatory, spontaneous, painless blister, often in acral locations (peripheral body parts, such as feet, toes, hands, fingers, ears or nose), seen in diabetic patients.
simple_sent: A diabetic bulla is a cutaneous condition that does not cause any damage to the body. It usually happens in the areas of the body where the feet, toes, hands, fingers, ears or nose meet the body.

ori_sentence: Eczema vaccinatum is a rare severe adverse reaction to smallpox vaccination.
simple_sent: Eczema vaccinatum is a disease. It is a very bad reaction to smallpox.

ori_sentence: Drug-induced nonautoimmune hemolytic anemia is a form of hemolytic anemia.
simple_sent: Hemolytic anemia is when the blood has too much hemoglobin.

ori_sentence: Drug-induced pruritus is itchiness of the skin caused by medication, a pruritic reaction that is generalized.
simple_sent: Drug-induced pruritus is itchiness of the skin because of a drug. This reaction is called generalized pruritus.

ori_sentence: Endocapillary proliferative glomerulonephritis is a form of glomerulonephritis that can be associated with nephritis.
simple_sent: Endocapillary proliferative glomerulonephritis is a form of glomerulonephritis that does not affect the kidneys.

ori_sentence: Benedikt syndrome, also called Benedikt's syndrome or paramedian midbrain syndrome, is a rare type of posterior circulation stroke of the brain, with a range of neurological symptoms affecting the midbrain, cerebellum and other related structures.
simple_sent: Benedikt syndrome, also called Benedikt's syndrome or paramedian midbrain syndrome, is a disease where the brain does not work properly. People who have this disease have problems with the midbrain and the cerebellum.

ori_sentence: Frigophobia is a phobia pertaining to the fear of becoming too cold.
simple_sent: Frigophobia is a fear of cold. It is when people feel too cold.

ori_sentence: Flaccid paralysis is a neurological condition characterized by weakness or paralysis and reduced muscle tone without other obvious cause (e.g., trauma).
simple_sent: Flaccid paralysis is a neurological condition. It is when a person has weakness or paralysis, and there is no obvious cause.

ori_sentence: Gastric volvulus or volvulus of stomach is a twisting of all or part of the stomach by more than 180 degrees with obstruction of the flow of material through the stomach, variable loss of blood supply and possible tissue death.
simple_sent: Gastric volvulus or volvulus of stomach is a twisting of all or part of the stomach by more than 180 degrees. This makes it hard for food to go through the stomach, and it can also cause tissue death.

ori_sentence: Radiation-induced lung injury (RILI) is a general term for damage to the lungs as a result of exposure to ionizing radiation.
simple_sent: Radiation-induced lung injury (RILI) is an injury to the lungs. It happens when people are exposed to radiation.

ori_sentence: Gastroptosis is the abnormal downward displacement of the stomach.
simple_sent: Gastroptosis is when the stomach moves down instead of up.

ori_sentence: Neuroborreliosis is a disorder of the central nervous system.
simple_sent: Neuroborreliosis is a disease that affects the brain.

ori_sentence: Bulimia nervosa, also known as simply bulimia, is an eating disorder characterized by binge eating followed by purging; and excessive concern with body shape and weight.
simple_sent: Bulimia nervosa, also known as simply bulimia, is an eating disorder. People who suffer from it think that they eat too much, and that it makes them fat.

ori_sentence: Atypical trigeminal neuralgia (ATN), or type 2 trigeminal neuralgia, is a form of trigeminal neuralgia, a disorder of the fifth cranial nerve.
simple_sent: Atypical trigeminal neuralgia (ATN) is a disorder of the fifth cranial nerve. It is also known as type 2 trigeminal neuralgia.

ori_sentence: Gastric varices are dilated submucosal veins in the lining of the stomach, which can be a life-threatening cause of bleeding in the upper gastrointestinal tract.
simple_sent: Gastric varices are small blood vessels in the lining of the stomach. They can cause bleeding in the upper part of the gastrointestinal tract.

ori_sentence: Bitemporal hemianopsia, is the medical description of a type of partial blindness where vision is missing in the outer half of both the right and left visual field.
simple_sent: Bitemporal hemianopsia is a type of partial blindness. In this case, vision is missing in the left side of the body, but not in the right side.

ori_sentence: Fungal keratitis is a fungal infection of the cornea, which can lead to blindness.
simple_sent: Fungal keratitis is an infection of the cornea. It can cause blindness.

ori_sentence: Focal and diffuse brain injury are ways to classify brain injury: focal injury occurs in a specific location, while diffuse injury occurs over a more widespread area.
simple_sent: There are two types of brain injury: focal and diffuse. A focal brain injury happens in a small area, and a diffuse brain injury happens all over the area.

ori_sentence: Flinders Island spotted fever is a condition characterized by a rash in approximately 85% of cases.
simple_sent: Flinders Island spotted fever is a very common disease. About 85% of cases cause a rash.

ori_sentence: Follicular atrophoderma is a skin condition consisting of follicular indentations without hairs, notably occurring on extensor surfaces of the hands, legs and arms.
simple_sent: Follicular atrophoderma is a condition of the skin. People who have the condition usually have indentations without hairs on their hands, legs and arms.

ori_sentence: Foville's syndrome is caused by the blockage of the perforating branches of the basilar artery in the region of the brainstem known as the pons.
simple_sent: Foville's syndrome is caused by an artery getting stuck in the wrong place. This happens in the part of the brainstem called the pons.

ori_sentence: Sudden Unexpected Death in Epilepsy (SUDEP) is a fatal complication of epilepsy.
simple_sent: Sudden Unexpected Death in Epilepsy (SUDEP) is when a person suddenly dies.

ori_sentence: The follicular cyst of the ovary is a type of functional simple cyst, and is the most common type of ovarian cyst.
simple_sent: The most common type of ovarian cyst is a follicular cyst. A follicular cyst is a simple cyst.

ori_sentence: Flea-borne spotted fever or California pseudotyphus is a condition characterized by a rash of maculopapules or furuncles.
simple_sent: Flea-borne spotted fever or California pseudotyphus is a disease. A person who has it will have a rash.

ori_sentence: Phlegmasia cerulea dolens (PCD) (literally: painful blue inflammation), not to be confused with preceding phlegmasia alba dolens, is an uncommon severe form of lower extremity deep venous thrombosis (DVT) that obstructs blood outflow from a vein.
simple_sent: Phlegmasia cerulea dolens (PCD) (literally: painful blue inflammation) is a rare and serious form of deep venous thrombosis (DVT). It happens when blood can not get out of a vein in the lower extremity.

ori_sentence: First arch syndromes are congenital defects caused by a failure of neural crest cells to migrate into the first pharyngeal arch.
simple_sent: First arch syndrome First arch syndrome is a birth defect. The neural crest cells do not move into the first pharyngeal arch.

ori_sentence: Non-celiac gluten sensitivity (NCGS) or gluten sensitivity is "a clinical entity induced by the ingestion of gluten leading to intestinal and/or extraintestinal symptoms that improve once the gluten-containing foodstuff is removed from the diet, and celiac disease and wheat allergy have been excluded".
simple_sent: Non-celiac gluten sensitivity (NCGS) or gluten sensitivity is a condition where people who have been exposed to gluten for a long time have problems with their intestines. People who have celiac disease or wheat allergy may also have problems with their intestines.

ori_sentence: Frenulectomy of the penis is a surgical procedure for cutting and removal of the frenulum of prepuce of penis, to correct a condition known as frenulum breve.
simple_sent: Frenulectomy of the penis is a surgery to cut the frenulum of the penis. This is to fix a problem with the penis called frenulum breve.

ori_sentence: Prolonged labor is the inability of a woman to proceed with childbirth upon going into labor.
simple_sent: Prolonged labor is when a woman goes into labor, but she can not give birth.

ori_sentence: Herpes labialis, commonly known as cold sores, is a type of infection by the herpes simplex virus that affects primarily the lip.
simple_sent: Herpes labialis, also called cold sores, is a disease. It is caused by a virus called Herpes simplex.

ori_sentence: Brachymetatarsia is a condition in which there is one or more abnormally short or overlapping toe bones (metatarsals).
simple_sent: Brachymetatarsia is a condition. In this condition, some of the toe bones (metatarsals) are too short.

ori_sentence: Complications of pregnancy are health problems that are related to pregnancy.
simple_sent: Pregnancy-related health problems are health problems during pregnancy.

ori_sentence: Onychogryphosis is a hypertrophy that may produce nails resembling claws or a ram's horn.
simple_sent: Onychogryphosis is a growth on the nails. The nails look like claws or a ram's horn.

ori_sentence: A subungual hematoma is a collection of blood (hematoma) underneath a toenail or fingernail.
simple_sent: A subungual hematoma is under a toenail or fingernail, and can look like this:

ori_sentence: Asystole is the absence of ventricular contractions in the context of a lethal heart arrhythmia (in contrast to an induced asystole on a cooled patient on a heart-lung machine and general anesthesia during surgery necessitating stopping the heart).
simple_sent: Asystole is the absence of ventricular contractions in the context of a heart arrhythmia. If the heart is working normally, the asystole may be normal, but if the heart is working hard, the asystole may be abnormal.

ori_sentence: Monorchism (also monorchidism) is the state of having only one testicle within the scrotum.
simple_sent: Monorchism is when there is only one testicle in the scrotum. This is also called monorchidism.

ori_sentence: Long COVID, also known as post-COVID-19 syndrome, post-acute sequelae of COVID-19 (PASC), or chronic COVID syndrome (CCS), is a condition characterized by long-term sequelae appearing or persisting after the typical convalescence period of COVID-19.
simple_sent: Long COVID, also known as post-COVID-19 syndrome, post-acute sequelae of COVID-19 (PASC), or chronic COVID syndrome (CCS), is a condition in which the patient has long-term effects after they have recovered from COVID-19.

ori_sentence: Zygomycosis is the broadest term to refer to infections caused by bread mold fungi of the zygomycota phylum.
simple_sent: Zygomycosis is the name for a number of diseases. They are usually caused by bread mold fungi.

ori_sentence: A heterotopic pregnancy is a complication of pregnancy in which both extrauterine (ectopic) pregnancy and intrauterine pregnancy occur simultaneously.
simple_sent: A heterotopic pregnancy is a pregnancy where both parts of the body are active at the same time. This is called an extrauterine pregnancy.

ori_sentence: Spontaneous bacterial peritonitis (SBP) is the development of a bacterial infection in the peritoneum, despite the absence of an obvious source for the infection.
simple_sent: Spontaneous bacterial peritonitis (SBP) happens when a person gets an infection in the peritoneum, but the source of the infection is not known.

ori_sentence: A head injury is any injury that results in trauma to the skull or brain.
simple_sent: A head injury is a serious injury to the head or brain.

ori_sentence: A ectopic testis is a testicle that, although not an undescended testicle, has taken a non-standard path through the body and ended up in an unusual location.
simple_sent: A ectopic testis is a testicle that has come through the body in a different place than normal. It is not an undescended testicle.

ori_sentence: Excessive daytime sleepiness (EDS) is characterized by persistent sleepiness and often a general lack of energy, even during the day after apparently adequate or even prolonged nighttime sleep.
simple_sent: Excessive daytime sleepiness (EDS) is characterized by a general lack of energy, even during the day. People with EDS usually have trouble sleeping during the day.

ori_sentence: Idiopathic chronic fatigue (ICF), is characterized by unexplained fatigue that lasts at least six consecutive months.
simple_sent: Chronic fatigue syndrome (ICF) is when the person has fatigue for at least six months at a time.

ori_sentence: Onychorrhexis (from the Greek words ὄνυχο- ónycho-, "nail" and ῥῆξις rhexis, "bursting"), is a brittleness with breakage of finger or toenails that may result from hypothyroidism, anemia, anorexia nervosa or bulimia, or after oral retinoid therapy.
simple_sent: Onychorrhexis (from the Greek words ónycho-, "nail" and rhexis, "bursting") is a condition where fingernails and toenails break easily. It can be caused by anemia, hypothyroidism, anorexia nervosa or bulimia.

ori_sentence: Ord's thyroiditis is a common form of thyroiditis, an autoimmune disease where the body's own antibodies fight the cells of the thyroid.
simple_sent: Ord's thyroiditis is an autoimmune disease. This means that the body's own antibodies attack the thyroid cells.

ori_sentence: Idiopathic short stature (ISS) refers to extreme short stature that does not have a diagnostic explanation (idiopathic designates a condition that is unexplained or not understood) after an ordinary .
simple_sent: Idaiopathic short stature (ISS) is a very short stature. It is not known why it is this way (idiopathic designates a condition that is not known why) after an ordinary short stature.

ori_sentence: Osteoma cutis is a cutaneous condition characterized by the presence of bone within the skin in the absence of a preexisting or associated lesion.
simple_sent: Osteoma cutis is a condition in which bone is found in the skin. There is no bone in the skin without an existing lesion.

ori_sentence: Ischemic optic neuropathy (ION) is the loss of structure and function of a portion of the optic nerve due to obstruction of blood flow to the nerve (i.e. ischemia).
simple_sent: Ischemic optic neuropathy (ION) is when the optic nerve can not get enough blood to flow to it. This causes damage to the optic nerve.

ori_sentence: Iododermas are caused by iodides, with the most common sources of exposure being oral and intravenous contrast materials used to treat thyroid disease.
simple_sent: Iododermas are caused by iodides. The most common way iodides are used is in contrast materials used to treat thyroid disease.

ori_sentence: Ocular neurosis is the usual cause of eye strain headache that begins abruptly with use of the eyes in which there is a normal ophthalmologic exam.
simple_sent: Ocular neurosis is the most common cause of eye strain headache. It usually starts when the person uses their eyes after a normal eye exam.

ori_sentence: Japanese spotted fever is a condition characterized by a rash that has early macules, and later, in some patients, petechiae.
simple_sent: Japanese spotted fever is a disease. People who have the disease have a rash that has early macules, and later petechiae.

ori_sentence: Oil acne is an occupational skin condition caused by exposure to oils used in industry.
simple_sent: Oil acne is a condition of the skin. It is caused by exposure to oil.

ori_sentence: Thyrotoxicosis factitia (alimentary thyrotoxicosis, exogenous thyrotoxicosis) refers to a condition of thyrotoxicosis caused by the ingestion of exogenous thyroid hormone.
simple_sent: Thyrotoxicosis factitia, also known as exogenous thyrotoxicosis, is a disease where the thyroid gland is destroyed. It is caused by thyroid hormone.

ori_sentence: Irregular menstruation is a menstrual disorder whose manifestations include irregular cycle lengths as well as metrorrhagia (vaginal bleeding between expected periods).
simple_sent: Irregular menstruation is when a woman's menstrual cycle is not regular. She may also have metrorrhagia (vaginal bleeding between expected periods).

ori_sentence: Muscle dysmorphia is a subtype of the obsessive mental disorder body dysmorphic disorder, but is often also grouped with eating disorders.
simple_sent: Muscle dysmorphia is a mental condition. It is sometimes called body dysmorphic disorder, but that is not exactly the same.

ori_sentence: Phakomatoses, or phacomatosis pigmentovascularis (PPV), is the term used for a group of rare syndromes involving structures arising from the embryonic ectoderm.
simple_sent: Phakomatoses, or phacomatosis pigmentovascularis (PPV), are a group of rare conditions. They are caused by damage to the embryonic ectoderm.

ori_sentence: Overflow incontinence is a form of urinary incontinence, characterized by the involuntary release of urine from an overfull urinary bladder, often in the absence of any urge to urinate.
simple_sent: Overflow incontinence is a form of urinary incontinence. It happens when the urinary bladder is too full, and the urine can not be controlled by the body.

ori_sentence: Spina bifida (Latin for "split spine"; SB) is a birth defect in which there is incomplete closing of the spine and the membranes around the spinal cord during early development in pregnancy.
simple_sent: Spina bifida (Latin for "split spine"; SB) is a birth defect in which the spinal cord and brain are not closed properly. This is called a "split spine".

ori_sentence: Asterixis is a tremor of the hand when the wrist is extended, sometimes said to resemble a bird flapping its wings.
simple_sent: Asterixis is a tremor of the hand. When the hand is extended, it looks like a bird is flapping its wings.

ori_sentence: Body dysmorphic disorder (BDD), occasionally still called dysmorphophobia, is a mental disorder characterized by the obsessive idea that some aspect of one's own body part or appearance is severely flawed and therefore warrants exceptional measures to hide or fix it.
simple_sent: Body dysmorphic disorder (BDD), sometimes called dysmorphophobia, is a mental disorder. People who have it think that some part of their body, such as their body shape, looks or feels wrong, and they need to hide it or fix it.

ori_sentence: Idiopathic pure sudomotor failure (IPSF) is the most common cause of a rare disorder known as acquired idiopathic generalized anhidrosis (AIGA), a clinical syndrome characterized by generalized decrease or absence of sweating without other autonomic and somatic nervous dysfunctions and without persistent organic cutaneous lesions.
simple_sent: Idaipathic pure sudomotor failure (IPSF) is the most common cause of a rare disorder known as acquired idiopathic generalized anhidrosis (AIGA), in which the person does not have any sweating at all. This is because the person does not have other autonomic and somatic nervous system problems.

ori_sentence: A headache is often present in patients suffering from epilepsy.
simple_sent: A headache is usually present when someone has epilepsy.

ori_sentence: Idiopathic guttate hypomelanosis is a very common acquired disorder that affects women more frequently than men, presenting with skin lesions that occur chiefly on sun exposed regions of the skin, suggesting sun exposure may play a role.
simple_sent: Idiopathic guttate hypomelanosis is a very common disease that affects women more frequently than men. People who have the disease have skin lesions that are mostly found on areas of the skin that are in the sun.

ori_sentence: Normal anion gap acidosis is an acidosis that is not accompanied by an abnormally increased anion gap.
simple_sent: Normal anion gap acidosis does not happen. It does not happen because the anion gap is too high.

ori_sentence: An epileptic seizure, formally known as a seizure, is a period of symptoms due to abnormally excessive or synchronous neuronal activity in the brain.
simple_sent: An epileptic seizure is a period of symptoms when the brain does not work properly. This is because there is too much activity in the brain.

ori_sentence: Barotrauma is physical damage to body tissues caused by a difference in pressure between a gas space inside, or in contact with, the body, and the surrounding gas or fluid.
simple_sent: Barotrauma is damage to the body because of a difference in pressure between a gas space inside the body and the gas or fluid outside the body.

ori_sentence: Neonatal hepatitis refers to many forms of liver dysfunction that affects fetuses and neonates.
simple_sent: Neonatal hepatitis is a disease where the liver does not work properly. It affects babies.

ori_sentence: Nicotine poisoning describes the symptoms of the toxic effects of nicotine following ingestion, inhalation, or skin contact.
simple_sent: Nicotine poisoning describes the effects of nicotine on the body after it is taken in, or when it is breathed in.

ori_sentence: Nasal septal abscess is a condition of the nasal septum in which there is a collection of pus between the mucoperichondrium and septal cartilage.
simple_sent: Nasal septal abscess is a condition of the nasal septum. It happens when the septal cartilage in the nasal cavity becomes too thick.

ori_sentence: Mushroom poisoning is poisoning resulting from the ingestion of mushrooms that contain toxic substances.
simple_sent: Mushroom poisoning is when people eat mushrooms and they get sick because of the chemicals in them.

ori_sentence: Arsenic poisoning is a medical condition that occurs due to elevated levels of arsenic in the body.
simple_sent: Arsenic poisoning is a medical condition. It happens when arsenic levels are too high in the body.

ori_sentence: Nervous system diseases, also known as nervous system or neurological disorders, refers to a small class of medical conditions affecting the nervous system.
simple_sent: Nervous system diseases are diseases that affect the nervous system. There are many different types of nervous system diseases.

ori_sentence: Mittelschmerz (German: "middle pain") is a medical term for "ovulation pain" or "midcycle pain".
simple_sent: Mittelschmerz is a German word. It means "middle pain" or "midcycle pain".

ori_sentence: A bezoar is a mass often found trapped in the gastrointestinal system, though it can occur in other locations.
simple_sent: A bezoar is a large mass in the gastrointestinal system. It is usually found in the stomach.

ori_sentence: Malignant pleural effusion is a condition in which cancer causes an abnormal amount of fluid to collect between the thin layers of tissue (pleura) lining the outside of the lung and the wall of the chest cavity.
simple_sent: A pleural effusion is a condition in which fluid collects between the outside of the lung and the wall of the chest cavity. This happens when cancer causes an abnormal amount of fluid to collect.

ori_sentence: Malarial nephropathy is kidney failure attributed to malarial infection.
simple_sent: Malarial nephropathy is a disease. It causes kidney failure.

ori_sentence: High anion gap metabolic acidosis is a form of metabolic acidosis characterized by a high anion gap (a medical value based on the concentrations of ions in a patient's serum).
simple_sent: High anion gap metabolic acidosis is a form of metabolic acidosis. A high anion gap means that the amount of ions in a person's blood is too high.

ori_sentence: A Hill–Sachs lesion, or Hill–Sachs fracture, is a cortical depression in the posterolateral head of the humerus.
simple_sent: A Hill-Sachs fracture (also called Hill-Sachs lesion) is a fracture of the humerus bone in the head.

ori_sentence: A metatarsophalangeal joint sprain is an injury to the connective tissue between the foot and one of the toes.
simple_sent: A metatarsophalangeal joint sprain is an injury to one of the toes on the foot. The injury is called a sprain.

ori_sentence: Harm avoidance (HA) is a personality trait characterized by excessive worrying; pessimism; shyness; and being fearful, doubtful, and easily fatigued.
simple_sent: Harm avoidance (HA) is a personality trait. People with it are more likely to worry a lot, be shy, be doubtful, and be easily fatigued.

ori_sentence: A major depressive episode (MDE) is a period characterized by the symptoms of major depressive disorder.
simple_sent: A major depressive episode (MDE) can last for a long time. It can also be called a major depressive disorder.

ori_sentence: Macrocheilia is a condition of permanent swelling of the lip that results from greatly distended lymphatic spaces.
simple_sent: Macrocheilia is a condition where the lip is always swollen. It is caused by enlarged lymphatic spaces.

ori_sentence: Organophosphate poisoning is poisoning due to organophosphates (OPs).
simple_sent: Organophosphate poisoning is when a person takes in too much.

ori_sentence: Headaches can be attributed to many different substances.
simple_sent: Headaches can be caused by many different things.

ori_sentence: Middle back pain, also known as thoracic back pain, is back pain that is felt in the region of the thoracic vertebrae, which are between the bottom of the neck and top of the lumbar spine.
simple_sent: Middle back pain, also known as thoracic back pain, is pain in the middle of the back, between the bottom of the neck and the top of the spine, in the thoracic region.

ori_sentence: A pesticide poisoning occurs when pesticides, chemicals intended to control a pest, affect non-target organisms such as humans, wildlife, plant, or bees.
simple_sent: A pesticide poisoning is when pesticides affect non-target organisms. These can include humans, animals, plants, and even bees.

ori_sentence: Medial inferior pontine syndrome is a condition associated with a contralateral hemiplegia.
simple_sent: Medial inferior pontine syndrome is a medical condition. It can cause hemiplegia.

ori_sentence: Hyperchloremia is an electrolyte disturbance in which there is an elevated level of the chloride ions in the blood.
simple_sent: Hyperchloremia is when the level of chloride ions in the blood is higher than it should be.

ori_sentence: Hemifacial microsomia (HFM) is a congenital disorder that affects the development of the lower half of the face, most commonly the ears, the mouth and the mandible.
simple_sent: Hemifacial microsomia (HFM) is a disorder. It affects the development of the lower half of the face. This includes the ears, the mouth and the jaw.

ori_sentence: Hematosalpinx (sometimes also hemosalpinx) is a medical condition involving bleeding into the fallopian tubes.
simple_sent: Hematosalpinx (also called hemosalpinx) is a disease. It happens when blood goes into the fallopian tubes.

ori_sentence: Herpesviral meningitis is meningitis associated with herpes simplex virus (HSV).
simple_sent: Herpesviral meningitis. Herpesviral meningitis is caused by a virus.

ori_sentence: Streptococcal pharyngitis, also known as strep throat, is an infection of the back of the throat including the tonsils caused by group A streptococcus (GAS).
simple_sent: Streptococcal pharyngitis, also known as strep throat, is an infection of the tonsils and back of the throat. It is caused by streptococcus.

ori_sentence: Hematocolpos is a medical condition in which the vagina is pooled with menstrual blood due to multiple factors leading to the blockage of menstrual blood flow.
simple_sent: Hematocolpos is a medical condition. In this condition, the vagina gets full of menstrual blood because of many different things.

ori_sentence: Heterophoria is an eye condition in which the directions that the eyes are pointing at rest position, when not performing binocular fusion, are not the same as each other, or, "not straight".
simple_sent: Heterophoria is an eye condition in which the directions that the eyes point at when they are at rest are not the same. When they are not at rest, they are not at rest either.

ori_sentence: Cauliflower ear is an irreversible condition that occurs when the external portion of the ear is hit and develops a blood clot or other collection of fluid under the perichondrium.
simple_sent: Cauliflower ear is a condition that happens when the outside of the ear gets hit with a blood clot. A lot of fluid comes out of the perichondrium and into the ear.

ori_sentence: Meconium peritonitis refers to rupture of the bowel prior to birth, resulting in fetal stool (meconium) escaping into the surrounding space (peritoneum) leading to inflammation (peritonitis).
simple_sent: Meconium peritonitis happens when a baby's bowel breaks before it is born. The meconium goes into the surrounding space (peritoneum). This causes inflammation (peritonitis).

ori_sentence: Giant condyloma acuminatum (also known as a Buschke–Löwenstein tumor) is a rare cutaneous condition characterized by an aggressive, wart-like growth that is a verrucous carcinoma.
simple_sent: Giant condyloma acuminatum (also known as a Buschke-Löwenstein tumor) is a cancer of the skin. It is a growth that looks like a large wart, but is not.

ori_sentence: Medial medullary syndrome, also known as inferior alternating syndrome, hypoglossal alternating hemiplegia, lower alternating hemiplegia, or Dejerine syndrome, is a type of alternating hemiplegia characterized by a set of clinical features resulting from occlusion of the anterior spinal artery.
simple_sent: Medial medullary syndrome, also known as inferior alternating syndrome, hypoglossal alternating hemiplegia, lower alternating hemiplegia, or Dejerine syndrome, is a condition in which the spinal cord is cut off at the back of the body.

ori_sentence: Actinic cheilitis is cheilitis (lip inflammation) caused by long term sunlight exposure.
simple_sent: Actinic cheilitis is an inflammation of the lip. It can be caused by sunlight.

ori_sentence: Rhinophyma is a condition causing development of a large, bulbous nose associated with granulomatous infiltration, commonly due to untreated rosacea.
simple_sent: Rhinophyma is a condition that causes a large, bulbous nose. This condition is usually caused by rosacea, a skin disease.

ori_sentence: An abscess in the psoas muscle of the abdomen may be caused by lumbar tuberculosis.
simple_sent: An abscess in the abdomen may be caused by tuberculosis of the psoas muscle.

ori_sentence: Pitted keratolysis (also known as Keratolysis plantare sulcatum, Keratoma plantare sulcatum, and Ringed keratolysis) is a bacterial skin infection of the foot.
simple_sent: Pitted keratolysis (also known as ringed keratolysis and plantare sulcatum) is an infection of the foot. It is caused by bacteria.

ori_sentence: Psychogenic pruritus is a common manifestation of chronic anxiety, usually a localized itch, especially in the anogenital area.
simple_sent: Psychogenic pruritus is a common symptom of anxiety. It is usually a localized itch, but it can be other things.

ori_sentence: Inferior vena cava syndrome (IVCS) is a constellation of symptoms resulting from obstruction of the inferior vena cava.
simple_sent: Inferior vena cava syndrome (IVCS) is a medical condition. It is when the inferior vena cava is not working properly.

ori_sentence: Monoplegia is paralysis of a single limb, usually an arm.
simple_sent: Monoplegia is usually caused by a single arm or leg.

ori_sentence: Personality disorder not otherwise specified is a diagnostic classification for some DSM-IV Axis II personality disorders not otherwise listed in DSM-IV.
simple_sent: Personality disorder not otherwise specified is a category in the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders.

ori_sentence: Suicide is the act of intentionally causing one's own death.
simple_sent: Suicide is when someone causes their own death.

ori_sentence: Mollaret's meningitis is a recurrent or chronic inflammation of the protective membranes covering the brain and spinal cord, known collectively as the meninges.
simple_sent: Mollaret's meningitis is an infection of the meninges. The meninges are the protective membranes that cover the brain and spinal cord.

ori_sentence: A vision disorder is an impairment of the sense of vision.
simple_sent: A vision disorder is a loss of vision in the eye.

ori_sentence: Powassan encephalitis, caused by the Powassan virus (POWV), a flavivirus also known as the deer tick virus, is a form of arbovirus infection that results from tick bites.
simple_sent: Powassan encephalitis is a disease caused by the Powassan virus. The Powassan virus is a flavivirus. It is also known as the deer tick virus.

simple_sent: Impaired fasting glucose is a condition in which a person's blood sugar levels during fasting are above the normal range, but below the normal range for a formal diagnosis of diabetes mellitus. This is called prediabetes.

simple_sent: Re-entry ventricular arrhythmia is a type of heart arrhythmia. It happens when the electric signal in the ventricle of the heart stops working properly. The electric signal does not go straight to the heart.

simple_sent: Episcleritis is an inflammatory disease. It mainly affects the outside of the eye, called the episclera.

simple_sent: Rotavirus gastroenteritis is the most common cause of diarrhoea in children and young people.

simple_sent: Psychoorganic syndrome (POS) is a progressive disease. It is also known as organic psychosyndrome.

simple_sent: It is named after Clement Dukes. Dukes disease is also known as fourth disease, Filatov-Dukes disease, or Filatov-Dukes disease.

simple_sent: Pneumomediastinum, also known as mediastinal emphysema, is when there is no air in the mediastinum. This is called pneumatosis.

simple_sent: Lupus vulgaris (also known as tuberculosis luposa) is a disease of the skin. It is the most common cause of tuberculosis in people, and the most common cause of death.

ori_sentence: Gender dysphoria in children (GD), also known as gender incongruence of childhood, is a formal diagnosis for children who experience significant discontent (gender dysphoria) due to a mismatch between their assigned sex and gender identity.
simple_sent: Gender dysphoria in children (GD), also known as gender incongruence of childhood, is when a child has a sex and a gender identity that are different, but they think they are the same or the same person.

ori_sentence: A vanishing twin, also known as twin resorption, is a fetus in a multigestation pregnancy that dies in utero and is then partially or completely reabsorbed.

simple_sent: Chronic paroxysmal hemicrania (CPH) is a very bad headache. It usually does not go away after a while.

ori_sentence: Bare lymphocyte syndrome is a condition caused by mutations in certain genes of the major histocompatibility complex or involved with the processing and presentation of MHC molecules.
simple_sent: Bare lymphocyte syndrome is a disease. It is caused by changes in certain genes in the major histocompatibility complex, which is a part of the immune system.

ori_sentence: Renal ischemia also known as nephric ischaemia, is the deficiency of blood in one or both kidneys or nephrons, usually due to functional constriction or actual obstruction of a blood vessel.
simple_sent: Renal ischemia, also known as nephric ischaemia, is when there is no blood in one or both of the kidneys. This usually happens when a blood vessel is blocked.

simple_sent: Rickettsia aeschlimannii is a disease. People who have it have a rash.

ori_sentence: In racquet nails (also known as brachyonychia, nail en raquette, and racquet thumb), the nail plate is flattened, the end of the thumb is widened and flattened, and the distal phalanx is abnormally short.
simple_sent: In racquet nails, the nail plate is flattened, the end of the thumb is widened and flattened, and the distal phalanx is abnormally short. This condition is also known as nail en raquette.

simple_sent: Intestinal connective tissue abnormality can cause this problem.

ori_sentence: Postterm pregnancy is when a woman has not yet delivered her baby after 42 weeks of gestation, two weeks beyond the typical 40-week duration of pregnancy.

simple_sent: Occipital neuralgia (ON) is a pain in the back of the head. It is usually felt when the greater occipital nerve (GON) or the lesser occipital nerve (LON) are touching the back of the head.

simple_sent: Dissociative fugue, also called fugue state or psychogenic fugue, is a mental and behavioral disorder. People who suffer from it are said to be "dissociative".

simple_sent: Lukoedema is a condition where the mucosa of the inside of the cheeks looks blue, grey or white. It can also happen on the mucosa of the larynx or vagina.

ori_sentence: Hemeralopia (from Greek ημέρα hemera, "day", and αλαός alaos, "blindness") is the inability to see clearly in bright light and is the exact opposite of nyctalopia (night blindness), the inability to see clearly in low light.
simple_sent: Hemeralopia is when a person can not see clearly in bright light. It is the opposite of nyctalopia (night blindness), where people can see well in low light, but not in bright light.

simple_sent: The human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) has a high genetic variability and is difficult to treat.

The bursa separates the coraco-acromial ligament from the acromion and the acromial arch.

simple_sent: Morgellons is the informal name of a self-diagnosed skin condition. People who have the condition say that they have sores on their skin that they think have fibrous material in them.

simple_sent: Zinc toxicity is a medical condition. People who have been exposed to zinc can die.

simple_sent: Human granulocytic anaplasmosis (HGA) is a disease caused by an intracellular bacterium called Anaplasma phagocytophilum. The disease is usually spread by ticks of the Ixodes ricinus family, which includes Ixodes scapularis and Ixodes pacificus in North America.

simple_sent: De Quervain's thyroiditis, also known as giant cell thyroiditis or subacute granulomatous thyroiditis, is a disease that affects the thyroid gland.

itemLabel: congenital adrenal hyperplasia due to 21-hydroxylase deficiency
ori_sentence: Congenital adrenal hyperplasia due to 21-hydroxylase deficiency in all its forms, accounts for over 95% of diagnosed cases of congenital adrenal hyperplasia (CAH), and CAH in most contexts refers to 21-hydroxylase deficiency and different mutations related to enzyme impairment have been mapped on protein structure.
simple_sent: Congenital adrenal hyperplasia (CAH) is caused by a lack of 21-hydroxylase. About 95% of cases of congenital adrenal hyperplasia (CAH) are caused by 21-hydroxylase deficiency. Different types of 21-hydroxylase deficiency have different types of mutations.

ori_sentence: A retroverted uterus (tilted uterus, tipped uterus) is a uterus that is oriented posteriorly, towards the back of the body.

simple_sent: Hypochloremia (or Hypochloraemia) is an electrolyte problem. In this case, the level of chloride in the blood is too low.

ori_sentence: Alcoholic hallucinosis is a complication of hazardous recreational alcohol use in people with alcohol use disorder.
simple_sent: Alcoholic hallucinosis is a medical condition. It happens when people who have alcohol use disorder use alcohol.

ori_sentence: Hallucinogen persisting perception disorder (HPPD) is a chronic and non-psychotic disorder in which a person experiences apparent lasting or persistent visual hallucinations or perceptual distortions after a previous hallucinogenic drug experience, usually lacking the same feelings of intoxication or mental alteration experienced while on the drug.
simple_sent: Hallucinogen persisting perception disorder (HPPD) is a chronic and non-psychotic disorder in which the person continues to have visual hallucinations after taking a hallucinogenic drug for a long time. The person does not feel the same after the drug as when they first took the drug.

ori_sentence: Tumor lysis syndrome is a group of metabolic abnormalities that can occur as a complication during the treatment of cancer, where large amounts of tumor cells are killed off (lysed) at the same time by the treatment, releasing their contents into the bloodstream.
simple_sent: Tumor lysis syndrome is a group of metabolic problems that can happen when cancer is treated. During the treatment, large numbers of tumor cells are killed, but not all of them are killed at the same time, and some go into the bloodstream.

ori_sentence: Alcoholism is, broadly, any drinking of alcohol that results in significant mental or physical health problems.
simple_sent: Alcoholism is, generally speaking, any drinking of alcohol that causes serious health problems.

ori_sentence: Biological warfare, also known as germ warfare, is the use of biological toxins or infectious agents such as bacteria, viruses, insects, and fungi with the intent to kill, harm or incapacitate humans, animals or plants as an act of war.
simple_sent: Biological warfare, also known as germ warfare, is the use of biological weapons to try to kill or hurt people or animals. The weapons are made of things like bacteria, viruses, insects, and fungi.

ori_sentence: Many species of arthropods (insects, arachnids and others) regularly or occasionally bite or sting human beings.
simple_sent: Many species of arthropods (insects, arachnids and others) bite or sting people from time to time.

simple_sent: 6-Phosphogluconate dehydrogenase deficiency (6PGD deficiency), also called 6PGD, is an autosomal recessive disease. People with the disease have abnormally low levels of 6-phosphogluconate dehydrogenase, an enzyme.

simple_sent: Sesamoiditis is a disease of the bones.

ori_sentence: Myocardial rupture is a laceration of the ventricles or atria of the heart, of the interatrial or interventricular septum, or of the papillary muscles.
simple_sent: Myocardial rupture is when the heart is pumping too hard. The heart is working too hard and the blood is not getting to the heart fast enough.

simple_sent: Rachischisis is a birth defect in the neural tube. The Greek word comes from "rhachis" - spine, and "schisis" - split.

simple_sent: Stannosis is a benign non-fibrotic disease. It can be caused by stannous oxide, stannic oxide or stannous tin compounds.
