simple_sent: A centipede bite is an injury that is caused by the stinger-like teeth of a centipede. The stinger sticks into the skin and injects venom into the wound.

ori_sentence: Bezold's abscess is an abscess deep to the sternocleidomastoid muscle where pus from mastoiditis erodes through the cortex of the mastoid part of the temporal bone, medial to the attachment of sternocleidomastoid, extends into the infratemporal fossa, and deep to the investing layer of the deep cervical fascia.
simple_sent: Bezold's abscess is an abscess deep to the sternocleidomastoid muscle where pus from mastoiditis erodes through the cortex and deep to the investing layer of the deep cervical fascia. Bezold's abscess is the most common infection of the sternocleidomastoid muscle in humans.

ori_sentence: Hereditary persistence of fetal hemoglobin (HPFH) is a benign condition in which increased fetal hemoglobin (hemoglobin F, HbF) production continues well into adulthood, disregarding the normal shutoff point after which only adult-type hemoglobin should be produced.
simple_sent: Hereditary persistence of fetal hemoglobin (HPFH) is a condition in which fetal hemoglobin (hemoglobin F, HbF) continues to be made well into adulthood. Normally, when a person becomes an adult, they stop making hemoglobin.

ori_sentence: Cubitus varus is a varus deformity in which the extended forearm is deviated towards midline of the body.
simple_sent: Cubitus varus is a birth defect. In this case, the forearm is longer than the rest of the body.

ori_sentence: Nicotine withdrawal is a group of symptoms that occur in the first few weeks after stopping or decreasing use of nicotine.
simple_sent: Nicotine withdrawal is a group of symptoms. They usually start in the first few weeks after people stop using nicotine.

ori_sentence: Anismus or dyssynergic defecation is the failure of normal relaxation of pelvic floor muscles during attempted defecation.
simple_sent: Anismus or dyssynergic defecation is when the muscles of the pelvic floor do not relax as they should.

ori_sentence: Jamestown Canyon encephalitis is an infectious disease caused by the Jamestown Canyon virus, an orthobunyavirus of the California serogroup.
simple_sent: Jamestown Canyon encephalitis is a disease. The disease is caused by a virus, the Jamestown Canyon virus.

ori_sentence: Stomatitis nicotina is a diffuse white patch on the hard palate, usually caused by tobacco smoking, usually pipe or cigar smoking.
simple_sent: Stomatitis nicotina is a disease of the palate. It is usually caused by smoking tobacco, especially cigar or pipe smoking.

ori_sentence: Factitious dermatitis is a form of factitious disorder in which patients will intentionally feign symptoms and produce signs of disease in an attempt to assume the patient role.
simple_sent: Factitious dermatitis is a form of dermatitis where the patient tries to make themselves look like they have a disease so that people will believe they have it.

ori_sentence: Neuralgia (Greek neuron, "nerve" + algos, "pain") is pain in the distribution of a nerve or nerves, as in intercostal neuralgia, trigeminal neuralgia, and glossopharyngeal neuralgia.
simple_sent: Neuralgia (Greek neuron, "nerve" + algos, "pain") is pain caused by nerves or parts of them touching each other. There are many types of neuralgia.

ori_sentence: Psoriatic erythroderma represents a form of psoriasis that affects all body sites, including the face, hands, feet, nails, trunk, and extremities.
simple_sent: Psoriatic erythroderma is the most common form of psoriasis. It usually affects the face, but it can also affect the hands and feet.

ori_sentence: Susto (Spanish pronunciation: [ˈsusto], Portuguese pronunciation:
simple_sent: Susto (Portuguese: Susto, Spanish: Susto) is a city.

ori_sentence: Heyde's syndrome is a syndrome of gastrointestinal bleeding from angiodysplasia in the presence of aortic stenosis.
simple_sent: Heyde's syndrome is a condition. It happens when a person has angiodysplasia and has aortic stenosis.

ori_sentence: Prurigo nodularis (PN), also known as nodular prurigo, is a skin disease characterised by pruritic (itchy) nodules which usually appear on the arms or legs.
simple_sent: Prurigo nodularis, also known as nodular prurigo, is a disease of the skin. People with prurigo usually get nodules on their arms or legs.

ori_sentence: Radial tunnel syndrome (RTS) is caused by increased pressure on the radial nerve as it travels from the upper arm (the brachial plexus) to the hand and wrist.
simple_sent: Radial tunnel syndrome (RTS) is a medical condition. It happens when the radial nerve in the upper arm gets too much pressure, making it go out.

ori_sentence: Deaf-mute is a term which was used historically to identify a person who was either deaf and used sign language or both deaf and could not speak.
simple_sent: A Deaf-mute is a person who is not able to talk. They used to be called this because they could not speak and used sign language.

ori_sentence: Hepatic porphyrias is a form of porphyria in which toxic porphyrin molecules build up in the liver.
simple_sent: Hepatic porphyrias is a form of porphyria. In this case, the body makes toxic porphyrin.

ori_sentence: Uterine perforation is a potential complication of any intrauterine procedure.
simple_sent: Uterine perforation can be a problem when a procedure is performed.

ori_sentence: Biotin deficiency is a nutritional disorder which can become serious, even fatal, if allowed to progress untreated.
simple_sent: Biotin deficiency is a serious health problem. If it is not treated, it can cause serious problems.

ori_sentence: Renal segmental hypoplasia is a kidney with a partially developed or atrophic renal cortex.
simple_sent: Renal segmental hypoplasia is a condition in which the kidney does not develop properly.

ori_sentence: Snapping hip syndrome, also referred to as dancer's hip, is a medical condition characterized by a snapping sensation felt when the hip is flexed and extended.
simple_sent: Snapping hip syndrome, also called dancer's hip, is a medical condition. When the hip is extended or flexed, it feels like it is going to snap.

ori_sentence: Pogosta disease is a viral disease.
simple_sent: Pogosta disease can be deadly.

ori_sentence: Mycoplasma pneumonia (also known as "walking pneumonia") is a form of bacterial pneumonia caused by the bacterial species Mycoplasma pneumoniae.
simple_sent: Mycoplasma pneumonia is a disease. It is caused by a bacteria called Mycoplasma. It is the most common cause of pneumonia.

ori_sentence: Binswanger's disease, also known as subcortical leukoencephalopathy and subcortical arteriosclerotic encephalopathy (SAE), is a form of small vessel vascular dementia caused by damage to the white brain matter.
simple_sent: Binswanger's disease, also known as subcortical leukoencephalopathy and subcortical arteriosclerotic encephalopathy (SAE), is a disease where the brain does not work properly.

ori_sentence: Erethism, also known as erethismus mercurialis, mad hatter disease, or mad hatter syndrome, is a neurological disorder which affects the whole central nervous system, as well as a symptom complex, derived from mercury poisoning.
simple_sent: Erethism, also known as mad hatter disease, mad hatter syndrome, or erethismus mercurialis, is a disease that affects the central nervous system. It is also a symptom of mercury poisoning.

ori_sentence: Epidemic typhus, also known as louse-borne typhus, is a form of typhus so named because the disease often causes epidemics following wars and natural disasters where civil life is disrupted.
simple_sent: Epidemic typhus, also known as louse-borne typhus, is a form of typhus. The disease is often called epidemic typhus because it happens so quickly after natural disasters or wars.

ori_sentence: Hypopigmentation is characterized specifically as an area of skin becoming lighter than the baseline skin color, but not completely devoid of pigment.
simple_sent: Hypopigmentation is an area of skin that becomes lighter than its normal color. It does not mean that the skin has no pigment at all.

ori_sentence: Iliotibial band syndrome (ITBS) is the second most common knee injury caused by inflammation located on the lateral aspect of the knee due to friction between the iliotibial band and the lateral epicondyle of the femur.
simple_sent: Iliotibial band syndrome (ITBS) is the second most common knee injury. It is caused by the iliotibial band of the knee rubbing against the lateral epicondyle of the femur bone.

ori_sentence: A sedentary lifestyle is a lifestyle type in which little to or no physical activity and exercise is done, as opposed to an active lifestyle.
simple_sent: A sedentary lifestyle is a way of life. This means that people do not do much physical activity, and they are not as active.

ori_sentence: An ependymoma is a tumor that arises from the ependyma, a tissue of the central nervous system.
simple_sent: An ependymoma is a cancer of the ependyma. The ependyma is a part of the central nervous system.

ori_sentence: DOOR (deafness, onychodystrophy, osteodystrophy, and mental retardation) syndrome is a genetic disease which is inherited in an autosomal recessive fashion.
simple_sent: DOOR (deafness, onychodystrophy, osteodystrophy, and mental retardation) syndrome is a disease. People who have it are called DOOR people.

ori_sentence: Delayed ejaculation describes a man's inability or persistent difficulty in achieving orgasm, despite typical sexual desire and sexual stimulation.
simple_sent: Delayed ejaculation is when a man has a hard time having an orgasm. It can happen even though he wants to have an orgasm.

ori_sentence: Malabsorption is a state arising from abnormality in absorption of food nutrients across the gastrointestinal (GI) tract.
simple_sent: Malabsorption is when food is not taken in by the body properly. This happens in the gastrointestinal tract.

ori_sentence: Left anterior fascicular block (LAFB) is an abnormal condition of the left ventricle of the heart, related to, but distinguished from, left bundle branch block (LBBB).
simple_sent: Left anterior fascicular block (LAFB) is an abnormality of the left ventricle of the heart. It is not the same as left bundle branch block (LBBB).

ori_sentence: Oroantral fistula (OAF) is an epithelialised oroantral communication (OAC).
simple_sent: Oroantral fistula (OAF) is an oroantral communication mechanism.

ori_sentence: A ganglion cyst is a fluid-filled bump associated with a joint or tendon sheath.
simple_sent: A ganglion cyst is a fluid-filled bump. It is usually near a joint or tendon.

ori_sentence: Cubitus valgus is a medical deformity in which the forearm is angled away from the body to a greater degree than normal when fully extended.
simple_sent: Cubitus valgus is a medical condition. In this case, the forearm is turned away from the body more than it should be.

ori_sentence: An auditory hallucination, or paracusia, is a form of hallucination that involves perceiving sounds without auditory stimulus.
simple_sent: An auditory hallucination, or paracusia, is when a person can hear sounds, but they do not feel them.

ori_sentence: Erythema toxicum neonatorum is a common, non-threatening rash in newborns.
simple_sent: Erythema toxicum neonatorum is a rash. It is not usually dangerous.

ori_sentence: Warfarin-induced skin necrosis is a condition in which skin and subcutaneous tissue necrosis (tissue death) occurs due to acquired protein C deficiency following treatment with anti-vitamin K anticoagulants (4-hydroxycoumarins, such as warfarin).
simple_sent: Warfarin-induced skin necrosis is a condition in which skin and subcutaneous tissue die because the body does not have enough protein C. This happens when people take anti-vitamin K drugs, such as warfarin.

ori_sentence: Haemophilus influenzae (formerly called Pfeiffer's bacillus or Bacillus influenzae) is a Gram-negative, coccobacillary, facultatively anaerobic capnophilic pathogenic bacterium of the family Pasteurellaceae.
simple_sent: Haemophilus influenzae (formerly called Pfeiffer's bacillus or Bacillus influenzae) is a pathogenic bacterium. It is a Gram-negative, coccobacillary, facultatively anaerobic bacterium.

ori_sentence: Seasonal affective disorder (SAD) is a mood disorder subset in which people who have normal mental health throughout most of the year exhibit depressive symptoms at the same time each year, most commonly in winter.
simple_sent: Seasonal affective disorder (SAD) is a mood disorder. People who have normal mental health during most of the year may have depressive symptoms at the same time each year, especially in winter.

ori_sentence: Cyclopia (named after the Greek mythology character cyclopes) is the most extreme form of holoprosencephaly and is a congenital disorder (birth defect) characterized by the failure of the embryonic prosencephalon to properly divide the orbits of the eye into two cavities.
simple_sent: Cyclopia (named after the Greek mythology character cyclopes) is the most extreme form of holoprosencephaly. It is a birth defect where the human body can not divide the space between the two orbits of the eye properly.

ori_sentence: Nail clubbing, also known as digital clubbing or clubbing, is a deformity of the finger or toe nails associated with a number of diseases, mostly of the heart and lungs.
simple_sent: Nail clubbing, also known as digital clubbing or clubbing, is a sport where people cut their nails so that they look like they have been clubbed.

ori_sentence: A distichia is an eyelash that arises from an abnormal part of the eyelid.
simple_sent: A distichia is an eyelash that is not normal. It looks like this:

ori_sentence: Tooth gemination is a dental phenomenon that appears to be two teeth developed from one.
simple_sent: Tooth gemination is a dental condition. In it, two teeth look like they came from one.

ori_sentence: Clutton's joints is a term describing the finding of symmetrical joint swelling seen in patients with congenital syphilis.
simple_sent: Clutton's joints is a condition. It is when a person has congenital syphilis and they have joint swelling.

ori_sentence: Sibling rivalry is a type of competition or animosity among siblings, whether blood-related or not.
simple_sent: Sibling rivalry is when two or more siblings fight against each other because they are different.

ori_sentence: Uniparental disomy (UPD) occurs when a person receives two copies of a chromosome, or of part of a chromosome, from one parent and no copy from the other parent.
simple_sent: Uniparental disomy Uniparental disomy means that one parent has two copies of a chromosome. The other parent does not have any copies.

ori_sentence: Wound dehiscence is a surgical complication in which a wound ruptures along a surgical incision.
simple_sent: Wound dehiscence is a complication of surgery. It happens when a wound gets too big.

ori_sentence: A bifid rib is a congenital abnormality of the rib cage and associated muscles and nerves which occurs in about 1.2% of humans.
simple_sent: A bifid rib is an abnormality of the rib cage. About 1.2% of people in the world have this condition.

ori_sentence: Folliculitis decalvans is an inflammation of the hair follicle that leads to bogginess or induration of involved parts of the scalp along with pustules, erosions, crusts, ulcers, and scale.
simple_sent: Folliculitis decalvans is an inflammation of the hair follicle. People who have the condition will experience hair loss, pimples, pustules, crusts, ulcers, and scale.

ori_sentence: Graves’ ophthalmopathy, also known as thyroid eye disease (TED), is an autoimmune inflammatory disorder of the orbit and periorbital tissues, characterized by upper eyelid retraction, lid lag, swelling, redness (erythema), conjunctivitis, and bulging eyes (exophthalmos).
simple_sent: Graves' ophthalmopathy, also known as thyroid eye disease (TED), is an autoimmune inflammatory disorder of the eye. People with Graves' ophthalmopathy have redness (erythema), swelling, conjunctivitis, and bulging eyes (exophthalmos).

ori_sentence: Acrogeria (Gottron's syndrome) is a skin condition characterized by premature aging, typically in the form of unusually fragile, thin skin on the hands and feet (distal extremities).
simple_sent: Acrogeria (Gottron's syndrome) is a condition of the skin. People with Acrogeria have unusually thin, thin skin on their hands and feet, and it can make them look older.

ori_sentence: Delayed sleep phase disorder (DSPD), more often known as delayed sleep phase syndrome and also as delayed sleep–wake phase disorder, is a chronic dysregulation of a person's circadian rhythm (biological clock), compared to those of the general population and societal norms.
simple_sent: Delayed sleep phase disorder (DSPD), more often known as delayed sleep phase syndrome and also as delayed sleep–wake phase disorder, is a condition in which a person can not get enough sleep. This happens over a long period of time.

ori_sentence: Actinic elastosis, also known as solar elastosis, is an accumulation of abnormal elastin (elastic tissue) in the dermis of the skin, or in the conjunctiva of the eye, which occurs as a result of the cumulative effects of prolonged and excessive sun exposure, a process known as photoaging.
simple_sent: Actinic elastosis, also known as solar elastosis, is a condition in which there is too much elastin (elastic tissue) in the skin, or in the eye. This happens over time as a result of too much sun exposure, and is also known as photoaging.

ori_sentence: An amniotic fluid embolism (AFE) is a very uncommon childbirth (obstetric) emergency in which amniotic fluid enters the blood stream of the mother to trigger a serious reaction.
simple_sent: An amniotic fluid embolism (AFE) is an emergency during childbirth. In this case, the amniotic fluid gets into the mother's blood and causes a serious reaction.

ori_sentence: Frostbite is a skin injury that occurs when exposed to extreme low temperatures, causing the freezing of the skin or other tissues, commonly affecting the fingers, toes, nose, ears, cheeks and chin areas.
simple_sent: Frostbite is a skin injury that happens when the skin is exposed to very low temperatures. This causes the skin to become too cold, especially on the fingers, toes, nose, and ears.

ori_sentence: Ogilvie syndrome is the acute dilatation of the colon in the absence of any mechanical obstruction in severely ill patients.
simple_sent: Ogilvie syndrome is when the colon becomes too big. This does not happen when there is no mechanical obstruction.

ori_sentence: Fibular hemimelia or longitudinal fibular deficiency is "the congenital absence of the fibula
simple_sent: Fibular hemimelia is when the fibula is not properly attached to the body.

ori_sentence: Steatosis, also called fatty change, is abnormal retention of fat (lipids) within a cell or organ.
simple_sent: Steatosis, also called fatty change, is when fat is kept inside a cell or organ for a long time.

ori_sentence: A foreign body (FB) is any object originating outside the body of an organism.
simple_sent: A foreign body is an object that has come into an organism's body.

ori_sentence: The Fregoli delusion is a rare disorder in which a person holds a delusional belief that different people are in fact a single person who changes appearance or is in disguise.
simple_sent: The Fregoli delusion is a rare disorder. In it, a person believes that there is another person inside them all the time, and that this other person is trying to hurt them.

ori_sentence: Dermanyssus gallinae (also known as the red mite) is a haematophagous ectoparasite of poultry.
simple_sent: Dermanyssus gallinae is a kind of mite. It is also called the red mite.

ori_sentence: Ectopic ureter (or ureteral ectopia) is a medical condition where the ureter, rather than terminating at the urinary bladder, terminates at a different site.
simple_sent: Ectopic ureter (or ureteral ectopia) is when the ureter does not go all the way to the bladder. Instead, it goes to a different place.

ori_sentence: Maternal death or maternal mortality is defined in slightly different ways by several different health organizations.
simple_sent: Maternal death or maternal mortality is how people die during pregnancy. There are many different ways to define it.

ori_sentence: A dysplastic nevus or atypical mole is a nevus (mole) whose appearance is different from that of common moles.
simple_sent: A dysplastic mole is a nevus (mole) that does not look like other moles. They are called atypical moles.

ori_sentence: Intrauterine hypoxia (also known as fetal hypoxia) occurs when the fetus is deprived of an adequate supply of oxygen.
simple_sent: Intrauterine hypoxia (also called fetal hypoxia) happens when the mother does not get enough oxygen during pregnancy.

ori_sentence: Tension headache, also known as stress headache, or tension-type headache (TTH), is the most common type of primary headache.
simple_sent: Tension headache is the most common type of headache. It is also called stress headache, or tension-type headache.

ori_sentence: Pulseless electrical activity (PEA) refers to cardiac arrest in which the electrocardiogram shows a heart rhythm that should produce a pulse, but does not.
simple_sent: Pulseless electrical activity (PEA) is when the heart does not work at all. When this happens, it is called cardiac arrest.

ori_sentence: Shaken baby syndrome (SBS), also known as abusive head trauma (AHT), is an injury to a child's head caused by someone else.
simple_sent: Shaken baby syndrome (SBS) is an injury to the head. It is usually caused by someone hitting the child's head.

ori_sentence: Ejaculatory duct obstruction (EDO) is a pathological condition which is characterized by the obstruction of one or both ejaculatory ducts.
simple_sent: Ejaculatory duct obstruction (EDO) happens when one or both of the ejaculatory ducts are not working properly.

ori_sentence: Small for gestational age (SGA) newborns are those who are smaller in size than normal for the gestational age, most commonly defined as a weight below the 10th percentile for the gestational age.
simple_sent: Small for gestational age (SGA) newborns are those who are smaller in size than normal for their gestational age. The most common reason for this is that they are too small.

ori_sentence: Psychological abuse, often called emotional abuse, is a form of abuse characterized by a person subjecting or exposing another person to behavior that may result in psychological trauma, including anxiety, chronic depression, or post-traumatic stress disorder.
simple_sent: Psychological abuse, often called emotional abuse, is when a person does something to another person that makes them feel bad. This can lead to problems like depression, anxiety, or post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD).

ori_sentence: Electrolyte imbalance, or water-electrolyte imbalance, is an abnormality in the concentration of electrolytes in the body.
simple_sent: Electrolyte imbalance, or water-electrolyte imbalance, is when there is too much water and not enough electrolytes.

ori_sentence: Binasal hemianopsia is the medical description of a type of partial blindness where vision is missing in the inner half of both the right and left visual field.
simple_sent: Binasal hemianopsia is a type of partial blindness. In this case, vision is missing in the left side of the body, but not in the right side.

ori_sentence: Kayser–Fleischer rings (KF rings) are dark rings that appear to encircle the iris of the eye.
simple_sent: The Kayser rings are dark rings. They look like they are going to wrap around the eye.

ori_sentence: Trichophagia is the compulsive eating of hair associated with trichotillomania (hair pulling).
simple_sent: Trichophagia is the eating of hair all the time. This is also called trichotillomania.

ori_sentence: Muscle atrophy is the loss of skeletal muscle mass.
simple_sent: Muscle atrophy is when muscle mass is lost.

ori_sentence: Venous ulcers are wounds that are thought to occur due to improper functioning of venous valves, usually of the legs (hence leg ulcers).
simple_sent: Venous ulcers are wounds that happen because the blood vessels in the legs don't work properly. Most of the time, this is because of injury.

ori_sentence: Body odor is present in all animals, including humans, and its intensity can be influenced by many factors (behavioral patterns, survival strategies).
simple_sent: Body odor is present in all animals, including humans. The intensity of body odor depends on many things, including the animal.

ori_sentence: Hand eczema presents on the palms and soles, and may sometimes be difficult or impossible to differentiate from atopic dermatitis, allergic contact dermatitis, and psoriasis, which also commonly involve the hands.
simple_sent: Hand eczema usually appears on the palms and soles of the hands. It can sometimes be difficult to tell the difference between hand eczema, allergic contact dermatitis, and psoriasis.

ori_sentence: Hyposmia, or microsmia, is a reduced ability to smell and to detect odors.
simple_sent: Hyposmia, or microsmia, is a reduced ability to smell things around them.

ori_sentence: Nevus sebaceus or sebaceous nevus
simple_sent: Sebaceous sebaceus, North America.

ori_sentence: Reactive attachment disorder (RAD) is described in clinical literature as a severe and relatively uncommon disorder that can affect children.
simple_sent: Reactive attachment disorder (RAD) is a disorder that can affect children. People who have this disorder are called "reactive".

ori_sentence: Polymer fume fever or fluoropolymer fever, also informally called Teflon flu, is an inhalation fever caused by the fumes released when polytetrafluoroethylene (PTFE, known under the trade name Teflon) reaches temperatures of 300 °C (572 °F) to 450 °C (842 °F).
simple_sent: Polymer fume fever or fluoropolymer fever is a disease. It is caused by the fumes released when polytetrafluoroethylene (PTFE) gets too hot. The temperature can be 300 °C (572 °F) to 450 °C (842 °F).

ori_sentence: Subcutaneous emphysema (SCE, SE) occurs when gas or air accumulates and seeps under the skin, where normally no gas should be present.
simple_sent: Subcutaneous emphysema (SCE, SE) happens when gas or air gets under the skin. Normally, there is no gas there.

ori_sentence: A needlestick injury is the penetration of the skin by a hypodermic needle or other sharp object that has been in contact with blood, tissue or other body fluids before the exposure.
simple_sent: A needlestick injury is an injury to the skin. It happens when a sharp object, such as a needle, comes in contact with blood, tissue, or other body fluids.

ori_sentence: Crush syndrome (also traumatic rhabdomyolysis or Bywaters' syndrome) is a medical condition characterized by major shock and kidney failure after a crushing injury to skeletal muscle.
simple_sent: Crush syndrome (also called traumatic rhabdomyolysis or Bywaters' syndrome) is a medical condition. It happens when a muscle gets crushed, causing major shock.

ori_sentence: Heat illness is a spectrum of disorders due to environmental exposure to heat.
simple_sent: Heat illness is a wide range of health problems, caused by heat.

ori_sentence: Nummular dermatitis is one of the many forms of dermatitis.
simple_sent: Nummular dermatitis is a type of skin disease.

ori_sentence: Megaureter is a medical anomaly whereby the ureter is abnormally dilated.
simple_sent: A megaureter is a medical condition. In this case, the ureter is too small.

ori_sentence: An accessory spleen is a small nodule of splenic tissue found apart from the main body of the spleen.
simple_sent: An accessory spleen is a small part of the spleen. It is usually found outside the main spleen.

ori_sentence: Metabolic alkalosis is a metabolic condition in which the pH of tissue is elevated beyond the normal range (7.35–7.45).
simple_sent: Metabolic alkalosis is when the pH in the body is higher than it should be. This is a metabolic condition.

ori_sentence: Phyllodes tumors (from Greek: phullon leaf), also cystosarcoma phyllodes, cystosarcoma phylloides and phylloides tumor, are typically large, fast-growing masses that form from the periductal stromal cells of the breast.
simple_sent: Phyllodes tumors (from Greek: phullon leaf), also called cystosarcoma phyllodes, cystosarcoma phylloides and phylloides tumor, are cancer of the breast. They are usually very large and fast-growing.

ori_sentence: Calcaneus apophysitis, used to be called Sever's Disease and is an inflammation at the back of the heel (or calcaneus) growth plate in growing children.
simple_sent: Calcaneus apophysitis, used to be called Sever's Disease, is an inflammation of the growth plate at the back of the foot.

ori_sentence: A phantom limb is the sensation that an amputated or missing limb is still attached.
simple_sent: A phantom limb is when a person has lost a limb, but they still feel it.

ori_sentence: A paper cut occurs when a piece of paper or other thin, sharp material slices a person's skin, often the upper part of the finger, and often the index finger.
simple_sent: A paper cut is when a piece of paper or other sharp material cuts the skin. Usually, this happens to the upper part of the finger.

ori_sentence: Horseshoe kidney, also known as ren arcuatus (in Latin), renal fusion or super kidney, is a congenital disorder affecting about 1 in 500 people that is more common in men, often asymptomatic, and usually diagnosed incidentally.
simple_sent: Horseshoe kidney, also known as ren arcuatus (in Latin), renal fusion or super kidney, is a disease. About 1 in 500 people in the world have it, but it is more common in men.

ori_sentence: Hyper IgM syndrome describes a group of primary immune deficiency disorders characterized by defective CD40 signaling; via B cells affecting class switch recombination (CSR) and somatic hypermutation.
simple_sent: Hyper IgM syndrome describes a group of primary immune deficiency disorders. These disorders are caused by damage to the B cells. This damage causes somatic hypermutation.

ori_sentence: Food intolerance is a detrimental reaction, often delayed, to a food, beverage, food additive, or compound found in foods that produces symptoms in one or more body organs and systems, but generally refers to reactions other than food allergy.
simple_sent: Food intolerance is a bad reaction, usually early, to a food, drink, food additive, or compound. It causes problems in the body because the body does not use the food properly, or it can not use the food at all.

ori_sentence: Labial fusion is a medical condition of the female genital anatomy where the labia minora become fused together.
simple_sent: Labial fusion is a medical condition. In it, the two parts of the female sex organs become fused together.

ori_sentence: Hyperoxaluria is an excessive urinary excretion of oxalate.
simple_sent: Hyperoxaluria is when too much oxalate is taken in.

ori_sentence: Pruritus ani is the irritation of the skin at the exit of the rectum, known as the anus, causing the desire to scratch.
simple_sent: Puritus ani is when the skin at the exit of the rectum gets irritated. This is called the anus.

ori_sentence: Mallory–Weiss syndrome or gastro-esophageal laceration syndrome refers to bleeding from a laceration in the mucosa at the junction of the stomach and esophagus.
simple_sent: Mallory-Weiss syndrome or gastro-esophageal laceration syndrome is when the esophagus and stomach meet and cause bleeding in the esophagus.

ori_sentence: Pes cavus, also known as high arch, is a human foot type in which the sole of the foot is distinctly hollow when bearing weight.
simple_sent: Pes cavus is a type of foot type. In this type, the sole of the foot is very hollow when there is a lot of weight on it.

ori_sentence: Binge drinking, or heavy episodic drinking, is drinking alcoholic beverages with an intention of becoming intoxicated by heavy consumption of alcohol over a short period of time, but definitions vary considerably.
simple_sent: Binge drinking, or heavy episodic drinking, is when people drink a lot of alcohol in a short period of time. The definition of binge drinking is different for different people.

ori_sentence: Parinaud's syndrome is an inability to move the eyes up and down.
simple_sent: Parinaud's syndrome does not allow them to move their eyes.

ori_sentence: Postherpetic neuralgia (PHN) is neuropathic pain that occurs due to damage to a peripheral nerve caused by the reactivation of the varicella zoster virus (herpes zoster, also known as shingles).
simple_sent: Postherpetic neuralgia (PHN) is neuropathic pain that happens when a nerve is damaged. This can be caused by the virus varicella zoster, which is also known as shingles.

ori_sentence: Esophageal webs are thin membranes occurring anywhere along the esophagus.
simple_sent: The esophageal web is a thin membrane. It can be found anywhere.

ori_sentence: Hydrops foetalis or hydrops fetalis is a condition in the fetus characterized by an accumulation of fluid, or edema, in at least two fetal compartments.
simple_sent: Hydrops foetalis or hydrops fetalis is a condition in the fetus. It happens when there is a lot of fluid in at least two parts of the fetus.

ori_sentence: Trench foot is a type of foot damage due to moisture.
simple_sent: Trench foot is a common cause of foot injury.

ori_sentence: Schmorl's nodes are protrusions of the nucleus pulposus of the intervertebral disc through the vertebral body endplate and into the adjacent vertebra.
simple_sent: Schmorl's nodes are protrusions of the nucleus pulposus of the intervertebral disc. They can be seen on the outside of each vertebra.

ori_sentence: Monocytosis is an increase in the number of monocytes circulating in the blood.
simple_sent: Monocytosis means that the number of monocytes in the blood increases.

ori_sentence: A pulmonary contusion, also known as lung contusion, is a bruise of the lung, caused by chest trauma.
simple_sent: A pulmonary contusion is a bruise of the lung. It can also be called a lung contusion.

ori_sentence: Metabolic acidosis is a serious electrolyte disorder characterized by an imbalance in the body's acid-base balance.
simple_sent: Metabolic acidosis is a serious health problem. It happens when the body's acid-base balance is not right.

ori_sentence: Metal fume fever, also known as brass founders' ague, brass shakes, zinc shakes, galvie flu, metal dust fever, welding shivers, or Monday morning fever, is an illness primarily caused by exposure to chemicals such as zinc oxide (ZnO), aluminium oxide (Al2O3), or magnesium oxide (MgO) which are produced as byproducts in the fumes that result when certain metals are heated.
simple_sent: Metal fume fever, also known as brass founders' ague, brass shakes, zinc shakes, galvie flu, metal dust fever, or Monday morning fever, is an illness that happens when people who are exposed to certain chemicals (such as zinc oxide, aluminium oxide, or magnesium oxide) for a long time.

ori_sentence: Xanthelasma is a sharply demarcated yellowish deposit of cholesterol underneath the skin.
simple_sent: Xanthelasma is a yellowish layer of cholesterol under the skin, just below the skin.
